golds.output: This product is just average. The flavor is not bad, but it does not have the rich, smoky taste I expect from a good bacon base. I used it in a few recipes and the result was okay, but nothing impressive. The quality of the product is good, but I was expecting more from the flavor and aroma. I have used other bacon bases in the past that were more to my liking, but this one is acceptable if you are looking for a decent, but not great, bacon flavor.

Review:
I am very disappointed in this product. The fish itself is good (in the batch I received), but the label claims "Net weight: 15 ounces". The problem is that each can contains only about 9.33 ounces of fish; the rest is water, oil and fish particles suspended in the fluid. The fluid is approximately
5.67 ounces by weight; 168mL fluid. After 4 hours time allowed for separation, the oil is about 11mL of the total. Hence, each can of "Chicken of The Sea" Chub Mackerel is only about 62 percent fish.
The measurements were based on the average of 10 cans. Deviation from the average was minimal. The ratio of fish-to-water is the worst of all canned fish I have seen. At 9.33 ounces of fish per can, the actual cost of the fish is approximately $0.268/ounce, far higher than it should be, making it more expensive per ounce than canned Salmon.
Also, all 10 cans were excessively dirty, half the cans were badly dented. Rubbing a paper towel around the rim revealed a mix of metal particles and dust/dirt. If you use this product, be sure to clean the can rim before using a can opener, else some of metal and/or dirt can get into the fish.

Hunt's Diced Tomatoes with Green Pepper, Celery & Onion, 14.5 oz, 12 Pack
Review:
The tomatoes appear to be good quality, but the product is too sweet (unless you really like extra-sweet foods). The ingredients list shows that the 3 main ingredients are tomatoes, tomato juice, and sugar. Less than 2% of all other ingredients. The flavor of green peppers, celery and onion is barely perceptible, partly because there is almost none of those vegetables in the can, and partly because there is so much sugar that it over-powers the other flavors. In fact, there is more salt and citric acid than celery or green pepper (see list of ingredients on the label).
Note that if you use these in a cooked meal, the sweetness is not quite so over-powering, because the bitterness of all the tomato seeds comes out during cooking, and tends to offset the sweetness. Maybe that's why they add so much sugar into this product.
On the plus side, none of the cans in my order were dented. Can't say the same about many other canned products I have ordered.

Product:
Newtons Fig Fruit Chewy Cookies - Snack Packs, 12 Count Box, 24 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
These are Fig Newtons, what can you say?  Everyone likes them (or not).  They are a nice-sized snack in a nearly indestructible foil wrapper.  You get two double-length cookies, approximately equivalent to 4 regular Fig Newtons.  Good for tossing in lunches, purses, the car, etc.  Arrived very fresh and in good shape.  Handy as a somewhat more nutritious snack.  We like them enough to order more, when on sale!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Betty Crocker Hamburger Helper Philly Cheesesteak, 6.5-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)
Review:
It's Hamburger Helper.  What can you say?  You either like it or you don't.  We do.  It's not exactly like homemade, but for a quick meal when you're in a hurry, it's okay.  The Hamburger Helper meal sizes are continuing to shrink.  These are a measly 6.6 ounces; about enough for one hungry person or two mildly hungry ones. I add a few extras--about 4 ounces of dry spaghetti noodles, a cup of additional water, some tomatoes and/or other veggies, to make a bigger meal.  Also, I quite often use ground Italian sausage, instead of hamburger, very tasty!  I look for these meals on sale, because at full price, they are just too expensive for what you get.  Hope this helps!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
SweetLeaf Sweet Drops Liquid Stevia Sweetener, SteviaClear, 4 Ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
I've used this product for quite a few years, after trying MANY other brands and forms, and still find this to be the absolute best stevia product--hands down!  I don't know what we would do without this product.  We use it every day, all day, for coffee, tea, sweetening yogurt fruit, etc.  All our family members like it, too.  One bottle lasts for over two months, usually three.  It has no aftertaste, a few drops is all it takes and finally, we've been able to almost eliminate sugars from our diet without "suffering".  There are 2,880 drops in a 4 oz or 120ml bottle, according to the manufacturer.  We love it!
UPDATE:  Received new shipment and bottle label has changed.  Now states there are approx. 600 servings per bottle at 5-8 drops per serving or to taste.  Last few bottles seemed slightly weaker, but still the best of all the other brands, by far.  We still love it!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
ALTOIDS Classic Wintergreen Breath Mints, 1.76-Ounce Tin (Pack of 12)
Review:
We love these Wintergreen Altoids! While they are a very good breath mint, we use them mainly for flavoring our coffee and sometimes, tea. One, in the bottom of the cup, or a few in the coffee/tea pot makes life more interesting! Also, good with just a touch of hot cocoa, added along with Altoids, in coffee. And yes, they are good in hot cocoa, too. Very inexpensive, easy way to flavor coffee or tea, much cheaper than alternative. Almost no calories, but big on flavor! We've used these for decades!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Roland Coconut Milk, Lite, 14 Ounce (Pack of 24)
Review:
We see why people like this brand of coconut milk.  We like it, too.  It is organic and does have guar gum (which is a food derived, natural ingredient), but it DOES NOT have chemicals/preservatives, which are bad for you.  It is thick and creamy when slightly warmed, has a strong coconut flavor and tastes better than the brands with added preservatives.  (We've tried a lot of them!)  The ingredients are coconut milk, water, guar gum---that's it!  I DO wish it said what percentage of coconut milk was in the can, some brands do, but other than that, we are happy with this brand.  It DOES NOT have an expiration date printed on the can (we wish it did).  The price is more than the brands with preservatives, which I don't understand, I wish it were lower, but if we want food with no preservatives/added chemicals, I guess this is what our option is.  Hopefully, the price will come down.  What we don't like is the shipping--9 out of 24 cans in the case were severely or moderately dented, which means we had to use them soon or immediately (not happy at all about that).  However, we will order this brand again.  UPDATE:  Ordered second case, case was shipped "as is", broke open during shipping, all 24 cans arrived severely or moderately dented.  Can't even open most of them with a can opener.  Completely unusable and not safe to use.  Unless packing for shipping changes, even though we love the product, we will not order again. Not happy about that, as we can't find a source to purchase locally.  UPDATE:  Contacted Amazon, they sent another case, better packing, only 2 cans minor dented.  Thank you, Amazon!  Will try purchasing again, as we love this stuff!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Yankee Traders Brand, Vanilla Beans, Organic (Whole)- 4 Pods
Review:
I ordered these to try them, not wanting a large quantity, if they weren't a good quality.  I have to say, these are just simply excellent!  These are organic from Frontier Co-op, a company I have ordered products from for decades.  Their quality is usually great, like these vanilla beans.  These beans are plump, slightly juicy, filled with paste, VERY fragrant and aromatic.  The fragrance is just intoxicating.  The flavor is very strong/intense.  One half a pod was all I needed to strongly flavor 1.5 quarts of homemade ice cream! The pods are larger and of a better quality than most and much better than those from the local store.  The price is a bit high.  Next time, I will order a larger quantity to save money.  It does NOT say what grade these beans are or the source of origin/variety.  But, just guessing, they seem to be a grade A.  Whatever they are, these are excellent!  I will buy them again!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Lipton Yellow Label Tea (loose tea) - 450g
Review:
This is NOT the regular Lipton's Tea sold in the USA.  This Lipton's Yellow Label Tea is what most of the rest of the world drinks when they drink Lipton's.  It is not acidic as is the regular USA version we all know (IE: no pucker/dry mouth).  It is bold, but mellow--sometimes with a hint of smoky flavor.  We first drank this while living overseas, I love this Yellow Label tea.  It is very good made as hot tea as well as iced.  Very good with milk or cream.  I have purchased this for years and will definitely purchase this again!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
PG Tips Black Tea, Loose Tea, 8.8-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
While this may not be "premium" tea, it IS very good tea.  It has a smooth, not harsh, yet bold flavor.  It stands up well to milk or cream and makes a very good iced tea.  After drinking this, Lipton's tea just seems so unbearably harsh and acrid. It brews up well, never seeming to become bitter.  It works well as a general, all purpose, every day tea; also, blending well with mint or other flavors, like cinnamon, if that's what you like.  PG is good black, too.  It is a finely cut tea, BUT, so what?  It steeps well and tastes great.  I use Finum tea filters, available on Amazon, to brew, which catches all the pieces.  I searched high and low, for years, and paid way too much for stale PG Tips before finding it on Amazon at a very good price, especially when purchased at subscribe and save prices.  I prefer the loose tea, but occasionally use tea bags, for traveling.  There are other teas I enjoy, but this remains on my list of favorites, both for taste and price!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Mrs. May's Trio Bar Variety Pack,  1.7-oz Bars (Pack of 20)
Review:
We like these Mrs. May's Trio Natural Bars. These are a little on the chewy, sticky side, so beware, if you have dental problems (chew carefully). Packaged in an almost indestructible cello package. The ingredients are as follows: Cashews, Almonds, Pistachios, Fruit (Cranberries or Strawberries or Blueberries or Tropical-Pineapple, Mango, Papaya), Sesame Seeds, Sunflower Seeds, Pumpkin Seeds, Dates, Raisins, Rice Malt, Natural Flavors, Cane Juice, Sea Salt. That's it! There are 20 bars in a 24 oz or 700 gram box. Each bar is 1.2 oz or 35 grams. The box says: vegan/no trans fat/no additives/no preservatives/no cholesterol/gluten free/diary free/wheat free/non-GMO/kosher and product of China (that worries me more than a little). Calories 170 each, 100 calories from fat, 12 grams total fat, 1.5 grams saturated fat, 0mg cholesterol, 45mg sodium, 14g total carbohydrate, 2g dietary fiber, 6g sugar, 5g protein, 2/4% calcium, 8% iron, 0% vitamins A & C. Yummy flavor, can taste the nuts and fruit, not too sweet for most people, certainly a lot less sweet than any other granola/snack/breakfast/protein type bar we've tried. Wish they were bigger, pretty small. Otherwise, very good bars.  Nice having 5 bars of each flavor all in one box!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Nutter Butter Peanut Butter Sandwich, Convenience Pack, 5.25-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
You either like Nutter Butter or you don't.  We do.  These 1.9 ounce packs have 4 cookies each and are just the right size for my spouse's on-the-go snack.  They are packed in tough foil packages with a cardboard liner, arrived fresh and stay fresh, long shelf life, easy to transport.  Just the right size, good deal when on sale.  We will buy again.
Rating:
4.0
</similarpairs>

First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
REDMOND Real Sea Salt - Natural Unrefined Organic Gluten Free Fine, 26 ounce pouch (1 Pack)
Review:
Yes, it is me, back again. This time I purchased the 3-pack giving me a chance to write another review!!! Ever since we first tried one of these little salt-shakers, we have become addicted. The mineral content of this salt is outstanding. I love that it really enhances the taste of food instead of just giving it that salty taste you get from processed salt. We use this salt on everything. it is our main go-to salt. That isn't to say that we don't use other salts, as we have quite a collection from all over the world. Some of which cost a small fortune. That being said, this one really stands up well amongst all of them.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
REDMOND Real Sea Salt - Natural Unrefined Organic Gluten Free Fine, 26 ounce pouch (1 Pack)
Review:
Salt comes in all different colors and flavors.
Being a foodie and salt connoisseur, I have traveled the globe trying every salt I have encountered.
Do your research and you will see that Real Salt is from a mine in Utah.
This is an ancient salt mine. This salt is is unrefined so it contains all of the minerals embedded with it.
There is some grit to this salt since it isn't a super fine grind. This is normal and acceptable.
This salt has an excellent balance of minerals enhancing all of the foods you eat naturally.
This belongs in every household for your main table salt.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
REDMOND Real Sea Salt - Natural Unrefined Organic Gluten Free Fine, 26 ounce pouch (1 Pack)
Review:
Salt comes in all different colors and flavors.
Being a foodie and salt connoisseur, I have traveled the globe trying every salt I have encountered. I have salt sculptures from all over. Salt comes in many different colors and flavors (i.e. white purple, pink, blue, green, black, brown of many shades). Keep in mind that flavors are different to everyone since every palate is unique and each person has different mineral levels which also changes how it tastes.
Do your research and you will see that Real Salt is from a mine in Utah.
This is an ancient salt mine. Don't worry about the various colors, this salt is is unrefined so it contains minerals embedded with it.
There is some grit (minerals) to this salt since it isn't a super fine grind. This is normal and acceptable.
This salt has an excellent balance of minerals enhancing all of the foods you eat naturally.
This belongs in every household for your main table salt. Real Salt also comes in super fine for those who cannot tolerate grit.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Starwest Botanicals Organic Arrowroot Powder - 1 Pound (16 oz)
Review:
This product kind of works like corn starch, but not exactly. It doesn't thicken nearly as well as corn starch. I will happily use it over corn starch until I can find certified organic corn starch.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Premium Madagascar Vanilla Beans 1/4 lb (26-30 beans) JR Mushrooms Brand
Review:
The smell emanates through the completely sealed package. These beans are soft, moist, fresh and heavenly delicious. I was skeptical when ordering, but WOW, these beans are so fragrant!. These make an excellent paste and are extremely robust. I'll definitely order this again. Mine came through OliveNation.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bell Plantation PB2 Powdered Peanut Butter, 1 lb Jar (2-pack)
Review:
How can you make peanut butter better than it already is? PB2! This is Peanut Butter without all the oil you get in the jar products. The taste is excellent. You can use it just like you do regular peanut butter. It is much lighter than a jar of peanut butter so it transports well. You can add it to grain recipes to give them a nutty flavor. You can use it in chocolates, shakes, etc. We love this and everyone we have told about it loves it too. I love using this on my pad thai dish and other dishes for a peanut flavor without all the added fat. If you LOVE peanut butter, you will LOVE this low fat version.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Spicy World Ground Turmeric Powder, 5 Pound
Review:
I am very impressed with the quality of this Turmeric powder. The bag I received was still sealed and the product is very fresh. Upon opening the bag, the intense smell of turmeric filled the room as it should. I tasted this straight and the flavor is robust, earthy, smooth and absent the bitterness you get from roots that aren't fresh. The first dish I made was some basmati rice with this turmeric, some onion, cumin, cayenne and salt. The flavor is exceptional!

I repackaged this for longer storage since this is for day to day cooking. The best way to store this for long-term is to divide it into smaller portions and vacuum seal each portion, then freeze it. Make sure you let it thaw completely to room temperature before opening a packet for use later to avoid moisture issues.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Harvest Snaps Red Lentil Snack Crisps, Onion Thyme, deliciously baked and crunchy veggie snacks with plant protein and fiber, 3-Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
Warning!!! You may want to eat the whole bag in one sitting. Once you start eating these, it is hard to stop. The taste is light, crispy, crunchy herbaciously delicious! Not overly salty, the seasoning is light and keeps you coming back for more. I'm so glad I ordered a 12 pack because they really are that good.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Numi Organic Tea Jasmine Pearls, 16 Ounce Bulk Pouch, Premium Organic Whole Leaf Green Tea, Loose Leaf Flowering Dragon Tea Buds Scented with Real Organic Jasmine (Packaging May Vary)
Review:
MMMMMMMMMMMMM! This tea is so delicious! It has lots of flavor. I love it Hot, I love it Cold, I love it in the pot 3 days old! No joke... This tea has a wonderful jasmine flower flavor and smell. I steep it in glass with filtered water. It is highly addictive. You can see the oil floating at the top after steeping. The aroma is so amazing, it fills the room. Every morning should be this good for everyone. I'll definitely buy more. The only nag I have is the ziplock at the top is not affixed properly to the bag, it tore away from the bag after just a couple uses.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Raw Sourwood Honey (Pure Natural Honey) 16oz
Review:
This is a rich-flavored honey. I wasn't sure what to expect by the name since I hadn't researched Sourwood. I enjoy trying honeys from around the globe. This one has to be in my top 5 favorite flavors. It has the essence of maple syrup and goes great with just about anything from beverages to pastries or breads. I highly recommend this honey!
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

I hope I can find other uses for them rather than as a snack, because they are bitter and really doesn't even taste like chocolate.  I am not a raw fooder, although I do have a couple of raw food cookbooks, so take that into consideration.  I have no idea what I'm going to do with $25 worth of raw cacao nibs now.  I even went to the web site to get recipes but there were none.  Geez.......

Product:
Eat. Think. Smile. Baked Nutrition Bar, Dark Cherry, 1.8-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12)
Review:
These Eat/Think/Smile baked nutrition bars, are more like a cookie, than a protein bar. Why? Because they have the same nutritional value of a cookie. Each cookie has 200 calories, with 7 grams of FAT, 34 grams of carbs, and 4 grams of Protein. There's a bit of a problem with the saltiness too, with 240mg of Salt. So, if you need a meal replacement, this isn't it. It simply doesnt have enough protein. On the plus side, these taste really good. They're sweetened with brown sugar, and dextrose and brown rice syrup. As for the chocolate, they are using some South American chocolate, so if you have issue with the child slaves working in the Ivory Coast chocolate farms, your conscious will be relieved. The taste overall is rich, chewy, and complex, mixing the chocolate, cherry and walnut flavors, in a whole wheat-corn-oat flour. Also, the bars have a lot of naturally occuring minerals and vitamins, including magnesium 10% and Iron 6%. Still, if I were thinking of buying a nutrician bar, I'd recommend a protein bar, that's vitamin fortafied.  If you are supplimenting a meal, or need a lunch box snack, etc, then these nutrition bars aren't a bad choice.
Rating:
4.0
</Other Writer-1>

</otherwriters>

Review:
This cereal is ugly.  It really looks like one of those "gross" health cereals that your grandma eats as you stare in fear and awe.  With great relief, however, I can tell you that it simply tastes like a pleasant mix of wheat flakes and graham crackers.  The benefits of the yogurt bacteria, broccoli, and fiber are really great, too, and quickly apparent.

I do have one word of warning.  There are some people who eat the half cup of cereal recommended and some people who curl up with a bowl the size of their head in front of the TV.  If you fall into the latter category, understand that you have just shifted your digestive system into overdrive.  This may surprise you in multiple ways, none of which I will mention.

Product:
Mae Ploy Thai Panang Curry Paste - 14 oz jar
Review:
I love Thai food, but had never tried the Panang curry.  It is delicious.  After reading the reviews, I just had to try it.  It actually is not as spicy as I thought it would be. The first time I used it I measured less of it than the directions called for and it was kind of bland.  However, next time I will try the full amount.  Mae Ploy really makes Thai cooking easy.

A few months down the road and this has become my favorite food.  I don't use coconut milk, because the thick canned kind at the grocery store leaves an aftertaste and makes me burp.  Instead, I use about 3/4 chicken broth for the liquid and it comes out just perfect.  My favorite way to use this is with Swai or similar fish fillets cut into bite sized pieces.  I stir fry whatever veggies I have on hand (red or green bell pepper, onion, shredded carrots, etc) and then remove them from the pan.  Next I fry the Thai Red Curry paste (I have found that 2 T. is perfect for me.  Spicy but not too hot) then I pour in the broth and let it sizzle for about a minute.  Next I add the fish and veggies and let it all simmer for about 10 minutes.  I serve it over rice or Thai noodles and it is heavenly. Not only does it taste wonderful, but the aroma lingers in my house for a day or two and smells delicious.  I'm so glad I found this.  I've stored it in the coldest part of my refrigerator and it has lasted several months with no sign of deterioration.  I use it about once a week.  I'll soon be ordering more, because I'm hooked.
Rating:
5.0

This has that deep, dark chocolate taste that goes perfectly with coffee.  Great price for a good supply.  Also yummy on raspberry sherbet. LOL Also, does not need refrigeration after opening so it stays easier to pour.

I've really noticed how this type of salt really softens my skin.  Epsom Salt, baking soda, Himalayan Sea Salt and a touch of lavender oil makes an incredibly soothing bath salt that makes aches and pains disappear.  So relaxing to soak in, too.  This is a great deal.,

Product:

Review:
Darn good coffee. I like to make it with really hot water. Only use 6 oz per teaspoon. I use a regular serving teaspoon and take out as much coffee as it will hold. Mix it well. I like to have a bottom of my coffee cup with the espresso and I top it with Milk. Milk that I have set up the day before with sweetener so the sweetener liquidfies into the milk making it uniformingly sweet. I  have a small bottle that I put milk into and I add my truvia and shake it up vigorously to mix the sugar and milk and set it into a very cold fridge for 8 or more hours. When I make my coffee I make it with very hot water and then stir it, and shake the milk and it has a nice foamy milk appearance and I add about 3 oz of sweetened milk to 6 oz of coffee careful not to stir the coffee just drink it with the layer of milk floating on top the thick rich coffee.....so good! Nice to have one cup. I have a Keurig and a regular coffee maker and the stove top espresso maker and its just a hassle to have one cup and I hate the expense of the keurigs. This is a more viable option for a rich cup of coffee.

Review:
Okay so I have been totally addicted to watching Korean Dramas on Hulu and Viki and Dramafever and Gooddrama.net etc... and see this brand constantly being eaten during these South Korean TV shows like Secret Garden, Coffee Prince, Smile You, and Kimchi Family to say a few shows if anyone ever feels like venturing in to the best TV ever! So Since I am a big fan of Korean TV I just had to try this ramen! On the show Potato Star one musician character eats it a lot So I ordered it and BAM! No wonder these actors smile and totally whoof it down! It is definently woofable. So much so I couldn't believe how good it is! I did not cut up the green onion as you see on the top of the package, I should have bought some green onions and sliced them thin and added to the top, but its fine without, more than fine without! Love this stuff. Okay so its spicy...not jalapeno spicey staying in your mouth needing a tortilla or milk to get your tongue back hot, its all together hot in a different way the kind of good hot for hot lovers. Makes you really want more. So spicy and hot with the red chili powder and its smooth and the broth you just want to drink it! Noodles have a great texture not all overly soft, they are firm and really taste better than the typical ramen I buy at my grocery store. Plus you put the water in the bowl, close the lid and when you open the bowl you won't believe the soup its like totally full of noodles like way more than the average ramen. At first the ramen looks all whimpy small and man or man it balloons out to fill the bowl.

Review:
I love ethnic foods and to cook them. I recently purchased another product which was a major disappointment, so I was back to the drawing board.

The reviews won me over, and free shipping, so I ordered one of each, red and green. Tonight I used the green for the first time and WOW! It made me look like a gourmet international chef - it is so incredibly good!

It was definitely hot, though, which is fine with me but I was glad I had the coconut milk base. This is excellent and I will keep this on hand always.

Review:
Happy with everything. Good product; good, fair price; good service. What's not to love?

Product:
Dandy Blend, Instant Herbal Beverage with Dandelion, 2 lb. Bag
Review:
Foolish and dumb as this may sound, I'd forgotten what impact caffeine has on various health issues - primarily raising my ocular pressure - and that can be serious for those with Glaucoma and other medical eye issues.
New job; new pressures; stress; longer hours; inclement weather, and I was brewing more coffee and having more refills; taking bigger travel mugs and not thinking about it. I was using a higher quality of coffee and had read many articles about how organic; higher quality, etc really has more to do with how coffee affects/doesn't affect someone than the actual caffeine component, so I felt I was "okay" with drinking more of it. Wrong (at least for me).
I had forgotten how I used to mix my coffee half and half with Teeccino and that cut down the caffeine. Teeccino's a great product, but it is not very cost effective for me, and I prefer something without the gluten.

In the past, I tried the packets of Dandy Blend and it was ok. They quickly hardened and dried out so I threw away the unused packets.
I had received some very bad news from my Ophthalmologist, so back to the drawing board and saw this 2# bag of Dandy Blend, with outstanding reviews and comments and thought I'd give it a go again. After all, it's a MUST!
Not only is it gluten-free (and they explain on their site 'how' that is); but dandelions are great for the liver which is very closely related to eye issues - they go hand in hand. (I already take Milk Thistle every day for my liver, so this will be an added bonus!)

Then I asked all of you a few questions on the Q/A area (great feature, and big help!). I wanted to be able to brew Dandy Blend along with a scoop of regular coffee grounds (as I did with Teeccino) and you all told me how I could. Score!
So, right now I'm enjoying a delicious cup - or two, or three - of mixed brew and eventually will cut out the coffee altogether.
I was too chicken to put the DB in the brew basket, so I used my normal amount of water for the pot; only put in one scoop of coffee, instead of two, and then when it was finished brewing, I added one rounded tablespoon to the pot and stirred it in.
FABULOUS!
The recipes and ideas on both the bag and the website are great - I would have never thought of doing that. Now I look forward to trying it. I'm getting ready to do some traveling, so will bring some with me.

Folks - we can monitor our BLOOD pressure at home (which I occasionally do); but we cannot monitor our own ocular pressure. Hopefully, one day, it will be possible to do. Fortunately for me, I HAVE to go regularly to keep a close watch on it; but I was without insurance and took my chances and it was almost disastrous. Please be sure to get your eyes checked regularly, especially to check your pressures. It's still the leading cause of blindness.

*****One week later****
I only mixed with coffee for one week. I ended up loving it so much, I prefer it ALONE! It's delicious! And what's really awesome - no headaches; no fatigue; no withdrawals whatsoever being without coffee! AWESOME!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bergin Nut Company Oat Bran Packages, 32-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
I concur. Ditto to everything everyone else has said. Good stuff. Happy happy. I make muffins regularly and this helps keep the quality along with the pricing and convenience all do-able.
Mine was backordered for about three weeks but I didn't mind as I was in no hurry for it.
First time using this and I like it very much and will use again and again and recommend. Tomorrow I will be seeing a friend and will give her a "care package" of a bag of this and a bag of the Bob's Golden flaxseed meal so it makes a nice gift packaging item also.
Thank you Bergin and Amazon!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Glutino Gluten Free Pantry Favorite Sandwich Bread Mix, 22-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
No doubt this is a good bread and I will probably end up making it again. Here are my thoughts both positive and otherwise.

1) Easily accessible product - found my box at Walmart, for $4.50.
2) The ingredients are self contained in the box; other than eggs, choice of fat; and liquid.
3) I like that you have options: water or milk or almond milk, etc; eggs or egg white; various oils or butter
4) This should easily be touted as another great "no knead" bread - just mix and pour.
5) I like that it gives the options of oven baking or bread machine. I don't have a bread machine so I made mine in the oven.
6) It rose very quickly and there are not several stages to wait through - just the one rising time.
7) It was done very quickly.
8) The bread makes a nice size loaf and slices well, without crumbling
9) Each slice of bread holds up well to spreading and doesn't tear even when buttering with cold, hard butter - no tearing
10) The flavor is good enough on its own, but I could also see how adding other ingredients would really be welcome, too. I can see why all the positive remarks that this is probably one of the best GF breads out there.

And now for my other comments:

While it is Gluten-free, it is not starch free (nor does it claim to be, either). I have a hard time, these days digesting ALL grains, and starches sometimes bother me, too. So, while the ingredients were very clearly stated, I chose to buy the product anyway just to see how well I would 'do' with this particular bread and whether or not to stay with it, or move on to Paleo breads, which are gluten free, as well as grain AND starch free. Only time will tell how I feel after eating this bread.
My other comment is that it contains corn starch, and as 80-90% of corn in the US is genetically modified, I'm wondering if that is true with this item as well?

Nonetheless, I was pleased with all of its attributes, and if/when I make it again, I'll be sure and not let it brown as much - keep an eye on it! :)
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Wild Planet Wild Skipjack Tuna (Light Tuna), 5 oz Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
Yum, Yum!
Bought it first to try and just now subscribed!
It's delicious! I take it to work and easy enough to eat right out of the can, while sitting in my car listening to the radio and catching some beautiful breezes.
The juice is awesome - fresh tasting. No oil, very little salt..not even water. Just the juice itself.
Fresh and delicious - haven't even made the 'regular' tuna salad with it yet. Haven't felt the need to.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
The Spice Lab Himalayan Kosher Unprocessed Cooking X-Fine, Grain Salt 2 pounds
Review:
I have a number of different salts in the house and so far my favorite has been the pink Himalayan salt.
The flavor is absolutely incredible and it completely makes all the difference in the way foods taste when you cook. They taste so much better.

But, I was reading some reviews and saw some comments that the pink salt had fluoride and had all these warnings on it! Well, that made me nervous because I try and avoid fluoride (don't use fluoride toothpaste, etc.). I was so disappointed.

But, I read further that the fluoride is not 'added', is not the same as the dangerous fluoride found in our water system here, but rather, naturally occurring. I didn't do a whole lot of research about this, but since that made me happy, I ordered it.

I really do love it, and prefer it over all the others, although the grey is nice as well.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
CHIQUILIN Smoked Paprika, 75 GR
Review:
I have been the blessed recipient of the most amazing eggplant parmesan recipe on this planet! The recipe takes three non-stop hours in the kitchen to make and it is so worth it.
When my friend gave me the recipe, she said that there are two specific ingredients that are a "must" and that is why it is a knock-your-socks-off killer recipe. The smoked paprika was one of them.
So, I turned to Amazon to see what you all have said about smoked paprika and which one I should get because this dish was going to be the "star of the show" at a dinner party and I wanted a good one.
Oh, ba-by! This smoked paprika is smokin'!
Not only did I use it to make my EP dish, but I have since used it in some regular standby dishes (such as a bean, kale and sausage soup) and it put that recipe into orbit! Now I won't make it without the smoked paprika!
You gotta get it! It will take a recipe over the top to the next level and you will be so delighted. Keep in mind that while just a bit is a good thing, don't over do, so keep taste testing. You'll be so glad you did. Let me know!
Rating:
5.0

Teeccino All-Purpose Grind Caffeine-Free Herbal Coffee, Java, 8.5-Ounce Cans (Pack of 6)

I let my cookies cool for 5 mins on the pan-maybe I will do 3 next time. DO NOT TASTE THE DOUGH-my fave part of traditional cookies-I cannot do that with these-it is horrible-I am not sure how the finished product ends up edible but it does! OH-do NOT forget to GREASE YOUR PAN =and I mean A LOT! Also- I added extra chips *almost 1/3 of a bag of them...and they still are not "loaded" but they are good. Might end up being cheaper to make from scratch w/ having to add the extras...but I haven't master gf/df choc chip cookies just yet

Product:
Solofill  Cup, Refillable Cup For Keurig Single serve cups Brewers, Red and Black (Pack of 2)
Review:
First, using packaged K-cups with a Keurig is a sucker's game. It's overly expensive, weak quality, and wasteful. So whether you use a "My K Cup" adapter, or this Solofill (or some other brand) that enables you to use your own coffee, that's a choice you really need to make.

I had used a "My K Cup" for a long time. But the mesh was finally wearing through and so I wanted to give something new a try.

The advantage for the Solofill:

MUCH less spraying and extra water into the cup, which means overall better tasting coffee and less mess. This is because you will use the original K-Cup pod in the Keurig (unlike the "My K Cup" which is a seperate adapter). So it's designed to fit like a K-Cup, and it doesn't have the problems with the spraying.

This is a BIG plus.

The disadvantages, which to be fair are mostly annoyances, but still...

A pain to clean. Unlike the "My K Cup," which had multiple parts and was easy to flick the old grounds out of, this requires you have to dig into the grounds to get them out. Then, the little divot at the bottom needs some extra spray to come clean.

The lid does not have a lip to open it, so you have to be careful it doesn't open and spill grounds everywhere.

Overall, it's okay - but I'm all about convenience, and the aggravations push it to three stars instead of four...but someone else might see it differently.

I don't see any significant difference in coffee taste. I drink coffee black, and it tastes about the same to me. It SHOULD be a little stronger without the extra water, but I don't notice.

In fact - another reviewer noticed that the water might go through TOO quickly, which makes it water. I'm not sure - but it's possible.

UPDATE, Feb. 27, 2013: I hiked the rating to four stars from three. I've been using it for awhile, and I like it - I still don't like the cleaning, but overall I'm having no problems with spillover and I think it distributes the water through the coffee grounds more effectively.
Rating:
4.0
</Other Writer-1>

</otherwriters>

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Peanut Butter & Co Bestie Almond Butter, Non-GMO, Gluten Free, Vegan, No Sugar Added, 11 Ounce Jars, 6 Count Review: I don't have any experience with almond butter but thought it might be a nice change from peanut butter. I was not expecting a liquid mess when I opened the jar but that is what I got, all over my jacket and floor. It has a consistency better suited to pouring than spreading. Perhaps if being used for drinks this would be acceptable but it doesn't work well as a spread or a dip. As far as the taste goes, it is edible but I didn't find it appealing. Very disappointing overall. Rating: 1.0 Product: Blue Diamond Gluten Free Almonds, Lime 'n Chili, 6 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: I like lime and I like chili so I figured this would be a pretty tasty nut. It is definitely very flavorful but the lime overpowers the chili so much that the chili might as well be nonexistent. So if you are a lime lover you will probably enjoy this flavor, otherwise you might want to try one of the other varieties instead. Personally I will finish up this batch but once they're gone I will go back to my habanero bbq and wasabi. Rating: 3.0 Product: Amazon Brand - Happy Belly Whole Raw Almonds, 16 Ounce, Pack of 2 Review: Tasty nuts but not a good mix for the price. The nuts themselves are delicious and I have nothing against peanuts if it is priced accordingly. My other complaint is that it comes in a re-sealable bag that does not close properly. I had the same problem with another of the Happy Belly snack line. Their "Ziploc" seals are not of good quality and require the use of a chip clip. At 44 oz, this bag should last awhile and I suspect it would not remain very fresh tasting without being transferred to an alternate container. Rating: 3.0 Product: Kitchen Basics Original Chicken Bone Broth, 8.25 oz (Pack of 12) Review: Delicious! I used it in my arroz con pollo and it was so much better than the usual Swanson broth that I use. It is not nearly as salty and extremely flavorful. Because it is listed as good for sipping I tried it that way as well and it was very good. I also really like that it comes in 1 cup portions which is great for recipes. I typically end up throwing out a good portion of a can when I'm cooking so this is much less wasteful. It's also very easy to open, no can opener or other utensil needed. Rating: 5.0 Product: C2O Baked Coconut Chips, Sweet and Salty, 1.4 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: These are so yummy! They are delicious right out of the bag and also make a great crunchy topping for ice cream, an addition to trailmix, or a multitude of other things that need some coconut flavor. I'm not so sure that they can be considered a healthy snack but if you love coconut then these are sure to appeal. They are very light and not filling so it is easy to eat an entire bag but fortunately (if you have the willpower to savor them) the bag is resealable. Rating: 5.0 Product: Colavita Mediterranean Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 68 Fluid Ounce Review: It definitely has a stronger flavor than the olive oils that I am used to using. This is not necessarily a bad thing but something to be aware of. As long as you use the added flavor as a benefit then this oil is great. Just make sure you aren't using it to cook something that needs a more neutral finish or with a conflicting flavor. Rating: 4.0 Product: Breakfast Flats, Banana Honey Nut, Breakfast Bars, 5-7.0 OZ (Pack of 8) Review: I thought these were just okay. They are too crumbly for my taste but are better when dunked in coffee or milk. My two boys (ages 12 & 14) really liked them however, hence the 4 star review. They liked the flavor and said they were more filling than other types of granola bars. Rating: 4.0 Product: Blue Diamond Almonds, Bold Jalapeno Smokehouse, 6 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: Ordered these because I wanted to try them and none of the stores in my area seem to carry them. Normally I eat the habanero bbq or the wasabi. For spiciness they are better than the habanero but not as much as the wasabi can be (though in all fairness the wasabi is in a whole different taste spectrum anyway) Flavorwise is where they lose out. They taste MUCH saltier and the flavor itself is overpowered by that until you get to the end zing where the spice kicks in. In summary, they are edible and I will finish off the cans that I ordered but I will go back to purchasing my wasabi and habanero after that. Rating: 3.0 Product: Kuli Kuli Moringa Green Energy Shots, Raspberry, 12 Count, 2.5 Ounce Shots (12 Count), Natural Energy from Green Tea & Leafy Green Superfood, Contains Caffeine, Equals Half Cup Vegetables Review: First off, it tastes awful. I can get my caffeine much more pleasantly in my coffee or tea consumption. I can't see where the benefit from the added greens is all that much and the stevia is just plain bad. I love coconut and really wanted to like this but I can't find anything (from taste to supposed benefits) about it that would make me recommend it. Rating: 1.0 Product: FISHER Chef's Naturals Walnut Halves & Pieces, No Preservatives, Non-GMO, 16 oz Review: What's not to love? They taste fresh and delicious. Perfect for baking or adding to salads (or my personal favorite, cranberry sauce) The packaging is resealable to keep the freshness for a longer period of time. I've gone through a couple of bags and have not found any shell pieces so far. Product:
FiberPlus Antioxidant Bars, Chocolatey Peanut Butter, 1.2-Ounce Bars, 5-Count (Pack of 6)
Review:
These Kellogg's Fiber Plus antioxidant bars are delicious; I could eat them all day but then I suppose I'd be spending my life in the restroom! Just as other reviewers have noted, these bars are quite tasty and they don't make me feel bloated, cramped, or uncomfortable in any way. Of course they contain some manmade ingredients (i.e., artificial flavoring) but they're still superior to candy bars. The "chocolatey peanut butter" flavor is quite good and these bars stay fresh a while after you pick up a box or two of them. Great!

True, there's some saturated fat in these bars but overall they're still good for me; they help me stay regular and that's a huge plus.

I highly recommend these Fiber Plus antioxidant bars from Kellogg's. The "chocolatey peanut butter" flavor makes them practically habit-forming!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
These power bars in that mixed berry blast flavor are tasty and delicious! True, I have to take a few minutes to chew them--they're not something I can eat very quickly, they're too chewy for that. Most importantly, but they are very  helpful to me when I exercise. For example, they are excellent for a power boost shortly before I exercise; and they help me replenish the salt I lose when I perspire both during and shortly after exercising.

Some will say that these bars really give you protein while others maintain that these bars don't have enough protein. They do have 6 grams of protein per bar so I guess it becomes an individual decision when it comes to just how much protein you want; you could have two bars before a workout or running if extra protein is what you want.

Overall, these bars are great. I love them! They are excellent for athletes and anyone serious about working out, but of course they can be enjoyed as a snack if you wish.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kellogg's Nutri-Grain Cereal Bars (Raspberry, 8-Count Bars, Pack of 6)
Review:
Kellogg's Nutri Grain cereal bars make for a tasty snack and they are good for when you need quick energy and you're "on the go." They are perfect when you don't have time to eat something more substantial to get quick energy. The price at which Amazon offers them is affordable compared to what my local supermarket charges. These strawberry flavored bars are low in fat and cholesterol, too--a great plus! Moreover, they are even "certified kosher" if that matters to you. Moreover, these bars are both chewy and satisfying  SMILE

However, this cereal bar is not perfect. Each bar contains 26 grams of carbohydrates and 13 grams of sugar; sugar can sometimes turn into fat in your body. These amounts of carbohydrates and sugar are a lot for a comparatively small cereal bar! Moreover, this food bar is not for anyone on a salt free diet as it contains some salt; and people with allergies to wheat or milk should consult their doctor before they eat this food.

These bars go down better if you eat them with juice, milk or water. I eat them with water or apple juice myself.

Overall, the strawberry flavored Nutri Grain cereal bars are useful for those of us who are not allergic to any of their ingredients and who want a healthy alternative to a regular breakfast or a candy bar. The Amazon price makes them affordable and I also recommend them as a nutritious snack food that is especially good for people on the run. They are far superior to any candy bar!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Fruit Harvest Cereal, Strawberry Blueberry, 12.2-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 4)
Review:
Kellogg's Fruit Harvest Strawberry Blueberry packs a huge punch with a great taste and it contains no fat, no trans fats and no cholesterol. It is relatively low in sugar and carbohydrates, too.

Despite the fact that this is one of the best tasting breakfast cereals out there I am disappointed in its vitamin content. The artwork on the box leads you to believe that this cereal just has to be very healthy for you. Yes, it has 25 % of your recommended daily intake of iron, niacin, vitamin B12, vitamin B6, riboflavin, thiamin and folic acid; but I expected this product to be healthier still. I will take off one star for that to make this a four star review.

It is low in sugar just as they say it is. However, if you aren't getting the proper amount of exercise you need, then the extra sugar in the strawberries, blueberries and corn syrup could turn into sugar inside your body. As always, when planning a diet, it helps to consult your physician before starting a new diet.

Nevertheless, the strawberries and blueberries taste delicious--even when you eat this dry and drink milk along with it. Kellogg's Fruit Harvest Cereal offers whole grain which is an important part of any healthy diet.

Overall, Kellogg's Fruit Harvest Strawberry Blueberry breakfast cereal is a great choice to start your day. Sure, it may not be the absolute healthiest cereal on your grocer's shelf but this cereal beats junk food by a mile. Buy some and enjoy today!

SMILE
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Product 19 Cereal, 12-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 4)
Review:
Product 19 is an excellent breakfast cereal. It has absolutely no fat, no trans fat, no cholesterol, and it is rather low in sugar content. Excellent! Product 19 even has 100% of vitamins C, E, B12, B16, iron and other nutrients as well. Very impressive! (Amazon states that it has only 10% of these nutrients but that is incorrect.)

On the other hand, the cereal is low in fiber and it contains sodium and carbohydrates. Check the label to see if you're comfortable with the amounts of ALL the ingredients in this cereal before buying it. Product 19 is something that grew on me; I initially didn't like it but I kept eating it in the morning for health reasons. Over time I appreciated the taste more and more. This may be true for you, too. Not everyone will find this cereal to be tasty the very first time they eat it. You could add a few strawberries or blueberries on top of the cereal to make it sweeter; these berries are also very healthy for you, too.

The packaging is attractive. The sealed plastic bag inside the box keeps the cereal fresh even a couple of months beyond the expiration date on the box.

Overall, Product 19 is an excellent cereal for people who care about what they eat. It may take a little getting used to because of the taste and the consistency of the cereal flakes. Despite the "taste factor" and a few drawbacks concerning sodium and carbohydrates, I highly recommend this cereal as part of a healthy diet.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Ritz Crackers, 10 Count, 37.7 Ounce
Review:
Ritz crackers by Nabisco have always been one of my favorites. I remember eating them in kindergarten at snack time--I always wanted a couple extra! These crackers have stood the test of time because they are very tasty and great to eat as a snack.

Ritz crackers are rather low in fat (4.5 grams of fat per serving) and they have almost no carbohydrates. They are cholesterol free as well--hooray! In addition, this product is kosher if that matters to you. The nutrition label indicates that there are no trans-fats but I did notice a bit of partially hydrogenated ingredients on the label--it may be that the amount of trans-fats this generates is negligible.

Ritz crackers can be eaten by themselves but feel free to get creative! They can help out when it's time to make snacks for company. Just put a bit of cheese (or melted cheese and ham) on them and you're serving up great appetizers or snack in no time! They go great with a little bit of butter on them, too.

Overall, Ritz crackers really hit the spot when I crave a snack before bedtime. I simply take a slice of two of regular cheese and place little bits of the cheese on top of the crackers and with a small beverage it's awesome!

I highly recommend Ritz crackers as one of the healthier crackers that will satisfy you, too. Great!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Gatorade Performance Series Carbohydrate Energy Formula, Wild Berry, 12-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 24)
Review:
Gatorade performance series carbohydrate energy formula is not my favorite tasting beverage; but for the athletes amongst us it can sure make excellent sense to drink this stuff! I am no athlete; I only drink this sporadically. This drink is best suited for people who train intensively and people who compete in sporting competitions. It's essentially a "high octane" version of regular Gatorade. It does have a somewhat pleasant berry, fruity taste to it that is enhanced by huge amounts of sugar. If the taste isn't too great, try to refrigerate this before drinking it. Leave any leftover Gatorade refrigerated for best taste and nutritional value.

Gatorade comes in a firm plastic bottle with a cap that screws on and off for easy drinking. It contains 79 grams of carbs that you will probably lose if you're really exercising a lot. In addition, this type of Gatorade has sodium (ouch) BUT it will rehydrate you fast after you work out. It may also be helpful to drink Gatorade if you have diarrhea; ask your doctor about this. It's also worth noting that this type of Gatorade contains 25% of the recommended daily intake of niacin, B6, and pantothenic acid

In addition, Gatorade can give you an energy boost without making you lose sleep; this is because Gatorade has sugar but no caffeine.

Overall, I highly recommend Gatorade as more than just a snack drink. Gatorade helps you to rehydrate after you sweat a lot during a work out or some type of sporting competition; and it gives you an energy boost as well while replenishing any carbohydrates you may have lost doing exercise. It may also be beneficial when you're on chemotherapy (as I am) to balance out your body's system. I believe that this type of Gatorade also contains electrolytes that can be beneficial to your system.

If you have any questions about Gatorade ask your doctor before drinking this beverage.
Rating:
4.0

Rating:

Product:
Sun Maid California Raisins, 6-Count, 1-Ounce Cartons (Pack of 8)
Review:
Sun Maid raisins are the best brand of raisins on your grocer's shelf--period. These raisins are rather healthy for you. There is no fat, no cholesterol and almost zero sodium to boot! They offer fiber and potassium and that's good, too.

However, this food is not an invariable substitute for a vitamin or other fruits with fiber, minerals and vitamins. They are relatively high in sugar (29 grams per 1/4 cup) and they lack vitamins. I'll have to take off one star for that.

However, if you want a healthy snack or something to add to your breakfast cereal or oatmeal, these raisins are excellent. They taste great and they are far better than any candy to sweeten your food. Moreover, Amazon correctly notes that the raisins do not require refrigeration nor do they bruise or spoil easily.

These raisins are great for persons everywhere who prefer to feed their children fruits as a substitute for candy. They are perfect for people who want to sweeten their food with something 100% natural, too. These 1.5-ounce cartons provide us all with a healthy snack; and that's a huge plus.

Highly recommended--to life!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
SPLENDA No Calorie Sweetener Packets, 400 Count
Review:
Splenda is a wonderful sweetener for beverages like coffee or iced tea. An individual packet has no calories; and the packet is also low in carbohydrates. It uses sucralose as a sugar substitute.

I used to prefer Sweet `N Low; but these days I far prefer Splenda as a substitute for sugar which is definitely not on my diet! Splenda is my number one choice because it makes coffee or tea very sweet without the negatives of sugar that some people have to watch, including myself because of the diet I must adhere to these days.

Splenda is a powdery white substance. Just open an individual packet (or two) and pour it in to your beverage. It is probably quite good for certain recipes as well. You may prefer to use the granular form of Splenda for certain recipes but if you don't have granular Splenda handy these packets just might do the trick. Keep the individual packets in the box they come in or you can put them into any container you wish.

The only negative I can think of is that you may want to look elsewhere for a sugar substitute if you need to watch your intake of carbohydrates. Depending on how much Splenda the recipe calls for (or how much Splenda you use in your daily beverages) there might be too many carbohydrates in larger amounts of Splenda for you. If you're watching your carbs, ask your doctor what to use as a sugar substitute.

Overall, Splenda is still a very good substitute for sugar. I used to prefer Sweet `N Low but over time I changed my mind.
Rating:
4.0

Product:
Joyfuel Organic Raw Cacao Powder, Rich Dark Chocolate, 16 Ounce (1 lb) Bag
Review:
I have been using Cacao for quite for a few years and have tried various organic brands. This one is my favorite over most others because it is actually raw and has a Dark Chocolate flavor. It blends well in smoothies and my non dairy lattes. In the morning I use 1/2 tablespoon in my Organic Hemp Smoothie. With this added it tastes more like a desert drink than just a healthy shake. I use pure Stevia extract (no other ingredients) to sweeten the drink. Only 1 very tiny spoon is enough for about 15 oz for me. I am presently using the Dukan Diet 1 oz bottle available on Amazon. Cacao is what Chocolate is made from, the less sugar the Darker the Chocolate. When I refer to a Dark Chocolate taste I mean 85% or Darker. Of course you can sweeten it to taste. Adding a good dark chocolate or unsweetened Cacao to your diet is not only delicious but has many health benefits as well. It provides fiber, iron, Magnesium, Copper & Manganese. It also contains potassium, phosphorus, zinc and selenium. Cacao as well as Chocolate contains caffeine so helps you in the morning but is unlikely to have the effects of Coffee. I started doing a shake in the morning for health benefits now I look forward to it. My recipe various somewhat but basically I use a non dairy milk such as Almond or Coconut or a combination of both, 1/2 tablespoon of Cacao, 1/4 teaspoon of Cinnamon, Stevia & 1 1/2 to 2 tablespoons of a Protein Hemp Powder. I vary adding 1/2 teaspoon of Maca, Matcha Tea Powder, Beet Powder, Berries etc. to mix it up a bit. After blending I use a couple of ounces of tea to rinse out the blender. I find I am looking & feeling better and my energy and morning brain fog has improved greatly which I contribute to the Cacao. While many brands sell Cacao finding a raw one is more difficult and being raw I find the taste richer and fuller. The bag it came is a very strong resealable attractive bag and the product I received has an expiry of January 2018. Enjoy!

5.0

Product:
Lotus Foods Gourmet Organic Madagascar Pink Rice, 11-Pound Bag
Review:
This long-grain brown rice smells more like green tea to me than floral.  It arrived to me quickly and in fresh condition from Amazon.

Organic Mekong Flower Rice(tm) - Cambodia's Floral Brown Rice, Imported from Cambodia

Mekong Flower is called 'Phka Malis' in Khmer, which means beautiful garland of flowers, because of its delicate floral aroma. Leaving the germ and bran layer intact intensifies its fragrance and nutty flavor while retaining the highest nutritional value. This nourishing whole grain rice has a lovely supple texture - unlike the chewy and bland taste of some brown rice.

Perfect in dishes that will showcase its delicate fragrance, Mekong Flower is nutritious and flavorful.

Perfect for all cuisines, it can be used steamed plain, in a pilaf, stir-fry, salad or pudding.

Mekong Flower is chiefly grown on small family plots by households belonging to the Damrei Romeal Organic Rice Cooperatives in Takeo, a province dominated by rice fields and sugar palm trees. Cooperative members are using a set of growing methods, called the System of Rice Intensification (SRI), which enable smallholder farmers to harvest more rice from their traditional varieties using less water, seed, land and no chemicals. Researchers have found that the major aromatic compound in rice is increased in response to water stress. With SRI, farmers drain their paddies periodically, which may explain why Cambodian consumers are saying that SRI-grown 'Phka Malis' is more aromatic and better tasting. Visit our SRI section to learn more about this amazing system that is transforming the rice-growing world.

# Cooks in 30 minutes
# Whole grain and heart healthy
# High in fiber, trace minerals and vitamins
# High in phytonutrients and antioxidants
# 3rd year transition, organic certification
# Fair trade
# Gluten and wheat free

1- it's only 130 calories
2- it's loaded with protein and essential vits/minerals

4- it's better than juicing all day two of these and sensible dinner will indeed take care of those two extra pesky holiday pounds provided dinner is sensible and no snacking except on a fruit
5- doesn't taste cloying like other coconut water I've tried!
Now the bad
1- every sip comes with a disgusting chalky clump
2- It doesn't matter how much you shake it, it will not dissolve the clumps
3- not particularly palatable I did it more to stick to a dietary plan than for enjoyment
4- isn't as natural as it proclaims but I guess that's to be expected
Good outnumbers bad so I am not totally disappointed but after this 6 day regimen to find once again my true north I'd probably not purchase it again
Good news is it saved me from going on another juice diet - I've almost forgotten how cranky and migraine(y) and dented my wallet was on those at lease thank God I still get to have coffee and some solids (aside from the clumps in this drink that is)

I also love that they are gluten free, so I was able to recommend them to my nephew. Rating: 5.0 Product: Torani Dark Chocolate Sauce, 16.5 Ounce (Pack of 4) Review: I am really enjoying this. I hate overly sweet or "fake tasting" chocolate in my coffee, so most store-bought mocha drinks annoy me. Yet, I love the really good ones. This allows me to have the taste of the best mocha drinks, hot and cold, at home for a fraction of the price! I never thought I could use a six pack by myself, but it has a long shelf life so I expect to have no problem! Rating: 5.0 Product: Twizzlers Licorice Candy, Halloween Candy, Hershey Chocolate, 12 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: I enjoy this flavor and it is not always available in the stores. I was thrilled to see these. They arrived very fresh and perfect. The problem was that it was too good! I ended up giving away half of them because I was eating them too fast! The recipients loved it as well, so we were all happy! If you like this flavor, I found that Amazon was a great seller and was very affordable. Rating: 5.0 Product: M&M's Milk Chocolate Mini's, 1.08-Ounce Tubes (Pack of 24) Review: The outer package and the individual tubes were perfect, yet every tiny piece is crushed! Don't know how this could happen! This made them not only ugly, but stale tasting. Very disappointed! They must have been melted and/or shaken VERY hard. Rating: 3.0 Product: Tire Tread Licorice, Black, 2-Ounce Bars (Pack of 42) Review: I really liked this licorice. It was shipped very fresh. I have had it several weeks (there is a lot in this order) and it still tastes very fresh, so it apparently has a very long shelf life. Best of all, the licorice itself is delicious. It has a very strong and clean licorice flavor. I will definitely buy again. Because of this, I gave it the full 5 stars. However, I was concerned with the way that it was shipped. It came as loose bars! They were scattered throughout my shipping box along with my other items. However, I did report this to Amazon and they were great about it. Hopefully everyone else will get theirs in a box or bag! Rating: 5.0 Product: TWIX Caramel Minis Size Chocolate Cookie Bar Candy 11.5-Ounce Bag (Pack of 4) Review: Tasty and fresh. Will order again when the hot weather is gone. I bought it in the summer and Amazon sent it packed specially with ice, which worked wonderfully. Now, we are in the later summer (Sept) when there is hot weather, but no fancy shipping, so I have to wait a few more weeks :( Rating: 5.0 Product: Endangered Species Panther, Dark Chocolate (88%), 3-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12) Review: This is VERY DARK chocolate. As such, with this high a cocoa content, it is not sweet, and is a little bitter. But, for some of us, that is a GOOD thing! I am really enjoying it. It has a nicer, smoother, texture than some of the other very dark bars. I am thrilled this came in a 12 pack! Rating: 5.0 Product: Nielsen-Massey Madagascar Bourbon Pure Vanilla Bean Paste, with gift box, 4 ounces, 2 pack Review: I bought an ice cream maker and took the advice of some reviews and bought this vanilla bean paste. It was amazing! The ice cream was the best I ever tasted. The flavor was so intense and delicious. I am really glad that I tried this, I was not interested in the extra effort of using the whole beans, and this is so much better than extract. I can't imagine ever going back to extract! I highly recommend it. Product: Bob's Red Mill Golden Flaxseed Meal, 16 Ounce (Pack of 4) Review: GOLDEN flax seed meal is never bitter or gritty, and Bobs Red Mill is the finest quality! We add it to ALL baking and everyone loves it. Example: We use this meal INSTEAD OF FAT in muffins and they are moist and delicious! For instance, if the recipe calls for 1/2 cup of oil, we substitute 1/2 cup of golden flax seed meal. Its that simple. The muffins (regardless of the type) turn out tasty and stay fresh for days! This is a MUCH better fatty fiber than any other you could add to baking. Plus, golden flax seed meal SATISFIES! You will require less food when you eat it. PLEASE NOTE - something seldom mentioned about FLAX - it is a laxative! - so add it to your diet slowly, or you may regret it. Flax calms your appetite, aids digestion, fills you up, regulates your bowels, gives STAMINA, and is a great source of Omega III fatty acids, among other things. It adds more value to your diet, naturally, than anything else you've ever tried! Your health will improve SO much after a few weeks of using this meal, you will never stop using it! Product:
Ona Grain-Free, Honey-Sweetened Brownie Cookie, 12 count
Review:
With multiple flavors, a variety pack is the best place to start.  However, as another reviewer has said, some of the flavors were impressive and others were not, although it is also a matter of personal taste.  I was impressed with two flavors, the Maple Pecan and the Brownie.  I also liked the Coconut Shortbread.  I did not care for the other flavors much.  I ended up buying the Maple Pecan and Brownie flavors again, separately.  Overall what you are getting is a soft, chewy treat that is shaped like a cookie but is more substantial in terms of density, flavor and nutritional content.  These cookies are a good source of healthy carbs, fat, and fiber and are not too sweet.  There are two cookies per individual package.  I will typically eat one of the two cookies at a sitting and save the 2nd one for later.  They are rich and satisfying and make a good mid-day snack or breakfast bar.  I do wish they were less expensive though.  However if price is no deterrent, it is hard to beat these for a healthy, enjoyable paleo snack.

Review:

golds.output: I've tried Langers pineapple juice in the past, but I have to say Dole Pineapple Crushed in Juice is a great alternative. I like the fact that the pineapple is crushed, it makes it easier to mix with other ingredients. The taste is really good, not too sweet, and it's great for making smoothies or adding to yogurt. I've also used it as a topping for ice cream or oatmeal. The 8-ounce cans are a good size, and the pack of 24 is a great value. I've had no issues with dented cans, and the expiration date is about a year from

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Langers 100% Juice, Pineapple, 16 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: First time I have tried Langers pineapple juice, as I was raised on Dole. A friend told me she liked the brand, so when I saw it at the grocery store, I grabbed a bottle. The main difference between Dole and Langers is Langers comes from a concentrate, and Dole may or may not be from a concentrate (plus Dole is now adding Vitamin E & Vitamin A). They are both products of the Philippines. Langer's seems a little sweeter, though the RDA label states they have the same calories and sugars count. Langers is also a touch thicker, like they emulsified it, as there aren't any bits of pulp settling down to the bottom of the bottle, or perhaps that's because it's pasteurized. Unlike Dole, you don't have to shake the bottle to mix up the settled juice. Nor do you need to transfer it to a new container with a snap lid (so you can shake it again before pouring it into a glass), once youve opened it. You also don't have to rummage around in the junk drawer looking for a church key to open the can. This does need to be refrigerated once the bottle has been opened. Expiration date is basically 1 year from when I purchased it. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kraft Free Catalina Fat Free Dressing, 16-Ounce Plastic Bottles (Pack of 6) Review: I prefer this over the regular Catalina, which I've eaten over 45 years. If you've never had Catalina Salad Dressing, it's a sweet, tangy, tomato based vinaigrette-styled salad dressing. Nice combination when mixed with Bernstein's Light Fantastic Cheese Fantastico Italian Dressing for a different variation. Unlike some other dressings, you do not need to over-dress your greens with this, it stands up for itself. Great on baked chicken. Good for mixing in a BBQ sauce. I've even used this instead of tomato sauce when making a pizza, with a little added diced garlic and onion (it's a lot like Round Table's Maui Zaui pizza's sauce). Rating: 5.0 Product: Campbell's Tomato Soup, 14.5 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12) Review: No dented cans so far. I make cream of tomato soup. Since I don't have milk in my home very often I add 2/3 cup of dried non-fat milk to the soup after I've heated it up. Therefore no scorching. Rating: 5.0 Product: Campbell's Bean with Bacon Soup, 28 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12) Review: Love this soup and it was my Dad's favorite. I am bad, if I have it, I will add some crisped bacon bits over the top. I also like to smash some of the beans to make it thicker. Great to eat with Marie Callender's Original Corn Bread. Plus, with both items, you only need to add water. EXPIRES: 10/2015 Rating: 5.0 Product: Green Giant Corn, White, 7-Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: EXPIRES: October 2017 Tender young sweet white corn. Unlike extra-sweet yellow corn varieties, this does not have a tough skin. Good kernel length. Not a starchy variety. Enough for 2 good servings in this smaller 7ozs. size. Compared to years ago, there is very little water added to the can. All cans are undamaged. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kraft Spaghetti Classics, Tangy Italian Spaghetti Spice Mix & Parmesan Cheese, 8-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 24) Review: Mom used to make this 50yrs ago and I haven't seen it on a store shelf in 15yrs probably. I was very happy to see this again. They haven't changed the sauce at all and it makes plenty for the given amount of pasta. The pasta is not gummy/starchy at all like other store purchased brands I've tried. If they actually pkg'd their pasta I would buy it though I normally just make pasta prior to serving it. Don't care about their parm cheese but then I also don't buy their brand, I'd rather buy a wedge and grate it myself b/c the flavor it so much better. UPDATE 5/2015: EXPIRES 1/2016 Rating: 5.0 Product: Hormel Compleats Beef Rib Tips with Mashed Potatoes and Gravy, 9 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: Has about 15 1/2" cubes of tender beef rib steak tips. Potatoes are okay, nothing to really talk about. I probably don't have the 'hard puck' problems that others do b/c my microwave is 30yo and only rated at 700w, so I cook this for 2" on Med.-High instead of the stated 1.5". Too much gravy, though it has a good taste. Would be good to mix the entire thing up and pour over a grain, bread or noodles. Stated low in sodium but it does come across as salty. Gravy has a powdered garlic taste. Found very few mushrooms, but with so much gravy if the pieces are very small I don't think you would notice them. They were sent for my Subscribe & Save order of Hormel Compleats Homestyle Beef with Mashed Potatoes & Gravy, 10-Ounce Microwavable Bowls (Pack of 6), as there was a mix-up by the packaging plant and the boxes were marked incorrectly. UPDATE 5/4/2015: Just noticed Hormel has changed this slightly. Hormel has removed the mushroom pieces from the beef gravy. Hopefully they haven't changed the gravy's flavor. Rating: 4.0 Product: Hormel Compleats Swedish Meatballs, 9 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: Microwaves in 60 seconds. Lots of spicy sauce, that you can dip your bread into, which is a little too sweet for me. Manicotti pasta is very soft. Cheese filling is okay, nothing to write home about. This was better after adding some parmesan cheese and black pepper to it. Not sure if I will order more or not. Rating: 3.0 Product: Hormel Compleats Swedish Meatballs, 9 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: This comes with two 1/8 inch thick slices of turkey, which has the texture of something Id buy in the packaged lunch meat section of a grocery store. The dressing is rather sweet and includes small dices of water chestnuts for some added crunch; it does need some extra spice seasoning in my opinion. Like all the Hormel Compleats Ive tried, this has lots of gravy. Knowing that beforehand, I made 1/2 cup of Idahoan Mashed Potatoes; so the gravy didn't go to waste. The turkey gravy is rather glutinous, and it also needed extra seasoning. This is an okay meal, but Id rather spend my money on their Chicken Breast & Dressing. It is not a couple of slices of formed meat; its actually an almost 1 inch thick piece of chicken breast. Rating: 3.0 Product: Hormel Compleats Swedish Meatballs, 9 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: Chicken breast was almost 1 thick and broke apart easily with just a fork. The stuffing was a little sweet but very tasty, it had enough sage in it to make me happy, and I liked the crunch from the added water chestnuts. The gravy was really tasty, and I don't normally care for chicken gravy. This was not at all salty, in fact I did salt & pepper the dinner after tasting it. Like the other varieties of Hormel Compleats Ive tried, the dinner is basically floating in gravy. Knowing this beforehand, I just made some Idahoan Original Mashed Potatoes to help use it all up. Rating: 5.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['nbsp', 'like', 'taste', 'great', 'use', 'used', 'added', 'really', 'cake', 'add'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Vega Snack Bar, Chocolate Mixed Nuts & Sea Salt, 1.48oz Bar, 12 Count Review: This is one of the best tasting food bars out there. I especially like the dark chocolate coating, which is a good contrast to the usual milk chocolate coating on other bars but without being too overbearing. I also found these bars to be very filling compared to other bars of its type. I received a box for review purposes but intend to purchase them on my own when I run out of them as they are definitely good in every respect. Review:

golds.output: I've had my fair share of dark roasts, and the Java Factory Dark and Handsome is a decent addition to that list. The coffee is rich and full-bodied, though not particularly complex in its flavor profile. I found it to be good for a morning pick-me-up, and it's definitely a convenient option with the single-serve cups. The roast is indeed dark, but not overwhelmingly so - it's a good balance for those who like a strong cup without being too bitter. Overall, it's a solid choice, though not necessarily one that stands out from the crowd.

Review:
While I am a huge fan of light African coffees for drip coffee, they often make a mediocre espresso. These Yrgacheffe nespresso capsules make a decent espresso, with a fair amount of crema, but it's not an especially rich flavored espresso. The light, wine-like flavors of the bean do come through a bit.

Review:
Both the original order and a replacement order arrived badly melted and partly crushed. The innards of the truffles turn easily to a liquid and the package and packaging was well coated in chocolate.

That said, if you order these in the winter, your success is likely to be better. The chocolates themselves are a sort of semi-dark chocolate, significantly different than milk chocolate, but not as dark as can be had. Tasty too.

3.0
Product:
Espressione 100% Arabica Coffee, 150-Count Pods
Review:
Both the 100% Arabica and the Espressione Espresso are excellent for espresso drinks. Traditionally espresso, unlike good drip coffee, is made with a mix of Arabica and Robusta coffees. The taste differences are noticeable, but I don't have a strong favorite. I use the pods for convenience, although I also roast my own green beans for espresso as well.

If you look at the negative reviews, they're mostly on the "best before" dates being passed. While I would also be upset to spend money and get "expired" pods, I should point out that the pods are good for quite some time after their nominal expiration dates. I just found a handful of these Espressione Classic pods with 2002 (this is late 2009 now) dates and they made acceptable, though not spectacular espresso. Basically they're vacuum packed and not much is happening inside the wrapper.

golds.output:
I'm pleased to report that Viva Naturals' Organic Ground Flax Seed is a top-notch product that has won me over with its exceptional quality and nutritional benefits. The first thing I noticed was the pleasant, nutty flavor and aroma, which is a testament to the proprietary cold-milled technology used in the production process.
