prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
CLIF BAR - Energy Bar - Apricot - (2.4 Ounce Protein Bar, 12 Count)
Review:
This is probably the best of all the "nutrition" snacks I've tried, and I've tried a lot lately.  It's NOT stale, unnatural, gummy, flat, tough, phony, bitter, sour, or just plain "off" in taste or texture.  Then again, it's not fresh apple pie either.

However, the predominant notes are cinnamon and raisins with some raw oat-y undertones, and it's comforting to discover that these are among the ingredients--70% of which are organic.  There is a slight apple-like undertone, but that may be by association, the cinnamon scent reminds one of pumpkins, coffee cake, waffles, and more. It's slightly chewy, but easily eaten and not dry.  The oats (especially) and walnuts add to the texture, although I didn't detect much walnut flavor (although there was that "waffle"-like taste). At any rate, the combination of flavors is excellent, making this an actually enjoyable little treat!

Ingredients: Organic Brown Rice Syrup, ClifProTM (Soy Rice Crisps [Soy Protein Isolate, Rice Flour, Malt Extract], Organic Roasted Soybeans, Organic Soy Flour), Organic Rolled Oats, Raisins, Walnuts, Organic Evaporated Cane Juice, ClifCrunchTM (Organic Oat Fiber, Chicory Extract, Organic Flaxseed, Psyllium), Organic Oat Bran, Molasses Powder, Natural Flavors, Ground Cinnamon, Sea Salt

Nutritional Facts: (Amount per serving is followed by % of daily value) Total Fat: 5 g, 8%;Saturated Fat: 1 g; 4% Trans Fat: 0 gr; Cholesterol 0 mg, Sodium 130 mg, 5%; Potassium 310 mg, 9%;Total Carbohydrates: 43 g, 14%; Dietary Fiber: 5 g, 20%; Insoluble Fiber: 3 g; Sugars: 20 g; Other Carbohydrates 18 g; Protein 10 g  20%.

The Clif website also reports that "Walnuts are a source of Omega-3s"  (there are 400mg of EPA and DHA omega-3 fatty acids per serving), but adds (or their lawyers add): "Supportive but not conclusive research shows that consumption of EPA and DHA omega-3 fatty acids may reduce the risk of coronary heart disease. One CLIF BAR provides 400mg of EPA and DHA omega-3 fatty acids. "

Other nutritional information.  Clif adds enough supplemental ingredients it begins to resemble an enormous,  good-tasting, multivitamin. While you don't get 100% of your recommended daily values (based on a 2,000-calorie diet), you get a pretty fair dose: Vitamin A 30%, C 100%, E 100%, K, 25%,  Thiamin 25% Riboflavin 15% Niacin 15% B6  20% , Folate 20%, B12 15%, Biotin 10%, Calcium 25%, Iron 25%, Pantothenic Acid 20%, Phosphorus 20%, Iodine  15%, Magnesium 25%, Zinc 20%,  Selenium 20%, Copper 15%, Manganese 35%, Chromium 10%, Molybdenum 15%.

While I would have preferred that the best, most natural flavor is chocolate, I'll still recommend these, but I'm taking a break from consuming or reviewing them for a while.  Bon appetit!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
CLIF BAR - Energy Bar - Apricot - (2.4 Ounce Protein Bar, 12 Count)
Review:
Main Points:

Much better then their "Nutrition" line peanut butter bar, the "regular" chocolate brownie bar has a rich flavor and a chewy, slightly nutty, substantial texture.  Unfortunately, there is an aftertaste that belies the initial flavor jolt, and-once tasted-it becomes more prominent. There's a raisiny, plum-y sort of taste (which may come from the figs inside) that threatens the chocolate integrity. Overall, however, it's quite tasty, filling, and eminently portable.

Ingredients:

Clif Bars feature organic, healthy ingredients, heavy on soy products. The ingredients include (as listed) organic brown rice syrup, organic rolled oats, "Clifpro" (a blend of soy protein isolate, rice flour, malt extract, organic roasted soybeans, organic soy flour), organic evaporated cane sugar, chocolate chips, fig paste, organic soy butter, cocoa, organic milled flaxseed, chicory, sea salt, Dutch cocoa, other natural flavors, and a pharmacopoeia of vitamins and minerals.

Nutrition:

Analysis of a 68-gram bar reveals the following:

Calories 240; Calories from Fat, 40; Total Fat, 4.5 grams; Saturated Fat, 1.5 g; Protein, 10 g; Dietary Fiber, 5g; Insoluble Fiber, 4g; Sugars, 20g; and Total Carbohydrates, 45g; and Sodium, 150mg. (This is basically comparable to the horrendous tasting Nutrition Crunchy Peanut Butter Bar mentioned above.) There are 100% of Daily Requirements of Vitamins C and E, and about 15-35% of many other vitamins and minerals (most of which are added directly to the product-see list above). Here's a nutritional comparison with the Clif "Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup":

Calories 220, Fat Calories 20, Total Fat (g) 2.5, Sat. Fat (g) 0, Cholesterol (mg) 0, Sodium (mg) 90, Potassium (mg) 280, Total Carbs (g) 43, Dietary Fiber (g) 5, Sugars (g) 21, Proteins (g) 8.

Summary:

This is apparently a very nutritious, soy rich, organic, portable snack that emphasizes protein, carbs, and fiber. Fat content is a little bit higher than their Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup, although this product has a bit more protein. While I can't give nutritional recommendations, I hope the information above is helpful.  The taste and texture are very good for this kind of product.  By the way, this is a socially responsible, consumer-friendly company (see [...]
Rating:
4.0
Product:
CLIF BAR - Energy Bar - Apricot - (2.4 Ounce Protein Bar, 12 Count)
Review:
Along with the chocolate Clif Z-Bar, this is one of the better tasting "nutritional" snacks. It has just enough chocolate (from chocolate chips, see ingredient list) to impart a chocolate flavor. Not a heavy or rich chocolate flavor, but an unmistakable one: You don't have to close your eyes, and convince yourself that it's chocolate.

This has a "Bit-O-Honey" -like chewy texture with honey overtones. Throw in some sticky peanut butter and chocolate, and you've pretty much captured the flavor. To my surprise, however, there is no honey. Clif gets that taste from syrups, malt, cane juice, fig paste, and other sweet ingredients.

It's definitely filling, especially if accompanied by an apple or something, and at least eight ounces of water.  While chewy, it doesn't seem as dry as similar products. Could it be the six grams of fat-two of which are saturated?  Made with 70% organic ingredients, this bar has a whopping 11 grams of protein, only 20 grams of sugar (compare that with other brands and flavors), and includes five grams of fiber. Along with Clif's Z-bar and the excellent Clif apple raisin walnut, this is one of the better tasting of its kind--just don't expect a brownie.

Ingredients at the time of this review. (just in case the recipe changes):

Organic Brown Rice Syrup, ClifPro (Soy Rice Crisps [Soy Protein Isolate, Rice Flour, Malt Extract], Organic Soy Flour, Organic Roasted Soybeans), Organic Rolled Oats, Organic Evaporated Cane Juice, Organic Peanut Butter (Organic Peanuts, Salt), Peanut Flour, Chocolate Chips (Organic Evaporated Cane Juice, Unsweetened Chocolate, Cocoa Butter, Soy Lecithin, Natural Flavors), ClifCrunch (Apple Fiver, Oat Fiver, Organic Milled Flaxseed, Chicory Extract, Psyllium), Fig Paste, Peanuts, Natural Flavors, Sea Salt. Vitamins & Minerals: Dicalcium Phosphate, Magnesium Oxide, Ascorbic Acid (Vit. C), Tocopheryl Acetate (Vit. E), Ferric Orthophosphate (Iron), Beta Carotene (Vit. A), Zinc Citrate, Phytonadione (Vit. K1), Biotin, Niacinamide (Vit. B3), Calcium Pantothenate (Vit. B5), Potassium Iodide, Manganese Gluconate, Copper Gluconate, Sodium Selenite, Thiamin (Vit. B1), Chromium Chloride, Cyanocobalamin (Vit. B12), Sodium Molybdate, Folic Acid (Vit. B2), Pyridoxine Hydrochloride (Vit. B6).
Rating:
4.0
Product:
KIND Healthy Grains Clusters, Vanilla Blueberry with Flax Seeds Granola, 10g Protein, Gluten Free, Non GMO, 11 Ounce Bags, 3 Count
Review:
I enthusiastically recommend this product, primarily for its vastly superior taste and texture. Although nothhing tastes like a blueberry as much as a blueberry, once you adjust (about 4 initial mouthfuls) the KIND version of blueberry, you'll not only love the taste, but it will seem close enough to the real thing that you'll have a Blueberry Experience!  NOt too crunchy, yet not too soft or crumbly, these have a great blueberry/flax/cinnamon flavor which I loved. (Non-cinnamon fans should stay away).

The product is slightly pricey, but this is offset by how filling it is--especially when consumed with water.  I'd recommend this as a pick-me-up/snack almost anytime,; for example, while at the office, on a hike, taking a break from a bike ride, etc. The ingredients tasted fresh (one unlucky reviewer reported a "rancid" ingredient). Overall a very tasty and satisfying snack food.  Highly recommended!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Worcestershire Sauce, Organic, 6.25 oz.
Review:
Annie's, the friendly company, makes this fine organic and vegetarian Worcestershire Sauce (it appears that other products have anchovies in them, hence their non-vegetarian status). Made in the beautiful state of Vermont (not too far from Ben and Jerry's) this apple cider vinegar, molasses, soy sauce based product adds a lot of dark spicy flavor to stir fries, hamburgers (I'm imagining here that you'll probably get soy burgers, and anything needing a sweet/sour/spicy kick to it. As suggested above, great in sauces and stews too.

In each large (perhaps recipe-based) 2 tablespoon serving (about seven servings per container), you get the following nutritional components:

20 calories, no fat, 460 mg. of sodium, 5 grams of carbohydrate (four of which are sugars), and bit of protein (< than 1 gram). Other information about Annie's company and products are on the web at anniesnaturals.com

Hint: For more fun, teach some youngsters to spell "Worcestershire," show them where it is on the map, and read "The Wind in the Willows" to them!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
York Peppermint Patties Dark Chocolate Covered Mint Candy, 66.7 Ounce
Review:
Yes, this is the candy that inspired the name of Patricia Peppermint Patty of Peanuts, (she's the likable, intelligent, assertive one) who pitched a no-hitter and clobbered 5 home runs in one game (and pitched a no-hit, 50-0 game which Charlie Brown lost for her with just one out), who got a D- on every one of her school assignments, and who has kind of a thing for Chuck.  Just like Patty, this candy is a classic.

If you like chocolate and you like mint, theres no better candy.  The bright, fresh mint taste explodes at first bite, somewhat mellowed and balanced by the smooth chocolate covering: The chocolate really gets second billing here, although it becomes more noticeable in the aftertaste. Its incredibly sweet, but somehow doesnt overpower, and the urge for more can be difficult to quell.  Some nutritional information might help, but even that may not be enough.

In three "Dark Chocolate Covered York Peppermint Patties (41 grams), there are 150 calories,  3g total fat, 2g saturated fat, no trans fat or cholesterol, 33g total carbohydrate , 27g sugar,  15g sodium, < 1g dietary fiber < 1g of protein, 2% of  RDA of protein, and 0% of the RDA of vitamin A, vitamin C, and calcium. Not health food, but better than some other candies on the block. Of course, this assumes you eat ONLY THREE PEPPERMINT PATTIES. The ingredients also compare favorably with other candies: Sugar, corn syrup, semi-sweet chocolate (chocolate, sugar, cocoa, milk fat, cocoa butter, soy lecithin, PGPR, vanillin (artificial flavor), invert sugar, egg whites, oil of peppermint, milk.  PGPR stands for Polyglycerol polyricinoleate, an emulsifier made with glycerol and fatty acids.  At least theres no artificial flavors to go along with all that sugars, carbohydrates, and calories.  BY the way, the people at [...] have far worse (nutritionally) data for a York Peppermint Pattie, but one can't tell if their information (which is for one piece only) is for this exact same candy as listed here, or some other version.  You can call the Hershey Company in (of course) Hershey, Pennsylvania to pursue this further, 1-800-468-1714, or go to [...]

Like Patty, Pattie is irresistible.  (I love that he is her ice-skating coach, and she thinks hes a "funny-looking kid with a big nose.")  Theres no denying that this is one delicious treat.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
Tasting and Texture Notes for Banana Flavor Power Bar.

Flavor: The predominant flavor is apples and cinnamon, with a persistent banana undertone, as well as tastes of raisin.  While not a rich banana flavor, it is recognizable, and none of the flavors seems off-tone-much more than can be said for similar products.  After looking at the ingredients below, I was very surprised that the banana power bar contains no cinnamon, and that the apple taste may be actually come from the grape and pear concentrates.  The ingredient list also reveals several grains (oat bran, rice bran, milled rice, brown rice flour), and the source of the banana flavor-banana powder.

Texture: After the initial touch bite into the dense, somewhat hard surface, the ingredients gradually present themselves as very chewy with a noticeable grainy texture.  Again, while initiates may need time to get used to this, it is not unpleasant, and the chewy quality gives the impression of substance (although there are only 3 grams of dietary fiber, as seen below).  I left one semi-open for a day or so, and found that the bar was easier to bite into, perhaps due to moisture absorption.

Nutritional Information:

(The information below is from the website, [...] and differs slightly from the Amazon.com list.)

230 Calories, 10 Calories from Fat, Total Fat 2.5 mg (Saturated Fat, 0.5 g and Trans Fat, 0 g.), Cholesterol 0 mg; Sodium, 100 mg; Potassium, 190 mg; Total Carbohydrates 45 g (Dietary Fiber 3g, Sugars, 20g; Other Carbohydrates, 22 g); Protein, 9g

*Percent Daily Values (DV) are based on a 2,000 calorie diet.

Vitamin A 0%*  Vitamin C 100% ,Calcium 30% , Iron 35% , Vitamin E 100% , Thiamin 100% , Riboflavin 100% , Niacin 100% , Vitamin B6 100% , Folate 100% ,Vitamin B12 100% , Biotin 100% , Pantothenic Acid 100% , Phosphorus 35% , Magnesium 35% , Zinc 35% ,Copper 35%,Chromium 20%, Chloride <2%

Ingredients:

High Fructose Corn Syrup With Grape And Pear Juice Concentrate, Oat Bran, Maltodextrin, Milk Protein Isolate, Banana Powder, Almond Butter, Rice Crisps (Milled Rice, Rice Bran), Brown Rice Flour, Glycerin, Natural Flavors, Soy Protein Isolate.  Contains milk, nut, and soy ingredients. Made on equipment that also processes peanuts.

Conclusion:

With a relatively low fat content (see above), nine grams of protein, and above average taste and texture, this is one of the better "energy bars" sold. Of course, for specific information about whether this meets your dietary needs, consult a physician, dietician, and/or nutritionist.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Kellogg's Frosted Mini-Wheat's Strawberry Delight Cereal, 16.3-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 3)
Review:
I'm not sure what market research prompted Kellogg's to launch this faux fruit disaster, but someone must like this. As others have indicated, this cereal is just way too sweet and artificial tasting, not too surprising when you look at the ingredients. Kids who have grown up on this taste might find it palatable, although the kids I know would go for chocolate flavoring first.  At least, the nutritional content isn't too bad.

If available and your budget permits it, try this novel idea: Get some regular mini-wheats and throw some strawberries on them.

Nutritional Information per 42 gram serving, does not include milk:

Calories: 140

Total Fat 0.5 grams (g)

0 grams of Saturated fat, trans fat, cholesterol, and sodium.

Total Carbohydrates 35 grams (12% of "Daily Value," based on a 2,000 calorie diet. This includes 4 grams of Dietary Fiber and 10  grams of Sugar.

Protein 3g

Contains 20% of the DV for THiamine, Niacin, Folic Acid, Riboflavin, Vitamin B6 and Vitamin B12, 70% of iron,, 8% zinc, and (they actually list these on the package) 0 % of Vitamin A, Calcium, and Vitamin C.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Torani Syrup, Sugar Free Vanilla, 25.4 oz
Review:
If it weren't named Torani, it still*should* be named Torani, the family named evokes the scents and "Little Italy" flavor of San Francisco's famous North Beach, where literary giants (writers, poets, booksellers, and assorted "Beats") once roamed, undoubtedly sipping deep-flavored coffee.

If that image doesn't persuade you to purchase some Torani syrup, then maybe a more relevant description will (after all, that's why you're reading this).  First of all, sugar-free means it doesn't have sugar.  This is simple stuff, but important to remember.  Sugar Free Vanilla Syrup has a vanilla flavor (although pure vanilla extract will be purer and stronger), and the taste of an artificial sweetener.  If you don't like that taste, or you insist on vanilla extract, you'll obviously be disappointed.  However, within the limits of its ingredients (and remember, this is vanilla, not, say, hazelnut or peppermint, both of which I prefer in coffee), this is a very good flavor addition.  Also, please note that the apparently outrageous price is due to the inclusion of 4 bottles of the syrup, not just one.  Then, the price is quite reasonable.  Even in the Bay Area, I've found certain flavors difficult to find, and buying from Amazon.com beats a long search.  If this is not your cup of tea (oops...), I'd still encourage you to try other flavors or, if you can, try one that is not sugar free.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Newman's Own Organics Newman O's, (Original) Creme Filled Chocolate Cookies, 16-Ounce Packages (Pack of 12)
Review:
In this multi-level analysis of Newman-O's vs. Oreos, we consider three areas:  Taste, Values, and Nutrition (as always, consult a physician or other professional about nutritional concerns).

1) Taste. A Draw--Newman-O's for adults/Oreos for kids:
Nutritional considerations aside, Kraft (which owns Nabisco) Oreos have the advantage of more sugar and a familiarity that does not bring contempt.  Newman's have a more "mature" taste, heavier on the cocoa side with hints of dark chocolate, and not as sweet as Oreos.  Newman-O's, however, are somewhat of an acquire d taste:  At first I didn't like them, then began to appreciate the more subtle cocoa flavors.  My hunch, though, is that kids will prefer Oreos.

2) Values. Newman 1, Kraft 0 (maybe even -1):
Threatened by a lawsuit and federal truth-in-labeling regulations, Kraft finally removed the trans fat (probably the worst kind of fat) from Oreos in 2006, even though a company spokesperson once said this would be "difficult,"  and that trans fat availability should be left to nutritionists, not to legislators or the courts. (Perhaps Oreos are "red state" cookies, and Newman's are for "blue staters?") Before legislation requiring labeling of any trans fat of half a gram or more, Kraft did not list it; Newman)'s never had it.

Newman's, as always, donates all after-tax profits to charity; Kraft donates an unknown amount, because they don't publicize it, and because you can bet the CEO's stock options that they're not donating all of it. While I don't want to get too political here, Newman's uses a number of organic ingredients, and organic food proponents cite the resulting health and environmental benefits.

3) Nutrition. Advantage, Newman-O's, but 2 cookies or 3?
It turns out that nutritional information for Oreos is based on a 34 gram,  three cookie serving size; Newman-O's uses a 28 gram, 2 cookie serving size.  As shown below, the 2 cookie serving size outclasses Oreos on having more of the good and less of the bad. One could argue, however, that this is an unfair comparison, because a serving size of Newman-0's is  % smaller than that for Oreos. (Although one could also argue that Newman's supports "portion control." However, if your portion control isn't controlled and you have 3 Newman-O's, the nutritional edge decreases. Still, even 3 Newman's (compared to 3 Oreos) gives you 3.57% less total fat, and less sodium. However, you'll consume 11% more saturated fat, more carbohydrates (47.25 grams to 25 for 3 Oreos), more calories (195 to 160).  Some people may also prefer Newman-O's wheat-free ingredients and use of sweeteners, rather than the often maligned high-fructose corn syrup found in Kraft Oreos.

The Verdict. A great Paul Newman movie!  Oh, and if I have to choose, I'd say at least try the Newman-O's. You (the adult, but perhaps not your kids) may like the taste better than Oreos, and the 2 cookie serving size handily beats the 3 serving-size of Oreos on total and saturated fat, sugar, calories, and sodium (as well as containng more organic ingredients).  At three cookies each, the difference begin to disappear, though with Newman-O's you satisfy not your appetite for cookies, but your hunger for helping people in need. I know, it sounds touchy-feely, but it's true.

Ingredients--Kraft Regular Oreos:
SUGAR, ENRICHED FLOUR (WHEAT FLOUR, NIACIN, REDUCED IRON, THIAMINE MONONITRATE [VITAMIN B1], RIBOFLAVIN [VITAMIN B2], FOLIC ACID), HIGH OLEIC CANOLA OIL AND/OR PALM OIL AND/OR CANOLA OIL, COCOA (PROCESSED WITH ALKALI), HIGH FRUCTOSE CORN SYRUP, BAKING SODA, CORNSTARCH, SALT, SOY LECITHIN (EMULSIFIER), VANILLIN-AN ARTIFICIAL FLAVOR, CHOCOLATE.

OREOS, Nutritional Information.  3 cookies (34 grams):
Total fat (7 grams), Saturated fat (2 g). Trans fat (0 g), calories (160), sugar (14 grams), Total Carbohydrates, (25g), dietary fiber (1 g), protein (2 g), sodium (190 mg), no cholesterol, iron (10% ofrecommended daily requirement--based on a 2,000 calorie diet), sodium

Ingredients, Newman-O's (information from drugstore.com):
Organic barley flour, organic sugar, powdered sugar, organic palm oil, organic corn flour, organic rice flour, canola oil (expeller pressed), organic cocoa, cocoa (processed with alkali), organic unsweetened chocolate, natural flavor, salt, baking soda, soy lecithin (an emulsifier). No hydrogenated oil, no trans-fatty acids. Manufactured on equipment that may process products containing peanuts, other nuts, and milk powder. Wheat Free, dairy-free, kosher (OU-D).

Nutrition, Newman-O's (3 methods of calculation).
A.  2 cookies, (28 grams):
Total fat (4.5 grams), Saturated fat (1.5 g). Trans fat (0 g), calories (130), sugar (10.0 grams), Total Carbohydrates, (31.5g), dietary fiber (1 g), protein (2 g), sodium (85 mg), no cholesterol, iron (8% of recommended daily requirement--based on a 2,000 calorie diet), sodium

B.  3 cookies (42 grams):
Total fat (6.75 grams), Saturated fat (2.25 g). Trans fat (0 g), calories (195), sugar (16.5 grams), Total Carbohydrates, (31.5g), dietary fiber (0 g), protein (1.5 g), sodium (120 mg), no cholesterol, iron (10% of recommended daily requirement--based on a 2,000 calorie diet).

C.  Serving Sizes Equal (Multiply values above by 34 grams/28 grams, round off to nearest tenth):
Total fat (5.5 grams), Saturated fat (1.8 g). Trans fat (0 g), calories (157.9), sugar (12.1 grams), Total Carbohydrates, (38.3g), dietary fiber (1.2 g), protein (2.4 g), sodium (103.2 mg), no cholesterol, iron (9.7% of recommended daily requirement--based on a 2,000 calorie diet).

Note: For "cookie sandwich" filling fans, Newman's version is also easier to separate.
Rating:
5.0

Product:
Raven's Brew Decaf Whole Bean Coffee, House Blend, 12 Ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
These coffees are weak in comparison to the Death Wish brand or even the Kicking Horse brand.  Three Peckered is extremely light, like drinking watery hotel coffee.  So, brew it extra strong.  Then it becomes palatable.  Resurrection is weak but tastes very nice and smooth.  Dead Man's Reach is the a medium strength roast that has a little more flavor.

No acidity.  Good taste.  Mediocre at worst.  If you like a smoother, gentler coffee, these three will do.

Better stronger coffees are the Death Wish, Valhalla Java, and Kicking Horse varieties.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Kicking Horse Whole Bean Coffee, Kick Ass Dark Roast, 12.3-Ounce Tins (Pack of 2)
Review:
Better than Starbucks, Dunkin, Maxwell House, Folgers, Green Mountain, Gevalia, etc.  I have tried a lot of coffee--all types of roasts.  This dark roast is full of flavor, never gets acrid, never tastes burnt--even when left in the pot too long!  It does not irritate your stomach or leave an aftertaste.  It is a very good roast, well worth the money.  In fact, you realize how much you get ripped off by the major, more popular brands out there once you taste this coffee.

Whether you like a lighter cup or a strong cup, the coffee never disappoints.  Although I must say that this is better going strong.  More scoops equal more flavor.

It is so good that I am now going to try every other roast they offer.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Cameron's Coffee Roasted Whole Bean Coffee, Flavored, Chocolate Caramel Brownie, 12 Ounce (Pack of 3) 
Review:
This coffee provides what it promises: a sweet brew that is not acidic or chemically-overpowering.  It is a decent flavored coffee that beats Dunkin Donuts' flavored coffees easily.  While the beans smell overpoweringly flavored at first, once you grind and brew them they release a heavenly cocoa aroma and impart only a slightly sweet taste.

Good coffee that smells sweet and tastes natural.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Raven's Brew Whole Bean Deadman's Reach,Dark Roast 12-Ounce Bags (Pack of 2)
Review:
Deceptively smooth.  You can make a strong pot of Deadman's Reach and not taste anything bitter.  But the caffeine level will surprise you.  It may say it's a dark roast, but it tastes like a rather plain medium roast.  In fact, I have had blonde roasts that are similar in taste to this coffee.  You are not getting a very flavorful cup of Joe here, but a pleasant smoothness that delivers a caffeinated punch.

I view this blend as a utilitarian blend.  You need caffeine?  Buy it.  You need a gentler flavor?  Buy it.  Not fond of aromatic coffee?  Buy it.

Deadman's Reach lacks the impressive flavor and aroma of Kicking Horse Coffee blends and lacks the heavier, bold caffeine grip of Valhalla Java from Deathwish.  It's still much better than Dunkin Donuts or most of Starbuck's coffees.  You can taste the quality.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Death Wish & Valhalla Java Whole Bean Coffee Bundle Deal, USDA Certified Organic & Fair Trade (1 of Each Bag)
Review:
Two great coffees, perfect together.  These coffees are strong and never get acidic if brewed extra dark.  Valhalla Java tastes the best, has more nuance to it.  Death Wish is a sort of straight-forward dark deliciousness.  Nothing soft or sweet about these bad boys.  They make a tough cup of Joe that tastes good.  I will say that, if you make them too light, they lose a lot of their flavor, IMO.  Valhalla also seems to have a better caffeine punch in the face.

Buy it.  Brew it.  Die happy.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kicking Horse Whole Bean, Hoodoo Jo Dark Extreme Bold Roast, 12.3 Ounce Tin
Review:
Another Kicking Horse hit coffee here.  Delicious, aromatic, and unique.  No stomach issues or acid issues.  Even when it's been left in the pot too long, its drinkable!  I don't recommend old coffee, but that has to attest to this coffee's quality.  It never tastes burnt.

Hoodoo Jo is unique in that it has a strong medium flavor to me, yet it definitely has "fruity" undertones.  But nothing weird that gets in the way of that coffee taste we all crave.  It is not sweet, but pleasant.  Different.  Earthy and fruity is the best way I can describe it--even though fruity makes you think of sweetness.  I simply mean it has a natural flavor that attracts you like fruit does.  Very interesting.  Very tasty.

It will not turn off the hardcore dark lovers OR the light drinkers.  I'd say every coffee lover should give this a try.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Vita Coco Coconut Water, Pure - Naturally Hydrating Electrolyte Drink - Smart Alternative to Coffee, Soda, and Sports Drinks - Gluten Free - 11.1 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
This is a wonderful product.  Vita Coco tastes delicious.  Not overpowering or sweet.  It has a perfect, subtle, natural coconut taste.

Vita Coco truly does refresh you and re-hydrate you faster than regular water.  Faster than Gatorade.  You can feel the difference.  Especially if you are working hard, working out, or having a hard day out in the heat.

Keep it cold and you will really enjoy its taste.  Very fresh and smooth.

If you are not feeling well, this coconut water is one of the best things for you.  Easy on the stomach and easy to keep down.  Gives you energy quicker than sipping water or Gatorade.

On a more touchy medical note, if you have constipation, this stuff will usually fix that for you naturally and without discomfort.  You just have to drink enough.  How much?  That depends on you personally, but finding out is easy and rewarding.

Delicious, useful, refreshing.  Can't get better than that.  BUY IT.
Rating:
5.0

Review:
These have a strong peppery flavor that reeks of cheapness and lack of flavoring.  Instead of a complex sweet and sour marinade, you get hit with pepper.  I expected much more from Jack Links.  While the cuts of meat are more tender than regular jerky--thicker too--the flavor just kills the excellent texture of these snacks.

If you love hot stuff, give them a try.  But if you are looking for a tasty snack, look elsewhere.

I recommend you buy Jack Links Teriyaki Tender Bites or a box of Slim Jim Original.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
PowerBar Protein Triple Threat 10g, Chocolate Caramel Fusion, 1.94-Ounce Bars (Pack of 15)
Review:
Let me tell you, you can get some terrible Power Bars--like the Dulce De Leche or Oatmeal Raisin flavors--but this Triple Threat bar is delicious.  It is not quite as sweet as a real candy bar, but definitely just as tasty.  In fact, I would say it has the perfect sweetness level.  No weird aftertaste.  No chocolate burn.  Its texture is pleasant, not chewy.  Not very big either, yet it is filling.

Highly recommended.  Does not taste artificial at all.  And it will have you questioning if you are ACTUALLY eating something good for you!

BUY IT.  Lift some weights.  Buy it again.

I've tried the Bonk Breaker Energy Bar in Almond Butter & Honey flavor, and I must say, it's a tasty and convenient snack. prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Bonk Breaker Energy Bar, Peanut Butter & Jelly, 2.2 Oz (12 Count), Gluten Free & Dairy Free Review: This review is for the Mint Chocolate Chip flavored Bonk Breaker bar. Each individually wrapped bar contains 200 calories, with only 60 calories from fat. There are 13 grams of sugar in each portion. The bar has 5 grams of protein, so you wouldn't call it a "protein bar" (this designation seems to refer to something greater than 10 grams of protein). The top three ingredients are brown rice syrup, cashews, and oats. There's not much fiber (2 grams). Size-wise, this is not a large bar. The weight is 49 grams (1.76 ounces), which makes it smaller than, say, a Clif bar. It is easy to chew, and it doesn't fall apart as you are eating it (a real problem with some bars). For this flavor, the mint chocolate chip is not overpowering. That's a good thing. Rating: 3.0 Product: Honey Stinger Organic Waffle, Caramel, Sports Nutrition, 1.06 Ounce (16 Count) Review: These Honey Stinger waffles are not as "crispy" as some other brands, and I like that. The crispier ones "shatter" and sprinkle you with crumbs. I am concerned about the source of the palm oil. I found a Honey Stinger website that noted the Palm oil is "RSPO certified," but since this is not noted on the package (as compared to the USDA Organic seal), there is no legal obligation for this to be true. Rating: 3.0 Product: Annie's Gluten Free Rice Pasta & Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese, 12 Boxes, 6oz (Pack of 12) Review: When is it worth paying a buck fifty for a box of mac and cheese when you can buy the generic for fifty cents or less? You have to want to eat and live responsibly, according to Annie's Homegrown. Organic pasta, real cheese, no rBST in the dairy product, and even 100% recycled paperboard for the box. Tasty. One of those foods that makes you feel good about yourself. I'm eating a bowl with added walnuts. Yum. Rating: 4.0 Product: Annie's Gluten Free Rice Pasta & Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese, 12 Boxes, 6oz (Pack of 12) Review: Annie's Homegrown Shells & White Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese is a tasty product. I'd give it an extra star if it had some whole grains in it. Here's how you can make it a gourmet dish. For a 6 ounce box, go ahead and cook your noodles. As they are cooking, dice up tomatoes (1/4 cup), walnuts (1/4 cup), and green olives ((1/8 cup), as well as 1/4 cup of sharp cheddar cheese. Add to cooked noodles with cheese packet and stir. Yummy! Rating: 4.0 Product: PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24) Review: Me, I'm generally a big fan of PowerBars. I don't look at them as "power bars," but rather snacks that are agreeable, tasty, convenient, portable, and nutritious. PowerBar's Fruit Smoothie ("Berry Blast" flavor) is almost there, with a few big caveats. I shared my PowerBar with 4 others, teens and adults. All found the flavor better than expected. One noted that it had a "fruity gum" flavor. I had a similar reaction; it wasn't unpleasant. All gave it a thumbs up for flavor. The consistency was soft in 80 degree heat, like soft taffy. When placed on a plate, it stuck to the plate and you had to literally peel it off. There was a sticky residue left on your fingers and on the inside of the packaging. This didn't make it the cleanest snack. There were the 24g of sugar in one serving. I thought this made it too sweet. My biggest complaint was the lack of dietary fiber in this "fruit smoothie" (less than 1 gram; PowerBar's Harvest Bars have 5g). The illusion is a package of real fruit. Well, real fruit is full of soluble and insoluble fibers, essential nutrients. The fiber tossed out in the manufacturing process here probably ended up as livestock feed, which is ironic when you think about it. So for the consumers who have the illusion that they are 'eating" a real fruit smoothie, this bar is, obviously, something else. Just remember, the PowerBar Fruit Smoothie isn't going to replace a banana and a Clementine orange in your diet. FOLLOW-UP: Two years later, with a much more strenuous workout regime (participated in Wasatch Back RAGNAR relay last month, 29 hours, 189 miles), the thing I like about this bar is that it is easy on the stomach as a recovery bar. It's not a candy bar or, if you use it as one, it's an expensive piece. I use it AFTER a run or strenuous workout (defined as a run of at least 5 miles, 8.5 minute miles or better, or a full hour of core workouts). I like the tanginess. Just throw some in your gym bag. You're good to go! Rating: 3.0 Product: PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24) Review: You need a magic tonic to help you recover following a new personal best? Good luck funding one. You want a candy bar? Keep looking. However, if you want a well-packaged, carb-rich bar that won't melt in your hands, that will give you a sugar replacement that 15 minutes following your intense activity lasting 45-60 minutes, then this PowerBar Performance Energy Bar might work for you. Nonfat chocolate milk might work just as well, but it certainly won't last 12 months in that pack under your bike seat or in your backpack's side pocket. Know what you are getting, and use it appropriately. Then you won't be disappointed! Rating: 4.0 Product: Kettle Brand Potato Chips, Krinkle Cut Salt & Fresh Ground Pepper, 8.5 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: Classic, tasty calories in the form of a potato chip seasoned with salt and pepper... ahhh. They are well-packaged, but how do you control your eating? Well, the bag folds over nicely and, when closed with a clip, the chips stay fresh. So you can't use the excuse, "I needed to eat them before they went stale." And the pepper keeps you from just gobbling them all down. Maybe. It's a treat for those of us disciplined enough to control our portions. And when it is shipped to you, nobody can look in your grocery cart and give you a "tsk, tsk." Enjoy. Rating: 4.0 Product: Taste of Nature Dark Chocolate Protein Snack Bars, Peanut Sea Salt, 12 Count (Pack of 12) Review: These "Taste of Nature Dark Chocolate Protein Snack Bars" are indeed tasty! For a mix of chocolate and peanuts, the peanut flavor is tempered. I like the 10g of protein (peanuts and soy), the 3g of fiber, and the 8g of sugar. The product claims to be 70% organic. I was not aware that you could legally advertise that a product is partially USDA organic. Isn't that a bit like being 70% a virgin? I'll have one in my pack this weekend for the 12 mile trail run. Rating: 4.0 Product: Eat. Think. Smile. Baked Nutrition Bar, Dark Cherry, 1.8-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12) Review: I've tried a number of "nutrition bars" over the years. There are certain characteristics that make them acceptable and desirable: 1. Taste - they have to taste halfway decent. I realize these bars in general aren't supposed to be candy bars, but in the heat of competition or need, a bit of taste isn't bad. 2. Calories - one of the reasons for having a bar is to supplement your diet. For example, I ran 10 miles this morning, costing me about 1000 calories. Most bars are in the 200-300 calorie range. 3. Fat - I'd like the calories from fat to be less than 30%. 4. Ingredients - when push comes to shove, organic, whole grains, and few additives is my goal. 5. Fiber - at least 6 grams of fiber per serving helps the world go round. 6. High fructose corn syrup - avoid, avoid, avoid. 7. Consistency - they shouldn't fall apart as you are eating them. So this particular bar, Eat. Think. Smile. Baked Nutrition Bar (Dark Cherry) has a nice taste (and cherries in the ingredients!), is 200 calories with 60 calories from fat, has 6 grams of fiber, is a bit crumbly (don't eat it on a treadmill), and is mostly whole wheat, corn, and oats (nice). It's not vegan. There is no HFCS (yay). I like the dark cherry taste. Better than some, but I'm not giving up my Clif Bars. Rating: 4.0 Product: Wild Planet Wild Sardines in Extra Virgin Olive Oil, Lightly Smoked – 4.4oz Can (Pack of 12) Review: This product contains one of two species of small fish, Sardinops sagax or Sardinops melanostictus, commonly called a "pilchard." Add extra virgin olive oil, water, sea salt, and smoke flavoring, and you have this product. These sardines certainly cost more than the off-the-shelf sardines in the store. So why buy them? Well, you have to be committed to the Wild Planet philosophy of sustainability. I suspect that means little or no by-catch. However, since the overall populations of sardines in the Pacific are abundant, I'm not certain whether these sardines are more "sustainable" than the other brands. But... I err on the sustainability side! Rating: 4.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['one', 'flavor', 'bar', 'taste', 'tasty', 'like', 'fat', 'shrimp', 'sugar', 'real'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Popchips Potato Chips Review: About 3 months ago I stayed at a hotel in Los Angeles and these chips were in the room, offered comp to hotel guests. I am not sure I would've tried them otherwise, but I am glad I did and now I'm addicted. I am a thin person so it's all about the taste for me, calories are not an issue. I've never really liked the taste of greasy chips, but baked chips seemed so bland. These chips are the best and you should give them a try. They are tasty and not greasy. My personal favorite is the original potato flavor, but they are all pretty good. Highly recommended. I don't normally review food products but these were so good I wanted to share. golds.output: I'm very pleased with Grady's Cold Brew Coffee. The coffee is rich and smooth, with a deep flavor that's perfect for hot summer days. I appreciate that it comes with 4 bean bags, which makes it easy to brew a large batch of coffee that will last for a while. The storage can is also convenient for keeping the coffee fresh. Overall, I think this is a great value for the price, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who enjoys cold brew coffee.

Product:

Review:
We were given a Keurig coffee machine for a gift. We really like the ease and convenience of use, but the K-cups can be very expensive. I've done extensive comparison shopping, and this particular deal is the best I've found (in online or retail stores, and even different packs here on Amazon). (Not: These K-cups do not work with the new Keurig 2.0 machines.)

Product:
Jones Soda GABA Fuji Apple, 12 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
Four of us tried this drink and none of us liked it.  I guess I was expecting more of an apple flavor but it was based on apple tea, which was an odd taste.  The color and flavor were weak, though since I didn't like the taste that didn't bother me too much.  Furthermore, my husband is a neuroscientist and says that GABA is exactly the opposite of what the vendor purports -- it's an inhibitory neurotransmitter (though  Wikipedia tells us that GABA *is* be an excitatory transmitter in children and insects, so this may do you some good if you're a young bee; otherwise, I'd pass this up -- unless you enjoy the flavor of watery apple tea.
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Brooklyn Beans Fuhgeddaboutit Decaf Coffee Single-Cup Coffee for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, 40 Count
Review:
Very pleasantly surprised by this great decaf collection. I've gotten used to decaf rarely being as good as regular coffee -- but these were great.

You get five each of eight flavors: Dark Roast, Medium Roast, Light Roast (Breakfast Blend), Cinnamon, Hazelnut, Vanilla, Caramel and Maple. The regular coffees have a very good, deep flavor, and the flavored coffees were all very good. You can really taste the maple or caramel, etc. in a pleasant way.

This is a very reasonable price and I had no trouble using these in my K-cup coffee maker.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Snyder's of Hanover Pretzels, Mini, 10 Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
Yum. These little pretzel twists are crunchy and mildly salty. With a nice snap and not so dry it sucks the moisture out of your mouth, 1 serving is supposed to be about 20 twists. Each is about 5 calories.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
I received a free sample power bar through the Vine Program and looked forward to trying it; when it arrived I was babysitting two preteens, so we each had a portion and all of us agreed -- yuk! I'm giving this item 2 stars because the flavor was fine; though one child said it tasted "like vitamins", I think he meant the good fruit-tasting vitamins. The problem with this bar is the texture -- it is VERY gummy, and even stretched a bit when we cut it into portions. As one chews, it becomes rubbery; in the interest of this review I had to force myself to finish my one-third portion because it was so unpleasant. If you're prepared for the texture you may enjoy the fine flavor, but otherwise I'd suggest you steer clear of this energy bar.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Archway Cookies, Original Coconut Macaroons, 10 Ounce Box
Review:
It's smart for Archway NOT to call these chocolate chip cookies. By that measure they would fail. But to call them cookie thins or crisps or chips or whatever gives the buyer a good idea of what to expect.

These are very thin and very crisp and they do taste of (but not exactly like) chocolate chip cookies with a bit of a toffee taste. Still, chocolate chip cookies come in a variety of types and styles, and this would fit in just as well.

If these were in a chocolate chip cookie contest they would lose. But if you know what to xpect I think you might like them. They are gluten-free, and the top few ingredients are: gluten free flour made with rice flour and potato starch, brown sugar, butter, chocolate chips, whole eggs, sugar, salt, baking powder and vanilla. Wow, that's pretty straightforward. Each cookie is about 20 calories and 1 gram of fat and they do scratch that gotta-have-some-cookies itch, even if they're not particularly sweet or chocolatey. Each serving of seven cookies has 115 mg salt and 6 gm of fat, 3.5 of which is saturated fat.

Package recommends dipping these in creme or crumbling and serving on ice cream. (The latter is a good option if yours come the way mine did -- almost completely pulverized in shipping.) But my favorite so far has been dunking them in coffee, which is sublime.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tattle Tea Spiced Chai Black Tea, 5 Ounce
Review:
This black tea blended with chai spices like cardamom has a mild but distinctive chai flavor and comes in an attractive heavy foil package that gives you airtight storage. This tea can be served as is but is especially chai-like with milk and honey, served hot or cold.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Spectrum Culinary Organic Unrefined Virgin Coconut Oil, 54 fl. oz. (Pack of 2)
Review:
Coconut oil has become popular in the use receently because it's versatile as a food product and a beauty aid. It tastes great when used for cooking, and is not as unhealthy as you might imagine because it has a complex structure that makes its fat less accessible. aplus, it tastes really good, alone, used as an oil or an ingredient. You can substitute other oils in a recipe for coconut oil and it lends a delicious new flavor. A bit in cocoa, for instance, is scrumptious!

Alternatively, cocnut oil is a multi-use beauty product. It works as a moisturizer, body lotion or hair conditioner. It also has healing properties!

These packets are great to travel with, but they are larger than a single-use, so if you carry it around bring a container for it. These packets don't seal and the oil liquefies at 76 degrees.
Rating:
5.0

Product:
Blue Diamond Oven Roasted Almonds, Cinnamon Brown Sugar, 8-ounce container (pack of 4)
Review:
Diamond Almonds
Almonds are a good source of magnesium. One ounce contain approximately 20% of the RDA for an adult recommended dietary allowance (RDA)
Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA) the amounts of selected nutrients considered adequate to meet the known nutrient needs of healthy people. The RDA is based on scientific knowledge and has been presented by a committee of the Food and Nutrition Board (FNB) of the National Academy of Sciences (NAS). The Canadian equivalent is the Recommended Nutrient Intakes. RDA is generally accepted throughout the world as a valid source of information. At least 40 different nations have as well as organizations have published standards similar to the RDA.

Magnesium is the fourth most abundant mineral in the body and is essential to good health. Approximately 50% of total body magnesium is found in bone. The other half is found predominantly inside cells of body tissues and organs. Only 1% of magnesium is found in blood, but the body works very hard to keep blood levels of magnesium constant.
Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps heart rhythm steady, supports a healthy immune system, and keeps bones strong. Magnesium also helps regulate blood sugar levels, promotes normal blood pressure, and is known to be involved in energy metabolism and protein synthesis. There is an increased interest in the role of magnesium in preventing and managing disorders such as hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes. Dietary magnesium is absorbed in the small intestines. Are you taking enough magnesium in the diet? The recommended daily allowance is 300mgs/day for men, 350mgs for women. Magnesium is extremely safe by mouth - too much simply causes diarrhea. Try increasing the amount of magnesium you take by mouth until it causes diarrhea, then reduce the dose slightly so it does not. This is called taking magnesium to bowel tolerance (just like using vitamin C to bowel tolerance.

Almonds are a good source of Fiber.
One ounce contains approximately 12% of the RDA for an adult.
So, in summary, Almonds are a very healthy snack, so what's left to say?

Two things:
1st be cautious about "bowel tolerance" or "happy bowels" if you prefer.
2nd Taste.  I realize that taste is a personal thing.  That's why they make chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla.

Here's my current favorites"

 1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar).

2nd Blue diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted
3rd  Blue diamond Blue Butter Toffee
4thd Blue Diamond Almonds Bold Habanero BBQ (reminds me of  BBQ potato chips again with less sugar).
5th Bold Blazin Buffalo Wing
6th Blue Diamond Almonds Cinnamon Brown Sugar
7th  Blue Diamond Almonds Lime `n Chili
8th  Blue Diamond Almonds Smokehouse
9th  Bold Wasabi & Soy Sauce

But that's just me: you might have a completely different take on these flavors.
 4th  and 5th are very close.

Gunner
May, 2012
Rating:
5.0

The other half is found predominantly inside cells of body tissues and organs. Only 1% of magnesium is found in blood, but the body works very hard to keep blood levels of magnesium constant.

Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps maintain normal muscle and nerve function, keeps heart rhythm steady, supports a healthy immune system, and keeps bones strong. Magnesium also helps regulate blood sugar levels, promotes normal blood pressure, and is known to be involved in energy metabolism and protein synthesis. There is an increased interest in the role of magnesium in preventing and managing disorders such as hypertension, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes. Dietary magnesium is absorbed in the small intestines. Are you taking enough magnesium in the diet? The recommended daily allowance is 300mgs/day for men, 350mgs for women. Magnesium is extremely safe by mouth - too much simply causes diarrhea. Try increasing the amount of magnesium you take by mouth until it causes diarrhea, then reduce the dose slightly so it does not. This is called taking magnesium to bowel tolerance (just like using vitamin C to bowel tolerance.

Almonds are a good source of Fiber.

One ounce contains approximately 12% of the RDA for an adult.

So, in summary, Almonds are a very healthy snack, so what's left to say?

Two things:

1st be cautious about "bowel tolerance" or "happy bowels" if you prefer.

2nd Taste.  I realize that taste is a personal thing.  That's why they make chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla.

Here's my current favorites"
 1st Blue Diamond Dark mint dark chocolate (reminds me of the chocolate mint Girl Scout Cookies with less sugar.

2nd Blue diamond Blue Diamond Dark Chocolate Oven Roasted

3rd Blue Diamond Almonds Bold Habanero BBQ (reminds me of the  BBQ potato chips again with less sugar.

4th Blue Diamond Almonds Cinnamon Brown Sugar

5th  Blue Diamond Almonds Lime `n Chili

But that's just me; you might have a completely different take on these flavors.  I intend to sample all of these over this year and will be making updates to this review.  3rd and 4th are very close.
Gunner March, 2012
Rating:
5.0

You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
Power bars in general are very soft and chewy. They're not my favorite, but they are not bad. This one has a strong fruity flavor, similiar to taffy. The "vitamin flavor" is noticeable, but not horrendously strong. This is a good choice for an occasional snack on the go. Power bars keep well in the car and if they get too mushy due to heat, they recover well when cool again.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
reGen Chocolate Muscle Recovery Beverage, 11-Ounce Containers (Pack of 24)
Review:
For those of you who are wondering:

INGREDIENTS: WATER; SUGAR; COCOA; MILK; PROTEIN ISOLATE; CONTAINS 2% OR LESS OF: CANOLA OIL; MALTODEXTRIN; RICE STARCH; CELLULISE GEL; DIPOTASSIUM PHOSPHATE; SALT; NATURAL AND ARTIFICIAL FLAVOR; MAGNESIUM PHOSPHATE; CARBOXYMETHYLCELLULOSE; TRICALCIUM PHOSPHATE; CARRAGEENAN; DEXTROSE; VITAMIN E ACETATE; VITAMIN A PALMITATE; VITAMIN D

Each serving is 11oz and has 11 grams of protein, 200 calories, total fat 4.5g, colest 5mg, sodium 320mg, carb 35g, and RDAs: 10% vit A, 20% calcuim, 10% vit D, 15% potassium, 6% iron, 10% vit E, and 25% magnesium.

Unsure why amazon doesn't require vendor to list this in the product description.

Taste-wise, imagine making a cup of hot cocoa and putting in the fridge. It tastes like that except it's thick and has a slightly bitter aftertaste. Probably will be easy to get used to the aftertaste.

The package design is good with a large enough hole to allow the product to flow out smoothly.

After a workout, I really don't want to slup down 200 calories in a single gulp, so I'm dividing these into 2 portions as 100 calories is a better portion. Even though I lift weights and a recovery beverage is good, I have a difficult time drinking it directly after working out as recommended because it is so thick. I do better with water.

This stuff would probably be optimal for large guys who need a lot of calories and don't mind a thick drink after a work out.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Ritter Sport, Alpine Milk Chocolate, 3.5-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12)
Review:
Ritter Sport Milk CHocolate bar is a basic milk chocolate candy bar. It comes in a rather thick brick divided into 16 squares. These are large candy bars, the nutrition information says it's about 3 servings, a child or small person would probably be happy with 4 squares (1/4 of the bar). Personally, I eat the whole thing, If I bought these by the dozen, I would not be small.

THe chocolate itself is wonderful, smooth and creamy. It has about 30% cocoa content. If you prefer dark chocolate, Ritter Sport's dark chocolate candy is wonderful too.

Last week, we ran out of chocolate chips and wanted cookies, so we all coughed up our squirreled away ritter sport bars and broke them into bits. THose cookies were the best we've ever had.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
HERSHEY'S Chocolate Snack Mix, 6 Ounce (Pack of 8)
Review:
These are tube shaped snack bags full of bite sized Hershey bar clumps. If you are often disappointed by the lack of nuts in an almond Hershey bar, these will bee a great alternative. They are filled with nuts.

Beware, these are big tubes and NOT for anyone counting calories.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co. Chocmeister Hazelnut Spread, Milk Chocolatey, 13 Ounce Jar
Review:
This has a nice dark chocolate flavor which, unfortunately, drowns out the hazelnut flavor. It tastes a little dry, like there's not enough oil in it - and I don't care for greasy or oil foods. While I prefer dark chocolate to milk chocolate - if I eat hazelnut spread then I want to taste hazelnuts, so I'm going to stick with leading brand for now.

Claims:
* While it has "25% less sugar" than the leading brand - it still has the SAME CALORIES! How does this help?
* "50% more protein" translates to 1 extra gram in the 200 calorie serving - meh.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Merci European Chocolates, Assortment, 8.8-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 2)
Review:
This chocolate assortment is delicious, rich, smooth and creamy as only European chocolates can be. Small sticks of chocolates are individually wrapped, each one with a creamy filling. I love to buy them and pass them out after dinner. Everyone enjoys choosing their favorite flavor and the small sticks are a satisfying low calorie treat.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Philadelphia Candies Peanut Butter Easter Egg, Milk Chocolate 8 Ounce Gift Box
Review:
Ordered one for my mom for Easter, she loved it. Said she hadn't been able to find them for years. The milk chocolate egg has a creamy filling with lots of fruit and nuts.

Note: This is fresh candy, so don't send it to hot areas in the summer. They are not packed with dry ice or anything. Too bad that's not an option. I overnight mine so it arrives in the best condition.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kashi, Chewy Granola Bars, Honey Almond Flax, Non-GMO Project Verified, 14.4 oz (12 Count)(Pack of 6)
Review:
These are the absolute best bars I've ever tasted. They are chocolate-ly and not overly sweet. They manage to be both chewy and crunchy in just the right amounts. The coffee taste is very light and blends well with the other ingredients.

These little bars are only 130 each, provide 6 grams of protein and are made with whole grains and oatmeal. I eat these every day as an afternoon snack. Around 2 or 3, I'm craving a candy bar but I eat one of these instead and I'm ok until dinner. Saves me about 150 calories a day. The only criticism that I have for these bars is that there are not enough almonds in them. They are so good though that I still have to give them 5 stars.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Ghirardelli Chocolate Caramel Turtle Brownie Mix, 18.5-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)
Review:
These brownies are soft, moist and delicious. They are so much better than other brands I've tried. Mmmmm!! If the ingredient list used whole wheat flour and something that wasn't "partially hydrogenated", I would've given them 5 stars. (Hodgson Mill brownies are also awesome)

These brownies are delicious, rich and chocolately. Enjoy them in moderation. :-)
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Mighty Leaf Green Tea, Tropical, 15 Pouches (Pack of 3)
Review:
Although I love this tea, I don't buy it often because it is expensive for what you get. Amazon definitely has the best price on this tea that I've found. However, I will review the tea and not the price.

The tea bags are each good for about 8oz of water, add any more water and the tea will taste weak. The tea bags are large enough to give the tea plenty of space and the tea leaves are large and not crushed. The tropical flavor is really strong. If you like sweet tea but want to cut the sugar down or out, this is an excellent tea to drink. It tastes sweet without any sweetener. The tropical flavors compliment the green tea and the outcome is delicious.

If you are having a hard time cost-justifying this treat, go buy a tea in a coffee shop. It will likely cost you at least a dollar for one cup. If you buy this tea on amazon, you get a cup of tea for about fifty cents. That's still cheaper than a soda and much healthier.
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

<Other Writer-1>
Product:
 Healthy Choice Lunch Express, Italian Style Penne 6.95-Ounce Bowls (Pack of 6) 
Review:
Some engineer somewhere had fun with this one!

Here's how you can be eating your meal inside 5 mins - at least how it worked for me:

1) Pull the plastic film off of the top of the container
2) Peel away the plastic wrapping that holds the strainer lid in place
3) Remove the inner plastic bowl that contains the meat sauce, and set the meat sauce aside for the moment
4) Add just enough water to the uncooked pasta so that the water level reaches the fill line (the fill line is a little tough to see at first)
5) Shake the pasta so that it's all submerged in the water
6) Replace the strainer top and then cook the pasta in a microwave on high for 3 mins 30 secs
7) While the pasta is cooking, open a corner of the meat sauce
8) When the pasta is done, remove it from the microwave and let it sit while you warm up the meat sauce for 30 secs on high.
9) While the meat sauce is warming up, drain any remaining water from the pasta and remove the strainer lid.
10) As soon as the sauce is done open the meat sauce covering the rest of the way, pour it over the pasta, stir, and eat!

Wow!  That was pretty convenient, and it actually worked as advertised!  It wasn't even too hot to carry!

OK, what about the food?

To start with I'm just a regular guy who usually makes my lunches of the previous night's family dinner left-overs...i.e., not a gourmet, but not taste-dead either...

I was pleased to find that the pasta cooked well, but be advised that if you don't shake the pasta down before you cook it you might find a piece here and there that still has hard spots in it.  There was plenty of sauce...no skimping on sauce volume, and the portion size was great for lunchtime.  I wasn't stuffed when I was done, but I wasn't still hungry either.

The meat sauce was tangy and mildly spicy.  The meat sauce contained small chunks of beef (i.e., looked like hamburger), and you could tell what it was if you looked closely.  The pasta and sauce consistency was good, and I enjoyed the entire meal.  Be advised that the sauce contains onion and garlic.  If you know you have an important meeting or date later on, you will probably want to pack some mints.  Say, that would be a great addition...an after-meal mint included with each meal that you can use to fight post-meal garlic breath.

If you like the combination of convenience and pasta, this may well an excellent choice for you.

If you are also environmentally conscious, though, you should probably think twice about this unit.  Once you are done with your meal there's really not much you can do with the packaging...just recycle it.  If, however, the packaging included a solid lid rather than just the strainer lid, the main container could be washed and then reused as a food storage container...alas, that is not the case.

Anyway, I thought the food was flavorful, the portion was adequate, and the convenience excellent.  Environmental challenges drop the rating by a star though.

Lastly, you'll have to determine whether the per unit cost makes this a good deal for you.

4 stars
Rating:
4.0
</Other Writer-1>

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Organic Chocolate Chip Pancake and Waffle Mix by Birch Benders, Whole Grain, Non-GMO, 16oz
Review:
I was in the mood for waffles, so I used an entire bag of mix (about 3 cups) along with 2 1/2 cups water and 4 tbsp canola oil. Once I figured out the right amount to put in the waffle iron, they cooked efficiently in my Belgian waffle maker.

They were really sweet -- and every bite had the taste of chocolate chip. I would have preferred something a bit more subtle, and with the sweet taste, I found very little need for butter or syrup as I would normally top my waffles with. Perhaps this was also related to the amount of oil I used (in terms of being rich) as I also found the waffles a bit greasy -- and not light and fluffy. I'd suggest halving the suggested amount of oil for a less greasy and slightly healthier waffle. Pancakes are similarly easy to make on a griddle or frying pan with this mix, but you won't need any oil.

If you love chocolate chips and want an organic mix for breakfast, you've found your product. The price is reasonable for an organic product. But if you want something more subtly sweet, I'd suggest looking elsewhere.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Nutri-Grain Kellogg's Soft Baked Chocolate, Raspberry, 10.4 oz
Review:
If you like chocolate bars as *part* of your breakfast, this is your bar. If you like raspberry, this isn't your bar. The raspberry taste is nearly nothing to me and there's not much filling inside. They are very thin and soft, however, so easy to bite down whenever you are hungry.

While loaded with some added nutrients, there's still 12g of sugar per bar and plenty of artificial ingredients. At 4g fat per bar (and you'll likely want a couple to fill you up), it's an okay snack, but it is not a meal replacement or protein bar. It's more like a cookie or dessert, but there are better alternatives out there. Because they are so small, you'll if you're using them as a meal or large snack, you'll likely want something else.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Organic Valley, Organic Milk Boxes, 1% Plain Lowfat Milk, 6.75 oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
Its milk - but its ultra-high temperature (UHT) processed that you don't need to keep cold until opened. The milk I received had a best by date about five months out, so it has a pretty good shelf life. Elsewhere in the world, UHT is the most popular type of milk and is the cheapest variety available.

It tasted pretty much the same as other 1% organic milk Ive consumed, but there is a slight taste difference with UHT  perhaps a tad sweeter, but otherwise I don't know how to explain it. The milk cartons are in a convenient 6.75oz size for an easy 90 calorie drink with only 10g sugar, but they are terribly expensive at over a buck a carton. Theyre well made with a convenient straw, but Im not sure I can justify such a price for something that is much cheaper in the regular refrigerated version.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Lindt LINDOR Dark Chocolate Truffles, Kosher, 60 Count Box, 25.4 Ounce
Review:
Dark chocolate is extremely popular and the large bite size Lindor Lindt Dark Chocolate Truffles fit smoothly into that desirable dessert category.  First, the dark chocolate is smooth as the package states, the chocolate is very meltable and easy to chew, unlike some hard dark chocolates, and the individually wrapped pieces are perfect for a small treat. Nice to put out after a dinner party as well.

The ingredients are pure, though the fat is a bit high, and if you don't want so many calories, eating just one piece keeps the calorie count under 100.  Since it's such a delightful taste, just one can be savored and enjoyed without the need to open more. It's a nice gift since you can give a whole package or just individual pieces which are each wrapped separately. Except for the fat, the nutrition facts aren't that bad, so you don't feel so guilty indulging. Any how, there is no "healthy chocolate" and I enjoy eating these as an occasional pleasure.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
PowerBar Performance Energy Bar, Chocolate, 2.29-Ounce Bars (Pack of 24)
Review:
First immediate impression: really sweet and artificial tasting. Though it kind of tastes like fruit punch in my opinion, it's kind of a shocking type of taste for a product like this. Definitely a bit like candy as reviewers have mentioned.

Apart for the energy, it did keep me going for a game of basketball I had about an hour after eating the bar. Nutrition facts aren't that great compared to completing products, however. And like other products from this manufacturer, they're still quite expensive per single bar.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Eat. Think. Smile. Chewy Granola Bars, Rich Cocoa, 7-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
From the moment you cut open the package, the cocoa smell wafts out, and you know you're in for a treat.  The Eat. Think. Smile. rich cocoa granola bar is delicious and healthy, a sometimes rare combination. It's easy to understand the ingredients and is easy to nibble on for a great quick breakfast or snack.

The special African cocoa has antioxidants, according to the package, and is comparable to a cup of green tea, one of my favorite accompaniments.  The box and web site explain the details about how healthful cocoa is, and why its CocoaOne is so special and exactly where it comes from.  Each main ingredient in these bars, whole grain oats, rice, cocoa, and nuts, stands out nicely.  There is a lot of competition for granola bars, but this one is low in sugar and fat, though it isn't high in fiber, it does contain some, 3 grams per bar.

There is crunch when you bite in, though an occasional piece may be a bit hard, you know you've got something substantive.  It's not sticky like some bars and doesn't crumble which makes it easy to eat on the go.  It comes in other flavors, which I have actually tried, and I'm impressed with the choices.  I'm think the name is too long and it would be better with just one word, instead of trying to be clever with  fanciful sayings. However, the product is tasty and hopefully, good for you. It's nice to see a company promoting a product for healthy living.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Kellogg's Raisin Bran Cereals, Cinnamon and Almond, 14.5-Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
So many cereals and so few mornings to enjoy them!  I remember the time when I would choose between Cheerios or corn flakes, now my pantry probably has 15 different cereals including oatmeal; however I have always been a raisin bran fan and often could trick myself into thinking I was eating something healthy (bran). 18 grams of sugar is not a small amount and with the addition of cinnamon added to the coated sweetened raisins the pandering to children's taste buds is ridiculous.  I admit I like the addition of almonds, but I believe this has been done before?  Using my box of puffed rice (naturally sweet) as a sort of base comparison, I was astonished to contrast it with the Raisin bran ingredients.  Puffed rice has no added sugar but is sweet enough, while the raisin bran has sugar, brown sugar, dextrose, cinnamon and honey.  (The last 4 items are under 2% but who needs them.)

Could I become addicted to this cereal, probably yes.  But even after the first taste test (A full bowl of just raisin bran Cinnamon Almond) I knew I would have to mix it with something else (Shredded wheat for example) to bring down the sugar count and the calories (240 with milk).  My general advice is don't give up on basic raisin bran but stay away from the expanded raisin brans.  This new product will not revive the cereal industry, but push us more toward generic healthier cereals.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Nescafe Coffee, Partners Blend, 3.52 Ounce
Review:
Instant coffee has come a long way from the early days days of Sanka, and this newest product from Nescafe shows how much the product has improved with a decent coffee taste. The Fair Trade marking is even impressive.

The taste of the 100% arabica coffee is enjoyable and satisfies my early morning coffee needs. I may not be a true coffee aficionado since I mix my beverage with cream and sugar, but I drink a cup of coffee everyday. I've always enjoyed a quick and easy Nescafe packet like these when traveling through Europe. All one has to do is pour the contents of the tube into a mug, add nearly boiling water and voil - Instant coffee. If you're going to make coffee for more than a couple people, this isn't cost effective, but if you can live with the taste, the individually wrapped paper tubes leave far less scrap than the pods. There are also no grounds to throw away or clog drainage systems.

For the frugal amongst you, the price of a box of 50 packets is much more competitive than the Starbucks VIA instant -- this Nescafe product is about 75% less per single serving. If the taste was perfect ( la regular coffee), I might be able to award five stars, nonetheless, you can still tell it's instant, so four stars it is. Nonetheless, I'm still happy with the Partners' Blend and it's definitely a step above Sanka...
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Wheat Thins, Fiber Select, 5 Grain, 8-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
At first the new Wheat Thins, Fiber Selects, seemed rather dry and almost like a piece of cardboard.  However, as I kept on chewing the flavor was good, not too powerful for a mild or strong flavored cheese.  The size is also good, small bites that are easy to eat.  The total fat is acceptable, but other crackers such as Triscuits, are lower in fat.  The important part is that it's basically healthy fat and the number of crackers is generous per serving.

Some of the crackers were broken in the box I received, which is frustrating when you want things to look nice.  However, that can happen with any box of crackers.  I don't know if I would buy them again because the price of crackers if getting expensive.  When they are on sale, I'll probably pick up a box.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Wholesome Sweeteners, Organic Sweet and Lite Sugar and Stevia Blend, 1.25 Pound
Review:
The organic sweet and lite sugar and stevia blend is definitely a worthwhile product if you want to cut the calories and still have a sweet tasting end result.  Being organic is a plus and having to use less of the product is great as well. The conversion chart shows that half of this combo replaces the same amount of real sugar.  I found, however, that I can even use less than the recommended amount in the recipes and still get a nice sweet taste. Using only stevia isn't as good, as I think, the taste of stevia alone is a bit artificial or overly sweet. I think the price is mainly what makes me lower the review a star (to four stars.)

The texture of the this sweetener is also good as it sprinkles nicely on top of baked goods giving them a crispy look.  It's easy to pour and measure, doesn't clump, and keeps fresh in the plastic bag.  Also included with the product are recipes on the back of the bag and on the web site. This is good for those who need guidance with measurements and also good because it gives some new treats to make.  I feel it's a great product for baking, cooking and beverages and will help to cut the calories and sugar in food, perhaps helping those who might consume too much sugar.  The cost per pound is significantly more than sugar, but worth it if you are trying to cut out sugar from your diet and keeping in mind less of the product is generally needed than sugar.
Rating:
4.0
</similarpairs>

Product:
Sun Crystals All-Natural Sweetener, 50-Count Packets (Pack of 12)
Review:
Now I must first admit that I am not a huge fan of Stevia: to me it has a strange taste and aftertaste that I don't particularly like...on the other hand, I LOVE products that use Raw CANE SUGAR: in its raw form, it is WAY more healthy for your body that super-processed and refined table sugar (white sugar), and so I often gravitate towards products that use cane sugar:

In this case, the use of Stevia with the cane sugar threw me off: I tried this in hot and cold beverages, and by itself, and let me just say that the flavor is way too 'off' for me: there is an immediate bitter and strong flavor to this, that reminds me of anise (licorice flavor) that I absolutely abhor!  This first flavor is something that I just absolutely could NOT get past!  The follow-up aftertaste is not that pleasant either, with bitter and sweet notes...

If you like Stevia but like sweet products that are more natural and 'healthy', then you may really love this product, but if you don't like Stevia, or don't like anise flavor, you will likely agree with me, and be completely put off by this product: now that's my story, and I'm sticking to it!
Rating:
3.0
</Other Writer-1>

Product:
Barilla White Fiber Pasta, 12 Ounce
Review:
Very nice taste, cooks up to desired consistency in the specified time shown on the box.  What else can one say?  Very nice product, nearly a 5-star rating (just not quite THAT good for us to be willing to put it in the "best of the best" category).  Would we buy it again?  Yes.  (I don't "do" gluten, so it'll get limited use in our house, but could very well be used again for others that like wheat-based pasta.  This review came from my wife, who sometimes cooks her own pasta, and sometimes just shares my gluten-free pasta.)

4.0

Vermont Smoke & Cure Summer Sausage,Antibiotic Free Uncured, Gluten Free, Great on Charcuterie Boards With Cheese, 6oz
Review:
Wonderful!  It's pepper-y as it should be, but not too much.  Quality is great, taste is great, and there are no "bad" ingredients.  What's not to like?  We had it as part of a combination ground turkey and pepperoni spaghetti sauce (home made, of course) over spaghetti.  Would I purchase this now that I've tried it for free?  No question.  Read the ingredients list - it's all good!  I'm not particularly generous with 5-star reviews - and in this case, I can't find a single thing for which I could downgrade this.  Love it.
Rating:
