Bragg Organic Raw Unfiltered Apple Cider Vinegar, 32 fl.oz (Pack of 2)
Review:
We've used this for years and love it, but as I type this review I note that underneath the name of the product it says, "breath-gel."  I have no idea what that means!  The review is indeed for the Bragg Organic Raw Unfiltered Apple Cider.  It was also packaged extremely well, and the glass bottle would have been extremely unlikely to break because it was so beautifully packaged.  Also, the expiration date is several years in the future.  This is by far our preferred brand of apple cider vinegar
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Betty Crocker Baking Mix, Gluten Free Cake Mix, Devil's Food, 15 Oz Box (Pack of 6)
Review:
I had hoped to like this product.  I loved it!  Having been gluten-free for more than 25 years, I've been thoroughly underwhelmed by the different gluten-free cake recipes being passed around at our local gluten-free support group.  But this is as close to an "original" (i.e. gluten-containing) cake mix as anything I'd ever tried.  Betty Crocker has really done their homework on this product!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
4204 Great Northern Popcorn Organic Yellow Gourmet Popcorn All Natural, 5 Pounds
Review:
Just got this today, put it in the brand new Presto PopLite Hot Air Popper, and could not be more pleased.  Taste was excellent, and there were perhaps three or four unpopped kernels that were thrown out of the popper with the popped corn, plus three more that never popped in the machine.  A very large bowl was filled with just the small amount of corn put up to the "fill line" in the popper.  Add butter or or olive oil and salt to taste, and get FAR better quality popcorn than you'll buy in bags at the store.  This popped up great, taste was great, and almost no waste.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
4204 Great Northern Popcorn Organic Yellow Gourmet Popcorn All Natural, 5 Pounds
Review:
Using the Presto 04820 PopLite Hot Air Popper, the unpopped kernels are almost non-existent.  This popcorn pops up beautifully, with virtually no waste.  Typically there are two or three, maybe four unpopped kernals that fly out into the bowel at the beginning of the popping process, but about the same number that are left in the popper when everything has stopped popping - in other words, virtually no waste.

And while I don't like plain popcorn, this is ALMOST good enough to eat without anything on it.  But I'll stick to good old fashioned butter and salt.  Regardless, this popcorn is about the best we've ever tasted, and is the only brand we intend to purchase in the future.  What else could one want: it's organic, non-GMO, has great flavor, and there is almost zero waste!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kaffree Roma, 7 oz (pack of 6 )
Review:
My wife stopped drinking coffee almost 40 years ago, and has tried just about every "coffee substitute" out there.  This is the ONLY one she keeps coming back to.  She likes it enough that she asked for a 6-pack in order to save money on it (just slightly lower than the cost of purchasing it locally, and with no sales tax to add to the savings).  So, based on her high degree of satisfaction, this is clearly a 5-star product.  (Me?  Gluten free.  Barley and I don't get along well.... <grin> )
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Welch's 100% Juice, Concord Grape, No Sugar Added, 64 Ounce Bottles (Pack of 8)
Review:
The grape and the peach both come through OK, but there is a hint of something else that I can't quite identify.  It's not unpleasant, though not quite consistent with the grape and peach flavor that is supposed to be dominant.  Looking at the label, it's likely the pear juice that's blended in.

Though I won't have any problem drinking the full case that we purchased, it is probably not a flavor combination I'd personally want to try again - I like a slightly "stronger" taste, and this is a bit subtle to me.  It may well be just what someone else wants, however.  I do think it deserves four stars, since it's above average, and beats some store-labeled brands hands down.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Betty Crocker Baking Mix, Gluten Free Brownie Mix, Chocolate, 16 Oz Box (Pack of 6)
Review:
My wife learned to make gluten free brownies about 20 years ago (I thought I'd gone to heaven with those and pizza - entirely lacking for more than 10 years at that point).  She's made them from scratch, used various mixes (some not so good, some great), but this is about as close to what "real" brownies tasted like in my pre-gluten free days.  And if Amazon is out of them, there are other sources at reasonable prices (Wal-Mart in many locations, for example).  I still prefer Amazon, of course - no tax, no shipping if over $25, etc.  There is not much more to say - these are GREAT!  Just as with many gluten free items, they don't stay as moist as "regular" (gluten-containing) brownies, so they won't last quite as long.  But it'll likely be difficult not to finish them all in a couple of days anyway, so that hasn't been a problem.

Note: we won't give 5 stars unless we consider a product at the top of the "best" list.  This is more than just a very good product.  Gluten free?  You'll love these!  Family of gluten free relatives?  You'll hardly be able to tell the difference if at all.  Just enjoy.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Rawseed Organic Apple Cider Vinegar 3 Pack 16 Oz Glass Bottles with the Mother,Kosher
Review:
This was originally a strong 4-star review, but after using almost all of the first bottle, I'm very displeased with the actual bottle itself - enough to downgrade the overall product, even though the content of the bottles is great.  Specifically, the tops of the bottles (not the caps) are very thick and rounded, and it is literally impossible to pour out just a small amount without making a considerable mess and also having the product run down the side of the bottle significantly.  I've ended up having to tear off a partial sheet of paper towels each time I use this to keep it from running all down the side of the bottle and even dribbling onto the counter top.  Other bottles have a far less rounded top lip, allowing the amount of liquid you want to be poured out, and the flow to fairly abruptly stop when you tip the bottle back up again.  That doesn't happen with this bottle design.  I don't know that I've ever dealt with a bottle of liquid that was this messy and difficult to pour small amounts before (and that covers a whole lot of decades, hah hah!).  If you don't mind messy, or having to clean up every time you pour a little out, then forget this top paragraph and go with the rest of the review - the contents still rates a very strong 4-star review.  I just find it so messy that I will likely not purchase this product again, but go back to Braggs.

==== Original Review Follows ====

Braggs has been our "standard" for years.  I decided to try this for a variety of reasons, and am not disappointed.  It does not seem to be quite as strong as Braggs, but at the same time it seems more mild/less acid, beyond just seeming a bit less strong.  It most definitely has mother in it, and could very well become an equal favorite with Braggs.  For now, I don't feel inclined to elevate it QUITE to the 5-star level, but you will certainly not be disappointed in this product.

Also, the expiration date is October 2021 (purchased in January 2017) - over 4 years of shelf life left.  Definitely not old product!
Rating:
3.0

Review:
The is my first time with a Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf product. I am, however a great fan of Chai tea and had unfortunately discovered that all Chai's are not created equally but I like to give them all a whirl.

I was surprised at how much tea is actually packed into this little 5oz tin. I have bought loose teas before that only filled half the box so I was pleased that they did not skimp on the servings here. The tea is loose and very fragrant. My main concerns were the anise. I am not a big fan of the taste of licorice and that is usually the primary reason I will dislike a chai tea - I hate it when the taste of licorice overwhelms the flavor as it means there is not enough cinnamon and clove in it.

Thankfully that is not the case here I thought there was a very near perfect balance amongst the spices in this tea. However, as mentioned by previous reviewers this can brew up fairly weak. One way to overcome this and get it to steep a little stronger is to take the time to grind up the tea before use.

As I bought this through Amazon, I also received 3 full tins which I thought was a pretty good deal for $16.00. I will be trying other products from this company for sure.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Homefree Treats You Can Trust Gluten Free Mini Cookies, Double Chocolate Chip, 5-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I got a bag of these in a subscription box and I have to admit, I was pleasantly surprised.  I normally don't like hard, packaged cookies, but these weren't half bad.  I was actually sorry to see the bag run out!

These were crunchy without being stale.  As one of the other reviewers said, they have a lot in common with vanilla wafers.  While I didn't try this, I suspect they'd be excellent as part of a cheesecake crumb crust -- and they're whole grain (and gluten free, if that's important to you), unlike the vanilla wafers you buy at the store.  Plus, if you end up with broken pieces, they'll still work in a crumb crust!

The vanilla taste was great.  These are sweet without being too sweet, they're pretty low in sodium, and they're fairly low in fat (nutrition facts are currently in one of the product images).  I have had the chocolate chip ones before but I like these a lot better.  Although they'd certainly work for recipes, they also make a decent snack on their own.  And the whole grain flour makes them better for you than other packaged cookies would be.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Homefree Treats You Can Trust Gluten Free Mini Cookies, Double Chocolate Chip, 5-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I am always thrilled to discover new whole grain products.  If they happen to be gluten-free, that's fine by me, although I do not have any special dietary requirements other than being vegetarian.  Honestly, it's probably best to eat a variety of different grains instead of sticking with the same one(s) all the time, anyway.

These are made with oat flour (from GF oats).  They're free from all common allergens except for soy, and they're also vegan.  If you have more than one allergy, it can be a bit hard to find any packaged foods that are OK for you to consume.  These, however, would be good even for multi-allergen households.

7 cookies (a little bigger than the size of a quarter in diameter, and about 1/4 inch thick) make up one serving (150 calories).  Less than half the calories from these are from fat, which is nice, and the sodium is relatively low for a packaged food.  The fiber value is a bit low for a whole grain product, though.

I'll admit these are not my favorites, as packaged cookies go.  But, I've never really liked hard or crispy cookies, so perhaps I am not the best judge of that.  Taste-wise, I would not have guessed these were GF or vegan if I hadn't had the package right in front of me (I regularly eat wheat, dairy, and eggs, so I am constantly reminded of what "the real thing" tastes like).  I did like the taste.

Personally, I would probably not buy these again simply because they're hard cookies (which, as explained above, is not my own preference).  However, because they did taste good, they did include whole grains, and because they cater to a variety of specific dietary needs, I'm still giving a fairly high rating.  It's hard to get all of those things together in one product.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Baker's Semi-Sweet Baking Chocolate Squares, 8-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 4)
Review:
Please note: this review is for the unsweetened baking chocolate squares, since multiple product listings are mixed together on this page.

I like to bake and I make pretty much everything from scratch.  (No boxed mixes for me.)  Whenever I come across a recipe that calls for unsweetened chocolate, this is what I use.  It's pretty much guaranteed to work (or at least, it always has for me) and, being the easiest-to-find product of its type, it's likely what the recipe was developed with.  I actually have a difficult time finding any other brands of unsweetened chocolate locally.

I have used lots of this in cakes, cookies, brownies, etc. -- all with success.  Another way I like to use it is in homemade yogurt.  I much prefer the flavor of unsweetened chocolate in homemade yogurt (just take about 2 ounces, chop it up, and let it melt in around a quart of scalded milk; let the milk cool and add yogurt starter, then put in a yogurt maker).

Please note: Baker's changed the packaging some time ago (I first started noticing around the holiday season last winter), cutting the amount of chocolate you get in half (i.e., the boxes are 4 oz. instead of 8 oz.).  So even though the newer packages contain less product, if you are wanting fresh chocolate, you'd be better off ordering the 4 oz. boxes (I've seen a lot of listings for the 8 oz. boxes on Amazon).  And you may want to check with any 3rd party sellers before purchase to clarify which you'll be getting.

I'm not happy that Baker's makes it seem on the box like the new containers are improved because of the "easy break" bar.  (I preferred the individually-wrapped squares to the bar.)  However, this is still my go-to product for quality and availability reasons.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Mandy's Cookie Thins, Dark Chocolate, 4.6 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
This review is actually for the chocolate flavor which is listed as "currently unavailable" but I really hope it comes back in stock soon because I like these a lot.  I am normally not a fan of packaged cookies but I got these in a subscription box and I figured I would give them a try.  And they are oddly satisfying.

The chocolate flavor is just at the perfect level.  These have a texture that is rather unlike other packaged cookie -- crunching and chewing them is somewhat reminiscent of a Ritz cracker, but not exactly.  They appear to be fairly stable in transit; I did not have any broken pieces in mind.  You can just about fit one whole cookie in your mouth without breaking it in half (though perhaps it looks a little rude to do so).

You can see the full ingredients list if you zoom in on the product image.  These contain wheat, milk, and soy ingredients and are processed in a facility that processes eggs and tree nuts, so watch out if you have any of those allergies.

I'm not really going to bother with any kind of nutritional analysis.  These are cookies and are marketed as sweets so yes, they are somewhat high in sugar and lacking in protein and fiber, but they never made any claims to be health food.  Consume in moderation, maybe not every day, and you'll be fine.

These are crisp but not too hard or dense.  I think they would make excellent dunking cookies for some coffee, cocoa, or milk.  They are vegetarian (but not vegan, for reasons described above).  I am happy to have discovered this company and am interested in trying some of their other products now!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Doctor Kracker Organic Crispbread, Seeded Spelt, 7 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I like these, but they're not for everyone.  They're quite a bit thicker than regular crackers so they are a little difficult to break and/or bite into.  On the other hand, because of that, they can stand up to heavier spreads and toppings without breaking, and they're much less likely to be damaged during shipping.

The taste is mostly neutral although, due to the presence of sesame seeds, these are going to be better in combination with savory toppings.  I tried (separately) Monterey Jack cheese and natural peanut butter, and both of those worked.  Sodium levels are intermediate, I'd say, but these are not overly salty.  You can see the full ingredients list and Nutrition Facts panel if you look at the product images.

These are fairly high in fiber, healthy fats (from the seeds and oils), and protein, plus they have a little iron.  They're whole grain, vegan, non-GMO, and organic, if any of those are important to you.  Spelt is a variety of wheat, though, so these are not gluten free.  The spelt flour and seeds, together, give these a "rustic" feel, so if you're looking for something softer or more refined, this is probably not what you want.  Since I've been eating whole grains pretty much exclusively for several years now, though, these are a texture I'm used to.  They're not greasy and don't leave oils on your fingers, but they are a little messy.  When you break or bite into them, seeds tend to fall off, so you should definitely eat them over a plate.

I've been using these as part of the lunches I bring to work and I think they're great for that, since they're fairly healthful and since they're easily portable.  I can't rave about the taste (I really don't want to eat them on their own, without a topping), but they're about what I expected.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Crunchmaster Multi-Grain Crackers, Sea Salt, 4.5 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
These are a little hard compared to wheat crackers, but for a gluten free product, the texture is not bad.  These are pretty thin and they taste really salty.  So it is amazing to me that one serving only has 135 mg of sodium.  That's much lower than I expected based on taste (which is a good thing).

I like how a lot of the grains in these are whole grains (i.e., brown rice flour, whole grain yellow corn) instead of just simple starches.  In my experience, starchy (and non-whole-grain) GF products are easier to come by than versions with some whole grains.  These are fairly low in fat and have a little fiber and protein.  You can see the full ingredients list and nutrition facts panel in the product images.

Because these are pretty salty, you would want to use savory spreads or dips if you are going that direction.  (And don't use anything that will conflict with the flavor of sesame seeds, because that is definitely noticeable here.)  Cheese and hummus would both be good.  These are also vegetarian.  And they don't stick in or on your teeth after eating, unlike some other crackers I've had lately!

Overall, I love the flavor and the texture is something I can live with.  Even though I don't need to eat GF, I would seriously consider buying these again.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Blue Diamond Almonds, Low Sodium Lightly Salted, 6 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I normally buy the Whole Foods store brand almonds to eat as a snack at work, and I probably still will after trying these.  These (I'm reviewing the "lightly salted" kind, since this page covers multiple products) are OK but nothing really special for me.

They do have a little bit of a lower salt level than the almonds I'm used to, and that is a definite benefit, especially if you are watching your sodium intake.  Despite the "lightly salted" label, you CAN still taste the salt.  Which is good, because I think I would have a hard time eating plain almonds without salt.  So the low sodium is definitely a benefit.

However, the almonds, themselves, are really quite small, as almonds go.  And despite the fact that my usual almonds -- like these -- are also roasted in oil, these are a bit oilier and have a larger proportion of calories from fat than my usual almonds.

In the end, the health benefits of nuts are well-established -- protein, fiber, healthy fats, vitamin E, iron, etc.  If you have a Whole Foods near you, you should give their roasted and salted almonds a try (they're often on sale).  But if you don't have access to Whole Foods or a similar store, or if you are watching your sodium intake, these Blue Diamond lightly salted almonds might work for you.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Emmy's Organics, Coconut Cookies - Lemon Ginger, 2 oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
I've had the lemon-flavored maracoons from Emmy's before and liked them, so I was excited to get a chance to try the dark cacao ones. (I've been having a bad weekend and I needed a chocolate fix.  These definitely helped.)

I would not have guessed these were raw although I'm not surprised they're vegan -- they definitely have a dark cacao flavor (no milk chocolate here).  They're also kosher and non-GMO, if those are of concern to you.

These do have almond flour and are made in a facility that processes peanuts, in case you are worried about allergens. They have more fiber than you might expect from a cookie (2g), which is nice.

The only thing I'd warn you to watch out for is that one single cookie is a serving and has 100 calories, so if you eat a whole 3-pack, you're getting 300 calories.  (It's very easy to eat a whole 3-pack, trust me.)  Also, the packages are not easily resealable so you may have to worry about that if you're going to try to limit yourself to one serving.

Overall, though, I think these taste very good, plus they're full of healthy fats and antioxidants (from the cacao powder).  If you're going to eat cookies, these wouldn't be bad ones to choose!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Emmy's Organics, Coconut Cookies - Lemon Ginger, 2 oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
These were pretty good.  I got them in a subscription box (I forget which one) and didn't know they were vegan and gluten free (and raw and kosher and non-GMO) until after I ate them.  They were very soft despite sitting around my condo (unopened) for a few weeks, and I loved the flavor.  The levels of lemon and coconut worked well together (the coconut was detectable but not overpowering).

These do contain tree nut ingredients (almond flour) so you would want to watch out for that.  Also, wow, I ate three of these, which is apparently three servings, for a total of 300 calories!  So you would probably want to limit yourself to one or two or these could totally ruin a diet...Guess that's to be expected of cookies, though.

Anyway, if you are making a purchase decision purely based on taste (and you like lemon and coconut), these are wonderful.  If you're counting calories, stick to having one at a time, though.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Flour Garbanzo Bean, 16-ounces (Pack of 4)
Review:
I went on a flour-buying binge from Bob's Red Mill a year or so back.  I have had repeated successes with some of the flours (oat, coconut, whole wheat pastry, almond meal) but others were sitting around waiting for me to figure out an appropriate use (green pea, chickpea).

I honestly cannot tell you what possessed me to buy 88 ounces of chickpea flour.  But I decided a couple of weeks ago that I'd paid for it, so I'd better use it.  I've since gone seeking recipes on the internet (won't bother to post them here since you can find the same ones using your favorite search engine; gluten-free cooking sites especially have a lot of offerings).  I've been quite pleased with the results.

I have used this flour for:

*crackers
*pancakes
*falafel-type patties

This is a very easy flour to work with.  It doesn't clump easily and I can make things like cracker dough without resorting to the food processor.  (Not that I don't love my Cuisinart, it's just easier clean up if I don't have to drag it out.)  The pancakes did not taste at all beany.  You could actually use just about any pancake recipe and substitute an equal amount of chickpea flour for all-purpose flour, and it should work.

The recipe for falafel patties was on my bag.  (If it's not on yours -- I think they do occasionally change up the recipes printed there -- there are a lot of recipes for Bob's products on the Bob's Red Mill website, as well.)  Anyway, the recipe is great because it works, even for inexperienced cooks.  It's easier than using actual mashed up chickpeas to make falafel, because you don't have to add additional flour or egg to make the patties stick together (so good for vegans).

I've done a little experimenting with making deep-frying batters using chickpea flour, too, and that worked fairly well.  It's been awhile since I did that, though, as I'm trying not to do too much deep frying these days.

Also, this appears to last a long time, stored at room temperature.  Like I said, I bought mine at least a year ago, and it's still good.

Note: You can make hummus with this flour, too.  I, personally, do not care for hummus made from chickpea flour.  I much prefer my results from either soaking and cooking dried chickpeas or using canned chickpeas.  That *may* be a matter of personal preference, so if you are thinking about trying hummus from chickpea flour, give it a go.  You could find that you like it better than I did.

Now if I could only figure out something to do with that green pea flour...
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Packaged in dedicated gluten free facility. Packed in a facility that handles dairy and soy. Hope this is helpful to soemone Rating: 2.0 Product: Schar Gluten Free Table Crackers, 7.4 Ounce (Pack of 3) Review: I bought a package of these after consulting Dr Schar products. I must say that I got them for a MUCH lower price than AMZ is charging - $5.39 @ Cub Foods in Saint Paul, MN These are like a YUMMY cross between a saltine and a buttery "RITZ" or "CLUB" cracker. Rating: 5.0 Product: Enjoy Life Foods Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips Gluten Free 10 Oz (Pack of 12) Review: Enjoy Life Semi-sweet Chocolate Chips -- 10 oz Each / Pack of 12 I bought one bag of these to try and was immediately enchanted with this allergen free product. I use 1/2 bag per recipe of my Peanut butter chocolate chip cookies. The mini chips are perfect. One trick - - when using these in a cake or cookie recipe, stir them into your flour before adding to the wet ingredients. This is an old baker's trick to keep them from falling to the bottom and staying there. These are the "music" to my allergen free life and baking. Even eaten out of hand, like when I am too lazy to bake, they are YUMMY! BTW: Gluten free peanut butter choc chip cookies Adapted from Ruth's Chocolate Peanut Butter Cookies By HokiesLady [...] 1 C. oil (corn, peanut, olive, etc.) 1 C. Peanut butter (Skippy Natural's Creamy-gluten/dairy/soy free) 2 eggs 1 C. sugar 1 C. Lt or dark brown sugar 3 C. flour of choice 1/2 tsp salt 1/2 tsp baking powder 1 tsp baking soda 1/2 bag Enjoy Life chocolate chips to make: Take a 2-Cup measure and add 1 C. oil (Corn, peanut, olive, etc.) to it. Add scoops of your favorite (Allergen free) peanut butter to equal 2 Cups. This makes the PB easier to remove after measuring. ~ I use Skippy Naturals Creamy (Brown cap here on AMZ) (Another trick: One cup from the Skippy's Natural 15 oz jar is to about the bottom of the first stroke line of the red "K" in Skippy's Natural label on the jar. About 1/2 of the jar. It may be a bit short, but it works.) Put two eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat slightly. Then add the oil and PB mix. Mix a bit. Add: 1C. sugar 1 C. Lt Brown sugar Mix well, then In a 3-4 C. measuring cup add 3 C. of your favorite GF flour mix. Add 1/2 tsp EACH of baking powder and salt 1 tsp baking soda 1/2 bag of Enjoy Life mini or regular choc chips Stir the all together - I use a table knife to get to the bottom without shooting flour all over everything, just kind of cut into the flour mix with it. Scoop portions onto a greased or ungreased nonstick cookie sheet. Bake 375 degrees for 12 mins. They may not look done, but remove from oven and let set on cookie sheet to cool, then remove to plate or rack. I get about 3 dozen palm-sized cookies. NOTE: If you are using a stand mixer to mix this all up, you may need to add 1/4 C. of liquid, such as coconut or almond milk.) Adapted from Ruth's Chocolate Peanut Butter Cookies By HokiesLady [...] I find that the use of oil makes for a shortbread-like cookie. I hope you and your family find these as enjoyable and easy to make as I do. Please feel free to comment if you need more information. Rating: 5.0 Product: La Tourangelle Pan Asian Stir Fry Oil, 16.9-Ounce (Pack of 3) Review: Use this for ALMOST EVERYTHING now - -douse it on chicken before roasting, hamburgers, pork steak and, of course, the base for my stir fries It is WONDERFUL!! Rating: 5.0 Product: La Tourangelle Pan Asian Stir Fry Oil, 16.9-Ounce (Pack of 3) Review: This is SO good! I use this for my stir fries, when I am baking burgers, even for frying my steak in. It adds just a hint of onion and garlic that takes meat to the most juicy, delicious place. I find myself and even guests smacking our lips and making guttural noises of pleasure as we consume meats cooked using this. I sometimes wipe it over a roast before putting it into the oven, pouring it over the accompanying carrots, turnips, mushrooms and onions, etc. YUMM!!! Rating: 5.0 Product: Life Savers 5 Flavors Hard Candy Bag, 6.25 ounce (12 Packs) Review: After speaking with the Wrigley company, I was delighted to learn that these contain no dairy, soy or gluten. I have to admit to an addiction to them requiring a couple of bags a week to satisfy my almost-continual craving for them and can only say OMG - - YUMMMM!!!!! BTW - I buy these for $1.79-$1.99 per bag at my local Cub/Super Valu store, & this S&S price breaks down to a little over $1.70 per bag - - NOT BAD!!! Go Ahead! TREAT YOURSELF!!! Rating: 5.0 Product: Kinnikinnick Gluten Free Animal Cookies, 8 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: I usually love these. They are great for eating, and for baking (cookie crumbs), however this particular shipment seems just a bit off, not as tasty as usual and as if there is something off in the ingredients - - too much or not enough of something so they taste a bit odd and have a nasty aftertaste they usually do not have. I will chalk it up to, perhaps, a measuring error or an ingredient sub or something affecting the flavor and when I order my next shipment, as I will, hope that they have gotten these back to their normally YUMMY self. 10/1016: Came back to order some more - - again for making crumbs and snacking on cookies but - - NOT at this Price & OUTRAGEOUS Shipping COST. NOT WORTH IT! Go to your local coop and get it cheaper! Rating: 2.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill Gluten Free Biscuit & Baking Mix, 24 Ounce (Pack of 4) Review: ABSOLUTE YUMM and SO versatile - - just made my gluten free pumpernickel/onion buns with this and . . . ! Rating: 5.0 Product: Heinz Dill Relish, 12.7 Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3) Review: THIS IS NOT GLUTEN FREE! I think this sounds so YUMMY and was all set to order this but called them first to be sure of allergens (1-800-255-5750 consumer affairs) and, unfortunately, it is not gluten free. Many Heinz products are, so it is a good idea to check with them if considering purchase. I use their ketchup with no problems when I am too lazy to make my own, and it is not only allergen free, but SO YUMMY! 1/27/17 Heinz is now making gluten free white vinegar AND it says up top here tha this is gluten free, so I assume they have altered their formula a bit. Given that, I am going to give these a try now - - but only after confirming with Heinz that these really are, in fact, now gluten free.. Rating: 3.0 Product: Almond Breeze Dairy Free Almondmilk, Unsweetened Original, 32 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: This is THE yummmiest and closest to real milk-tasting drink I have yet to encounter in my Dairy-free, gluten-frfee, soy-Free ventures over the past 25 years. I just ordered a case of this on S&S after paying $3.69 per carton in the stores - - when I can find it. (It is about $2.12 per carton here on S&S.) The Tetra packs make storage so much easier. When chilled, it is hard to tell the difference between this and 2% milk. Even my very discerning daughter likes this. One caveat, be sure you are not getting the Unsweetened as, to my mind, the taste is not quite as yummy as the just-plain Original. I also find the Vanilla a bit too sweet, but the chocolate is way-YUMMY too! Blue Diamond Almond Breeze Milk, Original, 32-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) Rating: 5.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['free', 'gluten', 'use', 'one', 'good', 'amz', 'add', 'make', 'mix', 'powder'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Starbucks Natural Fusions Vanilla Ground Coffee, 11 Ounce (Pack of 2) Review: I got a free sample of this product (ground coffee beans) from the Starbucks company today (December 29, 2010). The artificial vanilla flavor was NOT impressive. It simply does not taste much like vanilla. The added "vanilla" just provides some off-beat chemical flavor. Even worse, is that this chemical flavor lingers on the metal coffee filter, and contaminates the flavor of any coffee that is subsequently brewed. Another overall problem with Starbucks coffee is that, in an attempt to imitate Peet's coffee, the Starbucks company provides a generous roasting of their coffee, but they over-roast their coffee to the point that the overwhelming flavor is one of charred or burned wood. Thus, for my 5-cup a day habit, I stick to Folger's, and when I want to treat myself, I buy Peets. I am not sure why the Starbucks company is so successful, but I am sure it has MORE TO DO with their nice furniture, the creative nomenclature of their coffees, various other marketing gimmicks, and the endless selection of sugared, candied, confectioned, and embellished coffees, and LESS TO DO with the quality of the coffee itself. As a graduate student at U.C. Berkeley, I lived directly across the street from the first Peet's coffee shop, located at Walnut Square in Berkeley, California. I first went to Peet's in the year 1973. Rating: 1.0 Using the features, generate the proper review. If you haven't received some of the features, only make use of the provided ones. prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: King Oscar Sardines in Extra Virgin Olive Oil Mediterranean Sardines, 3.75 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: My husband and his two brothers grew up on sardines and truly love them. Until now, their favorite was Crown Prince Crosspacked Brisling Sardines in Olive Oil, 3.75-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12), and they always thought it was funny to visit each others' homes and find the same brand in each pantry. Recently, though, my husband tried these Mediterranean-flavored sardines from a local gourmet store and was hooked. We were delighted to find them available on Amazon. We just received our first case, and he's in heaven. Here's his report: -medium sized -single layer -with wonderful flavor from dark olives and herbes de provence -nice compromise b/w full fishy flavor and a slight salad-like taste He'll happily take a can of these to work for lunch (which he eats outside, straight from the can, to spare his colleagues!). He'll also enjoy serving them over a huge salad, again for lunch at work or even a quick dinner at home. They're also wonderful as a solid snack, in lieu of the usual salty or sugary kind. And good over Finn Crisp Caraway Thin Crispbread , 7-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 9) or other favorite crackers, or on rye bread. VERY healthy, good for you -- can't be beat! If you're a sardine fan, or if you've always wanted to be but were afraid of the fishy taste, try these -- you may be absolutely delighted, as he is. Rating: 5.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill Bread Mix Irish Soda, 24 Ounce (Pack of 4) Review: This bread tastes good (though not like a yeast bread; quick bread may be an acquired taste). It's also incredibly easy to make -- just bake it in a pie plate after following directions to mix the dough with egg, water and oil. We recommend adding lots of caraway seeds to the dough before baking -- lovely!! Any uneaten bread becomes very crumbly by day two or three, but, strangely enough, my otherwise picky husband doesn't mind -- he loves munching on any old leftovers as a snack when watching TV (better for him than chips!). When you make an easy vegetable soup starting with Bob's Red Mill Soup Mix, Veggie, 28-Ounce Units (Pack of 4), augmented with either your own chopped fresh vegetables or a pantry source of veggies such as Harmony House Foods Soup Mix, Dried Vegetable, 12 Ounce Quart Size Jar, some fresh soda bread elevates this very simple meal to more of an occasion. And it's great to be able to make all this even when you don't have much in the refrigerator on which to base a healthy weekday dinner. Nutritious soup plus bread, all home-cooked in one hour -- wow!!! :) Rating: 5.0 Product: Quaker Instant Oatmeal Baked Apple, 1.9-Ounce Cups (Pack of 24) Review: Yeah, OK, I know, these cups are wasteful. And you can buy this and many other cereals in single-serving envelopes that you then cook in your own utensils. So why go with these? Because they're so incredibly easy. And because something that's easy gets done more often than something that's not. I used to buy these with delight in my local grocery store -- always had them on hand. More mornings than not, I'd have one of these, either before leaving for work or once I got there. It would always hold me until lunch or later, without any impulse to snack in the morning. Maybe a couple of times a week, I'd have another one for a snack in the afternoon or evening, just because it was so easy -- almost as easy as the pint of ice cream I'd have rather had but which would have been much less good for me (and even easier than EasyMac!). Then I couldn't find them at any local grocery store for years. So I'd occasionally buy a new box of the instant envelopes, having thrown out the old box before ever finishing it. There they sat, unwanted and forlorn, until they too got tossed. These aren't the best diet food or health food, and they certainly aren't ecologically wise. But they work. They're easy enough that they'll substitute for even less good choices (such as a take-out breakfast sandwich -- erghhhh). And they're satisfying -- you really feel you've had something when you finish scraping out the last of the bowl just as it is (no need to add anything). I even looked for them occasionally on Amazon but could never find them. Imagine my surprise when I googled them tonight in a sudden mad urge to go farther if necessary to stock up on them again, only to discover Amazon has them after all! And on Subscribe-and-Save, no less! Awesome. My case is on its way. If you decide to try one, I think you'll be as happy as I am. We're all in luck!!! :) Rating: 5.0 Product: Biscoff Cookies, 8.8-Ounce (Pack of 5) Review: Oh, I'm so glad to have found these on Amazon! Our local independent grocer carries them during the holidays, and we just finished the last of the ones we've been hoarding since last December. These have a very soft, pleasant taste that grows on you. One of these shortly before bedtime makes me feel calm, relaxed and quite self-indulgent, although they're actually more nutritious than you might think. A very desirable item to stock in the pantry for last-minute entertaining, or to bring along when visiting a sick friend or a shut-in. They're actually good for settling a shaky stomach (must be the ginger and/or cinnamon?!), which may be one reason Delta gives them out as in-flight snacks. They're fabulous with a dish of ice cream or fresh fruit, or with port, brandy, cream sherry or a liqueur after dinner. They work well as an item for elegant receptions. We like to offer them at dinner parties along with coffee and dessert. Unlike many cookies, they go as well with morning, afternoon or evening tea as with coffee, and of course they're marvelous on their own. I just ordered 2 packs of 5 and will be ordering more before those are gone. Hooray! If you haven't tried them yet, maybe you'd like to: I bet you'll love them as much as we do! Rating: 5.0 Product: Biscoff Cookies, 8.8-Ounce (Pack of 5) Review: Oh, I'm so glad to have found these on Amazon! Our local independent grocer carries them during the holidays, and we just finished the last of the ones we've been hoarding since last December. These have a very soft, pleasant taste that grows on you. One of these shortly before bedtime makes me feel calm, relaxed and quite self-indulgent, although they're actually more nutritious than you might think. A very desirable item to stock in the pantry for last-minute entertaining, or to bring along when visiting a sick friend or a shut-in. They're actually good for settling a shaky stomach (must be the ginger and/or cinnamon?!), which may be one reason Delta gives them out as in-flight snacks. They're fabulous with a dish of ice cream or fresh fruit, or with port, brandy, cream sherry or a liqueur after dinner. They work well as an item for elegant receptions. We like to offer them at dinner parties along with coffee and dessert. Unlike many cookies, they go as well with morning, afternoon or evening tea as with coffee, and of course they're marvelous on their own. I just ordered 2 packs of 5 and will be ordering more before those are gone. Hooray! If you haven't tried them yet, maybe you'd like to: I bet you'll love them as much as we do! Rating: 5.0 Product: Campbell's Soup on the Go, Creamy Broccoli, 10.75 Ounce (Pack of 8) Review: These are soul-warming soups, hot or cold. My husband actually prefers them cold and drinks them for breakfast, lunch, dinner or late-night snack with total delight. Great to grab when running off without time to eat, or when planning to be away. Ideal for travel or emergency stash, because no refrigeration required, not even a microwave for reheating if you're like my husband and enjoy them cold! We have 2 cases a month on Subscribe-and-Save and go through them pretty fast. Their nutritional profile isn't as bad as you might think (at least according to Weight Watchers), and they're very satisfying. If you're craving a late-night snack, think: would you be better off with cookies/candy/chips or with tomato soup?? I love that these are just as convenient as those usual snack culprits!! Rating: 5.0 Product: Pacific Foods Organic Vegetable Broth, 8-Ounce Cartons, 24-Pack Review: We, too, are using more and more veggie broth and bouillon these days, so, when several reviewers commented it was nice to have the 8-oz size to drink right out of the box, we thought, hey, portion-control, great idea! Not really so great, as it turns out. We probably WILL use the remainder as reviewers also suggested to flavor rices, couscous etc. where you don't need a whole quart and the smaller size is convenient. But the taste, on its own, just isn't too pleasant. My husband and I tried them separately on the same day. I was surprised how awful mine tasted but resolved not to say anything in case he liked his. When he got home, I asked how was the wonderful new broth, and he said "AWFUL!". So that was that. Incidentally, if you are looking for two absolutely great-tasting vegetable broths (both of which my husband will drink up all by himself, right from the box, all 32-oz.!), try these: Wolfgang Puck All Natural Vegetable Cooking Stock, 32-Ounce Packages (Pack of 12) -- fabulous for drinking and cooking -- use in place of beef or chicken broth, too (and just available again on subscribe-and-save). Pacific Natural Foods Mushroom, 32-Ounce (Pack of 12) -- extraordinary -- the broth par excellence for mushroom soup, but great for absolutely anything -- world class (though currently out of stock -- should be available again soon). Hope this helps. So sorry to have to give a poor report about the 8-oz. organic vegetable product from Pacific Natural Foods, which makes the other product we love so much... :( Rating: 2.0 Product: Bahlsen Afrika, Dark, 4.6-Ounce Packages (Pack of 8) Review: These light, delicate cookies offer a light waft of flavor and elegance -- great with demitasse or espresso, or with a light pudding, creme or iced dessert. Also great for nibbling!! 8 tiny cookies are only 180 calories, and one or two suffice for a fine decoration for dessert. I see a few negative reviews, but my experience is highly positive: light, delicately crunchy, a deft coating of dark chocolate over an ethereally thin cookie wafer. And beautifully packaged: the plastic box liner cradles 8 each in 4 cushioned nests, so that they're unbroken (even though I dropped a box). Highly recommended!! Rating: 5.0 Product: Scarpetta Tuscan Vodka Sauce, 19.8-Ounce Jar (Pack of 4) Review: Oh, this is SO good! Super easy (just heat in its own jar with loosened top in the microwave -- takes less time than to cook the pasta and doesn't even dirty a pan or dish!). Love it with tortellini or any type of plain pasta. Also great with sliced green olives added to it. Don't believe the number of servings they say, though -- if you're anything like my husband, you'll barely get through one meal for the two of you per jar, with maybe enough left for him to take to work the next day. We'd clearly need 2 jars if we have guests -- and it's definitely company-worthy, in addition to being a fast-after-work meal for ourselves. My husband wasn't enthused about buying this but is definitely a convert. We've gone through 3 of the 4 jars in 2 weeks. You'll LOVE it! P.S. The packaging problem reported earlier is DEFINITELY SOLVED -- you might even be able to run over the shipping box in a jeep without damaging the jars inside. Well done, Scarpetta and Amazon! Rating: 5.0 Product: Idahoan Mashed Potatoes, Loaded Baked Potato, 4-Ounce Package (Pack of 12) Review: These Idahoan "instant" mashed potatoes are a godsend. Quick: name some other food that can be ready in less than 5 minutes and is "real", even though cooked from a mix? These are real, dehydrated potatoes, and they're unbelievably fast to prepare. Just put 2 cups of tap water into a microwaveable bowl, add the contents of one of these bags, stir a little to mix and to get rid of the biggest lumps, and microwave for 3 1/2 minutes. That's it. When finished, just stir and enjoy. Don't think fast means yucky. They taste delicious, and you can fool people into thinking they're leftover homemade or leftovers from a restaurant. Incredibly good to have on hand. My favorite is the Idahoan Mashed Potatoes, Four Cheese, 4-Ounce Package (Pack of 12) -- out of this world! I tried this Loaded version because the Four Cheese were temporarily unavailable from Amazon itself, and a third party supplier was overcharging by about 400%. The Loaded are pretty good -- not quite as good as the Four Cheese, but still great to have in the pantry. When you come home late from work, confront the fridge with exhaustion, and think longingly of your favorite ethnic hangout or even take-out, to combat that urge you need resources at hand! We keep thin ham steaks in the freezer and turkey kielbasa in the fridge for just such occasions, both of which are fully-cooked and just require searing/heating in just minutes. These wonderful mashed potatoes can be ready even before those are and will complement any entree. Add a fresh steamed vegetable and/or simple salad (or even, if you're really wiped out, high-quality canned or frozen vegetables -- try keeping a can of cut green beans, drained, in the fridge marinating with some fresh chopped onion and a wonderful vinaigrette as an instant salad for just such emergencies!), and you can have a meal on the table faster than you can get back home with takeout. Better for the budget, better for the waistline, and yet still delicious comfort food!!! :) FYI: Although I wouldn't try it with the Loaded, you can serve the Four Cheese or the Idahoan Mashed Potatoes, Buttery Homestyle, 4-Ounce Package (Pack of 12) for a dinner party, even -- they're that good! Rating: 4.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['even', 'good', 'one', 'amazon', 'sauce', 'nbsp', 'great', 'love', 'fresh', 'make'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Nature Valley Crisp Bars, Almond Dark Chocolate Nut, 5.34 Ounce Review: These Almond Dark Chocolate Nut Crisp Bars aren't bad. They're very crispy with a decent amount of dark chocolate, not too "killer" for dieters (Weight Watchers points value for 1 bar: 4 pts; for 2 bars: 7 pts). They not very big, and don't offer a lot of protein or fiber, but they ARE tasty, slightly sweet, slightly salty, crunchy. I didn't detect much almond flavor; I tasted more peanuts than anything. Basically, I like these OK, but given a choice, I'd probably opt for something with more fiber than these, and more filling. These are just too much like "candy" for my taste. Rating: 3.0 Product: HERSHEY'S GOLDEN ALMOND Chocolate Bar, Roasted Almonds in Fine Milk Chocolate Candy Bar, Individually Wrapped Bars in Gift Box, 14 Ounce Box Review: I'm an unrepentant chocoholic, and I'm usually an equal-opportunity chocoholic, meaning I'll eat just about anything that isn't pure drek. Hershey's is a decent brand, with generally good products, not as good as some brands, but probably better than others. So I kind of knew what to expect with these almond chocolate bars. You get 5 large-ish milk chocolate bars with just the right amount of crunchy almonds. Each bar breaks into 8 nuggets -- reminiscent of Hershey's Nuggets, Milk Chocolate with Almonds, 12-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4). Yes, the quality is consistent with Hershey's brand -- creamy, a bit sweet (it is, after all, milk chocolate), etc. The gift box is nice. But at the current price (twenty-five dollars) it's just not very economical, especially when you check out other options. If this were Scharffen Berger or Guittard quality, it might be worth the extra cost. But for Hershey's? You be the judge. Only you know if it's worth it to you. I'll pass. Rating: 3.0 Product: Stella D'Oro Cookies, Almond Delight, 9 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: I've purchased a few Stella D'oro varieties over the years but haven't been a steady customer, so I really don't have much to compare these to as far as taste/quality over a period of time. I do know that I like these. Probably not enough to put them on subscribe and save, but enough to purchase again occasionally. First things first: these are not overly sweet and they're rather dry, so it's clear they're intended to be eaten with coffee or tea or even wine. The flavor is there -- vanilla in some, lemon in others, chocolate -- but it's very subtle. The icing and sprinkles really bring nothing to the party -- the icing is a thin "smear," without flavor. But flavor and "mouth feel" are overall pleasant. They're also quite "sturdy" -- mine survived transport in less than optimum exterior packaging without a single broken cookie. Seriously -- not a one broke. Even with that, they're still tender - not "hard" and crunchy at all. And you do get quite a lot of them -- they come in a plastic tray that is 9.5" x 5.5" x 2" that is filled full. As I said, I'll likely order these sometime in the future, possibly adding them into my "cookie rotation" of brands/types that I like to purchase occasionally. Definitely worth 4 stars: I like them. Rating: 4.0 Product: OliveNation Honey Roasted Sesame Chips, 8 Ounce Review: Like others, I'm sure, I first tasted these in a "pub mix" blend of pretzel stix, cheese twists, and rice treats. It was love at first taste, and I spent some time trying to find a source for just these sesame chips. Tried a couple of other options, but this is the clear winner! It comes closest to the taste of the sesame treats in the pub mix -- a little salty, a little sweet, and a tender "crunch" that is ... well ... just about perfect. I eat them "straight up," of course, but one of my favorite ways to use them is in my own savory trail mix: these crackers, mini pretzels, cheeze crackers (or goldfish crackers), honey roasted almonds, and corn chex cereal. I usually have a couple of bowls of this out for cocktail parties and it always goes over well. Will continue to purchase these as long as they're still available. These OliveNation chips have the best flavor and definitely are the freshest tasting. Solid 5 stars! Rating: 5.0 Product: HERSHEY'S SPECIAL DARK Nuggets, Gluten-Free Mildly Sweet Dark Chocolate Candy with Almonds, 12 Ounce Bag (Pack of 4) Review: Oh my. Well, there went the diet, big time. The milk chocolate is creamy goodness, and the toffee chips and finely chopped almonds add just the right amount of sweet slightly salty crunch. These are absolutely addictive, and I have to seriously limit my consumption if I have any hope of staying on track diet-wise. Will definitely keep these around -- despite the temptation. They're really THAT good. Rating: 5.0 Product: Ghirardelli Chocolate Squares, Peppermint Bark, 7.06 oz., 3 Count Review: Certain members of my family are mint+chocolate addicts. Peppermint bark, filled peppermint chocolates, chocolate mint cookies, anything that combines mint with chocolate. This year, we got both the dark and milk chocolate varieties of these Ghirardelli peppermint bark squares. We liked both flavors, probably preferred the dark chocolate, but found both to have a nice balance of mint to chocolate. The crushed peppermint candy bits in the white chocolate top add a nice crunch, too. The price here is very good, too. Definitely a keeper! Rating: 4.0 Product: Twix Cookie Bars, Caramel Milk Chocolate, 1.79-Ounce Packages (Pack of 36) Review: A crunchy cookie topped with caramel, all covered in milk chocolate. What's not to like? These make a nice snack in the afternoon with a cup of tea. They're more like a cookie than a candy bar (to me, anyway). Amazon's price is pretty good, too, for 36 "regular sized" packages (2 cookie bars per package). Will order again, for sure. Rating: 5.0 Product: SNICKERS Easter Minis Size Chocolate Candy Bars 11.5-Ounce Bag (Pack of 4) Review: I have a love/hate relationship with this candy. I love it in terms of the flavor, size, etc. But it's all too easy for me to overindulge. So I have to be careful and put myself on an "allowance." But it's so worth it! I'm careful to indulge in a treat occasionally, not as a habit, and this is my "go to" treat (well, this, or a small brownie hot fudge sundae) :-) Seriously, though, these are excellent, and just the right size for a small treat once in awhile. The packages I received were fresh with a long expire date lead time. Will order again when I feel the urge for my Snickers fix. Rating: 5.0 Product: Planters Cashews in Milk Chocolate, 3.5-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 12) Review: I purchased these to use with various recipes that use small quantities of slivered almonds. The small 2-oz packages allow me to use just what I need, keeping the rest fresh for future use. My favorite recipe is a quinoa salad using dried apricots, golden raisins, slivered almonds, and a little green onion, with a lime-mirin-oil-spices dressing. YUM! The 12 packs will last awhile, too. Very happy with this purchase. Rating: 5.0 Product: Special K Cracker Chips, Sea Salt, 3.48 Ounce ,(Pack of 4) Review: These are pretty good. They're not as crispy as potato chips, but they have a decent sour cream and onion taste. Like someone else mentioned, these are VERY similar to Popchips, just a bit thinner. The calorie count is low: 27 chips = 110 calories, and there are only about 3 servings per box, so even if you can't stop yourself, you're looking at only 330 calories or so for the entire box. Obviously, you wouldn't want to down an entire box every day, but if you do, the damage isn't *too* bad. I'll probably purchase them once in awhile as an alternative snack. Rating: 4.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['flavor', 'like', 'good', 'chocolate', 'really', 'one', 'use', 'amazon', 'definitely', 'sweet'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Lazy Day Foods Dark Chocolate Ginger Cookies, 4.4-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4) Review: These cookies arrived in the afternoon. They didn't sit in the mail box long, but I discovered upon opening them that the chocolate was seriously melted. I put the box in the refrigerator. Not the best idea obviously because now the cookies were cemented together by the chocolate. Obviously this is no fault of the cookie manufacturer, but I do want to make you aware of what you might be dealing with if you mail order these. I'm a hormonal woman, so I found a way to eat the cookies, though they were so messy I ended up eating over the sink and creating a huge chocolate mess on my hands and face--I looked like a three year old. Were they worth the trouble? Sadly no. Ginger? What ginger? The dark chocolate isn't bad, but the cookie tastes like nothing. I was really looking forward to eating a ginger cookie, but there wasn't even a hint of it. If you're on a gluten-free diet, you might find these tasty. I'm not and didn't. Rating: 3.0 Using the features, generate the proper review. If you haven't received some of the features, only make use of the provided ones. golds.output: I recently purchased a pack of Lychee in Syrup and was very pleased with the quality and taste.  The lychees are sweet and firm, and the syrup is not too overpowering.  I was a bit skeptical at first, but after trying them, I found that they are perfect as a snack or as a topping for ice cream or yogurt.  The packaging is also convenient, with three 20oz containers that are easy to store in the pantry.  Overall, I am very satisfied with this product and would highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys lychees or is looking to try something new.

Product:
Queen Anne, Cherry Cordials, Dark Chocolate, 10 Pieces, 6.6oz Box (Pack of 2)
Review:
I received a box of milk chocolate Queen Anne cherry cordials for Valentine's.  These were the first I had eaten in some years as I prefer liquid center cordials.  The chocolate is very good, the cherry firm, the center a tasty mixture of liquid and creme fondant and the texture pleasing,  but they are very sweet.  I decided to buy a box of dark chocolate cordials to see if, perhaps, they would be less sweet.  As expected, they are less sweet than the milk chocolate variety but still very sweet.  These are not the cordials which most people would enjoy snacking on, one piece is enough to satisfy a sweet tooth.  Which means, of course, that you are unlikely to eat most of the box in one sitting.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
ALMOND JOY, Chocolate Coconut Candy Bar (Pack of 36)
Review:
We recently sampled several brands of chocolate coconut candy including Russell Stover, Anastasia's, and Whitman's.  Our conclusion is that we have yet to find any better than Mounds and Almond Joy.  The three brands listed are not even as good.  Neither are coconut bon bons or rainbow coconut slices from Cracker barrel.  Lindt isn't bad, but still not as good.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Margaret Holmes, Tomato, Okra & Corn, 14.5oz Can (Pack of 6)
Review:
I found this delicious treat at Dollar Tree. I was intrigued so went on line and discovered that the Margaret Holmes brand is part of the McCalls Farm group, specializing in Southern style canned foods. "In the early 1930s, Ed Holmes began canning white acre peas and squash; now the brand includes a wide variety of Southern-style fruits and vegetables."

This is not the thick style my mother and grandmother made. Instead, it is almost a thick soup. It is good as is but was better when I drained a can of beans and made a quick succotash. It would make a good starter for a variety of other dishes including gumbo. Well seasoned out of the can, I like a little more salt and spice so added a little Tony's All Purpose Creole Seasoning. Delicious. It was good enough that I am going to try other products from this company.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
SweetGourmet Mello Cream Autumn Mix - Candy Corn Mix (1.5Lb)
Review:
Most of the critical reviews concern sellers and shipping.  We bought this candy corn at a local candy shop so had no problems.  The candy is sweet and soft with a strong hint of vanilla.  It is also made in the USA unlike most brands in local grocers which are made in Mexico.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
CADBURY Chocolate Candy Bar, Royal Dark Chocolate, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 14)
Review:
My seven year old and I both love these chocolate bars.  If I buy just one, she gets at least half.  She has already made a significant dent in the box I received for Christmas.  Note that these are made by Hershey in the U.S., not by Cadbury in England.  Even though Hershey does not use the original recipe to make this candy, they, at this time at least, do not use standard Hershey milk chocolate either.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Pickapeppa Pepper Sampler (3 Pack)
Review:
Pickapeppa has always been an outstanding sauce for seafood, pork and some cheeses (not to mention fried potatoes).  New flavors have been added and this three bottle set has two of the best new ones - spicy mango and gingery mango plus a bottle of original.  One can usually find original at supermarkets in our area but it is not always easy to find all of the other flavors.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nestle Butterfinger Peanut Butter Cups Share Pack, 3 Ounce (Pack of 18)
Review:
Creamy peanut butter cups with the taste of a Butterfinger without the crunch.  The ones I bought have Product of United Kingdom on the label.  These are good, but we prefer regular Butterfingers.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Carr's Ginger Lemon Creme, 7.05-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)
Review:
I received a package of these cookies for Christmas.  My wife and I agree that they are good but not as good as expected.  Neither of us could detect any separate taste of ginger so I broke off a piece of cookie without filling. A very easy thing to do.  The piece had a faint aroma of ginger but little taste of it.  It was easy to break off a piece of cookie without filling because the filling in each cookie is scant.  The pictures on the outside of the package are not pictures of the cookies in the package.  This doesn't affect taste but is an extremely irritating form of chiseling behavior.  Because of this and the lack of ginger flavor, I'm rating these cookies at two stars.  If you want lemon cookies there are both better and less expensive options.  Try Mississippi Cheese Straw Factory lemon straws.  No filling, but superior lemon treats.  Much better than Carr's.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Tandoor Chef Palak Paneer, 10-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)
Review:
If there is a better brand of frozen Indian food, I have yet to find it.  This spinach and cheese dish may even appeal to those who do not normally care for Indian cuisine.  It is suitable as an entree or a side dish.  It is a little spicy but our nine year old who does not like really hot food, loves it.  She asks for it every time we go to the grocer.  This brand is a little expensive at our local grocers so we were very happy to find it on Amazon.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Amy's Organic Chili, Medium Black Bean, 14.7 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
A good but somewhat bland black bean chili which is labeled as medium.  Just as with most of Amy's soups which I have tried, the spices are subtle, not bold.  I stirred in a pack of Taco Bell hot sauce which made it good enough but still not the kind of chili I like.  The sauce made it hotter but covered up most of the other flavors.
Rating:
3.0

Each (Pack of 4) Review: These are snack packs similar in size to other snack packs (these are 0.8 ounces per snack packet). They have a higher sugar content than some snanks, the main ingredients being tapioca syrup, cane sugar, and white grape juice concentrate, with natural flavors, black carrot for color, vitamin C added, etc. They are an attractive snack for children in convenient tear-0pen packets. They can also be dropped into day packs, lunch boxes, etc., or be kept in a desk drawer at work. They have an expiration date on the box, but have a relatively long shelf life. Pouches Per Box),Betty Crocker Scooby-Doo Fruit Flavored Snacks (48 pouches - 0.8 oz each)total: 38.4oz `,Tasty Brand Organic Fruit Snacks, Mixed Fruit Flavors, 0.8-Ounce Pouches, 24-Count,Angry Birds Fruit Snacks 42 Pouch Assortment Variety Box,Tree Top All Natural Fruit Snacks (80 Pack), and many others. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kashi GOLEAN Bar, Chocolate Almond Toffee, 2.75-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12) Review: This is a diet bar of sorts, although it has 290 calories. It can be used as a breakfast bar. It has 13 grams of protein and 6 grams of fiber. It is a bit high on sodium with 250 mg, and has an equal amount of potassium. The texture is chewy and the flavor is good. It tends to be filling, which offsets the calories. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kashi Cherry Dark Chocolate Granola Bars 6 Count, 7.4 ounces (Pack of 4) Review: More filling and not as sweet as the Atkins Day Break Chocolate Chip Crisp - 5 x 1.2 Oz Bars (Pack of 6) reviewed separately. This bar claims 120 calories but has less nutrition with 5 grams of protein, 4 grams of fiber, and no significant amount of essential vitamins and minerals. It is less heat sensitive which makes it easier to ship and carry in a day pack, etc. The taste is good, somewhat on the drier side. I would note that the price will vary depending on the source. They are commonly available locally in sources such as Krogers. Rating: 4.0 Product: Kashi TLC Chewy Granola Bars Cherry Dark Chocolate 6 - 1.2 Oz (35g) Bars (Pack of 6) Review: This is a good product but the listed Amazon price is high. Krogers has them for about $3 for a box of 6. There is a "best by" date on the top of the box (in white lettering in the green rectangle). The boxes that I purchased were fresh and were not dry. Ingredients are also clearly listed on the box - they contain wheat, soy, milk, almond and peanut ingredients - if you have an intolerance for those products you obviously should not be eating the bars. I personally had no problem with the bars, and found them to be a good diet bar. I also eat Kashi cereal (both cold and hot varieties, e.g., Kashi Golean Cereal, 13.1 Ounce) The individual bars are listed as having 5 grams of protein and 4 grams of fiber with 24 grams of carbohydrate. It is listed as 120 calories per bar. Rating: 5.0 Product: Power Crunch High Protein Energy Snack, Cookies & Creme, 1.4-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12) Review: Normally I would have rated this product high as a high-protein bar with a good flavor. However, the manufacturer has loaded the bar with artificial flavor and artificial colors (yellow 5&6, red 3, blue 1). Therefore I do not recommend it as a diet or health product. Rating: 1.0 Product: Kashi GOLEAN Crunch! Cereal, 15-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) Review: This might be an excellent cereal, but the boxes that I bought had large pieces stuck together that were hard as a rock and dangerous to the fillings in your teeth. They can be manually broken apart, but that is a lot of extra trouble. Other than that, the flavor is good. It does have a significant amount of fiber, and a reasonable amount of protein. There is a potential problem with sodium deficiency if you eat too many foods low in sodium (that can cause muscle cramps, especially in your legs). Rating: 3.0 Product: Simply7 Quinoa Chips, Gluten Free, Barbeque, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: These chips have a nice flavor, and the Amazon price is lower than local grocery stores. The problem has been noted by other reviewers. The manufacturer has lowered his costs by loading them with potato starch which adds nothing except calories. If I want potato chips, I will buy potato chips. There are 140 calories per ounce, with only 1 gram of protein and 1 gram of fiber. In comparison, Beanitos Pinto Bean chips have the same calories, but have 4 grams of protein and 5 grams of fiber (with zero potato starch). per ounce. Rating: 3.0 Product: Erin Baker's Homestyle Granola, Peanut Butter, Gluten-Free, Ancient Grains, Vegan, Non-GMO, Cereal, 12-ounce bags (Pack of 6) Review: This is somewhat like eating a superior brand of soft oatmeal raisin cookies. The ingredients are whole grain oats, honey, canola oil, raisins, oat bran, molasses, ground flax seed, vanilla extract, and spices (cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves). A 2 ounce serving (based on 6 servings in the 12 ounce bag, is rated as 5 grams of protein, and 4 grams of fiber with 230 total calories. I thought that the flavor was good, with some after taste because of the spice. Rating: 5.0 Product: Erin Baker's Breakfast Cookie Minis Oatmeal Raisin, 8-Count Boxes (Pack of 6) Review: Breakfast cookies are a favorite with the young children (ages 6 and 9) of a friend. These one-ounce cookies are the right size for young children. The are individually wrapped, and can be used at home or as a take along snack item. They can also be used as special treats on occasions like Halloween. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kashi GOLEAN Instant Hot Cereal, Hearty Honey & Cinnamon, 11.28-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) Review: To start with, Amazon is mixing reviews again. The featured product, which this review applies to, is Kashi Creamy Truly Vanilla. Other products, such as the Kashi Honey and Cinnamon, have different flavors and different availability. Reviews for other products are meaningless and should be ignored. In actual fact, the local Krogers only has the Honey and Cinnamon in their hot cereal selections (they have a vast array of Kashi cold cereals). This Creamy Truly Vanilla is a basic cereal that you can dress up with other ingredients to your own taste. I personally add cinnamon, nutmeg, and local fresh honey, along with dried fruit Good Sense Berry Medley, 5 Ounce Bags (Pack of 6) The prepared product can be eaten without milk because it already has a creamy texture - that is an advantage over dry cereals as some people do not drink milk - it is also helpful when you forgot to buy milk at the grocery store. Overall, this is an excellent cereal, particularly because you can add ingredients to your own taste. Some reviewers have recommended almond butter and/or bananas, although I have not personally tried those combinations. I would note that the Amazon price is good, and is comparable to what local grocery stores charge for comparable cereals. They only down side is that you have to buy six boxes at a time. I would note that I remember somewhat larger portions when I first started using Kashi cereal. You can double the portion size by using two packets, but be aware that you need a larger bowl for the microwave to keep it from boiling over the sides. Slicing almonds by hand is a risk for missing fingers or parts thereof; a major bummer for a "healthier lifestyle"!

Review:
There are several of these Rice Sides that I really love. I have purchased and enjoyed more Cheese and Broccoli Rice Sides than I can even count. This particular Rice Side will not be going on my "favorites" list though.

When I grabbed this, only a small picture was available so I failed to see the word "ham." I have been a vegetarian for twenty-seven years ... and if I am going to "fall off the wagon," it will be for lobster (not for a bit of ham flavor in a Rice Sides). Therefore, those whose religious or personal convictions do not permit the consumption of ham will want to take note. (The good news is that this new, huge picture should solve the problem).

Since it was unusable by me, I relied on my family to provide feedback (yes, I am totally cool with them eating meat). The report was that it was "tasteless" and "bland." My boyfriend tried some fresh cracked pepper and shaved parmesan on his (it's our go-to solution for everything). He finished the little mound, but did not return for seconds. And, my brother simply left his on his plate.

Some of these sides are great, some not great. For the minute investment, you should sample them all (from your grocery store) and then return here and buy in bulk! (That's what I do!!)
Rating:
2.0
</Other Writer-1>

</otherwriters>

Rating: 5.0 Product: Twinings of London Pure Camomile Herbal Tea Bags, 20 Count Review: I recently ran into an aunt and as we talked she mentioned giving up diet cola drinks. She does not like the aspartame and was sure it had caused her some bad side effects. She mentioned that this tea was delicately flavored, not bold and intense. She also said this tea did not cause her to get jittery as other teas and cola drinks had. Just to try it, I bought a box and she was correct. Just as she said, the taste was delicate and fruity and it does seem like you're getting less caffeine, although it's possible that brewing it cold has that effect. It's handy and as you can drink it straight from tap or filtered water. Rating: 5.0 Product: Erin Baker's Breakfast Cookies, Banana Walnut, Whole Grain, Vegan, Non-GMO, 3-ounce (Pack of 12) Review: These breakfast cookies are so delicious, they'll make you want to get out of bed early. They genuinely have that caramel apple taste and although I no longer ea real caramel apples, because of my dental work, these are a very fine replacement. The texture is perfect and the taste even better. If you need a quick breakfast and love sugary caramel apples, this is perfect for you. Rating: 5.0 Product: RiceSelect Texmati Light Brown Rice, Long Grain American Basmati, 32 oz Jars (Pack of 4) Review: This long grain,American Basmati brown rice is sensational. I have switched from my old brand of rice to this one for nutritional reasons being that brown rice contains nutrients like zinc, magnesium and manganese. It has more fiber It's so flavorful, I added some garlic,onion and celery as I boiled it. The aroma was captivating, without exageration. It tasted delicious and I just wish I had more time to cook. It takes a little longer to cook than white rice but it's worth it. Rating: 5.0 Product: Gatorade Performance Series Carbohydrate Energy Formula, Wild Berry, 12-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 24) Review: I've always loved Gatorade since its beginnings. Because I live an active lifestyle, I sweat. I work out,jog and I am human, I sweat. I've relied on Gatorade drinks for years to replenish my electrolytes. I can feel the energy after having had a drink and I love this new wild berry flavor. This is a healthy drink I would recommend to anyone with an active physical life and as we all know, the flavors are delicious. Yes, I would recommend this new flavored , high energy Gatorade to anyone who is physically active and needs to replace the sweat of working out. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kashi, Breakfast Cereal, Organic Autumn Wheat, Non-GMO Project Verified, 16.3 oz(Pack of 4) Review:
 Finding healthy foods that actually taste good is a quest of mine. I love the taste of Kashi's Autumn Wheat cereal. Knowing that it is a natural product and is healthy is fine but he added benefit of tasting good is even better. I highly recommend this for anyone, especially those who are health conscious ! Rating: 5.0 Product: New York Style Bagel Crisps, Plain, 7.2 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: These tasty bagel snacks are perfect for snack time. They taste delicious and have good healthy ingrediants. A little more salty than I would use, BUT STILL NICE. I recommend there knowing you'll fall in love with these delicious, crispy snacks. Rating: 5.0 Product: Amy's Organic Chili, Medium Black Bean, 14.7 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review:
This is a tasty, spicy meat free organic chili. Highly recommended, even just a little try. Olio Santo, "the oil of saints" It has a delicious flavor, great for cooking, salads, drizzled on bread,etc. I don't mind paying a little more for great taste and quality. I recommend you give it a try or one of the other olive oils from Stonehouse Olive oil, made right here in the U.S. Rating: 5.0 Product: Ghirardelli Peppermint Bark Squares Limited Edition 7.06oz. Review: These chocolates have two layers, the first is chocolate and the top is peppermint. The combination is incredibly delicious and habit forming. They just melt in your mouth and have a clean, natural taste. If you like good chocolates and peppermint, this is just right for you. These are made in California, here in The US and I just love them. Anyhow, this box nearly duplicates the Red Lobster cheddar biscuits at home and are very easy to make with 14-16 minutes even if you are a beginner cook.  I admit that I cannot make these too often due to my weight loss goals but they are worth it to make for at least an occasional treat.
