prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Lipton Green Tea Pyramids, Mandarin Orange 20 ct (Pack of 6) Review: I enjoy Lipton brands a lot and my only other preferred tea is Luzianne. Lipton's Earl Grey Pyramid Tea Bags are pretty bad. Though I really like the design of their pyramid bags, and really like the Earl Gray flavor; there is something very off with the flavor from this tea. It's like a very strange combination. The Bergamot flavor is missing from this, no question. You can't even smell it when you open the package. The ingredients mention some type of marigold flowers which do not mix well with the Earl Gray. I would skip this particular product; it just doesn't taste at all like true Earl Gray Tea. Rating: 2.0 Product: Duncan Hines Decadent Brownie Mix, Chocolate Peanut Butter, 16.8 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: This Duncan Hines Brownie Mix bakes up easy and fast. Directions call for 1 or 2 eggs, oil and water. I like cake like brownies and always opt for 2 eggs. Using a 9x9 pan, they are usually done in about 30 minutes. They taste rich but not sugary, and excellent topped with a dollop of ice cream. Rating: 5.0 Product: Tropicana Orange Juice, 10 Ounce (Pack of 24) Review: There is no question that the Tropicana Orange Juice, 10 Ounce is a great size for travel, breakfast portioning, and a regular beverage anywhere in-between. Yes it does have "natural flavors" not found in regular orange juice that make me wonder just what that means, but that plus filtered water and concentrated orange juice make up this drink. No fat, no cholesterol. Sugar is 28g, though the label doesn't indicate any is added so hopefully that's all natural from the oranges. What gets me about this Tropicana Orange Juice is consistency between cases. I got one case that tasted perfect, but the very next case was thick and off. It even had 3 months on the expiration date so that wasn't the issue. I see from other review's I'm not the only one with this problem, so it's something to consider if you go with this brand. Rating: 3.0 Product: Swiss Miss Hot Cocoa Mix, Sensible Sweets, Light, 8 count,0.29 ounce, (Pack of 6) Review: I have enjoyed Swiss Miss for years because it's easy to make with just hot water. It's easy to make, just add hot water and stir; you can substitute milk for water if you have it available, but that's what makes this product so versatile. I was concerned that this 'diet' version might not be as tasty as regular Swiss Miss, however it tastes pretty okay. Much better than the regular 'unsweetened version'. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kraft Salad Dressing, Honey Mustard, 16-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 6) Review: I prefer using this dressing for dipping tenders. Adds a nice touch to nuggets, tenders and occasionally hot wings (as an alternative to ranch or blue cheese). Lid stays relatively clean, I recommend removing the label from the lid for less mess. You will have to remove the lid entirely to peal off the internal 'safety seal'. Rating: 4.0 Product: Arm & Hammer Baking Soda Fridge Freezer Package, 16-Ounce Review: The Arm & Hammer Fridge/Freezer Package is a great idea and one tough product. This product has removable sides that reveal a cloth-like face. This allows air to go in one side, become freshened, and exit either side. This pack is great for use in freezers, which I mainly use it for, to help cut down on the freezer burn smell that can collect on bags and containers. When thirty days are up, you can pop open the top and use the baking soda for various cleaning purposes, although it wouldn't be useful for cooking purposes. I have even refilled the package with fresh baking soda from a bigger container and sealed the top back and gotten the same results as if I had used a new fridge/freezer package. This is a great idea and can really help if you have freezer burn odor or a fridge that doesn't smell fresh. Rating: 5.0 Product: Dove Milk Chocolate, Silky Smooth Promises, 9.5-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4) Review: Dove's silky smooth milk chocolate promises are really delicious and pack a great message. On the inside of each individual wrapper is a fun and useful inspirational message to motivate and encourage you. Compared to other milk chocolate products, these Dove Promises are slightly more expensive, however I feel they do have a better quality to justify the slight mark up in price. Great for a little 'escape' from everyday life and well worth trying. Rating: 5.0 Product: Twix Caramel Minis Chocolate Candy for the Holidays, 11.5 Ounce Bag Review: I purchased two packages of these Twix minis about one week ago and they arrived in great condition both in terms of freshness and no broken bars. The current price here at Amazon is right on target with the local 'mart and a better deal when you consider gas and time. The outer packaging is holiday themed, however it's at such a great price you could stock up for school parties or other functions throughout the year. Rating: 5.0 Product: Maruchan Instant Lunch Roast Beef Flavor, 2.25 Oz, Pack of 12 Review: Comparing these to a local mass market retailer per each, this is a really good price + free shipping. Currently less than $0.50/each can't get them cheaper elsewhere. These spicy noodles are great, gives more of a kick compared to the regular chicken flavor. Personally I think they are just spicy enough without needing to constantly "cool off" your mouth after each bite. These are INSANELY full of sodium; however most Maruchan noodle soups are high in sodium. Some are upwards of 50% of your allowable daily value so this isn't surprising. The nutritional values from the package are: Calories -- 290 Calories from Fat -- 108 % Daily Value* Total Fat -- 12.0g Saturated Fat -- 6.0g Trans Fat -- 0.0g Cholesterol -- 3mg Sodium -- 1190mg Total Carbohydrates -- 38.0g Dietary Fiber -- 2.0g Sugars -- 1.0g Easy ways to reduce the sodium is to shake off some of the seasoning prior to adding the water or don't drink all of the broth. Overall, this is a convenient lunch, easily made with hot water and really delicious. Rating: 5.0 Product: Maruchan Instant Lunch Roast Beef Flavor, 2.25 Oz, Pack of 12 Review: Good price and a excellent deal. Currently less than $0.45/each you can't get them for much cheaper elsewhere. This 35% less sodium instant lunch noodles help address a big concern of most people, large amounts of sodium for just one meal. Some instant lunch noodles can be upwards of 50% of your allowable daily value so this is a pleasant surprise to find that Maruchan has taken this into consideration and tried to address it. The taste is a bit off; sorta like a buttery flavor and kind of begs for a bit more seasoning. The container has a good amount of veggies and seasoning, however it's still enjoyable even with the different taste. Something you could grow to love, knowing that is has lower sodium and in the respect is better for you. The nutritional values from the package are: Calories -- 290 Calories from Fat -- 110 % Daily Value* Total Fat -- 12.0g Saturated Fat -- 6.0g Trans Fat -- 0.0g Cholesterol -- 3mg Sodium -- 700mg (The regular flavor has over 1000mg) Total Carbohydrates -- 36.0g Dietary Fiber -- 2.0g Sugars -- 2.0g Overall, this is a convenient lunch, easily made with hot water and is also rather filling. Product:

Review:
A nutritionist recommended Kashi products to me. If you're hankering for a Snicker candy bar, these might not satisfy you. However, if you want a crunchy, nutty, dark chocolate treat that makes you feel good after eating, you may want to try these.  They are low in sugar--only 6 gms--about the same as in a cup of Cheerios or Total.  The nutritionist said to think of sugar as poison--your body wants to eliminate sugar before fat, so stay low in sugar. I keep one of these bars in my purse when I'm out doing errands in case I get hungry.  I love the dark chocolate chips and nutty crunch. One bar at 130 calories is quite satisfying and is a great go-to treat when you want a little sweetness in your day.

One bar is only 3 points on Weight Watcher's point system. I took a box to my Weight Watcher's meeting to recommend them for a healthy snack.  I've lost 30 pounds and reversed diabetes in the past 2 years eating healthy foods: low-sugar, low-fat natural vegetable/fruits/protein/dairy diet with little to no artificially flavored and processed foods.  These bars are my treat when I'm desiring a little fun without the guilt. I haven't found a chocolate dessert treat that's lower in calories/sugar and healthier. If you eat a bar a day, this is a great price on Amazon if you are on automatic monthly delivery and beats my local supermarket price.
Rating:
5.0

Review:

It isn't yellow either, it's Dark Orange!!!...Horrid runny dark orange muck!
I was so looking forward to a puree of yellow Butternut squash soup, not a sweet nutmeg flavored Pumpkin Pie mix knock-off, that I bought 2 cases...big mistake.
This soup is TERRIBLE hot or cold....overkill eating more than one teaspoon full of this yucky stuff.
Another BAD thing about this is it can't be doctored-up to taste better, because it's sweet and nutmegy like pumpkin pie, so you can't add any garlic powder, onions or anything to it to make it edible.

Wolf Chili with Beans, 15-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24)
Review:
It isn't greasy tasting, it's thick and damn good. I was vert surprised it held up to the gtreat reviews.  I added a few dried onions to it while cooking for ten minutes, the slight crisy and sweetness of the onion makes it taste as good as a restaurants.

UPDATE...A week later I ate another serving, only I ate the whole can instead of only ten ounces....8 hours later my body was forced to regurgetate it. This has not happened to me since I ate some really greasy spicy chicken wings for lunch at work in 1993. I spit it into a paper towel, it was orange grease, I fear the same orange grease that rises to the top of most other canned chili's that I am able to mostly skim-off  This chili showed very little solid grease at the top, I could not quickly remove it, so I didn't. I suspect it had just as much but was emulsified into the thicker sauce, which I ended up eating and then regurgitating because my body could not digest it. I wish I hadn't eaten it. Now I have 22 cans more which I will be afraid to eat unless I can figure out how to easily get rid of some of the hidden grease.

5.0

Review:

This tea isn't sweet, but not bitter either...it's perfect.  It's a great deal when you get a huge overflowing box of them and they are foil wrapped so will last a long time.

If I pressed down on that, who knows how much packed chicken is there, didn't care at that point...knew I wasn't getting anywhere near an actual can of chicken like the other white meat organic type I have bought. Product:
Lazy Day Foods Dark Chocolate Ginger Cookies, 4.4-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)
Review:
These cookies arrived in the afternoon. They didn't sit in the mail box long, but I discovered upon opening them that the chocolate was seriously melted. I put the box in the refrigerator. Not the best idea obviously because now the cookies were cemented together by the chocolate. Obviously this is no fault of the cookie manufacturer, but I do want to make you aware of what you might be dealing with if you mail order these.

I'm a hormonal woman, so I found a way to eat the cookies, though they were so messy I ended up eating over the sink and creating a huge chocolate mess on my hands and face--I looked like a three year old.

Were they worth the trouble? Sadly no. Ginger? What ginger? The dark chocolate isn't bad, but the cookie tastes like nothing. I was really looking forward to eating a ginger cookie, but there wasn't even a hint of it.

If you're on a gluten-free diet, you might find these tasty. I'm not and didn't.

Review:
So, my hubby loves this stuff. That is not an overstatement. He has been looking for a carbonated drink that has really sugar in it, is lightly sweetened and the flavor is light as well. He thinks the cherry flavor is great. I am not a huge fan of cherry overall (something to do with cherry flavored cough syrup as a child), and this drink did leave me with a distinctive cherry aftertaste that brought on some unpleasant flashbacks. I would love to try the ginger or vanilla flavors at some point.

Ingredients are simply purified carbonated water, pure can sugar, natural flavor and phosphoric acid. It is Non gmo verified. Each can has 60 calories and 15 grams of sugar. Nicely designed cans look pretty at a picnic, bar-b-que or in a lunch box.  Also, mixes well with spirits. On the dry sparkling website they have some fantastic drink recipes.

The flavor is traditional French vanilla and is yummy in coffee. Do not refrigerate or liquid will harden. Perfect for the holidays when the frig is often over flowing and space is limited. Also great for office or small business.

Creamer has an excellent sweet cream taste, equivalent to adding half-and-half and sugar to your java. This 21.1 oz. bottle contains 125 servings. Each serving is equal to one single serve creamer. golds.output: I was pleasantly surprised by Truvia Nectar, a blend of stevia sweetener and honey.  I bought this as a healthier alternative to regular honey and sugar.  The flavor is sweet, but not overpowering, and I love that it's lower in calories than regular honey.  I've been using it in my tea and on toast, and it's become a staple in my pantry. prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Desert Creek Honey Premium Raw Creamed Honey, 14 oz. Review: Delicious creamed honey! I love this on toast, pancakes, and in my tea. It has a mellower taste than regular honey and because it is creamed it doesn't soak into my food as quickly. For sore throats, a teaspoon full is a treat and an aid. Highly recommend. Rating: 5.0 Product: GoMacro Organic Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip, 2.5 oz Bars (Pack of 15) Review: I bought the variety pack since they are pricey and I didn't want to commit to one flavor in case they weren't all that good. I liked them all. The peanut butter chocolate chip was the most "desserty" flavor of the bunch with a few chocolate chips in the bar. The Cherries and Berries had some nice dried fruit chunks in it and a nutty sesame taste. The Granola with Coconut tasted exactly as the name implies. I will likely purchase the variety pack again instead of the single flavor boxes. They do not have a lot of protein and are somewhat high in fat, are very moist and chewy, so they aren't what I am used to from my meal replacement bars (I really like Zone Perfect Fudge Graham bars - my kids also like them which is a bonus and a decent after school/before sports snack that transports easily in backpacks and sports bags). Nice for a change but not quite as filling as others I have tried. Rating: 4.0 Product: Lavazza Decaf Espresso Bean, 1.1 lb Review: Delicious, smooth, full-bodied coffee. We use it in our espresso machine for our morning cappuccinos and couldn't be happier. For medical reasons I have to reduce my caffeine intake, but I don't miss it because this is so delicious. I'm not a fan of Starbucks because it is too bitter for me. Lavazza is far better and very similar to Illy but better priced. Rating: 5.0 Product: Shady Maple Farms Maple Butter, Og, 9.20-Ounce Review: Super sweet and creamy treat! My daughters eat it off a spoon! Wonderful maple product. Rating: 5.0 Product: Orbit Spearmint Sugarfree Gum, 14 Pieces (12 Pack) Review: Sweet and bubble gummy and not overly minty. I keep a cup in the car all the time and it takes away my craving for sweets and freshens my breath without smelling like mouthwash. Rating: 5.0 Product: Lavazza Gran Filtro Decaffeinato Ground Coffee Blend, Decaffeinated Medium Roast, 8-Ounce Brick Review: I would give this ten stars if I could. I wasn't a coffee addict until I bought this and made cold brew coffee with it. Now it is a morning highlight. It is smooth, low acidity (I have Crohn's disease, so this is important), slightly sweet naturally, and full on delicious. I highly recommend investing in OXO Good Grips Cold Brew Coffee Maker, Clear/Grey and planning to make your cold brew in advance. It takes 20 hours, yes, hours, to make, but it is so worth it. Once you've made the cold brew, store it in the fridge in a fabulous Libby Glass Milk Bottle with Lid, 33.5 oz (product link wouldn't work for this), pour it over ice in equal parts cold brew and the milk of your choice, add sweetener if you must, and enjoy. Don't say I didn't warn you! Rating: 5.0 Product: Nestle Aero Mint Chocolate-pack 4 Bars Review: These are my teenage daughter's favorite chocolate bar so we buy them as treats. They are light in texture and have a mild mint flavor that doesn't overpower the fabulous Nestle chocolate. Rating: 5.0 Product: Simply Organic Almond Extract, Certified Organic, 2-Ounce Container Review: Excellent value! I use this in my blueberry muffins and french toast, among other recipes, and it is every bit as good if not better than the much more expensive almond extract I have been purchasing at Whole Foods. The glass bottle is sturdy and sits well in my spice drawer and on the counter, unlike some other plastic extract bottles I have purchased in the past. Highly recommend. Rating: 5.0 Product: Jelly Belly Mini Bean Machine with 3.25oz Bag of Jelly Beans Review: We bought this for my husband, who is a Jelly Belly monster. He has absolutely no portion control when it comes to this candy. We bought it for his Christmas because other reviewers indicated that only 3-4 beans come out at a time. PERFECT! We set it to be used with coins, so he is totally aware of when he is going back for more and he loves the forced self control while enjoying his candy of choice. We highly recommend the mini bean machine. Rating: 5.0 Product: Yankee Traders Brand Classic Salted Caramels - 2 Lbs, Wrapped Review: I love salted caramels and have been looking for a reasonably priced option to satisfy my cravings. Like other reviewers, I found that the caramels stick to the wrapper, even if they are cooled in the fridge or freezer. The taste is ok, but nothing special. They remind me a lot of Kraft caramels - good but not great. I'm still searching. They are a delicious snack. In the non-sweet snack category, I'd put them right up there in the pantheon with Combos (obviously Pepperoni Pizza as the best kind) and Doritos (preferably Cool Ranch, but I'll hear arguments for other flavors). I have heard rumors goldfish are slightly healthier than the two aforementioned tasty treats. Rumors are a tricky mistress. Hard to say. What more can you ask for when discussing a snack that is as American as Windows 95. Goldfish for everyone. I paid $7.48, or even less with Subscribe and Save. At my local grocery store, they are like $8.99. Granted I live in New York City where a 3-pack of gum costs more than a 2 BR House in rural America, so take that as you will. Rating: 5.0 Product: Pepperidge Farm Goldfish, made with Whole Grain Cheddar, 30-ounce carton Review: Honestly, who in the world doesn't love goldfish? They are a delicious snack. In the non-sweet snack category, I'd put them right up there in the pantheon with Combos (obviously Pepperoni Pizza as the best kind) and Doritos (preferably Cool Ranch, but I'll hear arguments for other flavors). I have heard rumors goldfish are slightly healthier than the two aforementioned tasty treats. Rumors are a tricky mistress. Hard to say. What more can you ask for when discussing a snack that is as American as Windows 95. Goldfish for everyone. Whole Grain seems healthier, so I'm down. I paid $6.99, or even less with Subscribe and Save! At my local grocery store, they are like $8.99. Granted I live in New York City where a 3-pack of gum costs more than a 2 BR House in rural America, so take that as you will. Rating: 5.0 Product: Casina Rossa Truffle and Salt - Premium Gourmet Sea Salt - 3.5oz. Review: I was bored a few weekends back, so I ordered this as well as some black truffle oil and white truffle oil. Figured I'd have myself a little truff party. Well let me tell you, it's been a 2-week non-stop party in my mouth. And you can be invited! Well I guess the party would be in your mouth, but I digress. My kitchen now smells like Umamiville, USA. This is some seriously pungent stuff. Mrs. Philyodaddy put the three aforementioned products in one drawer, which she started calling the truffle drawer (very clever lady that Mrs. P). More like flavor country. So far I have applied small doses of this product on: sandwiches, steak, salmon, other fish, cheese, chicken, pork, lamb, my finger, and other animals I cannot currently think of. Everything was improved. As you can see, I have an extremely healthy diet. I might be going off the deep end a little, because Mrs. Philyodaddy is "getting sick of truffles". Like that's possible. Hey Mrs. P, maybe you should get sick of expensive purses or renttherunway. The ratio is 95 parts salt for 5 parts truffle, not that I could tell. It seems that there is real black truffle in as well as some sort of truffle flavor, but this is my first truffle salt, so I don't know if that's par for the truffcourse. I would say, of the three truffle related products I've tried so far I like the salt the best, and a little goes a long way. Try it out, unless you don't like delicious things. Rating: 5.0 Product: Huy Fong - Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce (Net Wt. 17 Oz.) - 3 Pack Review: Sriracha, while hard to spell, makes everything taste better. It is spicy in a much better way than Tabasco and also better than most other western/Mexican style hot sauces. Tabasco is overrated by the way. Fact. Deal with it. If I may be allowed use an analogy in SAT form, it would probably look something like- Sriracha : Tabasco :: Philyodaddy : People who stand on the left side of an escalator. See what I did there? Here is a list of things that are NOT made better by this Thai (apparently its from Thailand, now I know) delicacy: Cereal Fruit Fruit-based deserts That is all I got. Will update if I can think of anything else. Not likely. In addition to being great on cooked foods, it represents the single easiest way to prepare food. Pork, Chicken, Fish, just rub that red stuff all over it and put it in the pan/oven/Waring Pro DF280 Professional Deep Fryer, Brushed Stainless. Dinner for days. You're welcome. All that being said, I wouldn't pay more than $3.99 for this bottle, making this current price a pretty bad deal. Certainly not deducting any stars though from this tremendous product. Go on with your bad self, Huy Fong. Rating: 5.0 Product: REESE'S Chocolate Candy, Peanut Butter Cusp, 1.5 Ounce (Pack of 36) Review: Don't know who this Reese guy is, but shout out to him. Reese's really are the height of the candy industry. Shame on you, wannabe's. "If you come at the king, you best not miss" - Omar Little, The Wire. "Reese's are the best" - Philyodaddy, reviewer. Reese's are the Honey Nut Cheerios Cereal, 12.25 Ounce (Pack of 4) of the Candy aisle. Best in Class. Pretty sure they are very healthy as I would like to eat several a day and don't have the diabetes yet. If the packages include a calorie content sectsh, I certainly don't notice because I'm too busy devouring these morsels of heaven. 1.5 ounces of divinity right to the dome. Recommended way to consume: Dipped in Nutella. Can they make a Nutella-filled reeses? Wow, just give me the Nobel Candy prize, right now. Lastly, the full size cups (or even the super-large "Big Cup", which are also Philyodaddy-approved - please Reese's purists, don't nail me to the cross) are far superior to the little, dainty guys that come in the tin foil. Don't bring that weak crap up in this. You got the choc-pb ratio ALL WRONG. I'll eat those little guys if I am stranded on a dessert island or stealing your kid's halloween candy, but otherwise: no way, no how. I swear I'm not fat. By the way see what I did with "dessert island" - pretty clever, right? p.s. As for all the people who wrote reviews of this product claiming it is super fresh, what in the world are you talking about? It is a processed food. Did you think that they just picked your pack of 36 right off the Chocolate Peanut Butter tree before hand-delivering it to you in a refrigerated container? I want my steak dry-aged, my wine in a bottle, my Iphone made in China, and my g-damn Reese's from a warehouse in orange packaging. p.p.s. I learned the following from Wikipedia while researching for this review. "They were created in 1928 by H. B. Reese, a former dairy farmer and shipping foreman for Milton S. Hershey." The more you know. Rating: 5.0 Product: Orbit Spearmint Sugarfree Gum, 14 Pieces (12 Pack) Review: Remix to what? Similarly to R. Kelly's jam "Remix to Ignition" - The Orbit Strawberry Remix Sugarfree Gum is probably far more famous than the original. That being said, I like this gum. It is very strong-flavored, so weak gum-likers need not apply. It is true that the flavor does not last as long as other Orbit delights like the Wrigleys Orbit Bubblemint, 14-Count (Pack of 12). You can't win 'em all. Truth be told, that is a better gum. This is more of a special occasion gum, when you're really feeling the need to take the vacation to flavor country. I keep this gum at work so that I can make sure that my oral fixation always has 12 x 20 pieces on standby. Review over. Rating: 5.0 Product: Orbit Spearmint Sugarfree Gum, 14 Pieces (12 Pack) Review: Remix to what? Similarly to R. Kelly's jam "Remix to Ignition" - The Orbit Strawberry Remix Sugarfree Gum is probably far more famous than the original. That being said, I like this gum. It is very strong-flavored, so weak gum-likers need not apply. I keep this gum at work so that I can make sure that my oral fixation always has 12 x 20 pieces on standby. Review over. Rating: 3.0 Product: Haribo Gummi Candy, Rattle-Snakes, 5 oz. Bag (Pack of 12) Review: My love of Happy Cola is not the slightest bit healthy. In fact, if you look at the nutrition facts for Happy Cola (not recommended), Happy Cola is not the slightest bit healthy. I'm pretty sure each individual delicious chewy cola is like 290 calories. When you finish the bag, you better plug in P90, or you are totally f'd. These delicious cola-flavored chewables are not for amateurs. I'm pretty sure they should be left for 12-year-olds with unlimited metabolism, but I've always had a rebellious side. This is my favorite item in the Haribo product line. That hint of cola-flavor (is it Pepsi or Coke? I'll never know) is exactly what I need in my life. When you need a change-up I recommend going crazy with the Haribo Gummi Candy, Fizzy Cola, 5-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12) which is a totally different experience. In other news, if you do Subscribe and Save at around $1.00/bag, you are saving at least $0.29 per unit versus purchasing at over-priced New York City bodegas. I love per-unit savings almost as much as I love calling in sick and playing golf. What, no one else does that? 5 stars, easy. Rating: 5.0 Product: Cheerios Honey Nut Cereal, 12.25-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 3) Review: Alright, I'll preface by saying that I have not had the pricing or expiration (not that I would notice) issues that some of the other reviewers have faced. The humanity. I get them every 3 months and the price has always been between 6.50 and 8.50. This is a tremendous bargain. One of these boxes at Duane Reade costs $4.99+. I would probably get it delivered more than once every 3 months if I ate breakfast more. This is by far my favorite cereal, and while I may sound like a child, I'm 27. Since you're curious, the other members of the Cereal Rushmore are: Cinnamon Toast Crunch Frosted Flakes Corn Pops Honorable Mention: Lucky Charms Boom, done. Update 9/20/12: Now that they got rid of the 3pack, and replaced it with the 4pack, they also jacked the price. S+S is $18 currently ($4.25 per box). While I will still buy them, the savings is noticeably less. Maybe the other reviewers were right all along. Update 1/8/13: looks like they brought back the dealz... 4 for $10 - yes please. Now Amazon, quick jerkin my chain, makes the subscribe and save game a lot less valuable. golds.output: I am absolutely in love with these Organic Original Chewy Banana Bites - they are truly great.  The taste is amazing and the texture is perfect - chewy, but not too chewy.  I was a bit skeptical at first, but after trying one, I was hooked.  My kids also love them, and they are perfect for a quick snack on-the-go.  I love that they are made from natural ingredients and are free from artificial preservatives and flavors.  The fact that they are also vegan, paleo, and whole 30 friendly is a huge plus.  I will definitely be purchasing these again and

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
CLIF Nut Butter Filled - Chocolate Hazelnut Butter - (1.76 Ounce Protein Snack Bar, 12 Count) (Packaging may vary)
Review:
First of all my kids LOVE this bar, they would eat the whole case in one sitting - absolute LOVE.  I, on the other hand, don't like it at all.  Thus the mid star rating.

The bar is all natural, organic, non-GMO and full of fatty peanut butter, wrapped in chocolatey crunchy oats.  I think where the bar loses for me is the chocolate taste is not great.  I like deep dark bitter chocolate and perhaps this one is a bit too sweet for me.

Great for instant calories - about 230 of them, 100 straight from fat.  The bar will hold you between meals.

Super for kids, NOT for adults.  Let's leave it at that.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Nature Valley Backpacker Chocolate Chip Chewy Oatmeal Bites 6-1.24 oz. Pouches
Review:
I really take offense at a solid brand like Nature Valley offering these addicting tiny bites to kids.

They are chocolatey and have a bit of a coconut flavor to them, although I only found Palm oil, not coconut in the ingredients.  Each little tiny bag has about a dozen or so tiny bite-sized bits.  Each bag has 150 calories, over one-third of those FAT and 24 more simple sugar carbs to boot, and 8 calories of protein, as well.  8 calories of protein.  8.

The label on the box says,  "16 grams of whole grains and no artificial flavors, sweeteners, or colors."  So, you kind of think you are making a healthy choice.  And you are wrong.  You are feeding your child pure diabetes in bite-sized bits.  The fat comes primarily from Canola oil.  AND, WHAT IS Canola oil?  It's like Canadian Oil because they invented it and now 90% is a Monsanto creation.  Enough said about that?

I didn't see an age on here, but toddlers and youngers have an added danger of choking, these are pretty small bits - see the picture I included.

My son sat down to try a bag of these, I gave him one pouch to each.  He ended up finding the box and then eating the ENTIRE BOX.  6 in a box x 150 calories each pouch = 900 calories.  O.M.G. and then he went on to eat his regular lunch.  Granted the kid is super skinny but NO CHILD NEEDS 900 calories in one sitting.

I am not a big fan of these.  I am really mad at Nature Valley, famous for their oat bars, natural granola, to market such an addictive and sugary fat product to youngsters.  Corporate Accountability I am calling you out on this one!!
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Sweet Leaf Liquid Stevia Sweetner,  Cinnamon - 2 oz - Liquid
Review:
I had been using plain stevia with a shake of cinnamon in my espresso.  This product is too sweet/sickeningly cinnamony.  I will use up the whole bottle, but not buy it again.  I've experimented using less and that's not as bad, but the taste stays with you.  I will go back to using plain stevia with a shake of actual cinnamon.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co Bestie Almond Butter, Non-GMO, Gluten Free, Vegan, No Sugar Added, 11 Ounce Jars, 6 Count
Review:
This nut butter is so unbelievable good you have got to hold yourself back from sucking down the entire jar!  lol.  Seriously!

Kidding, but just a little bit.  The taste is phenomenal, the cashews taste great and make a phenomenal butter.  As these are my FAVE nuts, I am totally psyched!  This butter is oily.  No two ways about it.  Many natural nut butters are.  This is NOT JIFF, so you need to get over the oily smooth texture.  Stir as well as you can and then put on your Ezekial toast and OMG best breakfast EVER!  YUM!  Just watch the serving size ;-)  And no, the entire jar is NOT one serving!!

GREAT GREAT GREAT nut butter.  No sugar, bit of sunflower oil and touch of sea salt.  All WIN!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co Bestie Almond Butter, Non-GMO, Gluten Free, Vegan, No Sugar Added, 11 Ounce Jars, 6 Count
Review:
I hit the gym at 4 am.  I have to eat something before I go and almost always my food choice is an Ezekial bread, over-toasted so it is hard and 1 tablespoon of almond butter.  I was very happy with the BESTIE brand.  It is on par with the very expensive brands I usually buy.  Since I used every last scrape of nut butter in a jar, I was really happy with this size.  It won't go stale.  (Sometimes the one from Costco is so big, by the end, you are out of the oil and it less butter and more like concrete.)

This is the third product I have from this company and they have all been outstanding.  Really great nut butters.

Don't worry about changing brands, this is a solid choice.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peeled Snacks Organic Peas Please, Garden Herb, 3.3 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I got these thinking they were dehydrated veggies, peas to be exact.  I mean, the company motto is "To make you feel good about snacking."
Uh, NO.  Not the case.  Each 3.3 ounce bag has 3 and a half servings.  And you can easily kill the whole bag.  EASILY.  And if you did kill the whole bag, thinking, "OH, VEGGIES, GREAT," you would ingest, oh, 400 calories!  Enough for a small meal!!  And you would have ingested 4.5 grams of fat TIMES 3.3 ounces, so that's uh, close to FIFTEEN grams of fat in each bag?!?!?  WHHHHAAAT?  In one 3.3 ounce bag?!

Yeah, a bag of these healthy pea snacks could put your training program right over the rails.

Take heart, as there is actually organic whole green pea flour in here, it is the first ingredient.  And then there's brown rice flour and then oil.  LOTS and LOTS of oil.  And cheddar cheese, yeast, etc.

They do taste pretty good, but these are NOT veggies.  Lipstick on the pig does not make it more beautiful.  It just makes it WEIRD.  And that's how I felt trying these out.  WEIRD.

If you need the splurge, go get some proper Lays chips, go crazy, get a flavor.  Get some pretzels.  Have a piece of cheese with them.  But don't think you are doing yourself a solid by eating these peas.  PLEASE.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Vanilla Bean Grass-Fed Ghee Butter by 4th & Heart, 9 Ounce, Pasture Raised, Non-GMO, Lactose Free, Certified Paleo, Keto-Friendly
Review:
AMAZING!  Great taste - really sweet, you can taste the grass-fed in this ghee.  It is really, really, good.  Use it in cooking, oil the pans, I also LOVE it on popcorn.  With a bit of Himalayan salt.  Unbelievably good.  Smooth, creamy, super taste.  I love it.  Turns out that this ghee comes in other flavors!  I can't WAIT to try the garlic one.

I highly recommend you give this one a try.  Two thumbs up!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
HERSHEY'S Natural Unsweetened 100% Hot Cocoa, Baking, 23 Ounce Can
Review:
I spent a ton of money on one of the "Inca Super Food" type unsweetened cocoas - Hershey's is just so much better.  Taste, anti-oxidants and the energy punch - you get it all.  I've learned my lesson the expensive way.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz
Review:
These are dangerous for me because they taste so great!  Unlike some of the pre-packaged into correctly sized portion controlled servings, this is a whole jar.  And they are soooo good!  Perfect amount, just a touch of honey sweetness and wonderfully dry roasted peanuts - not oily at all.  10 stars - tastes great!!  I'm glad I got my ounce of these before my teenage son got home today.  :-)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co. Chocmeister Hazelnut Spread, Milk Chocolatey, 13 Ounce Jar
Review:
This product is OFF THE HOOK great tasting.

But it has an unfortunate label.  A really stupid label.  And name.  DUMB NAME.  No self-respecting person wants a CHOCMEISTER in their pantry.  Fortunately, this is the ONLY problem with this product!

It is much more sophisticated than the label lets on.  It is perfect for adults.  In fact, all adults should start their mornings with it.  The taste is deep, rich chocolate, not too sweet at all.  The tail end finishes with a tweak of bitter from the Hazelnet.  PERFECT.  .  Perfect with nut butter - almond, peanut, cashew - any nut really.  JUST PERFECT.  Elevates your breakfast to an amazing French like pastry.

Pictures below show the easy consistency at room temperature, not warmed up.  Great consistency.

Buy it and then hide it from your other adult friends.  Don't let them see the label.  Just don't.  GREAT PRODUCT!
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Review:
Whenever I get a Starbuck's card as a gift I go buy these. A lot more bang for my buck. So to speak.

I LOVE coffee but caffeine and I don't get along so well anymore. These are perfect for taking to work, when traveling - hotel coffee maker decaf is an abomination - or when camping.

USEFUL TIP: open the packet and pour the powder/fine grounds into the cup BEFORE you add the hot water. If you open it and hold it over the steaming mug, a good 20% of the coffee powder will absorb the water and stick inside the coffee packet.  Yeah, that's no fun.

Product: Kitchens Of India Recipe Paste, Vegetable Biryani, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: This is the authentic product, I can vouch for it since I am from India. The ITC Hotel chefs who created this recipe are very well regarded in India. Its just the right mix for a spicy lamb curry, all you need to do is mix it with water and add the lamb and then let it simmer on your stove for 30-45 minutes to bring out the aromas and flavors. Really convenient and time saving. The lamb curry paste is spicier than a butter chicken curry mix. The chicken curry usually has a more creamy consistency and is sweeter due to higher content of tomatoes. The lamb curry has a base of garlic, ginger, black pepper, onions, tomatoes and other highly aromatic Indian spices (bayleaf, cinnamon, star anise, cardamom, cloves, black cardamom, shah jeera, corriander seeds, red chilli powder etc.). I usually make my own curry as I prefer fresh ingredients but this mix is wonderful, it has just the right blend of spices that go into lamb curry. The secret to Indian food is to lower the flame once a curry boils and then simmer it for quite some time. This step is not a must if you're in a tearing hurry but it unlocks the real flavors. Once done this curry keeps very well in the refrigerator. In fact, as with all spicy curries, it even tastes better the next day. I use two packets at a time to make an entree for 6 people. Variations: I sometimes add some 1X1.5 inch cubes of diced potatoes along with the lamb to absorb the spiciness which makes it into a "Lamb Vindaloo". Or you can use beef instead of lamb, it will taste great with any red meat that absorbs the spice. If you're a vegetarian, you can use this curry with potatoes and green peas since the curry paste does not contain any meat in it. Just remember to add peas towards the end of the simmering process or they will get bleached out and you'll get a fantastic dish. Pairing: Pair this lamb curry with some aromatic basmati rice, cooked till all grains are done but still separate, and a bowl of plain yogurt (with a little sugar if you like) to counter the spiciness. Or you can also buy frozen Indian nan/roti from the local Indian grocery store, toast it in the oven and enjoy. Yummy! Rating: 5.0 Using the features, generate the proper review. prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: All Natural Imported Turkish Dried Figs - .55 lbs (250 grams each) Pack of 3 Review: I accepted a review sample because dried figs are an integral part of my diet when fresh ones are not in season. Since there are always figs in my pantry I was able to directly compare these to the usual California brands that I purchase. First, these are completely different. They are large, soft and moist in the center, and slightly sticky on the outside. Even the premium California figs I purchase locally seem mummified compared to these. The size is another factor - these are much larger. Second, these have a natural sweetness that exceeds the California ones. Indeed, it comes close to the over ripe fresh figs of which I am fond when they are in season. Of course, there is nothing to my palate that compares to a fresh fig, but these will do nicely when the fresh ones are not in season. I did a quick taste test when I was comparing these using a few cheeses and a wine samples to augment the flavors. I found that the sweetness of these figs is prefect paired with pecorino romano (a very strong cheese of sheep milk), while the California fig against which I tested it was bland and overpowered. The three wines I tried were an Italian white (Gavi), a California red (pinor noir) and an Italian red (valpolicella ripasso). This fig went well with the Gavi and valpolicella, but not the pinot. The California fig was so tasteless in comparison that it went with (but was not enhanced by) all three wines. My conclusion is paring a contrasting cheese - especially a strong one - with either a crisp, dry white or heavier, dry red wine is a perfect match. I mention this because for cheese and wine sampling parties this is perfect for serving after the tasting because the high fiber will counter the tendency of the cheese to constipate guests. Additional factors: the figs do not look exactly like those in the product images (at the time of this review). They are actually larger and flatter; and, the complete nutritional information in on the product photo of the actual container so I am not going to repeat it here. Also, the containers are relatively small (but this is a three pack, so the pricing is still competitive with my locally purchased ones). They are approximately four inches in diameter by two inches high. Finally, the packaging recommends that you refrigerate these after opening them. I do not - they dry out the figs. I store mine in a tightly sealed glass container in my pantry. Rating: 5.0 Product: Cinnamon Organic Saigon - Fine Powder - Naturally Sweet Flavor - Perfect for Cinnamon Rolls, Apple Pie, Baking, Smoothies - Unprocessed & Hand Harvested - 100% Satisfaction Review: Compared to cinnamon sticks and the usual grocery store fare Saigon cinnamon is potent, more aromatic and literally explodes with flavor. Use two thirds of what you would normally use or it will be bitter. In fact, like other brands I have tried this is fresh and potent enough to get by with a half of what you would normally use. You can always add a pinch more, but cannot remove it. Experiment if you have never used this Vietnamese spice because it's definitely like cinnamon on steroids. I use this mixed with either honey or unsweetened applesauce as a topping on baked sweet potatoes. I also add a pinch to coffee grounds before brewing when I want a special treat. This does NOT come in sticks because the nature of the bark from which this comes is too delicate to harvest in stick form. On the other hand, I have never had a cinnamon stick that came close to flavor and fragrance as this stuff, so do not let the powdered form fool you into thinking that there is something better out there. There isn't. If you cook or bake with cinnamon and have never experienced this variety it's definitely worth checking out. Rating: 5.0 Product: Dancing Moon Sumatra Mandheling Whole Bean Organic Fair Trade Antioxidant Coffee, 2 lbs. Review: I received this as a free review sample to try after criticizing the roast of the Dancing Moon Ethiopian Yirgacheffe, which I thought was over roasted. This one is perfectly roasted for the bean type. It's dark (the Sumatra Mandheling is best that way), but not oily, which would indicate over roasting. The flavor was typical Mandheling, with a full, rich body, low acidity and complex with earthy dominating, but a touch of sweet and - to my palate - an ineffable flavor that I cannot identify, but lingers in a pleasant way. When I test coffee I have a specific process. I always grind with a manual, ceramic burr grinder so as to not burn or burnish the beans, and I use a bottled water (Acqua Panna) when brewing because that water is totally neutral. Sadly that water is too expensive for daily brewing, but it contributes to a perfect cup of coffee. I also brew two ways: in a French Press and in a Bialetti 6799 Moka Express 3-Cup Stovetop Espresso Maker. This particular bean and grind brewed perfectly in both. I had expected a better brew from the French press, but surprisingly the moka did an equally nice job. In fact that brewer brought out nuances that the French press did not. My only complaint is there is no roast date on the bag. There is a 'use by' sticker, but that does not tell you how long ago it has been roasted - and is important to we coffee fanatics. Bottom line: I loved this particular bean and roast so much that I will probably be ordering a bag every few months - it's that good. Rating: 5.0 Product: Viva Naturals Organic Quinoa, 4 LB - 100% Royal Bolivian Whole Grain Review: I received a bag of this as a review sample and had other quinoa in my pantry to which to compare against. The grains in this bag were dry, fresh and had a slightly grassy flavor when I tasted a few grains. In contrast, the other brand I have in my pantry was not as pleasant to the palate (raw). The grains in this bag were smaller and more uniform as well. This one soaked and cooked about five minutes quicker as well, compared to the brand I had been using. As for the claims that this is non-GMO I have no way to verify that, but it's an important feature for me. I endeavor to eat only natural foods that are as pure as possible. Other reviewers have provided recipes and other information, so I will not repeat them. I will say that I've\ been eating quinoa for years because it is healthier on my system than most other grains. This is one of the higher quality bags that I have some across and I do know the difference. If you are exploring the health benefits there is plenty of information on the web. If you already consume quinoa this is truly a quality grain that is noticeably better than bulk bags (and even the giant plastic jars that some brands use). Rating: 5.0 Product: Thai Kitchen Fish Sauce, 6.76 oz Review: I can purchase this locally from a number of sources, including the dominant supermarket chain in Central Florida. Therefore my review will focus on this fish sauce and not address price or shipping. Not all fish sauces are created equal. I spent a lot of my life in Asia and was first introduced to this in the Philippines where it's called patis. This is identical to a high quality patis in all respects. Do be aware that this, like patis or other Thai brands, is extremely high in sodium. A single gram of this sauce contains 890mg. That means that a teaspoon contains a whopping 4450mg, so use it very sparingly if you have sodium restrictions. My main use is to chop fresh bird's eye peppers and make a combination dipping sauce and condiment that is called phrik nam pla in Thai. It's also delicious by itself on on grilled eggplant and zucchini, and especially pork (which I have not eaten in decades but did enjoy with this sauce when I did consume it.) Actually, this is perfect on mixed grilled or fried vegetables and will enhance many dishes if used in lieu of salt or soy sauce. Bottom line: this is a quality fish sauce that is identical to patis and the equal of any brand I have used. Rating: 5.0 Product: Thai Kitchen Fish Sauce, 6.76 oz Review: This is identical to the the top brands of the Philippine version called patis. It has the same purity and flavor, and can easily compete with my other favorite brand made by Tiparos. I switched to this brand mainly for convenience when I discovered it on a shelf at my local grocery store. That was a shock in itself, but a pleasant one. I use this - sparingly - on grilled eggplant and zucchini, and to make a hot dipping sauce called nam pra prik. That sauce can be easily made by finely chopping hot peppers (bird's eye chillies are the best) and adding them to this fish sauce. Although I haven't eaten pork in decades this was a perfect condiment for it when I did. The flavor of mixed grilled or fried vegetables is also greatly enhanced by using a few drops of this in lieu of salt or soy sauce. Do be aware that this, like patis or other Thai brands, is extremely high in sodium. A single gram of this sauce contains 890mg. That means that a teaspoon contains a whopping 4450mg, so use it very sparingly if you have sodium restrictions. Rating: 5.0 Product: Joyfuel Organic Raw Cacao Powder, Rich Dark Chocolate, 16 Ounce (1 lb) Bag Review: When I received this as a review sample I just had to try a little on my finger. It had that rich, slightly bitter taste of an excellent grade of cacao. I stirred a little into a cup of coffee and it complemented it perfectly. I was impressed by how easily it dissolved into the brew as though it were sugar. But know that it's anything but sweet (no quality cacao is). I know that this is supposed to have health benefits, some of which I know first hand from using cacao for quite some time. I have not had this long enough to say one way or the other. What I can say, though, is I have tried a lot of cacao in my life and this one is everything the product description claims as far as quality goes. In fact, if you make mole poblano from scratch, you'll appreciate this because it has a richness that you will not find in grocery store cacao or cocoa. The reason why I awarded this five stars are it is genuine Criollo, it's non GMO (a big deal for me), and the intense flavor and characteristic bitter aftertaste. If you do a lot of gourmet cooking using cacao this is worth every penny. If you are looking for the health benefits, I am not going to make claims other than to say that this is an exceptionally high quality grade. For me it's going to be a cooking ingredient, something to enrich after dinner coffee for me and guests, and as a sprinkle over confections made with mascapone cheese. I am sure I'll think of other uses, but when this runs out I am purchasing another bag. Rating: 5.0 Product: Island Fresh Superior Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, 54 Ounce Review: I received this as a free review sample. First, I want to address the 'extra virgin' claim. This oil was probably made by drying the coconut meat, then pressing it. That is a common method for making oil of the highest quality, but it is totally different from making olive oil. The EV designation can be confusing to cooks who are expecting a true grading system. There isn't one that is universally accepted for coconut oil. This does not detract from the quality of the oil, but I wanted to set expectations if you are new to it. My testing was strictly in food preparation. I used this in lieu of olive oil to prepare sea bass, as well as to make a Filipino dish called binagoongang gatas (a dish from the Bikol region of southern Luzon.) In both cases this oil proved to be very high quality. On the sea bass it was a subtle difference. So subtle, in fact, that you probably would not be able to tell which was which if I were to identically prepare one using olive oil and one using this oil. For the Filipino dish this is as real time saver. I typically boil coconut milk in a skillet until it flashes into oil, then continue with the rest of the recipe. Here I had oil to start with and it was just as good as the longer method I was accustomed to using. For me that is a big plus. Note that once opened DO NOT refrigerate this oil. It will harden. It should actually last a good six months at room temperature if tightly sealed. As for health benefits, I am not going to make claims one way or the other. Honestly, I do not know and even though I have been using coconut oil for cooking long before I tried this one, I would be lying if I said that made a difference. There are too many other variables in my diet. Bottom line: this is a high quality coconut oil that is perfect for cooking. I think it's vastly superior to most vegetable oils, and while olive oil is my most used oil, this one is perfect for many dishes. Rating: 5.0 Product: Vanilla Bean Powder, 3.53 Oz - Raw Ground Vanilla Bean - Unsweetened, Gluten-Free - EXTREMELY FRESH - Ground Moments Before Packaging! Review: I have used vanilla powder before, as well as genuine vanilla extract, so I had a good idea of that to expect when I accepted a review sample. This powder lived up to my expectations. While I sometimes use this in baking, my main use is flavoring a concoction that I am fond of: vanilla, milk and honey (and sometimes with an egg dropped in). I blend it and the drink is a wonderful pick-me-up. It's also healthy and is a great substitute for a meal. Note: this is pure vanilla, so do not expect it to be sweet. Like cacao, pure vanilla is not at all sweet and has a slight hint of bitter. I use honey, but just about any sweetener will work well with it. It dissolves fairly well in liquids. Not perfectly or completely unless you use a blender, but sufficiently so to make drinks like I mentioned above. It also adds a touch of flavor when sprinkled over pasties. I tried it on French toast with just butter and a slight touch of genuine maple syrup and it was delicious. I am not going to delve into the health advantages of pure vanilla because - frankly - I have no evidence one way or the other. In that respect I made no effort to validate the antioxidant properties. I enjoy this solely for the flavor, so if you are interested in the health benefits some research may provide answers one way or the other. For me, this is one of the best ingredients for healthy energy drinks, as well as for both sweet and savory dishes. It's perfect for adding a touch of bitter to balance out a flavor profile of a savory dish, as well as making some wonderful cakes and cookies. And a little of this goes a long way. Rating: 5.0 Product: Lee Kum Kee Guilin Style Chili Sauce - 8 oz. Review: I love hot sauces and love experimenting with various ones. Lately I have been using a lot of products from this brand and this one is among my favorites. The reason I love it is the flavor and the piquant character balance one another. Of course the piquant factor dominates the flavor profile (although this is not super spicy to my palate). The garlic is easily detected, but the surprise is the sweet aspect of the flavor profile, which seems to dominate more than the salt. About the piquant quality - this does have a slight bite and some spiciness, but if you can tolerate a serrano pepper you will not have any problems. For me I prefer a little more spiciness so I will often add some finely chopped bird's eye chilis to the sauce. Of course spiciness is both subjective and relative. If a jalapeno is too hot for you may want to avoid this. On the other hand, if a habanero is not enough, you will have to kick it up with additional peppers. To me it's all about flavor and this one has it. It not only works with stir fry dishes, but also in American dishes like grilled beans and as the base for stews and soups. A dab of this when making scampi will add a lot to that dish as well. Nutritionally a teaspoon contains only 10 calories and a single gram of carbs. However, it also contains 410mg of sodium, so if you have restrictions note that and use this sparingly. In fact, use it as a condiment in lieu of salt on some dishes for a real treat. If you love spicy sauces and want to fuse Chinese flavors into your tried and true menus, or to make authentic Chinese dishes this is a great shortcut. It's earned a spot in my pantry. Review:
This Stash Tea, Lemon Ginger Single-Cup is a really tasty zinger.  The lemon and ginger are strong flavors, and the tea color is far darker than most lemon ginger teas I've had.  I opened one of the single serves and found that the tea is more finely ground than those in loose tea mixes or tea bags.  Maybe this finer grinding allows more flavor to be brewed into the cup.

I like it plain when it's hot and with honey for a sweeter taste when served as iced tea.

If you're fond of citrus and ginger, you'll like this tea.  The convenience of the single serving cups is an added bonus.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
LÄRABAR Renola Grain-Free Granola, Cocoa Coconut, 1.18 oz, 15 Pack
Review:
I write this with the perspective of someone who does not NEED non-gluten, non-soy, low sodium foods.  It's simply the opinion of someone who enjoys delicious foods and snacks.  Larabar's Renola is a tasty granola substitute for those who are looking for a non-wheat granola product.

However, when I eat granola, I want crunch and this doesn't have it.  It does have almonds, pecans, cashews, sunflower and pumpkin  seeds and you'd expect a wonderfully crunchy texture from them, but maybe the fruit (raisins) and tapioca syrup soften them.

The flavor is sweet (dried molasses) and satisfying for a sweet tooth urge.  The cinnamon is mild and tasty, too.  They make the nuggets taste good.

The 200 calories for a 1.25 oz. serving seems awfully high, especially when 130 of them come from fat.  Unless you are desperate for a tiny splurge, I can think of better ways to consume 10% of the USDA's recommended daily allotment of a 2,000 calorie diet.  Please understand, if your needs are for non-gluten, this can more than meet your desire for a quick snack.  But, if you can partake of other options, I'd take a pass on this product.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz
Review:
These FISHER Honey Dry Roast Peanuts are delicious!  We happen to have an unopened jar of the Planters' dry roasted nuts with honey and so, we did a  'blind' taste test.  We prefer these FISHER nuts.  Both brands are good.  Maybe it's the ratio of sweet and salty, but the FISHER's is better in our opinions.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Traditional Medicinals Organic Belly Comfort Peppermint Digestive Tea, 16 Tea Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
If you follow the directions on the box, steeping your tea, you will have a delicious, spicy cup of ginger tea.  This is real ginger taste, not an artificial one.

I could not remember what brand of ginger tea I'd bought previously.  By reading the product description and consumer reviews, Traditional Medicinals Organic Ginger Aid seemed like a decent choice.  I am very happy with my selection.  I served it to a friend who loved it and shared half of my six boxes with her.  We'll be ordering more, I'm certain.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Super Fine Almond Flour, 16 Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)
Review:
I bought Bob's Red Mill Almond Meal/Flour with confidence, as I have used other products from this company and liked them.  Let me tell you why I bought it.  I wanted to make a pastry (almond crescents/horns) that requires one pound of almond paste.  At my local supermarket this sells for nearly $1/ounce--far too costly!  I looked at Amazon's price and determined that I could make almond paste for less than half that price.

The box came well-packaged and swiftly with Amazon Prime delivery.  I made two pounds of almond paste from just one bag of almond flour and will freeze the second pound for making marzipan.  The remaining three bags are stored in freezer bags in my freezer and will eventually be used in pie crusts, cookies, etc.

The almond flour blended perfectly with the other ingredients and produced an excellent paste.  The quality was very good; there were no dark spots (from almond skins), the flour had no lumps and appeared to be fresh.

This is a brand you can rely on and I do--again and again.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Belly Flops (Irregular Jelly Beans) by Jelly Belly - 2 lb Bag; 32 oz
Review:
If you've eaten Jelly Belly beans, you know how tasty they are.  Each tiny 'bean' is a colorful burst of gummy flavor.  In this package, you will find the appropriately named mistakes, 'Belly Flops'.  These are the beans that didn't meet production standards for size, shape, or perhaps, became stuck to another bean--twins, how yummy.  There's absolutely no difference in taste, just their appearance.  Each two-pounds bag contains a delicious, large variety of flavors of these cute, little beans.

Whether you buy them for yourself or, give them as a gift, they're sure to bring smiles of appreciation.  We mix the 'Flops' with the regular beans.  When scooping up a handful you'll never know what surprises you may encounter, making this treat even more fun to eat.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
FISHER Snack Praline Pecans Stand-Up, Resealable Bag, 5.5 oz
Review:
FISHER's Roasted Salted Pecans are scrumptious!  Each nut (some are full halves, some are large pieces) has a light sprinkling of salt and is perfectly roasted.  These nuts are good to eat right out of the re-sealable package and can be stored for future snacking without their becoming soggy.

A serving size is 1 ounce (about 1/4 cup) and contains 200 calories.  The problem is that they're so good, it's hard to stop with one serving.

The pecans are good on salads, on top of ice cream and I've even tried baking chocolate chip cookies with them.  Just use unsalted butter and add about half of the salt your usual recipe calls for.  I put these FISHER's Roaste4d Salted Pecans out for company with dried fruits, cheeses, and crackers.  Everyone complimented the nuts first.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Breadtopia Sourdough Starter (Live)
Review:
This product delivers.  Literally.  The San Francisco Sourdough Yeast arrived quickly; the starter is of excellent quality, and the rapid customer service (Rosalyn answered my online questions on a Sunday!) was about the best I have ever experienced.  Good things do come in small packages and this sourdough starter is no exception.

As I write this my dough is proofing and that singular San Francisco aroma tells me this is the real thing.  M-m-m.  I close my eyes and remember that delicious, yeasty sourdough from Fisherman's Wharf.

The only caveat comes with following the directions.  After the first feeding of the yeast with bread flour and water, the directions state to discard all but  cup, which can be used to make pancakes or biscuits.  (The pancakes were delicious.)  The second and third feedings each require adding  cup water and slightly less than 1 cup (I used 7/8 cup) bread flour.

The Sourdough Bread recipe calls for 2 1/3 cups of starter.  Take my advice.  Keep your discarded excess starter (remember, you keep only  cup of it each of the three times) in the refrigerator.  You may use it to create additional starters in order to have enough (2 1/3 cups) to begin making your dough.  Alternatively, take your final (third) proofing, using  cup of it to have enough multiples to make 2 1/3 cups of starter for your dough.

The best place for the yeast to activate was in the oven, with the oven light remaining on.  It gives off sufficient heat for a perfect environment and was free from drafts.

My dough (2 lbs.,14.5 oz.)  is ready to be punched down and I see that I'll be able to get two large or three medium loaves.

One final word:  This does not perform like bread using rapid rise yeast.  Give yourself a week to proof your sourdough yeast, make your dough and allow it rise two times (each rise can be from 12-24 hours).  Good things come to those who wait...
Rating:
5.0
Product:
FISHER Snack Cashew Halves & Pieces, Stand-Up Bag, Gluten Free, 5 oz
Review:
The Fisher nuts' label states that the nuts are "whole cashews".  But that's not correct.  They are small pieces, halves, and only some are whole nuts.  In addition, these nuts are quite small; not at all like the premium size you may be accustomed to buying.  The nuts have a slightly oily texture that I find detracts from their quality.  To their credit, they are lightly salted and not overly so.

I've really liked Fisher's other nuts:  honey roasted peanuts, macadamia nuts, etc., and that's why I wanted to try these.  Frankly, I'm disappointed.  Because of the mis-labeling and oily feel, they get just two stars.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Traditional Medicinals Organic Chamomile Herbal Leaf Tea, 16 Tea Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
If you love the peppery flavor of ginger, this tea is for you.  The longer the tea bag sits, the stronger the ginger taste.  What I like best about it is the true ginger flavor.  I've tried other brands and they just aren't as potent.

Whether you drink it strictly for taste or use it to soothe your stomach, this one's a great choice.  If you're drinking it just for enjoyment, try this:  steep your tea, allowing the bag to sit in the water until it's cool.  Add honey, stir, and pour over ice.  Delicious!
Rating:
5.0

Product:
Simply Organic Chili Powder Certified Organic, 2.89-Ounce Container
Review:
This Simply Organic chili powder contains the chemical additive silicon dioxide, which has been proven to cause cancer when inhaled.  Simply Organic's partner company Frontier Natural also includes silicon dioxide in one of it's curry powders.

The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) issued a ruling as of November 3, 2013 to limit the use of silicon dioxide in organic foods. Under the final rule, silicon dioxide is only permitted as a defoamer if "organic rice hulls are not commercially available as an adequate replacement."

Therefore, this product is no longer considered organic under USDA regulations.
