Review:

golds.output: I was excited to try the Louisville Vegan Jerky - Smoked Chipotle as I'm always on the lookout for a good vegan snack. The flavor is quite good, not too smoky and not too spicy. I appreciate that it's made with non-GMO soy protein and gluten-free ingredients. The texture is a bit chewy, but that's to be expected with vegan jerky. My only reason for not giving it a 5-star rating is that I find it a bit pricey for the amount you get. Overall, it's a tasty and satisfying snack that I would recommend to fellow vegans and vegetarians.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Nutiva USDA Certified Organic, non-GMO, Unrefined Granulated Coconut Sugar, 1-pound (Pack of 3) Review: As coconut sugars go, the Nutiva Organic Sugar, Coconut, 1 Pound (Pack of 3) is a good way to go if you need three pounds. I question the labeling as Organic Superfood because I do not consider any sugar to be a superfood, but in moderation, if you are going to use sugar, this is one to consider. The color of the sugar is brown, the texture is moist and fine. It doesn't clump as quickly as brown sugar, but I haven't had an opened bag around long enough for that to occur. Each pound is in a sturdy resealable bag and there's an interesting recipe on the back of the bag which I intend to try. If this is your first experience with coconut sugar, don't be misled by the very white packaging and expect the product to be white like the coconut flesh represented on the package. This is a whole other product which has a very caramel like, rich texture that lends itself to rich uses. Rating: 5.0 Product: FISHER Chef's Naturals Walnut Halves & Pieces, No Preservatives, Non-GMO, 16 oz Review: Fisher Chef's Natural Walnuts get 5 stars for being non GMO certified and for being mostly halves of the nuts and not too many small pieces. They seem to be expensive, though, for non-Organic walnut halves. I bake a lot and have an ample supply of walnuts, pecans and almonds at the very least in the pantry and freezer. Seriously, I must go through a pound or two a week. I recently opened another brand's sealed and "fresh" bag of walnuts that were rancid, so I will never buy that brand again. These, on the other hand, were delicious straight out of the bag. I'm using these nuts in their out of the bag unchopped form and will use my other favorite bag for recipes requiring smaller pieces. These are especially tasty when baked and bitten into while warm, as the flavors and oils come forward. They are also excellent when spiced as a snack with cocktails! I prefer pecans over walnuts, but I tend to look for quality nuts at a reasonable price and would repurchase these if the price was right. Rating: 5.0 Product: Navitas Organics Cacao Nibs, 8 oz. Bag — Organic, Non-GMO, Fair Trade, Gluten-Free Review: I've been purchasing the Navitas Naturals Cacao Powder, Organic, 16-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 2) for years and made a discovery I'd like to share. When out of cocoa powder, I needed to bake a batch of Alice Medrich's Best Cocoa Brownies for an event and was short on time. Remembering the cacao powder in the cupboard, I took a chance and was rewarded with a batch of brownies that drew more compliments than ever before, and I'm always praised for the brownies I bake. They were especially bittersweet and didn't require the addition of espresso powder which I often add to chocolate baked recipes. The ultra fudgy brownies were great with nuts, without nuts, and in the fresh batch I baked yesterday, I brought out the chocolate flavor the best so far with the addition of rehydrated cherries, cranberries and chopped figs. I'd recommend thinking out of the box with this cacao powder and although it may lose some of the nutritional benefits with cooking, it sure does produce great baked goods if you are willing to taste your batter, adjust as necessary, and take a chance. The above mentioned recipe was a perfect use because the cacao powder is cooked with butter and sugar initially and that's used instead of the typical chocolate chunks in brownie recipes. Oh yes, in all recipes, I also added some chocolate chips -- found the extra bitter chips weren't as good as the semi-sweet because of the natural bitterness of the cacao powder. Rating: 5.0 Product: Bobo's Oat Bar (Banana Chocolate Chip, 12 Pack of 3 oz Bars) Gluten Free Whole Grain Rolled Oat Bar - Great Tasting Vegan On-The-Go Snack, Made in the USA Review: I've purchased 4 boxes of Bobo's Oat Bars in the Chocolate variety from Amazon in the past month. An acquaintance had told me how delicious they were, so I took a chance and purchased my first box before I embarked on a trip, planning to take some along for the journey. Unfortunately for my wallet, every person but one to whom I gave a bar loved these, so I sent some a box to enjoy. Prior to my first purchase, I did not realize these are soft, sort of brownie like in texture, a little sweet in a molasses sort of way (no molasses in the recipe, though), crumbly, and with two servings in a single bar. Fortunately, I placed a bar in a small resealable plastic bag for the airplane trip, so I was able to break off a little piece any time I felt hungry. That bag was a saving grace because when a bar was gone, I replaced it with another and you won't believe how often I pulled out that little bag. I ordered the first box as a gift after I put a little bite into my father's mouth while he was busy enjoying himself at a slot machine and I realized that he needed to keep these on hand for him and Mom to have on the days they go out. For those who have few teeth, these are edible because of the soft texture, yet they provide an enjoyable flavor. Hiker's took these along for a day trip, not worrying about the double serving per package, happily eating the entire bar. As they put it, they felt like they had a brownie along for the trek, much more enjoyable than other bars they'd taken in the past. One sister has enjoyed these on days when she's been unable to break for lunch at work, having them with coffee or tea and some deep breaths. Without eggs, butter or flour, they are terrific, even though Earth Balance has never been my favorite flavor. I'll admit that I was expecting a firmer bar with visible chocolate chips, but after the surprise of a crumbly moist baked good with a not very sweet cocoa flavor, I was hooked. I will gladly try the other varieties when I can find them for a lower cost than over two dollars per bar. A retail value of about thirty dollars is too high for a dozen bars, so I've deducted a star from this review. The one friend who did not love her Bobo's Oat Bar thought it tasted like cardboard and she claimed to have forced it down at work. She loves the SOYJOY bars which I do not care for, so I guess the world is balanced. Rating: 4.0 Product: Nutiva Certified Organic, non-GMO, Vegan Hazelnut Spread with Cocoa, Chia and Flaxseed, Classic Chocolate, 13-ounce Review: I prefer the darkest, most bitter chocolates. Hazelnuts are a favorite, but I love nearly all nuts if they are fresh. Sugar seldom entices me, but watch out if a bag of savory snacks is opened in the house. The nutiva organic hazelnut spread surprised me because the 13 ounce jar is smaller than I imagined it would be. The information on the label appealed to me because the product is organic, non GMO, gluten-free, vegan, and it contains 12 grams of sugar in 2 tablespoons which is more than I will use at a time. The calories in that serving ar 210 with 15 grams of fat. It has no cholesterol. In this spread that contains 40% less sugar than the leading brand which we all know is Nutella, the first ingredient is cane sugar. I'm surprised to read that this may contain traces of milk solids which to me says it would not be vegan, but what do I know? I again was surprised when I opened the jar of classic organic hazelnut spread with cocoa and after prying off the seal, discovered a very thin product which I tried to stir with a very fancy spoon. There was nothing solid at the bottom of the jar, it was all the same thin consistency which reminded me of Hershey's syrup from years ago. I coated the spoon and tasted this product only to discover that I love it. It is not overly sweet and the cocoa comes through clearly with a very strong hazelnut aftertaste. There are no synthetic additives in this fair trade certified product of the United States. It is recommended that this not be refrigerated even after opening the jar which makes it much easier to keep in an office setting inside a desk drawer for quick access. I think it's that good. Rating: 5.0 Product: KIND Bars, Dark Chocolate Nuts & Sea Salt, Gluten Free, 1.4 Ounce Bars, 12 Count Review: I received the package of KIND Nuts & Spices, Dark Chocolate Nuts & Sea Salt, 12-Count Bars in the early evening, so it had been sitting in the shipper's truck all day in the heat. Unfortunately, when I opened the package, each bar was soft because the chocolate was melted and sticking to the wrapper. Regardless, when brought back to a temperature closer to the 80 degree range, I eagerly tore open a cellophane package and carefully peeled it back to try my first KIND bar. With the first bite, I was impressed by the great flavor of fresh nuts and simple dark chocolate, even after exposed to the environmental heat. On the second bite, I was hit with the sea salt, making me think about how smart it is to add sea salt instead of using salted nuts which I sometimes do when making chocolate covered nuts. That creates an inconsistent salt burst which I find appealing. At the small size of 1.4 ounces, it's loaded with fiber from the nuts and chicory root fiber, with relatively little sugars. I personally would seldom consider eating one of these as a meal, but would have it as a filling food when needed in times where a meal could not be obtained. I would supplement this and would not rely on this alone for nutrition! Without further information on what else is included in the diet, I don't understand how the "Yale-Griffin Prevention Research Center indicates that eating 2 KIND bars each day helps maintain your weight through low glycemic, deliciously satisfying, nutritionally rich ingredients that will keep you fuller longer." I think that 400 calories of intake per day is too much for any snack item. With that being said, I now carry one of these bars with me instead of another grain type bar for the times when I absolutely need something to eat or desire a chocolate fix. When I have these, I no longer carry a little bag of nuts either. Because I haven't yet purchased bars which haven't been heated, I can only say that those I've received are not visually appealing and require eating directly from the cellophane because the bits of chocolate fall away. Despite that flaw, these are a great snack item that I will be purchasing and will try other varieties as well. I would like to see these offered at a better value when purchased in a box rather than the current cost at about eighteen dollars for a pound box of twelve bars. Rating: 4.0 Product: Vedica Organics - Organic Turmeric (Curcumin) Spice Powder (3 oz) Review: Seems like everyone is into turmeric these days. You can buy it by the ounce, pound or capsule. I like this particular organic turmeric powder but think it is currently overpriced. It is securely packaged in a sealed plastic jar with a dispensing cap and screw top and since the powder is vibrant in color and I want it to stay that way, I have transferred mine into a glass jar and keep it in a cabinet. The powder tastes very good and blends well with other spices for assorted curry blends. There are currently a number of organic turmeric powders available and this one is fine. Vedica Organics provided a sample for review at an extremely reduced cost. Rating: 4.0 Product: KIND Sweet and Spicy Bars, Korean Chili, Gluten Free, 10g Plant Protein, 1.6oz, 12 Count Review: A few years ago, I started purchasing KIND bars from Amazon, then picked them up when I found them on sale in local stores. Favorites have been those with dark chocolate and nuts, sea salt, and the coconut almond. I recently discovered a new favorite which is unlike any other I've tried. The STRONG & KIND Roasted Jalapeno, 1.6 Ounce, 12 Count were in a basket at the checkout counter at my local Trader Joe's for a buck a piece, so I took a chance and purchased one. Now right off the bat, I will say that not everyone will like these. They are savory and since everyone in my household is a savory snack snackster, these are a huge hit and I purchased another dozen bars. Roasted jalapeno is also known as chipotle, so the smoky heat combined with the minimally sweet nut and protein based bar just pops. If you like the Texas Pepper Works Candy-Krisp Jalapenos offered on Amazon (and stacked in my pantry), chances are that you'll also like these high protein bars. I always carry a KIND bar in my bag and find that with no chocolate, I don't have a gooey mess if it's kept in a hot environment. Product:

Review:
I have used this oil for salad dressings and to drizzle over veggies instead of butter. I can't say that is adds flavor, but it is definitely more healthy to use than other oils. This particular oil should not be used for frying as it does not have a high heat tolerance. I have used it in baked recipes and it does well. I have also bought the Special Edition Walnut oil directly from the company. It is a lot more expensive, but it does have a definite nutty flavor. I have also used the Special Edition on veggies, and it does add a good nutty flavor.

I have used a number of the La Tourangelle oils and have not been disappointed with any of them. I have completely eliminated the use of non-nut oils to improve the quality of fats that we eat. When buying these nut oils, it is important to pay attention to which can be used with low heat or medium to high heat. It is also important to note which require refrigeration after opening - some do and some don't. To be on the safe side, I refrigerate all of them after opening. I think it helps to keep them fresher.

Although some of the Amazon reviews dock stars for dented cans, this is not fair to the product, nor does it deteriorate or affect the quality of the product. This is a 5 star product and reviews should not reflect Amazon's shipping practices.

Review:
This one of the many La Tourangelle oils that I use. I particularly like this one because it can be used at higher temperatures. I haven't use vegetable or canola oils for a very long time, and prefer to use the healthier nuts oils for all of my cooking. This, and other, nut oils are used exclusively for all frying and baking. I substitute nut oils for oils used in all of my recipes, and the work wonderfully. In fact, my bread recipes seem to work better using these oils.

Although nut oils still include fats, they are healthy fats, and do not have a negative effect on cholesterol or weight gain. Your body needs fats to function, but healthy fats are more beneficial.

 Frontier Garlic Powder, 16 Ounce Bags (Pack of 2) 
Review:
I use a lot of garlic powder, and I have found that the garlic powder purchased from the store is truly a powder. It is hard to mix with other ingredient, especially liquid, and tends to clump. I would describe this garlic powder as more of a fine granulated garlic. The smell is much more like fresh garlic. I can't say that I save money buying this garlic powder as 2 lbs. in the store actually costs a bit less in this area. The whole idea of using herbs and spices is to enhance flavor and aroma, and this garlic powder is the best for that. I would rather pay a little more to accomplish the desired results in dishes that I make. I like that Amazon is offering this garlic and saving me a trip to the store. I bought shaker bottles from Amazon, and filled one with this garlic powder. The rest of it went into the freezer to keep it fresher for longer.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Red Quinoa, 25 Lb Bag
Review:
For the last couple of years, we have been using the pearl, or white, quinoa for its health value because reviews have described the flavor of red quinoa as being strong. I mistakenly assumed that strong would not be good. More recently, I tried a couple of small bags of the red quinoa to see if we liked it. All I can say is "Wow". The difference is like night and day. The white quinoa has little flavor and needs additives to have any at all. When eating it, it doesn't stay together at all. All of the little, teensy pieces can be difficult to keep together without some sort of sauce or a spoon. In contrast, the red quinoa, has a crunchy texture, and a nutty flavor. Granted, I still add garlic and onion powders in addition to other spices when I cook it, but we love the texture and the color. I did rinse this quinoa a couple of times before soaking just to make sure there weren't any hulls or dust in it. I think it's better to do this than take a chance it has been cleaned enough. I did find it to be clean, and little, if anything, rinsed out of it. I would highly recommend this quinoa to anyone that has not yet tried the red variety and to those that have. I still also use the pearl quinoa as an additive for pot roast, stews, and other things that I only want the nutritive value without the crunch, but the red variety is our alternative to rice or potatoes.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Frontier Bulk Whole Certified Organic Mustard Seed, Brown, 1 lb
Review:
I bought both this mustard seed and the yellow mustard seed. The brown mustard seed is much harder to find locally. I grind this seed with the yellow mustard seed to make homemade Dijon mustard. Making homemade mustard is so easy, and doesn't compare to anything you would buy in the store. My recipe for Dijon mustard is:
Ingredients:
* 1/2 cup dry white wine
* 1/2 cup white wine vinegar
* 1/4 cup brown mustard seeds (about 1 1/2 oz.)
* 1/4 cup yellow mustard seeds (about 1 1/2 oz.)
* 3 garlic cloves, minced
* 1/2 tsp. kosher salt
Directions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a small glass bowl, stir and cover tightly. Let sit at room temperature for 2 days.
2. Transfer to a blender and blend until the desired consistency. Keep in mind that it's not possible for this mustard to reach a completely smooth consistency. Store tightly covered in the refrigerator for up to 3 months.

This mustard seems to increase potency as it is stored. It tastes more like a horseradish mustard over time.

Anthony's Organic White Mulberries, Sun Dried (12oz)
Review:
I have never had mulberries before. So I wasn't sure what to expect. After doing a little research on them, I found that they are considered to be a Superfood. They are a good source of resveratrol, vitamins C and K, calcium, and iron to name a few. These white mulberries are really quite good. They have a taste and texture similar to raisins. As you can see in my picture, they are uniform in size, and all of a similar color. These berries are very good, and healthy, for snacking, and would also be good in smoothies as you might use goji berries. We will also use them in my 96 year old mother's morning oatmeal. As an added benefit, these white mulberries are certified organic and non-GMO. For a 12 oz. bag, they are also quite reasonable. I plan to keep these in stock as I do goji berries.

I received these mulberries at a discount or for free for my honest, unbiased evaluation and review. All of my reviews are nothing less than honest as I rely heavily on customer product reviews for my own purchases.

Review:

This sometimes made it difficult to find and remove them all from the finished dish. The Frontier bay leaves are all very large, and the aroma is amazing. Granted the bag is large, but I keep them in my freezer to preserve freshness, and put a few at a time in the old bay leaf jar so that they are handy. I find it interesting that after cooking in a long cooking recipe, they don't break easily. They feel more like a leathery leaf and are easily removed from the food.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
La Tourangelle Roasted Almond Oil, 16.9-Ounce Unit (Pack of 3)
Review:
In the last couple of years, I have done a lot of research on healthy food products and healthy eating. So I have gotten away from using the various vegetable oils, and had been using primairly olive oil. When I found this product and some of the other nut oils, I now sometimes use them for the health benefits. I have been using this almond oil for a Ceasar dressing that calls for vegetable oil and it works great. Some of the nut oils can be used for frying and others are better for salad dressings and cold recipes. Some seem to feel that the nut oils add flavor, but this is not my experience. I really haven't noticed any difference in flavor, but the health benefits of nut oils are more than enough to convert recipes calling for vegetable oils.

Some of the nut oils are also supposed to be good for the skin and hair. I have tried almond and macadamia oils on my face at night, and the skin does absorb it. I tried mac oil on my hair once, but wouldn't do it again. My hair was pretty well slicked down, and I washed the oil out immediately. For salads and any cooking that doesn't use high heat, I would highly recommend this almond oil for its health benefits.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

Product:
Planters Cashews in Milk Chocolate, 3.5-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 12)
Review:
I bought this 9-ounce can of Planter Cashews (halves and pieces) at my local Grocery store. Good product. The taste is excellent, although a bit too salty for me. They were nice and fresh and tasty and didn't last nearly long enough. Next time it will be a bigger size package.

Halves and pieces. Hmmmm. Where and how do they get all the broken cashews? I couldn't find a single non-broken one. Oh well, I guess that's truth in labeling. But, how do they all get broken? Is there someone in charge of breaking them as they come down the production line? If they're accidentally broken and won't sell for as much as the non-broken ones, why isn't the price cheaper? Oh well, does it really matter? Once they're in my mouth, all will get broken.

Gary Peterson
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Hampton Farms Salted & Roasted In-shell Peanuts * Large Bag * Net Wt. 80 Oz (5 Lbs.)
Review:
I enjoy late night snacking while reading or watching TV. I'm on a diet emphasizing cutting out as much sugar as possible and peanuts fit the bill with less than one gram per serving.. By the way, my bag is only 12 ounces and is branded with the "San Diego Padres Baseball Club" imprinted on the label. Probably a local variant. Same salted in the shell nuts. Different size bag. Same Hampton Farms logo. Maybe every city large enough to have a baseball club has it's own variant. Interesting way to sell more nuts, I suppose. In any case, they're quite good nuts. Mine seemed a little stale (not a problem) and I would have preferred them to be a little saltier. My last bag of peanuts was a five-pound bag of Hoodies that was stale to the point of inedible. These are good. I'll buy them again.

Gary Peterson
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Crunchmaster Artisan Four Cheese Rice Cracker, 3.5-Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I picked up these Crunchmaster Rice (Artisan Four Cheese) Crackers at a nearby Costco Store. They looked good, and a lady gave me one to taste. They were good. Into the cart went a six package box. They're the same as these, only packed together in a slightly different way.

The crackers are excellent. They're real crunchy, way moreso than most crackers and they have the faint taste and smell of cheese. They're lightly salted and have a very low fat content. I enjoy them by themselves as snacks, or I eat them with smoked oysters or sardines as a light lunch. Or, I have them with a variety of spreads. They're pretty versatile, and delicious I should add.

Gary Peterson
Rating:
5.0
Product:
NongShim Bowl Noodle Soup, Spicy Chicken, 3.03 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
This afternoon I had a Nongshim Bowl Noodle Soup of the Spicy Chicken variety. It's a quick lunch (four minutes) and quite tasty. My only gripes would be that it's too high in sodium, a complaint shared by almost all noodle bowls, and that it doesn't have enough protein for a good meal. I can easily add the latter. I also had a big Delicious Apple to supply something fresh and something with a lot of fiber. Altogether, the combination made a good lunch, and it was quick and easy.

Gary Peterson
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Amy's Organic Chili, Medium Black Bean, 14.7 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
Some time ago, I tried the Amy's Spicy Organic Chili and liked it very much. So, when I was back at the nearby Fresh and Easy store and looking over the chili, I spotted the Amy's Medium Organic Chili. Into the cart a can went. Well, I like this one too and it's actually a bit zesty. I thought I'd add some Frank's Hot Sauce if it wasn't tasty enough, but it turned out that there was no need. This is good stuff. It's meatless, but has beans, soybeans and tofu so the protein content is actually fairly high but the fat content is rather low. If I had any criticism, i night be that the sodium content is too high. But, all in all, it's a rather good chili. Given the choice, I think I'd slightly prefer the spicy variety.

Gary Peterson
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Amy's Organic Chili, Medium Black Bean, 14.7 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
My nearby Fresh and Easy Neighborhood Market carries a lot of gourmet and health-related items and I like to try them. One I picked up recently was Amy's Organic Chili. I bought both the regular and the spicy varieties and I'm reviewing the spicy one here. It's quite good for a canned chili. I'd say it's at least as good as any other canned brand I've ever tried. Plus it's fairly low in fat and seems to lack that oily topping I associate with canned chili. I't's a little higher in sodium than I'd like, but not by much. The taste is quite good. It's somewhat zesty but I'd rate the spicyness as mild. The meat is ground and occurs as tittle interspersed grains rather than larger chunks. Of course, it's organic. I've always liked chili and this is a good one that I can keep stashed in my pantry. Amy's is a good brand and I'm very satisfied.

Gsry Peterson
Rating:
5.0
Product:
David Seeds Pumpkin Seeds, 5-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
If you're ever looking for a light snack to accompany watching television, a ball game or something like that, try David Pumpkin Seeds. They're lightly roasted, lightly salted and all natural. And they're delicious!

Some people eat the entire seed, but I only eat the kernels. Thus, I have to crack each seed, extract the kernel and dispose of the hulls. This process can be somewhat time consuming, but like everything else, you get better and better with practice. Still, some people would regard this as a negative, but I would regard it as a positive. I can sometimes spend all evening consuming a delicious snack and watching TV and consume less than a single serving which amounts to 280 calories. Plus, seeds and nuts carry a heavy caloric load in general, to be sure, but they also carry a lot of vitamins, minerals, unsaturated vegetable fat and fiber. They may have calories, but they aren't empty calories! I worry a little about the salt content, but the David seeds are only lightly salted and I don't consume the entire seed.

These David Pumpkin Seeds are a fine light snack. Prepare to get addicted. I'll bet you can't eat just one, or one pack. They can be a little hard to find, but finding large quantities online is easy. Good snacking!

Gary Peterson
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Sea's Gift Korean Seaweed Snack (Kim Nori), Roasted & Sea Salted, 0.17-Ounce Bags (Pack of 24)
Review:
I'll try almost anything once. As such I noticed the Sea's Gift  Roasted Seaweed Snack at my nearby grocery store and I had to try it. Well, it's light as a feather and a serving has only 25 calories. The smacks are thin little wafers and there must be about a dozen in a serving. They're strange tasting and slightly salty, but by the end of the serving I was enjoying them. They're like eating little pieces of flavored cellophane that dissolve in your mouth. In any case, it was an interesting experiment. I'll buy more. I may even get to like them.

Gary Peterson
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Aloe Gloe, Organic Aloe Water, White Grape, 15.2-Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I enjoy trying new foods and beverages. I found this "Aloe gloe" water (crisp, original, pulp free) in a 15.2-ounce bottle in my local Fresh and Easy Neighborhood Market. I had to try it. I've never had anything aloe before and I was curious. Well, it's quite good. I'd say it tastes like a mild iced tea with something of a fresh, very-light minty flavor and is ever so slightly sweet. All the ingredients are certified organic. It's produced right here in California, only about a hundred miles away, in fact. Supposedly it has digestive, immune and skin benefits, and I certainly can't vouch for that after having only one bottle. But, I like it. Nice taste. Goes  down easy. Only 70 calories in a 2-serving bottle. I'll be back for more.

Gary Peterson
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Aloe Gloe, Organic Aloe Water, White Grape, 15.2-Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I do a lot of my food shopping at a nearby Fresh and Easy Neighborhood Market and they continuously introduce new gourmet items, which I greatly enjoy trying. The latest was a couple varieties of Aloe Gloe Natural Aloe Water and mine is the White Grape Pulp-Free variety. It's quite a good drink. It's good tasting and refreshing. It's certified organic and contains all kinds of health benefits, as is explained on the label. Furthermore, it's gluten free and is only 35 calories per 15.2-ounce bottle. That's a hard-to-beat combination, and, yes, it's a bit pricey.

Gary Peterson

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: CLIF BAR - Energy Bar - Apricot - (2.4 Ounce Protein Bar, 12 Count) Review: Being a buyer at a small grocery store sometimes has its perks. Free samples are the best part. The rep for Clif/Luna bars gave me a sample of this bar. I can't wait for them to become available! The bar looks like your basic Clif bar: a squat granola-y bar with some chunks in it. The chunks in this bar are chocolate! Don't assume that it tastes just like the Luna Chocolate Dipped Coconut Bar, 1.69-Ounces (Pack of 15). Sure, they both have chocolate and coconut. However, the Clif version is much more like a granola bar, while Luna's is basically a healthier candy bar. The coconut Clif bar isn't as sweet, nor is it as chocolate-y. They are both excellent, in my opinion. Rating: 5.0 Product: CLIF BAR - Energy Bar - Apricot - (2.4 Ounce Protein Bar, 12 Count) Review: Being a buyer at a small grocery store sometimes has its perks. Free samples are the best part. The rep for Clif/Luna bars gave me a sample of this bar. I can't wait for them to become available! The bar looks like your basic Clif bar: a squat granola-y bar with some chunks in it. The chunks in this bar are chocolate! Don't assume that it tastes just like the Luna Bar Chocolate Dipped Coconut, 25.4-Ounce, 15-Bars. Sure, they both have chocolate and coconut. However, the Clif version is much more like a granola bar, while Luna's is basically a healthier candy bar. The coconut Clif bar isn't as sweet, nor is it as chocolate-y. They are both excellent, in my opinion. Rating: 5.0 Product: Thai Kitchen Coconut Milk, 13.66 fl oz (Pack of 12) Review: This brand does make a superior coconut milk, but Amazon buyers are always on the lookout for a good deal. The only difference between this Lite Coconut Milk and Thai Kitchen Pure Coconut Milk, 13.66-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12) is water! That being said, stretch your dollar and buy the regular version. To cut calories and fat, add the water yourself. Rating: 2.0 Product: CLIF MOJO - Sweet and Salty Trail Mix Bar - Dark Chocolate Almond Coconut - (1.6 Ounce Snack Bar, 12 Count) Review: I love the salty zip that seems inherent to most Mojo bars; this one doesn't have it. But, that's okay! What is does have is almonds, chocolate and coconut, along with the signature soy rice crisps. It is delicious and fairly hearty, probably due to the 8 grams of protein. One of the perks of being a buyer at a grocery store is getting free samples like this! The only downfall is having to buy them after getting hooked by the taste. Rating: 5.0 Product: Zevia All Natural Soda, Grape, 12-Ounce Cans (Pack of 24) Review: I grew up in an exclusively diet cola home. I got to nearly hate diet soda... uhg.. Even now, I would rather drink water to "real" OR diet soda. I loved to sneak sugary grape soda as a child, however. Correct me if I'm wrong, but I don't think diet grape soda even existed when I was a youngster. This stuff takes me back to the forbidden treat of my past. It even smells the same. If you grew up, like me, loving grape soda, try this product. You won't be disappointed! Rating: 5.0 Product: Spectrum Naturals Canola Mayonnaise, 11.25 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: I often come across a product that repels me. Then, occasionally, my taste buds change direction to the point of craving the aforementioned "repulsion." The first time I can remember this phenomenon was with Kombucha. I hated the vinegary bite, but kept drinking the beverage because of its health benefits. Now, I have to ration the stuff to protect my wallet. More recently, I fell into the same trap with this mayo. On first try, I felt like the product simply tasted "wrong." I disliked it, but I'm thrifty; I didn't toss it in the trash. By the 3rd or 4th try, my brain had accepted that this tasted different. I began to appreciate the merits the flavor does have. The texture is different, too. Most mayonnaise seems more whipped (with air in it). This is smoother and creamier. Actually, more like the food prep mayo I used to use when I worked in a deli. I guess another comparison would be with orange drinks. If you grew up on SunnyD Sunny Delight , Orange, 48-Ounce Single Serve Bottles (Pack of 8), than fresh squeezed orange juice would seem completely off the mark. You would, however, come around eventually. Rating: 5.0 Product: Luna Bars, Chocolate Peppermint Stick, 1.69-Ounce Bars (Pack of 15) Review: Pretty standard fare for a Luna Bar, which is pretty much a good thing. Soy crisps laden with pretzel pieces, peanuts, peanut butter smears and peanut butter chips; there is a peanut butter-y sort of candy coating on the bottom portion. If only there were dark chocolate chips or pieces tossed in the mix... I guess I'm just a chocoholic, but the Luna Bar Chocolate Dipped Coconut, 25.4-Ounce, 15-Bars really raised the bar on Luna products for me. All in all, a pretty tasty treat! Rating: 4.0 Product: Luna Bars, Chocolate Peppermint Stick, 1.69-Ounce Bars (Pack of 15) Review: I do the order for a small grocery store. When I saw this flavor in the order guide, I ordered it without hesitation. Luna Bars always sell well, even though I personally am weary of Luna Bars with chocolate in them; the chocolate usually tastes funky, waxy. Once it arrived, I tried one. Soooo good! It's hard to believe that this treat offers health benefits, it's THAT good. It tastes like a macaroon. Heaven. It is now the top selling flavor at the store. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kettle Chips Reduced Fat Sea Salt-Caddy, 1.75-Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: Now, I haven't done a side-by-side comparison, but these chips still taste like the real deal. These snack sized bags do as well as the regular brand at the grocery store I work for. Portion control AND reduced fat? Yes, please! With the Subscribe & Save these are much cheaper than at the grocery store. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kettle Brand Potato Chips, Spicy Thai, 5-Ounce Bags (Pack of 15) Review: These are my favorite, but they aren't for everybody. In a way, they sort of taste like Oriental flavor ramen, but with a kick. For me, how can one go wrong with the combination of jalapeno and ginger? They are a bit rich, so they aren't for EveryDayForAMonth snacking. Because this is a case purchase, I recommend trying out a single bag before buying an entire case. The 2oz size seems to be no longer available, which is a shame; I can eat the entire 5oz bag. Rating: 5.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['bar', 'like', 'nbsp', 'flavor', 'chocolate', 'tea', 'coconut', 'one', 'good', 'store'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Lipton Decaffeinated Green Tea, Superfruit Jasmine Passionfruit with Citrus, 20 Count (Pack of 6) Review: I am a tea drinker. Lately I have been enjoying different flavored teas and herb teas. This tea has a mildly sweat citrus flavor that I enjoy with a hint of a green tea flavor. As I have moved from black teas to flavored teas and herb teas I have learned that the name of a product and the box cover does not always represent the flavor. In this case it does a good job. I get a sweet taste that I assume comes from the jasmine and a slight tangy sweet taste from the citrus. I also get a hint of a green tea flavor as well. The flavors are mild but I have found this to be the case in most teas like this. I actually was concerned the Jasmine might make this too sweet but thankfully it was not. I wish the citrus was a bit stronger but overall this is a good tea. I do like that fact that Lipton cares about the environment and people who work to cultivate tea and lists on the back of the box that the tea is "Rainforest Alliance Certified." I did a search on the web and this means that farms that are "Rainforest Alliance Certified" meet set criteria when it comes to protecting the environment and ensuring employees on the farms are paid a decent wage and have good working conditions. I am neither an expert on the environment nor wage and work criteria but this seems to be a good thing and I feel better drinking a tea like this knowing workers were treated decently and thought was given to protecting the environment. I gave this four stars because I thought the citrus flavor could have been a bit stronger but this is still a good tasting tea. Rating: 4.0 Using the features, generate the proper review. Review:
I love this tea.  I've been drinking it for years.  I don't know why this mint is so much better than any other mint, but it is.  I put sugar and lemon in it, and it's perfect.  I drink it almost every day and I never get tired of it.  Sure, I drink other teas too, but this one is hands down my favorite.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Stash Tea Moroccan Mint Green Tea 20 Count Box of Tea Bags (Pack of 6), Tea Bags Individually Wrapped in Foil (packaging may vary), Medium Caffeine Tea, Green Tea Blended with Mint, Drink Hot or Iced
Review:
This is my "go to" tea.  I love the flavor- it's not exactly the flavor you get in a Moroccan restaurant, but it's very very good.  The mint isn't harsh- which is what I like about moroccan mint.  And if you add lemon to it (and I add a little German rock sugar) it's just amazingly good.  The new Mojito mint by Stash is also great.  I don't like it quite as much as this one, but I drink a ton of tea, and have about 5 favorites- and this and the Mojito are definitely two of the 5 (I also love the Stash organic Chai)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tea,PRINCE VLADIMIR, 20 Muslin Tea Bags (1.55)
Review:
This is very tasty tea.  I wasn't sure I wanted to pay this much for tea- but a friend of mine basically twisted my arm into trying two of these flavors- and darned if she wasn't right.  These are the most delicious teas i've ever had.  They are floral, without being cloying, and they aren't bitter at all.  I get about 3 glasses per tea bag- and the flavor- well it's fantastic.  Hard to describe all the notes- and they change from cup to cup(as you reuse the tea bags new notes emerge).  I want to try all the Kusmi teas now- and if you like tea, you should at least try them.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Stash Tea Organic Gold Cup Chai Herbal Tea with Turmeric 18 Count Tea Bags in Foil (Pack of 6) (Packaging May Vary) Individual Herbal Tea Bags for Use in Teapots Mugs or Cups, Brew Hot Tea or Iced Tea
Review:
This is delicious.  I love that it's healthy, but it's also tasty.  I have used it straight, and I've blended it with plain stash chai.  It is wonderful
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Lindt Chocolate Hazelnut Bar, Milk Chocolate, 25.4  Ounce
Review:
I had not tried these before.  They're a little like Baci.  They're super rich- with a creamy chocolately center surrounding the hazlenuts.  These are bars- it was a little hard to tell from the picture- i wasn't sure what i was getting when I ordered this as a deal of the day.  I'd definitely order this again- the bars are very very tasty.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Stash Tea Organic Chai Black Tea Blend of Organic Black & Green Teas 18 Count Tea Bags in Foil (Pack of 6) (Packaging May Vary) Individual Black Tea Bags for Teapots Mugs or Cups, Brew Hot or Iced Tea
Review:
I love this stuff.  And I love being able to buy it 100 bags at a time.  It's a great solid chai.  It's good iced, with or without milk, and it's great warm.  I think it's very balanced.  With some Chai's one spice predominates in an unpleasant way- that is not the case in my opinion with this chai.  The packages are easy to open, and most of the time the threads are well attached- though I did get one box two deliveries ago in which their seemed to be a defect, and the strings that attached the little paper dipper all came off.  So I had to use a spoon to fish out the tea bags- but it was a small price to pay for great tea at a great price, and it has not happened again.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Pamela's Products Gluten Free Figgies & Jammies Cookies, Mission Fig, 9 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
So much berry flavor.  Delicious moist cookies with fantastic raspberry flavor. My kids love these, and the ingredients are great.  The only downside is you'll want to eat them all.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Choice Organic Northwest Blackberry Tea, 20 Count Box
Review:
Love this stuff.  I mix one of these tea bags with 2 Earl gray and 2 Northcoast Blackberry to make a knockout ice tea.  Obviously it's also very tasty on its own, but I buy it to make the ice tea.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Choice Organic Northwest Blackberry Tea, 20 Count Box
Review:
I'm drinking this right now.  I used two teabags, because I thought maybe that would help.  Not much.  It's very weak in the fragrance department.  There's quite a lot of bitterness too- it's more bitter than my other Jasmine tea which is much more fragrant.  I won't buy this again.  Normally I love Choice tea, but this one is a disappointment.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Lindt Excellence Bar, 70% Cocoa Smooth Dark Chocolate, Gluten Free, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: I am a huge fan of coconut. This candy bar is one of my favorite coconut treats. It is not disgustingly sweet, rather it has a delicate coconut flavor. Normally, I dislike white chocolate but with the coconut, this candy bar is amazing. The consistency and intensity of the bar is not like a mounds bar. This is an actual candy bar with no filling. The coconut flavor is melded with the chocolate. The bar is fairly large. I typically take three to four days to eat one bar - the restraint is hard, but at 240 calories a serving restraint is necessary. Flecks of this bar are great on ice cream but also in thicker, warmer beverages. Rating: 5.0 Product: Nature's Path Organic Chewy Granola Bars, Sunny Hemp Plus, 7.4 Ounce Box (Pack of 6) Review: I love this bar and that is probably because I love any treat that combines peanuts and chocolate. I don't consider this a health bar. This has a good amount of sugar and a good amount of fat. I eat them because they are a great cheat treat. When I eat well all day, I look forward to this soft but chewy bar that has real peanuts and what seems to be real chocolate (I detest bars that proclaim to have real chocolate but instead incorporate a fake chocolaty substance). What I like about this bar: 1) The taste - Wow! For a granola bar the taste is phenomenal. The picture on the box does not lie. You can see peanuts and oats and the chocolate topping tastes awesome. The texture of the oats/nuts melds well with the oats and nuts. 2) Portable and easy to pack - If you try to stay aware of your daily calorie intake, it is always great to have easy to carry snacks with their calories clearly labeled. Who has time to count out the exact number of pretzels that comprise 150 calories? That is part of the appeal of a granola bar. You've got a 150 calorie food item that can be placed in a purse or coat pocket and you are out the door. 3) The company has made a conscious effort to reduce packaging in order to reduce impact on the environment. The box is made of 100% recycled materials. What is questionable about this bar: 1) This is a snack/treat bar and nothing else - This is not a healthful nutrition bar. The product packaging does not necessarily say this is healthful. It does use the words "organic goodness" and boasts "9 grams of whole grains". These notations may make some think this is a really healthy treat. But it's not. The bar has low fiber (2g) and pretty high sugar for a 150 calorie bar (11 grams). 2)If you use snacks to hold you over, you probably should find a snack with at least 4 grams of fiber. The 2 gram bar is not going to tide you over very long. If you feed these to your kids, there is a good likelihood they will like them. They are pretty sweet. But again with the sugar, what else are you giving your kids during the day? Four grams of sugar is equivalent to 1 teaspoon of sugar. So you have about 2 and 3/4 teaspoons in this bar. With everything else your kids consume during the day, (chocolate milk? orange juice? sandwich with jam?), the sugar in this bar may not be worth it to you. Kids usually need 1200 to 1700 calories a day. While there is no prescribed amount of sugar for a kid during the day, I have read that the calories from added sugar should be limited to 10% which, on the low end, would translate to 7 teaspoons of sugar and 11 teaspoons on the high end. Summary: Nature's Path has created a very tasty granola bar with quality ingredients. Props to the company for not saying this was a health or nutrition bar on the box. I am reviewing this as a treat bar and as a treat, it is a delicious option. If it were being reviewed for health, I would not be able to give it four stars as it has high sugar, high fat and low fiber. Don't expect it to hold you over for hours but do expect it to satisfy your sweet tooth. These granola bars are made in the United States. Rating: 4.0 Product: Banana Nut Cheerios Cereal, 10.9 Ounce (Pack of 4) Review: I love plain cheerios but sometimes a little cheerio diversity is called for. The banana nut flavor is not overly sweet and there is a distinctive banana taste, almost a slightly burnt banana taste. I love pairing a bowl of these cheerios with so delicious coconut milk and sliced banana pieces. The combination of the three easily keep me satiated from breakfast until lunch. I occasionally mix this banana nut flavor with chocolate cheerios for an even sweeter, exceptional treat. While I do not find the banana nut flavor to be overly sweet, one should not overlook that sugar is the second ingredient for this food and, the sugar content is relatively high -- especially for frequent use by children. Four grams of sugar is equivalent to 1 teaspoon of sugar. So you have about 2 and 1/4 teaspoons in a single 3/4 cup serving of banana nut cheerios. With everything else your kids consume during the day, (chocolate milk? orange juice? sandwich with jam?), the sugar in this cereal may be high for frequent consumption. Kids usually need 1200 to 1700 calories a day. While there is no prescribed amount of sugar for a kid during the day, I have read that the calories from added sugar should be limited to 10% which, on the low end, would translate to 7 teaspoons of sugar and 11 teaspoons on the high end. If you child is getting 2 and 1/4 teaspoons with this cereal, your child has consumed a fair amount of sugar for the morning. When paired with fresh bananas, this cereal can be filling but if limiting sugar for your kids (or your own meals), you might want to use sparingly. Rating: 4.0 Product: Wolfgang Puck Organic Signature Butternut Squash Soup, 14.5 oz. (Pack of 12) Review: This is a good soup -- there is no doubt. The corn, carrots and potatoes are plentiful (no skimping on ingredients in the cans I've tried). Together, the ingredients make a thick and hearty soup that is perfect for a cold winter day. I did not feel the need to add salt -- the corn is not bland in flavor and the soup already has a lot of sodium. Moreover, I felt no need to add crackers. The soup can hold its own. Some posters have noted that this soup has a high level of fat. It does -- 13g per one cup serving. Fat, of course, is not bad in moderation. In my quest for the perfect corn soup, however, I have found an alternative option. It is worth noting here for those who may have particular dietary considerations. Imagine foods makes an organic sweet corn soup that has 3g of fat per 1 cup serving. The soup comes in a boxed container and is just a corn base. There are no special flavorings. As a base, it is a good corn soup but when you add several cups of frozen corn kernels (and cooked potatoes if you have the time and desire), you can have a soup just as hearty and delicious as Wolfgang Pucks but with less fat and calories. This option does require about five minutes more of your time (if only adding frozen corn). Wolfgang Puck's soup is quick -- in two minutes you have a steaming bowl of great corn soup and you don't have to wait for kernels to thaw. If you are not looking closely at fat (or eat fat it in moderation) and want something quick, this soup is great. If you are looking for a healthy alternative, I would take a little more time and build a hearty soup using the organic sweet corn soup from Imagine. Rating: 4.0 Product: Pacific Natural Foods All Natural Chipotle Sweet Potato Soup, 17 Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) Review: First, I typically love products produced by Pacific Natural Foods. This was not a winner in my book. The smell was the first thing that turned me off. I had to wait five minutes to even try the soup because it smelled so awful. When I tasted it, the spices used were overpowering and it was difficult to taste any sweet potato. What I could taste reminded me of curry and it seems like the soup could be married well with rice. Unfortunately as the soup is now, it would be too runny to pour over rice. I suppose a person could add some sweet potato and regular potatoes to make it thicker. I drowned the soup with saltines and it was edible but not enjoyable. I'm giving it two stars because I think with modifications it could be used for different non-soup purposes. Better luck next time Pacific. Rating: 2.0 Product: Artisana Macadamia/Cashew Butter (100% Organic), 8-Ounce Packages (Pack of 2) Review: After trying Artisana's Cacao Bliss, I wanted to sample some of the manufacturer's other products. I really enjoy macademia nuts and thought the Macadamia with Cashews butter would be a good product to try. This product is made with just two ingredients -- macadamias and cashews -- and I can say that this product demonstrates what a healthy, good for you food should taste like. Unlike Cacao Bliss, which is a solid product at room temperature, the macadamia cashew butter is easily retrieved from the container. There was some oil separation but after a little stirring, one can take a butter knife and quickly spread the substance on a piece of toast or apple slices; the product is incredibly smooth out of the jar. When looking at the butter, you will see little pieces of nuts which makes this product product have some texture. This macadamia cashew butter is not as chunky as most chunky peanut butters; the chunks in this product are much finer. I found the flavor to be very much influenced by the raw cashews and actually considered my jar to be more of a cashew butter than a macadamia butter. It is recommended that this product be refrigerated for a longer life. While not noted explicitly on the product's label, I could see nothing that would contradict my belief that this is a vegan product. There is no milk, honey, eggs or other animal-based substances that go into the formulation of this product. According to the product packaging, this product is "made in a facility that processes tree nuts and soy, but does not process peanuts, gluten, dairy, cholesterol or GMO's." This is my second good experience with Artisana products. For holiday gift giving, I'm definitely going to be packaging several of Artisana's products in gift baskets. They are tasty, natural and unique. A note on another place to buy this product, iherb.com. I turn to iherb with frequency to purchase Artisana products. The site has free shipping over a certain threshold and offers thousands upon thousands of natural and organic food products. If interested in trying iherb, you can use my code LEK375 for a five or ten dollar discount depending on order size. This product is made in the United States Rating: 4.0 Product: Crystal Light Drink Mix - MARGARITA, 1.62 oz. (Pack of 6) Review: My husband and I drink a good amount of Crystal Light powdered beverages. I was initially leery of purchasing this particular flavor but after trying Crystal Light Moctails Mojito, 1.41-Ounce (Pack of 4) and finding it great, I thought I would give this one a try. In terms of flavor, I find this acceptable. It tastes like a very mild margarita (without alcohol). It even smells like a margarita. While I think Crystal Light has done a good job imitating a margarita, it is not my favorite Crystal Light product. If you live near a Meijer, you can buy a five pack canister of the Margarita drink mix (as well as Crystal Light Mocktails Appletini, 1.69-Ounce (Pack of 4) and Crystal Light Moctails Mojito, 1.41-Ounce (Pack of 4)) for about 2.79. If you recycle your plastics, be aware that Crystal Light sells its product in a #5 container. Unless you live in a relatively progressive place, #5 plastics are typically very difficult to recycle. Whole Foods engages in a recycling initiative to collect #5 plastics but if you don't live near one and you care about recycling, these can be a challenging item to deal with. At the end of the day, this is a beverage that I would drink again but I don't know if I would purchase it if some of my other Crystal Light favorites were available like Crystal Light Sunrise Ruby Red Grapefruit, 3.4-Ounce Unit (Pack of 6) and Crystal Light Moctails Mojito, 1.41-Ounce (Pack of 4). Rating: 4.0 Product: Nutiva Organic Chips, Coconut, 1 Pound, 16 Ounce Review: I, too, was thrown off by the name of this product. When I saw the words "coconut chips", I envisioned something like baking chips that were coconut flavored and could be used in the place of chocolate chips. Not so. These flakes are just larger versions of regular shredded coconut but not nearly as sweet. They have great utility in the kitchen. Here are some things I have used them for: 1. Fruit salad with coconut flakes - Cut your favorite fruit (strawberries, mangoes, blueberries, etc) and add some coconut chips, a drizzle of agave or honey, and some walnuts. Yum! 2. Vegan "bacon" bites: You can toss these coconut chips with liquid smoke and other spices to create vegan bacon bites for salads. There are many recipes online. Once the coconut chips are tossed with the various flavorings, the chips are baked for a bit to become crisp. The bites are a great substitute for croutons. 3. Coconut no-bake cookies: If you want to avoid tedious baking, cookies that can be whipped up without the assistance of an oven are always wonderful. Instead of peanut butter or chocolate no-bake cookies, try a coconut no-bake cookie. 4. Coconut chips: While the pieces of this product are small, I have made some cinnamon coconut chips that are perfect for snacking. Simply toss chips with cinnamon, salt, and oil. Spread the pieces out on a pan. Bake at 350 degrees for several minutes until crispy. It is pretty much the same process as the vegan bacon bites mentioned in #2 save with different toppings. Give this product a try! Rating: 4.0 Product: Luna Bars, Chocolate Peppermint Stick, 1.69-Ounce Bars (Pack of 15) Review: Of all of the Luna Bar flavors, the Chocolate Peppermint Stick is my favorite. It is very minty and easily chewable. You don't have to worry about breaking a tooth when you try to eat it. The bar is dipped in peppermint on one side; the overall chocolate and peppermint is very reminiscent of a peppermint patty. If I had not looked at the wrapper, I would be able to say this was meant to be a peppermint bar (try doing that with other protein/meal replacement/nutrition bars that claim to be peanut butter flavored or brownie flavored and they taste nothing like their inspiration.) There is also no vitamin taste. Overall, the bar is pretty filling and could hold you over between meals. As it has less than 200 calories, it can be classified as a snack. I like to eat one of these bars after dinner as a treat and also keep them in my office when I can't leave for lunch. In sum, if you like chocolate and peppermint, try this bar. Rating: 5.0 Product: Crystal Light Drink Mix, Lemon Iced Tea, Pitcher Packets, 4 Count (Pack of 4 Canisters) Review: My husband and I drink a good amount of Crystal Light powdered beverages. I was initially very leery of purchasing this particular flavor. The combination, particularly for a powder based beverage, sounded like a disaster in the making. In the end, I can say that it was better than expected. In terms of flavor, I think a kid (or the kid at heart) would enjoy this more than an adult. Some notes on flavor, color, and packaging: Flavor: Compared to other Crystal Light beverages, the flavor of strawberry orange banana is actually quite complex. You can taste each of those flavors in the beverage. While a fine combination of flavors, something about it screams "kid". It is just not what I would serve to a fellow adult on a hot day. Color: Like many of the flavors in the Crystal Light Light, the Strawberry Orange Banana is a rather vibrant color once mixed; it is a deep pink color. It looks very artificial (which, admittedly, this beverage is). If color is important to you, Crystal Light does have some subtlety colored options. For example, Crystal Light Moctails Mojito, 1.41-Ounce (Pack of 4) looks like cloudy water but tastes like mint and lime. Packaging: One negative with all of the Crystal Light products relates to packaging. First, the container is a #5 plastic. Unless you live in a relatively progressive place, #5 plastics are typically very difficult to recycle. I know Whole Foods engages in a recycling initiative to collect #5 plastics but if you don't live near one and you care about recycling, these can be a challenging item to deal with. Additionally, if you like Crystal Light, it can be very easy to go through these containers quickly. Some Crystal Light flavors, like the strawberry orange banana, have six packets and others have five. The container could hold more flavor packets, which would reduce the overall number of containers that the user has to dispose of. Overall, a fine beverage that is encased in packaging that is not very green. If you are looking for a more adult option, I would suggest Crystal Light Moctails Mojito, 1.41-Ounce (Pack of 4),Crystal Light Ruby Red Grapefruit Drink Mix (10-Quart), 3.4-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4), or Crystal Light Pink Lemonade Drink Mix (8-Quart), 1.9-Ounce Canisters (Pack of 4). 3.5 - 4 stars Rating: 4.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['product', 'tea', 'chocolate', 'flavor', 'like', 'bar', 'would', 'good', 'one', 'sugar'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. golds.output: I was a bit skeptical about trying a new nut butter, but I'm so glad I gave this Cracked Nut Butter Unroasted Pecan Plus Almond Butter Dessert Spread a chance.  The Brownie Batter flavor sounded intriguing, and I love both pecans and almonds, so I thought this might be a winner.  I was pleased to see that the ingredient list was relatively short and free of artificial additives.  The texture of the spread is smooth and creamy, and the flavor is rich and decadent--it really does taste like brownie batter!  I've been enjoying it on toast, crackers, and even

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Oreo Red Velvet Sandwich Cookies, 10.7 Ounce Review: I never purchase cookies--it's just my husband and I, and we don't need the temptation--but I do love Oreos, and I also love red velvet cake, so I couldn't resist trying this new release. Unfortunately, the flavor was extremely disappointing. First of all, the cookie part didn't really taste like anything. Red velvet, like Devil's food, is a type of CHOCOLATE, and there was very little chocolate flavor in these cookies. Next, the filling was describe on the package as "cream cheese flavored creme." It tasted nothing at all like the unique flavor of sweetened cream cheese, which is tangy without being overly sweet; instead, this filling was just a super-sweet cream. Honestly if I was going to splurge on something, I wish I had just purchased regular Oreos, because these were not worth it at all. I hope my co-workers like them, because they will be getting the leftovers. Although they are edible as a sweet, cream-filled store-bought cookie, I certainly don't recommend these as a red velvet treat. Rating: 2.0 Product: HERSHEY'S Nuggets Holiday Chocolate Candy, Milk Chocolate w/Toffee & Almonds, 60 Ounce Bulk Bag Review: I am usually someone who prefers dark chocolate--I like the richness of the dark chocolate, and I find some milk chocolates too artificial tasting. This Hershey variety is definitely an exception. It is labelled "Extra Creamy" milk chocolate, and it's true--although sweeter than dark chocolate, these nuggets are definitely more creamy than the standard milk chocolate. The little toffee bits--along with the crushed almonds--add a delicious bit of extra sweetness and crunch. Four of these little nuggets makes a single serving, which is a reasonable amount of calories at 200, but a bit high in fat, carbs, and sugar for me (13g, 21g, and 20g, respectively). So, I just eat two nuggets at a time for a yummy little 100 calorie treat. If you enjoy a toffee (or caramel, since I think it's quite similar) flavor, I would definitley recommend these nuggets and this generous 60-ounce bag. Rating: 5.0 Product: ZonePerfect Nutrition Snack Bars, Chocolate Almond Raisin. 1.76 oz, (12 Count) Review: I am always looking for nutrition snack bars that will help me refuel after workouts, curb between meal hunger pangs, and hopefully, taste great, too! I was encourged by the nutritional profile of the Zone Perfect bar, and I decided to give the Fudge Graham variety a try. This bar comes in at 210 calories, with 7 grams of fat (4 saturated, 0 trans), 21 grams carbs, 1 gram fiber, and an excellent 16 grams protein. The Fudge Gramam flavor has a nice texture--sort of like a Rice Crispie treat--and is covered in a fudge coating, but this had a bit of an artificial taste to me. In addition, I didn't detect any graham flavor, which I found disappointing. The bar did taste good, but I've also had better (the Pria Complete Peanut Butter Crunch are really delicious!), and I would've liked to see more fiber as well. Overall, this is not a bad choice, but keep in mind that there may be better options available. Rating: 3.0 Product: Pressed by KIND Fruit Bars, Mango Apple Chia, No Sugar Added, Gluten Free, 1.2oz, 12 Count Review: I thought these bars would be a good way to help me get in more fruit and vegetable servings--I like pineapple, bananas, kale, and spinach, so win-win, right? Well, in reality, not so much. The first thing that you notice upon opening these bars is that not only do they look like molded spinach, but also they SMELL very strongly of spinach, too. Now, as I said, I LIKE spinach, and normally, I don't mind the scent of it at all. However, it is much different in bar form! The bar does taste significantly fruity, so if I can sort of hold my breath and get past the smell, I can manage to eat it, although obviously, this is not ideal. The other issue I have with these bars is that the spinach/kale gets stuck between your teeth VERY easily, even worse than eating the fresh version of this items. So in the end, these bars are really NOT worth it to me, which is too bad, as they could have been a nutritious, convenient snack. Rating: 3.0 Product: Nature Valley Chewy Granola Bars, Vanilla Yogurt, 1.2 oz, 6-Count Boxes (Pack of 12) Review: I wasn't sure if I would like these granola bars; although I like yogurt, I didn't really like the idea of a yogurt coating. However, my niece's love of the bars encouraged me to try them for myself, and I was pleasantly surprised to discover that they are delicious! The granola part is sweet and chewy, and the additional sweetness of the yogurt is a perfect compliment. I've tried all the flavors but like the vanilla the best, as the others were a bit TOO sweet for my liking. If you are a fan of granola bars and yogurt, you are likely to enjoy this winning combination. Rating: 5.0 Product: Eat. Think. Smile. Baked Nutrition Bar, Orange Cranberry, 1.8-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12) Review: I was excited to try this product, as I usually have bars for breakfast, but it is getting harder to find ones that have good nutritional profiles in breakfast-appropriate (i.e., non-chocolate) flavors. I love cranberry, so this bar seemed nearly perfect, especially given that I checked out the nutritional content prior to ordering. At 4 grams, the amount of protein was a bit low for my liking, but the bar made up for this by being low in both sugar (12 grams) and saturated fat (1 gram) while being very high in fiber (7 grams). The texture of this bar is the first thing that struck me as a bit odd. Although it is moist (i.e., as opposed to hard and crunchy), it is not chewy; in fact, it breaks apart easily and is a bit on the crumbly side. (I suppose it is somewhat similar to a a CLIF brand bar.) The taste, however, was quite disappointing: rather than the tart taste of cranberry or the sweetness of orange, I detected only a bitter flavor. It tasted almost as if the bar had been flavored with the bitter rind of the orange. There did seem to be little fruit pieces in the bar that may have been cranberry, but unfortunately, the unpleasant bitterness overpowered everything else. I thought the first bar that I tried was just okay, but the second one seemed worse, and now I'm afraid I might have to toss the whole box (which I HATE to do--I hate being wasteful, so I might try dipping them in yogurt or something just to get through them). Perhaps another flavor by this brand would be better, but unfortunately, I can't recommend these. Rating: 2.0 Product: FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz Review: I consider nuts one of the most healthy things you can eat--I keep them on hand for snacks, salads, meal throw-ins, whatever! I typically buy store brand unsalted peanuts, so I was interested to see how these low-salt peanuts from Fisher would compare. The combination of dry roasting and sea salt gives these nuts an almost seasoned taste--they are delicious! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them. Rating: 5.0 Product: Luna Bars, Chocolate Peppermint Stick, 1.69-Ounce Bars (Pack of 15) Review: I like Luna bars, but because I tend to eat them mostly for breakfast, I usually stick more with the fruit-flavored bars (I especially like their Luna Nutrition Bars, Blueberry Bliss, 1.69-Ounce Bars (Pack of 15) and Luna Bars, Iced Oatmeal Raisin, 1.69-Ounce Bars (Pack of 15)). In addition, I tend to avoid protein bars covered in chocolate, as I have found that the chocolate often tastes quite artificial. However, I received a free sample of this Chocolate Dipped Coconut bar, so I gave it a try. I am pleased to report that this bar was delicious! The chocolate/coconut blend is quite reminiscent of the flavor of a Mounds chocolate bar and not artificial tasting at all--rather, it was rich and chewy, with no unpleasant aftertaste. In addition, the nutrition profile of this bar is comparable to other Luna bars: 190 calories, 7 grams fat (a bit high, but only 3.5 grams saturated, and no trans fats), 25 grams total carbs, including 3 grams fiber and only 11 grams of sugar, and 9 grams of protein. Furthermore, the bar is fortified with various vitamins and minerals, from 35% of daily recommendation for Calcium to good amounts of most of the B vitamins. This is definitely a bar that I would purchase on my own--highly recommended! Rating: 5.0 Product: FISHER Snack Mixed Nuts with Peanuts, Stand-Up Bag, Gluten Free, 5.5 oz Review: This mixed nuts product definitely lives up to the name, with a nice distribution of cashews, almonds, walnuts, and brazil nuts. If anything, I found that there were more of the former two, which worked out perfectly for me, as I especially love cashews and almonds! I would have preferred plain roasted nuts without the added oil and salt, but still, this is a good product overall. I would recommend this mixed nut collection, although the price seems a bit high to me as compared to similar offerings by other brands. Rating: 4.0 Product: FISHER Chef's Naturals Slivered Almonds, No Preservatives, Non-GMO, 2 oz (Pack of 12) Review: I love keeping sliced/chopped nuts around, as I think they are one of the most nutritious foods available--not only are they a natural plant product, but also they are packed with protein and healthy fats! This HUGE bag of Fisher Natural Sliced Almonds provides you with plenty of bang for your buck. The stand-up bag is resealable, which is very convenient. The almonds are delicious eaten straight out of the bag or tossed on salads and other dishes. I also toasted them in the oven--yum, smells like popcorn and tastes even better! Next I'll be using them in baking. I highly recommend this product for both taste and convenience.
