I've tried other dried banana products before, but this one is definitely my favorite. The flavor is natural and delicious,

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Natural Nectar Cracklebred, Sun Dried Tomato and Oregano, Gluten Free, 3.5-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I love these crackers!  I'm new to gluten free, and have not tried many gluten free products. I don't know how these compare to other gluten free crackers.  But I do know that they are as good or better than any regular cracker I've tried.  Cracklebred crackers are light and airy, but very crispy.  They are a little delicate but still hold up under a gentle spread of hummus.  This variety is flavored with sun dried tomato and oregano, but I honestly did not pick up on those flavors.  I thought they tasted slightly savory, but I still enjoyed them with a spread of blueberry jam.  Each cracker contains just 17 calories so they are guilt free.  Yum :)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
ORCHARD VALLEY HARVEST Cranberry Almond Cashew Trail Mix, Non-GMO, No Artificial Ingredients, 1 oz (Pack of 8)
Review:
I like the mix of fruits and nuts in this package of Orchard Valley Harvest mix. The walnuts, almonds, pistachios, and cranberries all taste very fresh. The package that I received in January expires in November of the same year. Each packet holds 1 ounce of snacks and it's just enough to hit the spot as a snack. Very lightly salted with sea salt, each packet contains just 15mg of sodium.

I immediately noticed that the contents of each packet are not consistent with each other. Every package contains at least one piece of the variety. The amount of pistachios and almonds varies widely. In half of the 8 packets, there was only 1 pistachio. Most of the remaining packets had 2 pistachios, although one package had 5 of the little green nuts. Almonds also varied from 2 to 5 nuts. Some packages had a higher ratio of cranberries to nuts. I attached 2 images showing 2 different opened packages.

The cranberries are sweetened with sugar, not HFCS, and also contain a small amount of expeller pressed sunflower oil to keep them soft. There is additional oil added to the mixture, but I'm not sure why. Maybe to keep the nuts from drying out? Sunflower oil is not a good source of ALA, containing only 1% ALA. Regardless, there isn't enough to make my hands feel too oily.

Each package contains about half of your daily recommended amount of alpha linolenic acid (ALA) not to be confused with the other ALA, alpha lipoic acid. This Omega 3 fatty acid is found in nuts and other plant foods.

Overall, I really like this snack! It's satisfying and tastes great, and I know that I'm not eating something I shouldn't. I would easily add these to my shopping list.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Crunchy Coconut Granola, 18 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I bought this because I love coconut, and the ingredient label looked simple and healthy compared to most other brands of granola.  I was glad that I tried this product and really love it.  The coconut flavor is very delicate, though, it was not as intense as I had hoped.  Still, the flavor is very good.  It does contain sugar, but the 4 grams of sugar per serving is low compared to other granola brands.  I also appreciate that this is not a hard granola, so it's easy to eat.  It's just crispy enough so that it holds up under milk.  I like it with Almond Breeze brand coconut milk.  Delicious!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Rhythm Superfoods Kale Chips, Variety Pack, Original/Zesty Nacho/Kool Ranch/Mango Habanero, Organic and Non-GMO, 2 Oz (Pack of 4), Vegan/Gluten-Free Superfood Snacks
Review:
I already love kale chips, and usually make them from scratch. These are very different in texture, but I really did enjoy them. This is the first time that I've tasted a flavored kale chip, and I love them. I brought the package to work and we shared it, and everyone that tried these kool ranch kale chips liked them, even Miss Picky. The bag didn't last long! They were crispy and tasty, and were not too salty. They only contain 220mg sodium per serving (half a bag) which surprised me since similar products usually contain more. The serving contains 140 calories and 6 grams of protein. Kale is loaded with vitamins, so it's a sneaky way to slip in some nutrients.  Although I loved the flavor, I was less than enthused about the clumps of kale chips that were stuck together due to the seasoning. They were tasty, but it was easy to get greedy with the clumps and leave the little bits and pieces for my coworkers to taste. The next time I get these kale chips, I'll try adding the leftover crumbs to a salad to add flavor to my lunch. And there will be a next time! I'll still make plain kale chips from scratch, but I can't make flavored chips to taste like this.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Colavita Instant Polenta Cornmeal, 16 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
This polenta is delicious! It really does cook up properly in just 5 minutes. It has good flavor and the texture is good. I always cook it with a little less water, then pour it into a pan to make polenta squares. I can grill them or saute in a pan. They freeze well, so I can pull out just enough for dinner. This was my first experience with a quick cooking polenta. I have always taken the time to make old fashioned polenta, and it is worth the effort. But for an instant product, the Colavita polenta works out very well.

Someone else mentioned that this polenta is non-GMO, but the box didn't reflect that. I contacted the company and verified that it is indeed non-GMO, which makes it an even better choice for many people.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Rishi Tea Organic Black Tea, Earl Grey Loose Tea, 3.3-Ounce Tin (Pack of 3)
Review:
Earl Grey Tea can be overwhelming. Generally, when an Earl Grey calls itself "Bold", they aren't joking. Personally, if there is too much bergamot oil in the tea, it is too overpowering for me to drink. I like to drink an aromatic tea, not a cup of perfume. The Rishi Earl Grey tea is described as "bold and sweetly smooth with an enlivening aroma of bergamot citrus." I think that sums it up very well. I was a little concerned when I popped the lid on the tin, as the scent was very powerful.  However, it is a pleasant smelling tea that does not overwhelm me when the cup reaches the mouth. I can taste a high quality, rich black tea with sweet and lightly citrus tones.

I also feel good about drinking this tea because it is a Fair Trade Certified tea that is shade grown from heirloom tea trees. It's organic as well as Kosher. Rishi also says this tea can be steeped multiple times, so this tea is also very economical. I'll definitely be trying more Rishi teas.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nutiva Organic Coconut Flour, 4 Pound
Review:
I really enjoy Nutiva coconut flour. It always smells fresh and it tastes wonderful.  I had been buying it in 3 pound bags that were clear plastic and did not zip close. I had to transfer them to containers that blocked the light. I like the new package since it blocks light and helps keep it fresh. The zipper was a little tricky to close, but it works.  I mainly use this coconut flour in morning smoothies to add texture and a big boost of fiber. I've used other brands that had a finer texture, but this one is fine for my purposes and it's often more affordable than others. It can be used in baking if you use it as a substitute for a small amount of the grain flour in your recipe, but it doesn't stand alone as a replacement. I've bought this several times and hope to continue using it in the future.  FYI the bag I just received has an expiration date of one year away.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
FISHER Chef's Naturals Slivered Almonds, No Preservatives, Non-GMO, 2 oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
These almonds are very tasty. They have a natural sweetness to them and the almond flavor really comes through, so they seem very fresh to me. The condition of the almonds is excellent, the bag didn't contain broken nuts. They are crunchy, but not dried out, so they chew easily. I've tasted many almonds that didn't have much flavor to them. Not the case with this bag of Fisher almonds! I like them a lot. I won't rate based on the price, since the price can fluctuate widely online. Plus these nuts are also sold in local stores. I tried to find out if these almonds are steam pasteurized or gassed, but didn't have any luck. If I find out, I'll update this review since that matters to some consumers. Overall, these are good nuts.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Lotus Foods Gourmet Organic Madagascar Pink Rice, 11-Pound Bag
Review:
You'd think you can't go wrong with a basic staple like rice, right?  Unfortunately, I was disappointed with this rice.  Lotus Foods Madagascar Pink Rice was described as having a hint of spice flavor such as cinnamon or clove.  I didn't pick up on that in the slightest.  In fact, this rice had very little flavor at all.  I normally buy brown basmati rice, or Lotus Foods Forbidden Rice which are fantastic all by themselves.  Those rices can be enjoyed without a speck of salt or other seasoning added.  The Madagascar Pink can't begin to compare.

I wish this had been available in a small package instead of an 11 pound sack.  I read the full description on the Lotus Foods website and I liked the idea of this rice.  The Amazon subscription price was a great deal, so I went for it.  I'll still eat the rice, of course, but it will be served in recipes that don't depend on the rice for flavor like other whole grain rices provide.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
BUMBLE BEE Sensations Sun-Dried Tomato and Basil Seasoned Tuna with Crackers, High Protein Food, Gluten Free Food, High Protein Snacks, Canned Food, Bulk Snacks, 3.6 Ounce Packages (Pack of 12)
Review:
This tuna kit is very convenient and is a great quick meal or snack while on the road or at the office. The contents are held securely by the outer packaging, so nothing will get broken or dinged. It even comes with a little plastic spreader to make it easier to eat. The amount is small, but it's just the right amount for a quick snack when you need a little energy. It's not something you would buy to keep in the kitchen since larger boxes of crackers and tins of tuna are much more affordable. However, it's perfect for what it is - a quick bite when you are away from home.  The tuna flavor is pleasant enough. The lemon pepper seasoning is mild and the tuna has a good texture. The crackers are fresh and crispy.
Rating:
4.0

Broadway Basketeers Thinking of You Gift Set

golds.output:
I have been a fan of Heinz ketchup for as long as I can remember and I use it on just about everything from scrambled eggs to French fries and even as an ingredient in my homemade meatloaf. I like this Easy Squeeze bottle as it is easy to use and it is a great addition to my kitchen. It is also a great size for my family as we use a lot of ketchup.

It tastes good and has the right amount of sweetness and tanginess to it. I love it as my favorite ketchup and I recommend it to you.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Heinz 57 Sauce, 20-Ounce Squeeze Bottle (Pack of 4) Review: I have liked this sauce for as long as I can remember. I use it on steaks, chops, chicken and even to eat French fries or tater tots. I even use it as a basting sauce for sausages or meat on the grill. I like some steaks plain but this sauce just adds zing to any kind of meat. Sometimes I mix in some Frank's Red Hot sauce to even make it hotter to use when grilling out. It is also a great addition to barbeque wings mixed with Buffalo Sauce. We also pressure cook pork or beef and shred it for pulled meat sandwiches and this flavor just sets it off. * Ribs * Sausage * Steaks * Shrimp * Hamburger for tacos * Hamburger sandwiches * French fries, onion rings or tater tots * Chicken wings * It has 100's of uses It does contain a lot of salt at 200 mg and 8% of your daily allotment for just one tablespoon. It also has 4 grams of sugar. I love it as my favorite steak sauce and I recommend it to you. Rating: 5.0 Product: Starbucks Pike's Place Kcups-Medium Roast, 0.44 oz, 16 ct Review: Even though this is a medium roast blend of coffee it has the traditional rich, bold and full bodied Starbuck's flavor and aroma. I drink my coffee with sweet and low and creamer in it and a cup of this coffee is tasty and satisfying. I blend the large cup serving of 9.5 ounces and it is just the right strength for me. This is an excellent coffee and I recommend it to you. I have posted a photo for your information. Rating: 5.0 Product: Knorr Pasta Sides, Beef 4.3 oz Review: My wife and I cook for only the two of us and we have found these Knorr side dishes to be just right to go along with our dinner meal. They taste good and they are easy to prepare quickly. My wife likes fettuccini and we add parmesan cheese to jazz up the flavor and make it taste a little richer. It is good with pork chops or chicken for example. The package makes 2 servings and that is just right for us. Each serving has 290 calories after being prepared and only 2 sugars which is important for us. I like the product for its ease of preparation, fast cooking and good taste. I rated it at 4 stars. This is just the right size to prepare for 2 people for dinner, we like it. It is fast and easy to fix! This is a pretty good little side for not a lot of work or cooking time. We liked it a lot. Rating: 4.0 Product: Dei Fratelli Pizza Sauce - All Natural - No Water Added - Never from Tomato Paste - 5th Generation Recipe (15 oz. cans; 12 pack) Review: We like to make homemade pizzas and we have found this sauce to be of excellent taste and quality. It is very thick and slightly sweet with the right amount of spice in it for an excellent tasting home pizza. I have included photographs of the can and nutrition label for your information. It tastes good and makes a better pizza than the other brands we have used. We rate this product as a 5 star product. It sells for about $1.50 a can so you may have to look around for the right price and shipping costs. It is a great product. Rating: 5.0 Product: Chef Paul Magic Seasoning Blends Herbal Pizza and Pasta MagicBtls - 3 oz Review: This pizza and pasta seasoning is just what it says it is, MAGIC! It provides the right blend of spices for your Italian cooking and it is great when mixed into pizza or pasta sauce, meatballs, or any dish. The wonderful thing about it is that it adds no calories, no fat, no salt, no carbohydrates and no MSG to your food. It also contains no preservatives. It is also very good for soups, salads, egg dishes and almost any casserole. There are some very good recipes on his web site and I like the breakfast pizza, it is pretty good. We love this product and as I write this review I see that we are almost out of it so it is time to buy some more! I recommend it to you. Rating: 5.0 Product: Dreamfields Pasta Healthy Carb Living - Elbows - 13.25 ounces Review: My family likes pasta in all forms but some of us have to watch how much we eat as it can be bad on your blood sugar levels. We started using this brand of pasta and it does reduce our sugar levels when compared to using regular pasta. I love this elbow pasta in our chili and as the cold weather has shown up we just had a pot of it last week. It has a great taste and it is a good source of fiber. Each serving has 190 calories and it contains 5 grams of dietary fiber per serving. Using this pasta has helped us to still be able to enjoy our favorite foods in moderation and still be careful of our carbohydrates. Using Dreamfield's calculations they claim that their glycemic index is 13 versus regular pasta with an index of 38. I can only judge that my blood sugar is lower when we eat this pasta when compared to others. Like everything else you have to eat this in moderation. This is a good product and I recommend it to you. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kitchen Basics Beef Stock, 32 Fl Oz Review: We love a lot of dishes with gravy, broth or sauces. Yesterday my wife made a large homemade batch of chicken and egg noodles. Many times you don't get enough broth and you have to add more as the egg noodles soak up a lot of the broth. She likes this Kitchen Basics Cooking Stock as she can get it in the unsalted version. She adds this into the chicken and WOW does it help to make a great dinner! This is even good the next day to add in more broth to warm up your leftovers. It is much better than using water and it doesn't dilute the flavor of your meal. We like this broth a lot and we recommend it to you as a 5 star product. Rating: 5.0 Product: Special K Cereal Cinnamon Pecan, 12.1 oz Review: This is an excellent tasting cereal and my wife and I enjoy it for breakfast. We both love the taste of cinnamon and the added pecans just make it taste better. It is only 110 calories for the cereal and only 7 sugars. It is healthier than most cereals with a good taste. I included a photo shot of the nutritional side panel for your information. Rating: 5.0 Product: 4 Oz Glass Shaker - Cherrywood Smoked Sea Salt Review: This is one of many gourmet salts that are available from the San Francisco Salt Company that are really excellent additions to any kitchen. This Cherrywood Smoked Salt is one of my favorites and I love it used as an ingredient in a rub onto a nice steak or a chicken that we are going to grill. This salt was a wonderful sweet and smoky taste that just adds to the flavor of the meat you are preparing. It was my favorite of the salts I sampled because of the added flavor it brought as a seasoning for your meals. It is not just a salt but it adds much more! It is also good for seasoning fish, meats, vegetables, pasta eggs and more. It is even recommended to be used as a coating to the rim of the glass of your favorite ales or rum cocktails. It is made of pure sea salt that is slowly smoked over Maine Cherrywood fire and the impact that it makes to the taste of your food is amazing. It is like adding wood chips into your grill to enhance the flavor of your grilling. The brown color of the salt also adds color to your meal and when applied it looks almost like a garnish on your vegetables or pasta dishes. When mixed into your sauces this just adds a special flavor that you will enjoy. This is a good product and my family liked it a lot. We rated it as a 5 star item. Here are some other salts that are available from San Francisco Salt Company: Red Alaea Hawaiian Salt (5oz pouch Fine Grain) Hawaiian Black Lava Finishing Salt (5oz pouch Fine Grain) Sherpa Pink Gourmet Himalayan Salt (5oz Pouch - Extra-Fine Grain) I was supplied a sample for test and tasting and I promised only a fair and honest review. Rating: 5.0 Product: Betty Crocker Baking Mix, Sugar Cookie Mix, 17.5 Oz Pouch Review: We are going to a big family get together today for Mother's Day to have 3 generations of family together. My wife baked up a big batch of these to take as an after meal desert. We will ice them and put sprinkles on them to dress them up. These things are always a hit with the kids and adults and they go quickly. They are easy to make and have a wonderful homemade taste. In less than 20 minutes you have your cookies but of course you have to let them cool down before you ice them. We used Betty Crocker Fluffy White Icing as the topping. No matter what the food will be at the get together I am sure that these cookies will be a hit! Great product from a great company! Product: Tully's Coffee French Roast K-Cup for Keurig Brewers (Pack of 96) Review: I've been drinking the Tully's House Blend K-Cup coffee for a few years now. I occasionally buy a different variety just to try it out, but always find myself wanting the Tully's more. I have to admit, I do like the new Starbucks K-cups, but they are almost as expensive as going to a Starbucks and buying coffee there, so I'll stick with my Tully's. I find the blend to be just the right mixture of smooth and bold. I can use a single K-cup twice to fill my 16 oz to-go mug and find that it's still strong enough. Aunt Gussie's Sugar Free Classic Pecan Meltaways, 7-Ounce Tubs (Pack of 4)
Review:
My husband is gluten sensitive, dairy sensitive, and diabetic, so it is very difficult to find desserts for him.  Usually, if it's gluten free, it has waaaay too much sugar, for example.  I tried a box of these cookies for him.  He tried them and said that they are surprisingly good.

They are not mereingues, even though they are shaped like those types of cookies.  They are regular cookie consistency.  There are just a few in a package, so they are rather expensive.  However, they are less expensive than buying all the materials yourself and having them fail.  (Can you tell I have made some bombs in my time as a specialty cook? LOL)
Rating:
4.0
Product:
REESE'S Peanut Butter Cup Miniatures, Sugar Free/Gluten Free Milk Chocolate Peanut Butter Candy, 8.8 Ounce Bag (Pack of 3)
Review:
My husband is gluten sensitive, dairy sensitive, and diabetic.  There are very few commercial products he can eat, especially in the dessert/sweets category.  Sugar-free Reese's Peanut Butter Cups is one of the few exceptions to this general rule.  Not only can he eat them, but they taste good as well.  He enjoys me getting him this larger bag because it lasts longer (obviously!) than the smaller bags.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Green & Black's Organic Classic Collection Gift Box, 6.34-ounces (Pack of 4)
Review:
This gift box of chocolates offers a nice variety of chocolate flavors, both milk chocolate and dark chocolate varieties.  My personal favorites were the dark chocoalte flavors, but I liked the milk chocolate varieties as well.  The chocolate is smooth and the flavors are nicely balanced with the chocolate.  The sweetness is not overwhelming; in fact, these chocoaltes are less sweet than a lot of other types of chocolates - a good thing for me.

If you are looking for a gift of chocolate for someone, this is a good choice.  There is a good variety.  The chocolates taste good.  And, you know what you are getting when you choose a bar.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Yogi Tea, Mayan Cocoa Spice, 16 Count (Pack of 6), Packaging May Vary
Review:
I tend to like spice teas and dessert teas, so this tea is a blend of the two.  It tastes great and is a great substitute for "real" chocolate (candy, cake, etc.)  I've drunk this tea for a long time and hope they never discontinue it!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
REESE'S Holiday Chocolate Candy, Sugar Free Peanut Butter Cup Miniatures, 3 Ounce Bag (Pack of 12)
Review:
My husband is gluten sensitive, dairy sensitive, and diabetic.  And, he has a sweet tooth.  We were thrilled to find that these candies are allowed with all of his eating issues.  Plus, they are GOOD!  Thanks to Amazon for carrying them.
Rating:
5.0

It's delicious straight from the can.  My mother would have been so pleased to see me eating tuna unadorned and right from the can.  Flavor unmatched by other brands. Vita Coco Coconut Water, Pure - Naturally Hydrating Electrolyte Drink - Smart Alternative to Coffee, Soda, and Sports Drinks - Gluten Free - 11.1 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
Coconut water has really benefited me in several ways.  First it is a great hydrator and a container right after working in the yard really is invigorating.  I recently had a bad virus and this was a wonderful soothing benefit for my sore throat.  There are other benefits as well. There's a great book available about coconut water well worth buying.  Look it up, Amazon probably has it available..

ADDED NOTE:  I recently had surgery.  As I was coming out of the "happy place" I heard the surgeon yelling for the blood count results.  "This guy lost a lot of blood, I think we might need to give him a transfusion".  The nurse presented him with my test and he said, "I'll be darned. It's normal.  It shouldn't be but it is." The nurse, who is from Hawaii, told the doctor they drink this stuff all the time and it's considered a life source.  She told him about the plasma bit. The smartass Urologist just looked at her and said something about stupid superstitious primitive beliefs. She just rolled her eyes and walked away.  What else could she do, this guy is THE surgeon and he thinks he knows everything.  Jerk thinks if you can't cure it with a knife or expensive pills and countless tests, it can't be any good.

If you've done any research on coconut water, you know how close it is to blood plasma and that they used it during WWII when they didn't have real plasma.  The fact that I drink this wonderful juice may not be the only reason my blood work was normal, but you'd have trouble convincing me that it wasn't a major contributor to keeping my blood chemistry as good as it was.  Only an 11 oz. box a day but I wouldn't be without it.

ADDED NOTE They've changed the top since I last ordered and I'd like to thank whom ever made the decision to do so.  The screw top is 1000% better than that old silver strip that never came off the same way twice in a row and didn't protect a partially filled box.  I hope they will continue to use this screw-top packaging from now on.  THANK YOU AGAIN
Rating:
5.0

golds.output: The Spicy Peach Herbal Tea by TIESTA TEA was a nice surprise. I'm not a huge fan of herbal teas, but this one had a good flavor. Product:
240 Bestpresso Nespresso Compatible Gourmet Coffee Capsules - Variety Pack - Natural Espresso Flavors - Nespresso Pods Alternative - Certified Italian Espresso
Review:
These pods are inconsistent. Some way too long with little coffee, almost clear, while some run for only 4-5 seconds.

When a pod did work correctly it was decent, but not on par with nespresso.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
SOS Hydration Inc Berry 20 Pack Electrolyte Hydration Powder Mix
Review:
SOS Rehydrate is designed for people doing endurance type of sports like running, triathlons, tennis, or soccer to mention a few.

SOS Rehydrate comes as a powder and you simply mix it with water; it is not a tablet like products from NUUN as an example. The first thing I noticed was the fact that it dissolved almost instantly  unlike a different rehydration drink I had tried in the past (NUUN). SOS Rehydrate had a refreshing flavor and tasted really good. It did not leave an after-taste in my mouth which is good.

SOS Rehydrate should definitely be consumed with cold water in my opinion. The flavor did not work well with water at room temperature. However, even though I did not experience the great flavor as before I did feel refreshed and ready to go within a few minutes. Again there was no bad aftertaste in my mouth.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kashi Go Lean Vanilla Clusters Plant-Powered Cereal, 10.8 Ounce
Review:
At first, I really didn't want to try this cereal after I looked at the ingredient list and the cereal sitting in my bowl with some milk. Was I going to turn into a modern day Euell Gibbons? Was my colon going to implode from all the fiber? After a playful smack on the head from the wife I decided to dive in.

The clusters have a pleasant, crumbly texture, while their taste is a lot like sweet popcorn. Even though popcorn wasn't invited to this pepita fiesta, thats still the dominant sensation. Fluffy, slightly buttery, and with a syrupy vanilla sugar glaze: this is what Id imagine vanilla cupcake popcorn is like. Its kind of like a healthier Rice Krispies Treats cereal.

I never thought I would like any cereal using the words 'plant power' or gluten free.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
The Spice Lab Pink Himalayan Salt - Gourmet Pure Crystal - Nutrient and Mineral Dense for Health - Kosher and Natural Certified (1 Kilo Coarse Refill Bag)
Review:
Very good flavor and interesting color. You can put this in your grinder, but you'll ruin your salt.

Salt should be broken down in a mortar & pestle and served, on the side, in a pinch bowl.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nescafe Taster's Choice Instant Coffee Beverage, Vanilla, Net Wt. 1.69 Ounce (Pack of 8)
Review:
Nescafe has always been a very good instant coffee. I always keep some around. Now I normally prefer to brew my coffee in a French press or a single cone filter over the cup. I love freshly roasted coffee, so finding places that roast it daily is key. But many mornings or sometimes after dinner I will make Nescafe.

To me it's the best instant. The Starbuck's instant is too strong (although good for Mochas with milk), and many other brands just taste bitter and cheap.

Not sure about now, but Nescafe was the ONLY instant that many restaurants kept around. It was better than keeping coffee on a hot plate for too long, and it was quick to make.

Each of these little packs makes one cup of coffee...just add hot water and you're ready to go.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Aquafusion Low Calorie Drink Mix, Blackberry Plum, 7 count (Pack of 12)
Review:
My family loves powdered drink pouches. As long as they contain healthy ingredients I'm okay with that as it gets them to drink more water.

The AquaFusion mixes are real sugar and stevia. Not the best ingredients, but not the worst either. But, holy cow batman, are they sweet. Each pouch is supposed to be 2 servings, but that's too much. We cut it pouch down to 4 servings and it's just right.

The flavor is good. The blackberry is more pronounced than the plum, but it's good overall.

The only odd thing is the color. We've never used clear mixes before. Generally something berry flavored is blue or purple. Don't forget that you've added the AquaFusion already as you can't see it unless you try it.

All in all, not bad. But way too sweet in it's original serving suggestion. Knock it down to 4 servings per pouch and you'll be good to go.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Newman's Own Organic Mints, Peppermint, 1.76-oz. (Pack of 6)
Review:
The number one factor concerning any candy is flavor. The cinnamon is spot-on. Not too hot, not tool mild. It's 100% organic but made in Mexico. The color is a light grey.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Quaker Instant Oatmeal, Gluten Free, Maple & Brown Sugar, Breakfast Cereal, 12.1 Oz (Pack of 6)
Review:
As a manly man and self-proclaimed Defender of The Universe, I generally stay away from gluten-free this, sugar-free that, and quinoa/chia fortified diarrhea laced products. Give me grains and sugars as our caveman ancestors ate them. Who cares if they only lived 26 years at best?

My pseudo-scientific test had only two criteria - taste and texture. If it tastes good I'm more likely to eat this product regularly and stash some at work. If it tastes like the high-school locker room after a homecoming game, then in the garbage chute it goes. Texture is also quite subjective. I'm not a fan of phlegmy gobs of gelatinous goo sliding around in my mouth or belly.

I made my oatmeal with milk. Real milk. From a real cow. No reduced percentages of bovine goodness for me.

Luckily I was surprised that this "gluten free" oatmeal was very tasty and didn't assault my senses. I was expecting an oral explosion of cardboard yuckiness. I won't say this is the best oatmeal that I ever shoved in my mouth, but it's decent. Decent enough to eat again. Decent enough to stash at work or a weekend camping.

The texture was pleasant. While it didn't make my undies damp, it seemed more refined than other oatmeals in a bag. Probably due to the extra processing. Kudos to Quaker for not turning these oats into mush.

All-in-all, I like these oats. The flavor is good and the texture is decent. My only concern is the increased cost because of the extra refining step. Luckily I don't need gluten-free products, but if you do, these oats are for you.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nescafe Instant Coffee, Ground Coffee, Light Roast, Tasters Choice, 132 Cups, 8 Ounce
Review:
For years I've always enjoyed a cup of Taster's Choice.

It's fast, easy, and consistent. Every time. No exceptions.

The 8oz. bag makes it easy to bring a personal stash to the office. Less than a minute in the nuker and BAM I've got hot water for my coffee. I like mine a bit stronger. No sugar, no creamer. Just hot and black.

Also the best coffee to take on roadtrips and camping.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Oreo Golden Oreo Fudge Creme, 11.3-Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
Needless to say these cookies didn't last long once they were opened. They reminded my wife of the Tagalongs the Girl Scouts used to sell.

Very smooth fudge coating and that oh-so-lovely Oreo crunch. I could eat these all day.

Viva la Oreo!
Rating:
5.0

I like that it's a regular blend, as I find that it suits my taste preferences perfectly. The flavor is rich and smooth, with just the right amount of acidity. I've tried other cold brew coffees before, but this one stands out for its depth and complexity. I would highly recommend Grady's Cold Brew Coffee to anyone who loves a good cup of coffee. It's definitely worth the investment, and I'm looking forward to

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Coffee-mate 2Go Triple Strength Coffee Creamer, Extra Sweet and Creamy, 3 Ounce (Pack of 8) Review: French Vanilla is my favorite coffee creamer flavor, so I had to give this product a try. I like the packaging, portability, lack of need for refridgeration, and concentrated aspect. Coffee-mate claims this is a triple strenght formula, but I think results will vary from person to person. I would put it at more of a double strength level. But it tastes pretty much the same as their little cup packages or the big container you need to refridgerate, so all is good. The fact that it is so portable and doesn't need refrideration is a definite plus. It may take you a few tried to figure out how much you need in your mug or travel container though. You do pay extra for this convenience though. ~ Kort Rating: 4.0 Product: Two Rivers Light Roast Coffee Pods Variety Pack for Keurig K-Cup Makers, 40 Count Review: I have a Keurig K-Cup machine but I admit that it is not my favorite coffee. I usually make a pot of regular drip coffee in the morning it gets used throughout the day. I also have a Nespresso machine which I love, but that is in another class. K-cups are not for you if you want a big, rich steaming mug of coffee. Most cups I've tried lack flavor and punch unless made at the absolute smallest size. Even then, they might not be the greatest coffee. For me, I usually need to brew two for a satisfying cuppa. What I find K-cups great for are an office environment, or if you want a quick cup of coffee that is freshly brewed. While not normally a flavored coffee person, this format lets me try different things. That is where the Two Rivers 40-count Mega Coffee selection shines. You get a wide variety of coffees (no decaf in mine) at a fair price. I would say that about half of them are flavored. They come loose in a box so half the fun is picking through them to find what you want to drink. I've only had a few of them (Workaholics Strait Grizzly, Hamilton Mocha Swirl, and Brooklyn Red Velvet), but brewed at the smallest size, I found them each to be distinctive and flavorful. This 40-pack *IS* for someone who wants to try different coffees and doesn't mind a small cup and would make a nice gift for someone in your life who owns a Kuerig and is adventurous when it comes to coffee. It is also good for helping you track down what K-Cups are good and which aren't so hot. I'm looking forward to seeing what my "mystery" cup is, but am saving it for last. I received a sample pack for objective review purposes. ~ Kort Rating: 4.0 Product: Community Coffee 100% Pure Chicory Medium Roast Premium Ground 12 Oz Bag (6 Pack), Rich Flavorful Taste Naturally Decaf Review: I've purchased this chicory directly from Community Coffee in the past and thought I'd share my experience here. I rarely see any chicory in my local supermarket and then usually only the pre-blended French Market City Roast, which I think is good, but not great. I prefer to have total control over how much chicory I add to my coffee, and blend in a bit less than the manufacturer recommends dependent on the strength of the coffee. Chicory seems to work best with a heartier roast, mellowing it out and making it less acidic. My recommendation would be to try adding one scoop to every 3 scoops of coffee and then adjusting it to taste. Also be sure to use a bit less overall when adding chicory. I find a little goes a long way. I DO NOT recommend drinking it in place of coffee, though I've read that they used to do that when beans were scarce. It's okay (when drunk hot), but it works much better as a coffee enhancer. Chicory is not for everyone however, so if possible, try before you buy. Six bags will last you quite a while! I've had nothing but good experience with Community Coffee products and their Pure Chicory is no exception. I've yet to find a better economical 100% chicory. Try mixing this with Community Coffee's Private Reserve Whole Bean Coffee, Louisiana Blend - Medium-Dark Roast for an exceptional cup of coffee! ~ Kort Rating: 5.0 Product: Coffee Mate Coffee Creamer, Pumpkin Spice Table-Top Pump Bottle, 21.1-Ounce Review: Coffee-mate creamer is one of my few indulgences. My daily cuppa wouldn't be the same without it. I know it isn't the healthiest product on Earth with numerous artificial ingredients, but is are low cal and adds to the flavor of my coffee. I usually have vanilla or hazelnut, but thought I would give Pumpkin Spice a go. There is a tea by that name which I like to drink during the cooler months. These special edition flavors can be fun to try and have on occasion. I'm impressed with Pumpkin Spice. It is actually a flavor I'd have on a regular basis. Cinnamon and sweetness pervade with pleasant pumpkin undertone. This is thick like the more concentrated Coffee-mate creamer that Nestle just started offering in squeeze bottles. One squirt is good for a regular cup for me, and three is great for my large travel mug. It is sweet enough that I don't have to add any additional sweetener. The pump is handy as well. It was easy to assemble and once I figured out how to twist the top just right to release the pump I was in business. It has a solid feel when pressing it down and it doesn't drip. This size and format would work well in an office environment, but knowing how much coffee I drink, it is good for home use as well. I hope they release a "Natural Bliss" version, but I'm content to enjoy Pumpkin Spice, artificial ingredients and all. ~ Kort Rating: 4.0 Product: Java Factory Single Cup Coffee for Keurig K Cup Brewers, Dark and Handsome Dark Roast, 24 Count Review: Java Factory's offering has above average variety for a multi-pack. Translation -- I like most of them. Smooth Caffeinator and Wakey Wakey are not ones I would choose to drink, but they were not undrinkable. They just weren't to my tastes, a bit on the light side. The other Cup varieties are darn good, even the flavored ones which are normally not my favorites. Dark & Handsome makes a great morning cup, and Da Bomb is a rich tasting caffeine explosion. The two flavored varieties make good dessert coffees, or regular cups for those who are into that. Actually, Vanilla Dream might just be the best tasting out of the bunch. All cups worked flawlessly with my Keurig. If getting another mixed pack, this would be on my shortlist. I received a sample of this product for objective review purposes. ~ Kort Rating: 5.0 Product: Lavazza Gran Selezione Ground Coffee Blend, Dark Roast, 12-Ounce Bag Review: I'm a coffee maven and take great pride in making that perfect cup of joe. I've tried all kinds of coffee, and as my wife has observed, have my coffee-making technique down to a science. I'm always on the lookout for a coffee with good flavor. For maximum freshness I prefer to grind my own beans, preferably freshly roasted. The LavAzza Gran Selezione Ground Coffee Blend comes finely ground (ideal for espressos and drip makers). Given it's already ground and roasted in Italy, I was impressed with how fresh tasting it is. It made a rich, smooth pot of coffee. Gran Selezione is labeled "intense and chocolaty" and though I detect it, my wife didn't really notice. She complimented me on how delicious the coffee I had made for her was (I did not tell her it was LavAzza until afterwards). It passed the wife test and she wanted me to brew it again the next day. I like that LavAzza is a family owned business that is responsible with their sourcing. This coffee tastes like it was roasted with care and is something I would have no hesitation getting again. On a scale of 1-10, it is an intensity level of 7 -- a moderate dark roast. For a coffee of this price range, it's an exceptional value. I would recommend it for anyone who wants a quality cup of coffee and prefers the convenience of pre-ground beans. ~ Kort Rating: 5.0 Product: Kauai Coffee Single-serve Pods, Island Sunrise Mild Roast – 100% Premium Arabica Coffee from Hawaii’s Largest Coffee Grower, Keurig-Compatible Cups - 12 Count Review: I love Kona coffee. That and Blue Mountain are my favorites. A couple of months ago, I found Kauai ground coffee on sale at my local grocer and gave it a shot. Both myself and my wife were impressed. It has most of the characteristics of a rich and mellow Kona coffee without the huge price tag. Even in pre-ground form it was good. Fast forward a few weeks and I get these K-cup single-serve compatibles from Amazon. I've found many K-cups to be a bit weak and unimpressive, but was pleased to find that these compatibles live up to the Kauai standard. While perhaps oh-so-slightly weaker than what I would brew in the regular coffee maker, they still retain their flavor as single-serve options. The format is not quite K-cup, but worked well in my unit and looks like it is more environmentally friendly. I only use my Keurig occasionally, but I've found a K-cup that I am happy to stock for those occasions! ~ Kort Rating: 4.0 Product: Kona Smooth Hawaiian Coffee, Our Kings Reserve DIAMOND, 8 Oz Whole Bea Review: I won't say this is the best coffee in the world; because I have yet to try them all and everyone's tastes differ. However, from my 20+ years of coffee drinking and of all the Kona coffee's I've tasted, THIS one reigns supreme. And it better for that price! But if you appreciate a well rounded, flavorful coffee, then this is the one to try. I lived in Hawaii for 3 years and was introduced to Kona coffee at the source. Of all the coffees I've had in my life, Kona is my favorite. It is the richest and smoothest you could imagine. Others are good, but not in this class. Also, watch out for Kona coffee blends. They can be tasty, but are usually only 10% Kona beans and not the top crops at that. This is the primo stuff here! There really is something in that Volcanic soil on the Big Island. A word of caution though. Drink this at your own risk. It is very hard to go back to "normal" coffee after tasting this nectar of the gods. Enjoy! Rating: 5.0 Product: Stash Tea Company Super Irish Breakfast Loose Leaf Tea 3.5 Ounce Pouches (Pack of 3) Loose Leaf Premium Herbal Tea for Tea Infusers Tea Strainers or Teapots, Drink Hot or Iced, Sweetened or Plain Review: I primarily use loose leaf teas and picked up a bag of this Irish Breakfast from Stash Tea. I prefer it to English Breakfast tea for the flavor which I find bolder and smoother at the same time. Stash's version is quite tasty and hits the right price point for everyday usability. It is comparable to Adagio's Irish Breakfast blend and I use their 16 oz. ingenuiTEA Bottom-Dispensing Teapot to brew mine for 2 minutes with hot water from the fresh water dispenser at work. I like mine without cream and sugar, but if you wanted to brew it a minute or two more, then cream and sugar would go well with it. This is the tea drinker's version of your basic cup of joe. It makes a good iced tea as well. ~ Kort Rating: 5.0 Product: Reed's Ginger Beer Extra Ginger Brew, 4 pk Review: This is very evidently "Jamaican Style" Ginger Beer. They tend to be fruity and very sweet. The ginger flavor is stronger here than in some other sodas, and it isn't quite as sweet as some, but it still isn't what I'd consider an extra strong ginger brew. It isn't bad and is likely a good mixer with the additional fruit flavors, but if you are looking for pure, strong ginger beer/ale, this shouldn't be your first choice. ~ Kort Rating: 3.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['good', 'like', 'kort', 'flavor', 'tea', 'coffee', 'would', 'one', 'chocolate', 'healthy'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Review:
This is not the first time I purchased this brand. I purchased the SuperCreame before. For my taste Buds they are both Bitter. The creame looks good but breaks down fast. I am not perfect and I have tried different grines from my grinder. I think I have the right gind but this coffee is just bitter. I am open to suggestions. My Cousins has a very old auto esspresso maker and it makes a great esspresso with lavazza but it is still bitter.... Help me out here??? Thanks.

UPDATE: Maybe it is an acquired taste???? Still BITTER!!! The bag says "Italy's Favorite Coffee" Well you know what comes to my mind?? I guess if we lived in Italy and wanted American coffee the Can of Maxwell House Coffee would say "America's Favorite Coffee" We know that is not true????? Woke up this morning and turned on the machine, ground my coffee and Bam!!!! Bitter. I can not get used to it.. I try to drown the flavor with sugar. I even went back to using Half/Half!!!! I will not buy this again. At Stop and Shop I buy whole coffee beans from PEET'S Coffee. That is the best I have found.  Lavazza should say " Just another reason to stay in bed in the morning"

Review:
Purchased this because I love English butter toffee with Almonds and I have purchased just about all from Amazon. First of all this is a little bit on the well done side. I can see how one reviewer said that it was burnt. I am not sure about their method or any method of making this. I can only say that the flavor is mild. Tastes like the sugar content is half of what it usually taste like. Basically it is not really sweet, some people may like that I kind of don't like it this way. This Toffee also contains Almonds inside not just sprinkled on top of the dark chocolate. That in itself may make taste less sweet.
  The appearance looks very good like homemade. It appears that much care was put into making this toffee so I do not believe it is darker in appearance by accident. This Toffee is very well made and its presentation is great. Now I am making my critique based on my favorite English Butter Toffee with Almonds and that is Aunt Mae's Sweet Tooth. Aunt Mae's is made with milk chocolate sprinkled with Almonds. It is the kind of Toffee I was brought up eating. The taste is twice as sweet as this and has no almonds mixed in the Toffee itself.
  Both of these brands are made in big sheets and broken to fit inside the box. Depending on what you are used to or you like Toffee that is not too sweet ? If you want Toffee on the mild side then this is great and deserves five stars. For my personal taste and probably most people that like English Butter Toffee are going to like Aunt Mae's because it is more traditional and very thick. I'm only giving this four stars because it is not my favorite because it is not sweet enough and may have a well done taste to it?

4.0

Review:

golds.output: I love Quaker Instant Oatmeal, and the Maple & Brown Sugar flavor is no exception.  Although I usually get the low sugar version, I was pleased to find that the extra sugar in this flavor doesn't make it overly sweet.  I like that it's gluten-free, so I can share it with my gluten-free friends and family. prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Quaker Instant Oatmeal Original, 12 Packets per Box (Pack of 4)
Review:
I usually get the low sugar version of this, and I bought this by accident.  The extra sugar, of course, makes it extra yummy.  No, it's not traditional oatmeal and instead instant, with the drawbacks of salt and no control over the flavoring amounts, but it makes a quick and nutritious breakfast.  I tend to use skim milk instead of water for a creamier texture.  Because I like thicker oatmeal, I use a little less liquid than called for and let it sit for a few minutes before eating.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Oatmeal Packets by thinkThin, Instant Protein & Fiber Hot Oatmeal for On The Go- 10g Protein, 5g Fiber, Vegan - Madagascar Vanilla with Almonds and Pecans, 1.76 oz Packets (6 Boxes/6 Packets Per Box)
Review:
When I opened my first packet of thinkThin oatmeal, I was surprised by how little was there compared to an average packet of Quaker Instant Oatmeal.  And the instructions directed me to add 1/2 cup of water to that small portion.  My first try resulted in too-thin oatmeal, so the next time I used 1/3 cup (and 1 minute in the microwave).  That ended up with a thicker hot cereal more to my tastes, but I had to let it sit more afterward to better "cook" the oatmeal.

The taste is pretty good for an instant hot cereal, but there's a weird, powdery, tongue-coating sensation that comes with it even though the oatmeal is moist.  It's not a taste, per se, or even a true chalkiness.  It's just . . . strange.  Once I got used to it, however, it didn't bother me.  I do like that the berries -- the blueberries, in particular -- aren't chewy after preparation like so many other dehydrated fruit products.  Because there are no artificial flavors, you don't get that cloying artificial "berry" taste that some products have.  Yeah, it doesn't taste like fresh berries, but it's much better than most.  The cereal contains soy and milk, although I don't see anything milk-like in the ingredient list.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Lindt Excellence Bar, 70% Cocoa Smooth Dark Chocolate, Gluten Free, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I love Lindt chocolate, and this collection has something for everyone, which made it great to use as stocking stuffers this past Christmas.  I'm more of a dark chocolate woman, so the extra creamy milk didn't appeal to me, although my mother-in-law loved hers.  These are solid bars -- that is, they don't have creamy fillings.  For example, the intense orange has bits of orange rind in it rather than an orange filling.  The 70% and 85% dark chocolate bars are great for cooking or snacking.  All bars arrived unbroken, unmelted, and fresh.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
5.0
Product:
CAILLER L'Art du Brut, Milk Chocolate with whole Almonds, Hazelnuts & Raisins,  6.9 ounce bars (Pack of 2)
Review:
This milk chocolate bar with almonds, hazelnuts, and raisins is heavy on the milk and sugar, light on the chocolate flavor, but still delicious.  It is packed with nuts and raisins -- they stick up through the top of the segments.  If you are a lover of milk chocolate, nuts, and fruit, then you've probably found your bar.

Each bar is a hefty 6.87 ounces.  To give you a comparison, Ghirardelli and Lindt large bars run about 3.5 ounces.  Although Cailler is manufactured by Swiss Nestlé, the high milk content is more reminscent of Cadbury than the Nestlé bars Americans are used to.  The milk tends to give the chocolate a creamier texture, though less intense flavor.

This chocolate bar satisfies my sweet tooth and cravings for nuts more than it does when my craving for chocolate, probably because I usually reach for dark chocolate instead of milk chocolate.  If you like milk chocolate more than dark, you will likely love these bars.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Skippy Natural Creamy Peanut Butter Spread with Honey, 15 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
This Skippy peanut butter tastes like those honey-roasted peanuts you sometimes get in a bar -- and it's just as addictive.  It's smooth, sweet, and full of peanut flavor.  Of course, if you prefer non-sweet peanut butter, then run away as fast as you can.  This peanut butter contains more sugar per serving than than regular Jif -- 5 versus 3 grams -- so don't buy this thinking it's more healthy.  It contains no mono- or diglycerides, however.

I grew up on Skippy peanut butter, but when I tasted Jif as an adult, I was hooked on the sweeter taste and switched brands.  Of course, I've also eaten natural peanut butters over the years, and they usually contained no sugar.  I was surprised that this "natural" brand had so much sugar added.  Kids and those of us with a sweet tooth will love the taste of this Skippy; I'm not sure health-conscious parents will.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Food Should Taste Good, Tortilla Chips, Multigrain Bean Chips, Pinto Bean, 5.5 oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
These sturdy chips taste great, with the nutty flavor of beans and seeds.  Although they are salted, the salt is not overbearing, and the grain flavor comes through as the strongest flavor.

Despite the ingredients of pinto beans, sunflower seeds, flax seeds, sesame seeds, and quinoa, these are still chips, and therefore are not as healthy as eating these ingredients separately.  They also contain stone ground corn (second ingredient, after pinto beans), brown rice flour, and cane sugar.  The serving size of 10 chips/1 oz. contains 3 g of fiber, 3 g of protein, and 2 g of sugar.  To compare, the Snyders pretzels I have in my pantry have, in 1 ounce, the same amount of fiber but only 1 gram of protei and no sugar in a single serving.  One ounce of these chips has 140 calories; one ounce of the pretzel have only 100 calories.

As a side to a sandwich or as a snack, these multigrain bean chips are great, as long as you accept that they are still extra calories without much nutritional content.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Hershey's Caramels, Dark Chocolate Caramels, 7.2 Ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
These individually wrapped caramels have the perfect dark chocolate to caramel ratio.  The caramels are soft and buttery tasting, and the chocolate is, well, Hershey's.  I love that I can put out a bowl of these, and they don't get stale or mushed together because of the wrapping.  They are perfect for Christmas stockings, sitting on a desk, or just snacking.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Honest Tea Organic Fair Trade Pomegranate Blue Gluten Free, 16.9 Fl. Oz, 12 Pack
Review:
I love this Honest Tea Honey and Green Tea because it doesn't contain much sweetener at all.  Normally, I'm a purist -- no sugar, no artificial sweeteners in my tea -- but this Honest Tea has enough honey to give the tea some complexity without seeing, well, sweet.  At 70 calories per 16.9 fl. oz. bottle, it's a relatively low calorie drink with some flavor.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
5.0
Product:
A Taste of Thai Coconut Ginger Soup Base, 2.1 Ounce Box (Pack of 6)
Review:
A Taste of Thai red curry paste is my favorite brand of pre-made paste, but lately I haven't been able to find it in my local grocery store.  I kinda go all-out with this.  You are supposed to use 1 tablespoons per can of coconut milk, but I use the whole package to give my stir-fry an intense flavor and medium-hot spice level.  I sauté bell peppers, onions, carrots, and broccoli with my choice of protein (chicken, salmon, shrimp), if any, and cook until just done.  I add the paste and cook for an addition minute, adding the coconut milk last, heating until hot.  Served over jasmine rice, it's one of my family's favorite meals.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
5.0
Product:
ORCHARD VALLEY HARVEST Cranberry Almond Cashew Trail Mix, Non-GMO, No Artificial Ingredients, 1 oz (Pack of 8)
Review:
Although I'm not normally a fan of raisins, I like chocolate-covered raisins, especially when they are paired with nuts as they are in this Orchard Valley mix.  Each 8-ounce bag contains eight individual bags for an easily portioned amount.  The size is perfect for sticking in a gym bag for a quick pick-me-up before or after exercise or to throw in a bag lunch.  I plan to travel with a few of these since I can't always access food when I'm in transit.  The individual packets each contain 150 calories: 4 grams of protein and 7 grams of sugar.  The sea salt (50 mg sodium in each serving) brings out the flavor of the almonds and peanuts.  Everthings tastes fresh and (except for the chocolate) wholesome.

-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Product:
Kitchens Of India Recipe Paste, Vegetable Biryani, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
This is the authentic product, I can vouch for it since I am from India. The ITC Hotel chefs who created this recipe are very well regarded in India. Its just the right mix for a spicy lamb curry, all you need to do is mix it with water and add the lamb and then let it simmer on your stove for 30-45 minutes to bring out the aromas and flavors. Really convenient and time saving.

The lamb curry paste is spicier than a butter chicken curry mix. The chicken curry usually has a more creamy consistency and is sweeter due to higher content of tomatoes. The lamb curry has a base of garlic, ginger, black pepper, onions, tomatoes and other highly aromatic Indian spices (bayleaf, cinnamon, star anise, cardamom, cloves, black cardamom, shah jeera, corriander seeds, red chilli powder etc.).

I usually make my own curry as I prefer fresh ingredients but this mix is wonderful, it has just the right blend of spices that go into lamb curry. The secret to Indian food is to lower the flame once a curry boils and then simmer it for quite some time. This step is not a must if you're in a tearing hurry but it unlocks the real flavors.

Once done this curry keeps very well in the refrigerator. In fact, as with all spicy curries, it even tastes better the next day. I use two packets at a time to make an entree for 6 people.

Variations:
I sometimes add some 1X1.5 inch cubes of diced potatoes along with the lamb to absorb the spiciness which makes it into a "Lamb Vindaloo". Or you can use beef instead of lamb, it will taste great with any red meat that absorbs the spice.

If you're a vegetarian, you can use this curry with potatoes and green peas since the curry paste does not contain any meat in it. Just remember to add peas towards the end of the simmering process or they will get bleached out and you'll get a fantastic dish.

Pairing:
Pair this lamb curry with some aromatic basmati rice, cooked till all grains are done but still separate, and a bowl of plain yogurt (with a little sugar if you like) to counter the spiciness. Or you can also buy frozen Indian nan/roti from the local Indian grocery store, toast it in the oven and enjoy. Yummy!
Rating:
5.0
</Other Writer-1>

</otherwriters>

This soup is outstanding on its own, and for low carbers/diabetics, it is a special treat. I use this mostly as a sauce for chicken, pork chops, veggies. I treat it like mushroom soup for a sauce, thinning with cream or broth if needed, which normally I don't.  It has just a bit of spiciness to it, and for me it makes a big difference in ease of prep and added variety to what are sometimes bland dishes. Review:
I was expecting more flavor in this blend, so it's a bit of a disappointment. The coffee itself is a mild blend, but it has a slightly harsh aftertaste. I also drink my coffee with cream but that's not enough to mask the harshness. I also wish the cinnamon flavor was more intense. If I were to do a blind taste test I'm not sure I could identify what the coffee flavor or smell is supposed to be. So I'm marking it down one star for harshness, and marking it down a second star for a weak flavor. Other than that, it's not a bad coffee and has a decent mouthfeel.

My husband and I have been buying the Monin syrups to make flavored dessert coffees. The cinnamon pastry makes a good base if you add some flavoring syrup to make it sweet. I think a little sugar could also round out the rough edges of the flavor. Vanilla and toasted marshmallow syrups are my favorites with this coffee.

On a scale of 1 to 10, I'd give this coffee a 5.

golds.output: I like these wafels but they are a bit too sweet for my taste. The honey and oats flavor is nice, but I would prefer less sugar in the ingredients. I also think they are a bit too crunchy, I prefer a lighter texture in a snack wafel. On the other hand, they are very convenient to eat on the go and the portion size is just right. Overall, they are a good choice if you like sweet snacks, but not my first pick.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz Review: These are good. Fresh, salt-free and very plump, crunchy and sweet. Just the way I like peanuts. Unless you are a salt-freak, I'd say these are far better than the salted ones. Rating: 5.0 Product: FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz Review: Very nice peanuts--a tad salty however. I frequently enjoy a handful of peanuts before dinner as a snack or with drinks. Can't eat tree nuts (allergic) but luckily, I'm not allergic to peanuts and I really like them. This was always a family tradition--my mom and dad and I would have a few peanuts before dinner with a sherry or glass of wine or whiskey. I still like to do that. These nuts are very fresh and roasted well. I'd consider buying salt-free ones, next time, because I just don't like so much salt nor should I eat so much salt in my diet. Rating: 4.0 Product: Ghiradelli Hot Chocolate, Double Chocolate, 16oz Review: Whoah! I just peeled myself off the ceiling after drinking a cup of this. This might be better named "Double Sugar" Flavor Hot Chocolate mix. First, the good stuff. There is no doubt in my mind that Ghirardelli continues to make a distinctive, excellent quality chocolate. The cocoa used in this mix is smooth, dark, fruity and aromatic. Nothing else like it that I've ever tasted. Now, the criticism. There is just too much sugar in the mix. The recommended proportion of mix to 8 oz milk is four tablespoons. (By the by, there is no powdered milk in here. You must add your own milk--or soymilk or rice milk--great option for lactose-intolerant types.) People, you are using a quarter cup of mix at 4 Tbs and most of the mix seems to be granulated sugar, which you can taste and crunch in your mouth if you sample the dry mix. Cutting down fifty percent on the mix gave me an acceptable cup of cocoa but...it was no longer double chocolate and it had naturally a poorer mouth feel and aroma. Double Chocolate Mix is some of the best cocoa I WOULD have had, if Ghirardelli could see their way to making a lower sugar version, and please, no sugar substitute, which I don't like to use. Summary; great chocolate flavor, unsurpassed. But overly sweet. If you don't like supersweet cocoa, pass this up. If you do love extremely sweet hot drinks, you will absolutely adore this mix. Rating: 5.0 Product: Barista Prima Italian Roast Coffee Keurig Vue Portion Pack, 24 count Review: If you like strong, dark coffee, the Barista Italian roast for the Vue cup is excellent. I make it on the STRONG setting for 8oz and it's perfect. In fact, it's better than what I make in my regular pot unless I have very fresh coffee just ground from beans. The color is a rich, blackish brown, the roast is dark but not burnt-tasting and of all the coffees for the Vue I've tried, this one wins hands-down. I have the same blend in K-cups (for the office, where the K version sits) and they are not as good, for some reason. The Vue is not the most economical way to make coffee (that would probably be a plastic Melitta filter with a paper cone and a mug or a French Press) but the Keurig is fast and convenient. And I get the coffee the strength and temperature just the way I like it. Rating: 5.0 Product: Barista Prima House Blend Keurig K-Cups,18 Count Review: I had a sampler and tried Italian Roast, Columbian, House Blend and a few other Barista blends. By far, the House Blend is my favorite. It's dark but not burnt, not overly strong and it has character. It stands up to milk and sugar but is pleasant when drunk black. Of all the coffees I've tried in the Keurig, this one is by far the best. It's balanced and hearty. Rating: 5.0 Product: Krusteaz Belgian Supreme Waffle Mix, 28-Ounce Box (Pack of 4) Review: This is an excellent mix for waffles. You can make them with or without the egg and oil, but they are better with those ingredients added. Waffles are not diet food. There is a trick to make really crisp light waffles, however. Make up the mix according to directions but do it this way: 1. Substitute melted butter for some or all of the oil. 2. Separate the egg. Add the yolk as you mix the rest of the ingredients, then beat the egg white until stiff and fold it in as the last step (put the whipped egg white on top of the batter, turn it in with a spatula, cutting it in gently until it is just mixed and the egg white is not showing lumps of white.) This trick will also work with any gluten free mix you may use (and those flours tend to be heavier than this mix.) I also add a pinch of ground cloves or cinnamon to add some flavor. Naturally, using a very good waffle maker, such as this one, will insure you get the lightest, fluffiest waffles you can make. There are many good ones on the market but I use a relatively simple one Presto Waffler. The key is to flip the waffle during cooking to make sure the center is evenly baked. There are ways to top the waffles that may surprise you. My dad's favorite was cream cheese and apple butter. I had them with strawberries and huge mounds of whipped cream in Luxembourg, and the best way I ever had them was with cherries (rather like pie filling) and whipped cream in a little mountain village in Germany. Those were awesome. As I said, not diet food, though you can simply dust them with powdered sugar and they still are pretty darn tasty. Rating: 5.0 Product: Cafe Escapes Milk Chocolate Hot Cocoa Keurig Vue Portion Pack, 32 Count Review: This hot chocolate is nice and convenient and you can brew it strong or less strong because the VUE lets you customize temperature and volume. But sad to say, I found it too sweet. The reason for it's being sweet is that in addition to sugar, it is sweetened with sucralose (aka Splenda.) This is a new trend in foods-- a mix of natural and artificial sweeteners. (Have you seen chewing gum? Even the non-sugar-free varieties have aspartame?) The reason for using a mix of natural and artificial is interesting but I believe in this case, using sucralose lowers the calorie count of the cocoa and it also allows more sweetener in a smaller cup size, as sucralose takes up less space than granulated sugar. I had to tease out the ingredient info by carefully reading the box, as it doesn't say so on the cup. Here's the good news, if you don't want sucralose, or even if you don't want sugar AND sucralose, you can buy packet cocoas and make a cup of hot water with the VUE, any volume and temp you choose. Just mix it up yourself. The only powdered mix I ever liked was Caotina (from Switzerland) which was not so sweet as American varieties but I can't find it in the US. However, I have guests who adore hot chocolate when they visit my office or home, so I keep Swiss Miss on hand. In any case, for the Cafe Escapes, blech! Rating: 1.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Half and Half Perfect Iced Tea, K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, 22-Count Review: I love this blend of tea--I've been drinking it since it came on the market. Sleepytime may have changed its package over the years but the blend is the same--lime blossom (linden flowers or tilia, same thing), chamomile and spearmint. This is a brilliant mix, the linden and chamomile floral, sweet and soporific, the spearmint adding just enough of a hit to make it interesting. It's good as an after-dinner digestif, or as a before-bed soothing drink. And it tastes really delicious Each ingredient has a purpose; linden is a relaxer and is said to restore the liver (hence, it's used as a tisane in France, where livers are always suspected of being upset), chamomile is a tension-tamer and soothes the stomach, and spearmint is a digestive--helps after a heavy meal. You actually don't need to have K-cups--just brew a cup of hot water from the Keurig and dip in a Sleepytime tea bag. But if you are serving guests at table or in your office, the K cup makes a cup of tea without the bag to deal with. Since I serve tea in my office (as well as coffee), the K cups are on hand for guests in several flavors (Sleepytime and Mandarin Orange.) At home, I simply use the bag version. Rating: 5.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Half and Half Perfect Iced Tea, K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, 22-Count Review: These cups are nice for our office--we can have teas on hand for guest who don't drink coffee. I like the "Sleepytime" which despite the name, is a good after-lunch tea. The linden flowers and spearmint are very soothing. But there is only ONE herbal in this selection (leaving out the Mandarin Orange, which is very popular) and well, you can throw a black tea bag, even a premium tea bag, into a cup of water drawn off the Keurig and it's a lot less expensive. To do this, you simply set the machine for 10 oz and don't put a K-cup in the holder (you do have to open it and shut it to tell the machine "ready!") Then push the brew button and you get a cup of hot water. Throw in a bag. Cost? Maybe 10 pennies, depending on what you had to spend on the tea bags. The nice thing about Keurig brewed tea is no bag and the strength is usually perfect. But unless you worry about mess or have a public serve-yourself-area where you want to limit cleanup to throwing away K-cups and sugar packets, then these are kind of an unnecessary luxury. I had a set, but I won't rebuy them. Rating: 3.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill Scottish Oatmeal, 20 oz Review: If you eat oatmeal for health or because you like it, this is a different porridge for your breakfast. Instead of the flaky texture of rolled oats or the heavy, thick and chewy texture of steel-cut (pinhead) oats, this is more like a mush or a cream of wheat texture. The oats are flaked and milled so it's like a coarse meal rather than whole flakes or chopped whole grain. It cooks up in 10 minutes to a porridge consistency. You might say it's a bit more like oatbran porridge only not as mushy. There is some substance to the texture. This is a good change from rolled oats or steel cut. It cooks faster --10 minutes in a pot of boiling water. You can microwave a single serving, but I found it tends to foam up in the microwave, so I do it in a small saucepan on the stove. After you stir the oats in at a boil, it cooks on the lowest heat and needs hardly any stirring. I was able to get my blood lipids to a healthy level simply by eating no red meat and adding servings of oatmeal almost every day. Your results may differ, but for me, this is a healthful food to add to my diet and it's enjoyable. The mealy texture makes this good for baking. I use it in oatcakes--where you knead some oats, some shortening, and some buttermilk into a dough and roll it out and bake it on a griddle or a baking stone. It makes a sort of soft cracker-like flatbread that is very good with butter, jam or honey with a good cup of tea or coffee. This also works well in muffins. Product: PowerBar Fruit Smoothie Energy Bars (Pack of 12) Review: The texture is strange and the flavor unpleasant. I had to use a scissor to open the package, the "tear here" instructions didn't work for me. This power bar contains 2% saturated fat, 210 calories, 30 from fat, 14% carbs, no fiber; it left a bad aftertaste in my mouth. I can think of many other portable and nourishing things to eat that contain fewer than 240 calories. Rating: 1.0 Using the features, generate the proper review.
