golds.output: i've tried a number of sugar-free gum products, and while mentos is not my first choice, this red fruit lime flavor is pretty good.  the gum comes in a 50 piece bottle, which is perfect for stocking stuffers or gifts, and the flavor is not overpowering, but rather subtle.  it's a bit too sweet for my taste, but that's likely due to the artificial sweeteners used.  overall, it's a decent sugar-free gum option, but not the best i've tried.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Dentyne Pure Sugar Free Gum (Mint with Herbal Accents 9 Piece Pack of 10) Review: i got the melon while it was still under $9 and don't know why the price nearly doubled in 2016. in the meantime i will wait till the herbal goes on sale to try it. this gum comes in larger chicklets that are not as minty as the usual dentyne, and chews softer as not to press or stick to dental work. it also does not taste rubbery once the flavor is gone as other dentyne do. i prefer chicklet gum because i can carry it raw in a pocket without wrappers or worrying it's going to melt like paper wrapped sticks. i will update this review once the herbal prices lower and i can better distinguish between the flavors. the melon gum tastes to me like wrigley's juicy fruit with added mint. Rating: 5.0 Product: EZ-Sweetz (2.0oz - Liquid Sweetener 800 Servings/Bottle) (Original, 1 Pack) Review: I consume 2,000 Splenda packets each year, so before I ordered my next case, I decided to give this liquid version a try. I was very pleased with how noticeably better it tasted in my home brewed Iced Dilmah Tea, 100% Pure Ceylon Tea, Loose Leaf, 4.4-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6), though it takes 2 drops to equal a packet's sweetening power. each gallon of tea I brew normally requires 16 packets (one per 8oz cup), while over 30 drops were needed to match that sweetness here. As I brew 4 gallons at a time, not having to rip open, tap empty and dispose of 64 packets was nice, but that still does not make up for this liquid's triple net sweetening cost. Should I find it again under $5/ounce I would get more, barring that - I'll probably go back to using cheaper packets. Rating: 5.0 Product: Dilmah Tea, 100% Pure Ceylon Tea, Loose Leaf, 4.41-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) Review: I used to buy Ceylon labeled tea exported from middle eastern countries Ahmad 500g Loose Ceylon Tea, 1.23-Ounce Packet (Pack of 4) for around $12 per kilo, only to later learn about high mountain genuine (lion&sword seal) Ceylon from Sri Lanka. Being able to buy the real thing on Amazon for $20 per kilo was an amazing find for me, as I brew a Gallon per day using a drip style coffee maker. Only 1g per cup is needed here, not the typical 2g per cup you may need with cheaper loosely packed leafy Ceylons, so each box can yeild over a hundred 8oz cups of tea - as no leaf rinsing is needed. This is NOT some low quality crushed leaf dust, just a fine packed leaf that requires a paper filter to brew to yield a crystal clear amber tea - don't use a hole steeper - only a fine screen will do. This is an affordable leaf type especially for ice tea lovers. This malty neutral pH tea, combines well with fruit, spices, citrus, and even milk. UPDATE: I'm just about to reorder and wanted to share that drip method ice tea *makers Mr. Coffee TM3-2W 3-Quart Iced Tea Maker like me - can save even more money by using only 1/2g per cup - and you will still get a dark amber full flavor tea. So for every gallon (16 cups) I brew, I use just 8g of this tea leaf, with 16x yellow 1g Splenda packets, and get perfect lightly sweet sugar free tea every time! That gets my cost per large 8oz cup of fresh brewed no preservative iced tea down under 10. Flavor with a tablespoon of cranberry or grapefruit juice for an extra kick. This tea the best balance of quality and afford ability. I have tried other Dilmah teas including; Ran Watte, Uda Watte, Supreme, Earl Grey, and these little blue boxes are the only ones worth reordering. Rating: 5.0 Product: Dilmah Tea, Earl Grey Tea, Loose Leaf, 4.4-Ounce Tins (Pack of 3) Review: the Bergamot used here smells and tastes like rancid Lychee nuts, so if you are just looking for a pleasant black tea, pick something else. A tea at this price point should not be using "flavoring" but the real essence, oil or dehydrated Bergamot citrus fruit. The leaves are cut up into 2mm bits, so you must use a paper filter when seeping this loose tea. The double capped tin does a fine job of air sealing the tea, so there is no need for an inner foil wrapper as others have contested. Rating: 3.0 Product: Golden Valley Natural Turkey Jerky, Teriyaki, 3.25 Ounce Pouches (Pack of 8) Review: I have tried every GoldenValleyNatural.com Jerky product. By far the best are all the Sweet N'Spicy and Peppered Flavors. Beef tends to be smoky and fatty, while Turkey is dry and flaky, making their Buffalo meat varieties the best of them all. Avoid their Low Carb Jerky unless you are willing to bite off tic-tac size bites and chew for a minute each time. All the Teriyaki Jerkys have the texture and taste like sweet Corned Beef, so I'd skip them as well. If you want to try different flavors, instead of 8 of the same from Amazon, just go directly to their web sight and buy them for only 15% more than Amazon's sale price. Rating: 5.0 Product: Lindt Excellence Bar, 70% Cocoa Smooth Dark Chocolate, Gluten Free, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: salt is good in chocolate only if it's a few large grains scattered about (like chocolate chips on a cookie) so you taste the good chocolate, then get hit by a bit of a salt surprise. here lindt just diluted extra salt into an average chocolate, and the results are just awful - and thanks to amazon i'm now stuck with 5 more bars of this junk. Rating: 2.0 Product: Barry's Irish Breakfast Tea, 80-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 3) Review: This is not a cheap Yorkshire Gold knockoff, rather it's an acidic Indian black with a distinct bergamot note, like a pathetic attempt at Earl Grey. Either everyone giving this tea 5 stars was born in the UK, or they are clueless about what good black teas are being enjoyed in other parts of the World. This is even worse chilled as an ice tea, since it clouds up within hours. Rating: 2.0 Product: Lipton Black Tea Bags, 100% Natural Tea, 100 ct Review: I found it amusing how much trouble Amazon went to explaining that "orange pekoe" has no orange in it, when in fact this tea leaf is 95% fanning. you will need 1.5g per 8oz cup of tea, so at 220g this box yields about 150 tea bags worth of the same cardboard bland tea. The tea arrives completely dried out in a foil&paper envelope, so I would not bother moving it to a sealed tin since it's already been ruined. Next time buy Dilmah Tea, 100% Pure Ceylon Tea, Loose Leaf, 4.41-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) which costs double, but also yields double the amount of far more flavorful black tea and is vacuum packed at the source like all loose not blended teas should be. Rating: 2.0 Product: Lundberg Family Farms Eco-Farmed Brown Rice Cake, Salt Free, 8.5-Ounce Units (Pack of 12) Review: Lundberg seems to make their cakes denser with less "starch glue" than the cheap typical store brands. I was not impressed with some of Lundberg's flavors I got locally for about $4/bag because they simply sandwich dry spices between each basic white cake instead of integrating them into the processing. I was able to S&S a $1/bag deal thanks to a "deal of the day" so I'm posting this to thank Amazon and Lundberg for a box with 10 months good till use date. I double bagged my dozen bag box to ensure they don't gain moisture during the few months it will take me to finish them all off. The timing of this purchase was perfect, since I'm trying to avoid bread cake cookie and pasta, so keeping rice cakes handing really helps fill that texture void. Rating: 5.0 Product: Orville Redenbacher's Gourmet Microwavable Popcorn, Natural Simply Salted 50% Less Fat, 3-Count Boxes 8.55 Oz (Pack of 12) Review: Amazon's description of this items is wrong; it's 2.9-ounce bags (total 36 bags, 104 ounces) each bag yields about 4.5 cups of popped corn. it contains Palm oil, not Soybean oil, and the ingredients are not all "natural"; it contains an organic Tocopherol preservative. Palm oil does give this popcorn a light buttery high note, but with triple the Salt and fat-calories compared to Lightly Salted Bearitos, dieters should avoid this. However it is a great alternative to full flavored salty microwave popcorn from most groceries. Product: Almond Breeze, Unsweetened, Vanilla, 32 oz. Review: When you get tired of soy milk, and want to splurge, try some almond milk. This brand is delicious, and not too dear. 05/29/2014
The price has gone up substantially. Check to see if local stores have a similar product for less. When I bought it in January of this year, it worked out to $2.38 a bag. Currently, it's $4.42 for the same amount. I'll have to rethink this.

Product:
Bob's Red Mill Flour Garbanzo Bean, 16-ounces (Pack of 4)
Review:
I've had a yen for my "super duper gut bombs" (oatmeal patties) but since I'm vegan now, it wasn't an option to make them with eggs. AHA! Garbanzo flour to the rescue and this brand is the best I've ever had. It held the patties together fully as well--or better--than eggs did. I'm a happy camper. BTW, I do the "throw together" method of cooking. Ingredients are quick oats, garbanzo flour, chopped fresh mushrooms, chopped onion, Braggs, coconut aminos, olive oil, garlic granules, Italian seasoning, sea salt and enough water to combine everything.  Baked them on an oiled cookie sheet @ 350 until brown, turned once. The mushrooms keep them moist. YUM!!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Fava Beans, 20 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
My doctor prescribed fava beans for my tremor in June of this year. Since then, I have bought boxes of fava beans. These are the best quality for the best price of any of the ones available and they aren't readily available! I have them on subscription to get the better price and use a package of them every three days or so. I have recommended them to others. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is because some of the beans are not completely peeled and I have to laboriously clean them off. Inevitably, there are little pieces of the germ under the "flap" of the bean that, for all the world, look like bugs when they're cooked. Otherwise, if you have to eat fava beans on a regular basis (I eat a cup of cooked beans twice a day) you can't go wrong with these.

Product: Solofill Cup, Refillable Cup For Keurig Single serve cups Brewers, Red and Black (Pack of 2) Review: For Christmas of 2011, a good friend of mine gave me a Solofill Reusable K-Cup. She knew that I have a Keurig 35 B30 Mini Brewer (Keurig 35 B30 Mini Personal Single-Serve Brewing System, Black) at work. I make at least two cups of coffee in the morning and sometimes one in the afternoon if I'm feeling sleepy. (I work two jobs and I am sleep deprived.) I've had this Keurig brewer for at least three years and I couldn't live without it. However, disposable K-Cups are expensive; this is why I purchased the Keurig My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter (Keurig My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter). At the time, I thought it was wonderful. It is a three-piece unit. A removable filter sits inside the reusable K-cup which has a top that screws on. Also, the Keurig brewer's filter holder has to be removed in order to insert the Keurig Reusable Filter. There is always the possibility that this filter holder could be damaged or lost. On a daily basis, I've been using the Solofill Reusable K-Cup for over seven months. It is much easier to operate and clean than the Keurig Reusable Filter. Also, the coffee tastes just as great; I use my favorite Starbucks Natural Fusions Ground Coffee, Vanilla Flavored ]. There are never any grounds in my coffee. My only concern was that the plastic hinge that connects the lid with the reusable K-Cup's body would eventually break but it hasn't. There are not any visible cracks, tears, shreds, etc. It looks nearly as good as when it was given to me as a Christmas gift. I no longer use my Keurig Reusable Filter, but I haven't thrown it away in case my Solofill Reusable K-Cup is lost or stolen. Several times I've accidentally left it in the break room after washing it. I could afford to buy another one. The Solofill Reusable K-Cup costs the same as a Keurig Reusable Filter. If you own one of the many varieties of Keurig single-serving brewing systems, then I highly recommend buying the Solofill Reusable K-Cup; it is easy to use, saves money and is very durable! Joseph B. Hoyos Rating: 5.0 Using the features, generate the proper review. If you haven't received some of the features, only make use of the provided ones. Product:
Sincerely Nuts Raw Brazil Nuts No Shell (2Lb Bag) | Premium Healthy Snack Food | Whole, Kosher, Vegan, Gluten Free | Keto & Paleo Diety Friendly | Gourmet Snack | Source of Vitamins & Minerals
Review:
These things are big fat plump hunks of deliciousness and pretty low in carbs (as nuts go).  I like mine without salt and extra crunchy (singed is good) so raw nuts are what I buy and then I give them a nice intense ride in the toaster oven.  I've been buying nuts online for years and have had some successes and some failures; these are a 100% success.  They are huge (some competitors' are a bit smaller), whole (not that I really mind fragments but there are none to be found here) and they taste like Brazil Nuts (I've had some that must have been sharing the production line with peanuts - I love peanuts but I don't want to taste them when I'm eating Brazil Nuts).  Very good stuff.

May 2016: just ordered a 3# bag because I have been going through these way too fast.  Best compliment I know how to give is to reorder!

5.0
Product:
Mauna Loa Macadamias, Unsalted Dry Roasted, 4.5-Ounce Containers (Pack of 6)
Review:
I am not a salt person - I'm on high blood pressure meds, yes, but have never been a big fan of salt except on french fries and onion rings (which I allow myself only infrequently) anyway.  It's hard to find good quality nuts of any kind that are unsalted.  These are first quality AND unsalted.  I eat them out of the can when I can't resist, but I mostly use them in stir-fry concoctions (the bottled sauces I use generally have way too much sodium all by themselves).  They are excellent with shrimp or with scallops.  Good stuff and the AMZN price (plus no tax and no shipping) makes them much more reasonable than local stores.

Review:
I'm doing the low carb/high fat lifestyle and one of the toughest things for me was/is walking away from noodles/pasta.  I allow myself this occasionally and it is a reasonably acceptable alternative to pasta.  I've always thought of pasta as a blank slate - it tastes like whatever you put on it - but this is a little different.  It doesn't taste like anything, no matter what you put on it, but it's *there* and provides some pasta-like texture and pasta-like interest in the dish.  I do enjoy it and will continue to buy it.  If you're avoiding carbs and think you have to swear off pasta completely, this really is worth a shot.

Bibigo Korean Gochujang Sauce, 11.46 Ounce, 2 Count
Review:
I'm all about the sauces - I claim to be able to cook but mostly I experiment with Indo-Asian condiments and noodles or vegetables and such.  If my guests like what I came up with I take the credit, otherwise I blame the sauce I snuck in on them.

Other reviewers have already pointed out that this is pretty thick - it's not a paste but it's definitely not watery thin, and it's not oily thin either (think of sesame oil or chili oil - it's not like that).  To my taste, both the sweet and spicy elements are right there prominently in your face without a lot of subtlety which suits me just fine.  There is a slight smokiness to the flavor and it has a pretty spicy kick for a finish so there's more to it than just fire and sugar.

I love hot stuff and can deal with quite a bit of heat, but I must say this would be a little over the top as the only sauce in, say, a stir fry.  The heat builds as you keep eating and it will get your attention.  (Lest you assume I'm a wimp, I'm the guy who brings his own chili oil/chili paste to the Asian buffet when a group of coworkers go out for lunch.)

I marinated some raw shrimp in it before steaming with veggies and sticky rice and that was a perfect use for it.  It's also great as a flavor variation if you like doctoring up ramen noodles as I do sometime.  But my favorite use so far is to add it to pizza - it enhances pretty much any variation.  I was an early adopter of Sriracha sauce for this purpose, 20+ years ago, and I completely burned out on that stuff a long time back.  This has about the same punch but a completely different taste that works with old-school pepperoni and red sauce, chicken and white sauce, olive oil based pizza, veggie, you name it.  Just a bit here and there as an enhancement and you can transform what was an excellent pizza pie into a completely different, but still excellent pizza pie.  A two-fer!

One caveat: Gochujang is a Korean staple, not an exotic rarity.  You can buy it in paste form for a lot less and mix up your own version of this sauce with, e.g., sesame oil and soy sauce and a few other odds and ends.  It's a convenience item and if you buy this product you are paying a premium for the convenience.

I racked my brain to justify fewer than 5 stars because this is a Vine review of a free product, the presence of which appears to cause some folks all kinds of heartburn.  Apparently the only proper atonement for receiving a review sample at no cost is to despise the product you're reviewing, but I think this stuff is really tasty so...five stars.  Haters gonna hate :-)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Jell-O Flan, 3-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 18)
Review:
My dad used to make creme caramel from scratch and it was a huge hit.  I tried this and the taste and texture are surprisingly similar, definitely a good enough substitute for the real thing.  The color is a little more custard-y yellow than blonde as I remember my father's version, but that's no big deal.  Would be 5 stars if they doubled the amount of caramel sauce included in each box - it's tasty, but there could be more of it!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Bar Harbor Sauce, Red Clam, 10.5 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I'm a single guy who likes to eat well and watch my weight at the same time, but I'm a lazy chef so I look for shortcuts like this.  I sauteed some shrimp in 1 can of this (1 can = 300 calories, supposedly 10 servings - hah!).  Right at the end I added a healthy dollop of cooking sherry and a goodly sprinkle of nutmet.  Served it over a 90-second-microwave bag of brown & wild rice in a bowl with a microwave bag of frozen mixed veggies on the side and that made a very fine meal with minimal prep and minimal cleanup.  A sprinkle of sliced green onions on top at serving is a good idea, but the reader should know that I sprinkle green onions on just about everything but breakfast cereal.  If you count grits and/or oatmeal as breakfast cereal, then I use green onions on breakfast cereal too.

I got the idea about adding the sherry and nutmeg from a review on another site which pointed out that even though sherry is one of the ingredients, it cooks off immediately and was undetectable in the product.  I tasted it and agreed, so added the sherry at the last minute.  The same reviewer recommended the nutmeg so I added that too.

I've looked at recipes for "real" Newburg sauce and I know it's better, but I also know I'm too lazy to make up a short shelf life batch myself.  I also know if I went out and ordered fill-in-the-blank Newburg at a restaurant I'd pay north of $40 for the plate.  This works for me; I'll be ordering it again.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Panda Sauce For Broccoli Beef, 8-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
This is a good base for doctoring up with multiple ingredients, and it works just as well if you just throw in some stew beef and broccoli florets.  I generally throw in at least some unsalted toasted almonds and chopped scallions.  It's hard to mess this up.  Nice flavor!

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Crunchmaster Crackers Multi-Seed Orginal - 2 / 4.5 Oz Bags Gluten Free Review: I absolutely love these Crunchmaster crackers! I discovered them by accident when my wife asked me to go to the supermarket to get some Mary's Gone Crackers, Original, 6.5 Ounce or an equivalent brown rice cracker. They were too expensive at $5+ a box, so I grabbed 2 of these instead. They're thin, crunchy, and super tasty. We like these better because they're airy. Mary's is too dense. Made with wholesome ingredients, I don't have to feel bad about eating these as a snack. There aren't any ingredients you can't pronounce, and I feel good that they're high quality ingredients-- certified gluten-free and non-GMO verified. One serving is 140 calories, with 45 of them being fat. Sodium content is low at 5% of your daily recommended intake, while giving you 8% of your daily fiber. I've also tried the Sea Salt flavor, but didn't like it as much. The Original is a lot better, in my opinion. First, the shape is more fun (hexagons) and it's flavored with tamari soy sauce. The sesame taste is also very pronounced. I got them from Stop & Shop for $2.50 a bag on sale. I'll gladly buy these again. Currently, they are available on AmazonFresh for the same price. Kids love these too. My friend's 3 year old kept coming back for more! Rating: 5.0 Product: Quaker Yogurt Chewy Granola Bar, Blueberry, 6.1-Ounce Packages (Pack of 6) Review: Think of this as a candy/snack bar rather than a granola bar and you will not be disappointed. It's very sweet and tasty, but there's little or no nutritional value in here, despite being made from oats. The product is heavily processed and definitely what anyone would call healthy. Made with natural and artificial flavors, the ingredients list is very long (see bottom of review). It's loaded with sugar and not something you want to give yourself or your kids on a regular basis. Note how many times sugar or its variants appear in the list (glucose, fructose). Each bar is 1.23 oz. Daily value: Fiber 1g (5%), Vitamin A (0%), Vitamin C (0%), Calcium (10%), Iron (2%). 150 calories per bar (40 from fat), 11g of sugar. I'm giving the product 4 stars based on taste and texture. It's chewy, but not hard like Nature Valley granola bars. Ingredients: granola (whole grain rolled oats, whole grain rolled wheat, brown sugar, sunflower oil, high fructose corn syrup, dried coconut, honey, sodium bicarbonate, natural flavor, whey and whey protein concentrate), yogurt flavored coating (sugar, palm kernel and palm oil, whey protein concentrate, yogurt flavored powder, soy lecithin, natural flavor, artificial color, citric acid, salt), corn syrup, high fructose corn syrup, brown rice crisp (whole grain brown rice, sugar, malted barley flour, salt), brown sugar, glycerin, vegetable shortening (canola oil, palm and palm kernel oils), corn flakes (milled corn, sugar, salt, malted barley extract), whey mineral concentrate, oat flour, rice flour, sweetened dried strawberries (glucose syrup, strawberries, high fructose corn syrup, modified potato starch, sodium alginate), corn syrup solids, sorbitol, salt, sugar, modified food starch, soy lecithin, natural flavor, malted barley flour, sodium bicarbonate, BHT (a preservative), citric acid, water. Made in Canada. Rating: 4.0 Product: Thai Kitchen Gluten Free Green Curry Paste, 4 oz Review: I used to buy this Thai Kitchen red curry paste when I was in college. Sadly, the recipe seems to have changed. It lacks flavor and intensity. I had to use a whole jar, whereas in the past, I could make a whole pot of soup with as little as a third of a jar. I'm going back to buying Thai red curry from Asian supermarkets. Rating: 1.0 Product: Organic Chocolate Chip Pancake and Waffle Mix by Birch Benders, Whole Grain, Non-GMO, 16oz Review: * NOTE: This review is for the Organic Pancake and Waffle Mix. (Several varieties are co-mingled on this page.) * We didn't like this pancake mix. In terms of ease, the instructions say to just add water, but the resulting taste is not very good if you do just that. My wife and I made them several times over the last week and were not satisfied with the flavor and texture. She said they were "mushy". I didn't like that they weren't fluffy. They are dense and too elastic, but not in a good way. This is owing to the potato starch and cassava starch in the recipe. When I made them, one side looked wrinkly when I flipped them prematurely, due to how potato starch cooks. To me, pancakes should be airy and spongey. Good pancakes sop up the syrup poured on top of them. These don't do that. Making them with eggs greatly improves the appearance and taste, but they're still not as good as all flour pancakes. Rating: 3.0 Product: Blue Diamond Almonds, Bold Habanero BBQ, 16 Ounce (Pack of 3) Review: The heat here is very very mild. I've had habanero sauces and chips that were so hot they made me cry for help. These are not like that. Only occasionally will you get a little kick. It's actually mostly tangy and tomato-y. The dusting of flavoring on the outside of the nuts will coat your fingers in an orange film. Satisfyingly crunchy and tangy, it's really hard to stop eating these. Even though the habanero kick isn't there as promised on the label, it's still really tasty. I highly recommend these. Sodium content is very low at 4% per serving. High in Vitamin E (35%) and magnesium (20%). This 1 pound bag (x3 bags) is a great deal compared to buying the 6 oz tins at the store, however, when my local Walgreens has buy 1 get 1, the price drops to about $0.35/oz. Blue Diamond makes about 8 other flavors that I know of. My favorites are the Soy Wasabi, Honey Roasted, Smokehouse, Dijon Mustard. Rating: 4.0 Product: HEALTH WARRIOR Chia Bars, Acai Berry, Gluten Free, Vegan, 25g bars, 15 Count Review:
    I'm not a huge fan of snack bars like Clif Bars, but I love these. Chia seeds may seem like the latest health food craze, but they've actually been eaten for thousands of years by peoples in Meso-America. Valued for their dense nutritional content, they were an important food crop for the Mayans, not just the stuff covering tacky terracotta heads. I've been eating them for a number of years for their high protein content, fiber, and high levels of plant-based Omega-3 fatty acids. Acai berry is another health food supplement additive. It's been around for longer (mostly for use in juices and shakes) and many people have heard of it, even if just by name. They are native to South America and grow on palm trees like a huge cluster of grapes. It's much better tasting than the coffee one, in my opinion. The coffee one doesn't taste much like coffee (or a really weak coffee). I love the way these bars are moist, with a satisfyingly dense and chewy mouth-feel. Chia seeds themselves don't have much of a taste, but they provide a lot of crunchy texture like poppy seeds or sesame seeds. The taste of the bar is tart and sweet, and all in balance. I don't think they're ideal for intense sports activity unless you have water readily available, however, due to the nature of how chia seeds interact with liquid (e.g. saliva) in your mouth. After finishing the bar, you may feel some loose residual seeds just kind of hanging out in your mouth. They will require sloshing out with water to clean up. For me, they don't get stuck in my teeth, but feeling around with my tongue, there are loose seed particles around the inside the mouth like the cheek pockets. That's a natural property of chia seeds themselves and not a fault of this product since chia seeds swells in water and form a sticky, gelatinous outer coating. My only problem with this product is how expensive it is for how small it is. That's partly a result of high demand for chia seeds, which has sent prices quadrupling or more since I started eating them 4 years ago. I do love these bars and don't feel guilty eating them because they are so packed with nutrients. Rating: 5.0 Product: FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz Review: I'm not sure you need to read a review on peanuts. But here goes. What you see is what you get, folks. This is a jar of peanuts. Jar is plastic and recyclable, with a freshness seal under the lid to peel away. Or keep it partially attached like I do. The nuts are in mostly halves (with a scattering of wholes), and pretty much like you see in the photo, though the image has been touched up to remove the dust that settled at the bottom of the can. The peanuts in the picture look too clean compared to the real thing. A fair percentage of the peanuts still have some of their outer skin on them. I'd say about 10% or less do. This is bonus to me, since some fiber is retained. Peanuts are high in fiber and protein. Taste is about as expected, with a good crunchiness. If you are watching your sodium intake like I am, go for the unsalted variety. The peanuts can also be ground up for things like Thai dishes or ice cream topping. Label says "Packed in USA". No mention of where they are grown. Rating: 5.0 Product: Sabra, Roasted Garlic Hummus, 10 oz Review: Sabra roasted garlic hummus is without a doubt my favorite flavor. I get a container of it every time I buy hummus. Sabra and Tribe are the two brands most common in my area, and I buy whichever is on special (usually 2/$5). It keeps in the fridge for up to a month, even if opened but your mileage may vary. I love it with baby carrots. I really like the large scoop of minced garlic on top. It offers a different texture so the hummus doesn't get boring. Ingredients: Cooked Chickpeas (Chickpeas [Garbanzos], Water), Tahini (Ground Sesame), Soybean Oil, Garlic, Salt, Citric Acid, Red Bell Pepper, Potassium Sorbate Added to Maintain Freshness, Natural Flavors, Spices. It's low sodium, and one tub contains 10 servings. If you ate the whole thing at once, it'd be only 700 calories and 50% of your daily salt intake. I appreciate Sabra's use on non-GMO soybean oil. Soybeans and corn are the two most heavily GMO'ed food ingredients in use today. Rating: 5.0 Product: POPCORNERS Cheddar Feel-Good, Popcorn Chips (5oz/12 Pack) Review: I got these on a recent Jet Blue flight and were very pleased with them. They're crunchy like nachos, but have a meatier texture. The surface of the chip has lots of bumps and bubbles that you can see and taste. They add a nice mouth-feel and crunch to the overall experience of eating these chips. One bag has only 140 calories (35 from fat) and very low sodium (110 mg), so you can eat a whole bag without feeling much guilt. There are no artificial additives or preservatives in this product. The only comment I have is that the taste is a bit sweet because of added sugar. I prefer a stronger salt taste. Popcorners are also relatively hard to find. After having these on the flight, I looked for them at a local Boston supermarket. I only found Kettle, but none of the other flavors (butter, sea salt, white cheddar, cheesy jalapeno). An excellent and healthy snack. Rating: 5.0 Product: Pacific Foods Hazelnut Chocolate Plant-Based Beverage, 8oz, 24-pack Review: I bought a 12 pack of this after trying the Pacific Natural regular hazelnut milk. I love this stuff! I saved about $6 using Subscribe & Save versus going to the store. I feel good about supporting this company because they believe in responsible, sustainable farming. But besides that, this milk is just delicious. Room temperature or chilled, it's equally tasty. I mixed it with coffee this morning and it's great too. I also dilute it sometimes with regular skim milk to dial down the sweetness. The box arrives well packaged. It's a box inside a box. The inner box is bubble-wrapped for extra protection. Unopened, the cartons do not need refrigeration and can be stored on a shelf. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Spicely Organic Coriander Seeds Whole (0.30 OZ ecoBox) Review: These coriander seeds has some really strong flavor to it. They are not the hardcore type of spice but more mild and soothing. The seeds are whole and dried so they're easy to use in cooking. I personally grind them into smaller pieces for meat dishes. The reason why this seed goes great with meat dishes is because it has a citrus or lemony fragrance. You can throw in the seeds when the oil is hot and let it soak up all the flavor then remove the seeds or you can leave it in there. That is up to you. For vegetable dishes I like to remove the seeds after the oil are soaked up in the flavor. You can use the oil for salad dressing or simply for cooking. For the benefits of eating this seed/culinary practice; - Control of Blood Sugar (great for people who are diabetic) - Contains all sort of wonderful minerals such as iron, copper, calcium, potassium, manganese, zinc and also fiber. - Contains Vitamin A, K, and C - Aids digestion I have received a reduced price for the coriander seeds for testing/reviewing purposes. All of my reviews are 100% honest and from my own experience. I do not promise a good rating. I am not affiliated with this company nor compensated in any way. Thank you for reading and I hope this review will help you in your purchase. Rating: 5.0 Product: Organic ACAI Powder (Freeze-Dried) - 4oz Resealable Bag - 100% Raw Antioxidant Superfood Berry From Brazil - by Feel Good Organics Review: This is my first time having acai powder or anything with acai in it. My first impression was that this acai berry smells very similar and almost identical to blueberry. Acai powder is packed with goodies for your body such as antioxidant, fiber, vitamin A and C. It is a great vegan, gluten free treat and very healthy. The powder is very dark in color. I tasted the powder raw and it's actually pretty good. Leaves a slight sweet aftertaste. I don't have a blender which I hope to get one soon to experiment more with this acai powder. I will mix it with yogurt next time I purchase some too. What I did here was taking: - 2 teaspoons of acai - 1 teaspoon of matcha (green tea powder) with a bit of hot water. I whisk them together with a chasen and the result was a dark green colored tea. Then I added coconut milk and mixed that good. Last but not least I sprinkled a pinch of the acai powder. It seems to me that acai powder doesn't dissolve so easily and need a good whisk or blend. At the end of the last sip, I noticed some dark residue left on the bottom. It's a bit gritty or crunchy. I think it's from the seeds of the acai berry. The taste is superb and healthy and it is organic as labeled. I have received a reduced price for the acai powder for testing/reviewing purposes. All of my reviews are 100% honest and from my own experience. I do not promise a good rating. I am not affiliated with this company nor compensated in any way. Thank you for reading and I hope this review will help you in your purchase. Rating: 5.0 Product: Organic Matcha Green Tea Powder - Japanese Culinary Grade Matcha - 4 oz (113 grams) - Increases Energy and Focus and Naturally Supports Weight Loss - From Kiss Me Organics Review: This is a large bag 4 Oz of organic cooking grade matcha from Kiss Me Organics. First of all I was running out of ceremonial grade matcha and I am FRICKING happy that I got to review this. And yes I did receive a discount for the matcha to test and review. All of my feedback and review are 100% honest and my own. This organic matcha is a product of Japan and it smells absolutely amazing. Compare to the organic matcha that was product of China you can easily distinguish the difference between them. The organic matcha from Japan smells like REAL fresh and good quality matcha. From this experience I will never buy matcha that are from China EVEN if they are organics. Compare to cooking grade matcha from China I'd say this matcha would be a ceremonial grade. LOL. There is a notice on the back that it is best to consume the whole bag within 2 months upon opening. I might just squeeze it to 3 months because I will use this for drinking mainly since it tastes almost as good as ceremonial grade. Of course it is not ceremonial grade because you can tell by the color and smell. The color is still very green but with a slight touch of yellow. The smell is extremely green and fresh like real green tea. It took me into my imagination of nature Anyways lets get to the good part shall we. I put about a teaspoon of the matcha into a small bowl. I smooth out some of the clumps with the spoon. Slowly pour the hot water and mix until the matcha dissolves. As you can see in the last picture I added some milk to the matcha. The texture is very smooth and creamy. The taste is exceptional! I can still taste the matcha and it is very fresh. If you want to drink this matcha alone, it might be bitter for you. I added Premium Organic Stevia Powder 30g - USDA Certified All Natural Alternative Sweetener 320x Sweeter than Sugar No Artificial additives & fillers ingredients, Industrial Grade Highly Concentrated Extract to make it sweeter. Without adding sugar. I have a BBQ party coming up and I cant wait to share this with everyone! I will serve it as tea, latte and sprinkle on ice cream. Don't be shy to explore different recipes with this matcha! Rating: 5.0 Product: Little Duck Organics, I Love Tiny Fruits, 100% Organic Freeze Dried Snacks, Apple and Banana, 6 Count Review: This super healthy snack is delightfully delicious. It is sweet but there is no added sugar. The only ingredients are banana and blueberry. It is certified organic and Non GMO. I do have to point out a whooping $20 a pouch is incredibly expensive. It's not surprising that the pouch is very light because the fruits are freeze dried. Also the ratio of banana to blueberry is like 3:10 which is uncalled for. If you can afford it definitely give it a try, you won't be disappointed in taste wise. The banana bits texture is similar to rice puffs or rice crispy. It is puffy and fun to bite into. While the blueberry are either crunchy or chewy. Rating: 4.0 Product: CHOMPS Grass Fed Beef Jerky Snack Sticks, Paleo & Keto Friendly, Whole30 Approved, Non-GMO Gluten & Sugar Free 100 Calorie Snacks, 1.15 Ounce Stick, Pack of 24 Review: Literally just bought this jerky and it has an expiration date of 1 month. Bought on july, expires august... The jalapeo jerky is more disappointing than the expiration date. The spice is bland and feels like its just pepper. This is not even spicy. Wheel shows right on the hot but this is definitely not hot at all. Rating: 1.0 Product: Japan Ceremonial 100% Wholesome Organic Matcha Green Tea Powder, Diet Drink, Detox, Energy Booster Review: First of all I want to thank the seller for shipping Jun Nippon Matcha directly to me. I received this product exchange for my honest and unbiased review and feedback The packaging was simple and efficient which I always come to appreciate. I am very sensitive and picky when it comes to matcha because every little detail count matters to me; The color, scent, texture and taste. Jun Nippon Matcha almost hit a perfect score: - The color of the Matcha was of a fresh bright spring green which I rate it 5 out of 5 - The scent was a light earthy green tea which received a 5 out of 5 - The texture is very smooth and had little to no clumps 5 out of 5 (thanks to the packaging as well). - The taste is definitely very green and smooth. Sweet at first sip. After taste was slightly bitter. However comparing it to the other ceremonial matcha that Ive tested it is a slightly lower quality. Therefore I gave it a 4 out of 5. Ive tried drinking the matcha as it is and Ive also mixed it with yogurt which tastes amazing. A sifter helped out a lot so its very necessary. The best way to get rid of clumps is with a sifter AND adding the hot water little by little as you mix in the cup or bowl. You should not just pour all the hot water in at once because that would form clumps. I also did the same with the yogurt. I used organic whole milk yogurt (unsweetened) because it is healthy and has a very thick and creamy texture. I find that the only kind of yogurt fit for this high quality matcha. I used about 5 table spoon of the yogurt and 2 teaspoon of matcha. I sprinkled a little amount of the matcha on top of the yogurt and mix and a little more and repeat. The result is a light creamy green yogurt treat. You can add a little bit of honey and mix well. You can consume the yogurt OR it can also be used for a face mask. Since matcha is anti-inflammatory, high in antioxidant and full of nutrient it is perfect for treating acne. It will also give the face a natural glow. Rating: 5.0 Product: Vanilla Bean Grinder, Whole Dried Vanilla Beans For Grinding Vanilla Powder Flakes Into Recipes, Drinks, Smoothies, Soups, Add Fresh Vanilla Flavor to Anything (2 Grinders) Review: These bourbon vanilla beans are from Madagascar. The process is dried then cut up into small chunks. Vanilla bean contains some minerals that the body needs, such as; magnesium, potassium and calcium. It is also known as an aphrodisiac. The vanilla chunks itself smells very intense and appetizing. They do have a slight liquorice aroma. I added some to my cinnamon milk tea and I could taste the fresh vanilla flavor. I had some residue left on the bottom of my cup after finishing and I scooped the remaining powder and just ate them. They were tasty and a bit chewy. I noticed that vanilla ice cream I purchased in the past had these small dark particles are actually the same as what Im getting right now. These vanilla chunks will come handy for upcoming Summer treats. Notice that there is a built in grinder. Its a simple and convenient to grind the chunks into fine powder. Sometimes when I grind the chunks, I get a couple pieces that I can chew on. Its not the best grinder but its really convenient. The way I use the grinder is just like traditional pepper shaker that has a grinding mechanism on the bottom. You twist a couple times facing down and viola. If you want to get more of a powder consistency you might want to use a different grinder or do it manually with mortar and pestle. Rating: 5.0 Product: Rigoni Di Asiago Nocciolata Organic Hazelnut Spread, Cocoa and Milk, 9.52 Ounce Jar Review: I recently heard of this organic hazelnut spread and went off to find one. It's fairly priced depending on where you buy it. I paid about half of what's priced on amazon in store. It is certified organic and healthy. No corn syrup and crap. I hit off with Nocciolata quickly and became best friends. I usually don't like to overdose on anything but I think I overate a little of the spread, raw. It is slight chunky. Smooth, rich, intense and delightfully sweet. According to the nutrition facts. serving size: 2 TBSP (34 g) contains 18 g of sugar. Ok that is quite a lot of sugar. But it says cane sugar so I'm going to eat the whole jar tonight. The full ingredient consist of; cane sugar, hazelnut paste, sunflower oil, skim milk powder, cocoa powder, cocoa butter, sunflower lecithin, vanilla extract. Rating: 5.0 Product: Mott's Medleys Fruit Snacks, Assorted Fruit Gluten Free Snacks, Family Size, 40 Pouches, 0.8 oz Each Review: I was looking around for fruit snacks and stumbled across this family sized box. It's cheap and contains 40 pouches, so I bought it. I grabbed 2 pouches after I had my lunch because I Was craving something sweet. I ate the first pouch without looking at the gummy twice. They were very sticky and I had a hard time trying to get it off my teeth. Also very sweet and yummy. I opened the second pouch. My first gummy from that pouch was a grape gummy and it was good too. The second gummy was an apple shaped and it HAD SOMETHING INSIDE. It looked like something orange because it's inside the gummy.. I flipped out and took out my phone to take photos of it. OMG ARE YOU FLIPPING SERIOUS. I don't know what it is pull the gummy and inside was this white powder with some green residue. It look disgusting. WHAT IF IT'S FUNGUS OR SOMETHING. I was so shocked because this is only my second pouch from the 40 others. I think I'm going to throw out the whole box after writing this review. I noticed the box says no colors from artificial sources, no artificial flavors and vitamin but it does NOT Important note*** Contain GMO: modified corn starch. It's cute how they added the ingredient list because of my review ;) Do your kids a favor. Don't buy them this. Rating: 1.0 Product: Naked Cow All Natural Grass Fed Beef Jerky - HONEY 3 Pack Review: I like the first bite and taste then everything went sour during the middle. This jerky has a rotten taste. The meat must've had been rotten before all the processing. You can taste the death in it. golds.output: I tried this spearmint gum and I must say I was a bit disappointed.  The flavor is good, but it doesn't last long.  I like that it's sugar-free and made with natural ingredients, but the aftertaste is not pleasant.  I would recommend this gum to those who are looking for a sugar-free option, but it's not my favorite.

Product:
FISHER Chef's Naturals Walnut Halves & Pieces, No Preservatives, Non-GMO, 16 oz
Review:
These are top quality walnuts!  I had to taste them as soon as I opened the package and I am pleasantly surprised!  They taste fresh and delicious!  Chopped uniformly and not too fine.  These walnuts are recipe ready.  I like the size of the package because I have no fear that I will be able to use them before they go bad.  They are also okay for storing in the freezer.  The resealable bag stands on its own, so there is less risk of spillage when you are using them or just eating from the bag.  These walnuts only have 4 grams of carbohydrates per serving and 2 grams of fiber which makes them perfect for anyone on a low carb diet.  I will be purchasing more Fisher nuts!  The best by date on the package is 8/31/18.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
ORCHARD VALLEY HARVEST Cranberry Almond Cashew Trail Mix, Non-GMO, No Artificial Ingredients, 1 oz (Pack of 8)
Review:
The Orchard Valley Harvest Dark Chocolate almonds are a very healthy snack. They are made with all natural ingredients and taste very good. They can be enjoyed any time of the day and by all ages. These chocolate almonds have a good flavor and can be addictive. I would recommend these as a healthy snack for those who are dieting, vegan, or health conscious.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Viva Naturals Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, 32 Ounce
Review:
This is the best of the extra virgin coconut oil products that I have tried.  The texture is rich and creamy, it's dissolves perfectly and it does not have hard clumps.  The fragrance is good and and it tastes fine.  I would recommend this brand to anyone looking for a good all purpose coconut oil.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Amazon Brand - Happy Belly Yogurt Trail Mix, 44 oz
Review:
This is even better than I thought it would be!  The nut is excellent.  It is basically good mixed nuts.  The dried fruits taste great.  They aren't too sweet, so even though I am diabetic I was able to eat them without my blood sugar going up too much.  Sweetened fruits can have a negative effect on me.  The yogurt drops don't taste like traditional yogurt, in my opinion they taste like white chocolate.  This is the best trail mixes that I have ever tried.  I would like to continue getting this.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Truvia Spoonable Natural Stevia Sweetener, 9.8 oz Jar
Review:
I have been using sugar substitutes for years.  This is the first time that I have tried Truvia.  I use Erythritol and Stevia separately a lot.  I like the taste of both even though Erythritol can have a cool aftertaste.  This is excellent for sweetening hot beverages.  It tastes good and melts quickly.  My only problem with it is that it doesn't melt easily in cold beverages.  I use this in my coffee and hot tea, but I don't like to use it in any cold beverages because there is usually a undissolved residue in the bottom.  This is a very good sugar substitute and I like the convenience of the spoonable container.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Yogi Tea - Vanilla Spice Perfect Energy - Energizes and Supports Focus - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total
Review:
If you love mint, then you will like this tea.  If you only like mint as an added flavor note, then this may be a bit too intense for you.  I enjoyed the flavor.  I had not had mint tea before, but I love lots of different teas.  I was surprised at how much it reminded me of eating food with chewing gum in your mouth if you eat anything with it.  I like mine sweet and it isn't bad with lemon if you like it that way.  The mint is dominant and strong, so it may not be suited to all tastes.  I didn't really get an energy burst from it, so I can't really comment on how that feels.  I probably wouldn't regularly buy it, but it isn't bad.  If you like mint, give it a try.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Amazon Brand - Happy Belly Sweetened Dried Mango Slices, 12 Ounce Pack of 2
Review:
These are very good quality dried mango slices.  The slices clearly come from ripe fruit that is process while fresh.  The texture is chewy and flexible instead of tough like some other brands.  The slices are also large rather than chopped up which makes them perfect for eating alone and easily chopped to add to other things.  The only problem that I have with them is the amount of sugar that they are coated in.  Mangoes are already a naturally sweet fruit and with so much sugar added they become more like eating candy than a good healthy treat.  My husband loves mangoes, but he thinks that these are too sweet.  We prefer less sugar on dried fruits in general and I like to get them unsweetened when possible.  Happy Belly has high quality products, so I would recommend that you give these a try if you like dried mangoes.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Carrington Farms Gluten Free, Unrefined, Cold Pressed, Virgin Organic Coconut Oil, 54 oz. (Ounce), Coconut Oil For Skin & Hair Care, Cooking, Baking, Smoothies – Packaging May Vary
Review:
The scent is a bit odd.  I didn't eat any, so I can't comment on the taste.  I'm going back to using my old brand.  This may be cheaper, but it's not worth it.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Coconut Coffee-made with real, whole coconuts and 100% Columbian Coffee
Review:
My husband bought this after tasting a sample at Costco.  He loves it, but I can't drink it.  It is too sweet for me.  I can barely drink it.  I read the ingredients, then I knew why.  The first ingredient is the sugar!  The second is coconut the third is the coffee.  I just figured that the coffee would be first.  At least second.  I never imagined that a coffee would have more sugar than coffee.  The only way that I could drink this is if it was mixed with plain coffee.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Thai Kitchen Coconut Milk, 13.66 fl oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
I used to think that this was the best coconut milk, but the quality has changed.  The milk is separated.  I thought that it was because I got my delivery during the winter and it may have gotten too cold, but when I got another case it had the same problem.  In my last delivery 5 of the 6 cans were dented in multiple areas.  The box that they were packed in was in perfect condition,  so they were dented before they were packed.  I will be cancelling my subscription for this product.
Rating:
1.0

Review:

golds.output: I think this Chobani Non-Fat Greek Yogurt is a fine product, though I'm not sure it's a winner.  The basic idea was to mix a high-quality Greek yogurt with blueberry, and it should have worked, but I just think they could have done a better job with the flavor.  Maybe they just opted for a different type of blueberry or something, but this yogurt has a somewhat unpleasant sweetness to it.  I've tried it again and again, hoping I'd get used to the difference, but in the end I just think it's not as good as some other brands I've had.

You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:

Product:
Tabasco Worcestershire Sauce, 5 Ounce
Review:
I think that the Tabasco folks tried sincerely to make this a good sauce: the basic idea was to mix a high-quality Worcestershire with Tabasco.  It should have worked, but I just think they misunderstood the things that make the classic Worcestershire so appealing.  Maybe they just opted for smoked anchovies or something, but this sauce has an unpleasant smoky, almost bacon-y undertone to it.  I've tried it again and again, hoping I'd get used to the difference, but in the end I had to chuck it in the trash.  From a man who has ordered and enjoyed multiple gallon jugs of Tabasco Regular and Habanero Sauces: this one is just not a winner.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Monin Flavored Syrup, Blueberry, 33.8-Ounce Plastic Bottles (Pack of 4)
Review:
Your only problem after buying this is deciding all the amazing things you will put it in.  Coffee, mochas, ice cream, yogurt, um, drinks, desserts, I could go on.  If you just compute the price per serving, it's an unreal bargain for such sweet delight.  Bonus tip: a good dash in horse feed and they will love you, complete with cartoon hearts appearing over their heads when you show up....
Rating:
5.0

Clif Bar Variety Pack, Chocolate Chip, Crunchy Peanut Butter, 2.4 oz.  Nutrition Bars, 24 Count
Review:
Love the CLIF Chocolate Chip, and love their Peanut Butter: now science has found a way to put both into a single box(!)  The bars looked like they had suffered a bit in shipment, but that's not the product's fault.  Fresh, crunchy, delicious snacks.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 India Tree Brown European-Style Sugar Cubes, 12 oz Bag (Pack of 3) 
Review:
I've tasted a lot of underprocessed, raw, or natural sugars, and chewed on sugar cane in my day, so I think I know what I like: something that tastes like dried sugar cane juice.  One taste, and I'm pretty convinced this is the real thing, authentic top-shelf brown sugar in convenient, attractive cube form.  Does take a little stirring to dissolve, but if it didn't I would be highly suspicious!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Hoosier Hill Farm All American Dairy Whole Milk Powder 1 lb
Review:
Sorry, but this just doesn't mix in cold water nearly as well as Peak brand does.  Tastes fine, but has these thick clumps that never dissolve.  That's a real issue, unfortunately....

3.0

Barbera Frantoia Sicilian Extra Virgin Olive Oil, 33.8-Ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
Just a wonderful product, a very dependably delicious olive oil that's good for any purpose.  My favorite use?  A simple classic dressing for pasta.  Handsomely bottled, too -- makes a great gift.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Ortiz Bonito Del Norte Tuna In Olive OIl 3.95 oz Oval Tin (Spain) 12 pack
Review:
Ah, just one taste of this fine white tuna brings back memories -- memories of how good the major-brand US tuna was like 30 years ago.  Alas, those days are gone -- the insect and bird brands serve up fragmented grayish mush as often as not.  But Ortiz -- flaky white tuna bursting with tuna flavor without excess fishiness or off-notes.

About the worst criticism is that the cans aren't 100% full, but it's still great for the money.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Organic Greenhouse Red On-The-Vine Tomatoes, 1 lb
Review:
Well, though fine tomatoes, these could have been riper.  Delivered in a nice, safe plastic container to protect from damage.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Tonnino Ventresca Tuna in Olive Oil 6.7 oz. Jars Pack of 6
Review:
The quality is beyond dispute -- this is true Costa Rican Tuna Ventresca, in nice clean solid fillets the way it was meant to be.  The bottle is topped-off with olive oil, which is fine with me, though some might want to drain the fishy oil off before serving.

The only negative I see is the slight-to-moderate saltiness of the product: personally, I crave salt constantly, so this is a non-issue for me.  But those who dislike salt (be it for health reasons or mere taste), these *might* be a little too much salt-wise.

One last point: like all well-packed tuna, you can expect the expiration date of the product to be 1-2 years from the day you receive it, and it is truly fine up to that very date.  But once you open the bottle?  Things are much different.  Guidelines basically suggest that tuna begins spoiling about three days after opening, assuming refrigeration of course.  But unless you completely forget about the half-eaten tuna. that is plenty of time for even the lightest of eaters (a small cat, say) to polish off this delicacy.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Tabasco Habanero Pepper Sauce, 5 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
Assuming you're a hot hot sauce fan, and can handle the vivid character of Tabasco Habanero, it's excellent on just about anything but ice cream.  The first time I had it (like 10-15 years ago), I remember used about two drops on a burrito and couldn't even go to work the next day, but now a couple of teaspoons per meal really hits the spot.  This is a pretty unique product, since it not only has actual classic Tabasco sauce in it for that beloved old-time hot flavor, plus a generous amount of Habanero peppers: it's actually a Jamaican style sauce.  That means that it has all this sweet, mild tropical fruity stuff in it, like bananas and mangoes, and then adds Habanero liquid electric fire to put a Caribbean blaze into almost any possible food.  Seriously, if I was forced to eat a cardboard box, with enough of this condiment, I would probably enjoy it.
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Product:
Por Kwan Pho Vietnamese Beef Flavor Paste - 8 oz x 2 jars
Review:
This isn't bad but it isn't that great either. The Pho Beef should really be called "Faux" beef as it is artificial beef flavor. Not bad if you take beef bones and add this too them but straight up out of the jar it is quite gross and will leave you with high blood pressure and swollen eyes from all the salt they loaded into this. Review:
This was 7.85 cents as are all the others flavors in the 10oz container. They raised it to 18.15, which is a ripoff. You can buy 3 for that price in any Asian market.
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Giant Crab Flavored Shrimp Chips (3 X 200g Boxes)
Review:
These are great! They taste just like prawn chips hard to tell difference even though they are crab. These are the same chips they use on the Pu-Pu platters here in Rhode Island.in some of the better Chinese restaurants. They are really easy to make and fun to watch as they grow in the oil. All you do is take a frying pan and put an inch of oil in, when oil is hot at about 350 drop these little wafers in and they will instantly grow to 3 to 4 times their size. They poof up and that is it, just remove them from oil and serve. Be careful to not make oil too hot as these burn easily. Everyone in my family loves these including my dogs and the parrot.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
College Inn Culinary Broth Thai Coconut Curry, 32-Ounce (Pack of 6 )
Review:
This stuff is pretty good. When opening it , it has a strong smell much like soap or perfume. I tasted it straight up and thought it was weird and not something I would like. I then decided to make rice with it.  I used 2 cups of this with 1 cup Basmati rice and about 1/2 lb of  peeled raw shrimp, 1 tablespoon freeze dried shallots(Harmony house brand) , threw everything in pan and cooked it for the 10-15 minutes that the rice needed and wow!  It came out excellent! The flavor of coconut is there along with cilantro and slight hint of curry and tiny bit of heat.

I also used this as a base for an Indian chicken curry and have to say it made it much better than usual. I prefer the Indian style curry to Thai and this is just perfect in it. As a soup base I would recommend equal parts of homemade chicken stock as this stuff is overpowering otherwise. By the way I used Patak's mild curry paste with this. You can spice it up and add more heat as you like as the others are just too hot for my taste. The price is right and I like this size, you can refrigerate the leftovers or freeze it in small container.
Rating:
4.0

NongShim Bowl Noodle Soup, Spicy Shrimp, 3.03 Ounce (Pack of 12)

4.0

Bisto for Chicken Gravy Granules (170g)
Review:

5.0

Nongshim Fresh Udon Bowl (pack of 6)
Review:
I love Nongshim noodles and soups but this one is not as good as the others. The noodles however are excellent, big fat round Udon noodles, the broth however tastes like sweetened soy sauce. The dry packet is OK with little bits of rubber like surimi fake crab and green onion, It just is not nearly as good as their other varieties. The bowl is a big one and I ended up using the noodles by themselves in my chicken soup, which was great!  These are also rather expensive and I would not buy them again.. Oh well live and learn.

I think it is better than Schriacha sauce, you just have to be careful and use a small amount till you know how strong it is and then you will be adding  it to everything. I do a quick dipping sauce with soy sauce, vinegar, sugar and this oil. Great for dumplings! This is a staple that everyone should have in kitchen.
Rating:
5.0

Lee Kum Kee Hoisin Sauce, 20-Ounce Bottle (Pack of 3)
Review:
I like the taste of this brand best. It is salty and sweet but not too salty. I like the price for this too.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Dynasty Canned Sliced Bamboo Shoots, 8-Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
These are great, crisp, tender and with a good texture. I recommend a quick blanch in some acidic salted water. I use salt and a little lemon juice, about 2 cups water, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp lemon juice, bring to boil and drop these in for a minute and a half. Rinse in cold water. This perks them up and gives them a fresher taste and kills the tiny bit of canned taste that these have. I have had other brands and they really had the canned taste. These remind me a little bit of artichoke heart or palm hearts.
Rating:
5.0

Product:
South Beach Living Snack Pack Delights Dark Chocolate Covered Soynuts, 7-Count Box
Review:
We aren't on the South Beach Diet, and we are usually leery of trendy diet foods for fear of the chemicals they douse their products in (especially high fructose corn syrup which is bad for you in so many ways and Splenda which is just a brain tumor waiting to happen). Boy, howdie! Was I wrong to be concerned in this case! The ingredient list is: chocolate, soy nuts, glaze, gum Arabic, and corn syrup.

We are vegetarian and always looking for ways to get more protein. These 100 calorie packs have 3 grams. And the fat content is not that bad 6 grams, 3 saturated. And they taste fantastic! OK, they taste fantastic IF you like semisweet, dark chocolate (which is better for you any way).

This is a new product from Kraft's South Beach Living line. The only drawback is I can't tell you this will be a great value for you money because I can't find a price for the product. I can tell you it is a great tasting snack that's good for you! Yum!

Product:
 ECOTEAS Organic Yerba Mate Pure Loose Leaf 1 Pound (Pack of 3) 
Review:
Based on the current retail price for 3 one pound packages of $22.73, this product is fairly priced. I can buy it locally for $7.99 per pound at our local health food store.  It is a great tea "staple" to have on hand because you can mix it with other herbal, black or green teas.  It definitely gives you a non-jittery energy boost and it is an excellent source of chromium plus it has some iron, magnesium, niacin, zinc and riboflavin.

Please note this one major difference that I just picked up on:  The kind that I purchased is called "Green Energy" and it is packed with vitamins including riboflavin, niacin, iron, magnesium and zinc.  No chromium, however. It has 80 mg of caffeine.  As far as I can see, "Green Energy" is only available on Amazon as tea bags not loose leaf.

Product:
Celestial Seasonings Sugar Cookie Sleigh Ride Tea Bags, 20 ct
Review:
This tea is very tasty and has a wonderful, velvety texture in your mouth.  I am not sure how Celestial Seasonings accomplished this, but they have created buttery softness and wonderful sweetness in this enticing and aromatic caffeine free holiday tea.  Pair this with turbinado sugar and you have a delicious and soothing hot beverage.  I found this for $2.49 after the holidays at my local health food store.  Now I will have to stock up on more.  There are three other teas in the holiday selections - Nutcracker Sweet (with caffeine), Sugar Plum and Gingerbread Sweet (both caffeine-free herbal teas) and Candy Cane Lane - caffeine free green tea with other flavors.
Nutcracker Sweet is a flavorful mix of black tea, vanilla and other spices.  It has a little bite as compared with this flavor - most likely from the addition of black tea.  I have yet to try to the three other flavors.

Product:
Celestial Seasonings Tension Tamer Tea, 20 ct
Review:
This tea is like drinking a ginger-y lemon drop after you add your choice of sweetener. It is very flavorful and has already become a favorite at our house.  It is also a good tea to mix with black or green tea if you want to add some caffeine.  Since it's caffeine-free, it's very versatile.  It might even make a good lemonade style cold drink.  I'll test it out.
Happy Sipping!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Kashi Vive Probiotic Digestive Wellness Cereal, 12-Ounce Box (Pack of 4)
Review:
I tested out this cereal this morning. The taste was fine. It didn't have a lot of appealing crunch to it, however - more of a dull crunch. I would like to see if Kashi offers a similar cereal with more protein, since I found that this cereal actually made me hungry in a shorter period of time as compared with when I eat a piece of toasted Mestemacher whole grain German bread (also available on Amazon)slathered with Smart Balance and ground chia seeds (lots of good fat).  The serving size of Kashi Vive is 1 1/4 cups with 170 calories per serving, 12 grams of fiber, 2.5 grams of fat, 10 grams of sugar and 4 grams of protein.  Total carbs are 43 grams with net carbs of 31 grams, so still a healthy dose of carbs.  Mestemacher sunflower seed bread in comparison is densely packed with whole grains, 140 calories per slice, 3 grams of fat, 0 grams of sugar, 6 grams of dietary fiber, 23 grams of carbs, so 17 grams of net carbs and 5 grams of protein. The bread also has 15% of iron which is naturally occurring due to the whole grains.  By comparison, Kashi Vive has 8% of RDA of iron and 20% each of calcium and Vitamin D.  It has whole grain and sesame flour, but is not 100% whole grain.  It also contains wheat bran, rice and yellow corn meal.

It's all about moderation, and this cereal is great as another means of adding fiber, calcium and Vitamin D to your diet.  You may find this cereal at your local Big Lots for $2.80 per box.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Wholesome Organic Raw Blue Agave Nectar, Syrup, Low Glycemic Sweetener, Non GMO, 23.5 oz (Pack of 6)
Review:
I have been using Raw Agave Nectar as a sweetener almost exclusively for a number of months now.  I am even enrolled in the automatic subscription program, however I am in the process of re-thinking my decision. First off, there is quite a bit of information on the Internet that points to the fact that agave nectar is really a manufactured  and not a naturally occurring product - agave syrup - and that it is really a form of high fructose syrup.  There is also a concern about the plant source and how it could be potentially harmful to some individuals.  This product is expensive, and if you use it regularly, you may find that you are using quite a bit even if it is sweeter than sugar.  And if you are using a lot, shouldn't you be concerned about what you are really ingesting?
Go to [...] for some insight into this.  Could it be that the sweetener that I have grown to love (and it tastes great - like a maple syrup substitute) and that I use primarily throughout the day in tea and in yogurt/kefir is worse for me or no better than table sugar?  Should I be frowning when my son uses pancake syrup and I choose to use raw agave "nectar"?
I guess the old saying still rings true - if it sounds or tastes too good to be true, then maybe it just isn't as good as it appears to be.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Tofu Shirataki Noodles 10 Bags Angel Hair Shape
Review:
I bought 3 pasta shape varieties of these 8 oz. 2-serving bags of noodles in liquid in the refrigerated tofu section of our local grocery store for $1.99 per bag yesterday.  I am puzzled how they can be sold and shipped since the front of the bag states "perishable - keep refrigerated".  I opened the bag and smelled the noodles, and they did have a rather strange, strong odor.  I immediate poured the noodles into a strainer and then rinsed them under cold water.  I put them in a sauce pan with a small amount of Lorivo expeller-pressed peanut oil and let them sit for a while, stirring occasionally.  I decided to add Guilin chili sauce, garlic powder, powdered ginger, a small amount rice vinegar, water, 3 - 4 tsp. coconut sap sugar and 1/2 large can drained bean sprouts.  I warmed this mixture for awhile - maybe 20 or more minutes.  It worked!  I created a palatable side dish with a good- tasting broth and appealing consistency.

I served this side dish with broiled tuna, mahi mahi, and a Spring greens salad mix with balsamic vinegar and olive oil.
I wish that these noodles were available in larger sized bags at a lower price per serving, but $1 per person for two modest serving sizes per bag isn't outrageous unless you compare this with the cost of regular pasta.  I added the bean sprouts because the noodles alone didn't look like enough food for 3 people, and I thought that adding bean sprouts would offset any texture issues with the noodles. This recipe has now worked out twice with no real concern about cooking time for the noodles. Maybe the vinegar is the key, but the noodles are just like any other noodles when prepared this way and they make a great noodles with Asian-style broth meal or side dish.  And finally ... a use for those canned bean sprouts!

Update:  I have now mixed these with baked tofu and Asian-style sauce. That combo worked out great.  Also I took the wide noodles, rinsed them and then put them in spaghetti sauce to simmer.  They tasted fine. Texture-wise, they will always be somewhat slimy and slippery and not al dente like well-prepared pasta, but otherwise, they worked out well. Just remember - just 40 calories - in an entire bag! And next to no carbohydrates!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Nature's Way Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil- Pure, Cold-pressed, Organic, Non-GMO, Gluten-free- 16 Ounce
Review:
This coconut oil is an excellent multi-purpose product.  I have used it for cooking, broiling, eating by the spoonful and as a skin moisturizer and massage oil.
Last night I put a few pats of this coconut oil on salmon with a salt and herb mix.  I broiled the salmon and it tasted amazing.  The coconut oil definitely enhanced the flavor.
I have been using this oil for frying eggs as well.  It does not seem to burn as quickly as olive oil or butter and it also seems that less is needed for frying - probably since it's easier to use small amounts since it is in solid form.
This coconut oil also worked well for sauteing tofu and broccoli with Bragg's liquid unfermented soy.
It's also tasty on a baked potato and I find that I can skip the salt and still enjoy the flavor.  You can also add it to rice or rice and beans or french fries for a tropical splash of flavor.
I combined this coconut oil with olive oil to saute vegetables for a pasta dish and it worked beautifully.
It has mild, fresh flavor and a little seems to go a long way.

April 19, 2012

Still loving this coconut oil.  It tastes great so you could literally eat a spoonful or two if you were hungry and needed instant energy.
I packed it for a trip to Florida.  It was solid when I arrived, but liquified once I hit the warmer weather.
It also works great in a hot bath for instant moisturizing and it's the perfect after sun moisturizer.  It smells so good that you could use it as a very mild perfume and moisturizer just by rubbing it into your arms and legs until the oil is absorbed - seriously!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Healthworks Chia Seeds Raw Pesticide-Free, 2lb
Review:
The chia seed is probably one of the most versatile, nutrition-packed, economical diet foods available. There are virtually no side effects - all of the good and none of the bad.  You can make chia gel to store in your refrigerator and eat alone or mixed with yogurt or other food.  The chia seeds will keep you from feeling hungry and provide an excellent source of hydration and sustained energy.  You can also add chia seeds to salad dressing or sprinkle them on foods.  Chia seed gel is tasteless so it can be used as a fat substitute for baking as well.  Chia seeds can also be added to fruit smoothies as a high fiber, low-carb source of protein and good fat.  Wouldn't it  also make sense to keep a package of chia seeds in your car (well-wrapped of course) along with water in the event that you were stranded?  Unlike flax seeds, chia seeds should not go rancid if kept dry.  Chia seeds as compared with flax seed contain more nutrients and have no offensive taste or odor.  Raw Food World offers a very good value for purchasing in small and medium quantities.  The double-wrap packaging is excellent and re-usable, the chia seeds are food-grade clean and fresh, and delivery is very prompt.  Check out the Aztec history of chia seeds.  A great addition to your "good fat" or "nut and seed" diet!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bragg Organic Raw Apple Cider Vinegar, 128 Ounce - 1 Pack
Review:
Hi, I had read about the benefits of raw, unfiltered apple cider vinegar for years and finally decided to try some several days ago.  After a few days of usage (and this could be coincidental, but unlikely), the psoriasis behind my ears and in my ears has gone away and the psoriasis on my scalp has virtually disappeared as well. I did use a small amount of topical cream on my forehead, but nowhere else.  I have a fairly mild case, but this could be a breakthrough for combatting this skin disease I've lived with since I was a teenager.  I am not sure if I can at this time say that apple cider vinegar helps with psoriasis, but it's worth a try.  My psoriasis continues to stay very "subdued" since I have been using the ACV, but I am also limiting my intake of yeast-containing and wheat products to see if this also contributes to psoriasis flare-ups.  I have not wanted to take any drugs for my psoriatic arthritis and I have used any creams very sparingly often going for months without using anything.  The other interesting thing about apple cider vinegar (called ACV) is that it doesn't seem to upset my stomach as you would think it might when mixed with water and a little agave nectar or ground stevia leaf.  I can even take it at night before bed.  I usually mix a tablespoon in about a cup or more of water, add some natural sweetener and drink it down. It's actually refreshing, and has a similar taste in my opinion to kombucha.  I then rinse my mouth out with water as a precaution to prevent tooth enamel erosion.  Today I mixed ACV with Bragg's Liquid Aminos in some stirfry.  It was tangy and tasty.  Check out all the blogs about ACV and psoriasis among other things.  There is a theory that people with psoriasis have too much alkalinity and ACV corrects that.  If you don't drink mass quantities, it can't hurt you, and, who knows, it might "cure what ails ya".  Good Luck!  I will follow with an update. Please note that you need to buy apple cider vinegar with the "mother" such as Bragg if you are going to ingest it - not inexpensive store shelf apple cider vinegar that you find in the condiments section.  Bragg is very reasonably priced in larger quantities.  Note:  I just received my order from the Vitamin Shoppe, and vinegar in the large gallon plastic bottle somehow leaked out some in the cardboard box onto the enclosed brochures.  I called Vitamin Shoppe and they are providing a replacement immediately.

Update:  I used the apple cider vinegar, but after several days - and maybe it was because I was on the phone while I was eating  very hot applesauce -  my throat became raw and sore, so I decided to discontinue the cider vinegar for a few days not knowing if hot foods and liquids were the culprit or the addition of vinegar to my diet - always diluted and no more than a tablespoon in water 1 to 2 times per day.  I will try the vinegar again soon, but I will be curious to know if anyone else experiences the same thing. I drink a lot of hot tea, but I have been cooling it down some.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Gluten Free Hearty Whole Grain Bread Mix, 20-ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
Update:  I have now worked with this bread mix several times and I have reached the decision that it is just not versatile enough for creative bakers like myself who love to improvise and have a base from which to work, but still not feel limited in terms of options.  The addition of onions and caraway seeds to this mix severely limits the options and appeal of this bread mix.  I managed to sift out the caraway seeds and sesame seeds, but still some of the caraway seeds got through.  I love caraway seeds, but for some reason, the caraway seeds are overpowering in this mix. Adding onion was also too limiting. Onion powder can easily be added by the person making the bread.  I had a bit of success making a loaf of savory bread.  I used baking powder, ground canned chick peas, eggs and some herbs and a small amount of parmesan cheese.  At least it's edible and it will make a good side bread.

I also added grated zucchini and that made the bread moist. Overall it's probably one of the better ways to use this mix of which
 have three more packages.  But again, I sifted out many of the seeds.
Original Review:  I bought this mix at a reduced price at our local Natural Food Market. I was looking for options for making Gluten free muffins and bread. This morning I prepared blueberry muffin mix the same way I usually do with an additional egg and the muffins rose perfectly.  My husband and I detected a different flavor to the muffins and when I read the packaging it said that there were caraway seeds in the mix.  The flavor and texture of the muffins is very complex, dense and intriguing.  I like the nuttiness of the texture. The muffins came out a rich brown color and seem suitable for the coming colder weather. Who is only after I read the reviews here that I found out that that the mix contains onion powder. That's honestly a little disappointing because it would make a much more versatile mix if the onion powder was left to the individual taste preference and could be added into the mix when preparing the bread or muffins or whatever. The consensus isn't in yet as to whether or not the majority of people would like the taste of these muffins but I rather like the taste and the hearty texture.
Rating:
3.0
