4.0
Product:
Green Mountain Coffee Nantucket Blend, Medium Roast, 24-Count -0.33 oz- K-Cups for Keurig Brewers (Pack of 2)
Review:
I enjoy starting the day with a cup of coffee. Once upon a time, I just used instant. Some were decent quality; some weren't. Then, I tried Mr. Coffee. Sorry, not my cuppa! Back to instant. Maxwell House had some nice instant.

But my family wanted a Keurig coffee maker, so--for the holidays this year--I bought one. The coffee that came with it was a Newman's Own blend. Pretty bold and tasty (better than instant and quite a bit better than my memory of Mr. Coffee). I recently ordered this through Amazon. It is not quite as bold as the Newman's Own k-cup coffee. But it does have a smooth taste that starts the day off nicely. So, I have encountered two good coffees for the Keurig coffee maker!
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Green Mountain Coffee Double Black Diamond, 24-Count K-Cups for Keurig Brewers (Pack of 2)
Review:
A dark roast coffee. . .  With a bold taste. I like this brand. Add a little half and half, and you end up with a strong taste--leavened somewhat by the half and half.

This K-cup translates into a very fine cup of coffee. . . .
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Starbucks dark French Roast, K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, 16-Count
Review:
My wife and I both enjoy immensely our Keurig coffee machine. We enjoy experimenting with a variety of K-cup coffees. We do agree on one thing: we prefer a bolder taste. And this product--Starbuck's French Roast Dark--does the trick.

First, it does feature a bold and full bodied taste. The coffee taste is robust and is a great way to start the day off.

I have tried a good number of K-cup products--Starbuck's, Tully's, Newman's Own, and so on. Across these brand names, the bolder tasting coffees just work better for me, and I have discovered a number of very satisfying K-cups. And this is certainly one of those.

For those who like a bolder taste, this will satisfy. . . .
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Green Mountain Coffee, Dark Magic (Extra Bold), K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers 24-Count  (Pack of 2)
Review:
My partner was getting distressed with the lack of taste in her K-cup coffee (my bad, since I'm the one who buys the coffee), and she requested something with a bolder taste. So, I tried this. We have used Green Mountain Coffee before, but not this particular product.

Bottom line. My partner really enjoys this. The taste meets her expectations. Indeed, although I am supposed to keep my intake of caffeine fairly low, I have also tried this on occasion--and I, too, am satisfied.

So, if you want a bolder flavor, this is worth considering.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Green Mountain Coffee  Breakfast Blend,  K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, 12-Count (Pack of 3)
Review:
This is a good solid cup of coffee. While I prefer a somewhat bolder sense from a cup, this has a smooth taste and is not bitter.

The pack in which the K-cups come speaks of a blend of four coffees from three continents, imparting berry flavors from Africa, body from Indonesian beans, and a smokey taste from French beans. I'm not sure that my palate is capable of separating out such flavors, but the end result is surely a nice cup of coffee.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Newman's Own Special Blend Coffee, Medium Roast Coffee K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers (Pack of 80, net wt. 32.1 oz.)
Review:
This is one of my favorite K-cup products. This is the first time that I have tried this particular Newman's Own product. And I expect to continue purchasing it! I have experienced a number of Newman's Own coffees, and I have been pretty much happy with all of them.

But this is quite good. The package described the coffee thus: "A hearty full-bodied blend of medium and dark roasts. Bold yet refined. Strong, yet smooth." To me, that pretty well describes the coffee.

It does have a bold taste--and yet it is pretty smooth.

Well worth buying again. . . .
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Caribou Coffee, Caribou Blend Decaf, K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, 24-Count
Review:
Doctor's orders: Cut down on regular coffee with caffeine. Challenge: Find a decaff that is satisfying. Answer: Caribou decaff! I really enjoyed the regular version of Caribou (with caffeine). So, I thought, maybe take a shot at the decaff version?

I have tried a number of decaff K-cup coffees. Some have been okay whereas others were pretty weak and didn't have a smooth taste. Caribou has a good coffee taste and is very satisfying. Overall, this represents one of my favorite decaffs for my Keurig coffee makers. Thus, Caribou is satisfying in both the regular and decaff versions.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Peet's Coffee Major Dickason Blend Single Cup Coffee for Keurig K-Cup Brewers 40 count
Review:
A very nice blend! It does have a complex flavor, as advertised. The side panel notes: "Rich, complex, multi-layered; like a relationship with an old friend." Apparently,  Key Dickason was a regular patron of the original Peet's cafe. He shared his own blend of coffee with Mr. Peet; the blend was tweaked and here you have the result!

The flavor is complex and rich. This is a deep roast coffee--which I like.

I judge this to be one of the best K-cups that I have tried.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Wolfgang Puck Coffee, Chef's Reserve Colombian Decaf (Medium Roast), 24-Count K-Cups for Keurig Brewers (Pack of 2)
Review:
Our Keurig coffee maker was a great Christmas gift last year. One of the pleasures of this device is the experimentation with various coffee blends. Some have worked well; others have not. Some are too mild; some are a bit "off" on taste.

This Wolfgang Puck product is one of the more successful experiments with the Keurig machine. It has a rich taste and still remains smooth. Not too strong a flavor, but it does have flavor.

So, the two coffee drinkers in my household are quite pleased to drink this brew.

4.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

Product:
Wild Planet, Wild Pink Shrimp,  4 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
After doing a lot of research on farm raised shrimp (the kind prevalent at the grocery store and in cans anymore) I have been looking for alternatives.  These shrimp are sustainably wild caught so you don't have to worry about shrimp raised in a cesspool of antibiotics, bacteria etc.  They are wonderful and the price is right.

I noticed a lot of reviews mentioning a fishy taste.  Because canned shrimp are cooked during the canning process they can taste very strong.  Canned shrimp should always be rinsed!  Empty into a fine mesh collander and *gently* rinse under nice cool water.  Shake gently a couple times and then tap them out on a couple of clean paper towels.  The flavor of these when rinsed is absolutely 5 stars.  Mild, delicate, but with that nice texture for salads and small sandwiches.

If you've been eating what amounts to catfood labeled "canned shrimp" you will be delighted by this brand.  But always gently rinse them first.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Reese Artichoke Hearts 6-8, 14-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
I have used Reese Artichoke Hearts *exclusively* since they voluntarily became non-GMO project verified.  I support companies that are proud of their product and are proud to display exactly what they are putting in our food on the label... and Reese is one of those companies. These Artichoke hearts are consistently tasty and of high quality and having them quartered for me is also a great benefit and value.  I love them.
Rating:
5.0

Oregon Fruit Pitted Dark Sweet Cherries in Heavy Syrup, 15-Ounce Cans (Pack of 8)
Review:
These are my favorite canned pitted sweet cherries.  I don't cook with them and choose to just eat them right out of the can.  Yes, they are in heavy syrup, but it doesn't (to me) make them too awfully sweet.  The ingredients in the can are:  Cherries, water and sugar.  That's it.  NO high fructose corn syrup.  Oregon Fruit Products has been in business for many years and (I believe) they are committed to high quality.  Although I don't believe that these Cherries are "Organic" I still trust Oregon Fruit Products to use the most sustainable methods available.  The convenience of being able to buy them here on Amazon makes them just that much better.  :)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Remond RealSalt Kosher Sea Salt, 16-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6)
Review:
There is definitely a difference between different types of salt!  Mass produced salt often has a very strong salty flavor and is lacking the minerals that our bodies need.  "Real Salt" has a wonderful flavor and is loaded with the good things that "table" salt is missing.  You won't regret purchasing this wonderful salt mined right here in the USA.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Farmers Market Organic Pumpkin, 15 Ounce (Pack of 12) (Packaging May Vary)
Review:
Safe food... that's what I look for when purchasing products for myself and my loved ones.  I choose brands that don't load up their products with a bunch of chemicals to either "preserve" them or make them "taste" better.  The Farmer's Market Foods Pumpkin tastes great and made the holidays enjoyable as I was able to make pies with a product that I can feel good about serving to my loved ones.  I will be purchasing this again using my Prime Pantry Benefit!
Rating:
5.0

Rapunzel Pure Organic Corn Starch, 8-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:

Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Shredded Coconut (Unsweetened), 24-ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
This coconut is wonderful.  It is a finer shred (but not like strings like you get in those blue packages at the store).  It smells wonderful and tastes great.  It has a very mild and naturally sweet taste and is amazing toasted.  I will be using Bob's Red Mill shredded unsweetened coconut from now on.  For those of you who are timid about buying in quantity... invest in some 1/2 gallon mason jars and a mason jar vacuum sealer attachment to go with a Food Saver.  You can double and sometimes triple the length of time you can store items like this.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
S&B Golden Curry Sauce Mix, Hot, 8.4-Ounce
Review:
I didn't read the label on this product before purchasing.  Most of us know that MSG occurs naturally in several foods we eat (tomatoes being one of them). There is a big difference between the MSG that occurs naturally in food and the MSG that is created in a lab to make things "taste good" (Even rotten meat can be made to taste good when sprinkled with chemically produced MSG).  When an item occurs naturally in a food, most of the time it can be used properly by our bodies (Sugars in fruits and vegetables for instance).  If you are someone who is avoiding *added* chemically derived excitotoxins/neurotoxins which some studies have shown to cause headaches, gall bladder problems along with a plethora of other symptoms you might not want to purchase this curry.  If you don't have a problem with MSG and are one of the many that claims "I'm going to die of something anyway" then this product might be "just what the doctor ordered".  For me, unfortunately, I had to end up throwing this away after reading the label.  I make almost 100% of what I eat from scratch from ingredients I have sourced but thought this might be a nice treat... my mistake.  To Quote Michael Pollan from his book "Food Rules":  "If it comes from a plant, eat it.  If it's made in a plant, don't."  (Great easy to read book by the way)
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Hodgson Mill Organic Whole Wheat Graham Flour, 2-Pounds (Pack of 6)
Review:
This is great tasting Semolina Pasta Flour.  Though I use most of my Semolina Flour in Breads and pizza Dough.  Hodgson Mill is renowned for the quality of their grains and flours and almost every single thing they produce is Organic.  They also are members of the voluntary organization "the Non-GMO project" and that makes me even more likely to purchase their products.  Great Taste, Great Value and SAFE food for your family.  That's what makes this brand stand out from the Brominated and chemical laden mass produced brands.  Get the Good Stuff!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Stash Tea Premium Green Tea, 20 Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6) Medium Caffiene Tea, Japanese Style Green Tea, Hot or Iced
Review:
Stash tea is one of the best available.  Their Green Tea is not one of their finest products, but for the price on Amazon, you can't go wrong.  I saved about 6 dollars buying it here.

4.0

Product:
Lotus Foods Gourmet Organic Madagascar Pink Rice, 11-Pound Bag
Review:
This long-grain brown rice smells more like green tea to me than floral.  It arrived to me quickly and in fresh condition from Amazon.

Organic Mekong Flower Rice(tm) - Cambodia's Floral Brown Rice, Imported from Cambodia

Mekong Flower is called 'Phka Malis' in Khmer, which means beautiful garland of flowers, because of its delicate floral aroma. Leaving the germ and bran layer intact intensifies its fragrance and nutty flavor while retaining the highest nutritional value. This nourishing whole grain rice has a lovely supple texture - unlike the chewy and bland taste of some brown rice.

Perfect in dishes that will showcase its delicate fragrance, Mekong Flower is nutritious and flavorful.

Perfect for all cuisines, it can be used steamed plain, in a pilaf, stir-fry, salad or pudding.

Mekong Flower is chiefly grown on small family plots by households belonging to the Damrei Romeal Organic Rice Cooperatives in Takeo, a province dominated by rice fields and sugar palm trees. Cooperative members are using a set of growing methods, called the System of Rice Intensification (SRI), which enable smallholder farmers to harvest more rice from their traditional varieties using less water, seed, land and no chemicals. Researchers have found that the major aromatic compound in rice is increased in response to water stress. With SRI, farmers drain their paddies periodically, which may explain why Cambodian consumers are saying that SRI-grown 'Phka Malis' is more aromatic and better tasting. Visit our SRI section to learn more about this amazing system that is transforming the rice-growing world.

# Cooks in 30 minutes
# Whole grain and heart healthy
# High in fiber, trace minerals and vitamins
# High in phytonutrients and antioxidants
# 3rd year transition, organic certification
# Fair trade
# Gluten and wheat free

4.0

Betty Crocker Baking Mix, Gluten Free Cake Mix, Yellow, 15 Oz Box (Pack of 6)
Review:
I tried this cake mix and it came out lacking.  I've tried several brands of gluten free cake mixes and this one was second from the worst.  It was dry and the texture was not great.

I used it to make a gluten-free pineapple upside down cake and we also had a non gluten-free one and not only could you tell the difference, no one wanted the gluten free version.  If you have to dabble with the cake mix so much, then its not a successful cake mix IMHO.  Otherwise, why not just get a good gluten free baking book and make one from scratch?

Much better luck with Pamela's mixes and Kinnikinnick.  I don't think Kinnikinnick has a yellow cake mix, but they do have white and chocolate...and you can't tell they are gluten-free in the least.

Am not planning on buying this mix again, unless they improve it.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
McCormick Steakhouse Onion Burger with Garlic, 3.12 ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
We had these on grilled burgers and it was wonderful!  Spicy, but not too spicy, though it did add some zip to the burger.  There is definitely a good garlic and onion flavor and I could see using this on grilled chicken or as a spice when you make potatoes in those sealed  bags over the grill.  A definite MUST for camping and grilling events and weekends.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Annie's Gluten Free  Rice Pasta & Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese, 12 Boxes, 6oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
I generally like Annie's products and really appreciate what they are trying to do, especially in offering gluten-free items.  That being said, I tried this Mac & Cheese made with rice pasta and was seriously underwhelmed.

For one thing, there weren't that many servings, especially if you are making this a main part of your meal.  Secondly, the cheese mix was very bland.  I had to doll it up with pepper and even some garlic salt before I could eat any of it.  Even then...there is no way this tastes in any way, shape, or form like regular Mac & Cheese.

The rice pasta cooked up nicely, which is a plus, but I would never use the cheese mix again.  So I guess I might as well, at that point, buy my own rice pasta and mix up my own cheesy mixture to go over it.  Takes more work, but why use something convenient like Mac & Cheese in a box if you don't end up enjoying the end product?

Definitely a pass.  Sadly.  If Annie's takes it back to the drawing board and makes the cheesy mix something tastier I would be willing to give it a second try.
Rating:
1.0
Product:
 Peanut Butter & Co. The Bees Knees (Honey) Peanut Butter, Gluten Free, 16 oz Jars (Pack of 6) 
Review:
I bought this on a whim and have now have started buying it on a regular basis.  The white chocolate flavor paired with the peanut butter is marvelous.  However, if you are looking for an overwhelming chocolate flavor then this might not be for you, because its a subtle mix.

I've used this on waffles, pancakes, toast, crackers and even made wraps out of it.  You really don't need to add jam when you use this flavored peanut better.  In fact, except for raspberry, jams don't always go with this flavor combo.

The peanut butter is nice and smooth and not too sugary.  I'm glad I found this brand and, so far, this is my favorite one...save for the maple one they also make that comes in a close second.

Recommended for both kids and adults.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Peanut Butter & Co. The Bees Knees (Honey) Peanut Butter, Gluten Free, 16 oz Jars (Pack of 6) 
Review:
When you eat a lot of peanut butter, you can get tired of the same old same old.  Then you take a chance on something new on the shelf and go...mmmm...where has THIS been?

I bought this Mighty Maple peanut butter because it looked interesting.  I also bought the White Chocolate one at the same time.  I actually prefer the White Chocolate flavor slightly over this one, but the maple-flavored peanut butter is pretty good.  I think it's actually tad sweeter tasting than the white chocolate one.

I have used this on toast, in wraps, and on crackers.  You really don't need any jam or honey when you use these flavored peanut butters.  The only thing I find missing with this one (and the other) is that I tend to like crunchy peanut butter, but for a smooth one...this comes in a close second to the Peanut Butter & Co White Chocolate in my opinion.

I think the chocolate flavors might appeal more to kids, and the maple more to adults.

I aim to try this one out when making peanut butter candy for the holiday season.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
 Lakewood Organic PURE Black Cherry Juice, 32-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 6) 
Review:
This black cherry juice is postively wonderful tasting.  It isn't too sweet or too tart and honestly tastes like you're eating black cherries...a terrific treat!  I also deeply appreciate that its organic and doesn't have all those added sugars like so many other juices out there.  Sure, this is more expensive, but its well worth it.

Cherries, like blueberries and blackberries and the like, are really really wonderful for your health.  I either drink this straight or mix it with sparkling water and make myself a tasty and good-for-you black cherry "soda."  It is also a nice juice to use for making punch for a party.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tinkyada Brown Rice Pasta, Spaghetti with Spinach, 12 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I have tried many different kinds of gluten free pasta and Tinkyada absolutely makes the very best.  Not only does it cook like regular spiral pasta, but if you don't tell anyone they really can't tell its not gluten pasta.  I have a recipe I like to make that calls for spiral pasta and despaired of finding anything that would work, but I tried this one and it was great.  I took it to a picnic and, as I said, if I hadn't told the people it was gluten free (for my gluten free friends) they wouldn't have known.

This gluten free spiral pasta also does come in the veggie colored spirals, which is how I make a favorite pasta dish.  But it works just as well with these regular spirals, if not looking quite so colorful.

I cook these spiral noodles as recommended on the package, but I also pull some out to check for the appropriate level of doneness, as I prefer them not to be mushy.  Rinse them off and cool down and add your chopped veggies, olives, pickled artichokes, maybe some pepperoni and onions, etc and some kind of dressing such as Italian and then you can keep in the fridge. You can also add some cheese if you want just before serving.  Makes a great potluck dish.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Glutino Gluten Free Pretzel Twists, 14.1-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
My biggest problem with these pretzels is their price.  They are quite expensive for a bag of pretzels, especially in comparison to regular bags of pretzels.  That being said, my second biggest problem with these pretzels is in trying not to eat half the bag in one sitting.

These gluten free pretzels have the same texture, crunch, and flavor of regular gluten pretzels, so if you are trying to go gluten free and miss your pretzels, these are pretty much the main choice.  I eat them as is or put them out at parties when gluten free friends are coming over.  You can use them with any dip you might normally pair with pretzels.  I can also see using these to make chocolate-dipped pretzels for the holidays or as a pretzel-based crust in some desserts.

I'm quite happy with these, price or not.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Ghirardelli Chocolate Baking Chips, Semi-Sweet Chocolate, 12 oz., 6 Count
Review:
I must admit that I also have been known to pull a bag of these out and snack on them or add a handful to vanilla ice cream.  They honestly taste great alone, but where they really shine is in your cakes, cookies, and other desserts.

Ghiraradelli melts nicely and has a great smooth chocolate flavor, much more subtle than Nestle or Hershey's chocolate chips.  Not that I don't enjoy Nestle or Hershey's chocolate, but Ghiraradelli seems a tad less sugar-sweet and so seems to taste more like rich dark chocolate.

I sometimes mix these in with some Bittersweet chocolate chips in cookies and they are my go-to chips when melting them down to make chocolate cake batter.  I have also used these to make ganache for frosting cakes and desserts.  I've also melted down these chips to make the coating for truffles.

Highly recommended.  I rarely go without a package of these in the cupboard.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
WOW BAKING COMPANY Cookies, Ginger Molasses, 8-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I've tried several of the gluten-free products from this company and I think this cookie is my favorite.  The cookies are soft, wonderfully textured, and have a great flavor.  For ginger-molasses cookies they are not overly spicy, but they have these great little tidbits of ginger inside them.  The primary flavor is a nice blend of molasses and spices, however.

My only issue with them is that, if you don't eat them right away, even with the re-sealable bag, they tend to get hard around the edges.  I didn't have that issue with the lemon cookies from this same company, so I'm not sure what gives.  They still taste great, but if you want them to be uniformly soft then eat them as soon as possible once the bag is opened.

Not enough of an issue to take away a star, though, especially since so many other gluten-free choices suffer from being too dry and these cookies start out so moist and soft.

Very much recommended...
Rating:
5.0

Review: Fresh. Packaged great. Love the tin canister can be used for anything to keep junk in. These are fresh baked and I mean fresh. They smelled warm and they were right out of the ovens. The packing is wonderful also. Very safe. These are almost on par with the special cookies that you find in the malls. BUT you won't find the freshness in them unless you catch them when they're first taking them out of the oven. Rating: 5.0 Product: GODIVA Chocolatier Assorted Chocolate Gold Gift Box, Classic Ribbon, 70 pc. Review: Just right as a present for my Pain Doc! She's pro active and awesome; lots of empathy for this disabled vet. The candies/box/wrapping are always classy and great. It's Godiva. BTW, the candies came in a huge cooler w/ ice packs (which are reusable) to keep everything in the cooler like just made. Rating: 5.0 Product: Gourmet Raspberry Jalapeno Jam Handcrafted Small Batch (FAT FREE, GLUTEN FREE & ALL NATURAL) Review: I'm sorry, I love Strawberry/Rhubarb, but this is SUGAR thinned w/a hint of strawberry/rhubarb. If I didn't know better the stuff was taken from a #10 mass produced can (maybe in small packets for restaurants, etc) and filled with this jar. Then sealed it, slapped on a cheap stick on/or made it themselves off the pc. I don't know but I am very disappointed. Save your money unless this is the kind of stuff your looking for, then go to Cisco (restaurant supplies) and buy a #10 can for $25.00. I grew up on a farm/dairy where my grandmother made this (preserves only) and it was thick, freshly cut, ripened rhubarb/strawberries and she refused to sell it. She would donate to church functions however (down by the Rio Grande). Small batches may be true, but I am guessing it has to do with the amount of jars they can get into a home canner. Rating: 2.0 Product: Godiva Chocolatier Chocolate Biscuit Cookies Tin Gift Pack Review: The chocolate cookies come in a huge, ice-packing container. The ribbon and gift wrapping are outstanding also: can't beat them. The name rings of 'High Dollar'. That said, I was very disappointed in how SMALL the cookies are. I don't expect one of those huge chocolate-gooey ones from Ur grocery store, but come'on! I think I'd save a bunch of do-ra-me if I get some good OTC bread/cookies in a tin, etal. They have them in the big retail chains, or Rx stores. Take those cookies, wrap them on your own wrap (gift wrapped by U ALWAYS impresses the receiver!>.at least me...it doesn't matter how it comes out; the wrapping, it's the thought someone would make the 'try') Hint: kids and husbands. Anyway, that's my opinion. $ is hard to come by, and as great-granddad use to say...'it all turns out the same way...and the same end.' Rating: 2.0 Product: Ferrero Rocher Fine Hazelnut Chocolates, Chocolate Gift Box, Diamond, 48 Count, 21.2oz Review: They receive 3*. The price purchase is high-dollar. The (hazelnut) chocolate has multiple flavors. Too many in my opinion, i.e., too many cooks in the kitchen spoil the food. The different flavors compete with each other for taste (dominance). The nut overwhelms any chocolate and the cracked mixed nuts on the outside of the chocolate add distraction. It ends up (in my opinion) as a soft (gooey) sweet 'something' with complex flavors. Rating: 3.0 Product: Hills Bros Cappuccino, French Vanilla, 16 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: If you follow the instructions on the box, you WILL be disappointed! To make it taste as 'rich' as a cappuccino should taste, you have to DOUBLE the amount of mocha. It's very difficult to mix w/o making a mess. No matter how you make the brew you're going to have to break up a bunch of lumps of it; that didn't get mixed into the water, and that will cause a mess. Doing it inside a cup/mug you are going to have residue mocha marks all over the sides and top edges. You can't help it IF you wish to just drink a good cup of hot choc. The best way I was able to use to accomplish the recipe w/o the mess on the sides of the mug, etc., was to put the steaming hot water in a blender, then set it on mix, putting the cappuccino slowly; you don't want the mix to hit the bottom! Once you get all the mixture in the hot water, and setting it on stir/blend, place the top on quickly and hit the fastest button you have on your blender. Keep it there until you see no powder on the sides or the bottom, and no lumps in the water. I made the mixture, usng the double mixture w/hot milk, coz' if you use water, as they say, all you are going to get is muddy water (in my opinion). Right after I see the mixture is about hot choc. should look/a little 'thick' not watery, I immediately pour the mix into a mug and place the balance in a container w/easy spout and stick it in the fridge. When you take the remainder of the mixture you have left in the fridge, no matter how well you blended it, some of the cappuccino will have settled on the bottom. You will have to shake the container vigoriously, turning it upside down, then put it in your mug(s) and 'nuke'. A good cup of hot choc, I like, is somewhat a little thicker than milk, and leaves a froth on the top (so you can add your marshmellows; however, this brand, cappuccino, isn't going to work w/the addition. Now, all that I have written is what you will have to do no matter the brand name or flavor, size of mixture, etc., you are going to have the same issues that I have written.....that is what you get when you go 'instant'. The ole' fashioned way of making hot choc. is my preferred method. You get your small pot, pour the milk into it and get it to boiling. Slowly had your hot chocolate. You stir in the pot using the same method I have written and you are going to have a good cup of hot choc. Hot choc. should be made w/whole milk, but not h.and h. Hot choc. is a cup of 'joy' for any time you wish to feel special....whether it be by yourself, wiith pet, or family. It's special. Taking the time to do it right makes the occasion even more enjoyable...if you don't hurry. Making hot choc. can't be rushed. Rating: 2.0 Product: DOVE PROMISES Variety Mix Chocolate Candy 43.07-Ounce 150-Piece Bag Review: Great as a gift. Put in a table bowl at the home or the office. They have fancy wrappings. It's milk and dark choc. (2 different) and 1 with a caramel ctr. I didn't count but there was a LOT of candies. Rating: 4.0 Product: YS Eco Bee Farms RAW HONEY - Raw, Unfiltered, Unpasteurized - Kosher (3 Lb (2 Pack)) Review: It doesn't say it's creamed but it spreads like it. A LITTLE goes a long way! Experiment but if you're used to the liquid squeeze bottle you want to be very conservative. You can always add more honey but you can't take it out...except add more of whatever you are putting it on. A teaspoon of it sent me into the 'sugar' overload sensation. Shaking like a leaf. --- One jar is going to last a long, long, long time. Rating: 5.0 Product: Church & Dwight Co 03020 Arm & Hammer Super Washing Soda 55 oz. (Pack of 3) Review: I'm old-71. I remember watching my mom put this 'stuff' in the old swing out arm/roller wash/machine. This stuff is great for what it says it does, on what it does. Will reorder PRN. Great value. Rating: 5.0 Product: Nescafe Clasico Instant Coffee, 7 Ounce Jar Review: I enjoy the medium roast better but so does everyone else because you are very lucky to find it. However, for instant coffee, this is pretty good. If you have to experiment with the amount you put in your water; for taste satisfaction. It IS instant. In a pinch it's bearable (you have to drink it very hot) Rating: 3.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['hot', 'good', 'get', 'water', 'choc', 'like', 'taste', 'small', 'however', 'going'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Newman's Own Organic Chocolate Cups, Peppermint Dark Chocolate Cups, 1.2-oz. (Pack of 16) Review: If you're planning on purchasing the Newman's Own Organics Dark Chocolate Peppermint Cups hoping to get something as minty as a York Peppermint Patty, you might be a little disappointed. Unfortunately the mint kick in the Newman's peppermint cups is a little lacking; but otherwise the taste is actually pretty darn good. The dark chocolate shell provides a nice mild bitterness which complements the mint that is present, yet it doesn't overwhelm it like many milk chocolates do by overloading you with sweetness. Each individually wrapped packet of cups is actually filled three cups which are smaller than the cups you might find in a Reese's Peanut Butter cups package. The weight of each individual package also suggests that each serving size is smaller - the Newman's packages weigh in at 34 grams, Hershey's lists Reese's as 43g. This may be due to peanut butter weighing more than the mint goo inside of Newman's, I have no idea - but I think by volume the Newman's are simply smaller. My batch of chocolate did have an unfortunate chalkiness which I usually associate with "old" chocolate - the ones that have been sitting on the shelf for a little while. The Newman's did not have any type of "best by" or "made on" date printed on the package that I could find so I have no idea if this was just how they were supposed to taste or if I did indeed get an older batch from Amazon. In either case the chalkiness was faint and didn't really detract too much from the final taste, but you did definitely get that weird powdery feeling. Ok, I know this review sounds pretty negative but I don't want to leave you with that impression. Really the only issue I had with the Newman's Peppermint cups was that I really wanted them to be more pepperminty. I would compare the "mint level" of these cups to about the same as you would get from eating one of those red-and-white swirled peppermint hard candies (or a candy cane) - I was really hoping for something more on the level with an Altoids (or stronger) mint. This chocolate is also not for someone who's looking to curb a sweet tooth as there's really not a lot of sweetness in the cup - I suppose you would call this more of an "adult candy". Less on the sugar, more on the mild flavors. That being said, the mild mint and the slightly bitter dark chocolate make this an excellent candy which I can easily recommend, the USDA "Certified Organic" stamp is just icing on the top. Product:
Frontier Co-op Organic White Onion Powder, 2 1 Pound Bulk Bags (Pack of 2)
Review:
I'm very happy with the taste of this ultra-fine onion powder but I'm giving it 2 stars because of the frustration of having to repeatedly smack the side of its recycled McCormick glass shaker jar or use a fork to jar/break the contents loose enough to sprinkle it since I purchased it last year.  Yes, I absolutely did read the most critical review before buying but had no idea the caking problem could be sooo bad!  I don't live in a damp climate, yet not even the tiny desiccant packs that I resort to using will keep it from caking. And, yes, I know better than to sprinkle the jar's contents over steaming food.  Yet, I currently don't have onion powder in my little shaker jar, I have hard BALLS of onion powder.  I'm writing now because I found the contents of the smaller of the two larger jars I store the bulk of it in had solidified into one hard mass whose chunks I broke it into will be dissolved to go down the drain.  Actions like that defeat the purpose of buying in bulk.  Unsurprisingly, the onion powder in my main storage jar, whose lid I couldn't remove without the aid of a bottle opener, is so much better indicating this is great onion powder as long as you don't open the jar.  That makes me wonder if those who left positive reviews haven't had it very long or use it so quickly that its fine particles don't have time to enthusiastically unite in organic solidarity.
Rating:
2.0
</Other Writer-1>

This review is for the 25% Less Sugar Chocolate Chip Granola Bars, sold by Amazon. I am a repeat buyer and purchase these at an awesome price through the Subscribe and Save feature!  I have been buying them for years and have never had an issue with quality or expiration date.  My one teen son is the primary consumer, but my husband loves them as well. My son loves the convenience and great flavor. He is always on the go with a busy work and school schedule. He grabs one for later so he not caught being hungry and needing to stop for fast food.  I admire his thought process! Personally, I love the cinnamon raisin granola bars!

5.0

Review:
I hate to admit it, but these were purchased as a special treat for my husband. He has talked about them forever! He was like a little kid when they arrived today! They have apparently been a favorite of his for many years. Thrilled to see the look on his face as he opened and ate the first one! Fantastic price point!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Julian Bakery Paleo Coconut Flakes (Low Carb & Gluten Free) Cereal, 10 Servings
Review:
I was hoping for a  low carb breakfast cereal to have once in awhile and even with the $11 price tag for a "box", I was willing to give it a try!  Upon arrival, I was instantly disappointed. What? A thin foil envelope of cereal? This was a very high price point for the product.

  However, I am updating my review because I want to point out that this product is sold for $8.99 on their website with a discounted price for shipping on multiple items.  That price puts it right in line with a very fair price point.  If you go through Amazon, you pay for the convenience and that's okay as well!

  It was time to taste test. I got out the measuring cup and poured my first serving.  Looked okay, smelled okay.  I'm afraid it was downhill after that. I personally did not have a taste for this particular product.  My love for coconut must not be that deep!  I understand we all have our own tastes and some are acquired.  It is a good low carb alternative for those that like coconut and want a cereal type of food to add into their diet.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Utz Potato Chips, Sour Cream & Onion, 1 oz Bag (Pack of 60)
Review:
Most people think of potato chips as a snack food. When growing up, my mom always had chips on her storm prep list. There she was getting gas, filling up containers of water, making sure there was cash in the house, etc. It always made me laugh when she purchased a bag of chips for the house! That was on her storm prep list!  During a recent hurricane, I had these sent to my sister. She was able to pass them out to neighbors who were all helping each other clean up and rebuild the destruction. They were a welcome sight! The chips were fresh and the individual bags made it so convenient!  Utz chips have been around for years and their name equals quality! So whether you want a portion controlled snack, preparing for a party or like my mom, a storm, this is a great choice!
Rating:
5.0

Review:

I had read another reviewer with similar issues. Sorry that I can't give this anymore than a 1-star review.

1.0

Review:

None of the cookies were broken and the taste was great! There are 300 calories per package, if you decide not to share with anyone. There is approximately 18 cookies per bag. I am fine with sharing, if you aren't, that's okay too. They go great with an afternoon cup of coffee! Great overall value!  We received ours 6 months before the expiration date on the package. Our cookies were fresh!

Love the flavor! Normally, when you think of cinnamon flavor gum, you think it is going to have a spicy kick. I was pleasantly surprised! Smooth cinnamon flavor without the punch! Still leaving you feeling refreshed!  It is definitely a perk to have the slightly larger gun. The gum was not hard either. It was fresh and packaged well. I also want to add that the price per pack is significantly less when purchased in in quantity here at Amazon. Use Subscribe and Save whenever possible for additional savings. It really adds up and beats paying extra at the checkout counter of a store. The entire family was pleased with the gum and considering the age range, that's saying something!  The packaging makes it much easier to offer someone a piece of gum!

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:

Product:
Raw Shelled Pumpkin Seeds - Pepitas, 2 Pound
Review:
I could not find these locally, but of course, I did find them on amazon.com!  Raw seeds are flexible.  Most of the time, I  just eat them raw, because I'm on a salt-restricted diet.  On the rare occasions I want them roasted, I can do that wihout adding any salt.  When making them up for guests, I can add sea salt before roasting.  That's what I mean by "flexible".  Raw seeds can be kept  refrigerated for 1-2 months in a tightly sealed container without loss of flavor, but frozen can be kept for a year.

Not only are they flexible, but they are outstandingly good!  I use them a lot in vegetable salads, but sometimes I just eat a handful or two as a light snack. If you want to dry roast your own, here's how I do it: Heat oven to its lowest temperature(160-170 degrees F.  Spread seeds in a single layer on a cookie sheet and roast for 15-20 minutes.  Higher temperature will cause break down of fats, creating free radicals you don't want.  (Commercially roasted are generally heated to much higher temps)  Remember, too, that roasted seeds have a shorter shelf life than raw.  So there you have it.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Spicy World Shredded Desiccated Unsweetened Coconut, 2 Pound
Review:
I ordered the wrong product.  What I should have ordered was coconut MILK powder.  However, once I opened it and discovered my error, I decided to use it in some of my Indian recipes.  It's just fine  in curries and other things, like berry or other smoothies where some texture is okay.  I  can use it also in baking and on icings that I might have used flaked coconut on.  It won't be wasted, but if you plan to use it like milk, be sure before ordering
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Filippo Berio Extra Light Olive Oil, 101.4 Fluid Ounce
Review:

Rating:

5.0
Product:
Hoosier Hill Farm Buttermilk Powder, 1 Pound
Review:
Tastes like buttermilk and thickens as it sits, so that when I use it to make dressings, it has the right taste as well as the proper "mouth feel" that I find important in creamy style dressings.  It's economical as well, since I make it up as I use it and there are no leftovers to spoil in the fridge. It's hard to beat that!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Almond Flour Blanched, Anthony's 4lb Bag, Batch Tested Gluten-Free
Review:
I usually do some research before buying what for me is a new product.  I bought a small amount in a local store, and it was good, so then I researched prices, locally and on Amazon.com.  I have only used almond flour so far for baking gluten free cookies, but have some other recipes I want to try, which means that I will be using it in larger amounts.  Not only was the price better (plus  Amazon's Prime program two-day delivery), but I found that Anthony's Almond flour tasted richer (fresher?).  With all these pluses -  fresher, faster delivery, richer taste - I'm really very happy with it.

I recommend Anthony's Almonds Blanched Almond Flour for anyone who loves to bake, whether regular or gluten-free.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Marshalls Creek Spices Dill Seed Whole, 10 Ounce
Review:
I found it at Amazon when I couldn't find it in grocery stores - oddly, now I'm seeing it everywhere!  (Everyone had dill weed, which is not at all the same!) It's a good, high quality product, but the jar may be more than most people would use in a year or so.  If you use a lot of celery seed, it's still the best price around, and I would certainly recommend it.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Soy Flour, 16 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
Bob's Red Mill products are truly the "best in class" for flours.  They have both Gluten-containing flours (think: wheat, rye, et al) and gluten-free flours, (think: soy, rice, bean, etc) both are finest quality.  They also guarantee that there is no crossing of grinding equipment for both types, so you can be assured of the purity.  I don't really need gluten-free, but I bake things for a friend who has celiac disease.  The slightest hint of gluten in her food causes her severe problems.  She has had NO trouble with anything I have made for her.  She trusts me and I trust Bob's Red Mill.  'Nuff said.  I strongly recommend Red Mill for quality and Amazon for low prices and fast delivery.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Igourmet Pub Cheese Assortment, 2-Pound
Review:
My daughter and her new husband have the problem of converting two complete households into a single one, so I was confounded when seeking a wedding gift for them. I finally settled on the Pub Cheese Assortment as something they could enjoy that would not add to the complexity.  Not only did they enjoy it, but they served the cheeses to guests at a wine-tasting, who also loved the different cheeses and insisted on knowing where they found them!  It could easily become my favorite wedding gift, as well as my favorite way to enjoy learning more about cheeses I can't find in my local supermarket.  I highly recommend this assortment as well as many others offered by Amazon.com. My own plan is to try them all!

This is wonderful for making up the small quantities of cream that I need for making icings and cookies (and  sometimes biscuits).  I just mix up the amount I need as I need it, so there's no waste at all. It tastes just like fresh cream, and it certainly saves me money!

First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Emerald Cocoa Roast Almonds, Dark Chocolate, 10 oz Canister (Pack of 4) Review: These Emerald "Cocoa Roast Almonds" are a low carb snack that bring a bit of dark chocolate flavor to good tasting almonds. These do have artificial sweeteners, but for those of us that have to watch our sugar intake, this is a very viable treat. Highly Recommended! CFH Rating: 4.0 Product: thinkThin BITES 100 Calorie Chocolate Toffee Nut, Gluten Free, 5-Count (0.88-Ounce) Bars (Pack of 6) Review: These thinkThin "100 Chocolate Toffee Nut Bites" are good tasting and filling. These are not as pictured on the box, but are rather a soft cake with a chocolate coating. The taste is better than most "diet" snacks and they are also diabetic friendly at less than 6 Net Carbs per bar and only 100 Calories. These do contain Maltitol and that can cause "gastric distress" that varies in severity from person to person, so you might want to see how these effect you before enjoying one of these and heading out to your weekly Book Club meeting. Recommended! I do like thinkThin BITES 100 Calorie Cookies and Cream, 5-Count, 4.4-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) CFH Rating: 4.0 Product: Nature Valley Granola Bars, Sweet and Salty Nut, Roasted Mixed Nut, 7.4 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: These Nature Valley "Sweet & Salty Nut Granola Bars" are good for between meal snacks and are fairly filling. While not very big, these bars pack a lot of flavor and energy that make them a real treat and I like that my kids will eat these in place of a candy bar. The only issue with these is that the bottom peanut butter layer can be come very soft and messy when heated up by a warm day of from being held in the hand too long, but I have learned to eat these held in the open wrapper to avoid the problem. My family also enjoys Nature Valley Sweet & Salty Nut Granola Bars, Peanut, 6-Count Boxes (Pack of 12) Recommended! CFH Rating: 4.0 Product: Blue Diamond Almonds, Bold Jalapeno Smokehouse, 6 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: The Blue Diamond Jalapeno Smokehouse Almonds are great tasting, with a strong smoky flavor and a nice jalapeno bite. These have a decent amount of spicy heat to them, but it isn't too overpowering. My wife picked these up for a long road trip and they were the first snack to get finished up. Highly Recommended! CFH Rating: 5.0 Product: Kashi TLC Chewy Granola Bar, Peanut Peanut Butter, 1.2oz 6-Count Bars(Pack of 6) Review: These Kashi Layered Granola Bars, Dark Chocolate Coconut are quite good and make great between meal snacks. I keep these in my desk drawer to keep my blood sugar up if I should miss lunch for whatever reason. Highly Recommended! CFH Rating: 5.0 Product: HERSHEY'S Dark Chocolate Candy Bars,Sugar Free, 3 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: Hershey's Sugar Free Dark Chocolate candy bars tastes very close to the full sugar version. Dark Chocolate was always one of my favorite treats before coming a Type 2 diabetic, so it is great being able to have it again in a sugar free version. There is a little bit of an after taste with these but dark chocolate is usually bitter so it isn't really an issue for me (but my wife says she notices more than I do). I should mention that eating too many of these (more than 3 or 4) does cause me some "gastric distress", so you might want to try them at home before eating a bunch while out in public. Recommended Rating: 5.0 Product: FiberPlus Antioxidant Bars, Chocolate Chip, 5-Count Bars 1.2 oz(Pack of 12) Review: The Kellogg's Chocolate Chip "FiberPlus Antioxidant Bars" are surprisingly good tasting and are very filling. My wife bought me these to use as snack bars since I try to keep my total Carb intake as low as possible, and the high fiber content gives these each of these about 17 Net Carbs. They also have 120 Calories and about 2g of Protein. The flavor is a lot better than most of other high fiber snack bars I have tried and these will become one of my regular treats. Highly Recommended! I also like FiberPlus Antioxidant Bars, Dark Chocolate Almond, 5-Count Bars (Pack of 12). CFH Rating: 5.0 Product: Nature Valley Crisp Bars, Almond Dark Chocolate Nut, 5.34 Ounce Review: These Nature Valley Almond Dark Chocolate Nut Crisp Bars are quite good tasting and make a reasonable snack alternative to a regular chocolate bar. I am a "snaker" and am always on the lookout for a more filling treat that has at least some nutritional benefit. The individually wrapped bars are convenient to put in a jacket pocket and are more "substantial" than some of other choices. Highly Recommended! CFH Rating: 5.0 Product: Premier Protein 30g Protein Shakes, Chocolate, 11 Fluid Ounces, 4 Per Pack Review: These Premier Protein 30g Protein Shakes are good tasting and quite filling! We are on the go early in the morning and seldom have time for a full breakfast, so we use this to hold us over until we can get lunch. The shakes have a very good banana flavor that does not seem "fake" or overly sweet tasting. They are much better tasting served very cold! Highly Recommended! CFH Rating: 5.0 Product: HERSHEY'S Sugar Free Chocolate Candy Bars, Caramel Filled, 3 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: Hershey "Sugar Free Caramel Filled Chocolates" are very good diabetic friendly chocolate candies. These are fairly small, but are very tasty. Sweetened with Splenda, these do not significantly impact my blood sugar levels or cause gastric distress. Highly Recommended! prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Back To Nature Organic Cherry Vanilla Granola, 12-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6) Review: The crunchy oats and tart cherries in this granola will steal your heart. The addition of vanilla also makes this cereal more unique. I like that this is organic - even the vanilla is organic. You will also like the fact that you are eating 34g of whole grains per serving. What can I say? I love this granola. It is possibly the best granola on the planet. ~The Rebecca Review Rating: 5.0 Product: Spectrum Culinary Organic Unrefined Virgin Coconut Oil, 14 fl. oz. (Pack of 3) Review: As far as taste goes this is the best coconut oil I've tried. It has a slightly sweet flavor and melts very easily in coffee. I started using this daily by putting one tablespoon in my coffee. Imagine my surprise when I stepped on my scale and was five pounds lighter. I'd heard that coconut oil helped to increase the metabolism but I didn't realize eating one bottle of coconut oil would help me lose five pounds. It seems ironic that you could lose fat by eating fat but that really seems to be what happened. I also noticed my brain functioning better and I seem more alert and in a good mood. This coconut oil can be used for medium heat cooking as well. It is unrefined, organic and virgin. What more can you wish for? I'll be buying this again. ~The Rebecca Review Rating: 5.0 Product: Tazo Organic Baked Cinnamon Apple Herbal Infusion, Caffeine Free, 20-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6) Review: As someone who has formerly raved about Tazo's Teas I can say that my first experience with this tea was less than satisfactory. Using two teabags with 12 ounces of water produced a flavorless tea that didn't even have the hint of cinnamon let alone the fragrance of apples. Realizing that the weakness of the tea was the reason for my dissatisfaction I tried brewing the tea by using four teabags and 12 ounces of water. This produced a very acceptable tea with a full-bodied taste and the delicious fragrance of freshly picked apples. The ingredients in this tea include: African Rooibos, cinnamon, natural flavors, apple and chamomile. While this tea is not a five-star tea it is at least slightly comforting in the winter and if you brew it for longer than you would normally brew tea then you might find it to be delicious instead of disappointing. ~The Rebecca Review Rating: 3.0 Product: Nature's Path Organic Chewy Granola Bars, Sunny Hemp Plus, 7.4 Ounce Box (Pack of 6) Review: I hate making breakfast so these bars are perfect for winter mornings. Why save the flavor of pumpkin and spice for only the holiday season? These are delicious year round. They do however contain quite a bit of sugar so maybe they should be a treat and not a staple. Either way I'm happy when I eat one because these are a source of Omega-3. I can't see why anyone would say these are bland. They are bursting with flavor. My box says best before OCT 2012 so it is a fresh box. I could see how these would not taste good if they were stale. ~The Rebecca Review Rating: 5.0 Product: Newman's Own Organics Organic Premium Chocolate Bar, Dark 54% Cocoa, 2.25-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12) Review: So many dark chocolates are bitter or sour. Newman's Own Organics Dark Chocolate is as near perfect as a dark chocolate can be. It is creamy and dreamy and will give you the most seductive chocolate experience of your life. It really is that good. I also like that it is not overly sweet but just sweet enough to satisfy your craving. The vanilla flavor is also very subtle. Usually I'd say try a bar before you buy 12 but this time I'm saying buy 12 so you don't run out. ~The Rebecca Review Rating: 5.0 Product: Numi Organic Tea Golden Chai, Full Leaf Black Tea, 18-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 3) Review: I'm used to drinking much stronger flavored chai teas so this one seemed like it wasn't spicy at all. You can barely taste the ginger. I think this tea would be much better if they added some peppercorns which is traditional. What this tastes like is a weak black tea with little flavor. I normally love Numi teas but this one seems too weak for me and I used two teabags per mug. So if you like stronger chai teas this may not suit you. It needs a lot more spices in my opinion. ~The Rebecca Review Rating: 3.0 Product: ALMOND JOY, Chocolate Coconut Candy Bar (Pack of 36) Review: Part of my husband's job is to spoil his clients by bringing them cakes or candy or sometimes even lunch. I usually know what he is buying because he brings home the empty boxes (like Twinkie boxes) for recycling. I then of course have to look at the empty boxes wishing he would have saved me one treat. Well finally he did remember to bring me two Almond Joys. I must say they are one of my favorite chocolate candies. The crunch of the almond goes so well with the smooth chewy coconut all encased in a bliss of melting chocolate. One bite and you are hooked. ~The Rebecca Review Rating: 5.0 Product: Traditional Medicinals Organic Belly Comfort Peppermint Digestive Tea, 16 Tea Bags (Pack of 6) Review: With all the holiday foods available during the Christmas season it is nice to know there is a calming tea to settle things down. This is good to drink in the afternoon or evening as it is caffeine free. It is made with ginger, blackberry leaf, stevia and lemon myrtle leaf. It is a little spicy and definitely has a strong flavor of ginger. I'm enjoying drinking this during the holiday season. ~The Rebecca Review Rating: 4.0 Product: Wholesome Organic Sucanat Whole Cane Sugar, Fair Trade, Non GMO, 1 LB (Pack of 12) Review: Organic Sucanat is many levels above regular white granulated sugar. This sugar takes baking and tea drinking to new levels of pleasure. When holding this sugar in the palm of your hand, you will notice the irregularity of the crystals and the "dark brown sugar" color. This does have a flavor that is reminiscent of brown sugar and yet the texture is much more natural and the crystals take longer to melt on your tongue. Recently I've been discovering a variety of more natural sweeteners. This on is perfect for tea because it not only adds sweetness; it adds a caramel flavor to teas in which you use milk. There is a purity in the flavor and you feel better because you are supporting organic farms and keeping your body healthy. This is a one-for-one replacement for refined white or brown sugar. Sucanat is made from 100% certified organic sugar cane. The sugar cane is "green cut." This means the fields are not burned and the leaves and tops of the cane plant are left in the field. The sugar is minimally processed and once the sugar cane is harvested it is pressed to squeeze out all the cane juice. This juice is then clarified, filtered and evaporated. This helps to remove excess water. The syrup is then crystallized and a sugar with a molasses flavor is produced. There are also vitamins, minerals and trace elements from the sugar cane plant. One teaspoon of Sucanat contains 10mg of Potassium and 6mg of Calcium. If you are still using white sugar, try Sucanat. It might surprise you with added flavor, goodness and purity. I find the flavor to be superior to refined white sugar. This sugar will add a touch of caramel flavor to all your baking. If you are looking for an even deeper flavor for chocolate recipes, try Muscovado sugar. It has a rich flavor that can't be matched by any regular brown sugar you would find in your grocery store. With Muscovado and Sucanat, you can take your baking to the next level. ~The Rebecca Review Rating: 5.0 Product: Swiss Miss Hot Cocoa Mix, Sensible Sweets, Light, 8 count,0.29 ounce, (Pack of 6) Review: Dear Santa, Since you read my reviews I thought I'd tell you the news I don't have a fireplace this year But never you fear A fireplace DVD I'll be running And Christmas tunes I'll be humming Knock three times on the back door I'm sure that won't be too much of a chore Diet Hot Chocolate I'm making for you Chocolate Oatmeal Cookies will also be new Don't forget presents for the cats They will all be wearing little red hats So Santa dear for you I'll be waiting All those special presents I'll be anticipating I hope you don't mind that I wrote you this poem Well it seemed easier to reach you than by phone love, me P.S. This cocoa mix is pretty good if you use two packets per mug of hot fat-free milk. For some reason this blends better in milk than water. If you whisk it it will also produce a pleasant foam on top. Or you could add some whipped cream. The whisk I use to blend this is RSVP Endurace Spring Whisk, 7-Inch. It fits nicely in most mugs and cups. The word "Organic" in the product title is misleading because the product is not marked USDA Organic. As I see it, the wording is intended to deceive. Why bother with Eden when Alter Eco and other brands are certified and labeled as USDA Organic. While it is true that the Eden product states "OCIA Certified Organic", the USDA Organic label is missing. As a consumer, I have tried both brands, and I prefer the one that's properly labeled.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Grassfed Organic Cultured Ghee 14 Oz. - Pure Indian Foods(R) Brand
Review:
The uncultured ghee consistently caused me diarrhea. This cultured ghee has been tolerable. The following is a suggested explanation on the product website:

"Why Cultured Ghee? Milk contains lactose, a natural sugar which gives it that delicate sweet taste. In order for the body to breakdown lactose into its basic components of simple sugars called glucose and galactose, an enzyme called lactase must be present. Many people lack this valuable enzyme in their digestive system causing a common digestive problem known as lactose intolerance. In order to metabolize lactose, lactase must always be present. During the natural bacterial fermentation process of milk or cream, lactose is converted into lactic acid. This makes for a much more digestible product for many people. Remember, generally ghee does not cause a problem with lactose intolerance. This is because during the ghee making process, the lactose is removed even if the butter used to make the ghee was not made from fermented cream."

The product website also states: "Fermentation process produces flavor compounds such as diacetyl, giving this product a more buttery taste. Many people prefer the taste and aroma of freshly fermented foods."

Diacetyl however is not entirely safe. In particular, its vapors are dangerous, as is noted on Wikipedia. Chronic exposure to its vapors is associated with lung disease and Alzheimer's. Technically, diacetyl can be removed, but there is no indication of PureIndianFoods doing this. Other similar compounds as a result of fermentation may also exist, but I can't be sure. As such, you probably do not want to heat this product much, or you may breathe in the diacetyl vapors. Eating the limited amount of diacetyl should probably be quite fine, however.

My LDL cholesterol rose substantially after eating this product for a few weeks. This is not unexpected considering the saturated fatty acid profile of the product. Although my HDL cholesterol also rose, I would rather not get in the LDL danger zone. Of course this is not enough evidence for any connection, but one may very well exist. If you decide to use it regularly, I recommend keeping track of all available lipid level indicators routinely.

On the positive side, vegetables do taste better with ghee. I didn't cook with the ghee, however, and only added it later.
Rating:
3.0

Wholesome Sweeteners Organic Stevia Packets, 1000 Count, 1 Case
Review:

Review:
I first had these in Japan fifteen years ago.  I always looked forward to a package of Pocky when I traveled to Japan.  Seriously, these were a whole lot better than a typical Japanese treat of a roll filled with red bean paste.  There just weren't many chocolate treats in Japan at that time.  And then, they started appearing in Asian grocery stores in this country.  Only the small boxes.  It was nice to buy a box now and then to remind me of Japan.  But now, they are showing up in Walmart and Costco.  Even though they are delicious they are not the treat they used to be--for me.

These seem a little different from the ones in Japan.  The chocolate is the same and the size is the same, but I think the stick is more pretzel-like in Japan.  They are still very good and I think I could eat them all day If I let myself buy one of the giant packages like the one above.

These were fun to look forward to in Japan or to buy in Asian supermarkets in this country to remind me of Japan.  They are good, but we have so many different treat choices in the U.S. that these don't seem that special now that they are everywhere.  Still, they might be different enough from the usual treats to make it big in the U.S.  Definitely worth trying!

Review:
If you like the real green tea that is served in Japan then you will be very disappointed in this tea.

This green tea is nothing like the flavorful, thick, green tea I have been served many times in Japan.  Now, I don't expect thick from a tea bag, but
I do expect some green tea flavor. There isn't any of that flavor in this.

Maybe this green tea is better for you than the fragrant authentic green tea beause it has so much less caffeine.  I don't know, but for me it is very boring.  Anybody want 18 tea bags?

Product:
David's Cookies Butter Pecan Melt Ways, 32 oz.
Review:
I am sorry to hear that some people received crumbs instead of cookies.  That's a shame.  If they had received whole cookies they would have been leaving great reviews like I am.  These are rich and delicious.  I have a family cookie recipe we call "Almond Crescents".  They look different, but they taste almost exactly like these wonderful cookiers even though we usually use finely chopped almonds when we make then.  These have chunks of pecans in them.  They really do melt in your mouth if you let them last that long.  Very buttery tasting.  They are crumbly, but if you are careful you will get every bite and not make a mess.

For once, I haven't looked at the calories.  It's the holidays.  I don't care.

I bought my tin at Costco for a lot less than they are being sold for here.  You pay something for the convenience of mailing, but it's not worth it if they come as a can of crumbs.  I would probably still eat them and love them.

Review:
My son likes taking a break from the stronger, bitter coffees with Starbucks Blonde blends.  Especially this Veranda blend.  My husband enjoys any coffee that isn't flavored--even if it's sold in the grocery store in a huge plastic tub with a lid.

LINDT LINDOR WHITE CHOCOLATE CITRUS TRUFFLES 5.1oz BAG

are citrus.  The citrus flavor should be stronger.

Product:
Knorr Rice Side Dish, Cheddar Broccoli, 5.7 oz, Pack of 12
Review:
I like this.  For a pre-packaged product the taste is very good.  No, you won't feel like you are eating something prepared in a good Thai restaurant, but it does taste far better than food in a bad Thai restaurant.  Not too hot and not too mild.  It's surprising because I don't usually like these Knorr rice side dishes very much.

I think a lot of people must like this Thai curry flavor because I have a difficult time finding more than one or two packages at a time at any grocery store.  I worry that they are going to stop making it.

Product:
Nutiva Organic Coconut Manna from Fresh, non-GMO, Sustainably Farmed Coconuts, 15-ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
****
This Nutiva Organic Coconut Manna is actually a type of coconut cream or coconut butter NOT coconut oil. The difference is that the cream or butter is much thicker, has whole coconut in it, and a very strong coconut flavor. You would not use the coconut manna for cooking. It is used more as a spread (which you wouldn't usually do with coconut oil) or can even be eaten by itself or made into a candy (because it is slightly sweet). It can be added to smoothies or used in many other creative ways. Think of it like whole coconut meat in a creamy form.

The reason I did not give this coconut manna five stars is because it is packaged in a difficult way. First of all, the container is plastic. In order to use the coconut manna, the container must be heated gradually to a very warm room temperature (say 80 degrees, I'd think) or else put in hot water for 30 minutes, stirred, and left in hot water for 30 more minutes. This is very inconvenient, plus the plastic container is not good for all of the repeated heatings.

Other than that, it's a great product. It is very slightly sweet and tastes strongly like coconut. The consistency is a bit gritty or grainy due to part of the coconut flesh that is powder and has been reconstituted, but I found that fine, not off-putting at all. It's great all by itself, added to smoothies, or put into the freezer in molds for a whole foods raw candy.

Recommended.
****

4.0
Product:
The Good Bean Chickpea Snacks, Sea Salt, Gluten and Nut Free, 2.5-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
*****
These are my very favorite snacks, and I like this flavor. My favorite flavor is the the smoky chili & lime followed by the sweet cinnamon. Still, these are good! They are crunchy too. If you like to munch on simple wholesome snacks, you'll like this one, I think.

Each bag comes with two servings in it for a total of (if you eat both servings, which I do) 280 calories, 4g fat, 46g carbohydrates, and 14g protein. This snack is gluten-free and uses non-gmo garbanzo beans. The ingredients are roasted chickpeas, evaporated can juice (ie, sugar), coarse salt, gum arabic, expeller-pressed canola oil (non-gmo), and Vitamin E. Half of the package (or one serving) isn't that much food, plus then you have the problem of keeping the rest of the package crunchy--if you leave them out in a bowl they will be not so crunchy the next day. I'm not sure why they add the sugar, but the taste is really fantastic without being sweet, so maybe it keeps them from being bitter.

Sometimes if I just want to have a delicious snack and I'm hungry and able to handle the carbs, I have these. They take a while to eat (they can be a bit hard on your teeth as they are very, very crunchy) and fill you up, plus if you drink lots of water (or other beverage) with it, you'll be really full afterwards.

They can be purchased alone in a six-pack here or as part of the sampler set. I have noticed mixed reviews here, so they are not to everyone's tastes; if you're not sure you'll like them, you can always order them as part of the sampler.

Highly recommended.
*****

Bare Natural Apple Chips, Cinnamon, Gluten Free + Baked, Single Serve Bag - 1.7 Oz (10 Count)
Review:
*****
These apple chips are tart, very crispy, and yummy! They don't have the processed or chemically taste that some dried apples have. They also are not soggy at all--I like my apple chips very crispy! They are 100% certified organic, baked with no added sugar, no preservatives or chemicals, no pesticides or herbicides, gluten free, and made from Washington State apples with five apples in every bag. These are a truly healthy and delicious snack.

These particular chips are only just barely sweet, mostly tart. If you want sweet apple chips, you can buy Fuji apple chips from the same company that are just as crisp and good. I like to mix both together for a sweet-tart combo.

I would recommend (and it's way more economical) to buy these in bulk. If you like tart apples at all, and you like your chips crispy, then you have nothing to lose.

Note: Each of the many dried fruits that are prepared and processed by Bare Fruits--each one is different--some are chewy, some crispy, but all are natural and vary as the natural fruits vary. In my opinion, their brand would tend to appeal to people who like things without added sugars and preservatives and whose taste buds and teeth can handle less processed food. The apple chips are very easy on the teeth, though...just so you know, not every product is like that

Highly recommended.
*****

5.0
Product:
Yogi Tea - Green Tea Super Antioxidant - Helps Reduce Free Radicals - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total
Review:
*****
What a wonderful tea this is! Herb-y tasting in a good way, and slightly sweet (from the licorice root) with lemongrass overtones and jasmine reminisces. This Green Tea Super Anti-Oxidant from Yogi Tea is one of my favorite teas. It has everything to make it a perfect everyday green tea. It is made from Organic Lemongrass, Organic Green Tea Leaf, Organic Licorice Root, Jasmine Green Tea Leaf, Organic Alfalfa Leaf, Organic Burdock Root, Organic Dandelion Root, Grapeseed Extract, Irish Moss Powder, and Emblic Fruit (Amla) Extract.

Green Tea Super Anti-Oxidant comes with an expiration date (a good thing, because it's not full of preservatives, plus you can tell if it is fresh). Yogi Tea seems to be another company (like Numi, Aspen, Traditional Medicinals) that values sustainable and healthy practices. Their web site, yogitea.com, is beautifully designed, with info about each tea they make.

According to Yogi Tea, this tea is 80% organic and is intended combat the damage of free radicals in the body that accelerate aging. It contains 21mg of caffeine (compared to 90mg in an 8oz cup of coffee).

Yogi Green Tea Super Anti-Oxidant makes me glad every day that I stopped drinking coffee and switched to teas---it's that good! If you've only tried commercial brands like Stash and Celestial Seasoning, and you think you don't like tea because they taste fake and full of strong flavorings, then you owe it to yourself to give this tea a try. If you enjoy Stash and Celestial Seasonings, love their strong flavors, and disagree with me, you may not like this tea as it is subtle and a very different tea-drinking experience. You'll know what type of tea drinker you are!

Highly recommended.
*****

Yogi Tea - Green Tea Super Antioxidant - Helps Reduce Free Radicals - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total
Review:
*****

This Organic Green Tea Kombucha Decaf from Yogi Tea is certainly unique. It tastes like a mixture of passion fruit, plum, ginger, and green tea. It is mild, and not bitter at all, even when you leave the tea bag in the whole time you drink the tea, as I do. Best of all, it is an easy, convenient way of benefiting from Kombucha, if you don't grow your own (and I don't anymore, as it is not easy or convenient for me). I have never before obtained my Kombucha from a tea; this is a tasty way to do so.

I am definitely impressed with this tea and with Yogi Teas in general. Organic Green Tea Kombucha Decaf comes with an expiration date (a good thing, because it's not full of preservatives, plus you can tell if it is fresh). Yogi Tea seems to be another company (like Numi, Aspen, Traditional Medicinals) that values sustainable and healthy practices. Their web site has a helpful glossary of tea ingredients and is beautifully designed, with info about each tea they make.

Yogi Tea writes this on the box about the tea's benefits: "Green Tea Decaf Kombucha uses the same delicious recipe as our Green Tea Kombucha but is naturally decaffeinated. Our organically certified CO2 decaffeination method removes only the caffeine while leaving all of the beneficial polyphenolic elements of Organic Green Tea (Camellia sinensis) intact. This method also maintains the antioxidant properties and delicate flavor of our delicious, organically-grown Green Tea.* Unlike other green teas, this special organic Green Tea has a delicate flavor with no bitterness. This formula incorporates the natural antioxidant properties of Green Tea with a concentrated, purified extract of Kombucha-Pure(tm). This extract is made from Kombucha grown in a unique medium of 32 supporting Chinese herbs and is produced without the use of refined sugar or black tea. For centuries, practitioners of herbal medicine have used Kombucha to detoxify the body, enhance the immune system, fight fatigue and soothe an upset stomach.* This convenient form of Kombucha can be taken daily for maximum health benefits."

Yogi Tea's use of "Kombucha-Pure", grown in 32 Chinese herbs and WITHOUT black tea or sugar is very, very appealing, and a new and exciting way of producing Kombucha.

Note that Yogi Tea also makes a caffeinated version of this tea that has exactly the same ingredients except that the organic green tea does include caffeine.

Highly recommended.

*****

Green Tea Energy comes with an expiration date (a good thing, because it's not full of preservatives, plus you can tell if it is fresh). Yogi Tea seems to be another company (like Numi, Aspen, Traditional Medicinals) that values sustainable and healthy practices. I gave this tea only four stars because the taste is so hard for me to handle. It is, however, a quality tea, and if you like it, there are many benefits to be gained.

Recommended, if you can stand the taste.

Stash Tea Organic Jasmine Green Tea, Loose Leaf, 3.5-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 3)
Review:
****
I enjoy bergamot a lot, but this tea was way too fragrant for me; still it was different and enjoyable to try. The bergamot flavor is strong, not subtle, and a bit overwhelming---it's all you can taste.

The ingredients of this tea are premium black teas with pure oil of bergamot---that's all.

The manufacturer writes: "Oil of bergamot comes from the rind of a citrus fruit which grows very well in the Calabria region of Italy. Pure top quality oil of bergamot is expensive but no blend or man-made flavoring can match the ethereal aroma and finely nuanced flavor of the real thing.
Certain Earl Grey fanatics have grown especially fond of the top grade Calabrian oil of bergamot that we use and have asked for more, ..More,... MORE! Thus was born Stash Double Bergamot Earl Grey. In our Double Bergamot Earl Grey tea, the black tea base still serves as a solid foundation for this blend, but the oil of bergamot takes wing and soars to new unprecedented heights. The flavor is quite pronounced but not at all soapy or bitter which would happen with low grade oils. Is the flavor too strong? For a conservative drinker, maybe yes, but more adventurous types really seem to like it."

I must not be adventurous enough. I do agree with the manufacturer, though, and it might be the tea for you if you're a huge fan of bergamot and want a lot of it, and I also agree that it tastes pure, not soapy or bitter at all.

Review:
*****
This is a healthy and delicious chip, approved by both my junk food loving husband and me (I eat healthfully). Corazonas are a high fiber (3g) and low salt chip perfect for heart patients---with only 115mg of salt. You can actually see the oats in them, and I enjoy that they fill you up better than conventional commercial chips.

Although each serving of chips has 7g of fat, note that they are made without trans fats and with healthy fats instead. If you are on a diet that minimizes all fats, you'd of course want to avoid them, but if you believe that certain fats (in this case expeller pressed high oleic safflower, mid-oleic sunflower, and/or canola oil) are fine in moderation and enjoy the full fat taste, these are the chips for you.

The 7oz large bags are larger, but they taste so good that they are addictive, and I like prefer these chips pre-measured into smaller quantities; thus I like the 2oz bags. So, if you're like me, buy this item, otherwise search for the larger bags. I like the plain Corazonas even more than the Jalapeno Jack version, which we have also tried, because they are wholesome and taste good on their own.

Corazonas claim to be the only chips containing plant sterols, which they say is proven to reduce cholesterol.

Highly recommended.
*****

5.0
