First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Organic Award-Winning Black Garlic PEELED 1 lb. (30-47 BULBS!!) (Equal to 908 grams, or 2 lbs, of unpeeled black garlic:No stems, cores, or peels in weight with PEELED): NO Sugar Water Added! NO GMOs Review: I'm loving this black garlic. I use it many ways, but my favorite way is to cut up a few cloves in my salad. It has a sweet, earthy taste. Rating: 5.0 Product: Food For Life Ezekiel 4:9 Organic Sprouted Grain Cereal, Golden Flax, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) Review: If you're still eating refined flour, sugar, and artificial sweeteners, this cereal (and all the Ezekiel products) will probably taste like granulated styrofoam to you. We train our palettes, for better or for worse. I have been eating Ezekiel for at least 20 years. I don't eat sugar, artificial sweeteners, refined grains, red meat, or artificial anything, and this cereal tastes sweet and crunchy and nutty to me. I usually eat it with a handful of chopped walnuts, cut up a banana or peach, and add almond milk. It's low on the glycemic index, which is also an enormous plus if you're trying to eat healthy. And it's filling; unlike when you eat those sugary cereals, you won't be hungry in an hour. When I walk into the grocery store, and 99% of the groceries are all about sugar and carbohydrate addictions and foods all pumped up with chemicals and addictive substances, I feel discriminated against. It's much harder to eat right in this country. I can't even find Ezekiel in most stores. I hope, I hope, I hope they never go out of business! Rating: 5.0 Product: Dragon Herbs Spring Dragon Longevity Tea Caffeine Free -- 20 Tea Bags Review: I can't have coffee or anything with caffeine, so I've been searching for a morning drink and was sure, from all the reviews on the internet, that this was going to be it. I didn't like the taste much but figured I could get used to it. What I won't be getting used to is not sleeping. Even when I drink it first thing in the morning, it evidently revs up my system so that I'm awake all night. Bummer. Back to my Rooibos tea. Rating: 1.0 Product: A. Vogel Trocomare, Organic Spicy Herb Seasoning Salt, 8.8-Ounce Canisters (Pack of 3) Review: The 3 pack that I've been ordering isn't available. I hope they bring it back! This is my favorite seasoning, kept near my stove, and I use it on so many meats and veggies, even on my salad. It just brings an added zip to the flavor. I had always used Herbamare, but when I tried Trocomare, I was hooked. Looks like I may have to go back to Herbamare. Rating: 5.0 Product: A Vogel Trocomare Organic Herb Seasoning Salt -- 8.8 oz Review: I've used Herbamare (off and on) for many years, mainly because it's healthy......but I ordered this one about three months ago, and it's my new addiction. The slightly spicy flavor just agrees with me and enhances the taste of anything I'm cooking from veggies to eggs to meat. I'm back to order the 3 pack. Rating: 5.0 Product: Traditional Medicinals Organic Chamomile Herbal Leaf Tea, 16 Tea Bags (Pack of 6) Review: Quite honestly, I don't like herbal teas, but I've been drinking them most of my adult life because they're good for me. You can add various milks and sweeteners, but mostly I take mine straight and think pleasant thoughts. But I'm at a point in my life where sleep isn't a sure thing, and I won't use drugs to make me sleep that would have catastrophic side effects, so I take a cocktail of supplements that are (knock wood) helping me slip into that nether world of dreams and rest, but it comes slowly if at all, and I've tried several herbal blends of chamomile, passion flower, etc., without much success. I found this one, while searching for something else and decided what the heck, and ordered it. It's not instant, as in something that will conk me right out, but if I drink it an hour or more before bedtime, it takes the edge off the day. Linden Flower appears to have a ton of benefits, everything from taming high blood pressure, to clearing mucus and yes, treating insomnia. I thought I'd look at some other Linden teas, but the Lemon Balm and Hawthorne in this one seem to work together, so I'm not going to try anything else just yet. Also it's organic, which is pretty high on my list of priorities. The taste is about like all herbal teas, grassy, and I definitely don't wake up feeling drugged. I would buy it by subscribe and save or in multi-packs if they were available. Rating: 5.0 Product: Chios Mastiha Tears Gum Greek 100% Natural Mastic Packs From Mastic Growers (50gr Small Tears) Review: I'm placing my second order for this gum. It's definitely helping my digestion issues, and I'm sort of addicted to chewing it. It's not like the gum we usually chew, and there's a bit of a learning curve. You have to test each of the tears by chewing down on it carefully to see how moist or dry it is. Some will break into tiny shards, and some will be so sticky you'll spend the better part of the day cleaning it off your teeth. I've found that what works best for me is to save a little piece of my gum from the previous day, start chewing it to get it softened back up, and then add a piece or two of new Mastic Tears to it. My jaws get a real workout. The first few times they were actually a little sore, so I guess it's good from that standpoint as well. Rating: 5.0 Product: Maldon Sea Salt Flakes, 8.5 ounce Box Review: Having this flake salt on my table isn't a big deal, but when I sprinkle it on my food, it's a burst of sea saltiness that I enjoy very much, and I know I'm also caring for my health, in one more small way. I'm the only one who uses it, so the two boxes last a long time, and I'm almost out, so I just ordered more. I have other sea salts for other uses. I just realized lately that this one makes an awesome salt to coat the rim of my margarita glass....also healthy, made with organic fruit juices and 100% agave tequila. Life is good :) Rating: 5.0 Product: Nutiva Organic Coconut Manna from Fresh, non-GMO, Sustainably Farmed Coconuts, 15-ounce (Pack of 2) Review: I've used this coconut manna for years, just love it. The best use I've found for it is a tablespoon in my morning matcha green tea, along with a tsp of Manuka honey, and a tablespoon of organic ghee. Whip it with a milk frother. It's practically a meal in itself, gets me off to a healthy, energetic start. When you receive it, if the manna has settled, immerse the jar in warm water for a while and then stir thoroughly or else you'll use up all the oil on the top, and the manna at the bottom will be dry and crumbly. Rating: 5.0 Product: Yogi Tea - Woman's Moon Cycle - Supports a Healthy Cycle - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total Review: I'm not sure why this is called Woman's Energy. Maybe it revs up some women, but for me, it's the exact opposite, and I get drowsy and sleepy, but it's a "peaceful, easy feeling". It does contain chamomile. The taste, well, it's an herbal tea, and most of them taste like grass to me, but with a dollop of almond milk and a little agave nectar, it's quite drinkable. I'm post menopausal, and I'm trying to get my HRT on a moon phase schedule, so I plan to begin drinking this only on the 4th week of my cycle to see if it will help balance my hormones, which have been a mess since my surgery nearly 20 years ago, even with compounded bio-identical hormone cream. I would recommend this tea but not for an energy boost. Product: Solofill Cup, Refillable Cup For Keurig Single serve cups Brewers, Red and Black (Pack of 2) Review: For Christmas of 2011, a good friend of mine gave me a Solofill Reusable K-Cup. She knew that I have a Keurig 35 B30 Mini Brewer (Keurig 35 B30 Mini Personal Single-Serve Brewing System, Black) at work. I make at least two cups of coffee in the morning and sometimes one in the afternoon if I'm feeling sleepy. (I work two jobs and I am sleep deprived.) I've had this Keurig brewer for at least three years and I couldn't live without it. However, disposable K-Cups are expensive; this is why I purchased the Keurig My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter (Keurig My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter). At the time, I thought it was wonderful. It is a three-piece unit. A removable filter sits inside the reusable K-cup which has a top that screws on. Also, the Keurig brewer's filter holder has to be removed in order to insert the Keurig Reusable Filter. There is always the possibility that this filter holder could be damaged or lost. On a daily basis, I've been using the Solofill Reusable K-Cup for over seven months. It is much easier to operate and clean than the Keurig Reusable Filter. Also, the coffee tastes just as great; I use my favorite Starbucks Natural Fusions Ground Coffee, Vanilla Flavored ]. There are never any grounds in my coffee. My only concern was that the plastic hinge that connects the lid with the reusable K-Cup's body would eventually break but it hasn't. There are not any visible cracks, tears, shreds, etc. It looks nearly as good as when it was given to me as a Christmas gift. I no longer use my Keurig Reusable Filter, but I haven't thrown it away in case my Solofill Reusable K-Cup is lost or stolen. Several times I've accidentally left it in the break room after washing it. I could afford to buy another one. The Solofill Reusable K-Cup costs the same as a Keurig Reusable Filter. If you own one of the many varieties of Keurig single-serving brewing systems, then I highly recommend buying the Solofill Reusable K-Cup; it is easy to use, saves money and is very durable! Joseph B. Hoyos Rating: 5.0 Using the features, generate the proper review. If you haven't received some of the features, only make use of the provided ones. golds.output: I love the idea of coconut and banana together, but these bites didn't quite live up to my expectations. They were soft and chewy, which I like, but the flavor was just okay. I could taste the coconut, but the banana flavor was a bit overpowered. My husband, who is a big fan of coconut, thought they were fine, but he didn't rave about them either. I appreciate that they're a natural snack and a good source of potassium, but for the price, I was hoping for a more exciting flavor combination.

Review:
This trail mix is so delicious.  I had to stop myself from finishing the bag in one day.  The chocolate is like M&M's, meaning they melt in your mouth . . . .  Hands, be clean.  And the nuts are not all peanuts; we also get almonds and cashews.  Yes, cashews!  My belly is more than happy.  Love, love, love this trail mix.

Product:
Viva Naturals Organic Coconut Sugar: Non-GMO, Low-Glycemic Sweetener, 6 lbs Bag
Review:
If you're wondering what coconut sugar is, the ingredient reads coconut nectar and nothing else.  It looks like coarse white sugar dyed brown, or dark brown sugar that's loose and dry.  It smells like the husk of a coconut and tastes sweet and nutty.

I baked a batch of cookies - half using regular sugar cane sugar, the other half using coconut sugar.  Then, I asked the family to compare without telling them which was which.  They chose because they had to, my husband asking if it was a trick question.  In the end, my daughter like the coconut sugar cookies.  My husband and son chose the white sugar cookies.  Like the rest of my family, I honestly couldn't tell the difference.

I made chicken wings in the oven.  It's a recipe I've used for years using soy sauce, honey, and sugar.  This time, I substituted coconut sugar.  Here, the difference was noticeable.  I could smell and taste the bolder, nuttier flavor.  I didn't tell the family I had changed the recipe, though, and no one commented on it.

I'm going to keep experimenting with coconut sugar.  It's not going to replace my sugar cane sugar, because there are times when I don't want that nutty flavor or brown color coming through.  It's a definite green light for cookies, as no one can tell it's even there.

This product was provided for review by Viva Labs.

I'm using it on my skin and lips, which makes me smell like the tropics.  The only problem is I can't seal up the packet.  There's way more in it than I'll ever need for one application.  Still better than dipping my hand in a tub, though.

Review:
I was looking forward to something the size of a jar of hand cream.  What I got could compete with a can of Crisco.  But lard, this is not.  Nope, it's too runny to be lard, and too thick to be oil.  I guess I could use it for cosmetic purposes, but that would mean dipping my hand in it.  Instead, I fried up some sausage.  This stuff heats up well and fries great.  I'm no fan of coconut flavors, but this didn't taste like coconut at all.  I like it, but I wish it came in a squeeze bottle.  It's about the right consistency for that.

_____________

UPDATE 5/19/16:  After cooking up some foods with milder flavors, yes, I can taste the coconut.  It does lend an interesting twist to the recipes!

Even my pickiest eater son has munched on his fair share.  My daughter says she likes them.  My husband is keeping his promise, and yes, I'm doing what I can to help out.  These are soft, chewy granola bars, not the crunchy sort.  All that chocolate makes them more cookie than whole earth healthy, but then they're only 100 Calories or less per each.  That's not so bad, is it?

golds.output: I am very pleased with this Druids Grove Lactic Acid. As a vegan, I am always on the lookout for products that are free from animal-derived ingredients and this product fits the bill. The fact that it is also non-GMO and gluten-free is a bonus. I have been using it in my recipes and it has worked beautifully, providing a nice tanginess without any harsh flavors. I also appreciate that it is OU Kosher Certified, which gives me confidence in the product's quality. Overall, I am very happy with this purchase and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a vegan-friendly lactic acid.

Bag - Divinely Fresh and Delicious - Packed with Healthy Nutrients - Zero Cholesterol - Kosher Certified Review: These cherries are a bit hard, but they are easily softened up by soaking. I use them in baking and in the trail mix I make with organic peanuts, organic raisins, organic shredded coconut, organic cacao nibs, and a touch of stevia. They have a delicious, tart flavor. Rating: 5.0 Product: Navitas Organics Cacao Nibs, 8 oz. Bag — Organic, Non-GMO, Fair Trade, Gluten-Free Review: For those who want to get all the benefits of dark chocolate without any processing, this is for you. These are raw, natural "nibs" of cacao. They aren't sweet like chocolate candy, and they can take some getting used to, but you don't need to eat a lot of this food to get the health benefits, only about a half teaspoonful of them per day. Over the last four years there have been dozens of scientific studies analyzing and confirming substantial health benefits from a small amount of dark chocolate consumed daily. The latest findings from a Harvard study released in early 2011 indicate that as little as 6 gm. of dark chocolate (about 30 calories) is a sufficient daily "dose." That means you need very little of pure chocolate like these nibs. The original German studies in 2007 used Ritter Sport dark chocolate, but I haven't so far been able to discover which kind of Ritter's dark chocolate was used by the researchers. However, since Ritter's only makes two types, 50% cacao and 71% cacao, this product's content of cacao goes far beyond the parameters of the dark chocolate used in that study. The health benefits of dark chocolate are due to the flavonoids contained in cocoa. Flavonoids act as antioxidants in the body, which both prevent and reduce inflammation. Over many years of medical research, inflammation has been found to contribute to or directly cause a host of diseases, including high blood pressure, heart disease, and cancer, as well as autoimmune diseases like arthritis. Flavonoids are found in the pigments of fruits and vegetables which give them their color. The darker and deeper the color of a fruit or vegetable, the greater the amount of flavonoids it contains. Cocoa is derived from the dark-brown cacao bean, which is the fruit of the tropical tree, theobroma cacao. In any chocolate product, such as this one, the higher the percentage of cocoa/cacao, the more flavonoids the chocolate contains. Dark chocolate such as this product is better for your health than milk chocolate because it contains more antioxidants, which are good for you, and less sugar, which is not good for you--especially if you have diabetes or are struggling with your weight. The FDA defines categories of chocolate based on how much cocoa/cacao is in a given product: 1. Unsweetened chocolate with no additives is 100% cocoa. Most all brands of unsweetened baker's chocolate fall into this category. Their ingredient list will state simply, "chocolate." This product is unprocessed cacao. 2. Bittersweet chocolate contains 35-99% cocoa (35% is the minimum), and it must contain less than 12% milk solids. There is a large range of products in this category, and the product names reflect the amount of chocolate they contain. Unsweetened chocolate is very bitter, and the more cocoa in a product, the less room for sugar, and the more bitter it will be. In order to avoid frightening off customers who are used to sweet chocolate, marketers often substitute the words "dark," "extra dark" or "intense" for "bitter" if that word is not paired with "sweet," for example as "bittersweet" or "extra bittersweet." This product lies at the top of this range. 3. Sweet chocolate contains 15-34% cocoa (15% is the minimum), and it must contain less than 12% milk solids. It is sometimes also marketed as "dark chocolate," even though it has a much lower percentage of cocoa solids than bittersweet, which can cause consumers, in such cases, to purchase a product with less cocoa in it than they realized they were getting. Everything else besides the cocoa and milk solids is essentially sugar. 4. Milk chocolate is only required to have a minimum of 10% cocoa, a minimum of 12% milk solids and 3.39% milk fat. The rest is sugar and milk. Rating: 5.0 Product: Sincerely Nuts Dried Pineapple Chunks - Two Lb. Bag - Beyond Delicious - Astounding Freshness - Bursting with Wholesome Nutrients - Kosher Certified Review: I eat a lot of dried pineapple, and it's not available locally in my grocery store. I had previously purchased the NOW brand, but it comes in a much smaller size, and the price for this product is great. The pineapple is in bite-sized chunks, and it is chewy and delicious. I have purchased it three times now and will again. Rating: 5.0 Product: Nutiva USDA Certified Organic, non-GMO, Gluten-free, Unrefined Coconut Flour, 16-ounce (Pack of 6) Review: For some time now I have been grinding up coconut flakes to make my own rough-and-ready coconut flour, and I at last decided to simply purchase some coconut flour. I was interested to see that this flour has far, far less fat in it than ground up coconut flakes. I can only assume that this is because the coconut pulp that is dried to be ground into flour has first been squeezed to remove coconut oil, which is sold separately. I use this flour in muffins, soup, and vegan ice cream. It tastes almost as good as ground up coconut flakes for these three purposes, and it saves a lot of calories. My recipe for a really creamy, delicious, tropical ice cream is: 1 ripe mango, peeled 1 ripe banana, peeled 5 large frozen strawberries 1 cup fresh or canned pineapple, pre-frozen in ice cube tray 1/2 cup coconut flour 1 tablespoon vanilla extract (I make my own) 1 teaspoon stevia powder 1-1/2 to 2 cups frozen ice cubes (I freeze green tea that I have sweetened to taste with stevia) I blend all the non-frozen ingredients in my Vitamix first. Then I gradually add in the frozen ingredients, blending on high until it is well mixed and the consistency of a Dairy Queen Blizzard. Yum! Rating: 5.0 Product: Garden of Life Greens and Protein Powder - Organic Raw Protein and Greens with Probiotics/Enzymes, Vegan, Gluten-Free, Chocolate 22oz (1lb 6oz/611g) Powder Review: This is a high-quality, meal-replacement supplement. It tastes pretty good for a vegan product. Every vegan protein powder I've ever tried has been really awful tasting. This product does have a somewhat grainy texture, however, it mixes well using a mini-whisk or a fork, and of course there is no problem at all if you use a blender. I mixed it into room-temperature, purified water, and I did not feel the need to try it at a later time with herbal tea or almond milk to improve the taste, as I do with regular, vegan protein powder. It tasted fine just with water. This product is certified USDA organic and non-GMO. It is vegan, Kosher, dairy-free, and soy-free. It also contains probiotics, enzymes and fiber. It is sweetened with stevia, and has no bitter aftertaste. In short, there are no bad ingredients at all and plenty of excellent ones. This product is fairly expensive, at about $1.50 per serving, but that's not too bad as far as healthy, meal-replacement products go. I found it quite filling. Rating: 5.0 Product: Frontier Natural Products Organic Bac'Uns Bacon Flavored Soy Bits - 1 lb Review: These are a delicious, organic version of soy, vegan, fake-bacon bits. They taste wonderful on salad, and I especially like them when I make toast, spread homemade guacamole on it, and sprinkle thesse Bac'Uns on top. Yummy! They also taste good sprinkled over potato salad. On top of all that, they are a terrific, low-calorie source of protein. Rating: 5.0 Product: Enjoy Life Baking Chocolate, Soy free, Nut free, Gluten free, Dairy free, Non GMO, Vegan, Paleo, Semi Sweet Mini Chips, 10 Ounce Bags (Pack of 6) Review: These vegan, mini chocolate chips taste delicious and they are terrific to bake with. I had not used mini chips before, and they work great for better distribution of chips throughout the chocolate chip cookies I made. Below is the recipe I used, which is one I developed for myself after a lot of experimenting with ways to avoid using sugar yet still have cookies taste sweet. I have included some pictures of the cookies I baked as well as what the dough looks like when made in a food processor. I will definitely purchase these chocolate chips again! Vegan Chocolate Chip Cookies Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Mix these dry ingredients together well or sift them together if preferred: 2 cups whole wheat pastry flour 2 tsp. stevia 1 tsp. baking powder 1/4 tsp. sea salt Puree in food processor: 1 medium, peeled and cored apple (or 1/2 cup applesauce) 60 gm pitted dates 1/2 cup coconut oil 1 tablespoon vanilla extract (I make my own) 1/4 cup maple syrup Gradually add in 1/2 of the dry ingredients to the pureed mixture in the food processor. Remove the pureed mixture from the food processor and place in a bowl. Stir in the rest of the dry mixture and add last: 1 cup Enjoy Life Semi-Sweet Chocolate Mini-Chips For convenience, I use my toaster oven rather than turning on my regular-sized oven (easier to deal with and uses less electricity). As stated above, I preheat my toaster oven to 325 degrees. I use a 1-tablespoon-size melon-ball scoop to measure out balls of cookie dough onto a greased silicone baking sheet which is specifically sized for a toaster oven. I press the cookie-dough balls flat. I then bake the cookies on the toaster-oven rack on its top level for 9-10 minutes. The cookies have a moist and chewy texture. This recipe makes about 44 cookies at approximately 75 calories each. Rating: 5.0 Product: Mrs Dash Garlic & Herb Salt Free Blend, 6.75-ounce Review: I'm a big fan of all of the Mrs Dash spice blends, but this is my all-time favorite. It goes great in almost anything, and I frequently use it to spice up bland, commercial dishes like soups. Many times when I've spiced my own soup or stew and, somehow, it doesn't end up with an excellent flavor, if I add a bit of this particular Mrs Dash blend, it saves the day and makes my "blah" dish taste great. Highly recommended! Rating: 5.0 Product: 2LB Cafe Don Pablo Subtle Earth Organic Gourmet Coffee - Medium-Dark Roast - Whole Bean Coffee USDA Certified Organic, 2 Pound Review: This is delicious, aromatic coffee, but fairly dark and strong. I like having whole beans and grinding it fresh on each use. I have bought it multiple times now, and each time it has consistently been of excellent quality. Rating: 5.0 Product: Mrs. Dash Garlic & Herb All Natural Seasoning Blend 2.5 oz Review: This is one of my favorite flavors of Mrs. Dash, and I use them all. I sprinkle it in canned soups such as Progresso Reduced Sodium Garden Vegetable or in my own homemade soup. It also tastes good on salads. If you are on a reduced-salt diet, this is so good, you won't miss it. Rating: 5.0 Product: Vega Protein & Greens, Plant Protein Shake, Vanilla,net weight 26.8 ounce,25 servings Review: Will give you the short and skinny from someone who bought-paid full price. My requirements were: low in fat, low in fiber, low in cholesterol, low in sugar, plant based proteins and with all that, it had to play nice with my pancreas.... oh, and with all that, I expected it to taste half way decent. Vega Protein & Greens ticked all the required needs and even tastes all right- As far as taste, it's a tad bit on the powdery/chalky taste for me, BUT, I think that's a small price to pay since it meets all the other requirements. Someone who evidently received this free for a review made mention that it's pricey. I'd have to ask, "compared to what?" I have been paying $55.00 for another brand and yes, that brand tastes less chalky to me, but still Vega is doing what I need it to do, it fulfills all the requirements I had,and so as long as they don't change up the formula, I most likely will continue to buy this product. I also forgot to mention it dissolves very easily, not many protein powders do, at least not without a blender or bullet type device. The Vega Protein & Greens dissolves easily with just a shake or two. That's a nice PLUS. UPdate: The price has gone up $9.00 since I bought the first one. There are equally good products out there for a little less with more servings... After writing the original review and saying I would buy again. with the price jump, I most likely won't. Rating: 3.0 Product: Island Fresh Superior Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, 54 Ounce Review: I was asked to sample Island Fresh Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil obviously due to reviews of other coconut oils I have purchased. I buy and use a LOT of coconut oil... some brands I've liked, some I would never buy again. I DO NOT keep any other oil in the house other than Coconut oil, so basically I use it for everything in the kitchen for cooking and I even use it on my Formica counter tops, around the house, on my skin .... I'm a coconut oil fanatic. The one thing I DO NOT use this type oil for is my essential oils.... I buy a cheaper version for that one application. Island Fresh Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil, so far, has passed all my tests of what I will buy more than once.... In a nutshell: it smells good, tastes good, feels good and in its hardened state is not 'pithy' feeling like a few other oils I've purchased. It's also competitively priced ... who could ask for more? I am sold !!!! Rating: 5.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill Raw Shelled Sunflower Seeds (Kernels Only), 20 Ounce (Pack of 4) (Package May Vary) Review: I've liked most all the Bob's Red Mill products I've bought and I was loving these sunflower seeds until about 6 months ago when more and more burnt seeds showed up in the bags. Who wants pre-burned sunflowers in their Sunbutter? Since I do not sprout my sunflower seeds, I can't dispute whether they are really raw or not, but I got to thinking, if the process is so hot that it's burning some of the seeds, what about the ones that aren't burned? Anyway, just a hmmmmmm thought for me. I've moved on to get my sunflower seeds at my local whole foods store. I still buy a lot of other Bob's Red Mill products though and have no complaints. Product: Stevita Stevia Supreme Powder - 50 Packets - Stevia & Xylitol All Natural Sweetener, No Calories - USDA Organic, Non GMO, Vegan, Kosher, Paleo, Gluten-Free - 50 Servings Review: I think a lot of people look at sweetener and they have to compare it to sugar. If you like sugar, then you need to use sugar. Plain and simple. But if you're "willing" to try other items to sweeten things, then certainly I think Stevia Supreme is worth a try. I found out about this product fist by doing a Google search on Truvia, and read a great article about that. . . and that's where I found out about Stevia, and why it's a "dietary supplement". So. . . I came to Amazon.com and found Stevia Supreme. I read the reviews and decided to try it. . . and I'm glad I did! When I first put some on my finger and tasted it. . . YUCK! I thought . . . this is NOT sugar! But then I decided to try it in some lemon/lime-ade and I really like it! I think it's quite a bit "sweeter" than sugar. But make no mistake . . it's NOT sugar. I make quick lemonade or limeade (or lemon/lime-ade) with True Lemon / True Lime True Lemon Crystallized Fruit Wedge ~ 192 Ct BulkTrue Lime Crystallized Fruit Wedge ~ 192 Ct Bulk This makes a refreshing, sweet beverage. I certainly don't think that Stevia Supreme is going to work for everyone. . . but. . . at this price, you can try it and see if it's right for you. As more and more reports are coming out about other sweeteners not really being very good for you. . . and Stevia has been used for many . . .many years. .. I think I'll stick with Stevia Supreme. . .at least for now. :-) Rating: 5.0 Using the features, generate the proper review. Product: SENSA Chews Chocolate Fudge, 6.3 Ounce Review: I work in a job where I simply don't have the opportunity to take a quick snack break whenever I feel like it, and there isn't a fridge handy where I can keep healthy snacks. A handful of almonds or a banana are easy to store in my desk, but don't always sound appealing. Chocolate fudge, though? It always sounds good. So, I was a bit skeptical about these Sensa Chews simply because I was worried I'd eat one and then end up still hungry and end up eating another and another and another. My first look at the individually wrapped chews in their packaging only added to my concern. They look quite a bit like those Storck RIESEN Chewy Caramels, Chocolate, 2.65-Ounce (Pack of 12). They're wrapped in the same type of parchment type paper, have the same color, and are similarly sized. When I was feeling junk food cravings coming on between lunch and dinner, I unwrapped one of these chocolate confections....and instantly knew that overindulgence would NOT be a problem. The taste of these chews isn't awful at all, but it's also not the taste of chocolate fudge. It's not even like a weak tootsie roll. It's a hint of something akin to chocolate without actually being chocolaty. That said, it's not bad, and it doesn't have any aftertaste whatsoever. What it does have is a sort of weird texture. Don't ask me how I know this, but the texture of the chew is actually quite like the texture you get when you're chewing a wad of gum and then take a bite of peanut butter (seriously, I don't know how I know this texture, but it's what instantly came to mind). The chew is very soft and very easy to chew, but it almost immediately starts to disintegrate as you are chewing. It goes from almost smooth to incredibly gritty, then sort of dissolves. And, while it's easy to chew, it's not a quick chew. It doesn't hurt the jaw at all, but it does require maybe a minute or two of chewing to fully dissolve. The package carries a warning label that you need to drink it with at least 8 ounces of water or risk choking, but I found that it went down quite easily enough (and I always take one with a full bottle of water so that I just don't have to worry about it). As far as suppressing my appetite, I think the Sensa Chews worked pretty well at this. Granted, I was still hungry, and still wanted something to eat after taking one, but it was more psychological than physical. And when I did eat afterward, I think I didn't gorge like I might do when I've gone all day without eating and then suddenly have a chance to get to something. Honestly, I might also be just as satisfied with a banana or a handful of almonds, but those get boring after a while, and despite my best intentions, I never remember to bring them to work with me (or the banana turns black or the bag of almonds that are supposed to be for emergencies end up getting all eaten on the same day I bring them). In any case, these chews are quite simple to keep in my desk and handy as well. I like them well enough, but I do wish that there were other flavor options besides the chocolate and berry available; I'd be willing to give them a try. It takes a few minutes to make, but you end up with real pasta feel and flavor.  The pasta is thinner than stove top, perhaps that is the trick. Review:
These beans are a staple in our cupboard.  We add them to everything from salads, to stir fries, to  sauts.  Would probably use dried beans for soup, but these canned beans are a quick, healthy, delicious convenience food. Always ready, you don't have to think to soak them the night before.  They can be tossed into just about any vegetable dish for protein and flavor. They love garlic and good olive oil for seasoning.  If you like dips, they'd make a great base.  At just over $2.00 a can, the Amazon price on these is great, too.  No BPA in the can, and Eden Foods is a wonderful little company that I feel good supporting.  (No, I don't own or work for Eden Foods.  Don't even know anyone who works there.  They are domiciled in the state where I spent my earlier years, but I've never even been to the city of their location.)
9-9-14 update.  I no longer recommend this product and have stopped purchasing it myself.  I have stopped purchasing all Eden products.  These canellini beans are even better:  Bioitalia Cannellini Organic Beans, 14 Ounce (Pack of 12), also available on Amazon where I purchase them on subscribe and save for less than $2 a can.

I hesitated to review this for selfish reason because I want it to be in stock when I want to order more. I am so excited that I could find it on Amazon.  Previously, I would only order my olive oil from a company in California, but for this olive oil I overcome my environmental scruples and buy something shipped in from another country. I am an experienced cook. I am blown away by the flavor of this olive oil.  For those having trouble will spillage, pull the spout up straight until it is fully extended before you twist off the cap.  This is a good, useful cap.  In the old days you had to open a tin of olive oil with a can opener, and then it was messy.

Product:
Bunnery Natural Foods Pancake Mix Sampler Pack, 5.25 Pound
Review:
I received four packages of pancake mix made by Bunnery through the Amazon Vine program.  The flavors are coconut vanilla, double chocolate, wild blueberry and original.  When I was preparing these I immediately knew these mixes were different than the Hungry Jack mix you add water to.  I normally serve Hungry Jack, so my kids were in for a surprise!  Maybe if my kids had the Bunnery Natural Food pancakes first before they ever tried the Hungry Jack mix, these would have been better received.  This mix is a healthier version of Hungry Jack and includes oats, sunflower seeds and millet.  It's very hearty! The directions on these mixes have you add 2/3 cup of milk, an egg and 2 tablespoons of melted butter.  I'm fine with that, but even after adding these ingredients the mix seemed really thick!  So I added a bit more milk.  They baked nicely and were very thick!  I would make them smaller next time and it yielded 6 pancakes for me, instead of 5 pancakes like it says on the back of the package.

Here are some of the family comments when they were served:
"I thought these were blueberry pancakes.  I don't see any blueberries."
"These are crunchy!"
"I'm stuffed."

These pancakes are very filling and have 6 grams of protein in them, so these are "stick with you" pancakes and that is a plus for me, since it seems like my kids are always hungry.  The blueberry, coconut vanilla and original pancakes would be improved if you added fresh or frozen blueberries.  The chocolate flavored mix might be better with some chocolate chips added.  These are healthy pancakes and they taste like it too.  With a little doctoring up, these mixes will be a hit!  We will try them again as I like to encourage my children to eat healthier food.
Rating:
3.0
</Other Writer-1>

You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

Product:
Coconut Oil Virgin Organic Non GE 20 Ounces
Review:
This oil has a rancid, off-putting odor that smells NOTHING like coconut, more like yeast.  It also has a TERRIBLE taste.  DO NOT BUY!!!

I consume a jar of coconut oil a week because I take it as a supplement and cook with it.  Jarrow, Spectrum, Nutiva, Vitacost and Swanson are MUCH better.  Their coconut oils smell really good with a fresh, coconut scent and taste great too.

I was surprised because I use other NOW products and am happy with them. The quality, judging by my experience & others', is that this may just be a faulty jar but the quality isn't consistent.  I don't see bad reviews from the other oils I use & I have never had a bad batch from the others I have mentioned.

1.0

Review:
Jarrow EVCO is becoming too expensive but other brands in its price range fell short. Nutiva is almost as good in flavor & aroma. It's at the moment more cost effective & I like that I now have options at this price point.  Good coconut flavor & aroma; my household uses it as the Primary oil for all cooking uses & as a health supplement. We go through at least 16oz per week.

the oil is EXCELLENT!! Robust with a vibrant green, earthy taste without overpowering. Great for using in recipes, savory or sweet, and for dipping bread. Amazon pricing not so good.

Product:
Swad Indian Spice Turmeric Haldi Powder, 14 Ounce
Review:
This stuff is on the slight bitter side.  It's not bad per se, I like bitter but this spice did not seem 'rounded' and pleasant on its own to me.  There's no aftertaste that I can detect and my food still tastes good using it, but I can tell it's not the usual brand I buy.

I bought this to get bulk for the money since I blow through Turmeric at a ridiculous rate.  I use A LOT of the stuff, in just about everything savory to assist with joint health and because I love the taste of turmeric.  I also love the color it imparts to food.  I will finish the package but will likely try another brand the next go around.

If I had to pick between having this and none, I would buy again.  Because of the price point, I likely will buy again, many times, just not as a first choice.

I will update this review after I've had a chance to try the tea recipes listed in other reviews.  It just might change my mind!  Hopefully I'll end up liking this better (it wouldn't be the first time that a product I didn't like at first ended up being my favorite goto so, we'll see).

Hope this helps.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
ZICO Pure Premium Coconut Water, Natural, 33.8 fl oz Container (Count of 6)
Review:
I love coconut water and was quite pleased with my old brand (98% coconut water, no pulp, no sugar added) but when I tasted this, I was immediately hooked.  Because it's 100% coconut water, no sugar added and not from concentrate (tetra packs), it tastes so good.  I don't mind pulp, but I like the ease of not having to strain the water to give to my finicky toddler.  There is no pulp in this particular Zico Natural Coconut Water 6 pack.

The 2% does make a difference.  I didn't even know my old brand was not 100% until I tasted how good and better Zico was.  I then grabbed a container of my old brand and read the ingredients.  I was surprised that I was paying for 2% water in each container.

I periodically buy coconuts from a local, natural food store so I am familiar with what virgin coconut water should taste like.  I appreciate that processing of Zico Natural flavor seems minimal.  It feels like it's hydrating the moment I swallow it, whether room temperature or cold, just like the coconuts I 'tap' myself.

Zico Natural flavor tastes so good, expensive though.  I search for sales at Amazon and my local grocery stores, then stock up!

Hope this helps.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
O.N.E. Coconut Water, 11.2-Ounce Aseptic Containers (Pack of 12)
Review:
I love coconut water and have been drinking it regularly for at least 5 years but probably more.  Lately, I buy the near expiration date coconut water for the affordability and because with Zico, it still tastes good (so far).  I must say though, that my recent purchase of this O.N.E coconut water in the 11.2 oz aseptic containers tasted so bad that I had to force myself to drink it down.  The expiration is not until August, 2013, which is 2 months away.  Still, I had to mix one container of this with 2 11.2 OZ containers of sweetened coconut water just to get it palatable enough to get it down.  The Zico on the other hand, expires this month, but still tastes good.

I will not order this particular O.N.E brand again, at least not close to expiration.
Rating:
2.0

Lundberg Eco-Farmed Sweet Dreams Brown Rice Syrup - 21 Ounce - 1 Pack
Review:
New to brown rice syrup. Used NOW brand in hot mint tea (with raw honey) and liked it very much. Decided to venture out & found this. Tastes very different than the NOW brand. It's richer and turns the tea cloudy, tastes and looks as if a splash of milk was added to the tea. NOW brand left the tea clear.

I prefer the NOW brand in hot tea but prefer this for baking, cooking and as a topping (sweet potato, krispy treats, popcorn, greek yogurt, etc.)  It has a more complex and buttery background which is better suited to such applications.

DELICIOUS.

Product:
Starwest Botanicals Organic Calendula Flowers Whole, 1 Pound
Review:
I received a bag full of whole flowers.  They smell wonderful, I plan to make a Calendula infusion oil with them.  They smelled so good, I was tempted to try and make tea from them but I don't know if Calendula are edible, or if these are food grade.

The recipe I'm using says to sterilize a canning jar and lid, any size (any jar with a tight fitting lid could be used).  Make sure THOROUGHLY DRY, INTRODUCE NO MOISTURE OR THE RISK OF MOLD AND MILDEW IS HIGH.  Put any amount of the flowers you want in the jar (most use 1/2 - 3/4) and cover with a good carrier oil (olive oil, sweet almond oil, etc.)  Let sit in a window that gets sun for about 6-8 weeks or until the oil is a nice, golden yellow.  Some recipes say to shake the mixture every once in a while.  When the oil looks good to you (orangish-yellow), strain over cheesecloth into a sterile jar.  Voila, calendula herbal oil.

I sent my mother a bag, and she is making the oil.  My apartment gets NO SUN, so mine will likely take a lot longer than 6-8 weeks.
Rating:
4.0

La Tourangelle Grapeseed Oil 16.9 Fl Oz, All-Natural, Artisanal, Great for Cooking, Sauteing, Marinating, and Dressing

I use this oil for topical usage.  It came in a nice, undented can.  I keep it in the fridge to try and extend it's shelf life.  It seems to work as well as the other grapeseed oils I have been using.  I've noticed no adverse change in the products I make from it.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Marshalls Creek Spices Thyme Refill, 5 Ounce Review: As always, fresh aromatic herbs, great price for large quantity, and in re sealable bag. I buy Marshalls Creek herbs and spices, and especially love their proprietary blends like Momma D's Seasoning blend. Rating: 5.0 Product: Das Foods Hawaiian Black Lava Salt- Sea Salt 6 Oz Jar Review: The black lava salt is *the* salt I must always have in the house. I have this variety, which is a very, very good quality brand and I also have a shaker jar of fine grind for adding at the table. The salt really *is* black and as you take pinches of it from jar to sprinkle on the food, it will turn your fingers black as if you had handled charcoal. It is absolutely delicious on fish and seafood, and I never eat my salmon with anything but this Das Foods salt. Das Foods salts, all I have purchased, are all fine quality and this is one of the best lava salts I've had. In my opinion it provides a fresh, kind of "oceany" taste to the fish that is a great addition to the dish. I highly recommend this, especially if you love salmon like I do. Great salt, great flavor. Rating: 5.0 Product: OliveNation Herbes de Provence 16 oz. - Fancy blend with Lavender Review: This is the real deal, with lavender, and the price can't be beat! I use a lot of this herb blend and was searching for some to replace what I used up. It wasn't easy finding an authentic blend that included lavender, but I stumbled onto this brand. This is wonderful, with a good aroma and a nice balance of herbs. And the price is ridiculously reasonable for a full pound. Rating: 5.0 Product: Coffee Bean Direct Irish Breakfast Loose Leaf Tea, 2 Pound Bag Review: Tastes great and is a massive bag for the money. I really didn't realize how much 2# was until it came! I may never have to buy tea again. Rating: 5.0 Product: Raspberry Oolong Tea 3 oz, By Higher Tea (40 Cups) Certified Organic Premium Loose Leaf Tea Review: I bought this accidentally. I spied it when looking at oolong to try as I had never tasted it. I thought I hit "add to cart" to save it whilst I looked at others and added them to decide about later. I hit the "buy now" instead, realizing that when I got text telling me it was arriving. Surprise! LOL I had hesitated originally because $10 for just that few ounces was pricy for me right now. Oh. My. God!!!! This is the most delicious tea I have ever tried. I have a huge variety of teas from Amazon and am no stranger to many many varieties. I favor black teas always. But this Raspberry Oolong changed my "black only" daily drinking habit immediately. It is incredible! I used a tiny bit extra in my T-Sac DIY bag and that gave it more strength without bitterness. Never steep longer, just use a bit more. I can't recommend this highly enough, and be assured it is worth every single penny and more. Try it!! Rating: 5.0 Product: PG Tips Gold Best Tasting Blend (160 Tea Bags) Review: This is a good everyday tea, when you want a big mug but don't want to make a pot. It makes a great iced tea too, very flavorful unlike the floor sweepings that pass as American tea bags or American knock offs of good U.K. teas (Twinings) Rating: 5.0 Product: Bigelow Cozy Chamomile Herbal Tea Bags 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6) Caffeine-Free Individual Herbal Tisane Bags, for Hot Tea or Iced Tea, Drink Plain or Sweetened with Honey or Sugar Review: I always use two bags of herbal tea in a normal size mug for more flavor. This works wonderfully on all my others, Cranberry apple, cranberry hibiscus, blueberry aa and others. I did the double bag with this, expecting a good distinct flavor like the others give me for two bags. Nope. It was very watery and insipid. It had a vague lemon taste, but so weak and watered down. I was so excited to try this, I love a good lemon taste in anything. This was horribly disappointing and I have to say, my sister agrees. I gave her a box from my six pack. I will try three bags per cup and see how that is. I hope it will be much better, as I am stuck with five boxes of this tasteless lemon water. Update: I tried to three-bag it in mug. I got much more lemon flavor, which would have been great had there not been a lot more mint flavor. I. Hate. Mint. Tea. Who does that? Mint and lemon? Its gross. Rating: 3.0 Product: Earl Grey Fresh Loose Leaf Black Tea (50+ Cups) - Fall 2018 Harvest - Directly Shipped From Our Family-Owned Estate in India - Blended with Bergamot Oil Sourced From Italy - Morning & Afternoon Tea Review: This is really good tea. It has a nice hint of lavender without being overpoweringly floral or strong, but just right. I really enjoy it, even in the evening when most people wouldn't drink black teal. I drink so much tea though, it doesn't even come close to keeping me awake LOL. I do love it after dinner, it is a good way to wind down with that nicely done lavender note. I plan to explore other black tea offerings from this Tea Estate as well. The quality of this tea is VERY good, without dust, tiny particles and small busted up leaves. The leaves are full and furled and make a wonderful, flavorful cup of tea. Thumbs up! Rating: 5.0 Product: Barry's Irish Breakfast Tea, 80-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 3) Review: I quite enjoyed Barry's breakfast blend Irish tea. I am a devoted PG Tipps tea drinker, that I buy directly from a vendor in England, via Amazon. I'd seen good reviews of this Irish tea and thought I'd give it a try. It is different than PG Tipps, but equally delicious. If you like a hearty black tea, I'd highly recommend this one. Rating: 5.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Victorian Earl Grey Tea, 25 Count Review: Delicious tea, and an Earl Grey that has the bergamot toned down a bit. It is more of a soft undertone of bergamot oil rather than the in-your-face strength of many Earl Greys. I recommend this for anyone who loves Earl Grey but find it too bergamot-y. This Victorian Earl Grey is very very good. Rating: 5.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['tea', 'good', 'teas', 'black', 'delicious', 'flavor', 'cup', 'great', 'bag', 'love'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Solofill Cup, Refillable Cup For Keurig Single serve cups Brewers, Red and Black (Pack of 2) Review: For Christmas of 2011, a good friend of mine gave me a Solofill Reusable K-Cup. She knew that I have a Keurig 35 B30 Mini Brewer (Keurig 35 B30 Mini Personal Single-Serve Brewing System, Black) at work. I make at least two cups of coffee in the morning and sometimes one in the afternoon if I'm feeling sleepy. (I work two jobs and I am sleep deprived.) I've had this Keurig brewer for at least three years and I couldn't live without it. However, disposable K-Cups are expensive; this is why I purchased the Keurig My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter (Keurig My K-Cup Reusable Coffee Filter). At the time, I thought it was wonderful. It is a three-piece unit. A removable filter sits inside the reusable K-cup which has a top that screws on. Also, the Keurig brewer's filter holder has to be removed in order to insert the Keurig Reusable Filter. There is always the possibility that this filter holder could be damaged or lost. On a daily basis, I've been using the Solofill Reusable K-Cup for over seven months. It is much easier to operate and clean than the Keurig Reusable Filter. Also, the coffee tastes just as great; I use my favorite Starbucks Natural Fusions Ground Coffee, Vanilla Flavored ]. There are never any grounds in my coffee. My only concern was that the plastic hinge that connects the lid with the reusable K-Cup's body would eventually break but it hasn't. There are not any visible cracks, tears, shreds, etc. It looks nearly as good as when it was given to me as a Christmas gift. I no longer use my Keurig Reusable Filter, but I haven't thrown it away in case my Solofill Reusable K-Cup is lost or stolen. Several times I've accidentally left it in the break room after washing it. I could afford to buy another one. The Solofill Reusable K-Cup costs the same as a Keurig Reusable Filter. If you own one of the many varieties of Keurig single-serving brewing systems, then I highly recommend buying the Solofill Reusable K-Cup; it is easy to use, saves money and is very durable! Joseph B. Hoyos Rating: 5.0 Using the features, generate the proper review. If you haven't received some of the features, only make use of the provided ones. Rating:
5.0
Product:
Molasses, Blackstrap, Unsulfured, Organic, 15 oz.
Review:
I have NEVER liked molasses but needed to find a way to get more iron into my body. I had heard that blackstrap molasses was the best to take so I purchased Plantation based on an article I read online.  I am here to tell you, this stuff is sweet rather than sharp and bitter.  I add my daily tablespoon in my morning coffee to sweeten and it is delicious!  I could probably eat the tablespoon just by licking the spoon but it is very sweet and I've been off white sugar long enough that too much sweet is a horrible taste to me.  This works perfectly.  I just use the stronger stuff for my baked beans - this is perfect for "medicinal" purposes!

If you need more iron, I'd recommend this.  If you don't like super strongly flavored molasses, this is one you'd like - not too strong, good flavor, sweet, and good for you!

I keep a container full of these in the refrigerator because I like cold half n half in my coffee to cool it down more quickly.  I was concerned at first that I would not use these up within three months; but I do and occasionally decide to add a little half n half to something else I am preparing.  At 10 calories per little container, I really am not adding too many calories to what I am preparing. Particularly I like it added at room temperature to a rice dish when serving it.  (this is when I am glad that some of my containers are not refrigerated)  These are perfect, real half n half for my coffee.  Not so much for tea as it makes it too rich and I am one who prefers milk in tea but I have found if I add as much water as I add half n half it usually works out. In three months I would spend a lot more money on half n half from the grocery so it is really a saving, not just a convenience.

Product:
Mighty Leaf Green Tea, Tropical, 15 Pouches (Pack of 3)
Review:
I should start by noting that I am not usually a fan of green tea.  I tend to prefer black and white teas.  Mighty Leaf's Green Tea Tropical is one significant exception for me.  I love this tea.  I often find that green tea tastes too grassy or plant-like for me- not the case for this tea.  Green Tea Tropical has a good, fruity flavor, and it's exceptionally smooth, and not at all bitter.  I suspect this might have a bit more flavor than your average flavored green tea, which may be a plus or minus depending on your tastes.  For me that's a good thing.  Even though the flavor is strong, it's delicate and well-balanced.  This tea does not taste like a giant fruit salad, though the fruity notes are certainly distinct.  Now, for the rating.  The reason I gave this 4 stars is that this is a *very* expensive tea.  More expensive than some other gourmet teas.  Yes, it's a very nice cup, but I'm not sure I'm willing to pay the price for it, when there are some other very good teas on the market at much lower prices.  It's clear that some of the money goes into teabag construction, as the bag itself is very high quality.

JOLLY RANCHER Hard Candy, Blue Raspberry Flavor, 88 Ounce
Review:
5 lbs. of blue raspberry Jolly Ranchers is the perfect filler for our daughter's Elsa piñata. These icy looking hard candies most definitely wrap up our Frozen theme. This huge bag is all I needed for the party. If you haven't had blue raspberry Jolly Ranchers they are a great hard candy that is colorful, flavorful, and has the perfect combination of sweet and tart. I'm assuming that most people have tried them, so Ill spend my time on reviewing the packaging. I absolutely love the size for a party.  I didn't count the candy, but the nutrition label says each serving is 3 pieces and it contains ~139 servings. That's over 400 pieces of candy; All in one bag! No need to buy or open multiple packages. It's perfect for my use (filling a piñata) or would be great for Halloween. Each piece is individually wrapped. All-in-all I am a big fan of the large bag.

Planters Mixed Nuts, Lightly Salted Deluxe Mixed Nuts, 15.25 Ounce

I don't know what it is about these nuts but they are ridiculously addicting. When we open these cans, we blow through them in a couple days (family of 4) with as much self-control as we can muster. It is a good mix without any "cheap" nuts. Tastes incredible!

We have signed up for subscribe and save shipping and it ends up costing about half as much as if we purchased it at our local grocery store. It even is cheaper per ounce than Costco's deluxe mixed nut mix, and the Planters mix tastes so much better.

Blue Diamond Almonds, Oven Roasted Cocoa Dusted Almonds, 14 Ounce

So, due to the awesomeness of these almonds, I think next time I order them I will break them up into smaller Ziplock bags in order to more clearly limit my intake.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Cello Whisps Parmesan Cheese Crisp, 9.5 Ounce
Review:
I love these! They taste incredible, and are a great crunchy snack. I've been very low carb (ketogenic) for almost three years and sometimes snacks are hard to find. These are a perfect option.

Light, great tasting, and filling.

As has been said in other reviews, at the time of this writing the price on Amazon is almost double that of Costco so shop around
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tattle Tea Earl Grey Black Tea, 5 Ounce
Review:
Earl Grey Tea is my mother-in-law's favorite kind of tea in the world. She has had Earl Grey from around the world, even returning from a recent trip to England where she had many opportunities to have Earl Grey. Her response after tasting this tea was, "This is the best Earl Grey I have ever tasted in my whole life."

This tea can be made strong and flavorful without becoming bitter. The flavor is perfect and clean in both hot and iced. I cannot complain about any aspect of the tea.

It comes loose leaf. We brewed it in a Teavana PerfectTea tea maker. Here are our recommendations for the perfect cup using 200 degree water:
  -HOT: Use the recommended 1.5 teaspoons of tea brewed for about 4 minutes.
  -Iced:  Use 3 teaspoons brewed for 5 minutes.

The problem with many black teas is that they get bitter especially when brewed for ice tea, because you need a stronger tea so it doesn't dilute. We didn't have that problem at all with this. Tattle Tea has become our tea of choice from now on for Earl Grey.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co. Chocmeister Hazelnut Spread, Milk Chocolatey, 13 Ounce Jar
Review:
The kids don't seem to tell the difference between this and Nutella. So it's nice to have a lower-sugar alternative. That said, this is not a health food, it is just a healthier alternative to the dessert spread. My main worry when ordering this was that it wouldn't taste good; Chocmeister has done a great job of that. The texture is right and the taste is good for 25% less sugar and extra protein.
Rating:
5.0

Blueberry Cinnamon Flax Hot Oatmeal, 11.2 Ounce (8 X 6 Pack)

Thick and hearty. My 3 year old son absolutely loves this oatmeal asking for it all the time. Good to know that it is Organic. The individual oats are much more substantial than Quaker and other instant oatmeals we have tried.

golds.output: I was excited to try the Cafe Classics Espresso Extra Bold pods in my Senseo machine. The pods fit perfectly and delivered a rich, deep, and dark flavorful cup of coffee. Product:
 McCANN'S Steel Cut Irish Oatmeal, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
This is the real thing, folks -- oatmeal as it should be. If you watch "Good Eats" on the Food Network, you've seen Alton Brown praise steel-cut oats and dis rolled oats (the "Quaker Oatmeal" stuff). I personally love rolled oats, but if you don't, don't let that stop you from buying the McCann's. The texture, the taste, the "oomph" are nothing like your ordinary breakfast oats. Where rolled Quaker oats are a bit slippery and thin, these steel-cut oats are much firmer with a lot more tooth and a much heartier, nuttier flavor.

Be aware that you have to invest a little time to cook this cereal -- half an hour on the stovetop. Or try boiling the water the previous night, turning off the heat, and then putting the oats in to sit overnight. Then finish cooking them in the morning for 10 minutes or so. There are other shortcuts, too -- try a Google search. Whichever way you try, you may be spoiled for other hot cereals forever.
Rating:
5.0
</Other Writer-1>

Product:
Hellmann's Dijonnaise, 10.75-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 12)
Review:
I compared this lite mayo side-by-side with the full fat version I already had in my refrigerator, and I actually like this one better.  It has only 60 calories per tablespoon compared to 120.  It has a nice tang to it and a very agreeable texture.  It does have a lighter mouth feel than the full fat version, but I actually prefer that.  Too me, regular mayo can get pretty heavy too easily, and I don't like that overly fatty taste.

I like that it is made with eggs from cage-free hens.  I'm aware that cage-free is still not ideal, but it is a step in the right direction.  Hmmmm, I just reread the label.  It says, "We are on a mission to use 100% cage free eggs in everything we make, and we are pleased to say that we are well on our way."  So, is this made with 100% eggs from cage-free hens or not?

I like that it is made with olive oil, but be aware that olive oil is the second oil used.  Soybean oil is the predominant one, something not discerned by looking just at the front of the package.

I like the bottle design, not having to use a knife or spoon to get out a dollop of mayo.  The plastic seems very lightweight, less material to go into recycling bins.

Overall I really love the taste of this product, and its lower calorie count.  I gave it 4 stars instead of five because:

1.)  It's made predominately with soybean oil instead of olive oil and that is not made obvious by looking at the label without also reading the little ingredient list.

2.) It is not clear whether this specific product is made with all eggs from cage-free hens.
Rating:
4.0
</Other Writer-1>

</otherwriters>

The cherry vanilla flavor is unique and delicious, and I find myself reaching for

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Glutenfreeda Gluten Free Instant Oatmeal, Apple Cinnamon with Flax, 8-packet Box, 8 Pack Review: This review is for the texture snobs in the world. As others have mentioned in their reviews, the flavor is great and the ingredients/nutrition are better. Hold on, though: there's a "but" coming. Remember the flavored instant oatmeal we ate before we knew what "organic" or "gluten" meant? Brightly colored "banana" bits held onto their fake yellow color and their cubic shape long after the hot water mushified the oats for us. We ate fake crap, and we liked it. We're older and wiser now, and want real bananas: real bananas that we re-hydrate ourselves with our steaming hot filtered water for optimum health and enjoyment. Except that rehydrated banana bits don't stay in bit form. Nor do they rehydrate to sliced banana consistency. Nay! Rehydrated banana bits taste like delicious, wholesome bananas, and have the consistency of runny snot. That's right: runny snot. I love everything else about this oatmeal, but when I want to feel snot run down my throat, I'll go out and contract the common cold, thank you very much. Based on other reviews, this doesn't throw everyone. Based on other reviews, you might love this oatmeal and shrug off the banana snot texture without a second thought. But if you're a huge texture snob, I thought you might want to know what you're getting into. I will shudder and finish the rest of my banana oatmeal one snot-filled bowl at a time (unless I can't take it anymore, at which point the food bank gets a wholesome and delicious donation), but I won't purchase this again. I think I'll slice bananas into gluten-free oatmeal the next time I feel a bananas-and-cream craving. Best of luck with your oatmeal experience, and thank you for pausing to read a different perspective. Rating: 3.0 Product: Karen's Naturals Organic Just Blueberries, 2 Ounce Pouch Organic All Natural Freeze-Dried Fruits & Vegetables, No Additives or Preservatives, Non-GMO Review: Hey, these are good! Ok, I wasn't terribly surprised by how good these are: I love freeze-dried fruit, I love blueberries, and I've never detected an "off" taste in Just Tomatoes products. Some freeze-dried fruit smells and tastes like a factory for some reason, and seems to be a brand-specific problem. These are nicely crunchy and nicely flavorful, but have a tamer flavor than some other dried food. They taste a little cooked: like homemade blueberry jam, actually, which is what I pretended I was eating. There are only 2 servings in the nice big pouch, even though it felt more like 8. I love that it's hard to over-indulge on these. They stain my fingers! I was surprised that berries without juice can do that, but these do! They're a little smaller than Kix pieces. I did get one bad or burnt one in the whole bag (I didn't spit it out to check, sorry!), but unless I find more in subsequent orders, I wouldn't worry about it too much. Hope you enjoy these as much as I do! Rating: 5.0 Product: Better Oats mmmMuffins Old Fashion Instant Oatmeal, Blueberry Flavor, 5 Pouches per 7.55-oz. Box (Pack of 3 Boxes) Review: This is delicious. Steaming fresh blueberry muffins with that dipped-sugar crust top flavor with only 2 minutes of microwave time and no mixing? Amazing. Mine blew up in the microwave and the tiny office kitchen smelled like a whole rack of muffins baking even though there's no oven in there. Of course, the "natural and artificial flavors" help. I would ignore the artificial flavors and continue eating this convenient breakfast favorite if not for the my wheat-senses tingling. I handle gluten better than most celiac sufferers, but this oatmeal really set me off. Many of the other "Better Oats" deliberately have wheat in them. This doesn't, but I suspect it has a fair bit by accident. My condolences to other wheat-free folk, as this is quite possibly the most delicious oatmeal I've ever eaten. Rating: 4.0 Product: Bare Natural Apple Chips, Cinnamon, Gluten Free + Baked, Single Serve Bag - 1.7 Oz (10 Count) Review: When I had more time, I dehydrated apple chips and my coworker/friends gobbled them up and went looking for more. I have significantly less time now, and I'm trying to lay off eating sugary dried fruit all day, but I couldn't resist buying these with an Amazon coupon. Apple Cinnamon flavor: way better than some truly funky tasting freeze-dried fruit we've had lately. Funky Monkey comes to mind, but it's unfair to pick them out because I can't remember the other one that was also so bad I threw it away without even offering it to the college students, who will eat practically everything. Sea Salt Caramel: The added caramel flavor is pretty subtle. If you want to eat some caramels, you'll be disappointed. That said? These are pretty good! The flavor isn't consistent, so you get the occasional Mmmmmmm piece in a sea of normal-tasting (and still delicious) apple chips. I was going to avoid the extra sugar in these, but they're 46 grams of sugar to the plain one's 42 grams. Not a huge difference, there. They're also 200 calories/bag compared to 180 calories/bag for the plain ones. If the sugar or calorie count is really important, however, you'll need to read your own bag. These things change! This has a *little* of that factory-floor taste, which I presume is nitrogen or another low-humidity, low-oxygen air replacement, and it dissipates pretty quickly. I recommend letting it oxygenate for a minute or two before you dig in, as nitrogen is harmless but can taste really "off" to us. (the same concept applies to letting a nitrogen-packed steak air in the fridge for 15-30 minutes before you cook it). Of course, dried-to-a-crisp fruits will get soft and lose their crunch if you leave them out, so consider resealing the little bags in a sandwich bag or a small plastic container, squeezing out as much air as you can without crushing the chips. I have now tried all flavors, and the Sea Salt Caramel is the only one that had any trace of this initial unpleasant flavor. Chili Lime: This stole the show at game night last night. Everyone wanted to try it, even the paleo kids who usually eschew cane sugar. The consensus: "Wow, that is really weird, and really GOOD!" Admittedly, I could taste the lime but not the cayenne. I am on my own in this: the other gamers all tasted it and loved it. I'm unlikely to buy these very often, but I'll have to try adding lime and cayenne to my homemade apple chips. Fuji Apple Flavor: Sweet, crunchy, good. I reached for this for some sugar cravings, and I didn't regret it! I love that the whole bag is <200 calories, so I can feel like I'm really cheating, but it's actually not a terrible health choice! I expected Fuji Apple to be my least favorite flavor because it's the plainest and I usually prefer granny smith's tartness, but this was actually my favorite! Granny Smith: I tried to save this for a friend's birthday because we both love Granny Smith the best in my homemade chips or when eating regular apples, but it was sitting on the table, and I caved. It's good! It's much less sour than I expected, and less sour than my own dehydrated granny smith apple chips, but it's still sweet and tasty, just not very sour. Rating: 5.0 Product: Nature's Path Organic Chewy Granola Bars, Sunny Hemp Plus, 7.4 Ounce Box (Pack of 6) Review: I had to double-check the expiration date: Yep, expires a year from now. Still, it smells and tastes like oil gone bad. There's soy. There's flax. There's something sweet. But it's all drowned out by the taste and smell of the bad oil. I opened two bars to be sure, and passed one to my coworker to smell. "Yeah, gross," she said. "I usually eat stale stuff, but I wouldn't eat that!" Although I purchased this exact product locally, I did not buy it from this retailer. I'm surprised and disappointed - their pumpkin granola cereal is my favorite cereal! I much prefer Cascadian Farm's crunchy pumpkin granola bars, but they're hard to find. Kashi's are good if you don't have a wheat or a gluten allergy. Rating: 1.0 Product: Yogi Tea - Vanilla Spice Perfect Energy - Energizes and Supports Focus - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total Review: I don't react well to caffeine. In low doses, it simply doesn't affect me. In higher doses (3+ cups of black tea), it just makes me ill. This perks me up, though. I don't know which herb is doing the job, but the overall affect is lovely. I still don't drink more than one - too much caffeine! My box says it has 72 mg of caffeine compared to ~90 mg in coffee, but check your own box if it's important - these things can and do change! The flavor is just fine. It won't be a favorite any time soon, but it's fine. It's a sweet flavor of medium intensity: not as light as Stash Tea Company Decaf Raspberry & White Tea, 18 Count Tea Bags in Foil (Pack of 6), but certainly not as bold and sour as Tazo Passion Herbal Infusion Tea, Caffeine Free, 20-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6) or Taylors of Harrogate, Raspberry and Vanilla Infusion, 20 Count Wrapped Tea Bag. I don't detect the black or green tea in this - I know there's plenty of both in there, but it still registers as "herbal" on my palate. I hope this helps - happy tea drinking! Rating: 5.0 Product: Funky Monkey Snacks Variety Pack, Freeze-Dried Fruit, 1-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)" /> Review: The pineapples hit it out of the park. WOW. They are crazy, crazy sweet and satisfied any candy craving I might have. They were so sweet that I was able to share my bag and nurse it through a day instead of gobbling it all down half-conscious of what I was eating. There was no subtlety, but I loved them. A++. The mango OJ was also sweet, and tasty. It got stuck in my teeth every time: annoying, but not bad. I'd eat it again. The bananas? Meh. Boring. They were the least sweet, the least flavorful, and the least interesting of the bunch. Some of the packages had a really yucky artificial taste to them, like a factory. It was bitter and unpleasant,and varied by package. I kept referring back to the packaging to see if there were unfamiliar ingredients (there weren't) or if it advertised being packed in a non-oxygen atmosphere that would have an off flavor to it. I tried airing them out, which didn't seem to help much. The apples were ALL gross. Factory, factory, factory. Some of my coworkers shared my distaste, and some didn't seem to notice it at all, but every package was the same. In the future, I'd order the pinepple guava, but no other flavor in this variety pack. Leave the factory IN the factory, please, and don't flavor my food with it! The crunch was universally good for all of these products, by the by. It's very satisfying, but you can get it in any sufficiently dried food. All freeze-dried food and many bake-dried foods will have it. Rating: 3.0 Product: Choice Organic Twig Tea, 1.1 Ounces 16-Count Box (Pack of 6) Review: I was introduced to kukicha when I purchased Haiku Japanese Kukicha Twig, 100% Organic, 16-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6), which was a tea experience unlike any I'd had before. So good! Then I fell in love with kukicha produced by Yamamotoyama, and so did my SO. Yum! A lot of their green tea is very, very good - we also love their genmaicha. This, however, tastes like coffee. It's unanimous: maybe I got a bad box that was contaminated when they processed tea after roasting coffee beans, but it tastes like weak but bitter coffee. Yuck! Rating: 1.0 Product: The Republic Of Tea Cuppa Chocolate Tea Assortment, 24 Tea Bags, Low Calorie Chocolate Dessert Tea Review: This was a good way to try several of the Republic of Tea's chocolate brands. I already knew I like the chocolate mint, which prompted me to order this in the first place. Velvet Chocolate - I thought it was meh, but my coworkers really enjoyed it Mint Chocolate - Love it! It's the best or second-best mint chocolate tea I have ever found in teabag form. David's Tea in canada has a nice one, and there are some loose leaf cacao nibs with mint that are excellent, but for the availability and convenience, this wins. Strawberry Chocolate - my new favorite, even better than the mint. Sweet and mild and delicious. Coconut Cocoa - I didn't try it, because I'm gluten intolerant and this one contains roasted barley. My coworkers were unimpressed. I'm surprised - I expected it to be quite good. The packaging is lovely for trading, sharing, and gifting. Rating: 4.0 Product: Trident Sugar Free Gum (Spearmint, 18-Piece, 12-Pack) Review: These are a favorite of mine! I got them here because it was a good deal. I keep them at work, and they have lasted from April to November. I finally need more. I didn't realize some of the other classic cinnamon flavors I chewed had sugar in them, so I'll try to get these from now on. I want to chew things that are better for my teeth! Thanks for stopping to read this review, and good luck with your chewing-gum selection. I can't tell a difference in taste between these, Big Red, or any other cinnamon gum, but I'm going with these for the xylitol instead of using something sugary. Rating: 5.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['tea', 'flavor', 'like', 'green', 'good', 'one', 'box', 'love', 'also', 'favorite'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Grocery & Gourmet Food" /> Review: Timothy's Italian Blend is WONDERFUL! I run a salon and every morning I have clients who tell me they have waited to have their morning "cuppa" at my shop, as they don't have a Keurig (WHY!!!!!!??????)It's just delicious! We make the 6 oz cup and it is almost syrupy in flaver.....rich, caramely, heavy coffee flavor with no bitterness (even when served black) Robust, but not acid, fragrant .......wow, we just love it.
