The fact that they're made with wholesome ingredients is a big bonus - I feel good about giving them to my family.  I've already

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Organic Chocolate Chip Pancake and Waffle Mix by Birch Benders, Whole Grain, Non-GMO, 16oz Review: A case of this mix feeds a big group of people! It's really easy to mix up, just add water. This is a good choice for quickly feeding an army. The cinnamon flavor tastes good and wasn't over powering. I love how easy they are - you don't even need oil of eggs and the pancakes taste great. Rating: 4.0 Product: Pop-Tarts Breakfast Toaster Pastries, Unfrosted Blueberry, Bulk Size, 96 Count (Pack of 12, 14.7 oz Boxes) Review: I'd wager that my fellow reviewers are children of the 70's, just like me. Raised back in the day when there weren't 400 different kinds of Pop-Tarts and NONE of them were frosted! (Maybe there were some frosted varieties but my mother would have NEVER bought them!) By far, my favorite are the unfrosted Blueberry. There's nothing better than a freshly toasted Blueberry Pop-Tart with a dab of butter melted on top - heaven! Finding them is a challenge. Way to go Amazon!! Rating: 5.0 Product: Kellogg's Fruity Snacks, Strawberry, 16 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: These gummies taste good, don't stick to you teeth and aren't so hard they endanger your toothwork. Each flavor is distinct even if they aren't dispersed evenly throughout the packages. Each packet delivers 70 calories of energy and 100% of your daily requirement of vitamin C. They were so well received in our house, we bought more. Rating: 5.0 Product: Lance Gluten Free Crackers, Peanut Butter and Cheese Sandwich Crackers, 5 Ounce (Pack of 4) Review: These are pretty good. They're a good alternative to cheese-it type crackers. As with other gluten free crackers, these have a mild after taste, which keeps me from over indulging them at least. Good flavor, perfect size and shape and satisfying crunch. There were very few whole pieces in my box - lots of breakage. Rating: 4.0 Product: FISHER Snack Mixed Nuts with Peanuts, Stand-Up Bag, Gluten Free, 5.5 oz Review: These are sweet and naughty like candy! There's a great mix of nuts in this jar and they are all coated with a sugary sweet candy-like coating. I don't really taste honey so much as just the sweetness. They didn't last very long in our house. Mr Pixels and Bits didn't care for the coated pecans, but I have to admit I loved them! These would be really good crushed and used as a garnish on treats like cupcakes or pancakes. It's very easy to eat too many if you don't portion them out. Great variety of nuts including cashews, almonds, filberts, peanuts & pecans. Rating: 4.0 Product: Tiesta Tea Blueberry Wild Child Blueberry Hibiscus Fruit Tea, 30 Servings, 1.8 Ounce Pouch - Caffeine Free, Loose Leaf Herbal Tea Eternity Blend, Non-GMO Review: I love loose teas and this fragrant and exotic white blend is a treat. The tin isn't huge, so this would be more of an occasional "investment" grade tea for special times or stolen moments. It's very fruity and floral. The blend is beautiful. I have included pictures so you can see how fresh it is. This is the "Eternity" blend, which has ingredients that help fight aging. I used way more than I needed for this little pot - a tablespoon would have worked fine. It tastes wonderful - very drinkable and sweet - would make a really thoughtful gift. Rating: 5.0 Product: Skinny Dipped Almonds, Dark Chocolate Almonds Raspberry, 1.5oz, 7g plant based protein, Non GMO project verified, gluten free, 9g sugar, 230 calories (pack of 10) Review: These are great tasting almonds. There's just enough chocolate to make them yummy and the espresso lends a twist to make them unlike other snack almonds. These are the larger packs offered by this company - they also offer them in a size about a third of this serving for a little less in terms of cost. These larger packs are the better value. Each 1.5 ounce package has 6 net carbs, which is a big deal for those of us who must account for every carb in our diet. I try to eat only a half a pack at a time, but they are very tempting and it's easy to find yourself eating them all. Rating: 5.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill Old Country Style Muesli Cereal, 40-ounce (Pack of 4) Review: After continual disappointment with the varieties of granola and muesli available in our community I decided to give Bob's Red Mill Old Country Style Muesli, 18-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4) a shot. My husband and I are extremely delighted with this mix and have quickly gone through the four 18oz bags that came in or initial order. In fact, we just reordered it in the larger 40oz bags (Bob's Red Mill Old Country Style Muesli, 40-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)) because the cost per ounce is a little less expensive. It can be a little boring to eat the same thing over and over again each morning so mix it up by having small Ziplock baggies of various raw nuts and dried fruit available to add as a topping. In our house, walnuts and extra raisins are a big hit though we also enjoy adding fresh fruit or a dollop of preserves from time to time. In the weeks that we have been eating this Muesli, both my husband and I have been amazed with how much more efficiently our bodies are digesting and eliminating waste. We not only feel better, but we are finding that we are looking better too. While keeping the old adage of "all things in moderation", we only eat a third cup of this cereal each morning mixed in with a half cup of fat-free vanilla yogurt and find that we rather miss it if we opt for something else! Rating: 5.0 Product: Luzianne Decaffeinated Tea, Tea Bags, 24-Count, 5.25-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4) Review: As ridiculous as it may sound to you, sweet tea is an important part of the culture of my Southern family. It's a tradition that spans generations with time honored brewing techniques. However, caffeine isn't the best friend of growing children - especially those who have been diagnosed as ADHD. We've been using Luzianne's decaf tea for years in a 50/50 ratio with the regular Luzianne tea bags. If you're at all familiar with the south you'll know that we tend to take iced tea rather seriously. When I was growing up my mother made iced tea from Lipton tea bags but when I discovered Luzianne tea there was no going back to Lipton! We make our iced tea in this manner: Steep a quart to a quart and a half of water almost to boiling. You don't want to use boiling water as it will singe the tea and create a bitter flavor. As long as the heated water is steaming, it's hot enough. Add 1 family sized (or 2 regular sized bags) of each variety of Luzianne tea (caffeinated and decaffeinated) to the water and allow it to steep all day and come to room temperature. If you're making sweet tea, add a bunch of sugar (this is a personal preference measurement) to the bottom of a gallon sized pitcher, then add about 2 cups of the room temperature (or warm) tea and stir to dissolve all the sugar. At this point, fill the pitcher with ice. Pour the brewed tea on top of the ice and stir gently to combine. Add water as needed to fill your vessel. Your tea will be clear, sweet and refreshing with no bitterness or after-taste. Enjoy! Rating: 5.0 Product: Nestle NIDO 3+ Powdered Milk Beverage 1.76 lb Canister Review: This is a richly flavored fortified milk product. It's a step up from Pet milk because of those added vitamins and minerals. The little guys like it - maybe too much. If you use it like powdered creamer, you'll likely gain weight! With all that said, I'm storing a few cans of this powdered milk in case of emergencies. We live in hurricane country and lots of us have lived through extended periods without electricity. All this needs is clean water and you're in business. If you're a prepper with children, it might be worth your while to stockpile a few cans of this fortified powdered milk. Rating: 3.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['tea', 'flavor', 'really', 'like', 'good', 'great', 'add', 'mix', 'little', 'variety'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Swiss Miss Hot Cocoa Mix, Sensible Sweets, Light, 8 count,0.29 ounce, (Pack of 6) Review: This is such a great product. Yes, it's a little harder to dissolve than the fat-free kind. Here's what I do: While I'm waiting for the water to boil, I put a couple of tablespoons of water (room temp is okay) into the cup with the powder. Stir it with a tiny whisk or a fork until it's totally dissolved, 30 sec or less. Voila! When you add the boiling water, there are no lumps at all. Perfectamundo. UPDATE: Good heavens. It has gone up 50% in price! I used to get this all the time. Now it's cheaper at the store--quite a bit cheaper. Ridiculous. I took it off my Subscribe & Save list. Review:
When I get a product or even look at something in the store first thing I do is look to see what's in it.  Unfortunately it didn't list all the ingredients online so I took a chance anyway.  First off let me say that this smells like heaven and tastes great too but if you have a heart condition you won't be able to drink it.  I was only able to take a few sips so that I could try it for the flavor.  DH said it did indeed make him get a little pick me up after drinking it so I will go with it does help energize you.  The flavor is perfectly balanced and not overwhelming so as long as you don't have a health issue give this a try.  It really is good and I do hope at some point the company can come out with this particular flavor in a decaf.

Review:
These are what we have all come to love about the Planters products.  Fresh peanuts with rich peanutbutter and other grains make this a delightful snack that actually leaves you feeling satisfied.  Each bar is a really good size and sooooooooo tasty.  I just love peanuts!!  We had a family cookout this weekend and I passed them around for each of us to try and the the overall vote was fantastic.  A great product from a great company.  I think the fact that the peanuts weren't ground up to small pieces added to the richess of the product.  The peanut size in the bars was half a peanut and there are loads of them.  Planters didn't use a pea shooter to put the best of their product together.  Some products will stress a certain item only to have very little in there.  Not so here.  This is a must have snack for anyone who loves or likes peanuts in its best forms.  YUMM!

They are cheaper than the brand name Nespresso pods so I guess you get what you pay for.  Hubby likes them a lot better than I do but he also likes a more bitter flavor to his coffee.  I will get more of them for him but as for me I will stick to the Nespresso ones.

I will make this a emergency staple for the house so that if I can't cook or am short on time it's here and quick.  Couldn't ask for more from a brand name I truly like.

Review:
This is another terrific nutiva coconut product.  This is my first time trying a refined coconut oil and I'm really glad I've got this in my cupboard now.
While I love the health benefits and taste of nutiva's unrefined coconut oil, there are some dishes that I simply do not like tasting coconutty (eggs for instance).  I can now use coconut oil as my primary cooking oil in more recipes.

Product:
Nutiva Organic Chips, Coconut, 1 Pound, 16 Ounce
Review:
If you're looking for a delicious, UNSWEETENED, coconut product with a lot of texture, this is the product for you.  I've found lots of great ways to incorporate these into a variety of foods.  They've found their way into waffles, banana pancakes, oatmeal, cookies, cakes, muffins, smoothies, yogurt parfaits, stir fry, etc.  They toast up nice and the large size gives them good "presence" in your recipes.
The flavor is subtle, especially if you are used to the sweetened, moist coconut products.  I've come to really enjoy this product a lot and am glad I gave it a try.
UPDATE:  These store very well in the frig--stay nice and fresh for months (as in I confess that I found a little bit left in a ziploc bag when cleaning the frig and they were still yum!)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nutiva Organic Coconut Manna from Fresh, non-GMO, Sustainably Farmed Coconuts, 15-ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
NOTE: If you like this product and plan to use it, the quickest way to heat (and then properly store in a glass jar) is to put in the trunk of your car on a warm/hot day for a couple of hours...learned this as a soapmaker who uses lots of coconut oil! I then mixed well and poured it into a sterilized mason jar.

I LOVE the smell of the Coconut manna, but then I love the smell of all coconut.  I normally use coconut oil in quite a few recipes and this is a slightly different experience as it includes the actual coconut.  The problem for me is that the ground whole coconut tastes and has the texture of....ground whole coconut.  Adding the coconut oil for creaminess isn't changing the gritty to smooth.  It changes the velvety texture of the oil to gritty, pasty (think really really thick peanut butter).

The only way I use it is making fresh peanut butter or almond butter in the VitaMix using just the nuts and a spoonful of Manna.  Said peanut butter on sandwich with banana or used in peanut butter cookies is borderline sinful.  This is the only thing I've found tastes good with this product.  I use coconut oil for everything else.

I was adding it to various recipes but have found that the earthy/dirty (hard to describe) taste of the ground coconut just doesn't work with much.  In addition, it doesn't work well in smoothies in the vitamix as the manna never fully dissolves or incorporates in the drink.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Sahale Snacks Cranberry Almond With Black Pepper & Orange Zest Bar, No Artificial Flavors or Preservatives, 4 count
Review:
I have had hit and miss success trying sahale products, with my favorite being their snack blends.
I love their creativity and inventiveness (which sometimes goes over into sheer weirdness).
We keep these type of bars around solely for emergency snacking and meal replacement (mostly in our cars) to keep us from snacking on even unhealthier items.
This variety pack was definitely filled with unusual flavor combinations. The bars are TINY, barely over an ounce (think snack candy bar size from hallowwen mixes for reference).
They average about 200 calories each, all have some type of nuts as first ingredient, have about 10 grams of sugars and 5 grams of protein.
All oh them were good, but none were great, and none will be reordered by either of us.
Overall, we found them to be too chewy, gummy and sweet.

The flavor of the mix is excellent!
The price is way too high...it takes 1/4 cup mix per pound of meat, and the container appears to have about one cup of mix, maybe one and a quarter cup tops
I would like to see this offered in a 16 ounce container at a much more attractiv price per ounce

Product:
NurturMe Organic Quinoa Squares, Cheddar + Broccoli, 5 Pouches (Pack of 6)
Review:
In the good/better/best world of nutrition I think these snacks fall into the good category,
If your child won't eat whole foods and 'needs' their snacks delivered in mini-packages these are a good choice.
Each package has about 8 smallish squares of snack, about 1/3 ounce of food.
I am not a fan of mini packs of food because of the waste and receptiveness of package sizes.
But there are times where those little packages are handy.
The squares taste good, you can taste the cheese and broccoli which I like and there isn't any bitter/off taste that happens with a lot of self-labeled 'healthy' snacks. We all liked the texture of the squares as well.
My 2 year old grandson is a great and adventurous eater and likes real food so I wasn't surprised he liked these.
Rating:
4.0

I thought these tasted just ok.  They would never be my first or second tier pick for a snack.  They are too small for meal substitute and contain too many calories for a snack for anyone watching weight.  I found the mouth feel of these to be unpleasant.  The taste is ok...none of the individual ingredients shine.
p.s. Someone with a chip on their shoulder has gone through the reviews for this product and given almost everyone of them an unhelpful feedback--and this includes a huge variety of detailed reviews.  I like to believe this is not someone from Pamelas as they are a good and reputable copany.  But, in all my reviews and looking at other reviews I rarely see this happen...weird...and if this person has the energy I feel sure tney will slam this one also.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Zero Calorie Cucumber Mint Cocktail Mixer by Be Mixed | Low Carb, Keto Friendly, Sugar Free and Gluten Free Drink Mix | 25 ounce, Single Bottle
Review:
I HATE raining on a start up companies parade. I really do.
I LOVE cocktails, but sometimes i just really want to get them in my hand and not squeeze, measure, and create. So, i periodically give new mixers a try.
I have yet to find a mixer (other than some locally crafted bloody mary mixes) that tasted very good.
This one was so awful that I threw it out, with my lovely expensive bourbon I am sad to say. Bourbon with some form of ginger and a twist of lime is my go to, so it was a no-brainer picking this ginger lime flavored mixer.
My first impression was that I had just dumped four packets of sweet n low, which i abhor into my bourbon. I didn't taste ginger, and i barely tasted lime. I tasted nothing but sickly sweet (which i might have tolerated better if it was a cane sugar sweet) yuck.
In the spirit of fairness i poured a half shot of vodka into another glass and tried it with that. NO
Then with club soda as on the box. NO
I appreciate the creators attempts to make a So-called healthy mixer. But now i know that monkfruit, stevia, unnamed fruit and vegetable juices and unnamed natural flavors do NOT belong in a good cocktail.
Dumped it all out and recycled the glass.
Creators, i am really sorry to give this bad review. I love entrepreneurs and love to support them.
Maybe people who like foofy sweet drinks will like this?
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Soy Vay Veri Veri Teriyaki Marinade, 21-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 6)
Review:
A local chef was doing a demo of this product at the Whole Foods in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.  He simply marinated some mahi mahi filets in the teriyaka and than grilled them at high heat.  It was some of the best mahi I've tried!
I've never been a fan of commercial teriyaki sauces...something about them is too "much" for me.  I could eat this teriyaki sauce with a spoon.  Great in and on everything!
Rating:
5.0

Product:
True Lemon Raspberry Lemonade 10-count (Pack of 6)
Review:
I'm not much of a water drinker.  I want to be, I just have trouble with the tastelessness of water and thus fall into the trap of guzzling down sodas both for the caffeine and for the taste.  Which is a habit I'd really love to stop.  The problem with most drink additives though is the ingredients.  All those fake sugars and I figure I might as well be drinking a soda.  So then I saw True Lemon at the store and the advertisement that it was 100% natural.  So I thought why not try it?  And I'm glad I did.

I started off with a little box of 10 packets of the Raspberry Lemonade to see how I would like it.  For drink additives it was pricey, but no more (and actually a little less) than if I had bought a case of the same amount of soda.  So I won't complain about the price especially considering this is better for me.  They came in little packets that were long and tubular shaped and easy to get open.  You just pop the top of your water bottle and pour the contents in, getting a little show in the meantime of the powder coming up like smoke from the bottle.  Hey, it doesn't take much to amuse me.

The taste is pretty good.  I think I taste more of the raspberry and sugar than they do the lemon, and that's why this product doesn't get more than four stars from me.  I would have liked to have had it be a bit more tart instead of just smooth and sweet.  But it's still not bad.  It goes down smooth and one packet is enough to flavor 17oz of water quite strongly.  It also turns the water a nice pale pink color.

As said before I was strongly attracted to this product because of its ingredients.  Instead of artificial sweeteners, stevia is used.  It also has lemon juice and other natural flavors.  Nothing in the ingredient list looked too bad so I'm happy.  And according to the box its only 5 calories, which isn't too bad either.

Definitely a product I'd try again, and I'll probably end up trying their other flavors as well.

Review by M. Reynard 2011
Rating:
4.0
</Other Writer-1>

Product:

Review:
I have been eating Oh Henry! bars ever since my late teens ( I'm 33 now ) and they are by far my favorite chocolate bar in the entire world!  They used to sell these wonderful chocolate bars at my local Walgreen's but for some reason they stopped carrying them at all the stores in my area so I went to search for them on Amazon and here they were!  I was a little hesitant to purchase them at first because of the price but then I did price comparisons on the Internet and I figured that it was cheaper to buy them here than anywhere else, including many of those so-called " candy " stores that charge you and arm and a leg for the old classic candy bars you grew up loving.

These bars are made by the famous Nestle company based out of Switzerland ( who also make baby Ruth ) bars and Nestle is a fine chocolate-maker, I'll give them that one for sure!  In fact, to me Oh Henry bars are not unlike a piece of candy you'd buy freshly made at a See's Candies store or something like that.  Fresh, aromatic, crunchy and just plain good.  I FEEL SO SORRY for the Amazon customer whose box of Oh Henry! bars came old and expired cos mine were fresh, chewy and just plain good. Also try Goo Goo Clusters Sumpreme if you like Oh Henry bars, they are a chocolate bar made by a candy company based out of Tennessee who produce a superior chocolate candy bar.  Well done Nestle, and thanks again Amazon!  UPDATE:  March 24th, 2011:  I HAVE ORDERED 3 MORE BOXES OF THESE AMAZING CHOCOLATE BARS SINCE THE TIME OF THE WRITING, THE MOST RECENT ON FEBRUARY 21st, 2011.  SAME CONSISTENT QUALITY, SAME GREAT TASTE, EVERYTHING AMAZING!  YOU CAN'T GO WRONG HERE, PEOPLE!!!

Dreamfields Pasta Healthy Carb Living, Elbow Macaroni, 13.25-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
For the past few years, 9 out of 10 times, we, or should I say, I, keep choosing Dreamfields Pasta Healthy Carb Living. The low carb has a lot to do with it, assuming all statements are correct, but the most important thing is that it is a great tasting pasta. This particular one is not the favorite, a little too small perhaps, but since I am almost sure they are all made the same, they taste just as good. I am very happy Amazon delivers these goodies, for all I have to do is wait and they arrive. They can be prepared in all imaginable ways and they always taste good. 4 Stars.

Product:

Review:
YummyEarth Organic Candy Drops, Wild Peppermint, 16-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4) are pretty good according to my loyal mother. She claims they even help her to breathe better but that point is debatable. At one time she had me believing that cough drops were good for her overall breathing but I came to find out that what she really likes is hard candy in any form or shape. I conducted a brief experiment with her: I bought her a large bag of regular candy, like 20 lbs of variety type candy, and stopped giving her cough drops. Well, it seems that what she mostly wanted was hard candy in her mouth and she never once asked me for the cough drops while she had this sizable bag available. At her age and according to her doctor she should get away with almost anything so I did not sweat the situation. Her dental work is, of course, expensive for she is addicted to sugar in the form of hard candy. Getting back on track: while she was enjoying YummyEarth Organic Candy Drops, Wild Peppermint, 16-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4) she praised them daily. I liked the amount on each bag and the many kind and encouraging reviews I found prior to purchasing this item. 4 Stars and when the faithful bag of candy disappears in time record I will give her the last two, which I am sure she will go back to endorsing the healthy properties of this cough drop, wild peppermint and all!

4.0

YumEarth Organic Pomegranate Hard Candy, 3.3 Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6)

Decent candy but a little steep priced. 3.5 Stars

Product:
 Kodiak Cakes All Natural Frontier Pancake, Flapjack and Waffle Mix, Original, 24 Ounce (Pack of 6) 
Review:
I am just dreaming because I haven't been camping since my Army days, but this would be the perfect start of the morning with a strong brewed coffee and powder milk for the kiddies. I was really pleased with my first batch of Flapjacks (I had never heard of that term, or if I did it did not stick), and was able to enjoy them thoroughly. Or should I say we, for I refuse to eat alone if I can help it. I normally make my own batter, an old family recipe that requires accurate measurements, plus a few ingredients, and more steps than one. When I am patient and careful, they are very good indeed, but as of last my so called pancakes have taken a turn toward the mediocre kind, and when I came across this great product called Kodiak Cakes Frontier Flapjack & Waffle Mix, 24-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6), I was very intrigued to say the least. So I purchased after reading the knowledgeable and glowing reviews by the well respected amazon reviewers, I never had seen so many enthusiastic reviews for Flapjacks (I love that name), and after reading the nutrition box to see how many carbs they were all about, I was gladly surprised and encouraged by the findings.
Boxes arrived, cabin like, outdoor like packaging, so much in fact, I was thinking of a mini camping trip on the backyard to add to the overall effect, perhaps myself cheating a little bit and going to my King Size where I reach deep levels of sleep without a hitch, but making sure to be the first one up to start the Flapjacks. I almost felt like hiding the boxes, and pretending it was all my skillful ways that made it happen. Enough to say is that I was able to put out an outstanding short/large stack of double fluffy (these did not flatten at all, even left overs remain inflated the next day) Flapjacks. Everyone agreed I had taken the concept to a higher level, and for a minute or two I took all the credit, when a sneaky little spy discovered the boxes. Add great syrup, Smuckers Sugar Free for the sugar intolerant, and regular Maple or your preference for the rest, quality butter (worry about heart attacks a little later), and eat them while they are hot!
The real beauty is that for regular Flapjacks all that is required is plain clean water from the streams, or the refrigerator in our case, and follow closely the sound advice found in the their website, kind of like the big no no's of making flapjacks, one of the most important: do not over steer the batter, do not overcooked, do not flatten (leave them be!), etc. I wanted to take the credit, but really, it belongs to Kodiak Cakes Frontier Flapjack & Waffle Mix! Will do the Waffle mix, but for now I am lazy and happy to use be using plain old water like in the old frontier! 4.5 Stars!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Al Dente Carba-Nada Egg Fettuccine, 10-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
Still debating whether Dream Fields Pasta is better than Al Dente Carba-Nada Egg Fettuccine, 10-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6). I have tried their different kinds and I find them to be an acceptable option and to me much better than regular pasta. I am happy that another low carb pasta is available for purchase for it is to my advantage to eat the low carb pasta. The last time I had regular pasta was a long time ago. Between the two pastas mentioned above I no longer feel I am missing much. 4 Stars!

4.0
Product:
Dreamfields Pasta Healthy Carb Living, Penne Rigate, 13.25-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)
Review:
I have nothing but praises for this product. Call me naive, call me a pasta lover, but I am firmly bought on the idea that this is a low carb pasta and prefer to not dispute the fact or second guess it. I love pasta, always have, always will! But since time does take a toll and careless living does have a consequence I ended being basically blocked from regular pasta. By basically I mean, that once I got a little smarter, I realized that most of my eating habits would have to change If I ever was to conquer my limitations. It was either or and going back to my many meals of italian origin, be that canneloni, lasaga, a la bolognesi, tutu di mare, pesto, I can go on and on and get hungry at the exact same time. The point is that Dreamfields Pasta (with such a beautiful name it can be the pasta of dreams) offers me a way out or should I rephrase and say: I way in. Man Oh Mama Mia, pasta a la alfredo, just with parmesan and butter (for me I can't believe it's not butter for the rest the real deal from the cow's mouth!) pasta primavera...I better stop! I am getting emotional and my eyes are heating up! With the upcoming Wonderfully Exciting FIFA World Cup 2010 and the beautiful first days of Summer Dreamfields Pasta appear like the saviors in a market that mostly ignore the needs, of perhaps the few, but never the less active, dedicated, and deserving as anyone else to enjoy life at its fullest! I hope this is the best of all world cups ever and I give 5 Stars to the only kid in town!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
EZ-Sweetz (2.0oz - Liquid Sweetener 800 Servings/Bottle) (Original, 1 Pack)
Review:
By weird I mean: here is a bottle that has this sugar replacement that cost a pretty penny and it measures in drops. Yes, two drops from this container equal one packet of splenda? And the container, supposedly, has 800 drops which is quite a statement that in true honesty I can not dispute because it would be really tedious to count every single little drop that pours out from the plastic dispenser. Okey, that aside let's go to the part in the title of my review where I also say: It works! I tried it in my regular daily coffee and must say the taste is very agreeable and I compare it mostly to Splenda (which has been the choice for the past year or more) and it certainly is as good, if not better. No weird taste that I been able to tell and with the added bonus that it has zero zero zero, I think it makes a strong case for consumption. Heard that Splenda does have carbs and calories compared with this EZ-Sweetz. So I like it and now I am trying to see how long will it last compared to the price it cost to buy it. And since it has no impact whatsoever in the glycemic index (don't I sound very informed?) that is a plus to be considered. Perhaps is not even expensive if it lasts for at least a month or more. I found the product by accident and intriguing from the gate go so I was running low on Splenda and instead of going back to Costco and purchasing another 1000 packets I bought this one. The only reason I gave it 4 Stars is for the value factor but in everything else that it is supposed to do, it does with shinning colors. Thankful to the fine, and I mean fine, reviewers in amazon which I have learned to value and trust their helpful opinions (most of the time, anywhoo) and who knew EZ-Sweetz (2oz - Liquid Sweetener 800 Servings/Bottle) existed in the free world? Not me, that's for sure and thanks to amazon and reviewers alike now I have one standing pretty in my kitchen ready for cereal, tea, coffee and why not? Maybe even for baking. 4 Stars but surely 5 if it last like 800 drops?
Rating:
4.0

Review:
I did not think coconut and dark chocolate could ever taste bad.
I was expecting mainly those 2 ingredients. I was wrong. It's mostly a date flavor and texture with a sprinkle of coconut and a thin chocolate coating. I did not taste cashews or almonds at all. Maybe the folks that are rating these bars highly have acquired a taste for such items.

Product:
Azar Nut Company Almonds Natural, Sliced, 32-Ounce Resealable Bag
Review:
I almost did not purchase these because I was not familiar w/ this brand. I took a chance based on Ms. Vega's review and I am so glad I did. They flavor taste as fresh as if you toasted them yourself-crunchy, fresh almond flavor-no rancidity! The foil resealing bag actually seals airtight unlike other bags that do not seal well since they are cheaply made. I will definitely purchase other Azar products. Also this product is actually cheaper than buying non-toasted sliced almonds at my local grocery stores (Food Lion and Farm Fresh). Truly a great deal on a quality item.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nutiva Organic, Raw, Shelled Hempseed from non-GMO, Sustainably Farmed Canadian Hemp, 1.1-ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
This hemp seed reminds me of finely chopped black walnuts in appearance and to my taste buds, it has a much milder black walnut taste. I really did not know what to expect for a nutty flavor, but was pleasantly surprised. I plan to use them as a nut substitute when I make banana bread. I was concerned since we were having such warm weather this past week that they would turn rancid during shipping, but they arrived fully sealed, fresh tasting, and thus far I have no shell complaint. I have also started using Nutiva's organic hemp oil for salad dressings and Pacific' hemp milk to decrease my use of diary. All products have proven enjoyable winners.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Next Organic Brazil Nuts Dark Chocolate Covered, 4-Ounce (Pack of 3)
Review:
I ordered these from Amazon, but they are not listing it as a verified purchase which is odd. I only mention this as I tend to believe the verified purchases eliminate the "shill factor." The nuts were delivered in perfect condition on a hot day. These candies are delicious and if you can resist not eating at least half of one package as a single serving, you have more self control than I! Organic dark chocolate covered Brazil nuts are difficult to find at a reasonable price. Now I wish I had purchased more while they were on sale. The nuts are fresh tasting medium sized covered in a glossy dark chocolate. This chocolate does not readily melt on your fingers, such as non-glossy chocolate typically does. I am enjoying these heavenly treats (5 pieces for 219 calories).
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nature's Path Organic Oats, Steel Cut, 30 Ounce Canister (Pack of 6) (Packaging may vary)
Review:
I'm a long time fan of McCann's oatmeal and a new fan of Country Choice (CC). The McCann's is cut larger so is a more chewier product. For those converting to steel cut oats, the finer cut of CC might make the transition easier. I could not tell a flavor difference between the two. Also for one serving I use one cup of boiling water w/ 1/3 cup of oatmeal. Here's my comparison based on Trader Joe's pricing:
McCann $4.99/28 oz., metal can, non-organic
Country Choice $2.99/30 oz., cardboard canister, organic
Surprisingly the CC has 5G of protein vs. 4G for McCann and 4G of fiber vs. 3G for McCann based on  c. dry of each. Clearly CC is the best value, particularly since it is organic and made in the USA. BUT when Amazon has the coupon code deal, it's more of a coin toss and personal preference.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Country Choice Organic Snacking Cookies, Iced Oatmeal, 7 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
If these had not been organic I'd only given 2 stars. I'm used to eating Nature's Path organic ginger spice cookies which is the one I'm using to compare. The NP ones have a stronger ginger flavor which I prefer. The crunch factor (hardness) is about the same. The price point is the biggest factor. The NP at $32 w/o coupon for 12 9 ox. boxes are approx. 4.75 pound (the last case I bought had a coupon so were $22 or 3.26/lb). These are about 6.50/lb. at Amazon's current price. I probably won't buy these again as I'll stick w/ Nature's Path. That said, I did give this brand's chocolate mint cookies 5 stars and I do plan on purchasing those again as well as trying their chocolate chip and oatmeal cranberry.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
YS Organic Bee Farms - Organic Honey, 16 oz gel
Review:
This is not your typical honey. Granted its organic and cream colored although it is not creamed honey. It is "pure" honey in the truest definition. The texture is solid, dense, somewhat waxy and velvety smooth with a pleasant floral taste. It describes itself as a gel, but I think it is much denser and although one gets a 1# jar, it is a small weighty jar. It softens easily on a piece of warm toast which is heavenly (no butter needed) or simply enjoy eating a spoonful by letting it melt in your mouth for a sensual treat. Due to its cost, which I think it is worth every cent, I won't be using it in tea. I'll continue using Rain Forest organic honey also sold on Amazon for that purpose. I think of this American/Canadian made honey as a true health food as it has numerous benefits. If you ever purchased the creamed South of France honey in the pail that Amazon used to carry, this honey's flavor and texture(when softened)will remind you of that incredible French honey. This is now my favorite honey. I encourage you to visit YS Organic Bee Farms website for additional information as they are a remarkable company. Also to comment on Swanson, the company that sold it, they were quick to fulfill and ship the order, both jars were well packed, they thanked me for my order a couple of times and sent a coupon for $5 off a future order which can be used in a direct order w/ them or on Amazon. So you know I'll be reordering this delightful honey and a few lucky friends may also receive a jar.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Back To Nature Jumbo Cashews, Sea Salt, Roasted, No Added Oils, 10-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 3)
Review:
I've liked most of the Back To Nature (BTN) products I tried and this is no exception. These are about 40% whole cashews and 60% halves. They taste fresh and are lightly sea salted. There are no added oils. I wouldn't call them jumbo though, as they are the same regular size of any other brand on the market I've tried. Since usually it is the Kirkland brand from Costco I buy, I will say BTN's taste much better, but they are also considerably more expensive. I will savor these 3 bags due to their high caloric content. Yum.
Rating:

Native Forest Organic Tropical Fruit Salad, 14-Ounce Cans (Pack of 6)
Review:
After I enptied the can, I noticed it was black in an area at the top of the can and appeared to be corroded. Of course I was afraid to eat the fruit, so I threw it away. I am waiting for a response from Native Forest to ascertain the type of metal can and if it is harmful. One would expect if they went to the effort to be certified as organic, they would use safe canning. I will post an addendum w/ their response.

Review:
I have been a fan for Maldon salt for many years now, once you discover this well known kitchen gem you will never look back, I stopped to write a review because I was making another purchase and realized that I never wrote anything about it on Amazon... The pyramid shaped flaky crystals can be sprinkled on for light as air like salt crunch or broken between the fingers as it gets sprinkled on anything and everything. Grilled veggies never had it so good. Salted Caramel is beyond luscious with this added in. I use this in place of most salt in my cooking even tough I have about ten vials of various salts ranging from Grey Hawaiian Lava, Pink Himalayan, Bamboo Jade, Hawaiian Red Alaea to a Black course grind  ( great with lemonade) on my counter, I cook a lot so I go a bit nuts with this stuff. This is worth the buck and lasts a while, I say try it once then see how you feel about it, I use this as my daily basic cooking salt but it's really so much more as the taste and texture surpasses anything else salt related that I have ever bought.

I also buy their peppercorns which are really zesty and the gorgeous pinkish smoked salt, this is so good that it best my usual stand by, Kosher salt which is nice and delicate but doesn't have the crunch and flavor of Maldon. This is the best salt hands down, soft and flaky, crunchy and slightly briny, it has a fresh ocean taste that truly tantalizes the taste buds.

- Kasia S.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Celestial Seasonings Madagascar Vanilla Red Tea Bags - 20 ct
Review:
I have loved tea ever since I was a little girl, and I can honestly say that Celestial Seasonings has been one of my favorite whimsical brands of teas supporting my habit of drinking this healthful and delicious brew. I don't know anyone who can resist the cozy boxes with cheery, charming artwork pleasing to the eye, all printed on 100% recycled cardboard, with the tea bags being large and very plain as their taste once dropped in the hot water is worth the bag looking the way it does while the cover art on the box really make this a better tea than some of the brand out there in their fancy boxes and shiny labels, that taste flat and bitter.

Madagascar Vanilla Red is a caffeine free blend of Rooibos, Natural French Vanilla Flavor and Vanilla bean. When sugar or honey or even milk are added it tastes like the sweetest, almost chewy vanilla one can sink their teeth into whenever a sweet craving kicks in. I swear it reminds me of the Madagascar Vanilla I use in all my baking for the intense and heady sweet aroma and it tastes like a bakery treaty in a cup and since it's healthy, easy to find and inexpensive it makes me a very satisfied customer. If I drink it plain, no sugar no nothing it tastes like a delicate exotic tea with a breath of sweetness, and this is one of the very few teas I can drink plain, quite a feat in my eyes.

I heartily recommend it for any tea fan, even if they don't think that Herbal/Caffeine type teas are their cup of tea, haha, this is better because its not decaf, its naturally caffeine free, omitting the artificial process and it simply makes me happy when I drink it.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Doctor Kracker Organic Crispbread, Seeded Spelt, 7 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
My first introduction to Doctor Kracker was through a random review on Amazon about eight years ago, dormant but not forgotten the review resurfaced when I finally saw a box of the flatbreads at my local Zabar's (perk of living in New York). While shopping I spotted them so of course my curiosity escalated and I took a box home, I love pumpkin and cheese, so these were totally up my alley, a few years later and I'm a still huge fan, in fact I'm munching on the now, watching Japanese Iron Chef on TV now, figuring I should review something that I'm so wild for.

These offer a major crunch, you almost have to chew these like a Viking with gusto but they are oh so good, the cheddar is quietly baked into to the batter with a few extra sprinkles on top and it provides a lightly salty and crispy background for the nutty pumpkin seeds which are sprinkled throughout each large slab, you can barely taste the cheese, just the salty residue really as these are nice and healthy, each packs 4 grams of fiber and 5 grams of protein per 100 calories ( 8 per box). This is a great treat to enjoy with beer if you want to go hang out with friends, or a nice piece under some creamy French Bree or nice slice of cured meat, even turkey and apples can become a lunch time snack with this flatbread under as it's sturdy enough to be a part of a meal. For me these make for a yummy bite, I can never get enough and I finish a box in no time, these are subtle but so refined that they beckon for me to keep coming back, anytime I'm at that store I have to get these because it's impossible to resists what awaits inside. These do not taste like junk food, they are very basic yet complex, at first they hardly taste like anything but the more you eat them the more you want, so keep some on hand once you start them.

- Kasia S.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Blue Diamond Natural Oven Roasted Almonds Vanilla Bean, 8-Ounce Jars (Pack of 6)
Review:
I have passed these in the store a few times before deciding to give them a try, and man I'm glad I did. The taste is really etheral, nothing artificial or fake, but a mellow, smooth buttery hint of vanilla - pretty subtle but addictive never the less. The first day I had this I ate about  of the container and had to stop myself from having any more.

These comes in a nice size, 8 oz plastic container, easy to take with me or keep on my desk at work, true that is distracts me, I find myself gazing at them and reaching to have a piece here and there, but they taste as good as candy and are healthy.

What I also love is the lack of corn syrup, this is sweet but has none of the appalling chemicals that food companies love to feed us with. This little nut, native to Iran is virtually carb free and has lots of fiber, vitamin E and is rich in mono unsaturated fat ( the good one that helps lower LDL cholesterol). It is possible that almonds benefit the skin - good complexion never hurts, and help prevent cancer, have anti-inflammatory properties and boosts immunity - phew, so much for such a little nut.

Also this price can't be beat, I will order my next batch from Amazon.

- Kasia S.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Ahmad Tea Peach & Passion Fruit Black Tea, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
If you're going to sip this lusciously delicious tea you might as well grab your kitty or puppy, a good book, blanket and snuggle up in the favorite armchair because good times are ahead!

Having the pleasure of all ready trying out some of the Ahmad teas I was pretty sure this was a good purchase but it ended up being tasty beyond my predictions. This tea tastes like a wonderful black smooth tea with the succulent mouth watering flavors of juicy apricots. I prefer a black tea with fruit blend to herbal fruit teas when I want something soothing because the black tea give the fruit unparallel depth and character.

This really bursts with flavor when sugar is added and it can be drank day and night. I'm really looking forward to tasting other Ahmad flavors like Strawberry and passion fruit and maybe their Earl Gray. This is easily one of my favorite teas and I can't see anyone not loving it from the first sip!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Ahmad Tea Peach & Passion Fruit Black Tea, 20-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
I'm a tea lover and as much as I like super fancy blends, sometimes plain black tea is the most  soothing and simply satisfying.  This tea is a simple and delicious treat with some smooth creamy vanilla and if anything its even more comforting and luxurious than any of my favorite black teas. The taste is so natural and subtly sweet that it feels extra special and can really be drank at any time of the day instead of plain tea.

Im really looking forwards to trying all of the flavors Ahmad carries, and at these great prices I see no obstacles on my tea tasting journey!

Each bag is packaged beautifully in foil and the box can stand straight up, facing forward with this removable slit at the bottom for easy dispensing.

Lovely and tasty, simply great tea.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Arrowhead Mills Organic Spelt Flour, 2 Pound (Pack of 4)
Review:
I often use this organic flour to make warm and cozy muffins in the fall and winter seasons, my favorite are the Apple and Cinnamon Muffins from the Nigella Kitchen cookbook by my culinary muse Nigella Lawson.  Those are just divine and oh so easy, this wonderful organic flour lets me have fun in the kitchen because I can bake and try out new stuff and still make it healthy since the fiber in this product is impressive. Just  cup has 130 calories, 1 gram fat, 0 saturated, trans fat, cholesterol & sodium, 150 mg potassium, 25 g carb, 4 grams fiber, 0 sugar and 4 grams of protein with some niacin and riboflavin per serving.

Spelt is special and it's related to wheat; the earliest findings of it are from the 5th millennium BC, just north of the Black Sea in Transcaucasia. Europe munched on it for ages, I come from Europe but it was America that introduced me to it through British recipes, life is funny indeed! This grain has been traced from the Neolithic to the Bronze Age, it kept the human machine alive and growing so I figure it won't hurt to bake with it once in a while, turns out that the nutty taste and hearty bite aren't so hard to convert to, this can make delicious  breads, cookies or muffins, white flour isn't the only option anymore, the world of good grains lies in front of everyone, just takes a change and courage to cook with the ancient grains that have stood the test of time, the taste and health benefits are worth the try.  Spelt does contain gluten, which I don't have a problem digesting, just a fyi to bakers out there who have food sensitivities and allergies.

- Kasia S.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
RiceSelect Organic Jasmati Rice, 32 oz Jars (Pack of 4)
Review:
Currently I'm on my second jar of this fantastic rice, it completely seduced me with its nutty and totally buttery aroma - raw in the jar it smells just like that, but the taste is equally impressive.
My favorite way of making it starts with sautéing two shallots or some onion with a bit of olive oil or butter, then to that I add whatever herbs I have around, usually rosemary or thyme, then I add the uncooked rice and dry sauté it until lightly toasted, at the end I throw in a handful of golden raisins and two cups of chicken broth, 20 minutes on a slow simmer and a tasty side is ready.

I have burned my share of rice in the past or was forced to throw out the overly wet batches, but this one comes out perfect every time. Whether I make it plain or fancy it up, it always tastes delicious.

This brand of rice is great at creating wonderful hybrids for all kinds of dishes, highly recommended.

- Kasia S.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Celestial Seasonings White Tea, Perfectly Pear, 20-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
This delicate white tea with the smoothest hint of luscious dewy pear and a kiss of vanilla takes me back to my childhood days of running around in sun all day, eating fresh fruit that would drip all the way down to my elbows washed down by massive amounts of tea.

I have to agree with the reviewer below that the taste is faint, and that's the best part of this tea. Sometimes you want something soft and soothing but not herbal, that almost tastes like juicy water and this really takes the punch.

I love it with a bit of sugar, and it gets even better when cooled or made with ice. For those watching calories, sugar can be omitted and this tea can be drunk in gallons to refresh and tranquilize. I can forget all about store bought iced teas and all the soda in the world when presented with this, as it is truly a tea I can see myself buying for the rest of my life. It's gentler than black tea, healthier and 100% natural with less caffeine than coffee and that flowery aroma of summer bouquets caught in a tiny tea bag is a marvel to behold.

- Kasia S.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Red Espresso Ground Rooibos Tea, 8.8-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 2)
Review:
This is an interesting brew, but I have to admit it tastes a bit different and has that "health" drink tang to it, I love black tea and good coffee so this is something I would drink to have instead of those two but never as a substitute. The flavor and scent is bit grassy, and makes me feel a bit like a farm animal when I drink it lol, for health benefits I prefer my green tea and mesh bags of Rooibos tea with nice flavors such as almond or coconut , I wouldn't buy this again even though its was free from Amazon...

Other than the acidic flavor it's hard to make, prepare to have your coffee pot clogged up...not fun and not fast/easy for sure

First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Bob's Red Mill Teff Flour, 24-ounce (Pack of 4) Review: Teff, a mainstay of diets in Ethiopia and popular in surrounding African countries as well, has the highest calcium content of any grain. Its actually a variety of millet thats easy to grow in diverse climates and under unpromising conditions and has a sweet, molasses-like taste. Its also gluten-free. You need to read Nutrition Facts on this grain to see the shocking amount of minerals and vitamins that it contains. Rare grain but healthy and delicious. Both have almost the same composition, mostly the same minerals and vitamins except Teff is high in manganese. I stopped consuming oats since I could never find oats having any Phytosterols and hardly any other minerals, so amaranth offer more nutrients, especially when it is raw and uncooked. Starch makes you feel full just like rice, potato, pasta unlike greens where you can eat and eat and still feel hungry but with starch it is like eating protein. Teff is never USDA organic certified. Amaranth offers more selenium 52-12=40% and vitamin B5 28-18=10% which are essential nutrients. All those measurements where for one cup serving. Quinoa is a milder taste grain in comparison to Amaranth or Teff but regardless I consume it all. Quinoa cooks in ten minutes, no more no less, ready on the spot, whenever I wish, with no hassle, with great taste but Amaranth and Teff take longer, and I mean really, really longer. Cooking Teff and Amaranth is a process, time consuming regardless of the brand but I ground amaranth for calcium and magnesium with flax and sesame seed and consume it daily. Powder will go rancid so need to purchase what is needed and kept in freezer. Rating: 5.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill Dried Tart Cherries, 8-Ounce Packages (Pack of 8) Review: Cherries contain melatonin, a natural antioxidant with a well-documented history of helping to regulate the sleep-wake cycle. Produced naturally by the body in small amounts, melatonin plays a role in inducing sleepiness at night and wakefulness during the day. Although melatonin is marketed as a supplement to help people fall asleep, I'm not a big advocate of going that rout since I care less for unregulated supplement industry. Consuming natural melatonin from whole foods like cherries is clearly another story since it is a fruit and my body more likely is going to use that very natural ingredient from a fruit in a much different way than it would via a pill. I do the same with ACV since I have no intention to go to store every single day. I am very healthy with no chronic or health issues and for years I have consumed cherries for inflammation since being in many sports, my body appreciates any help that it can get for all those bends and twists that it requires my joints to keep up those grueling exercises at a time. I just consume a spoon every single night straight out of the bottle, no mixing, no stories. Conventional cherries are one of the dirty dozens so USDA organic option is better choice for me. Furthermore the added sugar and oil, make this a very high calorie food with thirty one grams of sugar for one third cup serving size. Rating: 3.0 Product: Bumble Bee Salmon Pink Canned, 14.75-Ounce Cans (Pack of 4) Review: The cannery which produces this pink salmon for Chicken of the Sea, produces for majority of the sellers selling pink salmon. All come from one area in Alaska. It is the same can with different wrapping and sold for twice the cost in supermarkets but at Whole Foods Stores for $3.29 and Trader Joes for $2.99 year round except three months out of the year. Will never taste the same as the sockeye salmon fresh out of water, not few weeks old that I BBQ with the skin and eat the whole thing with just pitta bread, nothing added just pure salmon skin, meat and juicy oils. That is one real tasty delicious food out of this world. These are not as tasty but it is the best alternative and a very good alternative since ready whenever I want it to, in a can. Forget about the farm raised junk fish where they add carpet die. For something like $3.50 a pound, this is a very healthy protein source for me with many nutrients especially after pumping iron. Costco sells the worst tasting canned pink salmon, these are much better than Costco. Pink salmon is sold in cans hardly ever or infact never fresh unless you catch it yourself in Alaska. These are all small salmons so you will get couple of whole salmons in a can with all the bones and the skin. Product feature description is wrong. You can not take out the skin and the bone that easily so you may forget about buying this salmon if you can not consume it all. There is no vitamin A in this salmon either like some claims out there. I consume a lot of wild fish, sprats, sardines, herrings... No farm raised fish for me or fresh fish unless I catch it myself since fresh fish means few weeks old except shell fish which I get it in three days. The smaller the fish the more nutrition in the fish. I consume these salmon since these salmon stay in the rivers of cold Pacific in order not to be consumed by the bigger fish and feast on small bugs and fish which are high in nutrients. Few of the reviews on Amazon about these salmons consuming squid is misrepresentation. Bones means calcium. Skin means good polyunsaturated fat. I mix the whole can with few different vegetables and wolla, get my calcium, protein and all nutrients for $3.50 a pound. These pink canned salmons are in water not vegetable oil. I drain the water since I could care less for 2000 mg of salt in the can. Healthy, without any additives, growth hormones, pesticides, antibiotics, carpet dye, or sitting on a shelf exposed to air for few weeks... Sockeye salmon is the only fresh wild salmon you can get during the spring run and sold as smoked salmon which I consume but cost more. Atlantic and steelheads are only farm raised. Keta, Pink, Chum, Coho are always canned. Bravo. WARNING: 99% of all cans are lined in plastic which leach high levels of a chemical called Bisphenol A, which has been linked to cancer, clogging of arteries, birth defects, miscarriages, obesity, and insulin resistance, which can lead to Type II diabetes. Refer to the Environmental Working Group report on BPA for more information. This product claims that it has no BPA. It is generally safer to eat fresh than it is to eat canned goods. Canned goods, sometimes are contaminated with harmful agents such as botulism. Rating: 4.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill Organic Corn Flour, 24 Ounce (Pack of 4) Review: Corn is an excellent grain and I do not care going to the store and purchasing it frozen so I try to get organic in dry form and this was the best product but unfortunately goes rancid quickly since it is in ground form. I was looking for corn nothing more nothing less, Bob sells their corn flour which is pure corn, no additive, no mix as follows; Conventional $9.59, organic $11.79, (( par of the germ removed soaked in lemon called Masa Harina $11.79, gluten free Masa Harina $13.99)), gluten free conventional $18.90 all of those in 4 packages of 24oz. Can not figure why Bob sells Masa Hernia for less although some of the germ is removed since that is lots of work soaking it in lemon. Amazon sells it for different prices. I do not bake or make tortillas or bake cookies, I just dump some in my food so I would have the taste and benefit of corn. Bob is an excellent brand even when it comes to conventional since Bob is never GMO, no pesticide, no chemicals... Rating: 4.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill Old Country Style Muesli Cereal, 40-ounce (Pack of 4) Review: I purchased this for a friend of mine since there is hardly any healthy cereals out there. This is the best cereal I could find for her and unfortunately it is not organic but yet it is good enough to be as part of a healthy diet. She mixes Muesli with organic soy milk few hours in advance and consumes it in the morning. With fiber, protein, minerals and vitamins mixed with hemp seed that I purchase for her, nothing can come close to this healthy food. No one sells it out there for less than Amazon. Organic will cost her some $7.00 a lb but this at $28.00 for (4x2.5=10 lb) the package is less than $3.00 a lb, delivered to the door. Soaking is a necessity since it is raw. Soaking in yogurt is another option as well. I even tried it once and it is absolutely delicious. No wonder she keeps having it for breakfast. Bravo. Product: Solofill Cup, Refillable Cup For Keurig Single serve cups Brewers, Red and Black (Pack of 2) Review: First, using packaged K-cups with a Keurig is a sucker's game. It's overly expensive, weak quality, and wasteful. So whether you use a "My K Cup" adapter, or this Solofill (or some other brand) that enables you to use your own coffee, that's a choice you really need to make. I had used a "My K Cup" for a long time. But the mesh was finally wearing through and so I wanted to give something new a try. The advantage for the Solofill: MUCH less spraying and extra water into the cup, which means overall better tasting coffee and less mess. This is because you will use the original K-Cup pod in the Keurig (unlike the "My K Cup" which is a seperate adapter). So it's designed to fit like a K-Cup, and it doesn't have the problems with the spraying. This is a BIG plus. The disadvantages, which to be fair are mostly annoyances, but still... A pain to clean. Unlike the "My K Cup," which had multiple parts and was easy to flick the old grounds out of, this requires you have to dig into the grounds to get them out. Then, the little divot at the bottom needs some extra spray to come clean. The lid does not have a lip to open it, so you have to be careful it doesn't open and spill grounds everywhere. Overall, it's okay - but I'm all about convenience, and the aggravations push it to three stars instead of four...but someone else might see it differently. I don't see any significant difference in coffee taste. I drink coffee black, and it tastes about the same to me. It SHOULD be a little stronger without the extra water, but I don't notice. In fact - another reviewer noticed that the water might go through TOO quickly, which makes it water. I'm not sure - but it's possible. UPDATE, Feb. 27, 2013: I hiked the rating to four stars from three. I've been using it for awhile, and I like it - I still don't like the cleaning, but overall I'm having no problems with spillover and I think it distributes the water through the coffee grounds more effectively. Review:

golds.output: This Yellowbird Habanero Sauce is really good stuff. I love the flavor and it's got a great kick to it. I'm a hot sauce fanatic and I've tried a lot of different habanero sauces, but this one is definitely one of my favorites. It's not too salty like some other sauces I've tried, and the habanero flavor really shines through. I've been using it on tacos, nachos, and even as a dip for chips. It's also great as an addition to some of my favorite recipes. I'd highly recommend this sauce to anyone who likes a little heat in their life.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Melinda's Naga Jolokia Hot Sauce, 5 Oz Review: I have to agree with the other reviews. This sauce is very flavorful and by far the hottest Melinda's will ever be able to make. I love Melinda's because they don't try to destroy you with heat, although this one has some SERIOUS kick to it. They really know how to make a flavorful hot sauce, and this one ties with the 4x Reserve as being my two favorites. Rating: 5.0 Product: TRY ME SAUCE YUCATAN SUNSHINE, 5 OZ, PACK OF 12 Review: I had a hard time squeeking out 4 stars for this hot sauce. 3 1/2 would be more like it. The reason being it's too salty. Melinda's XXXX Reserve is balanced much better than this one and the habanero flavor shines through more with the Melinda's. The only reason I grabbed this one at the store was because it was $2.99 compared to Melinda's at $3.49. Seems trivial but this might last me one week. Rating: 4.0 Product: Dave's Gourmet Sauce, Crazy Caribbean, 5 Ounce Review: I love Dave's Insanity anything. This Ghost Pepper is no exception. It's extremely hot but I can handle the tongue and mouth heat. It's what happens in the belly that can really mess you up with this stuff. Don't use this on dinner if you plan on going to the mall the next morning. Rating: 5.0 Product: Dried Trinidad Moruga Scorpion Pepper Pods, 0.25 Ounce Review: You don't have to grind these or even eat them. Just use the pepper to add serious heat and flavor and then toss it. A friend of mine was visiting his father in South Carolina and found this same brand of dried Scorpion Peppers in a hot sauce store down there. He bought them for me because he knows I like the heat. I'm almost 50 now so my days of doing stupid stuff with hot sauce and peppers is over, but I can still handle a nice batch of inferno with a side of the runs now and then. I made a big batch of green chile stew with some leftover pulled pork I made and about 18 good sized roasted hatch peppers last Sunday. I decided to add one of these dried Scorpion Peppers to the stew for about 2 hours, at which point I fished out the pepper and tossed it in the garbage. I'l just say that it's a good thing we didn't have company for dinner. My wife can handle it but most people cannot. It was hot and it's the kind of hot that hits you immediately. No creeper with this one.....BAM!!!!! I personally love that and not many peppers can do that, they usually creep up on you. I cannot wait to try one of these in a wing sauce. I usually use Franks Red Hot, clarified butter, Dave's Original Insanity and a touch of honey or brown sugar for my wing sauce. I think I can omit the Daves Insanity next time and try one of these peppers. I'll probably reconstitute it in room temperature Franks for the entire day and then heat all the ingredients on the stovetop for a while. That should produce a wing with a good thwack of heat upon first biting in. You could also reconstitute these in olive oil to drizzle over potatoes or other veggies. I wouldn't suggest playing any jokes on anyone with these. That's not funny and you would really ruin someones day if they ate one of these. Rating: 5.0 Product: Trinidad Moruga Scorpion Hot Sauce (5 ounce) Review: This sauce has a nice flavor to it. At first it came across as being a bit salty but that was tasting it off a spoon. The only salt in the ingredients list is garlic salt and that's towards the bottom of the list. I'm not a total heat freak so this is about as hot as I can handle. It makes my head sweat and if I use too much of it my stomach is in bad shape as it cries out for me to stop. If you like this one try the Melinda's Naga Jolokia as well. Rating: 5.0 Product: Trinidad Moruga Scorpion Hot Sauce (5 ounce) Review: This is a flavorful hot sauce that has a good kick to it. If you can handle a good amount of heat and flavor is a top priority then this is the sauce for you. It's not a concentrated sauce and doesn't use extract so it's not going to drop you to your knee's the way some of the reviewers would like. Ingredients are Trinidad Moruga Scorpion Chiles, vinegar, onion, tomatoes, lemon juice, garlic, salt, spices. Rating: 5.0 Product: Dave's Gourmet Naga Jholokia (Ghost Pepper) Hot Sauce, 5-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3) Review: I find this to be rather tasty for such a hot sauce. It doesn't take much of this to make my head bead with sweat and its not foul tasting by any means. I'd like to incorporate this into a wing sauce. My go to is still Melinda's Naga Jolokia but this is good and I'm glad it's in the arsenal. Rating: 4.0 Product: Valentina Salsa Picante Mexican Sauce Review: This hot sauce is so tasty with Mexican food / Tex Mex that for me personally, nothing even touches it. This isn't a hot sauce that I would use for Buffalo Wings or home fries. This stuff lends itself to tacos, nachos, burritos etc so well that it's hard to describe. I'm a hot sauce fanatic and I love habenero hot sauces, but habenero hot sauce just doesn't work on a taco like this stuff does. I always thought it did, and it is very yummy, but not like this stuff on Tex mex or Mexican chow. I live in Upstate New York and travel a lot for business. I buy this stuff on the west coast for $1.29 a bottle at the grocery store, bubble wrap it and bring it home in my luggage. I think about this hot sauce some times. It's amazing. To put it in perspective for you west coasters, I hate Tapatio. It's got too much vinegar. This stuff does not. I would like to thank the creator of this hot suace, because it's that good. It really stands out on Tex Mex especially. Mmmmm. YUMMY ! ! ! ! Rating: 5.0 Product: Slap Ya Mama Original Blend, 8-Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: I use a few teaspoons of this in red beans and rice. I'm not from New Orleans but have been down there enough to know that a lot of people use it for this purpose alone. Yes, it is salty so just be careful. Rating: 5.0 Product: Lindt Swiss Premium Milk Chocolate, 10.58-Ounce Packages (Pack of 4) Review: This is a review of the Lindt Bittersweet bar. It's delicious and is basically the nectar that keeps me alive. As a past hater of chocolate, I'm so glad that I became an addict at the age of around 45. Two year later and I'm ordering it from Amazon by the pounds. You have to remember that this is good chocolate and that you may need to force your receptors to forget the taste of Hershey's Special Dark. This particular Lindt is the real deal. We had some friends over for dinner last night and they somehow noticed one of these bars. When I told them what it was their reaction was priceless. Apparently they're dark chocolate lovers so we gave them some. Since they just moved into a new home, I'm back here to,order them a house warming gift of this chocolate. This makes a great gift for the chocolate lover. Try it. Rating: 5.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['sauce', 'hot', 'one', 'good', 'stuff', 'like', 'really', 'would', 'use', 'heat'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Community Coffee Whole Bean Coffee, Breakfast Blend, (Pack of 3) Review: Community Coffee's Breakfast Blend is a smooth, medium roast coffee, perfect for the morning or any time of the day. I prefer medium to light roast coffees. Lately I have been purchasing either a Starbucks Veranda Blend™ Whole Bean Coffee (1lb) or a kona blend like Magnum Exotics Kona Blend Coffee, 2 Pound, Whole Bean. I like Community's Breakfast Blend better than Starbuck's Blonde Roast (which I still really like), but not as much as a Kona blend. Still, I would easily recommend this coffee for everyday use. Product:

Review:
First of all, this tastes exactly like almonds without flavoring.  You can taste the almonds but it is a pretty bland taste.  You would need to add something if you wanted to get a stronger taste.  I am not saying this is bad, just be warned, you are going to get this explosion of flavor from this product.

The butter needs to be stirred if you want it to be smooth.  Once again, a spoon and a few moments and you have smooth almond butter.  It is a little on the dry side but once again, it is still a very good product.  Once it is stirred you can pretty much put it on anything.  It doesn't clump much and you don't really have to worry about ripping bread.  It should smooth over without any issues.

My only issue is the price point, you would do better buying the big jar, getting small Tupperware pieces and putting the almond butter in them.  It is a great product, that being said, getting a jar and separating it if you are on a budget makes more sense.

You get four servings per container and the whole thing has 600 calories total.  This is a pretty decent snack.  You get a decent amount per serving at 1/4 cup and there is a good taste.

All in all this is a solid snack or whatever, I don't mind the lack of crunch and actually prefer this type of granola.

Everything about these nuts is great.  That being said I have yet to meet a Fisher nut that I didn't like.

The taste of chocolate and cherry blend together well.  You can taste the cholate without if overwhelming the cherry.  My only issue is the chocolate might be a tad bit bitter.  If you don't like the taste of bitter chocolate you might not like this.  It is like eating a chocolate chip.  I don't mind the taste and am quite happy with how it tastes.

These are pretty good.  If you have someone that loves dark chocolate and cherries you could do worse then this.  Pricing is good and the flavor is really spot on.

5.0

FISHER Snack Mixed Nuts with Peanuts, Stand-Up Bag, Gluten Free, 5.5 oz

It is interesting to not have a peanut taste when you are eating mixed nut because most of the times you get peanuts and then a few others.  This collection is just a collection of cashews, almonds, pecans and Brazil nuts.

I like fisher nuts. They give planters a run for their money and in some cases I like their products better then other brands.  This is one of those cases.

5.0

I will definitely be getting more of this when this one runs out and everyone in my room assures me it will only last a week or so.

Review:
This stuff is unnatural.  It surely has to be the work of a witch.  How can you take dried peanuts and make smooth and creamy peanut butter.  It is like magic.  You can make smooth, a little dry, runny or whatever you can imagine.

It tastes great.  How can something with so few calories taste so good.  You can get 2 tablespoons for 45 calories and get a decent amount of protein in the mix.  Just a really good item.

I still say it is something made by witchcraft.  Other then that, I have nothing to say!

Product:
Tamicon Tamarind Paste, 8-Ounce Unit (Pack of 6)
Review:
This tamarind paste is an essential ingredient in many Indian and Thai recipes and is so much easier than dealing with scooping and soaking pulp from the pods.  The sweet-sour flavor of the paste adds the "just right" touch to pad thai, curries, chutneys, salad dressings, etc.  It's the perfect complement to other ingredients such as fresh chiles, aromatics such as garlic, ginger, and shallots, coconut milk, or a blend of some or all of the above. A bit of sugar in a recipe really helps to accent the flavor. Besides adding flavor, tamarind works great as a marinade. The fruit's natural acidity helps to tenderize tougher cuts of beef, breaking down the fibers in the meat. Marinated overnight in a tamarind-infused liquid, beef becomes succulent and tender. Be careful with fish or chicken: if left in the marinade too long, the tamarind marinade alone will begin to "cook" it. Tamarind's rich color also deepens the color of a marinade, which can make a wonderful sauce when reduced.

With the 6 jars of paste that came in this order, I'll have to get cracking at finding and/or thinking up recipes that I can use it in, especially since you only use a small amount each time.
Rating:
5.0
</Other Writer-1>
