You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Kashi TLC Crackers, Fire Roasted Vegetable, 9-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
The pita chips we had been buying at our local supermarket where nice tasting but not whole grain. So I looked on Amazon for whole grain chips. I like Kashi, saw these, and decided to give them a chance.

I am very pleased. Wonderful taste, perfect texture and thickness. They are crisp and light. Great by themselves or with cheese or hummus. I think they have too much salt, especially for Kashi. It is just a little too heavy handed. But not enough to keep these from getting an overall 5.

Just take all the other chips in your house, donate them, have one last binge, whatever. After you get rid of them just get these. Your tastebuds will thank you, your doctor will thank you.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nature Valley Crunchy Granola Bars, Oats 'n Honey, 12-Count Bars (Pack of 12)
Review:
Making oat bars is apparently a pretty hard thing to get right. Over the years I have tried a lot of different brands and they are often too dry, tasteless, or just plain bad tasting. But this is one good tasting whole grain (very nice that they use whole grain) oats bar.

While you probably want to have some liquid available when you eat these they are not too dry. The taste is wholesome and flavorable. And they are not too sweet at all, just perfect for me, more of a hint of sweetness. Pretty good value as well, recommended.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Erin Baker's Breakfast Cookies, Chocolate Chunk Raisin, 3-Ounce Individually Wrapped Cookies (Pack of 12)
Review:
One of my favorite candies is rasinettes. This is the closest cookie I have found to that taste. It also has one of the best tasting chocolate tastes of any store bought cookie I have ever had. Add to that, they are invididually wrapped and a substantial size, this is a very good buy. Especially if you like soft cookies like I do. There is a good amount of rasins in the cookies, but they do not overwhelm at all the chocolate but compliment it.

I know Erin also sells just a chocolate cookie. If it is the same used here, I would highly recoomend that as well if you are not particularly fond of rasins or raisins or don't want them to get in the way of your chocolate.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Carr's Whole Wheat Crackers, 7-Ounce Units (Pack of 12)
Review:
I tried this with a cream-cheese appetizer I made recently and was really pleased. They are a little bit thicker than most snack crackers but the taste is not heavy at all. They remained firm even though the dish had a sauce and the crackers were partially in the sauce.

Very nice taste, heaty but not heavy, without getting in the way of what was on it. And whole wheat as well. Recommended.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Endangered Species Panther, Dark Chocolate (88%), 3-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12)
Review:
This is not your mom's Hershey bar. Even her 'special dark' Hershey bar. But that is a good thing. This bar is a very itense chocolate taste. And even though I am partial to 'dark chocolate' this was unlike anything I had tried before. There is no hint of sweet, is a savory experience. At first the unsweet intense taste was not the most pleasing. But as I finished the first bar and then had more in the coming days and weeks I started to very much enjoy the rich, savory, full chocolate taste.

It will take some getting use to though. But if you like mole, one of my favorite Mexican dishes, I think you will like this. If you are a fan of dark chocolate give this a try. Good price on Amazon, you get your money's worth and some of that money goes for good causes as well.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Lindt Excellence Bar, 70% Cocoa Smooth Dark Chocolate, Gluten Free, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
This is a nice way to enjoy healthy (high cocoa percentage) chocolate. It has a smooth, rich taste and it quickly becomes very enjoyable. Even my three year old quite enjoys it.

I am on a low carb high fat way of eating so this fits in. I searched the various chocolates and this came out best in that it doesn't use soy and also isn't processed in a way to reduce antioxidants. In fact it became one of the few choices on Amazon to meet those criteria and have a high cocoa percentage.

Granted soy lecithin in small amounts is probably OK. But you don't have to worry about it with this bar and very satisfying taste. And 2.5 squares is a large serving, all my family usually has less than one square and it satisfies. Highly recommended.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bear Valley Pemmican Bars, Carob Cocoa, 3.75-Ounce Bars (Pack of 12)
Review:
I bought these to be used essentially as breakfast. First off I find these delicious. They have almonds, raisins, sunflower seeds, and just enough of a cocoa taste. They are very dense and you will want to have a lot of water or other liquid available. They are also amazingly filling. Yes 440 calories (2 servings/ one par) so more of a meal replacement than a snack. But for breakfast a whole par gives you 16 grams of protein. Protein really helps get the mind/body going in the morning so they are excellent for that.

But you are also getting 24 grams of sugar. A little high. But at least it isn't from corn syrup or even sugar as a separate ingredient. I do highly recommend these for meal replacement, especially breakfast. I have them 3 times a week for breakfast and feel really good and satisfied until lunch. This is usually 4.5 hours away for me. I think they would be excellent for backpacking and camping as well. Or other meals in the day. Tasty and satisfying, with good ingredients.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
The Good Bean Chickpea Snacks, Cracked Pepper, Gluten and Nut Free, 2.5-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
This is a great idea, chickpea snack. It is also executed well. While a little on the dry side, these are a hearty but not heavy snack that have a very robust peppery taste. Af first I thought they were a tad bit on the expensive side which is my only down side in addition to you REALLY need to like a pepper taste. However, especially with subscribe and save, you get a good amount of snacking for the price. Especially for something that is better for you than most snacks and filling.

But I still think many people who are just ok with pepper might find the taste too intensely peppery. But overall for a hearty, healthy snack I do recommend these. And if pepper is not your thing you might want to consider a different flavor.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Campbell's New England Clam Chowder Soup on the Go, 10.75 Ounce Microwavable Cups (Pack of 8)
Review:
Wow. I was not expecting this to taste as good as it does. This is a wonderfully flavorful soup. You get real clam taste and a good texture (little on the thin side but acceptable), and even a bit of creaminess. It is actually the best tasting store bought clam chowder from a national brand I have ever tried. I have tried various types of Campbells before and Progresso, and probably some regional brands I can't remember.

But this is a very good soup. The first few ingridients in order are water, clam stock, potatoes, celery, clams, vegetable oil. Unfortunately Campell's does use high fructose corn syrup, but it is at least fairly far down the ingridient list. Too bad to save a few pennies or less (maybe even a fraction of a cent over real sugar?) probably per can of production they choose that. It does contain monosodium glutamate in case that is a no go for some people.

Overall though this is great to have in your pantry. You get a good amount of fill for 150 calories but you are also getting 15% of DRA for Total Fat 10 grams, and 10% of saturated fat, 2 grams. Nice to have on hand for rainy days also.

It takes 1 minute 15 seconds on high. It is a narrow can but you do have the option of putting the 'sip cap' back on and drinking your soup. Product:
TEAMI 30-DAY DETOX TEA PACK: Teatox Kit with Skinny Loose Leaf Herbal Tea for Weight Loss and Colon Cleanse Tea Bags to Increase Energy
Review:
Well after looking at all the YT videos and Instagram accounts of fitness girls who rave about this stuff I bought my own kit. I just finished the tea yesterday but have some few packets of colon cleanse left to finish. In case you don't know the colon cleanse tea is only consumed every other day so it will outlast the Skinny tea during the 30 day treatment. I lost 5 pounds by the 3rd week but I haven't weighed myself since then. I know I've lost more than that due to how my clothes fit especially in my hip and thigh area. I was already fit prior but this really blasted the stubborn inches. As a rule, I don't believe that scales tell the true story more than pictures, mirrors and how clothes fit.

By the way, I must stress that I'm a 4-5  day  gym rat who also Crossfits but I do think tea is SUPER effective. Especially with bloating and removing toxins which is the culprit that causes the body to hold onto excess weight.

PROS:
-Both teas taste amazing (Very high quality leaves and herbal blends)
-The aroma of both teas are great. Makes you feel so soothed as you consume them
-The Skinny tea helps with appetite suppression. I didn't get any excess energy from it like other people
-The directions are easy to follow and thus makes completing the detox effortless
-It REALLY gets rid of any toxins or build up in the digestive tract (You will become insanely regular)

CONS
-The colon cleanse does cause some cramping. This is especially true during the first 2 weeks when it's seems like your body is getting adjusted to the detoxing ingredients. I have had the cramping reduce significantly now. The only time I will feel a cramp is if I don't go to the restroom when I get the urge. I know, TMI but I really want to state that may be the main cause of the cramping at times. You HAVE to go when you get the signal from your body. If you try to wait the cramps will increase in severity.

Bewley's Dublin Morning Tea, 250 gram/8.8 ounce,80-Count
Review:

5.0
Product:
Dechunxian Yunnan Pu-erh Pu Erh Black Tea Diet Tea,100% Natural Organic Tea Leaves,produced From High Mountain Ancient Tree (Yunnan Puerh Ripe Tea)
Review:
This tea is really good. Its not bitter but it doesnt have any natural hints of sweetness either. I find it best with no additions with the exception of stevia or honey.

OVERVIEW: First of all it comes in a cute reusable canister that contains the bag of the tea leaves. A little goes a long way with this brand and I typically measure out less than half a teaspoon to brew a cup. Some people say you will need a tea strainer/infuser, however, Ive found that it can be prepared without one. Since you have to let this steep for 5-8 minutes to reach its dark composition, the leaves naturally sink to the bottom of your cup. Ive stopped using my infuser and prepare it in this way.

CONS: There's nothing written in English on the canister. Thought I would just point that out for fellow shoppers. However, I've purchased many products that this was common so it's not a deal breaker for me. The most important thing  is that they do put the expiration date in English on the bottom of the container. My batch is slated as October 3, 2016.

Additionally, a friend told me not to throw away the previous leaves and to reuse them for my next cup since Asian teas are really potent. Ive gotten 3-4 cups of dark, rich tea from this process. So even though the amount of tea doesnt initially seem like allot, you must keep this in mind. This is not your average tea from a grocery store. By using these traditional practices of small measuring and reusing of the leaves, you will get the full health benefits and cups per canister. Since I often like to refer to myself as a coffee and tea connoisseur and I definitely give this beverage my approval.

*I received this product for free in exchange for my review.

5.0

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Hormel Mary Kitchen Reduced Sodium Corned Beef Hash, 14 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: I read a cookbook recently where the author, in addition to giving recipes, interviewed famous and influential chefs of all sorts. One of the questions that the chefs were asked was "What do you eat when no one is watching?" In other words, what is your guilty pleasure that might not jive with your being a renowned chef. The answers were honest and amusing. Although I am only a foodie and not a chef, if I were asked that question my answer would be "Hormel Corned Beef Hash." First, let me be honest about what this is: this is not something that you would want to eat very often if you were worried about fat or sodium content; the potatoes are dehydrated; and the corned beef tastes a little like potted meat. Still, it is a real comfort food for me and I love it. I almost always add some freshly diced onions or shallots. I also add either diced bell pepper or minced Serrano. I put in it a hot skillet over medium heat and let it cook until crispy. I flip it and while the other side is cooking I cook an egg or two in a separate skillet and place them, sunny side up, on top of the hash. I like to finish it off with a generous dose of hot sauce. I buy this large size when I have guests (I have to admit that not all of my friends or family share my love for this product.) I also purchase the 15-Ounce and also the 7.5 oz can when it's just for me (and when I'm not having it for my main meal.) This is something that I always have on hand (I just hide it from my judgmental foodie friends.) :-) Rating: 5.0 Product: Coffee-mate 2Go Triple Strength Coffee Creamer, Extra Sweet and Creamy, 3 Ounce (Pack of 8) Review: I don't use creamer in my coffee or tea but many of my friends and customers do. I offer hot beverages where I work and for both our customers and my co-workers. I sometimes have real cream or a creamer on hand but it can go bad if I go a while before someone uses it all. This small, compact creamer is great to keep on hand since it doesn't need refrigeration to stay good. I have to be honest and say that I don't like non-dairy creamers or even creamers in general but I can say that my friends, co-workers and customers seem to like this just fine. It is very similar to what you get at a fast food restaurant in those little containers, only better. Rating: 4.0 Product: Thai Kitchen Coconut Milk, 13.66 fl oz (Pack of 12) Review: I have been using coconut milk for years, mostly for Thai dishes but also in place of milk or cream in recipes that call for those. Coconut milk is usually thick and needs to be remove from the can with a spoon or a spatula. For that reason I remove the whole lid with a can opener instead of piercing the top of the can and trying to pour it out. This is great for making a delicious meal quickly. I usually add a curry paste as well as veggies and some sort of protein, such as chicken or shrimp. The coconut milk gives the dish an authentic flavor and mellows the spice of the curry paste. Thai Kitchens is one of the more expensive brands on the market but it is consistently the best that I have used. I don't usually buy the organic version but I like this one as much as I do their non-organic product. Rating: 5.0 Product: Homemade Dressing Mix Variety Pack (French Garden, Napa Garden & Italian Garden), 3.3 to 4-Ounce Containers Review: When I first received my order of the Italian Dressing mix, I was a little wary. A lot of prepared herb and spice mixes on the market seem to be full chemicals that I can't pronounce and they taste very dull, extremely salty and have a strange, artificial after-taste. NOT THIS ONE! When my order arrived the first thing that I did was to taste the mixture straight out of the jar. I was surprised at how clean and fresh the taste was. I picked up on the herbs (I'm thinking oregano, basil, parsley, rosemary and maybe some mint), the sea salt and then the sweetness of the bell pepper combined with a tartness of the lemon juice. There was a slight bit of heat (the garlic?) and a nice, pure, food-like aftertaste. Next I mixed it with some fine olive oil and used it as a dip for some crusty Italian bread. Wonderful! Later in the week I used it, along with some Dijon Mustard, as a coating for a rack of lamb. I ended up adding a little crushed black pepper to the mix and it was great. Finally I used it as a salad dressing along with aged balsamic vinegar, wine vinegar and extra virgin olive oil. It took a few minutes to get the proportions right, and I did add a little chopped rosemary and some fresh minced garlic. It was much better than any prepared dressing that comes in a bottle. I was really impressed with the flavor and quality of this prepared mix, so much so that I ordered this variety pack. Here are my thoughts on the other two varieties that come with this set: * French Garden At first taste it seemed salter than the Italian version. The chives not only tasted fresh but still retained their classic oval shape (meaning that they were not over-processed or ground to death). The garlic and onions were strong, but not too. I also picked up on the parsley and I thought I tasted a little tarragon. I added this mix to a French style omelet (runny). Very nice! My fear of it being too salty was put to rest. I next sprinkled it on some grilled eggplant and I was blown away! It woke up the subtle flavors of the vegetable. I will be trying this is other dishes to be sure. * Napa Garden This mix had a different texture than the others, probably due to the tomato powder which added a wonderful richness to the blend. This one was not as salty as the other two. The pepper gave it a little heat but I usually like more (which is easy to add, hard to take out). I tried this (along with some olive oil) with spinach angel-hair pasta. That turn out to be a good choice. The mix did not overwhelm the flavor of the pasta but added that extra kick. I highly recommend this variety pack. All three will become staples in my spice cabinet. Rating: 5.0 Product: Roland Chipotle Peppers in Adobo Sauce, 7 Ounce (Pack of 24) Review: I love all things hot and Chipotle peppers are on the top of my list. I usually buy pounds of dried Chipotles during the Hatch, New Mexico Chile Festival. The heat of Chipotles are not overbearing (they are, after all, smoked Jalapenos) but the taste is warm and full of flavor. I had been buying the La Costena Chipotle Adobo Sauce and liked them fine. I recently tried the Roland brand and found them to be even better. The sauce seems richer and the peppers hotter. I often chop these up and mix them into ground beef for Chipotle burgers or, if I include to Adobo sauce, I can make Chipotle meatloaf with it. I keep several cans of both this and the Roland Chipotle paste on hand and I use them often. They taste great to me! Rating: 5.0 Product: Upper Crust Enterprises, Panko (Japanese Style Bread Crumb), 24-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6) Review: I first became aware of Japanese-style Panko bread crumbs when on my first visit to Tokyo back in the late 80's. I must have seen them before but it wasn't until I had Tempura made table-side that I noticed their exceptional quality. Larger and yet somehow lighter than traditional, western style crumbs they give a pleasing crunchiness and toasty taste to shrimp, chicken, mushrooms, onion rings, and many other foods. I use this product both with and without Tempura batter. I really love Tempura shrimp and the addition of the Panko crumbs on top of the batter is not only authentic but it significantly adds to the taste of the finished dish. Unlike finer ground bread crumbs the larger sized Panko crumbs don't burn or blacken before the meat or vegetable is done. This is especially helpful when deep-frying larger pieces of food. It is also good on casseroles and certain other dishes that you would usually add regular crumbs to. I have purchased many different brands over the years. Since Panko crumbs are so much larger and fluffier that a brand like Progresso you usually need more than you might think. I go through an eight or twelve ounce package in just one meal. This larger size 24 ounce package is just the right size. One thing that I really like about this package is that it has a very creative opening an inch or two from the top and it closes with a zip-lock style device. This may seem like a small thing but it is really convenient and helpful, especially for a larger package like this one. That, combined with the quality of the Panko crumbs makes this an exceptional product. Rating: 5.0 Product: Diedrich Coffee Variety Pack of Medium, Full and Dark Roasts K-Cup Portion Pack for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, 22-Count K-Cups (Pack of 2) Review: I have given over 10 Keurig coffee makers as gifts (I do have 6 children after all) and I usually include a couple of variety boxes of coffee with the brewer (a flavored variety and this one). If the recipient of the Keurig doesn't drink this kind of coffee then they use it to serve to guests that do. One thing to point out is that almost all Keurig coffee makers have the ability to make various sizes of cups (the B30 only makes one size). Some give you two choices and some give you up to five. Before you are talked out of buying these K-cups because a few other reviewers claim that this coffee isn't bold enough, I would wonder what size of cup they are making. On my Keurig I can brew a cup as small as 4 oz. and I promise you that it is pretty strong with just about any of the bolder blends. Coffee People Organic, Extra Bold K-Cups for Keurig Brewers (Pack of 50) [Amazon Frustration-Free Packaging] Rating: 4.0 Product: Green Mountain Coffee Nantucket Blend, Medium Roast, 24-Count -0.33 oz- K-Cups for Keurig Brewers (Pack of 2) Review: I prefer deep, dark roasted coffees but many people don't. My mother used standard household blends such as Folger's for many years. When she received her Keuring machine she started to experiment with other brands and blends. She occasionally drinks a flavored coffee but this has become her favorite. I get her a couple of boxes a month and she loves it. I have tried it and here is my take on this blend: The body (or "mouth-feel") is light to medium. The acidity is medium-low so it won't have too much of a bite, especially of you use cream. The flavor is surprisingly complex with some spice (maybe cardamom or anise and a little pepper) as well as a rich coffee finish. This will not replace my favorite dark roasts but I will keep it on hand for those guests who find a "Starbucks-type" of coffee too strong or bitter. If you, like my mother, enjoy a "regular" blend I don't think that it get's better than this. Rating: 5.0 Product: Gringo Bandito Hot Sauce, Green, 5 Ounce (Pack of 4) Review: I love hot sauce and have tried hundreds (yes, really that many) and often have about twenty open bottles in my fridge at one time. There are times that I want a simple puree that contains nothing but peppers. Other times I like a sauce that is mixed with vinegar, like Tabasco and this sauce. The first one that I tried was the red Gringo Bandito sauce. I liked it was not blown away. I would give the heat a 3 out 10. The flavor was rich and well balanced with a nice tomato base and not too much vinegar. Still, I have several sauces in my pantry with a similar heat and taste profile that I prefer. Now, the green Gringo Bandito is another story. I would rate it just a little higher in heat but the flavor really impressed me. It was the grassy, fresh, and herb-like notes that make this a go-to sauce. I use it when as a topper for tacos, burritos, and egg dishes but I think that it would get lost in a stew or a chili. It has earned a permanent spot in my pantry. Rating: 4.0 Product: Timothy's World Coffee, Variety Pack, 22-Count K-Cups for Keurig Brewers (Pack of 2) Review: It's hard for me the believe this myself but so far I have given 8 Keurig coffee makers away (five model B40s, two B60s and two B70s) as gifts and I always give this sampler to go along with the k-cups included with the machine. I feel that it includes a very good selection of coffees and teas. If someone does not like a particular beverage (some people NEVER drink tea for instance) the recipients have found that they can keep them on hand for guests. This does not include all of my favorites but it does have a very good mix. Here are some of the most popular: Hazelnut: I don't know why but most of the women in my family (and many of the men) LOVE this one. Rain Forest Espresso: If a person likes a full bodied coffee then this could be the one for them. Breakfast Blend: A milder, medium blend that a lot of people enjoy. Chinese Green Tea: This is becoming more and more popular in the US and my friends who drink tea like this K-Cup. English Breakfast Tea: A classic. And the not-so-popular ones: Italian Hot Lemon Beverage: I have personally never met someone who liked this one. I am sure that someone does, just no one that I know. Italian Blend: I usually like an Italian coffee but this one is not popular with my friends, family and guests for some reason. There are others in this pack but in my experience these are the ones that the people in my life usually love and the ones that they avoid. prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Watkins All Natural Gourmet Spice Tin, Pure Ground Black Pepper, 6 Ounce Review: I make dry rubs, marinades, and other things for BBQ that call for a lot of black pepper. Sometimes I use 3-4 ounces of it at a time, and it's tiresome grinding my own for that kind of quantity. So I went looking for pre-ground black pepper. I've tried at least a dozen brands, and I would say Watkins is right there at the top of the heap, one of the two or three best I've tried. The flavor is excellent and, while pre-ground pepper is not going to be quite as fresh as grinding it yourself, it seems to have come fresh and stayed fresh. The only thing I don't like about this product is that the tin, which is others quite attractive in a retro kind of way, but thin and flimsy; just the act of picking it up and setting it down on a counter can cause a small dent -- it's that thin! But I'm not docking it a star for that; it's just a container. The product itself -- the black pepper -- is extremely good and well worth the money. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kirkland Signature Fine Ground Black Pepper, 12.3 oz Review: I use a huuuuuuuuuuge amount of black pepper to make spice rubs and at the grill. This is one of the five I've purchased in the quest to find the perfect one. I do believe this one is best in class. The flavor is excellent, but what I really like about it is that it has a skooch less sting than some of the others - a tiny bit less heat/bitterness. Plus, the pricing is more attractive than some of the boutique brands. I unreservedly give this product 5 stars. Rating: 5.0 Product: Olde Thompson 9.75-Ounce Pepper Supreme Whole Peppercorns, Set Of 2 Review: Great pepper with a stronger, "bite-ier" taste than the generic black pepper which came in my grinder. Really happy with the smell and taste of this stuff. I will continue to use this going forward. Rating: 5.0 Product: RetailSource Death Sauce with Chipotle and Skull Key Chain, Original, 5 oz. Review: The flavor is excellent, probably in my Top 10 of hot sauces. Don't be fooled by the "Death Sauce" moniker. It's pretty mild. Even people unaccustomed to hot peppers will find this sauce "medium hot". True chili heads will find it very mild and more of a flavoring sauce than a hot sauce. Overall , it's a superb mild hot sauce with unparalleled flavor and I recommend it highly, unless you're seeking a truly hot hot sauce. Rating: 5.0 Product: The Original Habanero Shaker - 100% Custom Flaked Hot Habanero Chile Peppers Review: When I received this product, I immediately got a take-out pizza so I could pour this stuff all over it. Fantastic! I like hot foods and normal pepper flakes as served, for example, in a pizzaria don't even register as "hot" in my mouth. I long ago switched over to habs and bhuts to get my heat supply. Being very used to and accustomed to the mighty habanero (I've grown them for years, too) I can attest that this product uses very good quality habs. A teaspoon or two in a recipe works wonders, and it works equally well as a condiment. For chiliheads and others just kind of tired of the usual boring, low-heat flakes, this can really perk things up! Highly recommended. Rating: 5.0 Product: Mexican SWP Decaf Organic Coffee, Whole Bean, Swiss Water Processed Decaf Coffee, Fresh Roasted Coffee LLC. (5 lb.) Review: I am big fan of this company's Ethiopian, so I thought I'd give the Mexican a shot. The beans are very oily, literally shining with oil in the bag; I've never seen anything like it. I was wondering whether my burr grinder would get mucked up with all that oil, but it had no problem (though it did take a few more seconds than usual). This coffee has an interesting and very different taste, very chocolaty. Kind of like a cafe mocha. I've never actually had a coffee that had such a pronounced chocolate taste before. It makes for a great iced coffee, because it almost tastes like a dessert drink. Hot, though ... I'm just not sure. I find it "drinkable" but nowhere near as good as the Ethiopian. I appreciate the fair and reasonable pricing from FRC LLC. Their 2-pound bags for $21-$26 just really work for me. I find that kind of price much more acceptable than the $16+ a pound seen elsewhere from so many sellers. I also really like the 2-pound bag format, versus 12 oz and 1 pound bags, which I go through in 4-5 days. These 2 pounders last me a couple of weeks. Rating: 3.0 Product: Peruvian Decaf Organic Fair Trade Coffee - SMBC, Whole Bean, Water Processed Decaf Coffee, Fresh Roasted Coffee LLC. (2 lb.) Review: I was very pleasantly surprised by this coffee! Having given up on caffeine for health reasons, I've been working my way through the Amazon decafs. A generally disappointing experience, though some are OK; the problem is that none of them really hit the sweet spot for me in terms of the right mix of flavor, fullness, roast, aroma, etc. So I've been in search of "The One" for quite a while -- an economical "anchor" coffee I can load up on in 5 lb bags while occasionally supplementing with a lb of more expensive beans -- and I'm thinking this is it. I've already gone through several pounds of FRC's Ethipian, Mexican and Columbian decafs. I like the taste of the Ethiopian but find it a bit too mild. The Columbian is OK but nothing special, there are better, though not at FRC's price point. The Mexican I didn't care for at all. In general I find FRC's decaf's "good, but not great, at a very reasonable price". This one, however, is at least bordering on great. This coffee is bold and right on the cusp between medium and dark roast, not solidly in either camp - which is exactly how I like my coffee - a "strong medium" roast. I would agree with the vendor's take on the cupping notes: almond, sweet cream, hints of chocolate. The beans are very oily, which unfortunately is not usually a sign of quality, but nevertheless, I quite like the flavor, aroma and aftertaste of this coffee. I will for sure be ordering more bags of this one.. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kirkland Signature California granulated garlic, 18 oz Review: This is very good garlic. I make a lot of spice rubs and wasn't happy with the mediocre off-the-rack garlic in the grocery store, so I wanted to find something better. This is really good domestically grown garlic, and the price is good for such a large quantity. Recommended. Rating: 5.0 Product: Melinda's Naga Jolokia Hot Sauce, 5 Oz Review: Surprisingly good. I usually only buy habanero hot sauces, but lately the heat level has just not been enough for me in the standard habanero offerings. We all know that Naga is hotter than habanero, so I decided to give it a shot, not knowing quite what to expect. I didn't find the heat level all that much higher than a typical habanero sauce like Marie Sharp's Belizean Heat, but the flavor was definitely different. More of a ground (black) pepper kind of taste, with a bit of a sting. I quite liked it and I plan to keep using this sauce. Very versatile - it can be used on pretty much anything you'd put hot sauce on. Rating: 5.0 Product: Altoids Smalls Peppermint Sugarfree Mints Single Pack, 0.37 ounce Review: I really love Altoid Smalls. I became a heavy Altoid user after I quit smoking a few years ago. They (and Starbrights) were the only things that could stave off my desire to smoke, with their super-strong peppermint taste. But, of course, regular Altoids are basically pure sugar, and are therefore very bad for the teeth. And regular Altoids do have calories, too: 3.33 calories each, which adds up if you're chewing through whole tins of them. So I decided to give the Smalls a try. Been hooked ever since. They've replaced EVERY other mint, hard candy and other similar product; in fact, I threw all the others out once I tried these, and haven't gone back. They aren't pleasantly chalky like regular Altoids, by the way; they have a smooth texture, which is not as good but has its own charm once you adjust to the change. The details: - the Smalls have a strong taste. Those who like the burning sensation of strong peppermint will really like these (conversely, those looking for more of a Tic-Tac level strength will be overwhelmed). Personally, I like the taste a lot. - they have no sugar, so you can enjoy them and still have teeth in five or ten years - they actually last a pretty long time. I've gotten as far as 25 minutes on one mint, though 9-10 minutes is more typical. - they are a half-calorie each. An entire tin of 50 of them is only 25 calories. Even if you consume three tins of them in a day (which I have done) you're still only looking at 75 calories. - they do contain Sorbitol, an ingredient in many diet candies and treats which gives some people ... how's a nice way to put this .... gassiness and a need to go to the bathroom frequently. I seem to have no or very little reaction to Sorbitol. But I think it's just luck of the draw; my wife reacts badly to it. However, an entire tin of these only contains 25 calories worth of candy with Sorbitol in it, roughly equivalent to, say, two or three sugar-free Starbrights. So, even those with some Sorbitol intolerance might not be too bothered by these, if consumed in reasonable quantities. The summary: For the orally-fixated amongst us, who must have something in their mouths at all times, Altoid Smalls are practically a god-send: a sugar-free, virtually no calorie, strong-tasting mint that tastes pretty good and come in a convenient 50-pack. As long as you are tolerant of Sorbitol, I think you'll be pretty satisfied with these. They are not as good as regular Altoids, but have no sugar and practically no calories. They are a nice alternative. The only thing with the Smalls is learning to conserve them. There is a tendency to pop 3 or 4 of them in the mouth, chew through them, and then pop another 3 or 4. Getting it down to 1 mint and learning to savor it for a while can knock the daily consumption down from 3-4 tins to 1. Rating: 5.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['hot', 'sauce', 'like', 'heat', 'coffee', 'really', 'taste', 'good', 'price', 'one'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Just be aware that if you have an acid stomach, tend to run hot, have heartburn or yellow-green phlegm that Traditional Medicinals Organic Peppermint, 16-Count (Pack of 6) tea may be a better bet. The spicy kick from the ginger is a nice touch, but it's not too overwhelming. Overall, the flavor is pleasant, but it's not particularly complex or

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Yacon Syrup PREMIUM 100% Pure Raw All Natural Low Cal Sweetener (NON-GMO), 50% FOS Metabolism Booster | All Natural, NO Preservatives or Additives, 8 oz Review: I love trying out new foods, but I am always HIGHLY skeptical of any health claims made. There have been so many food fadsso many superfoods and garlic cures and the likethat I refuse to take any claims on face value. Those claims come straight from the Marketing Department. As a sweetener, this Yacon Syrup is just like molasses. Its almost identical in consistency, and very similar in flavor. There are slight differencesits a lighter, more subtle flavor than straight molasses. But that should give you a clue as to whether you will enjoy this or not. If you like molasses, youll like yacon syrup. I enjoyed it, and it was fun to try. As a health supplementwell, I suppose it is up to you whether you will buy what the marketing department is selling or not. The fact that you cant use this for cooking severely limits its usefulness. According to the manufacturer, you cant even put a spoonful into your coffee or tea without burning off its benefits. It is strictly served cold. Full disclosure: I received a sample for review. Rating: 3.0 Product: DeChunXian Yunnan Premium Pu-erh Puer Pu erh Dark Black Tea, Natural Organic Tea Leaves,produced From High Mountain Ancient Tree (Ripe Tea Brick) Review: My confession: I have always wanted to try authentic Pu-erh tea cakes, but I was intimidated by them. I had no idea what to buy, how to prepare them, what they would taste like thanks to Dechunxian Yunnan Premium 250g Pu-erh I have finally gotten to try them, and I realize how foolish I was for waiting so long. This is really good tea. In fact, it is so good that my wife simply refers to it as the good tea when requesting a cup. Its delicious. Like almost all traditional Asian foods, it makes numerous, spurious health claims. None of which I actually believe. This probably isn't going to slim you down or cure what ails you, but it will result in an absolutely wonderful cup of tea. The process of preparation does take some studying. Fortunately, there are numerous videos on the internet that will walk you through the process. It is nothing worse than Turkish coffee, which I also love and took some time to learn the proper preparation. To do it right you will need a few accompanying items, although you will probably be able to improvise. I don't have every recommended cup and tea pot, but it comes out just fine. I love how many cups of tea you can get from a single brewing. Normally the tea gets weaker and weaker, but this sustains its flavor. Ive tried both the ripe and raw varieties, and there is a noticeable difference. I liked the stronger, ripe version better myself. It really depends on how strong you like your tea. Rating: 5.0 Product: Stash Tea, Organic Premium Green Tea, 18 Count Box of Tea Bags Individually Wrapped in Foil (Pack of 6), Medium Caffiene Tea, Japanese Style Green Tea, Hot or Iced Review: Like many regular tea drinkers I prefer the loose-leaf variety when I am at home, but the afternoon cuppa at work calls for something a little less complicated. I am OK with sacrificing flavor for convenience, while saving some pennies at the same time. So far, I have been pleasantly surprised by Stash's brands of Certified Organic green teas. I have drank both this straight green tea and the Stash Premium Organic Earl Grey Black and Green Tea combination. The teas come from the Yamamotoyama Brazilian tea gardens, which were initially planted with Japanese seedlings. The processing methods and standards are all based on Japanese system. The flavor of this Premium Green Tea is really nice, with a subtle grassy flavor that I enjoy in decent green teas. I find that too many American-produced green teas are "watered down" in flavor, lacking the oomph that one finds in a true Japanese or Chinese green tea. This cup, however, is close to the real thing. It also gives off a nice green color, which is always a good sign. By no means the best tea you will ever drink, but this Premium Green Tea might just possibly the best inexpensive tea-bag style green tea on the market. Rating: 5.0 Product: Twinings of London Pure Camomile Herbal Tea Bags, 20 Count Review: Twining's can usually be counted on to put out a decent tea. They aren't really top grade, but nor are they bottom shelf and make for a fine daily bag tea. However, I found their Green Tea to be a bit bland. Indeed, it is the "light flavour strength", as it says on the box, but I wasn't prepared for just how light the flavor would be. Supposedly, the tea used here is sencha, but I have had many, many cups of sencha and it generally has a bolder, grassier flavor. Because the flavor is so light to begin with, you can't really pull more than one cup out of a bag either. The next cup is just pretty much colored water, which is disappointing. A nice strong tea usually yields a few cups, and that saves you some money in the long term. People who don't really enjoy the strong, grassy flavor of green tea might find this a nice balance. It is easy to make, easy to drink and will probably suit many people. I was looking for a decent bagged Green Tea to keep at work, but I think I will keep hunting as the flavor was too light for me. Rating: 3.0 Product: Good Earth Green Tea, Jasmine, 20-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6) Review: I got excited when I saw this in the tea collection at work. Jasmine Green Tea? I love Jasmine Green Tea! So I had a cup ... and it was awful. I thought maybe I somehow had a bad cup, so I tried a different tea bag ... yuck. It's hard to describe just how bad this tastes. Imagine a cup of green tea that someone poured some jasmine-scented perfume into. Or maybe dissolved some jasmine-flavored candy into. I saw someone say it was Pez flavored, and I can agree with that. But no matter how you describe it, it is undrinkable. Second cup was poured down the sink. And it isn't just the initial taste. Somehow this coats your tongue and the badness sticks with you. I suspect this box is going to be sitting around the office for a long, long time. Rating: 1.0 Product: ONE ORGANIC Matcha Green Tea Powder (250g) - USDA Certified Organic Review: We use this matcha green tea powder for pretty much everything other than making tea. My wife is Japanese, and likes making various matcha sweets--matcha cookies, matcha ice cream, matcha cheese cake, matcha muffins--pretty much every thing you can imagine. And while I am not Japanese, I love eating all the matcha creations she makes. We go through a fair share of matcha, and were eager to try this "One Organic Matcha green tea powder." This is culinary grade matcha, which is perfect for her purposes. It isn't that bright, vivid green of tea grade matcha, but doesn't cost as much either. And it comes in a nice big bag--we were both pleasantly surprised by the quantity. She has baked up a few treats using this matcha, and is happy with the results. It gives a nice, strong matcha flavor. You don't need to add a lot to get the matcha taste, so I have a feeling this bag is going to go a long way. Rating: 5.0 Product: Choice Organic Teas Green Tea, Genmaicha, 16 Count, Pack of 6 Review: I became a regular green tea drinker during the years I lived in Japan, and although I prefer loose-leaf tea I wanted some tea bags that I could drink at work. Genmai tea is one of my favorites, and I tried this "Choice Organic Genmai" thinking it might be an affordable, convenient way to brew up some of that delicious roasted rice flavor. Like many, I found these tea bags to be drinkable but weak. I wasn't expecting it to be as good as the loose-leaf tea I buy, but I also wasn't expecting it to be so watery. You can get a decent cup of tea out of it if you make a small cup, but I really wish it was more robust. I will keep drinking my way through the box I bought, but I don't think I will go back for seconds. There are probably better tea bag Genmais out there. Rating: 3.0 Product: Stash Tea Organic Earl Grey Green and Black Tea 100 Count Tea Bags in Foil (Packaging May Vary) Individual Tea Bags for Use in Teapots Mugs or Cups, Black Tea and Green Tea, Brew Hot or Iced Review: My two teas of choice are green tea and earl grey. Green tea goes great with meals, and early grey makes a nice morning or evening relaxing drink. When I saw a package combing them both, I had to give it a try. And it is good. The mixing of green and black teas has a unique flavor, and the oil of the rind of a bergamot orange gives it that distinct "earl grey" taste. Overall, it tastes much more like the classic earl grey black tea, with those notes overpowering the green tea, but it does have a lighter flavor than pure earl grey. I don't know if this will be come a regular drink for me, but it was a pleasant surprise and one that I will pull out every now and then. It would be a fantastic beverage for those seeking the health benefits of green tea but aren't particularly taken with the flavor. It is also an organic tea, which is an added bonus in flavor, health and overall quality of product. Rating: 5.0 Product: Morning Pep Goji Berries Raw Sundried, FFP, 32 Ounce Review: So right off the bat--forget all the "health claims" you might hear about Goji Berries. There is no such thing as a miracle food, and while they might supply some solid vitamins and fiber eating these berries is most likely going to do nothing spectacular for your health. With that out the way, we can get to the important part: How do they taste? Pretty good! Even though I lived in Asia for many years, I had never tried goji berries before (also know by the much cooler name of wolfberries). However they have a familiar taste of sour/sweet that I associate with Asian cooking. These are dried, and are essentially snack food, although you can use them for a variety of versatile cooking. I've actually found they go good roasted with chicken. But for the most part I mix them up with some cocoa nibs and nuts and other tasty treats to make a crunch mid-day snack at work. Apparently you can boil them for tea, but I haven't tried that yet. I've tried a few Morning Pep products now, and they never fail to delight. Just seeing their name on the package makes me want to give it a try, and I am glad I had the chance to sample these goji berries. Sample provided for review. Rating: 5.0 Product: Island Fresh Superior Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, 54 Ounce Review: I love cooking with coconut oil. It melts nice, adds a distinct flavor and aroma to cooking, and just works in ways that butter and other oils can't. I don't cook everything with it, but for some things like pancakes and eggs and even softening vegetables for soup it just works great. I have quickly gone through every jar I've ever bought. This Island Fresh is a huge tub that promises to last me awhile. I'm a bit suspicious of the "extra virgin" label, as that seems just pure marketing. This isn't olive oil--no need to borrow the language! But silly marketing aside, this is high quality product that I am happy to cook with. And you will be too. Sample provided for review. Rating: 5.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['tea', 'like', 'flavor', 'taste', 'green', 'really', 'sauce', 'cooking', 'nice', 'good'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Grove Square Cappuccino, Hazelnut, 24 Single Serve Cups Review: I was mislead in thinking it was a coffee based beverage, but it isn't. I added instant coffee to enhance the flavor & it was better. By itself this product was more like an instant hot chocolate, not fullfilling to whay I'd hoped for. Maybe I just misread their add or expected too much from it. Rating: 3.0 Using the features, generate the proper review. golds.output: These taste pretty good and have a good mix of flavors. The spicy ones are pretty hot, but that's what I like about them. Overall, a tasty and good variety pack of snacks.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Newman's Own Organic Black Tea - 100 Bags,7.1 OZ. Review: This tea is simply great, I also love the taste. It tastes so much better compared to the non-organic stuff, I honestly cannot even drink the other stuff anymore. This has a much more real tea taste as it should. 100 tea bags will go a long way for just one person. You should however be advised that this seems to have a lot of caffeine in it, unless you do a short brew. One cup is enough to get my heart going a little, so I only make small batches at a time. If you're looking for a nice iced tea recipe then I have one I made just for you :) I spent a little over an hour perfecting this tea recipe to get an amazing iced tea each time. A lot of taste testing when into this tea to get it just right. The taste is not overpowering, but just enough where you can enjoy it as if you bought the perfect tea from the store. Makes one gallon. Do not drink this tea until it's completely cold or else when you add ice it will be all watered down and taste bad. The sugar may need to be adjusted to your liking. In this tea you can just taste it. Feel free to add an extra half cup if you like it really sweet, but I find it's overpowering for a tea. What you will need: Royal Tea Black Organic - Of course :) Organic Meyer Lemon - Not as sour as regular lemons, has a more tropical taste too. These might be hard to find. Do not use pure lemon juice! You can check doortodoororganics.com if they deliver to your area. Organic Sugar - Regular sugar may be used if preferred. You could also use raw organic honey, about 8 tablespoons. If you use honey make sure it's from Y.S. Eco Bee Farms. Honey must be added while the water is hot. First Step: Bring 1 gallon of filtered water to a medium boil, then remove from heat. Tap water can be used, but let sit uncovered for 24 hours before using because chlorine is added to town/city water. Boil the water for 10 minutes at a rolling boil after 24 hours to sterilize if you let sit out. Second Step: With the water removed from the heat add 6 tea bags and let steep for 1 full hour. If you wish to have a more stronger brew use 8 tea bags. Make 3 semi-thin slices of lemon, remove seeds then squeeze into tea. After squeezing drop the slices into the tea and let the slices steep for half hour, then remove. You don't need to worry about removing all the lemon juice as it will be steeping. I find a quick squeeze works fine. It is important you remove the slices after half hour to prevent an overpowering lemon taste. Some pulp will be left behind, and that is OK. Third Step: After 1 whole hour remove the tea bags. Add 1 1/2 cups of sugar and stir. Let cool, then add to pitcher. Place into fridge. Serve over ice when completely cool. If you've made this right you will have tea tasting as if it were made by a pro! :) Rating: 5.0 Product: Twinings of London Pure Camomile Herbal Tea Bags, 20 Count Review: Thank you, Critic-At-Large. You've saved me a bunch of money by switching to Twinings. I was also a on the go tea drinker, as much as three times a day everyday. It was not until I seen the top review that I decided to add up the cost of the tea I was buying from Dunkin Donuts. After going through hundreds of my purchases on my bank account (excluding cash purchases) it worked out to $1,532.16 in tea alone. Now if I included cash that amount would be even higher. Crazy. Here is a twist, Dunkin Donuts actually happens to use Orange Pekoe tea so it's very easy to recreate it. One tea bag for every 12oz of water and let steep for half an hour. Tasted the same if not better. Twinings has forever won me as a customer. 10/10 would buy this amazing tea again. Rating: 5.0 Product: Orville Redenbacher's Ultimate Butter Popcorn, 3.29 Ounce Classic Bag, 6-Count, Pack of 6 Review: Good popcorn that pops very well. Could use more butter to distribute throughout the bag, most of the flavor is at the bottom. Not salty like others say, I find it's perfect. The bag says not to use popcorn button, but I did anyway on the 3oz setting and it came out perfect. Cheaper to buy from the store. Rating: 4.0 Product: Lindt LINDOR White Chocolate Truffles, Kosher, 60 Count Box, 25.4 Ounce Review: Lindt is a great chocolate maker, and the white chocolate was amazing. It's smooth, has a soft white chocolate center with a white chocolate shell on the outside. Has exquisite flavour.. you simply cannot go wrong with Lindt. The serving size is 3 balls (230 cals, 14g carbs (all sugar), but you will desire more. I was worried about the melting that other shoppers have pointed out. It didn't seem to be a problem with Prime shipping. Perhaps others used the slower shipping and it melted in transit? Either way, chocolate is something you don't want sitting in shipment for a long time. Use Prime's 2 day, or even next day it if you want. If you don't have Prime you could always activate the 30 day trial for the free 2-day. Rating: 5.0 Product: HERSHEY'S Cookies 'n' Creme Candy Bar, King Size (Pack of 18) Review: Really great candy to stock your pantry with. Even tastes better cold! Has a lot of flavor, really fresh, great candy to treat yourself to. Each bar is 370 calories, so careful if your watching them. You will find yourself wanting to reach for another. I ordered this on a Friday, but it seems Amazon does not ship perishables over the weekend. It shipped Monday with UPS Air, and arrived the next day all nice and cold in the cooler amazon packed it in. However, I can see the ice packs not lasting longer than 2 days, they were halfway melted by the time it got here (PA to NJ). If you get a delay you can be sure to have melted candy in your hands. Rating: 5.0 Product: HERSHEY'S Cookies 'n' Creme Candy Bar, King Size (Pack of 18) Review: Amazing 'beautiful' chocolates. If you've never had these then you're missing out on the best candy in the world! Also try the king size bars, you pay about $3-$4 more and it's shipped from Amazon rather than an amazon user. These taste even better when they are cold, try it! ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- Update 11/01/2012 - I decided to order these again when it got colder out. The candy box itself looked like it been raided through. The box itself was opened and the clear packaging wrap was opened. I don't think I will be ordering these from Amazon's warehouse again. Stick to sellers because the employees at the Warehouse might of been looking for a quick snack. Rating: 4.0 Product: Kellogg's Pop-Tarts - Pumpkin Pie (Limited Edition) - 12 Toaster Pastries, 21.1-oz. Review: First of all I would like to start by saying these things don't really even taste like a pumpkin pie. And I thought you would be getting more for $12, you can get them at least $9 cheaper from the store for one box. Also, I'm not allergic to pumpkin but these pop-tarts gave me an allergic reaction to them. I'm not sure what they put in it but I will most certainly not be buying these anymore. For those of you that want a pumpkin pie treat I would suggest looking elsewhere unless you *really* want these. Rating: 1.0 Product: REESE'S Peanut Butter Cups, Chocolate Candy, King Size (Pack of 24) Review: Reese's arrived melted even with chilled shipping. I'm in South NJ, and Amazon had it sent next day. So it was not out for more than 24 hours. But when I opened it I thought it just came off a stove! I reached my hand in and it felt 80 degrees inside of it. The ice pack was completely melted, in-fact it was actually giving off heat because it was so hot. They only used a single ice pack, which was a bad call. Wait until winter to order these. You get a nice head start if you need these melted down however! I contacted Amazon and I was given a full refund. Rating: 1.0 Product: Ghirardelli Chocolate Premium Hot Cocoa Mix, Double Chocolate, 16-Ounce Tins (Pack of 4) Review: This hot chocolate is the best I've ever had. I'm glad I got the pack of four because the first can of it was gone in just two days! Rating: 5.0 Product: Ghirardelli Double Chocolate Brownie Mix, 18-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) Review: The first time I had Ghirardelli chocolate was last year, when I bought the Ghirardelli Chocolate Premium Hot Cocoa Mix, Double Chocolate, 16-Ounce Tins (Pack of 4). I loved it it. But for the price I only So I decided to buy that again, along with this. I had an idea when I bought these that these would be amazing, and they were. I pretty much ate half of one box to myself, I could not stop myself from eating it. If you're looking for something to feed that chocolate craving than these brownies will surely do it. Rating: 5.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['water', 'taste', 'tea', 'get', 'like', 'would', 'good', 'chocolate', 'also', 'really'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Healthy Choice Lunch Express, Italian Style Penne 6.95-Ounce Bowls (Pack of 6) Review: Some engineer somewhere had fun with this one! Here's how you can be eating your meal inside 5 mins - at least how it worked for me: 1) Pull the plastic film off of the top of the container 2) Peel away the plastic wrapping that holds the strainer lid in place 3) Remove the inner plastic bowl that contains the meat sauce, and set the meat sauce aside for the moment 4) Add just enough water to the uncooked pasta so that the water level reaches the fill line (the fill line is a little tough to see at first) 5) Shake the pasta so that it's all submerged in the water 6) Replace the strainer top and then cook the pasta in a microwave on high for 3 mins 30 secs 7) While the pasta is cooking, open a corner of the meat sauce 8) When the pasta is done, remove it from the microwave and let it sit while you warm up the meat sauce for 30 secs on high. 9) While the meat sauce is warming up, drain any remaining water from the pasta and remove the strainer lid. 10) As soon as the sauce is done open the meat sauce covering the rest of the way, pour it over the pasta, stir, and eat! Wow! That was pretty convenient, and it actually worked as advertised! It wasn't even too hot to carry! OK, what about the food? To start with I'm just a regular guy who usually makes my lunches of the previous night's family dinner left-overs...i.e., not a gourmet, but not taste-dead either... I was pleased to find that the pasta cooked well, but be advised that if you don't shake the pasta down before you cook it you might find a piece here and there that still has hard spots in it. There was plenty of sauce...no skimping on sauce volume, and the portion size was great for lunchtime. I wasn't stuffed when I was done, but I wasn't still hungry either. The meat sauce was tangy and mildly spicy. The meat sauce contained small chunks of beef (i.e., looked like hamburger), and you could tell what it was if you looked closely. The pasta and sauce consistency was good, and I enjoyed the entire meal. Be advised that the sauce contains onion and garlic. If you know you have an important meeting or date later on, you will probably want to pack some mints. Say, that would be a great addition...an after-meal mint included with each meal that you can use to fight post-meal garlic breath. If you like the combination of convenience and pasta, this may well an excellent choice for you. If you are also environmentally conscious, though, you should probably think twice about this unit. Once you are done with your meal there's really not much you can do with the packaging...just recycle it. If, however, the packaging included a solid lid rather than just the strainer lid, the main container could be washed and then reused as a food storage container...alas, that is not the case. Anyway, I thought the food was flavorful, the portion was adequate, and the convenience excellent. Environmental challenges drop the rating by a star though. Lastly, you'll have to determine whether the per unit cost makes this a good deal for you. 4 stars Rating: 4.0 Using the features, generate the proper review. Product:
Spicy Tom Yum Paste / Instant Sour Paste
Review:
I am rewriting my review because I believe some people who do not like MSG marked it unhelpful.

Look I am not trying to tell anyone else how to eat, only that MSG is a staple ingredient in a lot of asian cooking, particularly thai and it is one of the ingredients that create an authentic taste.  I am not denying that some people are sensitive to MSG, although it is much lower than initially thought during the 90's msg scare (much).  Most people are as tolerant to it as they are table salt, so like table salt, use it in moderation (unless you get headaches from it, a sign that you are intolerant and should avoid it).  I'm not an MSG lover or hater, I'm just noting that I am aware of the MSG in this product and for my own personal use, I am okay with it.

So please... let me just say that I like this product.  For a jarred instant soup type product, it really nails the flavor of tom yum.  I think it's great and a good price.  So if MSG is not for you, don't freak out and hate the product, or my review, just move on to something that fits your lifestyle.  If you think you'd be okay with that and want to try the product then go ahead and try it.  If you have any questions let me know how I can make this review more helpful and I'll give it a shot!  Thanks!

5.0

Product:
SodaStream Diet Ginger Ale Syrup, 500mL
Review:
After years of dealing with increasing price of soda, finding place to store it and returning  empty bottles decided to give this a try. We bought ours at Costco which came with 1-130L Co2 Carbonator, 2 1-Liter Stainless Steel Bottles and trial flavors pack for $99. First let me say I'm very pleased, the flavors are not bad at all and i can use my own filtered water from either the fridge or Pure faucet attachment and no longer need to pay or bring back bottles for the deposit. They also have much less sodium than store bought soda with the exception of Diet Rite.

 I have tried many diet flavors and the ones i like the best are Orange, Caffeine free cola, dr pete, Fountain Mist, Cream Soda and Root Beer. As for the cost it has changed everything, no longer have to pay deposit, return empties or search for sale price on soda which means lot less trips to the store saving me from impulse buying and gasoline usage. I can now make fresh bottles of soda whenever I need it (unlike store bought soda which can lose carbonation)  and any flavor I feel like at the time. Already used up  1- 130L Co2  carbonator bottle so ordered 1 full bottle + 1 exchange for empty bottle from SodaStream web site this way I'll always have one full bottle when one is done. You should always search the web for coupons for any online store before ordering and SodaStream is no exception, saved $15 which is the price of the license on a new bottle.  So it cost me the same as if ordering to exchange 130L Co2 Carbonators, pretty sweet. If you order 10 bottles of syrup at a time you get one free  and with on line coupons and cashing in points your earn from them with every purchase can save you more than just the shipping cost, the cost of a trip to the store. For me the SodaStream is well worth the cost.

UPDATE: Dr Pete is gross just like cherry cola. Here is a secert for all thoes who like cherry cola but hate Dr Pete like I do. Buy a bottle of DaVinci cherry syrup and add 1 oz. to a 1 liter bottle of Sodastream cola, you got cherry cola. Great part you can get diet cherry syrup to use with diet cola syrup, works the same.

Product:
Healthworks Coconut Oil Organic Extra Virgin Cold-Pressed, 16oz
Review:
This review is for USDA Organic Coconut Oil 16 oz by Healthworks 100% Extra Virgin and Cold Pressed for Cooking, Health and Beauty

We use a lot of coconut oil in this house and have tried a lot of brands. I can't say this Healthworks outshines other good brands out there but I have no complaints. I have always been happy with Healthworks products and this coconut oil is very nice. It has a beautiful coconut fragrance and taste, very white, comes with a seal on the jar and the jar is sturdy. I eat it right out of the jar and it tastes great. That is always my test for coconut oil. How it tastes and melts in the mouth.. your testing may vary. lol

I noticed a one star review with a different labeled product jar and name, complaining about the lack of USDA label, (mine does have the usda label) no expiration date and a "watery" texture. I am not sure if people know coconut oil melts at 76 degrees F. You put coconut oil in a warm box truck and you are going to get melted coconut oil when delivered.  This product also arrived "watery" yet reset in a colder temp. I have uploaded photos to show you.

As for an expiration date, I have had many oils without expiration dates. But... expiration dates do not mean the expiration safety of a product. The labels are arbitrary and do not have much meaning. Your coconut oil storage, usage and weather will affect your expiration date. No company can control how you safely use and store products. That being said.. everyone should teach themselves the signs of a rancid oil. A rancid oil has a very distinct pungent aroma that is not hard to notice. Coconut oil in general is very slow to turn rancid. Outside conditions are the main factors in coconut oil going bad.

Signs of Rancid Coconut Oil:

1. Yellow in color when melted (Possible but not always accurate since filtering can produce a slightly yellow coconut product)
2. Blotchy, in color and texture when not melted
3. It will taste off, or bad and smell weird and different than what a fresh jar smells like
4. Signs of spots growing which could be mold.. the main reason for this happening is due to owner usage. Dirty spoons, double dipping, getting water or other food bits, saliva in the coconut oil, dirty conditions, improper storage. We store ours in the fridge.

Good coconut oil will be clear when melted and white when solidified. The in between stages will produce cloudy coconut oil.

My jar does have the meaningless usda seal.. and I say this because if you are paying attention to the past 50 years of any political entity, they are the ones failing the masses and their labels mean nothing. I have uploaded a photo showing the front of the 32 ounce container I received.

DISCLAIMER

I upload photos and or videos on the vast majority of all my reviews. If they are not showing up, I apologize. Amazon has been arbitrarily removing and replacing both at will for weeks now.

Product:

Review:
I've tried all of the LavAzza blends, and for how I like my coffee brewed which is percolated, this blend works the best, and for me tastes the best.
It is a very fine grind, not quite as fine as an espresso blend, but pretty damn close, in fact, the difference between this and an espresso grind is like splitting hairs.

4.0
Product:
2LB Pablo's Pride Gourmet Coffee - Guatemala - Medium-Dark Roast Whole Bean Coffee - 2 Pound (2 lb) Bag
Review:
I am most definitely a coffee snob. I've tried just about every coffee you could name, including coffees which I paid somewhere around a hundred dollars a pound; I can't remember exactly how much, but it was very close to that figure.
In order for me to get what I would call a great cup of coffee, I started roasting my own beans, in fact, I still have several pounds of green beans I purchased mostly at Sweet M.'s.
I hand grind my beans using a conical burr grinder (zaussenhaus), which I find superior to any other way of grinding, (a close second, is mortar, and pestle grinding).
I've tried every way possible, and I do mean that literally...every...way....you could name for coffee brewing, the best two methods for making a great cup of coffee are percolated, and vacuum.  I threw my French Press in the trash where it belongs, that method was the absolute worse way to brew coffee IMO, I didn't even want to give it to anyone, I tried that method for several Months just to be certain there could be no user error...but into the trash it went!
My Keurig, I did give that away as that was not as bad as the French Press, but still not for me.  I've brewed Greek, and Turkish using the Ibirk..etc. Automatic drip brewing is IMO for lazy people who are not that into having a great cup of coffee.  Again, without a doubt, (howbeit not well accepted by the parrots/sheep of the world)...is perked, and vacuum brewing methods.  One more brewing method that is not that bad, is pour over, but that would be my last resort brewing method.

Now that I've somewhat set the stage, let me get to this coffee.  It is going to be hard pressed to find a better coffee than this. I will reserve this being the best until I try all of Pablo's Pride coffee's, (sans decaf).
This is a wonderful coffee, I don't think I could roast a better bean, so it looks as though my green beans will be relegated to becoming green bean extract, which is in, and of itself not a true relegation, but only as far as brewing coffee is concerned.
Rating:
5.0

Product:
igourmet Parmigiano Reggiano 24 Month Top Grade - Pound Cut (15.5 ounce)
Review:
First of all let me state that the seller, (Mondo), was great to deal with. However, since this is a product review, let me review the cheese.
I'm a 68 year old Italian that was raised in an Italian neighborhood. I went to Italian Deli's all my life, I must have eaten literally hundreds, nay, thousands of pounds of Parmigiano Reggiano in my life.
This is some of the worst P.R. I've ever had.....NO...this IS the worst I've ever had!!

There are practically none of the little white crystals I seek in a good P.R., I can actually COUNT the number of little crystals I see. (I actually counted 7 crystals in two pounds of cheese)!!

I like the seller, not the cheese.  This has to be IMO, the lowest grade of P.R., and in fact, if it was not for seeing the stamp on the rind, (its not the stamp I like to see, but it is stamped), I would even question its authenticity.
This is not a good table cheese,(as far as P.R. goes),it is only (at BEST) barely good enough to be grated on macaroni.

Now, I have to try and find some good Parmigiano Reggiano, as the store near me where I now live has closed.

Sorry, but I have to tell it like it is.

Product:

They were great just out of the can cold, but better heated up (a minute or two in the microwave, ten or so in the oven).  They were tasty on their own or on bagels.  Apparently they are considered a breakfast food over there so that's when we had them.

One can will serve three people but once you've tasted them you won't want to share.

Product:
Simple Mills Almond Flour Mix, Chocolate Chip Cookie, Naturally Gluten Free, 9.4 oz
Review:
My college daughter is Gluten Free everything, so when these came available i decided that i needed to get them and give them a try.  I will have to admit that the waffles I ate this morning were very good.  I followed the instructions on the back of the box but I was only able to make 4 -- 7 waffles.  My waffle maker does make large waffles so that really does not have anything to do with the mix.  I was a little worried when I had mixed everything up as instructed and the mix was a little runny.  But the waffles turned out GREAT.  The waffles had a very good taste and looked good on my plate.  I will definitely let my daughter now about the Simple Mills brand.  Knowing her, she is probably already using your products.  I did like the suggestions on the back of the box regarding adding pecans or fresh berries.  Always forget about those until its to late.  I had pecans in the house so i chopped a bunch of those up and added them to the batter.  Great suggestion.  This is a very good product.
UPDATE...Yes my daughter already uses the Simple Mills pancake mix.  She eats everything gluten free due to help her gluten intolerance.
She has them at least once a week.  She told me that several times she will make her breakfast pancakes for dinner at night.  She has never had a problem with this product.  She says it is really good stuff.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Clamato Tomato Cocktail, 64  Fl. Oz
Review:
I have two  46 ounce bottles of V-8 Spicy Hot Juice in the frig right now so there will be some comparisons made between the Clamato and V-8 juices. I received one bottle of the Clamato under the Vine program. The Clamato is made up of 38% juice while the V-8 is 100%. Both are a cocktail. The Clamato has 60 calories per 8 ounces while the V-8 has 50 calories per 8 ounces. The V-8 has 650 mg sodium while Clamato has 790 mg sodium.
The taste of the juices are definitely among cocktail lines with the Clamato having a more thin liquid and watered down taste while the V-8  juice is thicker and heavier to the taste. If left in the frig for a few days both will need to be shaken before using as there seems to be a clear liquid that will appear on top of the liquid.
The taste for each is acceptable as a cocktail mixer and both have about the same kick when it comes to hotness. The Clamato contains MSG while I do not locate tat on the bottle of the V-8. I personally think either would be fine as a cocktail mixer and would result in about the same taste thus this becomes a personal preference for the buyer, however due to the thickness of the V-8 the Clamato might be more preferable when mixing with beer.  I will lean more to the V-8 juice since it is 100% juice, more favorable and thicker. I often drink it as a drink and not as a mixer.
Rating:
3.0

Review:
I used to travel to New Orleans just about every week and was always offered coffee with chickory. I got used to it after a few years and got to where regular coffee seemed weak. Then I quit traveling to New Orleans and started drinking coffee without chickory. I was just fine, until  few weeks ago we went to New Orleans and I stopped at the cafe Du Monde for coffee. Got back on the chickory "kick" once again and brought home a can of their chickory flavored coffee. We personally like he taste and my wife thinks it is too strong. It is very good coffee and if one is looking for an instant dramatic change to what they have been drinking they should sip on a few cups of this coffee. You will certainly noticed instantly the change and you might even prefer it over the regular coffee.

The best I can say is that is OK.  Sorry.  There was a hint of the Jasmine, which I did not mind.  But I could not taste nor smell the orange.  I love orange and was hoping for a bigger taste or smell of Orange, since it is listed as the first item after green tea.  This is a very light ice tea.  Lipton touts on the side of the box about how their tea is Rainforest Alliance Certified.  I guess I was not impressed.  So many companies taut this kind of stuff and all they do is make a donation for certification.  I don't know what is required for this certification so when I do see these things, it does nothing for me.  This is a LIPTON product, which I do drink a lot of their teas. If you are in that stage where you are transitioning your child from formula to milk and your child eats their fruits and veggies I highly recommend this as it is much easier on my children's stomachs than regular milk is and it has more nutritional value. However, if you have a very picky eater I suggest something with a higher nutritional value than this product, such as pediasure or pediasmart. While those products are more expensive I believe they offer better nutrition per serving. If, however, your child will eat a variety of foods and you just want something more nutritious than just plain milk, this is a great value at a great price.

Review:
I'm not an Asian food expert but it doesn't appear Betty Crocker is either.  My goodness, I bought a whole case of these seeing as I love Lo Mein.  Well, search further if you are looking for the real thing.  Here it appears like broken spaghetti, and the flavor packet obviously has a lot of bouillon in it, so you get broken spaghetti with salty chicken imitation flavoring.  How healthy, but then if you don't know what good Lo Mein is, and if you like spaghetti, you may be happy with it.  It isn't awful tasting but not that good tasting and definitely not the same texture as Lo Mein.  The box makes the noodles look bigger and they are actually somewhere between angel hair and regular spaghetti size.  It's just not what it says, and it is not good for you.  And, a lot of Asian food is rice noodles or something much more healthy.  Once this is cooked up it does finally make more than what it initially looks like (very little), but really not all that much.  Betty needs to remember that Asian meals are served with big helpings and this was probably a little less than the size of one real Asian dinner helping.  I was disappointed all around on this product.  Here's something odd, the picture of the product that goes with this review is in a totally different box than what I got.  The boxes I got are red and don't disclose it's Betty Crocker except a small spoon on one side.  It's almost an attempt to leave the name off.  Not the norm for this on, company. Product:

Review:

I love the stronger blend, robust flavor and satisfying after taste only Typhoo gives!  Cup after cup it is consistent, I never get tired of it, and the quality of the blend never varies!  I also love PG Tips; but notice that sometimes the blend isn't always consistent and the strength varies; but I accept this as I love the flavor the vast majority of the time...but Typhoo ALWAYS hits the spot!  From first tea bag or pot full to the last Typhoo is always the same great cuppa without fail.
If I couldn't have both brands and I had to choose just one for the rest of my life it would be Typhoo!  Sorry PG...but Typhoo put the 'T' in Tea:)

Buy this tea and you won't be disappointed!
