Product:
Café Bustelo Coffee Espresso, 10 Ounce Bricks (Pack of 4)
Review:
I am a caffiene addict, and usually most coffee at circle k, quik trip, and 7-11 while tasty, is not strong enough to keep me awake.  So i remember my grandma complaining that house blend coffee taste like water and asked me if I had Bustelo.  At the time I did not have any so i decided get some to give it a try.  Man this stuff is strong.  My grandma made expresso the old fashion way with a cloth strainer and wood handle, and my mom uses some stove top device. So if you like strong expresso, this will work.  I personally drink this like drip coffee (i am not an expresso fan).  If i really need to wake up I brew a cup or two of this in my coffee maker with a disposable filter.  There are times when I don't need as much caffiene so I use half bustelo and half some other coffee like Folders (my way off adding shots to regular coffee) .
  If you are a casual coffee drinker or one who mainly drinks light brews/blondes this may be too strong for your taste buds, friends of my who drink basic light house blends don't like it.  On the other hand my friends who drink Medium roast and dark roast coffees like this brand.  and many even like the combo of adding some bustelo with another brand.  So this is a great tasting coffee if you like bold strong coffee or expresso.  Again I brew this like traditional coffee, when I need a lot of caffiene, i brew  this solely, on days when I need a little less coffee i mix it with a regular brand like foldgers.  And its a great price.  Starbucks was getting too expensive especially since I was drinking three to four ventis a day.
Rating:
5.0

Not much to say other than it is very good, smooth and strong.  Love it!

5.0
Product:
KLASS Horchata Instant Drink Mix, 14.1 oz
Review:
I got this at the local store.  And it is not bad tasting, but not exactly like authethic Horchata.  This product is very sweet compare to real horchata.  This can be good for a person drinking it for the first time or kids it may work.  The taste is closer in taste to Vanilla than to authethic horchata.  The product taster better with milk and terrible with just water, which leads me to believe they emphasize the vanilla portion most when making this product.  Overall the product is not bad tasting but not what I was expecting.  It more like a vanilla shake rather than horchata
Rating:
3.0
Product:
96 Count Variety (10 Amazing Blends) Single-serve Cups for Keurig K-cup Brewers - Premium Roasted Coffee (Variety, 96)
Review:
Being in nowhere land, where we only have one local store, this product is excellent. lots of variwety and a good price. and I saved a lot.  In my area 12 oz of foldgers sells for $25 because of cost to delivering freight into the region.  Luckily we have a post office so ordering is simple.  Got a lot of product at a good price and great tasting.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Lakanto Monkfruit 1:1 Sugar Substitute | 28 oz Non GMO (Golden, 800 g)
Review:
negliable amount of monk fruit but it is marketed as monk fruit when the main ingredient is erythiol.  When ever you see the word "proprietary blend" always be sketical that you are getting what you think you are getting.  If the main ingredient is not Monk Fruit you probably are getting a negliable amount.  There are other products that have monk fruit as the sole ingredient or the number one main ingredient.  If the company refuses to tell you what percentage of monk fruit is in it then don't get it.

1.0

Product:
True Lemon Raspberry Lemonade 10-count (Pack of 6)
Review:
I'm not much of a water drinker.  I want to be, I just have trouble with the tastelessness of water and thus fall into the trap of guzzling down sodas both for the caffeine and for the taste.  Which is a habit I'd really love to stop.  The problem with most drink additives though is the ingredients.  All those fake sugars and I figure I might as well be drinking a soda.  So then I saw True Lemon at the store and the advertisement that it was 100% natural.  So I thought why not try it?  And I'm glad I did.

I started off with a little box of 10 packets of the Raspberry Lemonade to see how I would like it.  For drink additives it was pricey, but no more (and actually a little less) than if I had bought a case of the same amount of soda.  So I won't complain about the price especially considering this is better for me.  They came in little packets that were long and tubular shaped and easy to get open.  You just pop the top of your water bottle and pour the contents in, getting a little show in the meantime of the powder coming up like smoke from the bottle.  Hey, it doesn't take much to amuse me.

The taste is pretty good.  I think I taste more of the raspberry and sugar than they do the lemon, and that's why this product doesn't get more than four stars from me.  I would have liked to have had it be a bit more tart instead of just smooth and sweet.  But it's still not bad.  It goes down smooth and one packet is enough to flavor 17oz of water quite strongly.  It also turns the water a nice pale pink color.

As said before I was strongly attracted to this product because of its ingredients.  Instead of artificial sweeteners, stevia is used.  It also has lemon juice and other natural flavors.  Nothing in the ingredient list looked too bad so I'm happy.  And according to the box its only 5 calories, which isn't too bad either.

Definitely a product I'd try again, and I'll probably end up trying their other flavors as well.

Review by M. Reynard 2011
Rating:
4.0
</Other Writer-1>

Product: Bulk Sucralose - 2000 Yellow Packets (Generic Splenda®)

5.0

golds.output: I'm so glad I found this sweetener. I've been trying different sugar substitutes and this one is by far the best. It's perfect for baking and cooking. I've made a few desserts with it and they turned out delicious. The flavor is great and it doesn't have that weird aftertaste that some other sweeteners have. I've also used it in my coffee and it's a game changer. I purchased this at a discount for taste testing and review, but I will definitely be buying it again.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

Product:
Amoretti Premium Syrup, Swiss Chocolate, 25.4 Ounce
Review:
Wow!!!  We made ice cream sundaes tonight just so we could try this. I have never tasted chocolate syrup like this before. It is so rich and delicious. It truly has a different taste that I could easily get addicted to. I'm a chocoholic anyway. I can't wait to make some mocha cappuccino tomorrow with this. I purchased this at a discount for taste testing and review.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Amoretti Premium Syrup, Cola, 25.4 Ounce
Review:
We have used this at home to make our own soda.  I find the flavor better than some other Cola syrups I have used in the past.  It is not too sweet though, so we add a little agave to it and sweeten it up.  Without adding sweetener the home made cola tastes a lot like "Tab".  (Who remembers "Tab"?)  I love "Tab"...it reminds me of my grandmother so I like the taste, but some people think it is bitter.  If you use this to make your own cola and find it kind of bitter, just add some agave or other sweetener to it and you will be fine.  The bottle is very nice and comes in a box that is perfect for gift giving.  It also comes with a handy pump to make dispensing even easier.  I love having this at home and having the option to make my own carbonated drink whenever I want.  I can make it as sweet as I want.  Sample provided for testing, evaluation and review.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
HERSHEY'S Snack Size Candy Assortment, 36.9 Ounce Bag (100 Pieces)
Review:
Received today...only one bag although description said 10 bags. Misleading.
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Trident Sugar Free Gum (Original, 18-Piece, 3-Pack)
Review:
My favorite gum!  Tastes great and doesn't stick to my dental work.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Verweij 100% Roomboter Siroopwafels (Butter Stroopwafels), 10.6 oz Packages in a BlackTie Box (Pack of 4)
Review:
I wasn't really too sure what to think about these before I tried them.  The description was a little odd ("caramel syrup waffles").  I guess I was expecting something with a strong maple taste, but nope...no maple here.  Just delicious caramel syrup waffles.  ha!  Seriously, they are really, really good and unlike any type of "cookie" I've ever had.  I found myself having a hard time putting them down.  I don't think these 40 siroopwafels will last very long once my husband and kids find them.  (Maybe I'll just keep them hidden for myself.)  I purchased these at a discount for taste testing, evaluation and review.  I find them delicious!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Integra Tea - Slimming Weight Loss Tea, Powerhouse Loose Leaf Herbal Tea Blend of Gynostemma Leaves Tea, White Mulberry, Tulsi & Wu-long - Suppress Appetite, Block Sugar & Boost Your Metabolism, 1oz
Review:
I really hate to say it but this tea is NOT for me.  My mother, however LOVES it.  She has been drinking it daily for 8 days now.  While she enjoys the tea and the way it tastes (nice and sweet), she hasn't seen any weight loss benefit from it.  Granted, she doesn't really have much weight to lose but she was hoping for a pound or two.  She is going to continue to drink it because of the benefits it offers (managing blood sugar, cholesterol, and blood pressure).  It steeps well.  She has been using my double walled infusing glass and usually lets it steep a little longer (usually about 3-5 minutes longer than the initial 8 minutes) because she likes it stronger.  It is good that you can re-use 1 tbsp up to 3 times because she drinks it before every meal (but with each use of the tea she has to steep it a little longer, obviously).  Like I said, not for me (I didn't like the taste) but she loves it.  Sample provided for testing, evaluation and review.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Koffee Kult Dark Roast Coffee Beans - Highest Quality Gourmet - Whole Bean Coffee - Fresh Roasted Coffee Beans, 32oz
Review:
When the mailman delivered the box he mentioned it smelled good and he was right.  I opened it up and oh my goodness....it smelled so wonderful that I had to get the grinder out and grind some beans.  It didn't matter that it was 3:30 pm.  It sure did help that it was 33 degrees.  But my Mother always taught me that anytime is the perfect time for coffee and she is right.  This coffee is delicious.  It smells wonderful coming out of the box and you should smell it brewing.  The aroma is intoxicating...but the flavor is even better!  Delicious and robust.  Very bold but not at all bitter.  Probably one of the best coffees I have ever tasted.  If you are a coffee snob (and even if you are not), you will definitely love this.  Thank you Koffee Kult for offering this promotion so I could try this.  So glad I was able to try this because in the process I think I've found my new favorite.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
AntiPoleez Breath Mints 360-Count Capsules (Pack of 12)
Review:
I am a mint and gum freak.  I always have something in my purse because as Anthony Michael Hall said in "16 Candles"... "Fresh breath is a priority in my life..."  If I'm not always sucking on a mint or chewing gum I am handing it out because that is one of my pet peeves.  I have to say that I am quite impressed by these breath mints from AntiPoleez.  I really didn't know what to expect and I was pleasantly surprised.  Be prepared because they're not "minty" at all. They have a medicine like taste and are a strange texture. They are strong...but not overwhelming.  The most important thing, though, is that they will knock out any kind of funkiness lingering in your mouth.  Garlic and coffee breath are the worst, but these mints took care of both.  I was amazed.  Make sure to suck on them though...don't try to chew them up to get rid of them...just let them dissolve in your mouth.  It says to use 2 at a time and you can use a 3rd if needed...but I've never needed the third.  They will get rid of any bad breath you have...gone...not just masking it or covering it up but will really get rid of it.  Good stuff and I highly recommend it.  Sample received for testing, evaluation and review.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Brach's Cinnamon Hard Candy Discs, 2 lb Bag in a BlackTie Box
Review:
Brach's is THE BEST when it comes to cinnamon disc's. I remember eating these as a kid. They are the perfect cinnamon (in my opinion)...not too hot but just enough to satisfy. This two pound bag gives plenty to share (or plenty to keep to yourself). I like the box that they came in...great for gift giving. Purchased at a discount for taste testing, evaluation and review.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kopi Luwak Direct Wild Kopi Luwak Coffee, 2.4 oz / 70 Grams
Review:
I couldn't wait to try this coffee.  Any little bag of coffee that is THAT expensive must be fabulous.  I've had good coffee before but to me a cup of SBUX is expensive.  I googled this type of coffee bean and found out that in some places people pay anywhere from $30-$100 per cup for this stuff.  Wow!  Coffee people don't joke around!  I used my grinder to grind this up very fine.  I like my coffee stronger so made it a little stronger than regular.  After we finished discussing the whole "they get these beans from what?" topic I shared a couple of pots this morning with my Mom and a friend.  The general consensus was this: it's a really good cup of coffee.  It is very smooth and has no bitterness whatsoever.  We enjoyed the coffee, yes, it was good.  $30-$100 a cup good?  Well, not on my budget but I guess if I had the money to spend I would probably buy it.  I'm glad I was able to purchase the beans at a discount for testing, evaluation and review but I can't see buying it regularly...unless I were to win the lottery.  Don't get me wrong, it is good coffee but just a little too expensive for me.
Rating:
4.0

PG Tips Black Tea, Pyramid Tea Bags, 160Count Boxes (Pack of 4)

golds.output: I'm quite pleased with this product, and I think it's well worth the purchase.  The flavor is very rich, and the salted variety has just the right amount of salt to bring out the taste.  I've had this on bread, and I've also used it in cooking, and I think it's a great addition to any meal. prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:

Product:
NYC Deli Pickles by Brooklyn Brine (24 ounce)
Review:
These pickles really do grow on a person.  (Well not literally.  :)  ).  At first I didn't think they were bad, but wasn't overly impressed.  But after a bit I started to truly enjoy them, thus why I now give them a five star rating.  Due to their use of apple cider vinegar they do have a slightly sweet taste along with the garlic and dill, but not to the point of being nearly as sweet as a bread and butter.  I think if people don't get stuck in thinking they aren't like a kosher half sour pickle but are maybe in a category of their own, they will enjoy them as well.

They are pretty crisp as an aside also, and just slightly spicy.  I'm debating trying either these again, or another variety.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Cashews Oven Roasted Finely Salted, Dry Roasted Salted Cashews - Oh! Nuts (2 LB Dry Roasted Salted Cashews)
Review:
These cashews are delicious.  They have a notable dry roasted flavor, and yet the actual flavor from the cashew is never drown out either.  Perfect amount of salt, and are quite fresh.  The bag they come in works well also to keep them fresh after opened.  I'm quite happy, and I'd easily consider buying this or another product by this company again.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Panda Sauce For Mongolian Beef,BBQ Stir Fry, 8-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
How can anyone use this sauce?  Pandas are an endangered species!  The very idea that one would dice up a Panda and then use it as the meat in any meal is disgusting and unethical.  Yes, I know they claim this is sauce for Mongolian beef, but I'm sure that's to hide the fact that a panda is on the front of the label, thus clearly indicating that they expect people to use panda flesh!

As an aside, I have no problem with unusual or exotic meats in general, I'm far from a vegetarian.  But I won't eat a species that is so rare and endangered!
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Newman's Own Con Queso Salsa, 16-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I've been looking far and wide for a salsa or dip that tastes like vomit and has the smell of a soiled diaper.  I am overjoyed to finally find such a product!  In fact, I do wonder since this is a "Newman's Own" product if the late Paul Newman himself upchucked into a vat after eating a copious amount of cheese.  Even if not, the fact that this has the flavor of pre-digested cheese is a plus in my book!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bridgford Italian Salami, 7-Ounce Sticks (Pack of 6)
Review:
To be fair, I didn't purchase this product.  But I found it outside of someone's home as I was wandering the streets.  What I found to be exact was 3/4ths of one of the salami, in some sort of pet food dish as if left for a pet or some wildlife.  Well, since it was left outside, I decided that the owner might not care if I went ahead and ate it.  So I did, and it was wonderful!  I am only giving this product four stars since like "Mntijo" here with his review it was a bit greasy, and I also had stomach distress after eating it.  But this product is still delicious!  I do hope the owner of the home that placed this salami outside orders more, I'd love to get more free food of this caliber.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Old Wisconsin Beef Snack Sticks, 7-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6)
Review:
Although I've had better from local merchants and small businesses, these for being a "major brand" are very good.  Hopefully I don't come off as a food snob of some sort when I say that, but for the price point and in general I do enjoy this product.

The four star rating is more for the following:

1)  They are very greasy, and very slightly sticky also.  The grease is more on the outside of the meat stick then in the meat proper oddly enough.
2)  Although to me it was obvious based on the photo of the product, the package isn't resealable.  Far from a deal breaker, but don't be out of storage bags or containers when one first opens this.
3)  The meat could be packed just a bit denser in the casing.  Not by much, but it could be.

If they made them less greasy and/or a bit more dense I would have come closer to giving this five stars.  Item 2 is more just to mention it, it's not a deal breaker for me at all.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Rose Pork Brains with Milk Gravy 5 Ounce Cans (4 Cans Per Pack)
Review:
This is a wonderful product for those making a survival kit for surviving a zombie apocalypse.  First off, it's canned brains.  Being chased by zombies?  Pop open a can, and leave on the ground.  They will smell the brains and devour these instead of continue chasing you to eat your brains.  One can then run away, or if one has a ranged weapon like a firearm or bow can then run a bit, turn around and kill said zombie.  Of course, one can always eat these if one is desperate.  Or if one IS a zombie but still retains enough intellect to open canned goods.  The cans are small and compact, so keeping a few in a kit as zombie bait and/or emergency food is..pardon the pun, just a no brainer!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Blue Sky Zero Calorie Stevia Soda (Lemon Lime, 12-Ounce Cans, Pack of 24)
Review:
I went ahead and decided to order a 24 pack of this product here on amazon.com.  It very much is a fine product with what I'd call a unique "bite".  It's not as sweet as many rootbeers, using either corn syrup or cane sugar as sweetner but it is how I'd imagine an old fashioned one might taste.  The closest comparison I can make is perhaps Virgil's, if you've had that you've had one that is somewhat similar, although Virgil's is still a bit sweeter.

I'd lean toward Virgil's a tiny bit first, but this is still quite a good product, and one I'd purchase again from time to time.  My only issue was with packaging, which I already submitted in my packaging review to amazon.com.  (And I feel shouldn't be part of a product review in most cases anyway..or if mentioned then not included in the star rating).
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Golden Mountain Thai Seasoning Sauce - 6.7 oz x 3 bottles
Review:
This does have a similar flavor to soy sauce.  It's slightly sweeter (but not by a huge degree at all) to "pure" soy that is just soybeans, salt and water though.  It otherwise isn't bad, but doesn't really strongly stand out.

This would be a four star review except for the following.  The plastic used on all three bottles for the lid is VERY cheap.  On all three, there is a ring tab pull to open the bottle under the lid.  In all three cases, the ring just broke off.  The plastic almost feels more like wax.  I had to take a knife and poke my own opening in each case to use this product.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Kraft Spicy Ranch Dressing, 15.8 Ounce
Review:
People I don't think see that this actually is a great product.  Okay, at first I was going to give this one star.  As a cheese dip for tortilla chips or to drizzle onto tacos, it's kind of horrid.  Not vomit flavor horrid but it's up there.  But then I got inspired, and decided to comb some into my hair.  This makes a WONDERFUL hair mousse!  My hair is so easy to style now using this.  Also, the delicate smell of cheese is much better then any cologne I've ever used.  My only warning is that it can be a bit tough to get out of one's hair unless the water is pretty hot, I do suggest a hot shower, scrub this out of the hair and then apply shampoo as usual.  But truly do try this as a hair mousse.  You won't be displeased!
Rating:
5.0

Review:
Wonka Nerds Giant Chewy Candies are basically jellybeans coated with what seems to be a bumpy Gobstopper-like shell.

5.0
Review:

golds.output: I was really excited to try this, but it tastes like cheap cheese puffs. I know I'm picky, but it's really not that good. Product:
Annie's Gluten Free  Rice Pasta & Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese, 12 Boxes, 6oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
Tastes like sick chemicals. I cannot imagine any child eating this and liking it, same goes with all of Annie's mac and cheese products. Sauce is thin, noodles are too small, and it tastes like vomit or stomach acid (I'm serious). Kraft now makes Organic mac and cheese and it's DELICIOUS, I'm eating some right now.

2.0
Product:
Fritos Bar-b-q Corn Chips 9.25 Oz (Pack of 3)
Review:
I love these corn chips. They don't taste like BBQ flavor to me, they taste more like ranch. I didn't expect that when I bought them but I am pleasantly surprised because they taste just like Ranch Corn Nuts to me, my beloved snack that I can't eat anymore due to fillings (don't want to break my teeth). I missed the taste of ranch corn nuts so much and was shocked to realize how these taste just like those. Very happy with this product.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Snack Factory Pretzel Crisps, Original, 7.2 Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
I hate to be THAT person, but these are gross. Buffalo wings are one of my most favorite foods ever but these do not taste like buffalo wings. They taste really sour, then really spicy and hot, and WAY WAY WAY too salty, and I love my salt! I can't pick up a good flavor with these. I'm really sad because they sounded amazing. I recommend the "Everything" Pretzel Crisps.
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Back To Nature Crazy Bugs Macaroni & Cheese Dinner, 6-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)
Review:
I might be an adult but I still love mac and cheese and the "crazy bugs" gimmick got me. I picked this up at Walmart for $1.25. I prepared it on the stove and I was really annoyed to find out that the cheese packet powder is WHITE, and not ORANGE like they advertise on the box. I hate when the cheese is white, it looks so unappetizing. The taste isn't horrible but it's nothing special at all. My husband tried it and refused to take more than a bite, and he'll eat anything. All these positive reviews are just buying into the Natural gimmick.
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Chex Snack Mix Bold Party Blend, 8.75-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
I expected more, to be honest. These taste EXACTLY like that cheap snack that comes in a box called Nutty Bars. I always hated those because they were so cheap tasting. Also, really? Natural AND Artificial flavors? It's just chocolate and peanut butter, you really need to go artificial with such basic flavors? Okay.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Orville Redenbacher's Gourmet Microwavable Popcorn, Smart Pop Kettle Korn, 3-Count Boxes (Pack of 12)
Review:
I bought this, took it home, and read the ingredients and saw SUCRALOSE, EWWWWWWWW! If I had read it at the store I wouldn't have bought it. Either way I popped some anyways. It's surprisingly good, it's not great though. It has more negatives than positives. The positives are that it has a sweet taste for sure, nothing chemical or weird though. That's about it for the positives. The negatives are that you need to eat a handful or the popcorn is bland, if you eat it in small handfuls THEN it tastes sugary and sweet. The popcorn is also cold, coming right out of the microwave, I think this is due to it not really having any coating like butter so it gets cold fast......I like warm popcorn. It's also really light and dry.......I like buttery popcorn. All in all this popcorn is good tasting and I am really picky about this stuff and artificial sweeteners, it doesn't taste fake or chemical to me. Have you ever had a popcorn ball? It tastes like a less sweet version. I happen to love popcorn balls, some people don't.

UPDATE: I only ate 1 bag of this stuff. It's gross. I don't like it.
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Kellogg’s Corn Pops, Breakfast Cereal in a Cup, Original, Single Serve, 1.5 oz Cup(Pack of 60)
Review:
The cereal is amazing but this container is so awkward. If you want to eat from it, the bowl is really tall so when you put milk in it, the cereal overflows, and if you use only a little bit of milk and try to spoon the cereal from the bottom the cereal falls out because the container is too tall and thin and not wide :\
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Pringles Cheese Stix, 4.8 Ounce
Review:
These stix are nothing to write home about. They don't satisfy any part of me. It's just seasoned bread. It makes me want real pizza or a real breadstick. Also they contain sucralose -- Wtf? That's so random and stupid. No wonder they have a bad aftertaste.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Knorr Bouillon Beef, 7.9 oz
Review:
What is wrong with this item? I always buy the Knorr beef bouillon cubes, I thought this would be more convenient but it tastes nothing like the cubes. This product ruined my soup. There is no beef flavor and it's not even salty. I had to use 3 times the amount I was suppose to use plus a bunch of salt to get it near the level of flavor the cubes give the soup. I don't know why this product differs from the cubes when it says it's the same dang thing!
Rating:
1.0
Product:
S&B Golden Curry Sauce Mix, Hot, 8.4-Ounce
Review:

No surprise, it was extremely mild with no hint of spice. I found it kind of bland so I went back and bought Medium Hot. It was spicier but still not spicy enough for me, so I bought Hot and WOW! What a great kick of spice. It's not overly spicy where you're running for water, but it's a great heat. I think Extra Hot would be a little much for me and the normal person. The taste is excellent. I prepared it with chicken, onion, potato chunks and carrot chunks. It's extremely easy to make and super delicious over Japanese sticky rice.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Marie Sharp's Orange Pulp Habanero Hot Sauce (5oz)
Review:
Similar to Marie Sharp's Habarnero Pepper Sauce (which adds a bit of sweetness using carrots), this sauce uses oranges instead. Is there a huge difference between the two- no! This orange pulp variety is a bit milder and if you have a delicate palette you might detect the orange versus carrot taste.

As I type this - I'm trying a taste of each side by side - undiluted.

Make no mistake this woman knows how to make a good hot sauce! Fresh tasting, with a sense of "purity" is how I would describe her hot sauces. They are NOT overly complex - a nice bit of sweetness at first blush then just heat, lingering heat but no off tastes.

I don't see how anyone could go wrong with any of her hot sauces even if they lack complexity.

Very nice in a Bloody Mary!

How hot? About equal to Tabasco. Think of 3 or 4 tiny drops in a large Bloody Mary.

Why 3 Stars? I'm seeking perfection! BTW: I'd rate Tabasco's original at 1 star.

Elsewhere on the web this sauce goes for $3.99
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Demitri's Bloody Mary Seasoning Classic Recipe, 16-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)
Review:
Mild but well balanced. This is a concentrate (just add tomato juice and vodka).  It is mostly Worcestershire sauce balanced skillfully with chilies and a variety of other ingredients..

Ingredients/per label: Worcestershire Sauce (Vinegar, Molasses, Sugar, Anchovies, Water, Hydrolyzed Soy and Corn Protein, Onions, Tamarinds, Salt, Garlic, Cloves, Chile Peppers, Natural Flavorings, Shallots), Spices, Chile Pepper Puree, Prepared Horseradish (Grated Horseradish Roots, White Distilled Vinegar, Soybean Oil, Citric Acid, Sugar), Lemon Juice Concentrate, Red Pepper Sauce, Celery Seed, Natural Flavorings and Xanthan Gum.

Want it hotter - add a drop or two of your favorite hot sauce.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Tabasco Original Sauce, Pepper, 12 Ounce
Review:
I've kept a bottle of Tabasco (the original blend) in my kitchen for more decades than I care to admit. I've added a few drops to any number of dishes that I wanted to "kick up" a notch and used it regularly in a Bloody/Virgin Mary.

I'm embarrassed to say I never experimented with any other brand of hot sauce until recently.

After taste testing over 40 different hot sauces (everyone needs a hobby), writing up notes, test tasting them blind again - writing up new notes and then comparing my old notes versus new notes ----- I have to say Tabasco's original blend turns out to be one of the worse hot sauces I have tested blind.

Tabasco's original has only two tastes: hot peppers combined with a very heavy dose of vinegar. The bitter vinegar after-taste, so typical in Tabasco's original, is not an inherent quality of a good hot sauce.

I could provide an extensive list of hot sauces that are far superior to Tabasco's original but here are just a few that are widely available: I encourage you to try any or all of them. I'm quite certain you will be pleasantly surprised.

1) Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce (as potent as Tabasco) but with far less vinegar with a hint of sugar and garlic. Top rated by many. Found in most supermarkets if you look. If you look carefully you'll see it in most pantries on cooking shows
2) Cholula Hot Sauce (milder and less vinegar) - often highly rated by professional reviewers. Found in most supermarkets, look for the wooden top.
3) Tapatio Salsa Picante Hot Sauce (milder and with less vinegar)
4) Huichol Hot Sauce (milder - less vinegar - not widely available)
5) Tabasco's own Chipotle blend (much milder - rich tasting featuring the chipotle smoked pepper -less vinegar).Found in most supermarkets.

I hope I've encouraged everyone to try a few other hot sauces beyond this one

PS: Once you get away from Tabasco's (original) hot sauce and what I find to be its excessive vinegar after-taste you open up a whole new world. There are so many superior hot sauces available that it is almost impossible to comprehend. Things have certainly improved since the late 1800s when Tabasco first came to market. While Tabasco likes to brag that this is their original blend ---- that is not a "plus" in my view but rather a "minus" - a marketing gimmick where they argue that an inherent flaw (a lot of vinegar) is an attribute. BTW: Less anyone think I have an axe to grind with Tabasco - see my review of Tabasco's Chipotle hot sauce which I rated as excellent!

What more can I say - experiment - I sincerely doubt you will stick with Tabasco's original hot sauce after trying a few other brands.

UPDATE ----- A PROFESSIONAL REVIEW of Hot Sauces has come out: While my original review was written over a year prior - just recently America's Test Kitchen, a show on PBS, TESTED a number of HOT SAUCES.

What sauce came in FIRST? ------ Huy Fong Sriracha.

What sauce came in very LAST? ---- Tabasco

I'll admit it is nice to have a professional tasting panel come to the very same conclusions I arrived at a year earlier.

Tastes vary and Tabasco will suit those who like a lot of vinegar in their hot sauce.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Frank's Redhot Original Cayenne Pepper Sauce, Fat Free Hot Wing Sauce, 23 oz
Review:
This is a mild hot sauce. That means you can apply it liberally and it's unlikely you will make any dish too hot. So it is user friendly.

Ingredients (as copied from the label): Aged cayenne peppers, distilled vinegar, water, salt - etc

Why 2 stars? This sauce lacks any character beyond a heavy dose of vinegar. If you happen to like a lot of vinegar in your hot sauce - then you'll love this sauce and my 2 star rating is way off base. I don't like anywhere near this much vinegar. I've blind taste tested over 30 hot sauces and there are many better ones.

What is interesting is that the original Tabasco sauce has a near identical taste to Franks once it is diluted.

You will find mention that this sauce was top rated by Cooks Illustrated. That is absolutely true but what these pundits fail to mention is this was a casual test, done in 2005, comparing only three hot sauces!

Suggestion: Since tastes vary and if you happen to like this sauce - then buy it in one of its larger sizes - at least 23 oz and consider the gallon size. They cost little more than the smaller sizes.

I'd encourage others to experiment with a sauce that is not so heavily laden with vinegar - you just might prefer any of these:

a) Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce - This sauce has considerable heat but it is nicely balanced against a bit of sweetness combined with a hint of garlic. Virtually every supermarket carries it - look in the Asian section! No vinegar.

b) Cholula Original Hot Sauce - features a fine blend of peppers - medium hot and readily available - look in the Mexican section. It has a hint of vinegar.

c) Valentina Salsa Picante Mexican Extra Hot Sauce - a great blend with more vinegar than the above but not too much. Another great blend.

d) Valentina Salsa Picante Mexican Hot Sauce - a decent blend but with a lot of vinegar. Still it is much better than Franks.

e) Tapatio Hot Salsa Picanta - another widely distributed and excellent Mexican Hot sauce. A lot of vinegar but far less than Franks. Once again you will find this in your Mexican isle.

In my opinion, all of the above are far superior to Franks.

If you like Franks and are at the least bit curious, you should try any of these other hot sauces

UPDATE (August, 2013) America's Test Kitchen which is a TV program on PBS recently rated hot sauces. Tabasco came in last, Franks came in the middle and top rated was Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce

PPS: Bon Appetit magazine recently rated Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce as "ingredient of the year"
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Tabasco Chipotle Pepper, 5 Ounce
Review:
This is Tabasco's best tasting hot sauce! The Tabasco brand is traditionally associated with a very hot pepper (chile) sauce. This company has been branching out and now offers a number of new sauces. In my view, this is their very best sauce. In general, I'm not a fan of Tabasco products. Yet this one is excellent.

This sauce is based on the Chipotle - a smoke-dried jalapeno pepper.

The sauce is relatively mild (as is the chile) and it has the unique flavor, typical of this smoked pepper.

I'd call this sauce almost sweet - much like semi-sweet dark chocolate BUT with the additional kick of some gentle heat.

The smoked taste of the Chipotle pepper is fairly unique. Keep in mind, if you like this sauce, you will probably be buying a bottle monthly - given its diluted nature. So if you are use to keeping a bottle of the traditional Tabasco hot sauce in your pantry for a year or more, it certainly won't happen with this variety.

I've been taste tasting 7 other Chipotle hot sauces. This sauce is one of my favorites. The only real competitor is El Yucateco Chipotle Hot Sauce. The Tabasco Chipotle has a bit more vinegar while the El Yucateco has some added sugar and tomato paste. Both are excellent.

As noted, this sauce is far more diluted than the traditional Tabasco hot sauce yet it is far more potent and richer tasting than many other Chipotle based sauces I've tried. At least, in this sauce the Chipotle flavor is concentrated and the added vinegar is not overpowering. Certainly this is the best tasting Tabasco hot sauce ever made and the only real competitor I can find is the El Yucateco Chipotle Hot Sauce which has less vinegar and a bit more tomato taste. All the other Chipotle sauces I have taste tested are so diluted that they lack any real flavor and can be easily dis-qualified.

Try a bottle - if you like the Chipotle pepper and I think you will - you'll love this sauce. You might also try the El Yucateco Chipotle which is also excellent yet a bit different. Beyond these two Chipotle based sauces I have not found any other Chipotle based sauces that come even close!

Heads Up: You can probably find this sauce (in its smaller size) at any supermarket. I'm ordering a half gallon - on-line.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tabasco Chipotle Pepper, 5 Ounce
Review:
This Chipotle Sauce offers some gentle heat along with the rich taste of a smoked Chipotle pepper. It makes a great Bloody/Virgin Mary and will add some interesting flavors to any dish that needs some heat. As another reviewer said -- this is probably the best tasting product within Tabasco's ever expanding lineup.

I've taste tested 7 different Chipotle hot sauces and the Tabasco Chipotle is one of my favorites. The taste is very rich, smokey, semi-sweet and, for once, there is not too much vinegar! Yet make no mistake - there is a good dose of vinegar yet it is not over powering. It is quite simply one of the best Chipotle sauces I have taste tested.

Keep in mind that this sauce is relatively mild when compared to the other Tabasco products.  In this particular sauce, the heat is far more subdued and not what I would have  expected from a Tabasco product. This sauce needs to viewed as a completely different product.  This is the best tasting Tabasco sauce I've ever tasted and beyond that -- near the best tasting Chipotle I have found.

I paid $3.29 for it at my local supermarket. I doubt you'll have any trouble finding it locally and since tastes differ - I'd recommend you first buy a single bottle close to home. Then purchase a half gallon on-line.

What sets this chipotle apart is the richness of its flavor. It is concentrated in the best possible sense. Rich, with some sweetness, smokey, some vinegar and a bit of gentle heat.

I have repeatedly taste tested the following Chipotle:  Tabasco, La Victoria, El Pato, Cholula, Goya, Bufalo and El Yucateco.

The El Yucateco Chipotle is also superb and the only worthy competitor to this sauce. Both are rich - the Tabasco has more vinegar and the El Yucateco has a bit more sugar and a hint of tomato.

Update: My favorite blend turns out to be tomato juice, a fairly heavy dose of Tabasco Chipotle plus a bit of Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce. I also add a dash of Worchester sauce and lemon juice.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Tuong Ot Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce 28oz
Review:
This hot sauce has become a staple in my kitchen and replaced my bottle of Tabasco. Like Tabasco - it is primarily a cayenne pepper delivery device. A few drops add a lot of heat to any dish. This is NOT a watered down hot sauce like Franks, etc.

While Tabasco seems to impart mostly heat along with a vinegar note - this product has far more subtle tastes going on beyond the heat, yet the heat is considerable and dominates. It also lingers, on your taste buds, longer than Tabasco. There is a subtle sweetness with garlic notes to this sauce. While Tabasco can taste harsh if you add enough to a dish ---- this sauce, no matter how much you add, tastes fresh and just a bit sweet.

I wanted to say in my review that this sauce had a hint of tomato yet there are no tomatoes listed on the ingredients. I suspect what I thought was tomato is simply the sun ripened chilies and the added sugar listed on the ingredients. But to be clear - heat - lingering heat - is the primary taste

I like this product and I'd recommend its purchase but I'm not sure it rates 5 stars because the overall flavor does not seem, in any way, exceptional. There really is just one major taste evident and that is heat - and after that only a vague hint of something else which seems to be chiles, sugar and garlic. But chiles, sugar and garlic sure beats the vinegar aftertaste evidenced in Tabasco.

For the $5.99 I paid locally for a 28 Oz bottle --- I'm glad to have it on hand.

As another reviewer recommended - given the potency of this stuff - you probably only want to have a single bottle on hand. Larger quantities will deteriorate over time. I'd recommend you purchase this locally and not in the 2/3/6 packs offered on Amazon. I doubt many households will go through a bottle in a year. As I said: this is potent stuff.

Update (July 2010) - a formal taste test

I put 4 ounces of tomato juice into two glasses and progressively added 1/8 teaspoon of Tabasco or Huy Fong Sriracha into one of the two glasses until they both became too "hot" to taste

Results: With Tabasco - with each added dose the juice became not only hotter but harsher. With the Huy Fong - it became hotter yet retained a very fresh but sweeter note

Update (August 2013): While my review was written some time ago - just recently (August, 2013) America's Test Kitchen, a show on PBS tested a wide number of hot sauces. What sauce came in last? Tabasco! First was the Huy Fong Sriracha.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
30 2.12OZ Packages Mama Tom Yum Flavour Instant Noodles (Shrimp Flavored)
Review:
Given all the positive reviews I was anxious to try these noodles. Now I'm stuck with 30 packets.

I was very disappointed. Apparently the many reviewers who have rated this product so highly have never tried any other Asian noodle soups.

The packets are quite small - a serving for one, at most. Much smaller than average!

Taste - medium heat (using all of the flavor packets) combined with a hint of lemon grass and displaying no other flavors that I could detect. I found this soup rather bland although I did like that hint of lemon grass.

Why the discrepancy in reviews? Lets take one example: "heat" or "spiciness". Some reviewers rate this product as being "very hot" and others rate it as "medium". Why the difference? It really is quite simple: different cultures and different palates. For most Americans (if there is such a person) this soup may seem quite hot. However in many Asian cultures it is fairly mild. The beauty of ALL these types of noodles/soups is they provide a spice packet(s) and you can add as little or as much as you want. However with this soup - after using all the packets - it was relatively mild to me. I called it "medium hot"

Deceptive advertising: There are no whole shrimp or shrimp pieces as depicted on the label. As I write this review - I'm looking at a packet and reading from its label: The Major Single ingredient is wheat flour, followed by palm oil, then salt, then sugar, then MSG, then dried red chili powder, then Chile powder, then ... well it goes on and on to finally include very small quanties of fish sauce and dried shrimp powder along with many other lesser ingredients. BTW: Ingrediants are always listed from largest to smallest on an ingrediant label

Not recommended! A true two star product - mediocre

As an alternative try: Nong Shim Shin Noodle Ramyun soup, Gourmet Spicy Picante. That soup offers more flavor and comes in a much larger serving size. The soup costs about $17.00 (with free shipping) for 20 much larger packets. That is not only a better deal, the soup has more flavor. Yet I only gave that soup three stars yet having tasted this one maybe it deserves 4 stars or this one deserves 1 star. Interestingly when I rated that soup with 3 stars I came under considerable fire from the many customers that rated it 5 stars. It seems people fall in love with whatever noodle soup they first encounter.

I am NOT suggesting that Nong Shim Shin Noodle Ramyun Gourmet Spicy Picante soup is some panacea. It is just another less than healthy quick noodle soup which I enjoy and I find tastes better than this one. Remember, I only gave the Nong Shin soup three stars.

Conclusion: The many 4/5 star reviews of Mama Tom Yum strike me as having been written by people with a very limited perspective. In other words they had not tried many of the other availabe noodle soups.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
30 2.12OZ Packages Mama Tom Yum Flavour Instant Noodles (Shrimp Flavored)
Review:
Given all the positive reviews, I was anxious to try these noodles. Now I'm stuck with 30 packets.

I am very disappointed. Apparently the many reviewers who have rated this product so highly have never tried any other Asian noodle soups.

The packets are quite small - a serving for one, at best. Much smaller than average in my experience.

Taste - medium heat (at most - using all of the flavor packets) combined with a hint of lemon grass and displaying no other flavors that I could detect. I found this soup rather bland although I liked the hint of lemon grass.

Why the discrepancy in reviews? Lets take one example: "heat" or "spiciness". Some reviewers rate this product as being "very hot" and others rate it as "medium" at best. Why the difference? It really is quite simple: different cultures and different palates. For most Americans (if there is such a person) this soup may seem quite hot. However in many Asian cultures it is fairly mild. The beauty of ALL these types of noodles/soups is that they provide a spice packet(s) and you can add as little or as much as you want. However with this soup - after using all the packets - it was relatively mild to me. I called it "medium heat"

Deceptive advertising: There are no whole shrimp or shrimp pieces as depicted on the label. As I write this review I'm looking at a packet and reading from its label: The Major Single ingredient is wheat flour, followed by palm oil, then salt, then sugar, then MSG, then dried red chili powder, then Chile powder, then ... well it goes on and on to finally list fish sauce and dried shrimp powder along with many other lesser ingredients

Not recommended! A true two star product - mediocre

As an alternative try: Nong Shim Shin Noodle Ramyun soup, Gourmet Spicy Picante. That soup offers more flavor and comes in a much larger serving size.  The soup costs about $17.00 (with free shipping) for 20 much larger packets. That is not only a better deal, the soup has more flavor. But I only gave that soup three stars.  Interestingly when I rated the Nong Shim soup at only 3 stars I came under considerable fire from many customers who had rated it 5 stars.

I am NOT suggesting that Nong Shim Shin Noodle Ramyun Gourmet Spicy Picante soup is some kind of panacea. It is just another less than healthy quick noodle soup which I enjoy more. Remember, I only gave that soup three stars.

Conclusion: The many over the top reviews of Mama Tom Yum (meaning 4/5 star reviews) strike me as having beem written by people with a very limited perspective
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Franks Red Hot Sauce, 12 Ounce
Review:
Franks is a mild/diluted hot sauce containing some cayenne pepper along with a fairly heavy dose of vinegar. If you are just looking for a basic hot sauce that can be liberally applied then Franks might hit that mark, assuming you like this much vinegar.  The diluted nature of Franks makes it quite forgiving.

If you are a bit curious, then I suggest you try something else. You might be pleasantly surprised. Obviously, no reviewer can encompass the myriad of tastes that Amazon customers have. What a reviewer can do is suggest alternatives that might appeal to others.

For those of you who like Franks but are willing to experiment --- then I would suggest you try one or all of the following:

a) Huy Fong Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce - This sauce has considerably more heat than Franks, on a drop per drop basis so it is much more potent. It is nicely balanced with a bit of sweetness combined with a hint of garlic. It has No vinegar but, as noted, you'll need far less since it is far more potent than Franks.  Virtually every supermarket carries it - look in the Asian section! Amazon also carries it.

b) Cholula Original Hot Sauce - features a fine blend of peppers - low to medium heat and is readily available - look in the Mexican section or on Amazon. This sauce, given its lower heat level is almost a direct replacement for Franks but has, in my view, a far superior taste. It has some vinegar but is much better balanced than Franks.

c) Tapatio Hot Salsa Picanta - another widely distributed and excellent Mexican Hot sauce. Once again you will find this in your Mexican isle or on Amazon. Similar to Franks but a notch below Cholula in my view - but certainly worth a try - since tastes vary. It is excellent - I just happen to prefer the Huy Fong or Cholula.

d) Tabasco Chipotle hot sauce - a well know national brand. The Chipotle pepper is smoked and has a unique flavor. Commonly available locally or on Amazon ---- but the taste of this smoked pepper is different - a bit sweeter and with a very pleasant smoked flavor. I really like this sauce and it is certainly well worth a try. Not terribly hot so on a drop by drop basis it is not any hotter than Franks. But the flavor is much better!

I've given Franks 3 stars (which is a generous rating - I actually view it as a 2 star product).  The others sauces I've listed above I'd rate at least as a 4 star if not 5 star product. Why not experiment - at only a few dollars per bottle - why not?

I can't encourage you enough to experiment and enjoy the process!!!!

PS: There are a number of people who have settled on a single product (such as Franks) and hate the fact that anyone might suggest an alternative. These customers view any Amazon review that contradicts their beliefs as threatening and down rate it accordingly. That is unfortunate. This is nothing more than an honest attempt to suggest alternatives!

Update (August 2013): While my review was written some time ago - just recently (August, 2013) America's Test Kitchen, a show on PBS tested a wide number of hot sauces. What sauce came in last? Tabasco! First was the Huy Fong Sriracha.
Rating:
3.0
</similarpairs>

Product:

Review:
This is very, very yummy.  To make microwave cocoa with it, one cup at a time, put a few teaspoons in the bottom of a cup, with a little cold water, and make a paste. (This mixes it without melting the cocoa, which is why microwave cocoa usually doesn't work.)  Pour regular or almond milk into the cup, once you have made your paste,  and microwave the cup on high for 1 1/2 minutes.  The result is a steaming, sweet, coffeeshop appropriate cocoa.

This is also truly gluten-free. I'm a celiac with a sixteen-year-old diagnosis, and this doesn't make me sick  at all.  The only downside to this is that the bag is huge, and it gets cocoa everywhere. If you don't want cocoa all over your arms or sleeves, you'll have to have another dispenser to put the cocoa in.  Highly recommended.

Sushi Chef Short Grain Rice, 20-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
If you're hesitating about buying this, because, well--it's a lot of rice--never fear. To some extent, rice is just rice, and rice is interchangeable within recipes, as long as it's the same kind of rice the recipe requires. (Thank you, Alton Brown, for the information that rice is interchangeable.)

For example: medium grain rice like this also makes great risotto. I made a baked risotto with this rice tonight, using an Ina Garten recipe I found on the Google.  (It's probably up on my food blog, about now.)  Molto bene!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Madhava Organic Light Agave, 23.5-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
About 30-40% of the population of Central Europe has trouble digesting fructose.  If you have trouble digesting fructose, it can cause a lot of unexplained abdominal pain.

This is almost 100% fructose.

Personally, I spent about two months with very bad, mysterious abdominal pain that seemed to be everywhere. After several weeks of doctor visits, discussions about IBS, and an abdominal ultrasound that came up normal, I started thinking about what was different in my diet:  I had been using agave nectar in my tea several times a day.  After throwing out the agave nectar and looking online for a list of lower fructose food, I changed my diet, a little.

The pain went away in a matter of days, and hasn't returned.

If you're using agave nectar and you have suddenly started having digestive issues, try getting rid of the agave nectar.  For some people, this is really bad stuff.

Note to gluten-intolerant folks:  fructose malabsorption can go along with being gluten sensitive or intolerant.  If you're wondering why you're still sick if you're following a gluten-free diet, this may be the culprit.

3.0

This is a much better alternative that playing salmonella roulette with fresh chicken.  This is safe to eat, yummy chicken.  It's consistently good.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Kraft Grated Parmesan Cheese, 16-Ounce Plastic Canister (Pack of 3) Review: Parmesan is known as the queeen of Italian cheese. Kraft Grated Parmesan, 16-Ounce Plastic Canister (Pack of 3). Kraft Grated Parmesan cheese has been around since 1945. The container has been updated, but the cheese is still the queen. There are more delicious variations, such as freshly grated . . . and now Kraft has a kind with the grater included so we can grate our cheese to serve it fresh. I still buy large amounts of the good basic grated parmesan in the refillable green shaker container. It is quick, and most people are in a hurry these days. It will keep if we leave it on the table when we eat at the cafeteria. Ususally at home, I keep it in the refrigerator. It is great for a wide range of dishes, including pastas, soups, sauce, snack, bread, and meat. With only ten calories per teaspoon, we can sprinkle on all we want without feeling guilty. The cheese taste is one I crave, and eating Kraft's Parmesan is a good way to satisfy that craving for cheese. Perhaps parmesan cheese has been around since the eighth century B. C. or was it developed about 400 years ago in in the Italian city of Parma? There was a story that near Parma there was a mountain made entirely of parmesan cheese. On top of the mountain a community of macaroini makers cooked hot pasta, bathed it in butter, and rolled it down the mountain to the hungry people below. There is a legend that it was used by Roman legionniares becaue it lasted throughout their long journeys. (I found these stories on Kraft websites, and I could not resist sharing them with you.) Some of our recipes in Flavored with Love: Mary Lou's Family and Friends Can Cook and The Collard Patch call for large amounts of Kraft Parmesan. At my house we use Kraft Parmesan cheese in lasagna, meatballs, collard tortellini, and casseroles containing collard greens! It's delicious. I hope you found this review helpful. Rating: 5.0 Product: Suddenly Pasta Salad, Creamy Parmesan, 6.2-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) Review: We like the ranch and bacon flavor, but it is not what we usually think of when we think pasta salad. We think of something more Italian than ranch when we have pasta. Try it, though. You may love it if you are fond of ranch flavors. Rating: 4.0 Product: Healthy Choice Lunch Express, Italian Style Penne 6.95-Ounce Bowls (Pack of 6) Review: We enjoyed Healthy Choice Fresh Mixers, Zita & Meat Sauce. My friend and I are spicemouths, and we found the mixers decently flavored, perhaps better than some dishes we've tried in Italian restaurants that needed to fire their cooks. We eat in many different restaurants throughout the United States to evaluate the food. What we have discovered is that mediocre food can be made tasty if we apply our emergency taste-enhancer kit. Actually this dish was better than mediocre; in fact it was tasty, especially after we added some items from the kit. (We keep an array of items in our glove compartments of our vehicles and on our breakfast bar.) Realizing that we did not want to alter the calorie-count too much, we added a tiny shake of Kraft Grated Parmesan Cheese - 4.5 lb. container, which was about 10 calories. When we eat pasta, we like a little cheese. Then, being the way we are -- Louisiana and Texas people -- we needed a little kick. We shook on a few flakes of crushed red. (Tone's Spices Red Pepper Crushed (13.5 oz) - Large Restaurant / Food Service Size Shaker Container - Best Value per Ounce-- we really do buy the large restaurant shaker, but we carry a smaller version around with us in the car.) That's all we added, although we do have other items in our emergency supplies. With those two little items, the ziti and meat sauce tasted good. Preparing it was fun. The cute little container with the strainer lid amused me. I thought I would wash it and reuse it, but I was amazed to discover it was engineered for single use. This meal of 340 calories was satisfying and handled our hunger efficiently. It contains 600 mg sodium, which is perhaps a little less than some prepared dishes. I was surprised to see that it contains 990 mg potassium. People with renal disease should probably avoid this product unless they have the approval of their physician or registered dietician. There are 6 grams of total fat and 56 carb grams. With 8 grams of dietary fiber, it should get an approving nod from Weight Watchers. It meets the criteria established by the American Heart Association. I would recommend this dish for anyone who needs to take lunch to work where there is no refrigerator but where there is a microwave oven. I thought we would eat it again soon, but weeks have passed and we are still thinking about it. Mostly recommended. Mary Lou Cheatham, co-author of THE COLLARD PATCH/ Author of FLAVORED WITH LOVE, SOLOMON'S PORCH, DO YOU KNOW HOW GOD LOVES YOU? Rating: 4.0 Product: Sun Maid California Raisins, 12-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6) Review: We like raisins (Sun Maid Raisins, 12-Ounce Bags (Pack of 6)), and if you knew how many we eat, you would be shocked. We eat them on our cold cereal, in our oatmeal, mixed with almonds, stirred up with peanut butter, and by themselves. They are good to eat and good for people. They are pure food . . . "grapes and sunshine" Sun-Maid calls them. They are made in California's San Joaquin Valley from Thompson Seedless grapes. One pound of raisins is 4 pounds of fresh grapes. The hot summer sun makes the grapes sweet and juicy. In addition to snacking on raisins, we like to cook with them. Here's a classic recipe using raisins. My sister Ruth won a prize with it in a cooking show, and she shared it with permission in Flavored with Love: Mary Lou's Family and Friends Can Cook. Ruth's Prize-Winning Broccoli Salad 4 cups broccoli cup raisins cup onion cup nuts cup celery cup real bacon bits cup light mayonnaise cup sugar cup vinegar (apple cider or white) Mix the first 6 ingredients. Make a sauce out of the mayonnaise, sugar, and vinegar. Pour the sauce over the salad. Toss and chill. Lately we are paying more attention to nutrition. Raisns have 130 calories in a 1/4 cup serving. There are condensed food. They contain no fat. They have natural sugar with a large carbohydrate load. One serving has almost no sodium but 310 mg potassium. Diabetics and renal patients should consult with their dieticians before including raisins in their diets. I hope you enjoy Ruth's recipe and find this review helpful. Rating: 5.0 Product: HERSHEY'S Baking Cocoa, SPECIAL DARK Hot Cocoa, 8 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: This box of the most magnificent flavor in the world -- Hershey's Cocoa (Hershey's Cocoa, Natural Unsweetened, 8-Ounce Can (Pack of 6))-- contains the secret of my favorite childhood food memories. My mother could take a box of Hershey's Cocoa and produce a wonderland of culinary treasures. My brother and I convinced her that we could not drink milk unless it was hot cocoa. She wanted us to drink milk; so she made us hot cocoa. She taught me how to do it when I was quite young. The cake! She could make an old-fashioned chocolaty chocolate cake with the fudge frosting that she could make perfectly by cooking it until it was in a soft-ball stage. We found a cake like that at a church bake sell this week. Awww! So good! The candy, the brownies, chocolate pudding . . . her food was marvelous all because of the good old-fashioned cocoa. Many members of my family and many of my friends love Hershey's cocoa too. Is there any other brand? Here's a neat little recipe that is hard to find these days. This one, along with several others, is in Flavored with Love: Mary Lou's Family and Friends Can Cook. A friend gave it to me, and Paul and I cooked it on a local early morning television show. Chocolate Drops 2 cups sugar cup cocoa (Hershey's, of course!) cup evaporated milk 1 stick margarine cup peanut butter 2 teaspoons vanilla 3 cups minute oats Bring the mixture to a rolling boil and let it boil for 1 minute. Drop by teaspoons onto waxed paper. Adding 1/2 cup of toasted pecans enhances the texture and taste of these delicious cookies. I'm very glad that Amazon has started stocking this product. It is an American classic. I always have it in my kitchen. The ingredient in this fantastic box is cocoa, and cocoa is healthy. There are 20 calories in 1 tablespoon. It contains fiber, carbohydrates, and fat. There are always foolproof recipes on the box. Get yourself some Hershey's cocoa and savor it. Rating: 5.0 Product: Mr. Z Premium Cuts Beef Jerky Sweet & Hot Flavor, 1-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12) Review: Mr. Z Premium Cuts Beef Jerky Sweet & Hot Flavor, 1-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12) -- Oh, how delicious! These disappeared quickly at my house. They're sweet enough and not too hot, not at all too hot. The only problem is that they cost a bit more than I think they should. These are great for traveling, snacking, and recrational eating. They're ideal for low carb, high protein diets. I enjoyed the taste very much! Rating: 5.0 Product: Pasta Roni Garlic & Olive Oil Vermicelli Mix (Pack of 12 Boxes) Review: Pasta Roni Garlic & Olive Oil Vermicelli Mix, 4.6-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) is a delicious meal for two. It has 240 calories per serving plus the butter suggested on the package. I chose to use olive oil instead and to half the amount. There are some problems with cooking pasta that the box cannot solve. For example, it is possible to overcook the noodles or to make the sauce too dry or too thin. I decided to add something. The package suggested deli smoked turkey or ham strips and sliced ripe olives. I tried a few chopped onions and sliced mushrooms. I sauteed them in the olive oil before adding the water and packaged ingredients. Then I looked in Flavored with Love: Mary Lou's Family and Friends Can Cook at Mike's Ma's Lasagna and found the meatball recipe there. Yum! With meatballs, it was quite a dish. Rating: 5.0 Product: Nature Valley Crunchy Granola Bars, Oats 'n Honey, 12-Count Bars (Pack of 12) Review: Here is the important information on the product page: Safety Information Contains soy, peanut, almond, hazelnut, walnut and pecan ingredients. Ingredients Whole Grain Rolled Oats, Sugar, Canola Oil, Crisp Rice With Soy Protein (Rice Flour, Soy Protein Concentrate, Sugar, Malt, Salt), Honey, Brown Sugar Syrup, High Fructose Corn Syrup, Salt, Soy Lecithin, Baking Soda, Natural Flavor, Peanut Flour, Almond Flour, Hazelnut Flour, Walnut Flour, Pecan Flour. --- Although I am allergic to peanuts and almonds, I ordered the delicious crunch granola bars, oats and honey flavor. When they arrived in their inviting "100 percent natural, excellent source of whole grain" I could not wait to crunch down on one of these golden delicacies. I quickly discovered that for me these bars are real wheezers. The taste committee living in my house confiscated them. The report is that they are 100 percent delicious. Rating: 5.0 Product: RiceSelect Organic Texmati Brown Rice, 32 oz Jars (Pack of 4) Review: Try RiceSelect Long Grain Texmati Brown Rice, 36-Ounce Jars (Pack of 4) for some very special rice. While it is cooking, it will smell wonderful The fragrance of this rice is difficult to explain. I just know I like it. Maybe it is a little like the smell of bubble gum with earthy overtones and a nutty nuance. See? It's difficult to describe! Texmati aromatic rice is a hybrid of American long-grain rice and basmati. It has more flavor and fragrance than American long-grain rice but less than basmati. Nutrional Information about RiceSelect Long Grain Texmati Brown Rice: Each 1/4 cup uncooked serving provides 170 calories, 1 gram fat (2% Daily Value), 0 grams saturated fat, 0 grams trans fat, 0 milligrams sodium, 35 grams total carbohydrate (11% Daily Value), 2 grams dietary fiber (8% Daily Value) 0 grams sugar, 4 grams protein. Caution: This rice is packaged in a plant that also packages wheat and nuts. While developing the recipes for The Collard Patch, we used it in a hybrid dish. We placed an eclectic group of ingredients in Fish Couvillion, a classic Cajun food. We were working to achieve a Texas variation. Then we served some delicious collard greens over the rice, and we topped it off with the Couvillion. This mixture served on top of the marvelous Texmati Brown rice, which is also a hybrid, is so good that all who ate it kept eating until they could not put another bite into their mouths. I like RiceSelect Long Grain Texmati Brown Rice seasoned simply with butter and a dash of salt. It is so interesting that I like to savor the flavors. I hope you find this review helpful. Rating: 5.0 Product: Crystal Light Sunrise Ruby Red Grapefruit, 3.4-Ounce Unit (Pack of 6) Review: We tried Crystal Light Sunrise Ruby Red Grapefruit, 3.4-Ounce Unit (Pack of 6), and we really liked it. This kind of Crystal Light has a perky flavor. It has a realistic grapefruit taste and just enough sweetness. Review:
I have a gluten intolerance and have been looking for an easy breakfast option for days when I don't have time to heat up a meaty meal.  I am not a huge fan of traditional oatmeal or cream of wheat so I was not expecting this to wow me.  Some reviewers had mentioned the tiny portion size of just 1/3 cup was not enough to satisfy them.  I just received this and quickly made myself a portion. I scooped out 1/3 of a cup of the hot cereal into a bowl and added 1/2 cup of hot skim milk, 1 tbs of real maple syrup, 1/2 banana, and a sprinkle of cinnamon.  I have to admit, it is good!  It has a similar consistency to a thick cream of wheat instead of a steel cut oatmeal.  The portion once made is a generous amount.  If you are used to using preportioned oatmeal sachets from a box then you will be pleasantly surprised at how much just 1/3 of a cup makes you!  It tastes strongly of coconut which I do not mind.  I will purchase another bag so that I won't run out when I start work next week.  I need to go now so that I can finish my bowl before it gets cold! :)

4.0
