Product:
Eight O Clock, Hazelnut, Single-Serve Keurig K-Cup Pods, Medium Roast Coffee, 96 Count (4 Boxes of 24 Pods)
Review:
I prefer dark roast bc I put dairy in my coffee and the taste needs to hold up to that, and this does.  Some dark roasts are just not strong enough to do that, I try new ones and have come to like other brands, but there are many out there not worth buying again.  I would try this if you like dark roast.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Copper Moon Single Cups for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, Kenyan, 20 Count, Medium Roast Coffee, Bold and Chocolatey, with Finishing Hints of Hazelnut, Single-Serve Coffee Pods
Review:
Taste is a personal matter I suppose. I liked the Keurig Kona when it was offered, so I tried one box of this Kona to see if it's one I would take to. I don't like it as much as the Kona I remember, that's all I can say.  It has a bitter or burnt afternote to me, one that I do not care for. I am one for Tully's Italian and Starbucks Verona and the Sumatra coffee beans, they all taste smooth to me and not bitter at all.  Yes, this doesn't seem like a medium roast, more toward a dark roast to me, but I like dark roast bc I put dairy in my coffee...so it's not that that I am concerned about, it's the taste in general.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Copper Moon Single Cups for Keurig K-Cup Brewers, Kenyan, 20 Count, Medium Roast Coffee, Bold and Chocolatey, with Finishing Hints of Hazelnut, Single-Serve Coffee Pods
Review:
Excellent coffee, not bitter, just plain good.  I found it in The Christmas Tree Shoppes, sold in boxes of 12 for $6.99.  If you get a good price for it, try it.  I use dairy in my coffee, so I like a 'dark roast' and this is dark roast. If you like something milder, try their Costa Rican variety, it's a medium roast.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Torani Toasted Hazelnut Flavored Coffee, Single Serve Cups for Keurig K Cups Brewer, 24 Count
Review:
Excellent taste, not bitter, smooth.  It is like Keurig's Tully's Italian which is one of my top 3 faves.  I use the larger, 8 oz cup setting on my Keurig machine for each one of these servings. Then I add some dairy to my coffee. I always buy 'dark' roast bc I do dilute it w/dairy, and this is one that I would buy again.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tully's Coffee Italian Roast, 24-Count K-Cups for Keurig Brewers (Pack of 2)
Review:
I have been taste-testing so many brands and roasts of k-cups to determine our favorites that I feel like a 'lab rat.'  The Tully's Italian Roast immediately stood out from the rest--love at first sip! The other reviews are accurate by describing it as aromatic, smooth and flavorful, not bitter nor weak. I make my first cup of the morning by using one k-cup on the large cup setting, then I make my add'l cups of coffee using one k-cup and a combination of both the middle and smallest cup; that way I get more coffee using one K-cup. It still holds a robust flavor but just not as heavily as the first, which is what I like to do after drinking sev'l cups.  I use cream & sugar, so this routine works for me.  You may or may not tend to tweak your ritual the same way, but it just goes to show you that you can "think out of the k-cup."
Rating:
5.0
Product:
International Delight, French Vanilla, Single-Serve Coffee Creamers, 24 Count (Pack of 6), Shelf Stable Non-Dairy Flavored Coffee Creamer, Great for Home Use, Offices, Parties or Group Events
Review:
We are heading to Italy in Sept and bringing our coffeemaker and these mini moos along! I bought these at Sam's, for half the price, so FYI.  The expiration date is 3 months from now, early Dec.  I don't think these items ever are more than 3 months expiration.  That is the nature of the beast.  It cannot last months and months up to a year b/c it is real dairy. If you get these with an expiration time frame of 2 or so months to use up, as others have 'complained' of, then you are in the ballpark. What I like about this product vs. others that came before it, is that this is the real deal which is so much better than imitation non-dairy creamer substitutes.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Timothy's World Coffee Canarino, Italian Hot Lemon Beverage, K-Cups for Keurig Brewers, 25-Count Boxes (Pack of 2)
Review:
First off, I am an avid coffee drinker, only drinking tea when I eat out at Chinese restaurants or am under the weather--then I will only drink decaf green tea. I also like the taste of lemon. I may not be a bonafide tea drinker, but I know what I like. That being said, upon receiving a sample box of Canarino and having a cough/cold this week, I tried the Canarino instead of my usual go-to green tea. I loved it! What a nice change of pace. It wasn't bitter whatsoever to my taste. I sipped it w/o honey or sugar. I used the 8oz. serving cup size, just fine. It was smooth and light and kept my throat moist and was very comforting. It reminded me of Thera-flu w/out all the added medicinals. When I'm over this cold, I just might try it with a little added splash of my Limoncello!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
REESE'S Peanut Butter Cups, Dark Chocolate Candy, 1.5 Ounce (Pack of 24)
Review:
My young granddaughter just finished oral immunotherapy for peanut allergies and now she can eat peanuts. She had her first Reese's peanut butter cup on her last day, her graduation day, she swooned.  I found out later they came in DARK chocolate, and we all love dark vs milk chocolate, so this was a no brainer. It came today and it is just right.  I love the soft creamy bite you get.  I had previously purchased buckeyes in dark chocolate which basically are a peanut creamy center like this, but shaped like a truffle.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't the same thing I was hoping for.  The top of the 'buckeye' has a harder piece of lighter chocolate "the eye" and I always removed it bc I like the softer bite you get from Reese's.  It's a personal preference, but that's how all our food preferences are.  And this one is mine.  I can't wait to share it with my granddaughter when I see her this weekend.  She will like these even more now!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Cento Tomato Puree, 28-Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
I am a Baby Boomer and my mom taught me years back how to make Italian sauce. She used Progresso Puree then, I can't find it anymore.  I then made sauce of my own creation and touches, and altho' I get raves about it, I felt it needed something.  I find that adding a good puree to your main sauce using whole plum tomatoes is 'the secret sauce' to good Italian sauce.  It thins out the pour of the sauce without it being loose and runny. Without the balance of thick to creamy in a sauce, it is either too clumpy and gloppy or too runny. I like that the ingredient list has ONE ingredient:  VINE RIPENED TOMATOES.  You can't get more straightforward than that. When I make other dishes other than Italian style--Indian for instance--or even stuffed cabbage which also needs a base of tomato sauce--this is good to use bc there is no added herbs or seasonings to make it lean one way or the other.  I don't need basil or anything in my sauce bc I can add it myself.  It makes the sauce start out with a clean slate so to speak, ready for whatever you need to turn it into to be distinctive to that dish.  I order it by the case from Amazon, and it comes out to less than $2 a can.  I have tried other Italian brands of canned tomato products that I like, but even some of their purees are not to my liking, they are not as fresh tasting as this is.  It is also a product of Italy.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Eden Organic Kamut Elbows, 100% Whole Grain, 14-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
I like this one and the Eden Kamut ditalini--tastes as good as the best of them. They don't fall apart when boiling, like some other grains and combination of grains do--so they are no-fuss to cook up. Made macaroni salad with it today and it tastes great.  Also, this has 6 grams of fiber per 2 oz serving.
Rating:
5.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Mariani Sun Ripened Mixed Fruit No Sugar Added Dried Fruit 36 Ounce Value Bag
Review:
Italian Plums have always been used to make prunes. When allowed to ripen on the vine (tree), these plums are out of this world. The skin of this beautiful dark purple and oval-shaped plum contains very sweet, slightly firm flesh surrounding a small seed that doesn't cling. All this is what makes for a delicious prune when dried.

I noted the other fruits do come from other countries, but so do many of the fresh fruits we purchase in markets and we usually don't know where they came from.

I can't imagine that dried fruit from Costco would necessarily be a better product, especially if it's a house brand. I've noticed lately that some of their products have deteriorated in quality, i.e., baby wipes, bath tissues, to name a couple.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Hungarian Sweet Paprika, 5-Ounce Tins (Pack of 6)
Review:
I was in the middle of making chicken paprikash and noticed that my can of Szeged Sweet Paprika was getting low. When I checked my last purchase on Amazon it was no longer available from that vendor. I paid $8.40 for a 5 oz. can, which really turned out to be fortunate for me -- I frantically started checking for another vendor of Hungarian Paprika and came across this terrific bargain. Even though Prime doesn't apply to this, I'm only paying $30.00 for 6 cans. Since I use 1/4 cup per recipe, I'll probably go through that amount fairly quickly.

Imported to the US directly from Kalocsa Paprika Ltd., Kalocsa, this Szeged Sweet Paprika is an absolute necessity if you plan on making authentic Hungarian Chicken Paprikash.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Torani Sugar Free Syrup, Coconut, 33.8 Ounce (Pack of 3)
Review:
The product is great. I really enjoy the brown sugar and cinnamon in my oatmeal and have been using it for quite some time now. Each time I purchased it in the past it was sold and shipped by Amazon at $23.91 for 3 bottles. Torani, in most flavors, is sold locally at $4.99 for a 33.8 oz. bottle. Unfortunately, none of the local stores have started carrying this flavor yet, so I figured that paying Amazon $7.97 per bottle shipped with my Prime wasn't such a bad deal. Now Amazon has a third party selling it for $29.65 per 3 bottles, plus $8.91 for shipping. $12.85 per bottle is just a little more than I'm willing to pay for something I can order directly from the Torani people.

Update: 09/23/2013:
Sellers may actually pay attention to reviews **SURPRISE** as the price for this product came down from $29.65 yesterday to $24.99 + shipping @ $13.75 today. Too late, though, since I purchased it directly from Torani yesterday for $22.05 + shipping @ $6.95.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
NuSci Aspartame Pure Powder 227 grams (8.0 oz) Low Calorie Sweetener
Review:
This is really wonderful. I have been using it in drinks, tea, coffee and anything else that I want sweetened, including cooking with it. I mix it in my oatmeal before microwaving -- so delicious. Up until now I've been using Equal, but its first ingredient is Dextrose w/Maltodextrin (sugar) which, in my opinion, defeats the purpose of using it. Can't tell the difference between using the pure Aspartame powder or using Equal.

The only thing I wish NuSci would do is to pack it directly in a glass or plastic jar. It takes some dexterity to transfer from the plastic package. It is so much easier to use by "spooning" it out of a jar. As for the packaging itself, I must admit is excellent. The powder is in a heavy plastic zipped bag with the label on it, which is then placed into another heavy zipped plastic bag.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Equal 0 Calorie Sweetener, Granulated 4 oz (Pack of 8)
Review:
I notice that a number of people giving a one-star rating say it is not as sweet as what is in Equal packets. The reason for that may be because Equal packets contain Dextrose, Maltodextrin, Aspartame and Acesulfame Potassium. Equal Spoonful contains Maltodextrin, Aspartame, Acesulfame Potassium -- it doesn't have Dextrose in it. Dextrose is sugar (actually a simple sugar) which also helps dissolve the product more quickly.

In the past I have purchased pure Aspartame from Amazon (NuSci Aspartame Pure Powder 227 grams (8.0 oz) Low Calorie Sweetener) which is quite difficult to dissolve and it too has a different taste. However, it's good if you want plain Aspartame.

I have been using Equal for  50 years and for the information of anyone terrified of Aspartame, I don't have any of the diseases with which quacks insist on threatening people who do use it.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
York Sugar Free Peppermint Patties Dark Chocolate Covered Mint Candy, 3 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
Maltitol, Lactitol, Isomalt and Sorbitol -- the sugar substitutes used in this product can be pure poison to some individuals.  I am one of those people.  Granted, the makers of this product warn it can have a laxative effect (that's from the above-mentioned sugar substitutes, not the product itself), but some of us go way beyond experiencing a laxative effect to debilitating diarrhea even with moderate consumption of cookies or candies made with these sugar substitutes.
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Szeged Hungarian Paprika, Sweet, 5 Ounce
Review:
I am cleaning out my spice cabinet and came across this identical can of Szeged Rose Paprika at the very back. The only difference I can see between mine and the picture on here is the top. Mine is white with 3 ways to open -- sift, spoon or pour -- and all are very difficult to open. This can is very old, decades, and I was trying to figure out why it is still here. I suppose it's nostalgia because I certainly wasn't using it. Occasionally over the years I have tried to find this product and couldn't. I decided to Google it and arrived here. After reading the reviews, I realize why it wasn't being used. It is a very dark red and has a bitter, not sweet, taste. I have purchased other brands and been disappointed. None of them met the standards of the one my mother used which is why I kept trying to find this brand, hoping I just got a bad batch. I am going to purchase a can and see what I end up with this time.

BTW, no bugs and if there were, they certainly would have had decades to do their thing.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Roasted Unsalted Jumbo Peanuts, Blanched, 5 Pound Bulk Bag - We Got Nuts
Review:
These peanuts are perfect. I tried to cancel my order when I read the description again and noticed it says "Jumbo" but it was too late. Yee Haw, I am so happy it was too late to cancel. These will be the right size to use in my Microwave Peanut Brittle.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Arrowhead Mills Organic Buckwheat Groats, 24-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)
Review:
Beat an egg into 1 cup of the buckwheat groats, place it in a dry pan that has been heated over medium or slightly higher heat. Stir constantly until the buckwheat is toasted to suit you. The egg coats the kernels and keeps them from sticking together while cooking. Bring 2 cups of chicken broth to a boil (water or vegetable broth if you don't eat meat) along with 2 Tbsp. of chicken fat (I always save some fat when I cook a chicken) or oil, salt, and ground pepper if you like. Add the buckwheat to the hot broth, stir and let it come back to a boil, then reduce heat to the lowest setting. Cover and cook for 10 minutes or till the liquid is absorbed.

Dice a medium size onion, do the same with about 1/2 pound of white or brown mushrooms, crush 2 cloves of garlic (it must have garlic...:-). Mix these ingredients together while you heat another pan containing about 2 Tbsp. chicken fat (or oil) and saute the mixture, adding salt, and pepper.

Stir the two mixtures together and enjoy.

Yum, it tastes just the way my mother used to make Kasha.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Organic Kasha / Roasted Buckwheat, 18 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I just sent this to the place where I buy bulk foods:

"I have not yet purchased this product from Honeyville, but I read the 3 reviews. One said the seeds were broken up... not good. I originally bought a 30# bag locally and all the seeds are perfect in shape and well toasted. This makes wonderful Kasha, but I am gradually running out and need to locate a new source to purchase.

Is the Buckwheat from Honeyville toasted, is it raw? And are some of the seeds truly broken up?

I don't know how to rate this as I have never yet purchased anything from Bob's Red Mill.
Rating:
3.0

Product:
Bob's Red Mill Organic Grain Quinoa, 26 Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)
Review:
I just received this today and started cooking with it.  I've used other brands of quinoa and Bob's is as good as any I've ever used, if not better.  The flavor is plain and you can add your own spices.  This could be used as a breakfast cereal or as a dinner side dish.  I am on a diet to avoid the white stuff - white potatoes, white rice, white pasta, and white flour because of health concerns.  This is a welcome tasty addition to my new diet.

I cooked mine in the microwave like I do with rice, but it did not require as much time to absorb the water.  One cup quinoa with 1 cup water, and less than 10 minutes on high with cook it up nice and fluffy.  Microwaves are all different, so your timing will depend on your microwave's power.  Mine is a low 800 watt compact microwave, and like I said, it was done in less than 10 minutes.

My local market carries Bob's products, but not this quinoa.  One small box of quinoa costs about 2 times what I paid on subscribe and save.  I've stored the unused unopened bags in my freezer for save keeping so they don't turn rancid before I use them, but I think I will be eating a lot of this, so I don't think it will have a chance to get rancid anyway.  It tends to fill you up, so a little goes a long way.
Rating:
5.0

golds.output: Mavuno Harvest Fair Trade Organic Dried Fruit, Banana is a good product that I enjoyed. The dried bananas are a nice, healthy snack that are easy to take on the go. I like that they are fair trade and organic, as that aligns with my values. The bananas themselves are sweet and chewy, with a good texture. I was a little disappointed that some of the bananas were a bit too dry, but overall they were a good snack. I would recommend them to anyone looking for a healthy, fair trade option.

Product:
Pastariso Instant Rice Mac and Cheese Meal Cup, 2 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I wasn't expecting much from the Pastariso Instant Rice Mac and Cheese Meal Cup, and that is pretty much what I got.
It would have actually been better than expected except for the fact that the product's cardboard container makes it taste like, you guessed it, cardboard. Preparation was easy and fast. I did not have any issues with it spilling in my microwave, or coming out "soupy" and unevenly cooked. The gluten free rice macaroni was actually better than expected, and the cheese sauce came out well after letting the product sit for a minute. Unfortunately, there's no getting past the cardboard taste. It doesn't make the Pastariso Instant Rice Mac and Cheese Meal Cup inedible, but it makes it just bad enough to not recommend it.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Barilla Organic Pasta, Spaghetti & Penne, 16 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
Barilla Organic Pasta, Spaghetti & Penne is made from certified USDA Organic ingredients, and contains no GMO ingredients. This variety pack contains 3 boxes of USDA Organic Spaghetti Pasta and 3 boxes of Organic Penne Pasta. The pasta cooks up al dente, and has the same texture and great taste of regular Barilla Pasta. I enjoyed it.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Wholesome Organic Pancake Syrup, Non GMO, 20 fl oz (Pack of 6)
Review:
Wholesome Sweeteners Organic Pancake Syrup is a good tasting pancake syrup, but the best part is that it doesn't contain high fructose corn syrup. Honestly, I have no idea how much healthier organic cane sugar syrup really is, but I do know how bad high fructose corn syrup is. My doctor calls it  "evil". On his advice,  I've eliminated most of it from my diet, and lost 20 pounds in 6 months. I feel better too.

Wholesome Sweeteners Organic Pancake Syrup is a nice thick syrup, almost the consistency of maple syrup. It isn't quite as good as maple syrup though, but I didn't expect it to be. It does tatse better than the usual store bought syrups, but also costs about twice as much. It costs less per ounce than maple syrup though. I like Wholesome Sweeteners Organic Pancake Syrup, and will use it in the future.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Community Coffee Ground Coffee, Breakfast Blend, (Pack of 3)
Review:
Community Coffee Ground Coffee "Breakfast Blend" is a very good medium roast coffee made with 100% Arabica coffee beans. I generally do not like dark roasts, especially the blends found at most popular chain coffee houses. I also find light roasts to be bland and/or weak, so medium roasts are my blend of choice. Community Coffee Breakfast Blend  definitely falls in the category of medium roast, and I like it a lot. While there isn't anything really distinctive about the taste, it's just good coffee. If I had to compare it to another coffee, to me it tastes similar to McDonald's Premium Roast Coffee, which to me is also very good. Community Coffee Breakfast Blend isn't bitter. It's somewhat mellow but not weak, and very smooth. Medium roast fans should really like it. Light and dark roast drinkers probably won't hate it either.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
ACUTEfruit 8x24 Tropical Blast, 8-Ounce (Pack of 24)
Review:
ACUTEfruit Tropical Blast is non-carbonated fruit blend energy drink that unlike most energy drinks contains 50% fruit juice and only 70 calories. It also contains 3g of Fiber, and is loaded with B Vitamins. ACUTEfruit Tropical Blast  gets it's energy mostly from the small amount of caffeine (47mg) from Guarana and Yerba Mate. It does not provide the jolt that the mega caffeine, high sugar energy drinks provide. This can be a positive or a disappointment depending on what you're expecting. There is no "crash" after drinking ACUTEfruit Tropical Blast which is a major plus. Taste wise, I find the apple and orange juice combination to pleasant enough. I find canned orange juice to always have a strange taste with an almost medicine like after taste, and ACUTEfruit Tropical Blast has a little bit of that. The apple juice does a pretty good job of masking it though.

I like ACUTEfruit Tropical Blast. It gives me the same boost as a cup of coffee despite having less caffeine, and the ingredients are somewhat healthier than the average energy drink.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Eight O'Clock Coffee, Original Ground, 12-Ounce Bag (Pack of 4)
Review:
Everyone has different tastes, but Eight O'Clock is my favorite coffee. It's a smooth, medium-mild blend. Drinkers of dark blend coffees will probably prefer 8 O'Clock 100% Columbian. It is stronger and bolder. Both are excellent coffees, and moderately priced.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Balance Bar, Chocolate Caramel Peanut Nougat, 1.41 ounce bars 6 count, Chocolate Caramel Peanut Nougat Nutrition Bar
Review:
Balance Chocolate Peppermint Patty, 1.41 ounce bars are chewy candy bar like snacks that taste quite good, but I'm not a fan of the very chewy like texture. The bars are gluten and wheat free, and contain slightly less calories, sugar, and fat than a standard candy bar. They also contain some fiber too. Price wise, they cost about twice as much as a candy bar. In the end, Balance Chocolate Peppermint Patty, 1.41 ounce bars aren't bad. I can see people really enjoying them is they want a chewy candy bar like snack. To me though, I was expecting something a little different than what tastes like just another candy bar.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Maxwell House Master Blend Ground Coffee, 11.5-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
Maxwell House Coffee "South Pacific Blend" is an excellent medium-dark roast blend. If you like Maxwell House Coffee "Original Blend", then you'll probably like "South Pacific Blend". In fact, they taste almost the same to me. The only real difference is that the "South Pacific Blend" is a slightly darker roast. I've never seen Maxwell House Coffee "South Pacific Blend" in my local stores, so it may be hard to find other than online. I recommend trying it if you get a chance, as long as you enjoy original Maxwell House, and like a medium-dark roast.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Snack Factory Pretzel Crisps, Original, 7.2 Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
Snack Factory Organic Pretzel Crisps are a tasty snack that are excellent for dipping.  Basically they're thing flat pretzels. They aren't overly salty and taste good with or without dip. The ingredients are good too. The crisps are USDA Organic and Non-GMO Project Verified. The only negative and the reason I can't give them 5 stars is that the majority of them were broken inside the bag. It was kind of disappointing.  Other than that, I really like them.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Quaker Instant Oatmeal Original, 12 Packets per Box (Pack of 4)
Review:

Review:
Purchased this locally.
It works very well for putting you to sleep and I was well rested in the AM. I have now switched to passion flower, though.
Side Effects of the tea:  After several days of drinking 1-2 cups a night, I had severe side effects to the saint johns wort.  A rare-ish side effect of saint johns wort is myelin sheath damage from the sun.  Basically after drinking this for a few days, my arms legs and face began to tingle after being in the sunlight for even a few minutes.  I researched all the ingredients in this tea and turns out saint johns wort, which there are TWO types of it in this tea, is the culprit.  This tea is the only thing I changed, and when I stopped drinking it, after 2 days or so, the tingling numbness in my body went away, I can now be in the sun without issue.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Altoids Peppermint Mints - 6 paks
Review:
I've carried a tin of Altoids with me since I was a kid in grade school, well over sixty years ago.  Of course, the tin is what attracted me to the product but then I got hooked on the burst of peppermint in my mouth. There is something so old world soothing about opening the tin, gently parting the thin foldover paper, and choosing just one mint, refolding the paper and snapping the tin shut.  I've never gotten tired of that experience.

Altoids, the curiously strong mints, have not changed their recipe in over 200 years, using only natural flavors.  The explosion of peppermint when placed on the tongue is truly a treat which I'll never be without.  Refreshing experience from such a little lozenge.
And a delightful refresher after a meal without adding but a couple of calories.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Harney & Sons Caffeinated Hot Cinnamon Sunset Black Tea with Orange and Cloves Tin 20 Sachets
Review:
This is a wonderful cinnamon spice flavored tea which is caffeinated.  I prefer the caffeinated for mornings and an herbal tea in the evenings.  I ran across the Sunset tea at my local Walmart at about half the price of Amazon so I purchased a tin of 20.  The bags are mesh in a pyramid shape, giving full brewing access to the tea.  I normally use a half teaspoon of honey in my teas but this particular tea doesn't require any extra sweetner.

I find that the tea bag is strong enough to brew a double cup as 8 oz. of water is just too little and makes quite a potent brew.  I keep an extensive variation of teas to suit my mood but find that this Harney and Sons Hot Cinnamon Sunset is one of my go to flavors.  As an added plus, the kitchen smells wonderful while the cup is steeping.  Even my husband comments on how good it smells and he's not a tea drinker.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Mrs. Dash, Seasoning Blend, Onion & Herb, 2.5 Ounce
Review:
This product by Mrs. Dash is one of the better salt free blends in the product line.  I use several Mrs. Dash items and like to switch up the seasonings.  Too much pepper bothers me and this one particular blend doesn't have as much pepper in it as some other Mrs. Dash products although pepper is the third ingredient listed.  The onion and herb flavors are not over powering but of course, can be strengthened with a heavier application of it.

My household is not on a salt restriction diet but as we get older we try to cut down on it and the Mrs. Dash products give us lots of flavor without the salt, which then we use so much more sparingly.  I find the Onion and Herb flavors compliment pork really well and I like to use it on our vegetables.  We keep three of the Mrs. Dash mixtures on our spice shelf, the original being the most used.  It's a very good product that enhances the flavors of grilled meats and veggies.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Keebler Club Crackers Original, 13.7 Oz. (Pack of 3)
Review:
A salad or a bowl of soup is just not complete without Keebler Club Crackers.  We have eaten these crackers for many years now and after trying out several brands and store brands, always come back to Keebler.  They are so light and tender with a buttery flavor and seem to just melt in our mouths.

I always have a box on hand and they stay fresh and crisp.  I roll down the top on a partially used sleeve of the crackers and gently put a rubber band lengthwise on it.  This has always worked, even in the hot humid summers. Keebler club crackers may cost a little more but are totally worth the extra expense.

These in no way resemble a saltine, which have their own place in the kitchen.  Yummy good.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Betty Crocker, Muffin Mix, Authenic Cornbread & Muffin Mix, 6.5-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6)
Review:
Betty Crocker cornbread mix is by far the best mix that I've found.  Most of the mixes I've tried are much too sweet and we don't care for a heavy sweetness when paired with ham and beans or homemade vegetable soup.  It is super easy as it only requires three ingredients to be added, milk, egg and butter.  It turns out light and tender and rises very well.  It has that wonderful cornbread taste that so many of the other mixes are lacking. I've tried many recipes through the years and have not found one that is better than this mix,  the recipes make way too much anyway and I have to throw the leftovers out for the birds.

I have a small cast iron skillet that I bake this in as it seems to be the perfect size and as the pan is old and well seasoned, the cornbread pops out without sticking.  I've also made muffins and cornbread sticks with it.  Actually it depends on what we're having with it that determines what pan I'll use.  The envelope makes just the right amount for the two of us and with enough left over for another meal.  If you have more than three or four in your family, you'll probably need to use two packets.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tone's Minced Onion - 15 oz shaker
Review:
I have had a large container of Tone's dried minced onion in my pantry supplies for years now and am constantly reaching for them.  If I'm making a big pot of soup or stew I'll use fresh onions but for small jobs, the dried onions are indispensable.  I love to put them in my tuna or chicken salads as they reconstitute with the available ground up sweet pickle juices and make a much nicer consistency of salads.

I find that the onion flavor is milder than fresh onions but that is one of the reasons why I like to use them, they're not overpowering.  And I really don't like the crunch of freshly chopped onion in my sandwiches and I hardly know they're in the recipe except for the subtle flavor.  These are also great to mix with ground beef when grilling hamburgers for when I don't have any fresh onions on hand to slice.

I find that they never spoil and keep their flavor indefinitely which is a big money saver as fresh onions can turn on me quite quickly no matter how I store them.  This large size container is so much more economical than a small bottle off the spice shelf. They reconstitute quickly in a little warm water if I should want to plump them up before using.  Great product!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Hidden Valley Original Ranch Seasoning and Salad Dressing Mix, 16 Ounce
Review:
If you are like me and use Hidden Valley Ranch and Seasoning mix in much of your cooking, then this 16 oz. container is the only way to go.  I have found such a wide range of uses that are enhanced with this seasoning mix.  To name a few; our hearty Taco Soup that is a go to in the winter, sprinkled on cubed potatoes that are then oven browned, sprinkled over baked potatoes, sprinkled on popcorn, sprinkled on steamed broccoli and green beans, mixed with sour cream or plain yogurt for a tasty dip, the applications are as endless as your imagination.  And on occasion I do actually make a dressing for salads with this!  So simple and fresh tasting. I used to only buy the envelopes but as I found the bountiful ways to use it, I had to go with the bulk containers.  As I cannot find this larger container in my local Walmart, Amazon provides a great and economical place to get it.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Knorr Rice Side Dish, Cheddar Broccoli, 5.7 oz, Pack of 12
Review:
To my way of thinking Knorr's Taco Rice is one of their best products.  The flavor is great, not too spicy nor too salty.  When cooked, which doesn't take but 7 or 8 minutes, each kernel stays separated, not gummed together.  This holds true even when cold.  If you prefer a little more seasoning, then you're free to add a little more taco seasoning on your own.

I was beating my head against the pantry door one night trying to think of something very easy to fix and yet with substance and flavor.  I pulled out a packet of this Taco Rice and just happened to glance at the back.  There was a recipe for Taco Vegetable Pie.  I had the ground beef, the diced tomatoes, cheese and tortillas.  Oh Boy.

The recipe called for the addition of frozen mixed vegetables which I didn't have but my husband wouldn't have like them added anyway.  All it was consisted of was browning the ground beef and adding the drained diced tomatoes and a spoonful of chili seasoning but I used extra taco seasoning instead as we like that flavor.  Fixing the rice as directed I then layered a third of the beef mixture, a third of the rice and a fourth cup of grated cheddar cheese and to finish the layer, a tortilla. Repeat this process for another layer and end up with the beef, rice and cheese on top.  Bake at 350 until heated through.  20 or 25 min.  Serve with chopped lettuce or sour cream.

This was simply delicious and a nice reprieve from my husband's regular meat and potatoes.  The left overs heated very nicely so this made two meals for us.

I make a Texas skillet with gr. beef, rice, kidney beans, mushrooms, cheese, tomato sauce and lots of chili powder and this Taco Rice will make a wonderful substitute for the plain minute rice.

The rice used in this Knorr package is more like whole grain rice and keeps a good solid texture to is that is so much more appetizing than a faster rice.  I think the application of this rice in recipes would be endless.  Knorr really hit a home run with this particular rice mix.  I know that I will always keep a supply of this Taco Rice on hand because it can be used so many ways.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Chef Boyardee Pizza Sauce with Cheese, 15 oz, 12 Pack
Review:
I was first introduced to pizza around 1960 when the Chef Boyardee Pizza kits came out.  I thought it was the most wonderful thing created but I can remember my dad hating the "stinky" smell of the Parmesan cheese as it baked.

I've tried other pizza sauces down through the years and have found a couple that are acceptable but none is as good as the Chef Boyardee sauce.  After many years, the company started selling the sauce in a can by itself.  This was great as I didn't like to have to buy the whole kit, preferring different cheese adorning my pizzas.

There is no other taste quite like this sauce.  It's thick and rich and savory, complementing whatever I top my pizza with.  I just purchased a can and stuck my spoon in after opening...wow....I was once again transported back over half a decade.  Nothing like it.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Gulden's, Spicy Brown Mustard, 12oz Bottle (Pack of 2)
Review:
Gulden's mustard has been in my refrigerator for years now, the brand of mustard, not the same bottle.  I will say that I like a variety of mustards on hand for different foods such as a horseradish mustard, a hot mustard, a smoked mustard, a dill mustard and plain old yellow mustard.  But Gulden's is the mustard I reach for for the main usage.

It goes with just about any sandwich, works well in home made salad dressings and blends up well in marinades.  It is delicious served with cold roast beef or roast pork on the side and the blend of spices compliments just about any application you would want to use it for.  You know it's really good when there are less that six ingredients listed on the label.  No long list of unpronounceable additives or enhancers.  No fat making be a very healthy flavor boost when watching calories.  A tried and true product that's been around for decades.
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Product:
JUST LIKE SUGAR Just Like Sugar, 5.82 Ounce
Review:
I purchased a bag of this product which cost about $20 with shipping. The bag isn't quite as big as buying a bag of regular sugar,so in comparison, it's really expensive. That wouldn't bother me if I had been more pleased with it, but it really IS NOT just like sugar.. It's not as sweet at all and just doesn't work that great for baking, which is what I purchased it for. My husband is diabetic and really misses cookies, and we don't want to use any of the artificail sweetners on the market because of all the health hazards connected to them. But Just Like Sugar is not the answer. I made one batch of oatmeal cookies, one pan of brownies and one batch of no bake cookies with this one bag of product, so it cost almost $7 per batch for the sweetner!!! The oatmeal cookies were just so so.. not bad, but not great.. definatly not as sweet as they should have been and they had a different kind of texture.. I'm not quite sure how to describe it..Kind of grainy... The brownies, horrible!! A recipe that normally makes delicious brownies turned out flat and not very tasty. We ate one brownie each and threw the rest out. The no bake cookies were ok, probably the best out of the three recipes, but still not that great... My package of Just Like Sugar also included a small sample of the Just Like Brown Sugar.. I put it on my oatmeal but could barely tell there was any sugar on it..
All in all, I guess if you have no alternative it's better than nothing, but I won't ever purchase it again.. I'll stick to Stevia, which is also a natural product and is super duper sweet! I thought the Just Like Sugar would be more convenient because the makers of it claim you use the very same amount in recipes as real sugar, and with Stevia, there's a lot of conversion.. But the claims just aren't true... You'd need to use quite a bit more of the Just Like Sugar in order to have the same sweetness as sugar. Very dissapointing.. After all the hoopla about this product and supposed feedback from happy customers, it just simply doesn't live up to the claims.
Rating:
2.0
</Other Writer-1>

</otherwriters>

Product:

Review:
Bought the Variety Pack to try some new coffees - Barista Prima House Blend, Donut Shop, and Fair Trade Colombian are the house standards.

The Martinson Dark Roast is OK - similar to Donut Shop - and about what you'd expect at a donut shop.  Not as strong Dunkin' as I would expect (or want) from a DARK ROAST.  I like my coffee to provide a rich, robust, deep flavor - just short of French or Italian or Espresso roasts - Starbuck's Morning Joe, for example.  This ain't it.  Not dreadful but nothing to displace the current house favorites.

House Blend is pretty lame (or tame if you're being charitable).  Weaker than Donut Shop - if Donut Shop is a 4 on a 5-point scale, Dark Roast would be a 3 and House Blend a 2.  Just not much by way of rich coffee flavor or aroma.

Final word: these K-cups are being shelved and will bring them out to offer to my in-laws when they invade the house (they all drink coffee with milk and sugar so what difference does the coffee make - not that they have ever actually finished a cup - they just make 'em and then leave them all over the house for me to find after they leave...sometimes LONG after they leave since they "hide" them all over).  Whew.  I feel much better.

But no more Martinsons.

Product:
Mad Dog 357 Silver Collector's Edition with bullet Key Chain Hot Sauce, 5oz
Review:
I didn't purchase this on Amazon. However, i thought i would share my story as a survivor of the Mad Dog bite. Here is my account as posted on a blog site i use.

So, a new store opened in the Gateway shopping district in downtown Salt Lake City recently called Hot Sauce & Things (at least, i think that's what it was called...my memory is a little shaky after....). Shelly and i wandered in there last Sunday out of curiosity and boredom. There were only three other people in the store....the employee, a nice Korean girl (comes into play later) and a young couple who had name tags from another store in the Gateway. Anyway, they were sitting at the bar which also functions as a checkout stand trying hot sauces. After a minute of browsing, i here the guy exclaim, "Ooh, that's HOT!". The employee was like "Yeah, I'm Korean, and i cant even eat more than a toothpick's (dipped in) worth. Ahhh....now my interest and curiosity were piqued.
The couple left without buying anything. Shelly and i had already grabbed a few promising sauces to try out at home. I walked up and asked the girl if we could try the last one the dude before us had tried. She said it was the hottest one sold. However, before you can try it, you have to build up to it. Thus began my journey through five continents and twenty four different hot sauces, ranging from the jalapeno based sauces, through the habanero based ones, and past the ghost pepper based sauces, to be greeted by my twenty fifth and final opponent, the Mad Dog 357 (complete with bullet holes and a whole list of caveats printed on the bottle. Let me just say, prior to that one, my mouth was already on fire and my insides were feeling a bit shaky. Afterwards.....well, lets just say i abhor even the thought of consuming milk, but quickly drank deeply of the chocolate milk they also sold there. I felt buzzed out and disoriented, like i had just left a bar in the new light of the morning sun after having sat in the dark and dank establishment all night. My heart was racing and my body felt like a balsa wood building try to stand against hurricane winds.
Needless to say, i bought a bottle, took it to work, and made every single person i work with try it (in many cases i tried it again with them). Word got out and for the next three days (including today), doctors, nurses and administrators all came down to try this now legendary hot sauce (i work in a hospital). Best dollars i ever spent!
Rating:
5.0
</Other Writer-1>

</otherwriters>

1. I'm a chocolate lover. 2. I'm mildly allergic to milk. 3. I'm on a low carb diet. 4. I hate artificial colors, flavors, and sweeteners. So what should I do? Voila! Lily's came out with an entire line of chocolate bars that have just a little milk fat (not enough to trigger my allergies), no sugar, and no artificial sweeteners. They have the ONLY bars sweetened with Stevia, and what is most amazing is that they are wonderfully delicious! I always hated that nasty aftertaste of any chocolate I ate, but the only aftertaste with this product is a wonderful chocolatey coconutty flavor that is simply divine. Fact is, I never understood my wife's love of chocolate; I hated the stuff. But that was because of the milk and sweeteners. Since we discovered Lily's, I find I am completely, irrevocably, in love with their chocolate bars. I can't say enough good about them. No worries about sugar impact. Very few calories. Product:
SweetLeaf Sweet Drops Liquid Stevia Sweetener, Vanilla Creme, 2 Ounce
Review:
This vanilla creme stevia is a critical ingredient in our low carb green tea frappuccino recipe. It gives the frapp sweetness and vanilla flavoring without any calories, and is absolutely fantastic. I have also taken carbonated water and added a few drops to make a creme soda to good effect, but the frapp is my favorite. The price is excellent and the product absolutely fantastic. No bad aftertaste, just a nice sweet drink that is reminiscent of creme sodas from my childhood. By the way, if you are interested in a low carb frapp recipe, here is ours:

Ingredients:
1 cup Silk Unsweetened Soy Milk
1 level tsp Matcha Powder
1/2 eyedropper Vanilla Creme Sweet Leaf Liquid Stevia
3/4 cup crushed ice
Whipped Cream for topping (optional)

Put all ingredients in your Bullet blender (if you don't have one of these, you owe it to yourself to buy one Right Now!) and blend for one minute.  This tastes just like the Starbucks Green Tea Frapp, but has only one carb (without the whipped cream)!!! Our whole household gives enthusiastic thumbs up for this drink!

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Old Wisconsin Beef Snack Sticks, 7-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6)
Review:
Old Wisconsin Snack Sticks - Turkey.

After reading some of the existing reviews, it appears that they are mixed up between the beef and turkey product. This review is only for the 28 ounce package of turkey snack sticks.

My Doctor recently advised me to cut way back on my red meat intake. I have been searching for turkey products that have decent flavor. These are indeed good tasting, satisfying, turkey snacks with a nice smoked flavor. To me, the taste is very close to the beef. Imagine a 'Slim-Jim' type snack that is less spicy, and bulk packaged in one ounce sticks, also with better texture. That is what these are.

The 28 ounce package that I purchased from Amazon.com, arrived promptly and had a 'use by' date that was 8 months into the future. These are not what people would consider healthy snacks, due to the fat and sodium content. They are darn satisfying though, and at least in my case, healthier than the beef variety. My package does say 'refrigerate after opening'.

Enjoy
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Fiber One Chewy Bar, Oats and Peanut Butter, 1.4 Ounce, 5 Count, Pack of 12
Review:
OK, I ate some of the 'protein' bars and was happy with how full I felt after. These 'fiber' bars are also good, except, I found I was having 4 or 5 bowel movements a day after only one day of eating 3/day. I now limit my intake to one a day and am good.

The taste is excellent to me. What attracted me to this product was that the main ingredient is listed as "Chicory Root Extract". Chicory root appears to have some unverified health benefits. I sometimes enjoy a little tea made from roasted chicory root and it just makes me feel better.

Either way, If you are hungry and need a snack eat one of these, two or more in a day, be sure a potty is nearby.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
People's Choice Beef Jerky - Classic - Original - High Protein Meat Snack - 3 Ounce Bag
Review:
I like their 'Old Fashioned - Original - Peppered - Sugar-Free' the best. This 'Classic' is priced slightly lower and beats the heck out of any national brand of jerky that I have tried. I would recommend this to anyone who likes jerky. It is chewy as you would expect natural jerky to be. I use a set of kitchen shears to cut this up into bite sized bits for snacking. Yum!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
POPCORNERS Sea Salt Popped Corn Snacks, Gluten Free, Non-GMO, Single-Serve 1oz bags (Pack of 40)
Review:
This review is on the 'Sea Salt' flavor. For a serving size of a 1.1 ounce bag, the facts are: 3.5g fat, 0g trans fat, 0g saturated fat, 190mg sodium, 24g carbohydrate, 6% DV of iron. The ingredients: Yellow Corn, Sunflower Oil, Sea Salt.

The date code on the bags I received was for 10 months onto the future, I have no worry about being able to finish them by that time.

They are popped corn that has somehow been pressed into the shape of a fried corn chip. They are a little crisp mixed with the texture of popped corn, meaning they are not dry and as brittle as a corn chip. Medora did some kind of magic on the pressed chips to make them taste a bit like real corn chips. All in all, I was pleasantly surprised with the snack-ability, good job with that.

I ate two bags of these and then placed an order for another 40 pack, of a different flavor. That is my endorsement.

Enjoy.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
People's Choice Beef Jerky - Old Fashioned - Original - Sugar-Free, Carb-Free, Keto-Friendly - 1 Pound, 1 Bag
Review:
What can I say? This stuff is way better than most brands of jerky. I've got some 16 oz Jack Links left over that I do not want any more. I just ordered another pack of 'People's Choice' today. Natural, dried just right, not too chewy. A bit more expensive per ounce but worth every penny.
Just for grins, I set the unopened pack on a postal scale, 17 1/2 ounces, pretty fair for a 16 ounce bag. The 'Sell By' date is 13 months into the future. No worry there, it will be long gone by the sell by date.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Swanson Chicken Cooking Stock, 26 Ounce Cartons (Pack of 12)
Review:
First off, if you are not used to low sodium items, this will taste a bit bland. I am on a low sodium diet and this is one of the more flavorful items that I have discovered. I use it to flavor rice or fresh veggies. Good stuff.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kashi, Crunchy 7 Grain with Quinoa Bars, Chocolate Chip Chia, Non-GMO Project Verified, 7 oz (10 Count)
Review:
These are good except the crumbs will get all over if you are not careful. Lots of whole grains, crunchy and satisfying, yum.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Snyder's of Hanover Pretzels Variety 100 Calorie Pack, 22 Count (Pack of 4)
Review:
I love potato chips but my doctor lets me know what chips do to my cholesterol, every five or six months when I see him. These have a lot of sodium, but I will take that any day over the increased cholesterol that hi fat chips can cause. I still work and still get hungry at work. Pretzels are one of the 'less harmful' snacks that I have found that can satisfy hunger. The 'use by' dates were a little different for all four types, ranging from 4-6 months into the future. I guess that is OK for a dried snack item. Good quality and fast delivery. I cannot get too excited about pretzels, so 5 stars. Now if they could only make potato chip flavored pretzels? :)
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Crunchmaster Multi-Grain Crackers, Gluten Free, 20 oz.
Review:
My interest in this product started with my Doctor recommending that I eat a diet with more whole grains (and less red meat). These Mufti-Grain crackers are absolutely satisfying and tasty. They are not diet food. More like survival food. They do have 140 calories, 5g fat, 2g fiber and 3g protein per 30g (about 1 ounce) serving.

They have a sesame and soy flavor, combined with a delightful potato chip type crunch.

My only complaint is that they are sort of addictive, I just ordered my third box. Yummy.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Jack Link's X-Stick, Original, 0.5-Ounce X-Sticks (Pack of 50)
Review:
These are along the line of Slim Jims but have a milder, less spicy, taste. The X-Sticks also have a much better texture than Slim Jims, these things actually look like they are made of real meat, NOT the 'mystery meat - goat hair/cardboard' texture of the modern Slim Jim.

The X-Stick is 'not exactly' a health food snack. They have a fair amount of fat, a little over 5 grams (each stick, in this package, is 14 grams total mass). Sodium content is about 224 mg and, about 3.2 grams of protein and only 64 calories (about 47 calories from fat) per stick.

What the X-Stick is, is a very satisfying snack. I sometimes have to miss a meal, due to my work. One or two of these take the hunger away and puts some energy back into me. I do try to limit my fat intake but do not feel guilty about snacking on these once in a while.

Enjoy.

Ken
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

I recently tried Glee Gum's All Natural Peppermint Gum, which is Non GMO Project Verified and eco-friendly. While I appreciate the effort to create a more sustainable product, I found the gum to be just average in terms of quality and taste. The peppermint flavor is not overpowering, but it doesn't last very long either. I also noticed that the texture of the gum is a bit dense and rigid, which can be unpleasant to chew on.

In terms of social and environmental impact, I think Glee Gum deserves some credit for using natural ingredients and eco-friendly packaging. However, I wish they would take it a step

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Simply Gum, Cinnamon Chewing Gum, Vegan, Non GMO, 15 Pieces, Pack of 6
Review:
I bought variety packs of both Glee and Simply Gum to stock up and figure out which is my favorite. Yes, perhaps I have too much time on my hands ;) First, heres my overall summary of the two for quality and price:
Simply Gum (5/5 gold stars):
 Simply Gum took me a little while to get used to (my initial rating was 4/5).
 Now that Ive adjusted to the softer, stickier texture, its my favorite gum and I find it hard to go back to regular gum.
 The flavors are all appealing to me  subtle but interesting. Ginger is my go-to flavor.
 The flavor is integrated into the gum (rather than just in a coating) so its not overpowering and also lasts quite a long time.
 It seems more expensive, but with about 20 pieces per box (one piece at a time is sufficient) its actually not bad. A serving of Glee is 2 pieces, so a box of Glee gum contains 8 servings.
 The packaging design is beautiful and functional. It makes me a little happy whenever I use it.

Glee Gum (3/5 gold stars):
 Glee Gum is tasty when you first chew it, but the flavor disappears quickly.
 The texture of Glee is also a bit dense and rigid for my liking  especially after a minute when the sugar is gone.
 Overall, Glee is economical and fine for people who don't want to chew for very long.
 The flavors are all quite good - my favorites are tangerine and mixed berry.

Id much rather chew either of these gums than go back to a major brand like Trident, etc. This is partly because I prefer Glee and Simply Gum and partly because they are more sustainable. Most leading brands of gum list a gum base on their ingredients. This gum base can include polyethylene (plastic), polyvinyl acetate (wood glue), paraffin wax, fats (hydrogenated vegetable oil) and talc. Glee and Simply Gum are both made from natural tree gum (chicle), harvested by tapping Manilkara trees that grow in the rainforests of Central America. I think that both of them are far superior to the big commercial brands of gum and both deserve 5/5 green stars for social and environmental impact. Here is some more info on these two brands:

 Harvesting natural gum from trees can help protect rainforests and support a sustainable practice that has gone on for thousands of years.
 Natural gum also has a lower carbon footprint than petroleum-derived ingredients that are used to make the gum base of commercial gum.
 Natural gums (Glee and Simply gum) are also biodegradable  reducing biological hazards (and ugly pavements).
 In Simply Gum, most of the ingredients (sugar, glycerin, rice flour) are organically grown.
 In Glee Gum, the sugar is not organic but it is Fairtrade certified.
 Both Glee and Simply Gum are packaged in recyclable cardboard boxes  no plastic.
 Both companies and woman-owned and based in the US.
 Glee Gum works with people with disabilities and supports Trees for the Future and scholarships at the Maya University in Mexico.
More info on sustainable chewing gum is available on my site  greenstarsproject. Interested in writing green star reviews? If so, contact me!

5.0
