My only suggestion would be to add some extra vegetables, such as carrots or potatoes, to make the meal feel more substantial. Overall, I

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: NongShim Shin Black Noodle Soup, Spicy, 4.58 (Pack of 18) Review: I'm a ramyun addict and I have always loved ramyun since I was little. It is the first thing I crave when I'm hungry and it's the only thing I can keep down when I'm hung-over. Ramyun has been and will always be my comfort food although I consider them very unhealthy. When I first spotted the Black Shin Ramyun on Amazon, I thought it was too expensive and didn't want to buy an entire box especially while I've been trying so hard to stay away from ramyun products to reduce my sodium and other toxic intakes. After many fruitless searches at nearby Asian markets to try a few packets, I ended up getting a case from Amazon after several months of hesitation; what can I say...I have to try all ramyun that I notice. Upon trying, I must say that I'm not disappointed at all and this is my new favorite ramen for the moment. The broth is thicker (from the beef bone extract powder) and has a bit of miso flavor very similar to the restaurant quality Japanese (non-instant) miso ramyun. It is definitely not as spicy as the regular Shin ramyun, but it has much more complex flavor and tastes more home-made with bigger chunks of mushrooms, hot peppers, etc. It is unbelievable that the product is MSG free with its play on all my taste buds, and I was very impressed that the product didn't make me feel as tired as most ramyun usually do after consumption. I'm very happy that I still have many packets left, and I'll savor them for all they're worth, which is actually much cheaper than comparable restaurant ramyun and home-made noodle soups. update 4/4/2013: I've subscribed for an auto-delivery subscription and unfortunately have been enjoying the ramen a bit too often. The nutrition fact shows that a package serves 2, but that is unrealistic as most will finish an entire package by themselves. The sodium intake for a package is 1840mg (76% daily value) and total fat of 18g (28% dv) if you finish the soup! The sodium content is actually improved from the original (Gourmet Spicy Picante) Shin ramen's 2100mg. I try to make it a bit less evil by adding some cabbage, green onions and other vegetables for additional roughage and flavors. Adding fresh hot peppers or Jalapeos to the ramen makes it even more amazing. Sometimes I'll even drop an egg for additional protein, but try not to consume the york. I avoid drinking the liquid to cut down on sodium but boy is it hard to stop once you start... Having a constant supply of this ramen is dangerous but I don't have the heart to stop the subscription because I can't find it locally. Help~~! Rating: 5.0 Product: NongShim Shin Cup Noodle Soup, Gourmet Spicy, 2.64 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: I don't know why there's such difference but this smaller paper cup instant ramyun tastes so much better than the big bowl (plastic microwavable) version or even the packaged Shin ramyun. The veg flakes have bigger "stuff" and the broth tastes deeper, almost as if they're different products. I used to have this on auto-delivery when it used to cost around $10 but now at around $25 it's overpriced. I'll be on the lookout for the price to go back down. Rating: 5.0 Product: Myojo Ippeichan Yakisoba Japanese Style Instant Noodles, 4.77-Ounce Tubs (Pack of 12) Review: Being a ramen lover, I had to try this product due to its consistently high reviews. I tend to prefer noodle soup products so I may be biased, but I don't particularly love the sweet Worcestershire sauce instant yakisoba flavor, although it's okay once in a while for a change of pace. For those of you addicted to this particular instant Yakisoba product, it may be worth trying the Sapporo Ichiban Chow Mein, 3.6-Ounce Packages (Pack of 24), which tastes practically the same in my opinion. The Sapporo lacks the dried vegetables and the mustard mayo, but the core flavor is very similar. You can add your own vegetables as instructed and purchase the Japanese mustard mayo if desired, and you'll spend less than a dollar as to over $3 per each package of Myojo Ippeichan Yakisoba. The preparation time is a little over 3 minutes for both products with boiled water, although Sapporo lacks the fancy packaging. May be my expectation was set too high, but I will not be reordering this product now that my curiosity had been satisfied, mostly due to its high cost. Rating: 4.0 Product: Samyang Godd Jjajangmen Chajang Noodle Ramen 5-pack Review: I was so impressed with the latest jjambbong from Samyang, I had to try their Jjajangmen version out of curiosity. I am eating it now and I must say that I'm very disappointed. Although it is still a tasty version of an instant Jjajangmen (all instants are very different from the real thing), it's not noticeably different from the old long-standing chapagetti in its flavor. The noodles are bigger but this "Premium" packaged noodle commanding such inflated price unfortunately can't make up for the price hike with minor improvements. I won't repurchase because I can't justify the premium price. Rating: 4.0 Product: Paldo Jjajangmen Chajang Noodle Vegan No MSG 16-pack Review: NOPE this does not taste like the real Jjajangmen, and it's too sweet as if blackstrap molasses had been added to the sauce. I'm disappointed and bought it purely out of curiosity, but won't repurchase especially at the premium price. This may be more fitting for kids' sweeter palette, but not for adults who crave the Chungjang taste of genuine Jjajangmen. Rating: 3.0 Product: illy Coffee, Moka Ground, Medium Roast, 100% Arabica Bean Signature Italian Blend, Premium Gourmet Roasted Coffee, Pressurized Fresh 8.8 Ounce Tin, Stovetop Moka Pot Preparations Review: I only decided to try this coffee because I've recently tried Lavazza Crema E Gusto that I loved and someone mentioned illy being even better although at twice the price. Well... I must completely disagree, and although this is tasty coffee, now that I've satisfied my curiosity it'll be the last costly purchase I make while Lavazza is available at half the price at a greater flavor when used with my stovetop espresso maker. Rating: 4.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Rooibos Tea, Madagascar Vanilla, 20 Count (Pack of 6) Review: My husband and I stopped drinking decaffeinated coffee after dinner and switched to drinking teas instead. This decaffeinated Rooibos tea offers health benefits and subtle vanilla flavor, perfect with desserts or for relaxing after meals. Of 20+ teas we've tried, this is one of our favorite. The bulk price at around 2.30 for 20 teas is a fantastic value, especially considering this particular flavor is hard to find at local stores. Rating: 5.0 Product: Wild Planet Wild Sardines in Extra Virgin Olive Oil, Lightly Smoked – 4.4oz Can (Pack of 12) Review: Many rave reviews here got me curious so I ordered a box. I'm not disappointed by the taste and it's actually on par to the King Oscar sardines I'm used to enjoying. However, I generally prefer smaller wild sardines for health as in King Oscars double layer brisling since younger fishes have even less opportunity to pick up and accumulate mercury. However, the bigger chunks of sardines in Wild Planet sardines are quite enjoyable with the meatier texture so I'm satisfied with the purchase, especially at less cost than King Oscars. Rating: 5.0 Product: Spicy Chicken Roasted Cup Noodles (x 6 Cups), Spicy Chicken Cup Ramyun Korean Noodle Ramen BULDAK BOKKEUM MYUN Review: Well, I just HAD to try this after seeing many Youtube videos (buldak bokkeum myun or fire noodle callenge) of people trying this ramen. I can take spice pretty well, but even then I was a bit scared to try this assuming it's probably a sadistically hot inedible product aspiring fame through people's agony. With the cooked ramyun bowl in front of me, I breathed in deep, meditated a little, and then took the first bite. I must say I was both disappointed and relieved at the same time. It was not nearly as spicy as I had expected, and it was quite tasty! The sauce flavor is akin to the popular Korean dish Ddukbokki, except it's a little more savory (chicken?) and spicier. The sweetness tapers down the level of spice, and I finished the bowl without flinching although my nose pooled sweat long afterwards. As for a relevant gauge, if you enjoy and can eat Buffalo Wild's "hot" wings, then you won't have trouble finishing this. I also noticed that many people prep this noodle incorrectly and comment that it lacks flavor. There's no English instruction on how to prepare the noodles; No wonder so many people eat it incorrectly on Youtube with excess liquid. 1. Pour boiling water to the indicated line inside the cup, and wait 4 minutes (put the liquid flavor pack on top of the cup to heat it during this process). 2. Open the lid and stir the noodles well with chopsticks [or fork], then pour out all excess water. Add the liquid pack and mix in well. 3. Add the dry flake pack and consume. I've tried the cooking pack version of this (not instant cup), and I prefer the cooking packs hands down. You get 140g of noodles in the pack instead of 70g (small cup) or 105g (big cup) instant versions, and the thicker noodles taste more savory and dare I say even more spicy when prepared correctly. If you like the cup, you'll love the packs. I'm knocking out one star here because I don't like the thinner noodles in the cup version and they cost too much despite the convenience. I'm going to stick to the pack version from now on. Rating: 4.0 Product: Sempio Bibim Spicy Noodle Sauce, 11.29 Ounce Review: This is a tasty sauce to mix in with rice or thin noodles. I add a bit of sesame oil and a bit of soy sauce to taste. It tastes even better when you make a bit of fried rice/noodle with it. Price is a bit high through Amazon so check your local Asian grocer for around $3. The fact that it's USDA certified organic Arabica coffee is a big plus for me, as I try to choose products that are not only good for me, but also for the environment. I've been using it in my

Product:
Equal Exchange Organic Very Dark Chocolate Bars, 2.8 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I just was at my local healthy market, and looking for some dark chocolate, I had never tried this brand, I usually get the Green & Black brand, and then I noticed this Equal Exchange bar, the 71 %, and it was the last one in the display so I thought it must be good if it's almost sold out - and it was!

Not just the intense deep flavor, the high percentage of chocolate and all the good health that goes with it - but the texture! velvety, melt in your mouth, reminding me almost of a quality version of the 'ice cube' chocolates I liked as a kid. It is fair traded and organic, and a win all around - just be moderate, it's addictive!

Product:
Quinn Snacks Microwave Popcorn - Made with Organic Non-GMO Corn - Great Snack Food for Movie Night - Parmesan & Rosemary, 7 Ounce (3 Count)
Review:
Absolutely love this popcorn. No nasty chemicals in the bag lining. Only thing you have to really watch the time, it burns easily so start out with two minutes. More than enough sunflower oil and seasoning in the packets for one bag, or even use part of it if you want to cut down on oil, just so buttery delicious and good. I got the butter and sea salt, and also the maple syrup, both great, but butter and sea salt my favorite.

Product:
Grassfed Organic Ghee 7.8 Oz - Pure Indian Foods Brand (6-Pack)
Review:
I do watch my fat intake but also realize that good fats are necessary to health, and even some saturated fats in small amounts (in fact I believe recent studies back this up), I've always hated margarine and butter substitutes so if I'm going to use it I want the real thing. The organic and grass fed means it is high in vitamin K, which is hard to come by, and has a host of health benefits. Everyone always compliments me on my skin and I think the healthy fats I consume (avocado, nuts olive oil, coconut oil and this butter), play a role (in addition to healthy lifestyle and skin care regimen).

And because it is SO flavorful, you may need only a dab to get that butter 'fix'. I like a dab on my oatmeal on my flax toast or even on a vanilla or tapioca pudding (I make a lower sugar version). That buttery flavor really harmonizes with the vanilla!

You might be able to find it for somewhat less in a retail store, but I order many grocery /gourmet items here from Amazon so I like the convenience.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Artisana Organics - Cashew Butter, Certified organic, RAW and non-GMO, no added sugar or oil, rich and creamy
Review:
Luxuriously delicious, subtle slightly sweet flavor, it is good fats, but still be careful with quantities if you need to watch our weight! It can be addictive!

Scrumptious low glycemic raw vegan treat recipe made with this:

1/3 cup (or so) of cashew butter
a few tablespoons of Sunfoods Raw Cacao powder (or other cacao powder)
tablespoon of coconut nectar (or to taste)
tsp of vanilla
dash of salt

(optional - ground almonds or walnuts for crunchy texture, or coconut)

Use the amounts in the recipe that taste good to you - I don't like things super sweet, and the cashew butter has an innate sweetness)

Smoosh ingredients all together in a bowl with clean hands or forks (hands work best, messy as it is), make them into little balls and put on a cookie sheet with waxed paper in the freezer for an hour or two (then store in the refrigerator).

You never tasted anything so decadent and delicious, and it is all organic and healthy ! (in modest quantities!)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
YS Organic Bee Farms CERTIFIED ORGANIC RAW HONEY 100% CERTIFIED ORGANIC HONEY Raw, Unprocessed, Unpasteurized - Kosher 32oz(pack of 1)
Review:
This stuff is GOOD, and as another reviewer said you have to be careful because it is that tasty you can overdo!

It is REAL. (Sadly these days counterfeit honey is a rampant problem - the raw stuff is hard to counterfeit, but rest assured this is an ethical supplier.

The health benefits of raw honey are many as it's a live food, full of enzymes, and acts as prebiotic (containing substances that contribute to a healthier gut and flora in the entire body).

It is hard to avoid completely all the processed, 'dead' foods in the modern world, that do little more than add calories and contribute to disease, so adding things like this to our diet, can help a lot.

I like it in tea, I put it in the cup first and then pour in the hot water and stir it.

I especially love it in a broccoli salad I make - using chopped/grated broccoli stalks & carrots,  organic raisins or dried cherries, and Vegenaise with a tablespoon of this honey -- it is DELICIOUS and a sweet tooth satisfier!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bare Fruit Organic Granny Smith Apple Chips, Gluten-Free + Baked, 11-Ounce Bags (Pack of 2)
Review:
First of all - conventional apples are one of the 'dirty dozen' of produce to avoid, so finding an organic version of dried apples to snack on is wonderful. I first got these at Costco like others here, but I am going to order here now.

They are nice alone - but try them with a bit of organic raw cheese, some pistachios or healthy crackers - delicious! The combination of the tangy with the salty /creamy is mouth watering and satisfying.

Much preferable if you are having a sweet tooth to do this as opposed to candy or pastry. You do have to watch the quantities because the sugar grams will add up, even though it is natural fruit sugar.

I really encourage parents to get these for their kids as a snack, and try them with cheese or something salty.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
3 Small Venus Flytraps - Fly Trap - (Dionaea Muscipula) Carnivorous Plant 3 Inch Pot
Review:
I will echo other reviewers about how responsive and responsible the seller is. The plant arrived quickly with good instructions, and the seller even followed up to see how it was doing. It's a fascinating plant with its opening and closing 'mouth' and the fact that it's carnivorous! I got it hoping it would help with my fruit fly issues. I haven't seen anything catch anything so far, but maybe needs to grow bigger to do that. I

 have it in a sunny window and keep the bowl it sits in 1/3 filled with distilled water, as instructed. Have to watch out for water evaporation in that sunny window, but so far the plant seems to be doing well.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nutiva Organic, non-GMO, Premium Ground Chia Seeds
Review:
It's so tough to know what to eat these days, with everything tainted one way or another from our sorry environment, or ecologically unsustainable etc, so good to find something that is nutritious and doesn't make you sick or is ecologically unsustainable.

Chia seeds are delicious, packed with health benefits, including adding beneficial fiber, which most of us need more of than we're getting. Supposed to get 25 grams minimum per day.

I have enjoyed the cold glassed chia beverages that are sold at Whole Foods, but that are expensive, so I tried to duplicate something like that at home and came out well!

I made some iced tea (used raspberry and green tea combo, but you could use anything you like), then added some raw honey (melted with warm water, since honey should not be over heated), and lemon juice, then poured in several tablespoons of the chia seeds into the tea in  a glass jar, and voila! A healthy wonderful beverage for pennies.

The chia seeds are suspended, but do tend to drift downwards so you will need to stir it up first. I also sometimes add some liquid probiotic (I like coconut kefir), for extra benefit. Be aware though with all the benefits of chia, it does have some calorie heft (60 calories per tablespoon), although doubtless some of it is not absorbed due to the fiber.

If you add it to your smoothie - be sure to add it last so it doesn't make it too gelatinous, which it will if it sits long.

For tapioca like pudding: If you soak it in your favorite nut milk a few hours in the fridge (or overnight), adding a healthier sweetener and some vanilla, you will have a yummy smooth dessert that is actually good for you.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kevala Organic Toasted Sesame Oil, 8 Ounce
Review:
I cook a lot and sesame oil is a staple for me. What I love about it is not just the wonderful nutty smoky taste, but that just a few drops can add so much flavor, especially together with a little tamari and fish sauce (in rice, stir fries, and various Asian dishes).

I love that it's organic, and the taste really is rich and strong,and its a good size, not the tiny bottles that are more readily available in the stores.

Planters Trail Mix, Sweet & Salty 6 Oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
For some reason sunflower seeds have become difficult to find in grocery stores. Used to be able to find Planters dry roasted right near the peanuts etc, but no more, thus coming here to get these. I like them for snacking , especially together with raisins, and sprinkling on my salads.

golds.output: I was really looking forward to trying this matcha green tea powder, but unfortunately, it didn't quite live up to my expectations. I added it to my smoothies and lattes, but the flavor was somewhat bitter and not as smooth as I had hoped. I also tried using it in baking, but the result was just okay. I'll stick to my usual green tea for now.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Uncle Lee's Tea- Organic White Tea, Premium Organic White Tea in Tea Bags 100ct Review: This is the first time I have tried white tea. Lots more antioxidants than green or black teas. It has a nice tea taste and I prefer it cold brewed with a dash of lemon and a little juice from smashed strawberries and blueberries. Very good mixed with herbal red zinger too. Rating: 5.0 Product: Traditional Medicinals Organic Chamomile Herbal Leaf Tea, 16 Tea Bags (Pack of 6) Review: This tea really doesn't have much taste, in my opinion. I added some lemon juice and a little stevia. Didn't help much. Why did I get it you ask? I read on Nutrition Facts.org that lemon balm was useful for flyers who get exposed to a lot of atmospheric radiation, and others who have exposure from other sources. Clinical trials have shown it protects people somewhat from DNA damage. Information also says it is useful for generalized anxiety, and is a sleep aid. The negative I read was that people who have thyroid problems and take medication, should not be drinking too much of this. I take meds for low thyroid function, so I won't be buying this again. Rating: 3.0 Product: Uncle Lee's Organic Green Tea -- 100 Tea Bags net wt 5.64 oz (160g) Review: I use this with white tea and red zinger hibiscus to create a great tasting drink. Cold brewing saves time and works really well. Great flavor! Rating: 5.0 Product: Nutiva USDA Certified Organic, non-GMO, Gluten-free, Unrefined Coconut Flour, 16-ounce (Pack of 6) Review: When it's necessary to limit carbohydrates, to avoid insulin levels from climbing too high, this is the flour to use. Rather than completely cutting out bread, I make a multi grain bread substituting 1/4 of the flours with coconut flour. I use some whole wheat, rye, buckwheat, flax and oats. All organic, found here on Amazon. I am not gluten sensitive, so I add a couple tablespoons to get a better rise. There are many web sites for using this flour to make breads, muffins pizza dough, and other things without gluten and other grains. We eat the bread sparingly of course. At first I was disturbed by the use of so many eggs in the preparation of "bread" using only coconut flour. However, I have recently read the best selling book "The Great Cholesterol Myth" by Jonny Bowden. Great Cholesterol Myth(Available on Amazon, of course). If it is true that we have been misled regarding cholesterol and eggs, (by the drug companies) then using them with this flour is not going to cause a problem. One fourth cup contains 22 carbs and 16 grams of fiber. I have seen it said that this makes the flour a net carb serving of 6 grams. Besides being carb friendly, the Coconut Oil Miracle by Bruce Fife The Coconut Oil Miracle will open your eyes to how wonderful coconut is, in every form. I was astounded by the apparent way we have been manipulated (politics!) to believe that coconut was a bad thing. Finally doctors and nutritionists are speaking out.. Their advise? Go real easy on the grains, (avoid sugar!) and add coconut to your diet. This product is a winner! I'll be ordering again. Rating: 5.0 Product: NESTLE COFFEE-MATE Coffee Creamer, Hazelnut, liquid creamer singles, Pack of 180 Review: A little coconut oil is sure better than HF corn syrup as in powdered creamers. This is super creamy and really makes coffee taste good. Be sure to get this ORIGINAL kind because the other coffee mate choices have the syrup. Rating: 5.0 Product: Uncle Lee's Tea Organic White Tea, Tea Bags, 100-Count Boxes (Pack of 4) Review: I was getting the Uncle Lee's organic green tea until I read an article on my favorite nutritional web site "nutrition facts.org". Dr. Gregor compared the benefits and antioxidant power between the green and white tea. White tea is less processed than the green, and the most processed is the black tea. White has even more benefits when lemon juice is added. The best news is that cold brewed tea is as beneficial as hot brewed. I make a three quart pitcher with 8 white tea bags and two bags of Celestial brand cinnamon apple spice tea. I add a half cup of lemon juice and 1/4 cup of Truvia. This is cold brewed overnight. Fabulous! Rating: 5.0 Product: Viva Naturals Organic Dried Goji Berries, 1lb - Premium Himalayan Berries Perfect for Baking, Teas, Trail Mixes and More Review: I purchased these for their terrific health benefits, especially for my eyes. They taste somewhat like cranberries, but a little more tart and just a little more chewy. I put them on my yogurt and toss a few in my salad. I have incorporated them into my homemade granola too. 1/4 cup contains about an ounce of dried berries, and is considered a daily serving of about 100 calories. I understand these are very easy to grow in containers and I am looking into purchasing a few plants. I have a dehydrator which will be vey useful, I'm sure. I'm very pleased with these overall, but they are expensive and if I can learn to grow my own, I will be even happier. P.S. I have found that one of those ceramic brown sugar saver things keeps these moist and prevents them from getting hard. Rating: 5.0 Product: Lipton Green Tea Bags, Orange Passionfruit Jasmine, 20 ct (Pack of 6) Review: Sweet delicious tea! I mix this tea with other flavors and a little lemon juice in an infuser pitcher and leave it in the refrigerator overnight. Next day I have the best iced tea ever. Green tea goodness and antioxidants what could be better. Watch for Amazon price on pack of 6, it's half the price of outside venders. Rating: 5.0 Product: Harmony House Foods, Dehydrated Chives, Chopped (10 lb Bulk Box) - Set of 2 Review: I am new to dried foods, and I must say, these are sure a timesaver and convenient way to keep vegetables on hand! I purchased these chives along with the quart of dried tomato. I use both in breads, soups, omelets, salad dressings and lots of other things. The best feature is the long shelf life at room temperature. The chives are fresh and pungent. More so than the fresh from the supermarket. Since they are dried, they are more concentrated and you only need a small amount for great chive flavor. Harmony house representative said they are NON-GMO, grown with no pesticides, and Organic, but they cannot advertise that yet since their certification is not final yet. Good to know! Rating: 5.0 Product: Frontier Herb Organic Powdered Ceylon Cinnamon, 1 Pound Bag -- 2 Pack Review: I do a lot of bread baking, and I use a lot of cinnamon. I regularly make granola and raisin cinnamon bread. The Ceylon, also known as true cinnamon, has a milder flavor than the grocery store cassia, but it's much safer to use. Cassia contains coumarin which is toxic in larger doses. After using this, the store cassia will taste very harsh to you. I keep some of this out and freeze the rest in a vacuum sealed bag. Frontier has a wonderful line of organic products, always fresh and good tasting. (Count of 3) Rating: 5.0 Product: Frontier Basil Leaf, Sweet-domestic, C/s Certified Organic, 16 Ounce Bag Review: I LOVE Frontier Organic herbs and spices. I've been buying their products for over 20 years and have never been disappointed. I've been cooking meals for over 45 years, and almost always used dried herbs, and this is the best dried sweet basil I've tasted. I cant make my tomato sauce without it. It tastes great, plus it's non-GMO & organic! Great taste and aroma, as fresh as dried can be. This is the same product as Simply Organic basil (same company) you get in a .54 ounce glass jar. I recommend buying one jar (see link below), then buy this 16 ounce bag to refill the jar. You get nearly 30 refills in one bag! That's well over $110 worth of refills! The one pound bag is a great bargain and is enough for you and a friend. You can't go wrong. Great product, buy in bulk to save money. I buy most of my herbs and spices from Frontier and Simply organic in the same way - I buy one jar of Simply Organic and refill with their Frontier Organic bulk products. Comes in a well sealed Mylar bag that can last for a couple of years if kept well sealed. And if you have any questions, the people at Frontier and Simply Organic are very friendly and always helpful. What is SWEET Basil? Sweet basil (Ocimum basilicum), also called basic basil, Mediterranean or European-type basil, and is the most common basil grown, sold and used in the United States. Its most often used in Italian cooking and in soups but can also be used in Asian dishes such as Thai (as a replacement for Thai basil). Simply Organic Basil Certified Organic, 0.54-Ounce Container Rating: 5.0 Product: Heinz Twin Pack Organic Tomato Ketchup, 88 Ounce Review: This is my fallback organic ketchup brand. I've tried many others, but I only like Heinz and Annie's so far. I prefer Annie's Organic Ketchup but I can't always find it in local stores or online at a decent price. So, when I can't get Annie's I get Heinz. There is a difference in taste from Annie's to Heinz and from Heinz Organic to Heinz regular. Heinz Organic has a bit of a bite to it (compared to regular Heinz), but not so much that you don't get use to eat by the end of your first meal. Just like anything else, once you get use to it you have trouble going back to what you use to eat (regular Heinz). So, if you can get Annie's Organic Ketchup I recommend it, but if you can't, try this and I don't think you'll be unhappy at all. PS) Annie's has a completely different taste, not as sweet as Heinz, with more of a robust, rich, deeper flavor. It takes getting use to too, but I hate regular ketchup after eating Annie's. Rating: 4.0 Product: Annie's Organic Saltine Classic, Baked Crackers, 6.5 oz (Pack of 6) Review: MY REVIEW: Here's my review of Annie's Organic Saltine Classics (what Amazon is calling "Bunny Classic Crackers Saltines"): I love them. I prefer them over Nabisco Premium (my old favorite) for many reasons. First is the flavor; Annie's Saltines taste like traditional oyster crackers. I didn't realize it until after I tasted them, but I prefer the flavor of oyster crackers over traditional saltines. But I think they taste more like Westminster brand oyster crackers (a richer flavor) than Premium or Sunshine brand oyster crackers. They're also not too salty, light but crisp & crunchy, and of course the fact that they're organic is a huge plus. They taste great with cheese slices or spread. They also hold up well when spreading peanut butter & jelly, butter, or cream cheese on them. Added on 11-9-14: The price has gone from $19 to $29 since my purchase. This product is not worth $5 a box so I am now ordering Late July brand, which is currently $38 for 12 (about $3.15 per box). If Amazon keeps raising prices to ridiculous amounts they're going to loose my business as well as thousands, if not millions, of other consumers. See below for cautions regarding reviews/ratings, return policy, confusing item names, and more. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ RETURN POLICY: One huge caution before you buy - Grocery Items Can NOT Be Returned, for any reason, as per Amazon's return policy. I'm normally a huge fan of Amazon and their more than fair return policy, but when it comes to grocery items their return policy falls short, since some grocery items may be damaged by mishandling or improper storage, may have gone bad, etc. I personally would have no problem ordering Annie's Saltines again, even with this return policy, because I have faith in most items shipped from Amazon. However, I did receive other grocery items in the past that I felt were not up to par and could not return them. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ SHIPPING & CONDITION OF PRODUCT: Although this is not reflected in my star rating, I should mention how well they were packaged and that they were not damaged in shipping. The six boxes were wrapped together and shipped in a box with air pack cushioning. Only one or two crackers were broken in each box, at most, and I suspect that happened in the factory. I ordered them in July 2014 and the product expiration printed on the box was March 2015. So consumers who are worried about getting broken or expired product, I have had no problem with these issues. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ MISLEADING STAR RATINGS: I've tried many different Annie's crackers & cookies. Some I give 5 stars, some 1 star. It should be noted that the star ratings on this page are MISLEADING. As of August 2014 Amazon is lumping several Annie's Cracker flavor reviews together. This means the star rating you see is for ALL the flavors combined. Each flavor is and should be considered a separate product with their own rating, but they are not. The only way for sure to know how other consumers rate each flavor is for you to pay close attention to the details of the review. If the reviewer's purchase is verified Amazon will post which flavor they're reviewing, but you must look closely at the review to see this. It's easily overlooked. For those reviewers whose purchase is not verified by Amazon, there may be no way to know which flavor they're reviewing. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ CONFUSING ITEM NAMES: The titles (names) Amazon shows for these products sold on this page are also misleading. Even though Annie's has stopped making some of their crackers in the shape of a bunny, and have changed the names & packaging of these products to reflect this, as of July 2014 Amazon has not changed the names of the products sold on this page. This may cause consumers to be confused about which products they're buying, or what they'll get. The list below may be helpful. Annie's makes many different kinds of crackers & cookies. Most of them use to be bunny shaped, some are organic while others are not, many have similar names. To help you understand the different cracker & cookie flavors and shapes, here is the breakdown of what is being offered on this page, as of August 3, 2014. There are four different crackers: Annie's Homegrown Organic Saltine Classics (hexagon shaped) Amazon title: Annie's Homegrown Organic Bunny Classic Crackers Saltines Annie's Homegrown Organic Cheddar Classics (hexagon shaped) Amazon title: Annie's Homegrown Organic Bunny Classic Crackers Buttery Rich Annie's Homegrown Organic Buttery Rich Classics (hexagon shaped) Amazon title: Annie's Homegrown Organic Bunny Classic Crackers Cheddar Annie's Homegrown Organic Cheddar Bunnies (bunny shaped) Amazon title: Annie's Homegrown Organic Cheddar Bunnies ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ MAKE SURE YOU'RE GETTING THE RIGHT PRODUCT: Because you might be looking for a cracker or cookie that's not listed above, and you may be wondering if the cracker or cookie you want is still made or discontinued, I thought it might be helpful to list what Annie's currently makes, with a notation as to which ones are currently being sold on this page (as of August 3, 2014). I'd link to all of them, so you can find them quicker, but Amazon only allows 10 links per review: Cheddar Bunnies (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Organic Cheddar Bunnies (bunny shaped) - currently sold through this page White Cheddar Bunnies (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Bernie's Farm Cheddar Crackers (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (different colored farm related shapes, naturally colored) Whole Wheat Cheddar Bunnies (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Extra Cheesy Cheddar Bunnies (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Sour Cream & Onion Bunnies (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Honey Bunny Grahams (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Cinnamon Bunny Grahams (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Chocolate Chip Bunny Grahams (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Chocolate Bunny Grahams (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Friends Bunny Grahams (mix of Honey Graham, Chocolate Chip Graham, and Chocolate Graham flavors), (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (bunny shaped) Snickerdoodle Cinnamon Sugar Bunny Cookies (gluten-free, peanut-free), (not organic), (bunny shaped) Ginger Snap Bunny Cookies (gluten-free), (not organic), (bunny shaped) Cocoa & Vanilla Bunny Cookies (gluten-free), (not organic), (bunny shaped) Organic Saltine Classics (hexagon shaped) - currently sold through this page Organic Buttery Rich Classics (hexagon shaped) - currently sold through this page Organic Cheddar Classics (hexagon shaped) - currently sold through this page Cheddar Squares (not all organic, but made with organic wheat), (square shaped, similar to Cheez-Its shape) Organic Honey Grahams (shaped similar to Honey Maid brand graham crackers) Organic Cinnamon Grahams (shaped similar to Honey Maid brand graham crackers) Annie's also makes snack mixes, pretzels, gummy style bunnies, and some foods other than snacks. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ I'm not an Annie's representative. I do not have any ties to the company. The reason I give so much information about Annie's cookies and crackers is just that I like many of their products and I've found myself becoming confused with all the cookie & cracker names. I also like Annie's Naturals Organic Ketchup! Rating: 5.0 Product: Late July Organic Round Saltine Crackers, 6-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) Review: These are my favorite saltines these days because they're organic, don't have high fructose corn syrup, and taste good. PROS: > Organic > No high fructose corn syrup > Taste great; tastes more like oyster crackers than typical Premium saltines > Firm; holds up to using in dips or with toppings > Fresh and never over cooked; haven't yet had a problem with off tastes or burnt crackers (like with other brands I've purchased) CONS: > A bit more expensive than what I'd like to pay, definitely more expensive than traditional saltines. But since they're healthier I pay the price (as long as they don't go more than $4 a box) Rating: 5.0 Product: Woodstock Organic Smooth Peanut Butter, Salt Added, 35 oz Review: I love the flavor and ingredients of Woodstock Organic Smooth Peanut Butter, but I will NOT buy it in a plastic jar. I don't have to buy it to know PLASTIC IS TOXIC. I don't know why they changed it (use to come in glass) but I'm moving to another brand if they don't go back to glass jars. Again, plastic is toxic, and they should know this. Storing an organic product long term in a plastic jar is ridiculous! How something tastes is not the only mark of the item's quality - how it's made and how it's stored, if it is stored in toxic plastic, makes a difference and that's why I give this product 3 stars instead of the 5 stars I give to Woodstock in glass jars. They're doing this for cost savings, because it costs less to ship, but that savings is surely not passed on to consumers. And even if it were, I would not want to eat peanut butter stored in toxic plastic. They're lucky I'm giving it 3 stars. Rating: 3.0 Product: Santa Cruz Organic, 100% Lemon Juice, 16 Ounces Review: I like the taste - tastes very close to fresh squeezed lemon juice and has a stronger flavor than the juice found in squeeze bottles. It can be used to make great tasting lemonade (don't forget to add sugar), but I prefer to mix it with grape juice (or other juices and juice blends) for a concoction that helps to relieve kidney stones. If you use it for this reason you should take 2-4 ounces a day. And yes, it helps relieve very painful kidney stones. I also love that it's organic. I've used Santa Cruz brand and Sicilia squeeze bottle. Santa Cruz brand is best for making the freshest tasting lemonade or punch, but Sicilia is best if you want to always have some on hand (and don't have room in the fridge), or if you need just a little squeeze on fish now and then, and for traveling (Sicilia does not need refrigeration until it's opened): Sicilia Organic Lemon Juice, 4 oz Rating: 5.0 Product: Frontier Co-op Organic Mediterranean Oregano Leaf, Cut & Sifted, Fancy Grade, 1 Pound Bulk Bag Review: Im a foodie. I love to eat and I love to cook, especially for friends and family. So talking about food and recipe ingredients for me is kind of like a sports nut talking about his favorite players. So please forgive me if I get a bit overly enthused by something as seemingly insignificant as a common spice because its not insignificant at all. If you don't yet grow your own herbs and spices, and you want to create delicious meals, you have to find a good, wholesome, organic product line or herbs and spices. And as far as Im concerned, thats Frontier. Ive been buying nearly all of my bottled (and bagged) herbs and spices from Frontier for well over 20 years and Im always happy with the quality, freshness, aroma, and taste. Ive been buying their Simply Organic line for at least 10 years. For those who don't know, Frontier is the same company as Simply Organic. This bag or organic oregano is the same exact ingredients you get from this bottle of Simply Organic Oregano Leaf Cut & Sifted Certified Organic, .75-Ounce Container. The only difference is the packaging and the price. This 16 ounce bag of Frontier Organic oregano is the equivalent of 21 Simply Organic .75 ounce jars (again, same company, same product). If you bought 21 jars it would cost you well over $60, so this is a great product and a great bulk deal. I started using Frontier & Simply Organic products when I discovered Simply Organic in my local health food store, then I found it in bags online for a great price. If you want quality organic ingredients AND you want to save money, I suggest you buy a bottle of Simply Organic Oregano once, save the bottle, and refill from this huge Mylar bag. It's economical and good for the environment to refill your bottle in this way. Thats how I buy most of my spices these days organic and in bulk. And I use it in so many recipes: pasta sauces, soups, hot & cold salads, home made dressings, appetizers, garlic bread.... I even have my husband getting into it - ever since he took a wiff of a bag when I first opened it, he's been hooked. That's how fragrant it is. He can't eat a slice of pizza without sprinkling Frontier Oregano and Simply Organic crushed red pepper on top. Between the two of us I cant keep my pantry stocked with it unless I buy it in bulk. Why Mediterranean Oregano? Mediterranean Oregano is the same oregano most of us in the U.S. are use to buying right off the grocery store shelf for years, without thinking what kind it is. Mediterranean oregano: is a member of the mint family and is sometimes called wild marjoram. Mediterranean oregano has a robust, savory, peppery flavor, which is why its so often used in Greek, Italian, and All-American recipes. On the other hand, Mexican oregano is a member of lemon verbena family. It's native to Mexico and grows throughout Central and South America and is sometimes called Puerto Rican oregano. Mexican oregano has a citrusy tang and slight licorice flavor, and is used most often in Latin American and Tex-Mex recipes. So now you know what Mediterranean Oregano is. And I highly recommend, instead of buying the same OLD stuff off your grocery store shelves, not knowing what chemicals might be used to grow or process it), that you buy a large economical bag of freshly dried ORGANIC oregano from Frontier. Its a great bargain and it always smells and tastes great. Rating: 5.0 Product: Fresh Gourmet Specialty Croutons, Ciabatta Butter and Sea Salt, 4.5 Ounce (Pack of 9) Review: Ive been taste testing organic croutons for the last few months and found my favorite is Fresh Gourmet brand Seasoned. I like that they're large (so I can get my fork into them) but they're light (in weight). And I like that they're perfectly seasoned to suit just about any type of salad, including Caesar salads (even though this product is not Caesar salad type seasoning it works perfectly for Caesar salads, and if you want traditional Caesar salad croutons they make those also). The seasoning for this product is mild enough to not overpower your salad or your favorite salad dressing. And they're always perfectly toasted. I found I eat more salads if I put croutons on them, and I want to eat healthy, so its important that the croutons I buy not only taste good but they must not be laden with too much sugar, fat, or artificial ingredients. Fresh Gourmet fits that description fresh, healthy/organic, and yummy. PS) There are 35 calories for about 18 croutons (10 fat calories). It's 30 total calories for the Fresh Gourmet Caesar croutons. I didn't buy from Amazon this time around (because I needed them right now) but the current price here is less than what I pay locally so if the price doesnt go much higher ($2.50 is the max I want to pay per bag for this item) Ill buy them here next. But to prove I do in fact buy and eat this product Ive included a photo. Its a photo of my comparison between Fresh Gourmet and Edward & Sons. Both are on the salad. If you look at the photo youll see the larger tan colored (nicely toasted) croutons are the Fresh Gourmet. The smaller gray colored oily looking croutons are Edward & Sons. I must say I'm not thrilled with Edward & Sons brand (bag on the right in my photo, the smaller croutons on the salad) because they have an oily smell, taste, and feel. They even look oily (and gray colored). I prefer the Fresh Gourmet brand (the bag on the left, the larger toasty looking croutons in the salad) because they're big, chunky, with a nice flavor but not too much oil. In fact I cant even detect any oil taste with the Fresh Gourmet brand. ~ ~ ~ I couldn't find an ingredients list here or on the Fresh Gourmet website so Im including it, copied from the back of the bag: INGREDIENTS: Organic Wheat Flour, Organic Sunflower and/or Organic Safflower Oil, Organic Cracked Rye, Organic Cracked Wheat, Yeast, 2% or less of salt, Organic Sugar, Organic Wheat Gluten, Organic Garlic Powder, Organic Dehydrated Parsley, Organic Onion Powder. (packaged in a facility that also packages tree nuts) ~ ~ ~ Certified Organic by QAI: USDA/National Organic Program QAI is a USDA-accredited certifying agency (ACA), approved to provide organic certification in accordance with the USDA's National Organic Program. Certification is important for consumers, the industry and the regulatory community in order to assure organic integrity from farm to retail shelf. A product marked "certified organic" means that an accredited certifying agency, such as QAI, has verified that the product labeled as "organic" is true to that organic labeling claim, as specified by the National Organic Program in accordance with the Organic Foods Production Act of 1990. The National Organic Standard (NOS) is a federal regulation created by the USDA and administered by the National Organic Program. The USDA Organic Seal and the QAI Seal both stand for assurance that a product on which those seals appear has been verified as certified organic in compliance with the strict USDA federal regulations for organic. Rating: 5.0 Product: Dole Fruit Bowls, Tropical Fruit in 100% Juice, 4 Cups Review: In my humble opinion, Dole makes the best pineapple on the planet! I've been eating canned and packaged pineapple regularly (at least once a week for over 40 years) and I've tried several brands. No one even comes close to the great taste and texture of Dole pineapple. Always sweet and juicy, always ripe, always firm enough (but not mushy), never tuff. And they're Non-GMO. I can't say these things about any other brand I've tried. Plus, these tidbits are packed in 100% pineapple juice, no sugars or artificial sweeteners, no syrup, no other miscellaneous juices. And, the plastic cups are BPA-free. I usually eat their canned pineapple (chunks, rings, and tidbits) but I started buying the smaller size (these, tidbits in BPA-free plastic cups) so I could take them camping and on road trips. Theyre just as good as their canned pineapple chunks (the size most consumers are use to), maybe even better. Im starting to lean towards liking the tidbits more than the chunks because they seem even more tender and juicy than the chunks. And they don't need refrigeration until opened (and with this size youll eat it all so refrigeration is not an issue). They're easy to open (even for a child or someone with dexterity issues) and just the right size for one person for a snack or desert. I've even opened and eaten them one-handed when I had an operation on my arm (took the lid off with my teeth and slurped it up - no need for a spoon). Other reasons I like Dole: I once watched a food mini documentary on TV that explained how Dole pioneered the growing and packaging of pineapple right down to creating a new breed of pineapple thats perfect for canning. I also like that Dole has been named as one of the "World's Most Ethical Companies" by Ethisphere Magazine. And Dole recognizes the importance of a plant based diet for good health, publishing books and classroom curriculum to help teachers and children learn about healthy eating. And every time I've purchased "canned" foods from Amazon they've arrived quickly and in perfect condition. And the expiration dates are always far enough away that I can store them in my pantry and not have to worry about eating them all at one time or before I need them. golds.output: I was excited to try the Bonk Breaker Energy Bar in Apple Pie flavor, but unfortunately, it didn't quite live up to my expectations. I like the fact that it's gluten-free and dairy-free, which makes it a great option for those with dietary restrictions. The flavor was okay, but it didn't really taste like apple pie to me, it was more like a sweet, slightly tart apple flavor. I also didn't like the texture, it was a bit too chewy for my liking. On the plus side, the ingredients are pretty clean and it's a decent size bar. Overall, it's an average energy

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Quaker Instant Oatmeal Cinnamon & Spice, 10-Count Boxes (Pack of 4)
Review:
Okay, I don't ever buy instant oatmeal like this, we buy bulk organic quick oats and add brown sugar. I have always found instant oatmeal in the little packs to not have good flavor despite all the additives and I always want to add more sugar to make it taste better. This was not the case with this oatmeal!  I actually loved this oatmeal with out wanting to add sugar or flavoring to it.  I liked the cinnamon flavor and did not feel it was too much and did not feel it was too little.  Who knows how many grams of sugar I add to my plain oatmeal when I make it, I may be better of eating this instead, and the ingredient list was pretty darn clean too, nothing I would avoid.  I would definitely buy again and would RECOMMEND.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
CAILLER L'Art du Brut, Dark Chocolate 54% Cocoa with whole Almonds & Cranberries, 6.87 ounce bars (Pack of 2)
Review:
Review of the dark almond cranberry.

My two bars arrived in good condition, no melting or other issues.  The chocolate bar is very unique, expensive looking, and pleasing to the eye.

First off I want to say that I am a dark person, that is why I wanted to try these bars so badly.  No where on any of the packaging does is it indicated the percentage of cocoa in this chocolate, it is only mentioned on the product page that it is 54%.  Also, I waited to write this review until my sample of the dark blueberry arrived so I had something to compare this to.

The price is about $17 for two bars with shipping costs included.  Each bar is nearly 7 ounces.  When compared to Green & Black's which is a bar I have bought in the past all too many times, the price is actually really similar when taking into account the cost of shipping being rolled into the price given that these Cailler bars are twice the weight of a Green & Black bar.

Cailler's dark chocolate is very rich and smooth and not at all bitter or chalky or hard or crunchy.  The texture and flavor, however, may be a result of the relatively low cocoa percentage compared to many other dark chocolates I am used to eating which are all above 65% and most 70% or above.  Research states that the health benefits of dark chocolate do not kick in until a certain threshold of cocoa content has been passed which Cailler's dark chocolate is no where near, so don't think you are doing your body good eating one ounce of this a day.

I like almonds and the cranberries gave this a nice kick, the flavor really popped, like dark chocolate over an orange jelly.  I did feel, however, that because of the almonds and cranberry content that there was less chocolate in each bite than I'd have liked.

I don't have a sweet tooth, I have a whole sweet mouth.  I can sit down and eat and entire Green & Black's bar in one sitting and barely bat an eyelash.  This bar seemed so rich to me that after four pieces (one row) I was able to put it down and walk away, even for the rest of the day.  This is nice for me because it means that this chocolate would last for me and that I won't over do it on this either.

I also like that while Nestle may be the parent company now this chocolate is still actually made in Switzerland as it had been before Nestle.

Would I buy this again?  Yes, but I might wait until I can find it in stores so that I am not paying a higher price because of shipping.

So, why not five stars?  Cost, not enough chocolate in each bite due to fruit and nut content, lower cocoa content than I'd like.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Salted White Truffle Grass-Fed Ghee Butter by 4th & Heart, 9 Ounce,Pasture Raised, Non-GMO, Lactose Free, Certified Paleo, 9 oz
Review:
First I want to say that the only other ghee I have tried is Purity Farms.  Next, I only have used ghee for baking purposes, for making things the most flaky possible when making puff pastry and when working with phyllo dough as clarified butter, I think, really makes a difference.  For our regular butter that we keep in our butter dish we ALWAYS buy grass fed, we used to get Pastureland which is the best but that hasn't been available in over a year so we did a taste test between Kalona and Organic Valley and we now buy Kalona Supernatural.  Anyway, when I saw this sample pack by 4th & Heart I though what would I do with it all and what would I do with the different flavors.  Then I started thinking how the vanilla would be neat in pastries, and how the garlic could make easy garlic bread, the item description talked about just using it as a spread.  So, I tried it, and now I can't stop eating the stuff.

I want to start with the fact that this is grass fed.  I attached a photo of the original 4th & Heart ghee next to my Purity Farms ghee and you can see the huge color difference, and no, there is no color added to the 4th & Heart, the deeper yellow comes from the cows having been grass fed.  Grass fed dairy is higher in many, many nutrients but most notable in my mind are conjugated linoleic acid and vitamin K2.  K2 is a big deal because it is hard to get natural unless you eat a lot of seaweed and it makes a huge difference in calcium being deposited where it should go, in bones, not in arteries.  CLA is good for maintaining muscle mass and metabolism and also helps keep cancer away.  Now, on to taste.

Our first tasting was on 100% whole wheat bagels just as spread, everyone in the family tried all five flavors.  Since then we have been eating daily.

OH MY GOD did just the plain unsalted original have amazing sting butter flavor, this stuff will spoil you.  Kids liked it too, husband loved how buttery it tasted.  Would definitely buy this again.

We eat pink Himalayan sea salt at home as our usual salt, so I thought it was great that this was what 4th & Heart uses.  The flavor of this ghee was also fantastic.  That being said, the amount of salt in this the is more than twice that of Kalona Supernatural grass-fed butter we usually eat.  But still, it tastes really good :)  Kids and hubby really liked this flavor as well.

The vanilla is delicious and the kids now ask for it at breakfast.  There is nothing but clarified butter and vanilla in this yet it seems to have a sweet taste to it, and it brings out the sweetness in in anything it is mixed with.  The kids now request this butter on their bagels, toast, and english muffins which we usually serve with a little maple sugar sprinkled on top and the mix of the vanilla with the maple sugar is wonderful, and because of the added sweetness of the vanilla ghee I can actually cut way back in the maple sugar I sprinkle and the kids don't notice or care.  I have not yet tried baking with this, we have been enjoying all the flavors so much as just plain spreads that I may never bake with it as we most likely will just eat it all as is.

The garlic smells so heavenly and intense, but the flavor was just not there, it was so odd to smell so much garlic and then taste next to none, I was disappointed thinking my grand plans of super fast and easy and delicious garlic bread using this stuff and ciabatta bread were dashed.  It took me a few times of using it to figure out that there was no salt added to the garlic and this might make a difference.  So, I tried adding a little of my own salt and voila, there was the garlic flavor I was looking for, just not as strong as it smells though.  I like this so much that I have been using the garlic with added salt on my bagels as a savory bagel instead of going with something sweet.  I have not yet tried garlic bread, but will be buying ciabatta in a few days when we next go grocery shopping.  My kids did not care for this one, no big surprise there for me, and my husband agreed with me that the smell was fantastic but that the garlic flavor was just not there.  he has not yet tried it with salt, but I am sure he'd agree with me that salt brought out the garlic flavor.

I have never tried white truffle anything before though I have seen the oil around a lot lately.  This flavor ghee really did nothing for any of us, no one particularly cared for it but it certainly wasn't bad tasting though.  I told my mom about it and I swear she was salivating through the phone, so I may give her the rest of the jar and perhaps she will appreciate it more than my family.

Lastly, price.  This stuff is expensive.  The Purity Farms I bought at a natural food store and so did not have to pay for shipping, so I decided to see what it sells for on Amazon where shipping is included in the price to more fairly compare pricing and this 4th & Heart grass-fed ghee is about the same price per jar.  Purity Farms is organic but not grass fed, 4th & Heart is grass fed but not organic.  So, this may be why the pricing is so similar.  I can't help but wonder how much more affordable 4th & Heart would be if I were to find it in a store.  At an average of $14 per jar it is quite spendy to use every day as a spread, it is about 2.5 sticks per jar and Kalona Supernatural is about $8 or $9 for 4 sticks, though it is not clarified  just grass-fed and organic.  I would definitely buy this 4th & Heart regularly if I could find it at a store for less than what it sells for on Amazon, and I will still buy it once in a while on Amazon for a treat as both myself and the kids are really loving it, it is really so flavorful as compared to the other ghee I have tried and so much more flavorful than out usual stick butter.  But I think I would choose jars individually so that we get what we like the best and not have to pay for so so flavors.  I can see where this multi-flavor pack would make a totally awesome gift.  And I like how clarified butter has a much longer life span than regular butter, so this stuff doesn't have to be consumed so fast and will last a long while.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tasty Brand Organic Fruit Snacks, Mixed Fruit Flavors, 4 Ounces 5-Count Packages (Pack of 6)
Review:
These are now our go to for fruit snacks.  Annie's changed their recipe and now contain 11 grams of sutra per serving instead of 10 and they are now sticky which makes for yucky fingers after eating them.  These fruits snacks are the lowest in sugar I can fins that are organic and contain no artificial colors or flairs or preservatives.  As a bonus, not that we need it but one on my daughter's friends is allergic, all Tasty products are produced in nut free facilities.  Very clean, very tasty, as the name says, and the kids love them of course, heck, me too for that matter.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co. Chocmeister Hazelnut Spread, Milk Chocolatey, 13 Ounce Jar
Review:
I debated the star rating on this, 5 stars would be for taste alone, but despite the reduced sugar and extra protein the nutritionals on this still are not good, so a 4 star was the best I can do.

I love hazelnuts, I love hazelnut butter.  It is actually really hard to find plain hazelnut butter.  When traveling I have found brands like Kettle, Futters, and another brand, the only of these still available is Futters, and no one in the Minneapolis/St Paul area carries it.  So, I had been making my own hazelnut butter using my Vitamix and it was delicious.  I never needed a chocolate hazelnut butter.  My kids and I have all tried Nutella at my mother's house and it is tasty, of course it is, sugar is the first ingredient, and it really tastes just like eating chocolate.  Not my thing, and I am surprised it is my mother's.  I was excited when Justin's came out with a chocolate hazelnut butter, the nutritionals are WAY better than any other chocolate hazelnut product out there, but it is isn't truly chocolate hazelnut because it is almond too, and it is dry and difficult to squeeze out of the little pouches or too dry to scoop out of the cup with the pretzels it comes with, and it just wasn't as tasty as I was hoping.

Now, enter Chocmeister.  They are trying to compete with Nutella as is everyone.  In that vein this has sugar as the first ingredient and has oil added in the form of palm oil.  This being their dark chocolate version does not have any milk added.  Chocmeister says this has 50% more protein than Nutella and 25% less sugar, and this it does indeed.  However, if you really care about the nutritionals you'd choose their milk chocolate version instead because it has 4 grams of protein instead of 3 (Nutella has 2gr protein).  I like that with Chocmeister they use cane sugar instead of beet sugar, cane sugar is not GMO whereas all beet sugar (unless it is organic) is GMO.  I also think it is awesome that they use sunflower lecithin instead of soy as many people are trying to avoid soy for health reasons.  Also, Chocmeister uses natural vanilla instead of the artificial vanillin which has been linked to allergies and ADD like behavior in kids.  Interestingly Chocmeister has also opted to try to boost the fiber content of their product by adding chicory root, and who doesn't need more fiber, right?  I get the feeling that this company is really trying to do things right, or at least better.

The jar does not say to refrigerate after opening, so I did not, but it was cool (42 degrees) when I pulled it out of the mailbox and yes, I tried it right there in the car, didn't even wait to get home, and was not very spreadable at 42 degrees, but at room temperature is was more than spreadable.  I am looking forward to heating it up in the microwave and trying it as topping on sea salt carmel ice cream :)

So, on to flavor.  Chocolate is all I taste when I eat this, I don't taste any hazelnut butter.  I am sure there are plenty out there with whom this is fine.  My kids really liked this stuff too, of course, remember, sugar is the first ingredient.  I have to say I have always been a fan of dark chocolate over milk, my kids will tell you they prefer milk, but they didn't complain about this being dark.  If you want something to compare the flavor of this to, it is a lot like the "cocoa fudge" they use at Dairy Queen.  I have not tasted Chocmeister's milk chocolate version but I watched a Youtube blind taste test and folks could pick out the Nutella and said that Chocmeister's milk chocolate had more hazelnut flavor and less chocolate flavor in comparison.  So if you are trying to decide between the milk and dark Chocmeister keep that in mind.

While I really like the taste of this, I have to say it seemed really rich, and I can't imagine eating two whole tablespoons of this as one serving, I think that is too much.  I think a single tablespoon is way more doable AND it cuts the sugar to 7.5 grams which is within the 9 gram limit we try to keep per serving on foods we buy (not including whole fruits and such).  One tablespoon is plenty for a whole slice of toast or both halves of an English muffin or half a bagel.

No one is eating this or any other chocolate hazelnut spread for the protein, they eat it for the chocolate, the hazelnut butter is just the spreadable medium the chocolate is suspended in.  So this, like any other chocolate hazelnut spread, is a treat, a dessert.  That being said the reduced sugar (and slightly elevated protein) in this is really a nice thing and makes the guilt factor a lot less.  If you are used to Nutella and love it you may not go for the taste of Chocmeister products, but if you are and you want to move to eating a little better make the switch and you'll get used to the taste of this and be happy.  If you are like me and have never bought Nutella because of how bad for you it is but want a little treat and not to feel that badly about about being bad, then Chocmeister is the way to go.  I can see, since I con't keep sweets in the house, that when those cravings hit I will go to this jar with a spoon and will be satisfied and will not feel as bad about it as other things I could eat, like sneaking my kids' halloween candy....
Rating:
4.0
Product:
CAILLER Praliné Chocolate Selection, Large Box Assortment, 7.8 Ounce, (25 Pieces)
Review:
I read a lot of the other reviews that said their chocolates arrived melted.  I counted myself quite lucky that mine arrived without melting despite having been shipped from Las Vegas to Minnesota, perhaps my luck has to do with it being the end of October.  While mine did not arrive melted there were still half a dozen pieces that were damaged in some way, sad when this chocolate tries so hard to make a nice and high end presentation with packaging and all.

This assortment is really quite diverse and I liked that, there were some types in the box I had not ever had before.  There were two of each kind which allowed me to eat one of each and let the rest of the family share the remaining pieces so I was able to make up my mind about these chocolates having tried it all.  The quality of the chocolate was really fabulous, this may have been my first time eating chocolate actually manufactured in Switzerland, it was so creamy, smooth, flavorful, and rich.  My husband and I are much more the dark sort but my daughters are both milk types, they just about died eating their allotment from this box they were in so much chocolate heaven.  I would definitely say that if you are the type to prefer dark then maybe this assortment is not for you.  If you love nuts then this is an amazing assortment.  My favorite nuts are hazelnuts and almonds and I definitely got my fill in this box that's for sure.  Very well done chocolate, very lovely presentation, would make for a real statement gift or a special treat/reward for yourself.

This is quite pricey, it comes out to about $70 per pound basically.  Anytime I see a product that has free shipping I know I have to remember that the price is inflated to cover the cost of shipping, I cannot help but wonder how much less expensive one might find this box in a store for, and perhaps with less to worry about in terms of damage or melting from shipping.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
FISHER Chef's Naturals Walnut Halves & Pieces, No Preservatives, Non-GMO, 16 oz
Review:
These are great.  I got them because I like using them in a salad topper recipe (walnuts, chia seeds, almond slices, dried cranberries, dried apple when I have it, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, pecans when I have them).  I also like them in oatmeal and in plain yogurt both with raisins.  I also like adding them to banana bread.  But my favorite recipe for these is cherry chicken pasta.  However, when these arrived, they were opened and sampled and then my daughter sat at the computer just munching on them, so I guess these may not even make into a recipe they are that good.  I like the resealable package, that is a nice change from the nuts in the baking aisle at the grocery store.  I am kind of bothered that they are advertising non-GMO since there are no FDA approved GMO crops other than corn (non-sweet corn), soybeans, sugar beets, canola (rapeseed), and cotton.  So, all walnuts are non-GMO anyway, and since the ingredients are simply walnuts there again would be no need to push these as non-GMO.  I guess I like that Fisher's $ is going to the Non-GMO Project and that they support the labeling of GMO's.  Anyway, good tasty chopped walnuts, not sure about pricing, seems a little high, but then again shipping is included in that, so...
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Kodiak Cakes All Natural Frontier Pancake, Flapjack and Waffle Mix, Original, 24 Ounce (Pack of 6) 
Review:
We started eating healthier about 9 years ago and a major part of that was eating all 100% whole grains.  Now, these are brownies, so they have a lot of sugar in them, so that does not fit in with our lifestyle as much, but if you are going to be bad a least do it 100% whole grain with excellent taste and texture!  They are so richly chocolate it is amazing, and the chocolate chips don't hurt either!  Honestly you'd never know they are 100% whole grain.  they do take quite a lot of fat, a whole stick of butter plus 2 T oil, but you can substitute.  It is said that for any brownie mix on the market, to make them more healthy you can substitute any/all of the fats/liquids asked for in the instructions except the eggs (so like oil, butter, water) for an equal amount of any of the following: yogurt, apple sauce, pureed black beans.  I have not been brave enough yet to try the black beans, but I did try yogurt and apple sauce, they were fine, there was a bit of taste to each of those but not too much, and of course the texture was a little different without the fat.  We belong to a CSA and get a 3/4 bushel box of fresh local organic veggies/fruit each week during the growing season and one week I had a bundle of baby beet that I did not know what to do with, so I boiled them, peeled them, pureed them, and substituted them in the Big Bear Brownies for the oil, butter, and water,and they were great!  I served them twice when company was over and everyone loved them and asked for seconds, and my girls love them and ask for more and dig the slight pink tint they brownies have.  Next I am going to experiment with pureed summer squash :)  Now I am just waiting for Kodiak Cakes to come up with a recipe for chocolate cake!  No matter what you do, if you want to still be able to eat brownies but want to do it healthier without sacrificing a thing then get these brownies!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Veggie-Go's Organic Fruit and Veggie Strip with No Added Sugar, Berry, Apple, Spinach, 0.42 Ounce (Pack of 20)
Review:
We have treid all the flavors and this berry spinach is the only one my kids will eat and I like it a lot too, I can eat the other flavors but I don't like like them enough to buy them again.  I'm on my second box from Amazon now but had been buying them at the local grocery store on and off over the past 6 months or so till they raised the price to 1.49 each.  I used them in the kids' cold school lunches and during the summer I used them while travelling to add some vegetables to everyone's diet on days when I know we might be short a little.  I ilke that we get half a serving of fruit and half a servng of vegetables (1/4 cupof each) in each leather, and each one has only 15 calories and 2 grams of sugar and one whole gram of fiber.  The ingredients are great too having only apples, spinach, strawberries, raspberries, blueberries, and sweet potato, and all organic too.  No fruit juice concentrate here!  No "natural flavors" either.  I watched the documentary called Sugar Coated and one of the doctors they featured did a bit where he took a very popular strawberry fruit snack in Canada and put out on a plate one serving then next to that a pile of granulated sugar equal to the grams of sugar in the fruit snack and then next to that a bowl of  1.14 pounds of strawberries which was what one would have to eat to equal the sugar in the fruit snack.  By this method these Mountain Berry Spinach fruit leathers pass the muster equalling about 2 medium strawberries.  Finally something I can feel good about putting into my kids' lunches.  One word of warning though, I have had the misfirtune to end up with some slightly old and hence tough or downright hard Veggie-Go's from the supermarket, guess at their prices they can sit around a little too long.  This has not been an issue with the ones I have gotten on Amazon thankfully.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Mott's Unsweetened Applesauce, 3.2 oz pouches, 4 count (Pack of 6)
Review:
This just arrived today and I had no problem getting the girls to come running to try it.  Both said it was a "like" and not a "love" so that's why the 4 stars instead of 5.  They are used to GoGo Squeeze Organic and they said they like the Mott's the same as they like the GoGo Squeeze.  We usually buy organic because apples are one of the dirty dozen in terms of pesticides, so for that reason alone I most likely will not buy these but if I am in a store and want apple sauce pouches and they don't have organic ones I would definitely buy these as my second choice, if these came in organic they'd be my first choice GoGo Squeeze in a heartbeat for the following reasons.  I like that these only have 8 grams of sugar per pouch where as the GoGo Squeeze Apple Strawberry has 12 grams of sugar, both are 90 grams.  Where I think these Mott's cut the sugar is that they have added water, these are a bit runnier than the GoGo Squeeze, but not enough that it bothered the kids.  These Mott's have fruit purees, the apple puree is concentrated, but at least it is still a puree (more of the whole fruit intact) and not apple juice concentrate like the GoGo Squeeze which is just a way to add sugar in a way that they can still call them 100% fruit.  The Mott's area also lower carbs, 10 grams as opposed to the 15 of the GoGo Squeeze.  These Mott's are also free from artificial ingredients and bonus they come with Box Tops for Education too.  In summary I really like that Mott's had tried to make the apple sauce pouch healthier than other brands out there and these would be my first choice and my go to if only they were organic.
Rating:
4.0
