Review:

golds.output: I love these rice crackers and they're gluten free which is a big plus.  The Simply Salt flavor is perfect, not too salty and not too bland.  I've tried other rice crackers and they can be a bit on the bland side but these are great.  I use them to snack on or to add some crunch to my lunch.  I also like to use them as a base for appetizers when I have company.  The price is a little high but I think they're worth it.  I've purchased them several times and will continue to do so.

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Frosted Mini-Wheats Blueberry Muffin Cereal, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 4)
Review:
The blueberry flavored shredded wheat had free shipping so I decided to try it.  You smell blueberries as soon as you open the box but the flavor is not that "fresh blueberry" taste.  It will appeal to some and not to others.  The cereal is ok but not great.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
 Roland Foods Balsamic Glaze, 12.9 Ounce (Pack of 2) 
Review:
This is a completely edited review.  I even changed my rating from 3 stars to 2.  There are some stellar reviews here so I'm going to say this must be a matter of taste.  I've had a lot of balsamic glazes in my long life and this one is the least appealing to me.  My first issue is the vinegar.  When I taste it alone I don't get a balsamic vinegar taste in my mouth.  I just get a harsh plain old vinegar taste that makes my mouth pucker.  I looked at the ingredients and immediately understood why. This is not pure balsamic reduced vinegar.  It's mixed with wine vinegar and that's what I'm tasting.

I tried doctoring this glaze up with honey and it's better but still not what I want.  This just isn't for me.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Planters Cashew Halves & Pieces, Salted, 1 Pound and 10 Ounce
Review:
We love cashews but they can be expensive.  These large jars of halves and pieces fit the bill for snacking.  Every jar I've ever purchased has been fresh and delicious.  I've got them on Subscribe and Save so we don't run out.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kraft  Asian Toasted Sesame Dressing & Marinade, 16-Ounce Plastic Bottles (Pack of 6)
Review:
I absolutely love this salad dressing.  One thing I really like to do is make a green salad topped with cooked chicken.  I dress the salad with the Kraft Asian Toasted Sesame Dressing and then toss the chicken with Kraft Honey Mustard Dressing which I also buy on Amazon through Subscribe and Save.  What a fantastic taste combination.

By the way, I've tried other sesame dressings and don't care for them at all.  I only like this one so if you've never tried it...give it a shot.  It's got bold taste with a sweet edge that just melts in your mouth.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Old El Paso Fat Free Refried Beans 16 oz Can (pack of 12)
Review:
These are very tasty refried beans with add flavor and fiber in lots of ways.  Beside the traditional recipes adding the beans to burritos, dips, and other Mexican style dishes, I also sometimes add a can to homemade bean and veggie soups as a thickener and taste booster.  Fat free is always a big plus.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Quaker Natural Granola Oats, Honey, Raisins and Almonds - Two 34.5oz Bags
Review:
My husband is addicted to this cereal.  It's a daily ritual...1/2 a bowl of this granola with 1/2 a bowl of mini shredded wheat, and a banana. A friend gave him a bag of it a few months ago and that was it.  Love at first bite...lol  I wish they'd bring the price down though.  I bought the first bag here but when I found out it was going to be a regular purchase checked Walmart.  It's cheaper there.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Barilla Collezione Pasta, Cheese & Spinach Tortellini, 12 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I purchased Barilla Three Cheese Tortellini about a month ago at the super market after being discharged from the hospital. I was told to stay on a low fiber/no meat diet for a while.  They suggested pasta and rice as a base.  When I saw this I thought...it's Barilla...how bad can it be.  It was pretty darn good with a little drizzle of quality olive oil and parm cheese sprinkled on top.  Now I can eat seafood and right away thought about this with sauteed shrimp and fresh garlic tossed in.  As usual, I checked for the product on Amazon and see they've got a 4 pack available through Subscribe and Save....my favorite way to shop.

I'm looking forward to trying the shrimp dish. While the tortellini is cooking I'll quickly saute fresh shrimp and chopped fresh garlic in a little olive oil and a small pat of butter for rich flavor. Toss that into the cooked pasta and top with a little grated cheese.....yummy!!!!!  Can't wait to add veggies to this dish.  One bag serves 4 or, if you're a robust eater, provides 2 REALLY generous servings.  By the way...leftovers keep well in the frig for days and reheat well if not over cooked so singles or someone cooking for two shouldn't shy away from cooking a whole bag at once.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Simply Organic All-Purpose Seasoning, Certified Organic, 2.08-Ounce Container
Review:
I use Simply Organic All-Purpose Seasoning on everything.  I also use Mrs. Dash but find this a little less spicy for milder dishes.  I wouldn't be without it.  IT'S ORGANIC so it's my first choice.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Mrs. Dash Seasoning, Salt Free Original, 6.75 Ounce
Review:
My doctor recently recommended Mrs. Dash to help me replace salt in my diet.  I had already started using a lot of Simply Organic spices which I highly recommend.  Thought I'd give this a try too and I'm glad I did.  It's got a rather unique blend of herbs and spices that might sound a little off putting when you read them but they work very well together.  One thing I will note here is that it can be a bit on the spicy side if you add too much.  There are several different types of pepper in this blend that add just the right amount of zip if used properly or to your taste.  I have a sensitive stomach so I don't over due it.  I discovered just how "zippy" it can be the last time I made tuna salad.  I had used it in tuna salad the week before and it was fantastic.  I figured if a little was great, more would be fantastic....lol.  Maybe it would be for someone who likes spicy.  Bottom line...buy it...experiment with it starting with smaller amounts at first and add more until you find the amount that gives you the spiciness you want.  Remember it's dried so it takes a little time for the flavors to develop.  When making something like tuna salad, I add it to the mayo first so the dried herbs and spices absorb moisture faster and then mix everything together.  I will definitely be buying this again.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
YORK Dark Chocolate Peppermint Candy (Patties), 19.75 Ounce (Pack of 3)
Review:
I just looked at a bag of York Peppermint Patties my husband and I were eating.  I love these little patties so wanted to find out the calorie count so I didn't overdo...lol.  To my surprise I noticed that even though these are a Hershey's Corp product, they're manufactured in Mexico instead of Hershey, Pa., like many of their other candies.  Very disappointed.
Rating:
3.0

Product:
Capella Flavor Drops Cool Mint Concentrate 13ml

5.0
Product:
SweetLeaf Sweet Drops Liquid Stevia Sweetener, Vanilla Creme, 2 Ounce
Review:
I got these vanilla cream drops to sweeten my homemade yogurt. They did not disappoint. I did have to use more than I thought I would, but it will help me to use less sugar in my homemade yogurt. I did impart a bit of flavor and that added nicely to the vanilla extract I had already added. It's nice in a dropper bottle so you can more accurately control how much you use.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Splenda Minis Dissolvable Tablets, 100-Count (Pack of 4)
Review:
I like Splenda Minis much better than granulated Splenda, and having them in a dispenser is nice. Hopefully one day they will come in a cardboard container that I will be able to refill my dispenser from. In the meantime I just pop the top off and dump them all into my 400 count dispenser. For some reason you can only get 100 counts in the US
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Harney and Sons Decaf Hot Cinnamon , Decaf Flavored Black 20 Sachets per Tin 1.4oz
Review:
I have had a tin of this tea for several years. I just wasn't using a lot of decaf, but I got it as a gift. When I finished the tin last week I realized it was coated with cinnamon from the lovely tea bags. I threw in a cup of sugar and shook it. A week later I had the flavor of the tea back, in my sugar!!!! Wow! Just makes the tea even more special!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
nutpods Unsweetened Dairy-free Creamer, 4-pack (Original, Discontinued Listing)
Review:
Oh how I hoped for more when I saw this creamer. Alas it doesn't stand up to percolated coffee. I shook it well and added the 2 tablespoons to my coffee. I added more, stirred, more, stirred, more, stirred. I added a third of the 11 oz container and gave up. I still had to add regular half & half to get to a reasonable level of creaminess.

I guess if you like your coffee weak and just a splash of cream it would work. However, it just doesn't stand up to espresso or percolator grinds.

Taste was good (no noticeable aftertaste) but for the calorie load I'll stick with half & half. I can deal with the 40 calories of half & half much better than the higher calorie load it takes to lighten my coffee with Nutpods. I'll just use it on the weekends and maybe in some dinner rolls or baking recipes to use it up.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Stur - Classic Variety Pack, Natural Water Enhancer (5 Bottles, Makes 100 Flavored Waters) - Sugar Free, Zero Calories, Kosher, Keto Friendly Liquid Drink Mix Sweetened with Stevia
Review:
I am very happy so far. I got these to add to a powdered collagen supplement that I use in order to make it more palatable. I have tried two of the five flavors so far and they are good. I was not sent the exact description of the items as I did not get the Blue and Blackberry one, but a Black Tea with Lemon was subbed instead, so I am deducting a star for that. Otherwise they are very good, with none of the bitter stevia aftertaste that so turns me off about stevia. Will probably but again.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Pomonas Pectin Universal 3 Pack
Review:
Works great, much better than other pectins I have used. I tried it in yogurt, but the yogurt came out grainy, and I did not go over 180 degrees, so I know it was the pectin. Instead of using it in the milk, I just made really tight low sugar fruit and froze the packets. It worked much better in my yogurt that way.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Palm Sugar - 1lb
Review:
I like this palm sugar because it was in a more natural state (thick and not runny). It is not a dry granulated product, think paste but scoopable with a spoon. My only dislike was that it was obvious it had a wax seal, because I had to scoop out the broken wax pieces. It doesn't say this in the description, but should. Othewise very tasty. I do not use bleached sugars for anything but pickling or birdfeeder food, and this is a nice addition to my natural unbleached sweeteners
Rating:
4.0
Product:
YS Eco Bee Farms RAW HONEY - Raw, Unfiltered, Unpasteurized - Kosher 3lbs
Review:
First and foremost the seller said in the description: Naturally Crystallized, Energy Packed, True Raw State, Our Honey Is Never Forcefully Processed To Make Creamy (Spreadable) . So I expected to get a honey that was crystallized, and I did. Many people don't understand that crystallized honey in it's raw state is hard. It is not creamy and it is marginally spreadable at best.

I just got it today and already threw about a half a cup that I carved out of the container into a food processor and buzzed it with lemon to make a cough syrup because I'm not feeling well.

Also the honey does not say in its title it's organic, it just happens to be produced by a company that produces other organic products so that is on the label, not in the title, so I did not expect to get organic honey.

What I wanted was raw, solid honey. That is what came in the package. It is not for cooking (although you could cook with it) because you would destroy any healthful benefits of it.

The bottle was sealed on the outside and the lid was on tight. I did not expect it to be sealed on the inside and it wasn't. After all, there is nothing to spoil inside the package if its real honey. There was nothing to spill. If you get grossed out because there is no inner seal then you probably don't garden either, because to do that you'd have to realize that once in while you eat dirt, and that it's healthy.

I've been eating raw honey for many years now, long before it was fashionable. This is a mild flavor compared to other honeys I've had.

I'm sucking on a nice chunk of it right now

I'm a satisfied customer
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Wilton Edible Glitter Silver Stars,  0.4 oz.
Review:
Very pretty stars, and I couldn't detect sugar anywhere on the label. Small bottle, so if you need a large amount be prepared to order more. These will be a nice addition to my other decorating items.
Rating:
5.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:

Product:
Jovial Foods Organic Einkorn Flour, 32.0-Ounce
Review:
I just re-ordered this unique flour, and still trying out different recipes.  Have seen some recipes for No-Knead bread using this flour.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
NuNaturals - NuStevia - Pure White Stevia Extract – 1 Ounce
Review:
I've always purchased the Now 1lb stevia, but a food blogger highly recommended this brand, saying it does not have bitter aftertaste - as long as you don't over-add it.  This small bottle will go a long way because it is very strong. I "powdered" some over a pint of fruit salad (pineapple chunks, mandarin orange segements and freeze dried raspberries), and it perfectly corrects and balances the tartness and the sweetness, enhancing the flavor of the canned pineapples, especially,.

It is a softer stevia, and at the same time very concentrated, which is why I used the term "powdered".

My only objection is the plastic bottle, and as soon as I can I will put this in a glass bottle that fits the lid. I took away the fifth star for that. For flavoring though I give it five stars.  I will purchase this again.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Food For Life Ezekiel 4:9 Organic Sprouted Grain Pasta, Penne, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
I purchased this at a local health food store because I do like the Ezekiel bread occasionally. It's OKAY if cooked to softness in something like a strong tomato sauce or a spicy hungarian goulash. When I first opened the bag it did not pass the sniff test - musty smelling. Imagine eating a wet Triscuit cracker that has no salt or sugar or seasonings - that's what it's like if you undercook it. I'd rather purchase a bag of sprouted grain flour and make my own spaghetti noodles - I'm sure it would taste better.  I would not purchase this again and even though I really like noodles I prefer the zucchini noodles. I also like the Jovial brand classic white einkorn pasta but the phytic acid is still an issue with all grains and seeds products that have not been pre-germinated. The ancients knew this. There is a longstanding myth that the human body needs protein to break down into amino acids, whereas the body is perfectly able to create its own protein from amino acids in fresh fruits and vegetables. Nuts, seeds, grains should not need to be more than 10% of diet, and meats amd dairy even less --- I did not start to experience a restored youthfulness until I made ripe fruits and leafy greens 80% of my diet...doctor's orders.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
King Soba Noodles Organic Sweet Potato and Buckwheat Noodles, 8.8 Ounce
Review:
Great packaging, great product, and I've looked for and tried other sobas... most of them contain wheat as first ingredient.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Garden of Life Raw Organic Protein Unflavored Powder Packets, 10ct Tray - Certified Vegan, Gluten Free, Organic, Non-GMO, Plant Based Sugar Free Shake with Probiotics & Enzymes, 4g BCAAs, 22g Protein
Review:
My body did not jump up and down for joy with this product, and I'm not referring to the taste, smell, or texture.  I follow Dr. Peter D'Adamo's guidelines and data re blood types, have found it to be largely true for myself.  For example, I have to sprout my grains before I eat them without consequences, esp. beans and wheat.  My personal idea of really great raw protein is Steak Tartare, and probably costs the same as this canister cost me.  However, I can see how the "A" blood groups would mostly love this product.  My envy  :-)
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Native Forest Organic Premium Coconut Cream, Unsweetened, 5.4 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
I purchased this at $1.54 per can which I thought was a fair price. The same size can of organic tomato paste is a little less, but this size is needed for a single person who does not have a lot of refrigerator space to spare. It packs a lot of cream for its size.

I decided to purchase only the Native Forest brand after trying other cans. I also purchase the "Simple" (no guar gum) product. Native Forest uses BPA-free cans. I know BPA-free is not a guarantee of food safety and I've asked the Eden Foods Company to start selling coconut milk in their high integrity food-grade BPA-free cans.

I use one chilled or frozen can of this and frozen fruit in my nutribullet-900 to make creamy soft frozen desserts.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
REDMOND Real Sea Salt - Natural Unrefined Organic Gluten Free Fine, 26 ounce pouch (1 Pack)
Review:
Great on mashed potatoes.  Of course I had to "PR" to my people the little black specks in the otherwise white salt because they are used to the conventional bleached table salt.  I will be ordering this salt again and again.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Dole Pineapple Chunks, 23.5 Ounce Jars (Pack of 8)
Review:
I purchased a case of these from another seller that had it on sale.
Before I discovered Dole Pineapple Chunks in the plastic jar with the green lid, I ate canned only pineapple of all brands.
I prefer the fresher and non-metallic aftertaste of these jars of pineapple chunks. I will buy this again.
Best tasting when chilled, and I sometimes add coconut flavored syrup or freeze-dried raspberries. Great tasting juice too.

I also use pineapple chunks in cooked savory recipes, but don't further cook it - add after the dish is removed from high heat.
The chunks are slightly but not overly fibrous, but also a melt-in-your-mouth flesh...Meaty overall.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Redmond Real Salt, Nature's First Sea Salt, Coarse Salt, 16 Ounce Pouch (6 Pack)
Review:
Since I've been doing daily intermittent fasting my tastes are changing, and I find I can now enjoy the taste of vegetables and meats with much less salt added.  I used to purchase the Himalayan sea salt, and it increasingly became too harsh for my evolving palate.

On my daughter's recommendation I purchased the Redmond Real Salt.  It is a milder salt, not as harsh as the pink salt.  My next purchase will be the fine grind.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Artisana Organics - Cashew Butter, Certified organic, RAW and non-GMO, no added sugar or oil, rich and creamy
Review:
I purchased this same product (cashew butter) from another website.  Here was my review on that website:
"Has a very smooth texture and slightly nutty, but mostly neutral flavor. I've been testing it out, and I used it similar to adding a dollop of sweet yellow miso to a soup or sauce once it is taken off the heat.  Instead of miso I added a dollop of the cashew butter combined with dried herbs to some white sauce (for a pasta dish).  I would do that again.

Anything you wish to add some body and up the fattiness unctiousness, this would be neutral enough, unlike p'nut butter.  If you want to tone down a p'nut butter sauce you could add this, half and half.  I think it has potential to also to enhance a stove-top mac and cheese.  If you spiralize cucumber, this would add some unctiousness - if you don't have an avocado on hand - but would need to be thinned with some lime juice, etcetera; However, I'm not using it as a spread for bread or crackers - it's too bland and needs to be combined with something else to be canape-worthy.
Rating:
5.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Hoosier Hill Farm Cheddar Cheese Powder, 1.5 lb.
Review:
I have always been a big fan of the Kraft grated cheddar cheese. The kind that comes with their macaroni and cheese dinners, and used to be available in containers. They vanished from stores years ago, and they used to sell it in small 3 oz shakers by the case here on Amazon, but that too has since disappeared.  Unfortunately grated cheddar is very expensive as compared to the standard Romano or Parmesan.  The Kraft was worth the extra cost for it was so delicious.  But the others I have tried have either been way to expensive, or weak and flavorless.  This Hoosier cheddar blend is not as strong nor as flavorful as the Kraft by any means in my opinion.  But it is still very good, and excellently priced.  Unlike many on here, I don't use it much on popcorn.  I love it on pasta especially, and when making my home made pizzas.  It is also very tasty in soups as well.  It is indeed unfortunate that the Kraft grated cheddar is not available anymore, but this is a very worthy alternative, especially for the price.  Not quite as good as Kraft, but still decent and recommended... : )

PS:  At the time of this writing, the 1 1/2 pound size is a much better bargain over the one pound container.  It's just around $3.00 more and you get another half pound of product.  Also, I was originally sent a one pound container by mistake, but the seller allowed me to keep it and promptly sent me the correct larger size. : )
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Beef Broth Powder, 8 oz.
Review:
This is excellent bullion at a bargain price.  Since its a powder you can much more easily make an accurate measurement of how much you want to add to your stock. And as a powder, it contains slightly less sodium than the familiar cubed bullion. A little of this powder goes a long ways for it is so rich.  So this 8 oz. package ends up being a bargain for it will last most of us through several winters. I highly recommend it.  It has helped me make the best vegetable beef soup in the United States.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Viva Naturals Organic Ghee 8 oz - from 100% Grass-Fed Cows, Non-GMO, and Certified Paleo Diet Friendly
Review:
This stuff doesn't taste exactly like butter, or margarine, but it is close enough that it has a very pleasant, buttery like taste all its own...Though it states that it should be refrigerated after opening, enough reviewers here have taken note that it is not really a requirement....Thus this stuff stays rather soft and spreadable by remaining at room temperature..(But not as soft as butter or margarine that has sat at room temperature for a while). One thing about this stuff that is a nice advantage is its higher boiling point.  Spreading it out in a frying pan sees much less smoke and more substance that butter...A good asset for sure if you really like cooking with this.  Personally with its cost I did not find any real advantage to cooking with it as to taste in the finished product.. If you are really into this being a purer perhaps healthier alternative to butter, that would be a different matter.  But for myself I like it best as a spread for hot rolls, toast, cornbread, etc, all of which it tastes great on.  All in all some really good stuff...A little too costly for me to  use regularly, but a little of it goes a long ways which is a good thing...Recommended for those that are into this sort of thing and really do enjoy the rich taste...
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Chef Boyardee Overstuffed Italian Sausage Ravioli, 15 oz, 12 Pack
Review:
This is undoubtedly the best canned ravioli I have ever tasted. And I am not usually a big fan of canned ravioli except for a quick lunch sort of thing. I just recently came across this variety in the market here and gave it a try.  Not only is the ravioli truly overstuffed, but the sausage they use is very tasty without being hot and spicy.  I have actually baked these with Parmesan cheese and some added garlic and onion for 15 min and had people rave about them being home made.  If you can't find this in your market, its a good deal here on Amazon by the case, and with free shipping.  Excellent home made flavor, and highly recommended... : )
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Cheddar Cheese Powder, 1 lb. by Barry Farm
Review:
I am admittedly a big fan of Barry Farm products.  They make just about any food, veggie, dairy product, or spice in either a freeze dried or powdered form.  As an outdoor enthusiast that enjoys carrying along a little taste of home into the savage wilderness, this is a company that I am well familiar with.  Not everything they make is delicious, or worth it. My experience with them however is that most of their products are just about the finest, and many times the only ones around.  This cheddar cheese powder is definitely one of their best.  Many reviewers here mention making macaroni and cheese, and popcorn with it.  Although I have used it for those purposes like everyone else, I have also used this powder as an addition to many soups that call for cheese, or grated cheese. (It makes a very flavorful substitute for grated cheese in many recipes.) Hamburger and sausage soups are a good example.  Many times I have concocted delicious one pot meals using this powder while out in the wilds on a hike, or camping. They are remembered as some of the best meals I have ever had. It is also very good when sprinkled on home made pizza, and I have an excellent recipe that includes this powder, butter, flour, and salt, that makes a delicious cheese spread for crackers and super bowl parties. Barry Farms cheddar powder is strong and flavorful, and a little goes a long ways.  A one pound bag will get you through many a recipe and outdoor adventure.  However since the shipping on this is a little high, (and the powder so reasonable) I suggest buying two pounds or more at once and storing it in a good air tight container.  You will save a lot on the shipping, and this powder will last for months if stored correctly.  I highly recommend this cheddar powder for those that enjoy the simple pleasures of popcorn and mac and cheese, as well as the more adventurous among us in the kitchen, and over an open fire...
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tomato Flakes, 2 oz.
Review:
I have used a pretty good size line of Barry Farms dehydrated veggies for more than a decade now.  Although I occasionally have used them when cooking in my kitchen, the vast majority of time I use them for campfire cooking when I am hiking.  I love carrying dried products such as this on my hikes for they are light, easy to carry, and you can just use what you want and reseal the bag.  (Unlike canned veggies and such that don't take kindly to being bagged and toted along as leftovers).  Best of all, these tomato flakes are very flavorful.  Make that downright delicious.  I add about a third of one bag to any stew or soup I am making on an open fire, and the rich taste of fresh tomato is your reward in every spoonful. A little of these flakes goes a long ways as to flavor, so keep that in mind if your a beginner with them.  They have a much fresher taste than you would imagine, and have been a part of some of the best meals I have ever put together in the wilderness.  My only recommendation when ordering these flakes is to get at least 3 bags at once to make the shipping worth it.  You can order 3 of them for the same shipping cost as one.  Really rich tasting and well worth your money in my opinion...
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Kirkland Signature California granulated garlic, 18 oz
Review:
Garlic powder is like salt and pepper in this house...Never without it and never left out of a recipe...Although I have settled for cheaper brands, quality in the past, this has now become a staple in my home...You can really smell the freshness and strength of this upon opening, and definitely in the taste of whatever I am cooking...This is also superior to the McCormick California garlic which I have had and used before...Fresher and stronger, and even lasts longer...Garlic like any other spice can go bad, lose its pungency over time.  This size jar is just right for how often I use it and its keeping well fresh till the end...And it comes at a very fair price, as well as arrives fast and intact...Really good stuff and recommended...Now, its time to make my home made spaghetti sauce...With garlic...: )
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Margaret Holmes, Tomato, Okra & Corn, 14.5oz Can (Pack of 6)
Review:
This stuff is available at the local dollar store here.  I picked up a can once just to see what it tasted like and waited quite some time before using it.  Finally one night I decided to heat it up along side a sandwich and was very pleasantly surprised.  It really is delicious and spicy.  It's so good it is one of the very few things I eat that I don't add anything to it, no garlic, salt, nothing.  Since finding it I pick up a couple of cans every time I go to the dollar store and eat it often as a side dish, and sometimes just by itself as a soup. (It's loose in consistency, like a soup). I love it and hope they never stop carrying it at the dollar store.  It's a lot more expensive here but would be worth it if it came to be the only place I could find it.  Try your local dollar store then decide.  Darn tasty stuff...: )
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Celery Leaf and Stalk, 2 oz. by Barry Farm
Review:
I have many reviews for Barry Farm products here on Amazon.  Maybe a dozen or so.  If they are not the largest distributor of dried veggies, spices, herbs, etc, than they have to be very close.  I became familiar with Barry Farm products many years ago when I first started doing a lot of hiking.  Their freshness, convenience, and flavor has made them a regular staple carry along on my hikes.  This dehydrated celery stalk and leaf is one that I probably use the most for any camp cooking.  Simply because there is not a soup or stew that I make that doesn't include celery at home. This stalk and leaf product is an excellent alternative to fresh celery that for obvious reasons is not a practical take along on the trail. This product is very flavorful, and a little of it goes a long ways.  I would even  venture to say that in the wilderness, or even at home, this dried celery has even more flavor than fresh any time.  I think it may have something to do with the fact that this is dried from both celery stalks and leafs.  The leaf being something that most of us don't bother with at home.  Every time I have used this in a stew or soup I have easily tasted the celery distinctly in the most delicious of trail concoctions.  As I said before, a little of this goes a long ways. A 2 oz. package gets me easily through three large one pot meals on my hiking trips.

The only downside to this and all Barry Farm items is the shipping.  This celery goes for around $2.00 a package but costs around $7.00 to ship.  All Barry Farm products are expensive in the shipping sense for a reason I have never really figured out.  But it's very easy to make this and any other Bary Farm purchase easily a bargain by combining either 3 or more bags of this, or anything else from them.  You can actually order 6 of these celery bags for around a dollar more in shipping than the cost for just one.  I routinely order at least a couple of several products at once and end up paying close to the actual price per unit that way.  I highly recommend this very flavorful and convenient celery talk and leaf, as well as combining the shipping on this and or all Barry Farm products.  It will help make you some of the best one pot meals you are to ever enjoy...
Rating:
5.0

Dubble Bubble Tub, Original Flavor, 380-Count, 60.3 Oz(3.7 lb)
Review:
I decided to buy some Dubble Bubble after seeing a tub of it in the Red Sox dugout on TV.  For some reason I always thought they chewed Bazooka since that was just about all there was growing up as a kid here.  I ran out and got a couple of packs of each for my own taste test.  I gotta admit I like the DB better.  Like the other reviewer here I noticed that its not as sticky on the teeth as Bazooka.  And I actually thought it was sweeter and lasted a tad longer.  Its sorta like comparing Coke to Pepsi for their both good and very similar.  But I do have to give the final nod to DB. (Even considering you still get the Bazooka Joe comic with Bazooka.) Besides, if Dubble Bubble is good enough for the Red Sox, its good enough for me!...
Rating:
5.0

Product:
True Lemon Raspberry Lemonade 10-count (Pack of 6)
Review:
I'm not much of a water drinker.  I want to be, I just have trouble with the tastelessness of water and thus fall into the trap of guzzling down sodas both for the caffeine and for the taste.  Which is a habit I'd really love to stop.  The problem with most drink additives though is the ingredients.  All those fake sugars and I figure I might as well be drinking a soda.  So then I saw True Lemon at the store and the advertisement that it was 100% natural.  So I thought why not try it?  And I'm glad I did.

I started off with a little box of 10 packets of the Raspberry Lemonade to see how I would like it.  For drink additives it was pricey, but no more (and actually a little less) than if I had bought a case of the same amount of soda.  So I won't complain about the price especially considering this is better for me.  They came in little packets that were long and tubular shaped and easy to get open.  You just pop the top of your water bottle and pour the contents in, getting a little show in the meantime of the powder coming up like smoke from the bottle.  Hey, it doesn't take much to amuse me.

The taste is pretty good.  I think I taste more of the raspberry and sugar than they do the lemon, and that's why this product doesn't get more than four stars from me.  I would have liked to have had it be a bit more tart instead of just smooth and sweet.  But it's still not bad.  It goes down smooth and one packet is enough to flavor 17oz of water quite strongly.  It also turns the water a nice pale pink color.

As said before I was strongly attracted to this product because of its ingredients.  Instead of artificial sweeteners, stevia is used.  It also has lemon juice and other natural flavors.  Nothing in the ingredient list looked too bad so I'm happy.  And according to the box its only 5 calories, which isn't too bad either.

Definitely a product I'd try again, and I'll probably end up trying their other flavors as well.

Review by M. Reynard 2011

4.0

You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.

<similarpairs>
Product:
Viva Naturals - The BEST Organic Ground Flax Seed, 15 oz - Proprietary Cold-milled Technology
Review:
I bake a lot of breads, and always try to sneak some extra health in each loaf.
I know that health benefit of flax seeds, but worry about small seeds when baking for those that might be prone to diverticulitus.

I love this product, all the goodness with none of the risk. I've put it in baked goods and even stirred it in yogurt and honey. Next will be in smoothies that are made in a VitaMix.
Nice, fresh smell.
I received a sample size to try, views and opinions are my own.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
2LB Premium Raw Organic Cacao Nibs, Rich Dark Chocolate Taste - Healthy Chocolate Chip Substitute, 60-Day
Review:
DISCLOSURE: I received a small 2oz sample of these cacao nibs to test, with the option to review. Views and opinions are my own.

And you only need 2 ounces to see how easy it is to add this superfood in, well, almost everything!
As is, they are crunchy with a mild, pure, unsweetened dark chocolate taste. A bit bitter and astringent, wonderful in a trail mix.
Use as a nut substitute, in baking, in smoothies and shakes. I like to sprinkle over potatoes that are oven roasted with poblano peppers, garlic, and flaked sea salt.

Cacao nibs are an antioxidant powerhouse, with studies showing that regular consumption can lower blood pressure and possibly reduce the risk of heart issues.
Rating:
5.0

Nutiva Organic, Cold-Pressed, Unrefined, Virgin Coconut Oil from Fresh, non-GMO, Sustainably Farmed Coconuts, 15-ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
This coconut oil has a very strong coconut taste, making it an excellent option for cakes, cookies, curries, and the like. On the down side, it seems to melt at a lower temp than some other brands, and a combination of that and seals that do not hold tight make for an occasional messy package in summer months. Still, it has a nice fresh taste and it's a reasonable price.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
ORCHARD VALLEY HARVEST Cranberry Almond Cashew Trail Mix, Non-GMO, No Artificial Ingredients, 1 oz (Pack of 8)
Review:
In listing my top ten of favorite snacks, these little packets of Trail Mix are definitely on the higher end.
Not only is it the perfect portion control size, but the flavor and freshness is near unbeatable.
Very lightly salted, the nuts are crunchy and crisp.
Raisins are coated in a glossy dark chocolate. The sweetness of the raisins tempers the bittersweet of the chocolate. Decadently chewy.
I was thinking that some of these would be sent to a dear friend in college as part of her care package.
Nope.
Not one pack made it into the box.
Guess I'll have to send some directly from Amazon to her.
They are that good!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Organic Coconut Oil, Extra Virgin, Cold Pressed, Unrefined, Non-GMO - 16 ounce (1 lb.) Use for Cooking, Hair and Skin - Hexane-Free Extraction and Fair-Trade Certified
Review:
On opening this jar of coconut oil, you'll notice that it's a bit more mild than some other brands, but still has a fresh coconut scent.
That makes it great in a wide range of dishes.
I saute using it, and it adds a slightly more interesting flavor...but here's my favorite way to use it:
Chop any fresh vegetables you have on hand.
One good combination is diced potatoes, cauliflower florets, red and green peppers, garlic and/or onion, and a can of peas.
Saute the fresh veg in a generous tablespoon of coconut oil. Sprinkle on as much curry powder as you like, along with sea salt. Before serving add a dollop of plain yogurt.

Also, it's a healthy treat for your dog. Put a half teaspoon on your hand or spread on a plate and let your pup lick away.

And of course, it makes a wonderful after bath skin treatment.

Delicious as well as a huge multi-tasker, and organic to boot.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Spectrum Culinary Organic Unrefined Virgin Coconut Oil, 54 fl. oz. (Pack of 2)
Review:
Before it was so easy to buy certain organic products in the grocery store, the Spectrum company had all kinds of wonderful fresh oils that I would buy at the health food store. Since that time, certain oils are available in my local grocery. I guess what I'm trying to say, is that they have been around a long time, and always with a focus on high quality and good health.
Coconut oil has all but replaced my cooking oils, and most of the butter I use. To say nothing of being used on my hair and skin.

In the years I've been using it, it's become clear that not all coconut oil is the same.
Unlike a few others, this one has no 'off' scent, it smells fresh and the coconut scent is mild enough to used in a wider variety of cooking applications, as opposed to the highly scented ones that are best in dishes where you want a prominent coconut flavor.
Non GMO, which I really like.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Viva Naturals Organic Quinoa, 4 LB - 100% Royal Bolivian Whole Grain
Review:
At first quinoa was treated like a flash-in-the-pan 'trendy' fad, but thankfully, it looks like it is here to stay.
And with good reason.
If you're reading this, you're already familiar with the health benefits of this ancient grain. What you might not be as familiar with, is it's versatility.

Yes, it makes a wonderful pilaf, with or without the addition of rice. Have you tried it in a cold salad? I recently bought one of those super expensive lunch salads from Starbucks,  it was a southwestern one with black beans, roasted corn, tomatoes, and quinoa. Fabulous!

Quinoa is also terrific in soups. I love it in any tomato based soup, and it lends itself well to almost any broth based soup or stew.
This particular brand not only cooks up well, it is a much better value than the boxes at the local grocery store.

I received a sample to cook up and review, I really like it.

5.0

Product:
Wedderspoon Raw Premium Manuka Honey KFactor 12, 17.6 Oz, Unpasteurized, Genuine New Zealand Honey, Multi-Functional, Non-GMO Superfood
Review:
A friend of mine has a form of OCD where she will chew on her fingertips until they are bloody and raw.
Without going into all of what she goes through, therapies, Etc, I wanted to share this...
One day I noticed that her fingertips looked great and I asked her what she was doing.
She replied that she had put Manuka Honey on them. They healed better than any topical ointment, and believe me, she's tried them all.
For whatever reason, who can say if it's the honey or something else, the urge to do this has also diminished.
Now I'm not saying that the honey helped with the OCD, all I'm saying is that it really helped with her fingertips.
I like that this brand has been around before the whole hype of manuka honey. It's the real deal, and has been for a long time.
Now all you have to do is decide whether you want it in your kitchen cupboard or your medicine cabinet. I suggest a jar in both!
Rating:
5.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Good Earth White Tea with Vanilla, 18-Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
Yuck - this tea is really not to my liking.  This tea has a very unpleasant taste, something I cannot quite describe.  I have to force myself to drink it until I use up my supply.  It sort of makes me shudder as I swallow it.  I have tried brewing it for shorter times and I still don't like it.  I have also tried the Decaf White Tea, with the same opinion.

It was surprising to me that I dislike this white tea.  I love other Good Earth tea products, with the decaf green tea and organic decaf green tea with mango being my favorites that I drink daily.

I know the other reviewers have rated this white tea highly, but I would suggest trying a box from your local grocery before ordering in bulk.
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Traditional Medicinals Organic Throat Coat Seasonal Tea, 16 Tea Bags (Pack of 6)
Review:
This tea sampler is a must for cold and flu season.  I like to have this variety of teas on hand, and pick one most appropriate for how I am feeling "under the weather".  The box contains 4 sachets of 4 kinds: Throat Coat, Echinacea Plus, Breathe Easy and Gypsy Cold Care.  My favorite is the Breathe Easy which really helps to clear up clogged sinuses.  Be aware that the echinacea- or other flower-based kinds might affect people who have allergies to certain flowers, this may also depend on how long they are brewed.  Note that it is recommended to brew these teas for 10 to 15 min.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Good Earth Herbal Tea, Sweet & Spicy, Caffeine Free, 18 Count Tea Bags (Pack of 6) (Packaging May Vary)
Review:
I have been drinking Good Earth Decaf Green Tea for many years and it is my favorite tea. This tea is not purely green tea leaves - it also contains lemongrass and other flavors. It is flavorful but mild. Ingredients: Decaffeinated Green Tea, Lemongrass, Natural Flavors (Contains Soy Lecithin), Rose Petals and Peppermint.

Be aware that the Good Earth Decaf Green Tea does not have the more delicate flavor as real Japanese green tea (and not a roasted flavor like Genmai), but it is great as an everyday tea. If you are expecting green tea like in Japanese restaurants, this is not it - if you want that, get high quality loose tea leaves and brew it with the correct temperature water in a teapot. (Although maybe the Good Earth green tea would taste more similar to Japanese green tea if brewed like Japanese green tea should be - read on...)

I often leave my tea bag steeping for a long time (I know, not recommended for green tea, but it likely does extract more of the beneficial antioxidants), up to 30 min, and this tea does not get bitter. It also does not get bitter if the tea sits around before drinking. One Good Earth tea bag works fine for my large 16 oz mug. I have found that other brands of tea can be weak and not flavorful if using only one bag for 16 oz water.

I also like that this tea is decaf since even the smaller amount of caffeine in green tea affects me. Decaf green teas are somewhat hard to find. This company uses a CO2 process for decaffeination, preferable to a solvent extraction process.

Note that this product is available in 18-count and 25-count boxes.

I have tried many other brands of green tea (decaf and regular) over the years and keep coming back to Good Earth brand. Highly recommended.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Kashi, Breakfast Cereal, Organic Autumn Wheat, Non-GMO Project Verified, 16.3 oz(Pack of 4)
Review:
This is one of my favorite cereals that I always try to have on hand.  It is very lightly sweetened throughout (not frosted), has a great taste and good fiber content of 6g per serving.  I tend to avoid any sweetened cereals but I like the light amount of sweetness in this cereal.  I prefer this version over the Kashi Cinnamon Harvest, which was still excellent but a little too "cinnamony" for me.

This Kashi cereal is organic and is a great option compared to the standard brands for shredded wheat and frosted mini wheat cereals.  It tastes better than plain shredded wheat.  It is a healthier option with 7 g sugars compared to 12 g sugars in frosted mini wheats and those contain ingredients I am trying to avoid like high fructose corn syrup and gelatin.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peacock Brown Rice Vermicelli, 7-Ounce Packages (Pack of 12)
Review:
I am always looking for healthier, whole grain versions of foods I enjoy.  Unfortunately, these Peacock brand noodles are yet another food masquerading as healthy.  The product title in big letters on the front says "Brown Rice Vermicelli", making the consumer think "this is made with brown rice, so it should be a healthy choice".  But the first indication that it is not is when looking at the fiber content on the nutrition facts - only 0.6g per 2oz serving.  Then onto the ingredients list to see why so low... contains brown rice, sago starch and water.  The sago starch comes from palms and must not have much (if any) fiber.

The Annie Chun's Maifun Brown Rice Noodles (sold on Amazon and in my local healthy grocer) has become one of my staples and is my frame of reference when comparing to the Peacock brand.  The Annie Chun's product is made with 100% whole grain, with ingredients brown rice flour and water.  Per 2oz serving, it has 4g fiber and pretty much the same calories and other nutrients as the Peacock brand.

If you do try this Peacock brand noodles and have not used rice noodles before, you will need to seek guidance elsewhere on preparation.  As others have pointed out, the Peacock package gives almost no directions on how to prepare the product, aside from a brief mention in the recipes (in the header text it does say that they are "easy-to-cook" but does not say how).  It also contains a very strange recipe for rice noodles: Aglio Olio style - this is an Italian recipe for noodles with olive oil/garlic/sprinkled with grated cheese that I think would not be very tasty.  The second recipe appears to be for a soup with veggie strips.  Neither recipe gives amounts or much direction.  In comparison, the Annie Chun's package gives clear, specific directions on rice noodle preparation and two recipes.

I use rice noodles = maifun = rice sticks = sometimes called vermicelli for making the Vietnamese salad "bun tofu", to serve with stir-fried veggies or in lettuce rolls.  They can also be used in spring rolls/egg rolls.  When cooking with thin rice noodles, be careful not to oversoak/overcook/overmix or they tend to disintegrate.  Asian rice noodle vermicelli (maifun) are not the same as Italian vermicelli and are not readily interchangeable.  If making an Italian recipe, the best results would be expected from Italian pasta and not maifun.

A few final notes...  Both Peacock and Annie Chun's brown rice noodles are gluten free.  The Peacock is made in Singapore and the Annie Chun's in Thailand.  The Peacock noodles do taste fine (kind of bland), but so do the Annie Chun's.  At this time, they are both approximately the same price.  Peacock come in an plastic bag with some noodle crushage upon shipping; Annie Chun's are perfect upon removal from their cellophane bag in a box.  Overall, I highly recommend the Annie Chun's Maifun as a healthier option over the Peacock brand.  On a related note, the Annie Chun's soba and brown rice pad thai noodles are also excellent.

Rating for this product: 2.5 stars rounded down to 2 stars.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Gaia Herbs Sleep and Relax Herbal Tea Bags, 16 Count
Review:
I am a regular tea/herbal tea drinker and have tried lots of brands and types of tea, including may of the Sleepytime-type before bed teas.  Those tend to be comforting and relaxing but have not made me sleepy.  I was surprised that this Gaia Sleep & Relax tea actually worked to make me sleepy and relaxed within about 15 to 30min.  Thus, I would not drink other than right before bed because it did make me sleepy.  It has a good flavor; I tend to let the teabag steep for a long time and this did not result in bitter or unpleasant flavor.  I assume that letting it steep may result in more of the sleep-inducing herbs to come into the hot water.  The box says to let steep 10min and to drink 1 hour before bed.  This is the second Gaia product I have tried and I have been impressed with the quality.  Although not prominent on the front of the package, this product is certified organic.  Good value for the 20 tea bags.  Definitely recommend.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Annie Chun's Soba Noodles, 12-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
I agree with the 5-star reviews for this product.  These noodles are excellent tasting, have a good texture and cook up very quickly (4 to 5 min in boiling water).  I have not really bought many soba noodles in the past, so I'm not sure how these US-made noodles compare to authentic Asian soba.

It is easy to saute some veggies and make a quick sauce (or use a purchased sauce), for a weeknight meal.  I often cook the whole box then divide in half, making 1/2 as a hot stir-fry dinner and then save the other 1/2 (plain noodles) to use the next day.  I put the left-over noodles in the microwave for a brief time (just to bring them to room temp) then assemble the salad.  Amazingly, the noodles taste fresh and good the next day, possibly better tasting than freshly cooked.  I'm sure they would make a great noodle soup, although I have not tried yet.

Ingredients are unbleached enriched wheat flour, buckwheat flour, water, egg whites, salt.  They seem pretty healthy and have a decent amount of fiber, although they are probably not as healthy as a 100% whole wheat pasta, for example.  For the 12 oz box, 6 servings/box, amounts per serving: 200 cal (10 from fat), 3g fiber, 390mg sodium, 8g protein, 10% iron.  Also, great price from Amazon.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Higgins & Burke, Green Tea, 20 Count (Pack of 6)
Review:
I drink a lot of tea, but not mint very often.  Mint tea is thought to be relaxing and calming, and I did find this to be such.  I generally think of all mint teas to be the same, since they usually contain only one ingredient, mint of some sort, although of varying "dustiness".

This Higgins & Burke peppermint tea exceeded my expectations.  It has great flavor and is very minty/mentholy (invigorating and refreshing, as well as soothing).  This reflects on the high quality peppermint used.  The individual teabag packaging also keeps the product fresh, so it will taste great even if it has been in the cupboard awhile.  I did need to be careful not to overbrew it.  While this peppermint tea will not replace my daily tea selection, it is a nice change.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
 Erewhon Raisin Bran, Organic, 15-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
This is a great organic cereal.  I love that each individual flake comes from one wheat berry that is steamed then squished - no overprocessed flakes mixed with sugar as mass market raisin bran cereals.  This does mean that the Erewhon flakes are small, as a few reviewers already mentioned.  I really like the texture of this cereal.  It tastes great with a blend of vanilla soymilk and cow's milk to provide a bit of sweetness (since the cereal itself does not contain sugar).  I do let it sit after adding milk, to soften a bit before eating.  It could use a few more raisins, but that is not a big enough deal to downgrade my rating.  Another consideration is that this is not a fortified/enriched cereal, so it is different from the typical cereals that provide a bunch of added vitamins.  It does fill you up (6g fiber per serving) and helps to reduce between meal junk food cravings.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Carmelina Brands Italian Bianchi De Spagna Beans (Butter Beans), 14.28-Ounce Units (Pack of 24)
Review:
LOVE!  These beans are delicious, high quality, creamy, XL size.  Their large size also makes them seem fun to eat and a novelty.  The ingredients list is short, only beans and water.  Since they have no added salt, a fair amount of salt/seasoning is required.  The beans are somewhat fragile, so mix gently and if using in soups, add at the end of cooking.

One of my favorite quick dinners is to drain and rinse these butter beans, heat up in the microwave (can also add chopped onion or bell peppers), drizzle with a good evoo, S&P & maybe fresh chopped herbs and top with homemade whole wheat breadcrumbs (made with butter/evoo, garlic salt, herbs; or Italian seasoned panko would work too; or the crumbs left in the bottom of a croutons or stuffing mix package).

I have been very satisfied with all varieties of Carmelina / Mangia beans I have tried.  Great, healthy product to use when you don't have time to soak and cook your own dried beans from scratch.  Product is imported from Italy.

As others, I have also experienced some dented cans that I use up first (nothing so damaged that it was unusable).  I have ordered beans a number of times over the last few years and always have this issue - since Amazon has not corrected by now, I am not hopeful this will be resolved.

Update 5/15/2015: on my latest order, the cans were delivered in perfect condition, no dents!  The packaging has changed to a cardboard box having inner cardboard dividers between cans.
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Product:
KIND Healthy Grains Clusters, Vanilla Blueberry with Flax Seeds Granola, 10g Protein, Gluten Free, Non GMO, 11 Ounce Bags, 3 Count
Review:
We've been gluten free for several years now, and one of the things that has been missing is a good, crunchy, gluten-free granola.

The Vanilla Blueberry granola boasts a punch of delicious vanilla flavor and crunchy oat clusters. It's packed with a variety of healthy grains in addition to the gluten free oats.  It's a healthier granola.  The only downfall is the lack of blueberries in the granola. When a granola is labeled vanilla blueberry clusters, I tend to look for blueberries or at least a noticeable blueberry flavor. (The lack of blueberry is the reason for the 4 star instead of 5 star review.)

The Cinnamon granola had a very nice cinnamon flavor. The granola tasted great with milk as well as eating plain as a snack.

It would be nice if the granola came in larger packages as we went through the granola very quickly. If you use it on top of yogurt or ice cream, it will last much longer.

Review:
We love this stuff. This is the best product out there in powder form for authentic Chinese cooking and chicken flavor.  . .beats any other brand on the market! I use it constantly instead of chicken cubes in my basic cooking. It can be a little salty but the flavor beats all the other brands.....so when your almost done cooking then taste your food then add salt!.  This product certainly should not be used for someone on a low sodium diet! I have been using it for my homemade egg drop soup. I add a few tablespoons of Korrs chicken broth mix to a quart of water and add few teaspoons of  soy sauce, maybe a dash of ginger and a dice scallion, then I add last the scrambled egg mixture to the hot broth and it taste like real authentic egg drop soup from Chinese take out! Also made cream of chicken and wild rice soup which was awesome! If you do not like using the powder form I also use "Better than Bouillon Chicken Base Organic" which once opened need to be refrigerated but the taste is superb but more expensive!

****************************************************************************************

Update one year later. .. . .OMG, this stuff is the bomb! So addicting  because of the outstanding flavor. I have been sauting vegetables (actually any vegetable will work) and sprinkling a half teaspoon of this and it brings out the best flavor. I then throw a splash of cooking sherry..  . .yummy! I cannot say enough great things about the flavor. Every week I find a new reason to use this. I go through this like crazy! So happy I can get the large size (2LB) on Amazon. Everyone I have had over to eat ask me what the magical wonderful flavor is . . . . . .this broth of course. .  .but that is my little secret!

Ghee is a product I've walked past in the grocery store hundreds of times. I've heard of it but have never given it any thought until now. What I didn't understand is that though it's butter, it is clarified butter and therefore has a higher smoke point than just regular butter. This has the same great taste as butter, even richer I think, but is good for high temperature cooking. I used it tonight on my  oven-baked fresh cut fries and it worked wonderfully and made the best tasting fries I've ever had. I think this will be a product in my kitchen from now on. prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Frontier Organic Seasoning, Harissa, 1.9 Ounce
Review:
I try to keep food prep from taking over all the available time - I cook in batches of basic, low-fat meat and non-gluten sides like rice, then want to vary them each day until they're gone. So I'm lovin' these pre-mixed offerings of spices from various places in the world. As I am fond of Mediterranean cuisine, this mixture from Tunisia with its peppery bite hits my palate just right. I only had to correct the salt. You can just sprinkle it or make a paste with water or olive oil for a rub.

It tastes very fresh and of course had a good seal when it arrived. It has already been assigned a place in the refrigerator in order to keep it fresh as long as possible. Well, not sure its life expectancy is ALL that long cuz it tastes really good!

The label says it contains organic paprika, organic caraway, organic crushed red chili pepper, organic cayenne, organic coriander, organic cumin, organic garlic, organic peppermint and sea salt. I don't think sea salt can be organic. I'd rather they didn't put that in as our oceans are so polluted and sometimes I've seemed to react badly to it, like an allergy.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Progresso Soup, Traditional, Homestyle Chicken Soup, 19 oz Cans (Pack of 6)
Review:
This review is for the Chicken and Wild Rice that the can describes as "savory". Which it is. There never is a lot of chicken in any canned soup and I suppose the consumer doesn't expect it. But there IS some and obviously rice including wild rice and vegetables. There are three things I particularly like which are that it is gluten free, the vegetables do not overwhelm the rest of the ingredients and the stock is in fact particularly savory.

I've never quite gotten over an ad campaign Progresso mounted in which they mocked and targeted their competitor, Campbell soups. It seemed to be the work of the worst kind of bully. I spoke to both companies about it. It put me off Progresso products for some time but I happened to come into the possession of this soup and did find it very good.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Senseo Dark Roast Coffee Pods, 4.41 Ounce, 18-Count Pods (Pack of 4)
Review:
Here's the thing: the one-cup Senseo coffeemakers for which this pod is designed have proved unreliable. I wouldn't buy any more of them. But these pods are fabulous.

I got these nearly two years ago for my Senseo pod coffeemaker that lasted for all of 30 uses. Junk, crap. But these pods have proved the opposite. They have outstanding flavor, even when they ought to be stale. Usually I have brewed coffee but when I run out and it doesn't make sense to make another pot, I put fresh water in a cup, add one of these and heat it in the microwave. Presto! A cup of java to which I add my 1% milk and enjoy. I am simply amazed that I can get such a good cuppa from a non-refrigerated, long-opened package, coffee pod!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Senseo Dark Roast Coffee Pods, 4.41 Ounce, 18-Count Pods (Pack of 4)
Review:
I have been most impressed with both my super-fast Senseo single-serve and its coffee pods. But no, the coffee does not taste as good as that I freshly grind. I realize that is an option if I want to produce my own pods but that would defeat the undeniable convenience of the single-serve machine. The coffee produced by this pod arrangement is happily strong - with this Dark Roast; I haven't yet tried any others - and the crema is wonderful, over and over. I do pre-wet the pods before brewing. I guess I could also wet down the machine parts. And I do heat non-fat or 1% milk in the microwave, then brew directly into that cup. This procedure mixes moo and joe quite adequately.

There is some aspect to the taste of the brew that does not please me - not sure I can put it into words well. I think it is partly due to the inevitable not-entirely-freshness of the pods. In addition there is some kind of harshness that seems intended to masquerade as richness. Duh? Maybe someone more knowledgeable about coffee prep can identify it better. I do not see anywhere on the package that these coffee pods are 100% Arabica. Could that be it? But for the convenience and cost, I cannot complain TOO much. I am really happy with the purchases.

Want to say a word of thanks to other reviewers who have made helpful suggestions and observations. Here's one I've found through experimentation: There is still strength left in the pod after one brewing. I've started re-using them. The method depends upon my coffee needs at the moment. Sometimes I install the 2-cup holder in the machine and re-use one with a new one. Then I end up with two used ones, and darned if they don't have another use in them. Maybe you won't like this but it is an option to try if you wish. (By comparison, I've found there is absolutely no value in the used grounds after I've brewed a pot of drip.) By the way, the used pods still produce a fine crema; whether this is due to the pods or the well-designed machine I do not know.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Fire Cider, Apple Cider Vinegar Tonic with Honey, Original Flavor, Natural Detox, Pure & Raw, Certified Organic Ingredients, Ideal for Cleansing Diet, No Heat Processed, 16 Shots, 8 oz.
Review:
In order to obtain a trademark for Fire Cider, these people had to pretend that it was not already in common usage. All you have to do to discover that it has been used and shared for years, particularly by herbalist leader Rosemary Gladstar - and specifically called Fire Cider - is to Google it. Please do. Even if by some weird coincidence, they HAD happened to come up with both a strikingly similar formula and exact name, they could only obtain a trademark (which they have!) via false search results. Even if it weren't illegal, this is such a betrayal of trust, such a dishonorable act, that these Shire City "business" people deserve zero respect. The obvious lack of morals in claiming to have originated this, calls into question their credibility in every other aspect. Do they think they can corner the market by legally preventing anyone else from making for sale, a recipe that was developed by someone else before they were born? They seem to claim they won't do that, but as I said, they have already destroyed their credibility.

Here's their less-than-honorable attempted enforcement of this shabbily-obtained trademark. After claiming on an Internet site that their trademark was needed to protect the product from the large food corporations, they stated that they had no intention of keeping others from using fire cider as they had been prior to the trademark. On their Wordpress blog, they state, "We are not interested in suing anyone, especially herbalists working outside of the commercial marketplace." Right. Forcing others to discontinue selling long-held products via a well-known auction site is not the same as bringing a lawsuit. Go find them. Their blog is entitled "firecider" and as I said, it is at Wordpress. (Also search Fire Cider for their Facebook page.) You'll find their blog explanation cleverly worded but if you know the turf, very slippery. What happened, according to herbalist friends, is that they then proceeded to cause Etsy, the artsy Internet auction site, to stop other retailers from offering fire cider there. Do you need any more proof?

Before I knew of the problem these people have created, I bought some of the product locally and it was so-so - a friend a few blocks away makes some that is far better. Thing is, if people will claim ownership of a commonly-held recipe and name for profit, in what way will they alter their products for more profit?
Rating:
1.0
Product:
Fini Balsamic Glaze, 8.45 Ounce Bottles
Review:
Luckily found this at the supermarket but not a great deal cheaper. I enjoy balsamic vinegar and also the art of cooking, so a product that is condensed balsamic vinegar was something I just had to try. Naturally, I had to research it first. Turns out a lot of brands add a lot of extra ingredients; that I didn't want. This has just "Balsamic vinegar of Modena ('aceto balsamico di Modena I.G.P.') 90%, (concentrated cooked grape must, wine vinegar, caramel color), glucose syrup, modified corn starch. Yes, it is sweeter than just plain balsamic. It makes such an elegant dollop, say on roasted pork with which it pairs well.

In addition to having a wonderful taste, I like the way the container is designed. It will stand up on either end, taking up less room in the fridge and promising utility when I have to get that last remaining amount to the business end. Speaking of the business end, I am delighted to find an unusually well-designed dispenser which allows me to put a dollop or smear exactly where I want it and when done, there is no mess. I mean the outside of the dispenser is totally clean after dispensing.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
True Orange Shaker, Ginger, 2.82 Ounce
Review:
Another great flavor burst from True Citrus Co, made in the USA and containing only crystallized orange [citric acid, orange oil, orange juice], ginger, maltodextrin, natural flavor. Contains soy. No preservatives. Gluten free. I keep it in the refrigerator and use it to instantly transport my simple meals to International Flavor City.

The orange flavor is very definite. The ginger is less so but its tart tang adds to the orange. I am accustomed to buying gingerroot and paring and mincing just before consumption; it is unlikely a dried version can replicatehat flavor. At any rate, I am more than happy with these products, their convenience and purity.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Thai Kitchen Coconut Milk, 13.66 fl oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
Luckily this is available locally so I got to try it without ordering a whole case. I find it absolutely delicious. So far it got used to make a black rice with dried cranberry dish, very simple. Tomorrow a pumpkin curry soup, then I think a chicken curry the next day. I'm looking into making my own coconut milk so I don't have to worry about using a whole can before it goes bad, but meanwhile I am delighted with this brand in both taste and consistency.

AND let me not forget to praise the manufacturer for resisting the temptation to add those poisons people think are preservatives (particularly sodium metabisulfite). I'd rather there were no guar gum, frankly, but was unable to find any without that at local supermarkets.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Splenda Essentials No Calorie Sweetener with B Vitamins, Net Wt 2.8-Ounces (Pack of 4)
Review:
Splenda is Splenda. That's easy. It works to create an illusion of sweetness. It can be most helpful if staying away from regular sugar is necessary. I was thin, too thin, for many years but gradually that changed. I still didn't have to count calories, just stay away from ingesting too much or too fatty food, but even that changed. Now I am analyzing my intake to eliminate the empty calories of cane sugar, corn syrup and the ilk, even the fructose of 100% fruit juices in favor of consuming the whole fruit.

What's not easy is choosing whether to use an artificial sweetener. First of all, some people mistrust them, suspect them of being carcinogens etc. and ask whether the cure might be worse than the disease. Some of the other artificial sweeteners, which shall remain nameless, might bear investigation.

But Splenda, which has only been available in the US for a dozen years, is sucralose plus dextrose and/or maltodextrin. Sucralose is actually derived from sugar but has no calories. The fillers add calories but not nearly as many as sugar. In addition, Splenda is heat-stable to 450F and does not add an artificial flavor to baked goods. However it is questionable whether the vitamins survive the heat of cooking.

I find Splenda especially helpful in making desserts sugar-free when necessary, everything from puddings to pies to betties. This Splenda claims no calories, as do their other varieties. The actual caloric content of a single-serving, 1-gram packet [which is the size of the packet reviewed here] is 3.36 calories, which is less than a third of the calories of a single-serving, 2.8-gram packet of granulated sugar. FDA regulations allow foods to be labelled zero calories, "if the food contains less than 5 calories per reference amount customarily consumed and per labeled serving". So that gets just a mite tricky. Regardless of FDA regs, I feel it is questionable to emblazon the packaging with a claim of "No Calorie Sweetener" when it actually does have them.

Another packaging issue is the description "Net Wt 2.8-Ounces (Pack of 4)". That made me think I would receive four packages of 0.7 oz. each which I could use in baking. But in fact there are 80 tiny foil packages suitable for use in individual cups of whatever, and the box states "Each packet sweetens like 2 teaspoons of sugar." No problem; you just need to be aware of what you will be getting as this stuff is really expensive.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Community Coffee Whole Bean Coffee, French Roast, (Pack of 3)
Review:
First impressions: None of the three bags received were vacuum-packed in the manner that withdraws air from bag and leaves the bag material tightly air-free and clinging to the bean bodies. However the expiration date of the packages is 12/22/13, giving plenty of time for consumption. Upon opening, I found the beans to have a fresh aroma and the consistent dark oily appearance expected of a dark roast.

Prep: I carefully cleaned my Mr. Coffee burr grinder whose grind adjustment is 1/3 of the way into the fine grind setting. I shook out as many of the old beans as possible, then ran fresh beans from this bag through and dumped the results, brushing out all visible debris, hoping for no contamination. Then and only then I ground for this pot.

Brew: Made a full 12-cup pot in a long-used, familiar Gevalia automatic drip machine. Carafe cleaned regularly with baking soda and well rinsed. Water allowed to run prior to filling machine in order to clear stale water from pipes.

Cuppa Joe style: Used my preferred method of 1/2 cup skim milk heated in microwave, topped off with 1/3 cup freshly brewed coffee. No sweetener.

Analysis: Right off I was hit with floral, winey notes. I felt smoothness with strength. Then the intensity of traditional dark roast broke in a very pleasant way. The smoky intensity lingered as an aftertaste, also pleasant and satisfying. Suddenly the fog left and I was delightfully wide awake so there is plenty of caffeine which is, for me, a requirement.

Recommendation: Outstanding price/value. How can you do better? 5 1/2 stars.
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

It's not cream, don't expect the same texture especially as this product doesn't contain the typical thickeners usually found in products like this.  But the taste is excellent (nutty and slightly sweet with a creamy vanilla finish), and I experienced no issues at all with curdling when I added to the tea.  The amounts are pretty true to cream for me;  if I add cream to my team, it's usually about a teaspoon, and the same amount of nutpods worked well for me.

If you would like to avoid dairy and like the taste of nut milk, I think you'll be pleased with this product.  I would (and will) be buying this again.

Product:

Review:
We love Tropic Bee Orange Blossom honey.
My husband likes to use it in the crock pot on pork roasts, and uses half of the bigger jars.
I thought this size would be just right for his cooking ventures.
It also seems a little easier to handle, since honey can be a little heavy.

VERY happy with my purchase. The company packs their honey VERY well, and everything

We'll be long-time customers of this brand.

Product:
Crystal Light Pure Drink Mix, Strawberry Kiwi, On The Go Packets, 7 Count (Pack of 6 Boxes)
Review:
I was very pleasantly surprised to see a Crystal Light product that wasn't loaded with aspartame!

I hope they get on the stevia bandwagon (or even go back to saccharine since it has long since been proven
to be perfectly safe) and start making more flavors.

I love the drink mix packets anyway, and I'm always happy when there's a really tasty flavor.
This one had my attention as soon as I opened it - it smells like cotton candy when in the powder form!
(It made me wish I had some!)  I had to cut the packet open - the little corners don't always tear
too well.

It dissolved fairly easily, and makes your water a shade of pink.
It tastes really good, even though I had room temp water, not cold water.
It is a little bit strong in the 16.9 oz bottle (since I took a drink out of it before
adding the powder), but nothing outrageous or overwhelming.

All in all, I'd buy it again.

Crystal Light - I hope you'll start making more flavors in the Pure Fitness line.
I'd buy your products all the time if you didn't have them stuffed with aspartame.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Lipton Iced Tea Mix, Raspberry 10 qt, (Pack of 6)
Review:
Well, to say this was disappointing is putting it mildly.

I love raspberry iced tea, and always try to get it at places like Denny's, Taco Bell, whereever it
might be offered. While I knew this had sugar in it (most premixes do), I still wanted to try it, as I am trying
to break a Pepsi habit I acquired in the last few years.

I originally wanted to buy raspberry kool aid and just add it to a pitcher of regular iced tea.
However, good luck finding the raspberry kool aid! What did they do with it?!

Anyway - this makes a RED drink, and it tastes like raspberry kool aid that they waved a tea sprig
over. It isn't horrible tasting, but do not buy this thinking that you will be making a glass of tea
with raspberry flavoring. You'll be making raspberry kool aid with a tiny bit of tea flavoring.

I won't be buying it again, that is a big fer-shure.

Lipton - you can do SO much better - why don't you try it?
You already know how to do tea - now you need to work on flavorings and sweeteners.
Here's a news flash - most of us do NOT want aspartame in our drinks any more.
PLEASE change over to stevia, which does not cause the side effects or raise blood glucose levels.
Listen to the customers...

Meanwhile, pass on this one!  : P
Rating:
2.0
