Laffy Taffy Rope, Strawberry, 0.81 Ounce (Pack of 24)
Review:
These are so good!
The product we received as very fresh and tasty.  Every rope was a big mangled, like they'd been shoved in the package by ogres, but they were not popped open and were safe to eat.

Laffy Taffy, for those who have not had it before, is a very soft, chewable taffy, not at all sticky.
We love all the Laffy Taffy flavors except grape, but strawberry is a big favorite.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Sunsweet Prune Pitted Ones, 7-Ounce Packages (Pack of 10)
Review:
I absolutely love these!
Each canister is filled with individually wrapped prunes.

I am the only one in our house who eats these.  I've tried buying the bags,
and buying another type of canister, but they always get dried out before I
can finish them all.  This is just right - allows me to eat them when I want to,
and I always get a fresh product.

While they could do better on the cost in my opinion, I have not had a bad one
from this canister from Sunsweet yet. Is it the best value for your money?
Depends on how you look at it - it costs more per prune, but in my case, I have a lot
less waste. So, it is a flip of the coin.

The fruit, however, is fresh, soft and tasty. Don't let an "old person" image of prunes
keep you from trying this yummy fruit!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Fiber One 90 Calorie Soft-Baked Bar, Lemon Bar, 12 Fiber Bars, 10.6 oz (Value Pack)
Review:
I was skepticle about these bars being very good.  I mean, I know Barry from the commercials loves the Fiber One bars, but what about those of us to had to actually buy them, and weren't paid to eat them?

Well, turns out that these are VERY good. They are also VERY small.  Apparently, Fiber One made the portion size with keeping under 100 calories in mind.  I was seriously surprised at the tiny size. But, you have to keep your focus on the fiber so you don't kick yourself for such a tiny bar. They do have a lot of sugars in them, mainly from the lemon flavored frosting squiggles. Not sure if they had to add so much sweetness to cover the taste of the inulin (chickory root), the fiber they use or what, but at this point, I don't mind.  Thanks to dental troubles, I can't chew as well as I used to, so getting fiber is a challenge. (Sorry, I just can't down a glass of Benefiber, even though I know it isn't supposed to be gritty! I know it's in there!)  These bars seem to be doing the job I hired them to do, and taste goodwhile doing it.

Well done Fiber One.  This is one I'll be a repeat buyer for.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
DaVinci Gourmet Syrup, Zero Calorie Caramel, 12.7 Ounce
Review:
We have a recently-diagnosed diabetic in our house, so have been purging the house of all things sugary
and trying out replacements that do not have aspartame in them.

We have several flavors of the sugar-free syrups.
This one tastes like pancake syrup.
Not unpleasant, but I wouldn't call it caramel either!
Very thin and watery, and definitely leaves the pancake syrup flavor behind in your mouth.
Ok maybe for super sweet coffee drinks.

I don't think I'd buy it again.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Arizona Lemon Iced Tea Stix Sugar Free, 10 Count Per Box (Pack of 6), Low Calorie Single Serving Drink Powder Packets, Just Add Water for a Deliciously Refreshing Iced Tea Beverage
Review:
My son loves Arizona tea, and these packets make it easy to have tea instead of water.
He tosses a few sticks into his backpack or pocket and can easily have tea whereever he can get a bottle of water.
They are a little overpriced for what you get, so watch for a sale price, but he's happy with them.

It's odd that they can advertise "no artificial flavors" when they use SUCRALOSE as their sweetener though.
They aren't truly sugar free, and the fructose in sucralose can really mess with your blood sugar, so be aware if you have
problems that way. It'll also add to your waistline if you drink too many of them.
Be aware that you are drinking that mess every time you have them. That lost them a star for my review.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Lundberg Family Farms Wild Blend Rice, 16 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
First off, we all love rice at our house. I also love wild rice and rice pilaf,
although the others are not all that big on those dishes.

So, when I read the descriptions on this, I thought it sounded really tasty, but
had some real hesitations about buying six packs of the rice. I wondered how we'd actually
manage to use six bags before it went bad.

Well, the bags are not all that huge. Each bag is one pound of rice. I guess I had a hard
time visualizing it, but the bags are fairly small. I don't have one in front of me, but they
are maybe 6" square.

Anyway, we made the first bag this weekend, putting it in a crock pot and letting it cook
on low for 2 or 3 hours. Hubby is the chef in our house, and he used beef broth with the rice.
We had it with some sausage for dinner. Let me say - WOW!
This is really tasty rice! Between the four of us, we managed to wipe out the entire pound
of rice (yes, it was that good!), and were figuring out what the next meal with the rice would be!

Watch your prices on this - they vary widely, even across Amazon. But, as long as it stays in the price
range on this listing, then we'll be buying it again. Seriously, this stuff tastes great! It was
tasty, filling and actually easier to chew than I thought it might be (I have troubles with crunchy foods).

Thank you Lundberg for a really great blend of rice.  You've converted us!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
BUMBLE BEE Premium Skinless and Boneless Wild Pink Salmon, Ready to Eat Salmon Pouch, High Protein Food, Keto, Gluten Free, High Protein Snack, Canned Food, Bulk Salmon, 5 Ounce Pouches (Pack of 12)
Review:
I love these packets!  No can openers needed, no draining needed.
I have not tried the tuna packet yet, but I've had BB in a can, so I am sure these are just as good.

The product arrived quickly. What I most wanted to know was the fresh until date.
We ordered in June 2014, and received product with a fresh "use by" date of July 2017.
Since I am buying this partially for "prepping", I was happy with the date.

Would buy again.

UPDATE:
I've now eaten this tuna three times. It is great! I was concerned that it might be dry and yuck,
much like Walmart's tuna packets. Nope... these are very moist and have great flavor.
The packets are very easy to open as well.  I often just squeeze some mayo right into the packet
and stir it up and scarf it.

Interesting note to me... we have two cats, neither of which likes seafood or tuna flavored cat food.
But when I opened the Bumble Bee packet, our boy cat about climbed up on my shoulder to check it out!
Very unusual for him, but I take it as a sign that this is a much better tuna than the WM brand I've been buying. I let him lick the inner packet (which I cut completely open), and he was eating chunks of tuna right out of my hand.  So, this is a better tuna, according to both my fork and my cat! ;-)
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Pinto Beans, 27-ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I grew-up around Southerners, and one of their favorite meals was pinto beans, slow-cooked all day with ham hock and chunks of ham, until it made a thick, rich, brown gravy...and tasted absolutely scrumptious. I left home, and did not really bother to make beans for years and years, then one day I experienced an incredible urge for a pot of Pinto Beans. I bought some at the grocery store, but they were tiny, not the right color, and their taste was dull, without any of the rich gravy that I had come to expect from every batch of Pinto Beans that I had ever had in my life.

So, I turned to good old Amazon, certain that Ammy would have more Pinto Beans than even the most ardent lover of beans could ever imagine. I was right, it took me an hour to go through all of the various Pinto Beans on offer, and I had to make a few tough decisions.. In the end, I opted for Bob's Red Mill Pinto Beans. While they are not organic ( my preference), they are non-GMO, and are thick, plump, lightly-speckled beans, just the type that I grew up with.

I ordered a big , old- fashioned Southern ham from a smokehouse in the Deep South, boned it out, cut up the bones, chopped about a quart of the ham into cubes, and was ready to go. First, I washed the beans and soaked them overnight in cold water, in a pan covered with a cloth, at room temperature. The next day, I drained the old water and added enough fresh water to cover about 2 inches above the beans, I added about four pieces of ham bone, four cups of cubed ham, two chopped bell peppers, 1 chopped onion, 2 bay keaves, a tea strainer full of about one tablespoon of whole black peppercorns, and two cans of original flavor Rotel Sauce. I brought this mixture to a boil, turned the beans way down low to simmer, and left them, barely bubbling, on the stove for about 5 hours. I stirred them infrequently, just to make sure that they weren't 'sticking on the. bottom of the pan.

I made a batch of long- grain brown rice in my rice maker, and we each had a soup bowl filled with rice, and topped by these luscious , flavorful, and delicious beans with a thick rich gravy. They were so good that even my Yankee husband went back for seconds. These pinto beans are the best that I have ever eaten. They were a whole new taste experience for me, each bean was plump, juicy, and full of its own rich flavor, not to mention the flavor of the ham which had permeated the entire pot of beans with its own hickory-smoked flavor.

These are without a doubt the best Pinto Beans that I have ever tasted. They were clean, pale cream in color with the classic pinto dark markings. They had a very sweet taste, which was clean and pure, and they  soaked-up the ham and other seasonings as well. These beans are really expensive, my Southern ancestors must be turning in their graves over the price that  I paid ! However, I do not eat them every day, and they are the only beans that I have ever found that taste as good as the  beans that I grew-up with. You can serve them over brown rice, or you can make a nice batch of cornbread made with stone-ground corn meal and buttermilk., and use that to sop-up the yummy gravy.. Again - these beans are so expensive, but they are the only beans that I have ever found that taste like the beans from my childhood.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Organic Extra Thick Rolled Oats, 32 Ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I live on Smoothies. One of the many, many ingredients is oats. I like thick,hunky, seriously "Oatey" oats.these fill the bill. Like all "Bob's Red Mill organic" items, the quality is just superb.

The have a fresh, rich, oat fragrance, and are the trickiest cut that I have been able to find. I have 26!noz. smoothie cups. These are serious Smoothies that I am making, and I live on them. I add 1/4 cup oats to each cup (approx), along with about 1/8 teaspoon of cinnamon to bring out, and accentuate the flavor.. I put them in the cup, and mix them into the Smoothie,not wanting to run them through the blender, and  totally defeating the purpose of my lovely fby chopping them up all tiny again.

They are about as pure and additive-free as can be found. The flavor and quality is just like candy to me ( I lack a sweet-tooth.), and really read and consider the nutritional level of this oat, I should be blasting off to the  moon some day,  under my own steam some day soon.

I highly recommend these. I double bag themin Zip-Loxks, and freeze them. They stay nice and fresh, and their vitamins and nutrients are unaffected by the heat of a warm kitchen. If you can, try these. The nutrition that is added to your system, plus the luscious taste, makes these oats worth the effort.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill, Organic Medium Grind Cornmeal, 24 oz
Review:
I grew up eating cornbread, not the kind made with finely ground meal, white flour, sugar, and other non-Southern affectations. No, my family made the real thing : Stone Ground Coarse Yellow Corn Meal ( Personally fetched from the mill.), buttermilk, eggs, baking soda, salt, and bacon drippings. A large cast iron skillet was heated in the oven, with a spoonful of bacons drippings, until smoking hot, then the batter was poured into the pan. The pan was so hot, that the bottom and sides of the batter immediately fried and climbed the sides of the pan. This pan by the way, was a sacred object in our kitchen, it was never to be washed with soap and water, never scrubbed, and only Mother was allowed to use it. When the cornbread was baked, she would grab the hot pads and flip the heavy, cast iron pan over onto a plate. The cornbread came sliding smoothly put of the pan, exhibiting a golden, crispy, and yummy crust. Mother then wiped the hot pan out with a paper towel, and left it on the stove to cool down, that was it. Generations of Southern women seasoned these precious pans and passed them down to a lucky daughter.

The corn bread was yummy, tart and rich from the buttermilk, crispy on the outside, smelling of bacon, and crumbly and speckle-colored on the inside. This freshly ground corn meal was not solid yellow, it had various colors of specks in it, including black specks. Since it had just been ground, this was not mold or dirt, that was just what stone-ground corn meal looked like. I grew-up, left home, and forgot about cornbread for many years. But then the urge for it returned, I purchased my own cast-iron skillet and began a search for corn meal. I could not find any coarsely ground, stone ground corn meal that even remotely resembled what I grew up with until I tried this meal from Bob's. What a relief, the grind is just right, the meal is coarse and full of  differently colored specks, just exactly like what I grew up with. The corn bread that I produced was perfect, just as Mother would have made it. This meal is really expensive, my female Southern ancestors must be turning in their graves over what I paid for this. But......it is authentic, and just exactly what was needed to produce a real old-fashioned Southern cornbread.

* Always store this in the freezer, it will go rancid very quickly otherwise.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Baja Bob's Maui Madness Mai Tai Mix, Sugar Free, 32-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 6)
Review:
I ordered a case of this product, not expecting much in the way of taste, but at least it would be a low- calorie way to enjoy a Margarita. Amazingly enough  - this is an excellent mixer,  it tastes as if it has been made with fresh limes, and the artificial sweetener does not give the mix an odd taste. I just followed the instructions on the bottle, 3 parts mix to one part of Tequila. I added nothing additional, and served the drink with crushed ice. It has a light and refreshing taste, a recommended way to enjoy a nice Margarita, without an overload of calories.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Carr's Whole Wheat Crackers, 7-Ounce Units (Pack of 12)
Review:
These are the most lovely biscuits that I have had to good fortune to discover -  rich and whole-wheat flavored, and that extra " Highlands Butter taste. These have a womderfully fine crumb, the aroma wafting from these must be eaten, or enjoyed, with a fine Cappuccino..

They have a lovely golden  color, and one can easily eat three or four of these, without recognizing that fact. These must be carefully packed, and well-padded, if their wonderful flavor and  good taste is to be enjoyed whole. Just set a few out on a plate, and watch them disappear.

I have eaten so many of these over the years, we used to get  them only during the holiday season.  My entire family is addicted, and If you like  nothing betterr than a lovely,  crumb texture, and a rich golden crumb, these are for you.

They are worth the occasional splurge-out for a truly super Scottish Cookie.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Walkers Shortbread Animal Shapes, 6.2-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
These chocolate shortbread cookies are extremely cute. The idea of baking Scottish Shortbread into the shape of a Scittie dog was a good one. They are just so cute, you really do not want to eat them. I gave several boxes to friends with little dogs that resemble the cookie dog. They all laughed and enjoyed the cookies.

Walker's Shortbread is an old, well-established, and top-quality of Scottish shortbread. Normally it projects an intense buttery aroma, and is light, flaky, and crumbly. Walker's is the very standard for what good shortbread should be. Therefor,e,  I was a tad bit surprised to find that these cookies were not quite up to the normal Walker's quality.

The boxes of cookies were fresh and undamaged, not a broken cookie in sight, so that could not be the problem. It appears that the alterations required to produce a chocolate shortbread batter make a less flaky and delicate cookie. The chocolate taste was just a bit strong, lovely for chocoholics , but less exciting for the pure shortbread contingent.

The most noticeable feature of Walker's shortbread has always been the amazingly rich and buttery fragrance, along with a light and delicate crumb. The addition of chocolate tends  to obscure the buttery fragrance,  Also,, the texture of the chocolate variety of this Walker's Shortbread is a bit tougher, and the crumb is less fine thanthat of the standard Walker's shortbread.

If you are a big fan of chocolate, and prefer more of that taste, then these cookies will be quite suitable for you. If, as some are, your entire shortbread experience is heavily based-upon the rich and buttery flavor, and the fine crumb, you will be better served with the original, and non-chocolatey version.

These are nice cookies, the  little dog figure is quite sweet,  and they are of high quality. For chocolate lovers everywhere, these are a fine choice.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Roland Sushi Ginger, 16 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I eat a lot of sushi, and acquired a strong liking for pickled ginger. I ordered this ginger, and am pleasantly surprised by the price and the taste.  It is thinly sliced, although there are a few thicker pieces mixed in. It is quite spicy, not too sweet, and tastes very good. it is sweetened with sugar, not aspartame. There is no artificial red food coloring in this product. Recommended for other pickled ginger fans.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Fantastic World Foods Original Hummus, 6-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12)
Review:
I received this order in a timely fashion. I immediately made one box of the mix, the powdered mix smelled pretty strongly of concentrated lemon flavor. However, after I added the water and oil, the odor disappeared. I added 1 clove of crushed garlic and some Cayenne Pepper. The mix is very tasty, very similar to "real" Hummus. It does not have a strong and artificial lemon flavor, indeed, I added a few squeezes of fresh lemon juice. I have eaten Hummus for a very long time, I would never have guessed that this was made from a dried mix. Next time I will use 2 boxes of mix at once. It is very good and and 1 batch will not go far. I can highly recommend this to Hummus aficionados everywhere.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Carr's Table Water Cracker Selection, 6 Packages of 3 Varieties Inside, 1lb 9.5 oz. Box
Review:
Yet another luscious assortment of Carr's English crackers. Carr's has long been a standard of quality that few in the world can match. Yes, they are expensive, but if you want the very best - go to Carr's, you will not be disappointed. This is an assortment pack of three types of the lovely
Carr's Cream .Crackers : Original, Sesame, and pepper.

Each cracker is quite thin, amazingly crispy, and full of a flavor explosion,, which whether eaten alone,  or with cheese, Prosciutoo and fruit, etc. is superb.

The original flavor is a less salty version of a superb saltine, thin, full of crispy layers, and possessing a rich wheat flavor. The sesame is the same cracker, but with added sesame, which adds a great deal to the flavor of the basic cream cracker. The basic cream cracker will not fight against any topping that one might choose to use. The sesame cracker is quite tasty, all by itself, but will be better with some cheeses than others. The pepper version of the cracker is the most pronounced, and the most dominant of all of the three crackers.

The pepper-flavored cream cracker is lovely all by itself, crispy, with a touch of salt, and a smidgen of the finest quality ground pepper. Non-pepper lovers need not fear the pepper cracker. The pepper taste is indeed noticeable, but will never be so overwhelming as to repel a taster, or any topping chosen to accompany iit. The only exception that I can think of would be sweet toppings,  which might not blend with those nuances as well as with the sesame and original form of the cracker.

Keep a package of these on hand for unexpected guests, or tasty midnight nibbles. You will not be disappointed, and your guests will be most impressed by the high standards of your palate.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Eden Kombu, 2.1-Ounce Packages (Pack of 6)
Review:
This sea weed is the best that is currently available in most of America. It is the true, wild, hand-harvested, sea weed from the far northern Hokkaido Islands. The sea weed is sun-dried, and trimmed to leave only the central portion of the leaf, highly-valued its umami flavor. This is crucial for the preparation of dashi, which I prepare on a daily basis, whenever possible.

I have tried Korean sea weed, and given it up as a bad job all around.  Eden Kombu is what is needed for those acquainted with the preparation of fine Japanese cuisine. This costs the earth, but it is worth it.

Eden is a reputable company, concerned with the quality of their offerings, and the satisfaction of their customers. I know this because I carefully checked the company's background, then spoke directly with a company representative at the company headquarters.i recommend this Kombu, you will not find better unless you find yourself in Japan.
Rating:
5.0

Sometimes, you just gotta have some good ol' pasterized, bottled juice around the house! And if you gotta have it around, this is the best juice to purchase in my opinon! Love the taste, quality & all around goodness of this yummy stuff. Kiddos love it, too. 2 thumbs up! Purple carrot mixed with a little grape juice, & my kids never even detect it. I can just drink it plain its so good, but, the kiddos aren't quite there yet. Lakewood veggie juices rock.

These are VERY good!  I buy these as gifts for a friend who is allergic to soy, and for another friend who is on a very strict organic/healthy diet.  I tried one of them, and they are delicious!  I would say they are an organic version of a Lindt truffle, and almost as smooth and delicious.  Pricey, but worth it for those who cannot eat regular chocolate.

I could never spend this much on chocolate for myself, but for someone who cannot have soy or other questionable ingredients, this is the best chocolate there is for special diets!  I am a junk food junkie and I approve!

Product:
Torani and DaVinci fit Syrup (25.4 oz-750ml) Pump - 2pk
Review:
Probably not much need for additional reviews, but I love these pumps!  I currently have four DaVinci syrups I use for my coffee, and I have pumps in all four.  When you first get the pump to put into a new bottle, you'll need to hold a cup or something under the spout and do a couple pumps.  You don't necessarily have to pump the liquid out, but you do need to get some of the liquid up into the tube so that you have room to screw the pump lid on without overflowing the brand new bottle of syrup.  It took me a couple of times before I learned this.  After that, this pumps work flawlessly every time.  I feel like my kitchen is a fancy cafe with my four flavors to choose from and easy dispenser pumps!

5.0
Product:
La Nouba Sugar-Free Marshmallows 2.7 Oz (6 bags)
Review:
I adore marshmallows!  However, I have been struggling with borderline blood sugar lately, so I'm trying to reduce my sugars and carbs.  I saw these and decided to try them.  I was a little surprised at the smaller size of the package, but that's my fault for not paying more attention to the weight.  These taste VERY good!  Fresh and soft with a slight denseness that comes with higher quality marshmallows, and perfect flavor.  I don't notice any aftertaste either.  I love them so much!  I didn't want to spend extra for the chocolate kind, so sometimes I'll layer it with a caramel Atkins square, and BOY that is heavenly!  They do raise my blood sugar a little bit, but nothing too dramatic.  Just don't eat the whole package in one sitting, because the sugar alcohol carbs can add up if you eat too much at once.  Totally worth the price.  I will definitely buy these again.

None of my kids can stand to keep one in their mouth...but that's okay, because I get nervous about jawbreakers being a choking hazard, anyway.  Anyway, all the more for me.  :-)

I was diagnosed with an ulcer and wanted some natural remedies to help heal it, although I am taking a prescription as well.  I really like black licorice and black jelly beans and things like that, so I figured I would enjoy this as well.  The initial flavor seemed fine, but the longer it sat in my mouth, the harder it was to keep it in there.  But I do understand this is an unsweetened licorice root tic-tac, basically, so I'm not really complaining...but I really am not sure I can learn to like these.  For now, I just swallow one along with my vitamins in case it helps my ulcer.  It may be, as my ulcer seems to be healing--but I don't know whether it's from the meds, or from the licorice.  Maybe both!

For awhile, I made my own from scratch, but wanted something I could whip up faster.  So I tried Annie's and to my surprise, the stuff is delicious!  Even my kids, who do not care for my homemade kind compared to Kraft, will lick their bowls clean (even my picky one!).  The taste, as well as the no preservatives, definitely makes this worth the extra cost.

The chocolate flavor is not super good (a chocolate Tootsie Roll pop would even be better than this) and the texture is strange and its just...not great.  There are so many other good choices out there for sugar free candy other than this.  And ESPECIALLY chocolate.

I don't recommend buying this, especially for this price.

Product:
Kitchens Of India Recipe Paste, Vegetable Biryani, 3.5 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
This is the authentic product, I can vouch for it since I am from India. The ITC Hotel chefs who created this recipe are very well regarded in India. Its just the right mix for a spicy lamb curry, all you need to do is mix it with water and add the lamb and then let it simmer on your stove for 30-45 minutes to bring out the aromas and flavors. Really convenient and time saving.

The lamb curry paste is spicier than a butter chicken curry mix. The chicken curry usually has a more creamy consistency and is sweeter due to higher content of tomatoes. The lamb curry has a base of garlic, ginger, black pepper, onions, tomatoes and other highly aromatic Indian spices (bayleaf, cinnamon, star anise, cardamom, cloves, black cardamom, shah jeera, corriander seeds, red chilli powder etc.).

I usually make my own curry as I prefer fresh ingredients but this mix is wonderful, it has just the right blend of spices that go into lamb curry. The secret to Indian food is to lower the flame once a curry boils and then simmer it for quite some time. This step is not a must if you're in a tearing hurry but it unlocks the real flavors.

Once done this curry keeps very well in the refrigerator. In fact, as with all spicy curries, it even tastes better the next day. I use two packets at a time to make an entree for 6 people.

Variations:
I sometimes add some 1X1.5 inch cubes of diced potatoes along with the lamb to absorb the spiciness which makes it into a "Lamb Vindaloo". Or you can use beef instead of lamb, it will taste great with any red meat that absorbs the spice.

If you're a vegetarian, you can use this curry with potatoes and green peas since the curry paste does not contain any meat in it. Just remember to add peas towards the end of the simmering process or they will get bleached out and you'll get a fantastic dish.

Pairing:
Pair this lamb curry with some aromatic basmati rice, cooked till all grains are done but still separate, and a bowl of plain yogurt (with a little sugar if you like) to counter the spiciness. Or you can also buy frozen Indian nan/roti from the local Indian grocery store, toast it in the oven and enjoy. Yummy!
Rating:
5.0
</Other Writer-1>

</otherwriters>

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Cheddar Cheese Powder (1.5lb) by Anthony's, Batch Tested and Verified Gluten-Free, No Artificial Colors
Review:
This is much better than I'd actually expected it to be!

It tastes like a creamy mild Cheddar - which is, well, what it is.  ;)
It's especially good for sauces or other places where one wants a very smooth texture - I personally tend to like my Cheddar super-sharp, but the fact is that it's difficult to melt it smoothly into a sauce or sooth coating.  This powder fixes that - it makes a nice sauce in and of itself ((and it's good mixed into all sorts of other things, too!)), but it also makes a very good "matrix" into which very sharp, harder cheddar can be melted.

There are very few ingredients in it, which is why I decided to try it ;)
Some folks have said it tastes like the here-unnamed "famous boxed brand-name mac and cheese".  I didn't grow up eating that, so I went ahead and tried some a few years back, shortly before I turned 58 - and I trashed it after the first bite. This is NOT that!!!  This is actually cheese, with some buttermilk and whey protein (which is a component of milk).  The yellow color is from Anatto, which is derived from the nut of a shrubby South American tree that's been used for food and other uses for thousands of years. Some people raise a fuss about Anatto because some folks do seem to have an allergy to it ((just as some people have an allergy to peanuts, and/or other various foods)), but Anatto is so widely used, including in butter, so if you're allergic, you probably found out early on.

In the absence of such an allergy, I recommend this as a tasty addition to one's pantry.  I haven't yet tried making any sort of cheese crackers or rolls with it, but I'm betting it would be good in baked goods as well, for those folks who like ((or need)) to make their own.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Organic Buckwheat Flour, 22-ounce (Pack of 4)
Review:
I enthusiastically like everything I've gotten from Bob's Red Mill - the quality is always high, and I like that it's a o-op sort of arrangement.

The Buckwheat flour (like all of their flours) is fine and evenly-sized, delicious, and a pleasure to use, especially for those for those of us with wheat allergies.

I have - and keep! - my pantry stocked with a variety of Bob's Red Mill non-wheat flours.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Suzie's Whole Grain Thin Cakes, Puffed Brown Rice Crackers, 4.9-Ounce Bags (136g) (Pack of 12)
Review:
- Basically, "Suzie's Whole Grain Thin Cakes, Puffed Brown Rice Crackers" are UNSALTED thin brown-rice cakes.  But the operative word there is THIN.  Maybe 1/4"/apx 6mm or a bit less.  They also are less crumbly than "regular" rice cakes.  And the brown rice gives them a bit more taste and 'substance'.  I also think the size is perfect.
 - What I get is the ultra-plain, no salt, nothing-but-rice ones.  They're a bit bland, I guess, for eating on their own ((to me, they taste a bit like plain pop-corn)), but I generally use them as a substitute for bread ((I don't have a gluten problem - I have an allergy problem)), so I've used them for everything from little "pseudo-Ruben" type things, to mini-pizzas, to tuna "sandwiches", to having them with peanut butter.  Or just melting some cheddar on them.  And so on.
 - And again, they seem to me to be a little more "dense" and less crumbly than regular rice cakes.  So, they hold the toppings, and don't clash with anything.
 - As long as they keep selling them, I definitely will keep getting them, because they are, for me, the best "bread substitute" I've found.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
San-J Tamari Gluten Free Soy Sauce, Non GMO Black Label, 64 Ounce
Review:
This is my favorite soy sauce - it's 100% soy, NO WHEAT, hooray!, and it's delicious.  I use soy sauce frequently, so yeah, I bought the humongous bottle, LOL!  Not sure what else I can say about soy sauce...
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Tinkyada Brown Rice Fettucini Gluten Free, 14-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
I bought this at a grocery store because I have a wheat allergy and can't eat wheat pasta, and now am ordering from Amazon so I can be assured of a steady supply.  This is by far THE BEST non-wheat pasta I've ever had!  The texture is not at all grainy, but rather, is smooth very pleasant, *very* much like "regular" pasta; the flavor is excellent ((I do not at all like the wheat-free pastas that are made with corn :p )); and it's *easy to cook*, tolerates even a bit of over-cooking, and retains its structure - some non-wheat pastas get crumbly, but not this one.
Rating:
5.0

Frontier Co-op Organic Korintje Cinnamon, Ground, A Grade, 1 Pound Bulk Bag (Pack of 2)
Review:
- This is DELICIOUS cinnamon!
 - I never ordered spices online before very recently, and when I saw that this was from Frontier, I gave it a whirl.
 - My expectations were definitely exceeded!
 - It is very fragrant and has a full-bodies flavor, without the harsh edges that the common store bought "cassia" type has.  I've bought Korintje cinnamon locally in the past, but this Frontier cinnamon is sooooooo much better!
 - It came in two bags, so I popped one into the freezer and transferred part of the other to a "daily use" container, and keep the main bag in the fridge.  I was worried that I would "never go through that much" but it's so good that I'm going through it faster than I had anticipated ;)
Rating:
5.0

StarKist Premium Ocean Clams, Chopped, 6.5 Ounce (Pack of 12)

 - I received them quickly, too :)
 - So yes, I'll get these again, to be sure - better pricing than the local grocery store, and that's when I can get someone to go to the store for me, since I can't get around well at all at this point.  So I really appreciate that I can not just order food, but best!, receive GOOD food :)
Rating:

 - They do contain have salt/sodium, so if that's important for anyone's particular diet, check the description, I think the levels are listed.
Rating:
5.0

StarKist Chunk Light Tuna, In Water, 11 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
- This is the best way ever to buy tuna!  My mobility is not what it once was, so first of all, I like being able to order items.
 - Second, although I know that the cans are recyclable, I have to admit that I prefer the flavor and texture, AND reduce draining required, of the tuna packed in these things.  Again, with reduced mobility, it's preferable to me to open one envelope, to having to open and drain three cans.  It's more expensive than buying the cans in bulk, but there also is no risk that I'll order them, drive out the 12 miles or so to pick them up, and then find they are "out of stock".  These came right to my mailbox and arrived pretty darned quickly at that.
 - The freshness date was also excellent.
 - So, as with all things, one has to set one's own priorities.  Buying this was is a bit more expensive, but it was highly reliable, a good buying experience, and a quality product which is convenient and easy to use.

- Nicely crunchy-toasty coffee beans.
NUM NUM NUM!!!!

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Mighty Leaf Tea, White Orchard, 15-Count Whole Leaf Pouches 1.32 Oz. (Pack of 3)
Review:
Lovely tea.  The peach does not overpower.  The fragrance is truly orchid-like.  Not bitter either.  One of my favorites from Mighty Leaf.

Don't over-brew this one:  Usually white teas require five or six minutes to steep, but this one will loose its peach and melon flavor if steeped that long.  No more than three minutes works well for me.  Also, do not use boiling water; let boiling water sit for several minutes before pouring over white teas (or do not bring it to a boil). White teas like 180 to 185 degrees Fahrenheit.

Highly recommend if you like a floral fragrance in your tea.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Dole Pineapple Chunks in Heavy Syrup, 8.25 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12)
Review:
Come warmer weather and we turn from soups and stews to grilled and lighter dishes, I make sure I always have a can of these Dole Pineapple Chunks on the pantry shelf.  When I don't have an appropriate fresh fruit, and I need a sweet-sour-spicy salsa for fish or chicken, I grab this can.

The pineapple is as close to fresh as it can be.  I buy the chunks so I can chop it into smaller pieces myself.  I believe the bigger chunks hold their flavor in the can better.  And we like a bigger chop than what comes crushed, and a smaller chop than comes with the tidbits.  Plus, these chunks work for kebobs, too.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Knorr Pasta Sides, Beef 4.3 oz
Review:
After serving Knorr's Smokehouse Bacon Parmesan Pasta Sides to my family at dinner last week, they insisted that they would not ever try another Pasta Sides flavor. So, I cooked this up during the day, just to give it a try.  I tasted a few spoonfuls to confirm that my pre-conceived opinion was correct, then I dumped the rest.  I didn't even want to give it to the chickens in the yard, because I felt the wimpy noodles and excessive salt were not healthy for them.

This package makes two cups prepared pasta.  One cup is considered a serving size.  I was appalled to see that one cup of this stuff contains 31% of a person's recommended daily salt intake.  And I could only stand at the counter and shake my head when I read that two cups of this weighed in at 580 calories--and this is just a side dish?!?

If you try this product, remember to not exceed the 12 minute boiling time in an effort to get the sauce to thicken; your noodles will be mush.  Thickening occurs during the two minute resting period after you take it off the flame.

I don't know why anyone would bother with this product, as it isn't even a true "convenience" food that you can pop into the microwave at work.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
ZICO Watermelon Raspberry Coconut Water Drink, 16.9 fl oz, 12 Pack
Review:
Having been lucky enough to have once lived in an area where I was able to crack open as many fresh green coconuts as I desired, I must say that the flavor in these bottles is decent:  Not perfect, but not bad.  I had to get it really, really ice cold to achieve the correct flavor.  Coconut water right out of the shell is extremely refreshing, and I don't think it can ever be correctly duplicated.  (Same like the juice from a freshly-squeezed lime or lemon loses its true taste as it ages.)  But his offering from Zico comes close.  And the aftertaste is authentic, too.

I don't think that all people understand that fresh coconut water does not taste like coconut meat.  Coconut water has only a hint of the flavor of  coconut meat, and it has a slight tang and almost a slight "soapy" taste.  It is nothing like coconut milk or coconut cream.  And its nothing like the coconut flavor in a pina colada.

I'll say it's decent enough flavor to bring back memories of shaking green coconuts to listen to the slosh of the water inside.  Then taking a machete and trimming off the top of the tough outer green of the coconut.  The final swipe would expose a hole to the inside.  Bring it to the lips and some water would always trickle down my chin.  When the water was gone, I would crack the coconut open and use one of the ovals from what was trimmed from the top to scoop out the jelly inside.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Lee Kum Kee Premium Oyster Sauce, 18-Ounce Glass Bottles (Pack of 2)
Review:
Yes, this oyster sauce is more expensive than many others, but it gives so much more flavor that it is worth it to me.  It has a richness that the others do not have.  It has a meaty flavor.  It has a deep flavor.  If I want to quick throw a stir fry together, I drizzle a tablespoon of this oyster sauce, a tablespoon of a hoisin, and a bit of low salt soy sauce.  It makes a great sauce!

I've been using it for years and am never without a follow-up bottle on my pantry shelf.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
FISHER Chef's Naturals Slivered Almonds, No Preservatives, Non-GMO, 2 oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
Almonds taste fine, but the bag I received contained more little pieces and brown skin than pretty slices.  When I buy sliced almonds I expect sliced almonds.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Pastariso Instant Brown Rice, Mac and Cheese Meal Cup, 2-Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
It has a nice creamy texture; that's about all the good I can say about this product.  It is way too salty, with a cup-full taking up 28% of your daily allotment of sodium.  There is absolutely no cheese flavor, and it surely wasn't worth the 4 1/2 minutes it took to prepare it.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
FISHER Chef's Naturals Chopped Hazelnuts, No Preservatives, Non-GMO, 2 oz (Pack of 12)
Review:
Until very recently, hazelnuts were hard to find in my area of central south Texas.  I found them in a one pound bag, but it's hard to keep them fresh when a recipe only calls for a few ounces.  That is why I really like this packaging from Fisher.  These hazelnuts are very fresh.

They are already chopped and convenient for many applications.  Be aware that in chopped form, it is not easy to remove the skins.  Some recipes call for skinning the nuts.  With these nuts, I didn't bother with that de-skinning step:  Nobody noticed, so that's a good lessons-learned for me, and a real time-saver.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Chex Snack Mix Bold Party Blend, 8.75-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
I like the idea of less salt, but, really, you need some to bring up the flavor.  This mix is not worth spending calories on.  I suppose if I was starving, I might make a dent in this bag, but since we first opened it a week ago, it is still sitting on the shelf.

I don't know how they decided to call this flavor mix "Bold", because it is milder that a Ritz cracker or the plainest Dorrito.  It's got less flavor that an original Cheez-it.

I did go through and pick out the dark "rye/pumpernickel" round chips; there were ten or so.  They didn't have much flavor to them; I think they were just dyed dark brown...  The two different Chex in this mix are not bad, but the pretzels have no zing, no tangy taste when they first hit your tongue.

If you empty this bag, if you are way too hungry to need this kind of a snack.  Grab a carrot or piece of celery--you will get the crunch you're looking for and a perkier flavor.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Barilla ProteinPlus Multigrain Pasta, Thin Spaghetti, 14.5 Ounce (Pack of 20)
Review:
My eagle eye caught sight of this Barilla "Plus" on the grocery store shelves about two years ago.  At that time, I was starting to feel guilty about serving and eating regular semolina pastas once a week, and was in the mood for a change.  It was time to start cutting back on carbs and start looking for healthier choices.  I had given the Barilla whole wheat pasta a chance and the family nipped that in the bud.  So when I first saw the "Plus" I did not hesitate to grab a box off the store shelf.  It costs more than the regular, (always about a dollar to a dollar and a half more than the blue box Barilla), but it seems eating healthy always does cost more...

From the very first box--which, by the way, was the bow tie (farfalle) shape--we loved the taste.  Its flavor is not the same as "regular" semolina:  It is more flavorful, with a richer, nuttier, "bigger" taste.

Then we tried the rotini, and I realized I had found the perfect choice for cold pasta salads.  The "Plus" in general does not absorb as much moisture as the semolina in the blue box, so it has great holding power in cold salads.  And the ridges of the rotini hold a thin dressing well.  The flavor of the Plus goes well with the olives, pickled and raw vegetables, salami, and feta or cojita cheese that I toss into a pasta salad.

Plus is more toothsome also.  And it has less starch.  Which brings up the fact that it does not cook up the way good old semolina does.  With some of the shapes it has never been an issue.  For instance, one does not use farfalle in dishes that rely on pasta starch for some of the body of the sauce.  So, if I have a sauce made up in another pot, and it just gets spooned on top of the pasta, or mixed into the pasta, or if I am using this for a cold or room temp pasta salad, this is our pasta of choice.  If I need to use spaghetti or fettuccine shape, I don't use Plus, I use the regular blue box semolina.

So, here is a little tip:  Think twice before using this pasta where your sauce is minimal and you need some of the pasta water to add body:  This Plus will not do that for you.  It does not have the required starch.  Also, do not use a Plus pasta in a mac 'n cheese if you follow that sneaky little ingenious stove top recipe of cooking your pasta in milk then adding grated cheese and ta! da! you have a creamy noodle side dish in 25 minutes.  It is just not starchy enough.

But for everything else, this is a great pasta choice!
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

Review:
I use these to soak in lime juice with a little chili and salt, then toast for a low-carb snack.
It is hard to find pieces that are large.
So far, this has had the most consistently large flakes per bag, and they have excellent flavor and taste, even untreated.

Anyone who wants to try this:
1/4 cup lime juice
1/8 tablespoon chili powder
1/8 tablespoon cayenne
1/8 tablespoon salt
(I mix all that first)
Then add 2 cups or so of the coconut.
Stir gently so all coconut is covered, sometimes let sit to absorb.
Spread thinly on a cookie sheet
Convect at 2:20 degrees Fahrenheit  for 1 hour and 20 minutes,
stir a bit, then another 10 minutes, then remove from oven to let cool.

Product:
Bonne Maman Strawberry Preserves, 13-Ounce Jars (Pack of 6)
Review:
Because I found Bonne Maman Cherry Preserves incredibly good, I had no hesitation when it came to purchasing the strawberry.  I can only say I am disappointed by the product and hope my experience may be an aberration.

Unlike most of the commercially available products, the flavor of these preserves is excellent.  It is natural and does not taste as if the flavor was enhanced during processing.  However, the consistency of the preserves reminds me of rubber cement - it is gluey and does not spread easily.  Fortunately, I use a lot of preserves on each bagel piece, so this gave me an excuse to pile it on.  I thought it might be that the jar I purchased was getting toward the end of its shelf life, but it still had 15 months until the pull date.  Further, the jar I opened first had whole strawberries through it, rather than smaller pieces.  While this may be considered desirable, I like to be able to apread the preserves and not just glop on chunks of berry.

I enjoyed the Cherry Preserves immensely, but I think there are all-natural strawberry preserve products on the market that are better than Bonne Maman Strawberry Preserves.  In fact, one of the big box stores has its own organic strawberry preserves available in a quart jar; these have the same outstanding flavor of the Bonne Maman, but are not rubbery and the strawberries have been crushed rather than processed as whole berries.  I believe the cost is about $7 for that product.
Rating:
3.0
</Other Writer-1>

golds.output: I was really looking forward to trying these KIND Bars, but unfortunately, they were a huge letdown. As someone who's gluten-free and always on the lookout for tasty, natural treats, I thought these would be a great option. All I added was EarthBalance butter, salt and pepper, with a touch of garlic powder and paprika. I was certainly a hit among us normally gluten free eaters. Review:

No problem, I just spread it till it reaches the edges of the pan. We tried these warm and they were ok. We both agreed they were no like brownie (chewy and chocolatey)they tasted "off" but familiar. We agreed, they were more like a crumbly fudge cake. After we tried them cooled down, I figured it out what was off...it was too much baking soda/powder flavor. Not really sure but I know I got that after taste when I was learning to bake as a teen. If we ever try these again, we will load them up with other things like blue berries, chocolate chips, nuts, coconut, or whatever I have around.

Would I recommend? It depends. I don't need a gluten free diet. So, for those who are like me in that way, then No. For those who need gluten free, then Yes.

My favorite brownie to date, is Trader Joe's brownie mix...oh, with Biscoff spread, OMG! Heavenly.

For me... a little goes a long way as I don't care for anything overly sweet.  I use the same amount of this product that I used with the organic sugar I've now replaced.  For Lucy who is wondering whether this is 100% organic coconut sugar, the ingredient list states: organic granulated coconut nectar (it is made from the flower buds of the coconut tree). The tastes have really varied with each and every one I tried and after reading all of  the reviews for the different brands, I've been struck with some realizations.  First of all... the different brands utilize coconuts from different parts of the globe.  That in and of itself would cause flavor differences.  But, the other thing that came to mind is how the same tree can produce different flavor and texture results in things like oranges and apples depending on the weather pattern for that season, etc.  Perhaps the same applies to coconuts?  In any case, of all the brands I've tried, this is by far my favorite.  I decided to try drinking coconut water to help with lowering my blood pressure and it has definitely done that.  So I am happy that I finally found one that I can happily consume and enjoy every day!

I also use it on the boys (2 black labs) for the same issues... except for the complexion.  The taste is different as the manuka plant is in the same family as the tea tree oil plant.. not very tasty.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Lightly Sea Salted Whole Pumpkin Seeds, 4 LBS by Gerbs – Top 12 Food Allergy Free & Non GMO - Vegan & Kosher Certified - Dry Roasted In-Shell Pepitas from United States Review: I'm used to pumpkin seeds roasted in the oven at home at Halloween, and these don't measure up all that well in comparison. They're barely toasted at all, so they don't have much flavor. On the other hand, they're a healthy snack, and not that bad. They certainly don't lead me to overeat. I'll probably finish them eventually, though if I had more choices (I'm prediabetic with celiac disease), I doubt I'd try. Rating: 3.0 Product: Eat Natural Almond & Apricot Bar with Yogurt Coating,1.76 Ounce Bar, 12-Count Box Review: I've been carrying Larabars with me as a gluten-free snack, and bought "Eat Natural" almond & apricot bars to give them a try after seeing the glowing reviews. They are indeed delicious - though I find the coconut and yogurt flavors come through much more strongly than the apricot. They're somewhat more filling than Larabars - 235 calories vs. 180 calories, in both cases half fat. There's big difference in saturated fat - 9 grams for "Eat Natural", 1 for Larabars, and "Eat Natural" bars have almost 20 times the sodium (95 mg, as compared to 5 mg), and half the fiber (2 grams as compared to the Larabar's four). "Eat Natural" ingredients don't get any more unnatural-sounding than soya lecithin, glucose syrup, and dextrose - but the list is certainly a whole lot longer than my Larabar's "dates, almonds, unsweetened apples, walnuts, raisins, cinnamon" (yes, that's all). These "Eat Natural" bars do taste good and are a little better at killing hunger pangs than Larabars. I might buy them again sometime if I find I need a snack that's a little better at killing hunger but think I'll stick to Larabars in the meantime. Rating: 4.0 Product: Eat Natural Bars: Almond & Raisin with Brazil Nuts & Peanuts, 1.76-Ounce, 12-Count Boxes Review: Not something I'll buy again - rather bland puffed rice and nuts (mostly Brazil nuts and almonds), sweetened with glucose syrup and with some raisins mixed in - the only fruit I could taste, though the ingredient list includes apricots and peach. The result is bland as well as overly sweet. Though "Eat Natural" yogurt-coated almond & apricot bars are even sweeter, they're far tastier and would be my choice if I were to buy "Eat Natural" bars again. I prefer Larabars to either - though I know they're not everyone's cup of tea. (And the dates and other fruit used to sweeten Larabars seem more natural ingredients to me than the glucose syrup used to sweeten "Eat Natural" bars.) Rating: 3.0 Product: Raw Almonds from California - 10 (1 Lb) Resealable Packages Review: These are great almonds - bigger and not as dried out as the ones I've been paying a lot more for at the grocery store. Not a bad almond in the lot, and very well packaged too. We'll buy these again! Rating: 5.0 Product: Bakto Flavors Pure Madagascar Vanilla Extract - 8 OZ Review: This is really good vanilla extract, in a bottle size that's much better suited to the amount of baking I do than the much smaller bottles available in my local grocery store. Not a bad buy, either. Rating: 5.0 Product: Madi K's Almonds, Whole Natural Nonpareil, 31 Count (Pack of 31) Review: Love these - have been getting them on subscription for months now. So handy to tuck away for a snack on the go - I'm gluten free and diabetic, and finding good portable snack foods is a problem! They always taste fresh. Not just my imagination - I brought them with me as part of my contribution of food for a 13-hour session working the polls at a special election recently, and they were a big hit with everyone else too. The box they come in works as a dispenser - has a drop-down panel at the front. Very convenient too. Rating: 5.0 Product: Ideal Brown No Calorie Sweetener, 10.6 oz. Review: I'd had no luck finding a gluten-free brown sugar substitute until I found this on Amazon - and checked the manufacturer's website, which assured me it is gluten-free. AND mostly xylitol - the sugar substitute I prefer anyway. So I order one bag to try it, and quickly went back to order more. It's great stuff - more like light brown sugar than dark brown, so I need to add a tad of molasses in some of my baking. And of course like plain xylitol, it's much drier than sugar, but adding a little applesauce to whatever I'm baking helps with that. But mostly I use it on my breakfast cereal - sprinkling cinnamon in the bottom of the bowl, adding Bob's Red Mill Gluten Free Whole Grain, Rolled Oats, 32-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4) and a handful of raisins, microwaving it, and topping it with Ideal Brown no-cal sweetener. Yum. Rating: 5.0 Product: Bobs Red Mill - Sweet Sorghum Flour Gluten-Free 22 oz Review: I buy most of my flours from Bob's Red Mill in the 4-pack boxes, if only because having all the bags and boxes the same size makes it easier to store them. It's good flour, and the bag's a good size for baking for a small family - also a good shape that will stand up on the counter while you scoop flour out of it. Rating: 5.0 Product: Bob's Red Mill, Texturized Vegetable Protein, 10 oz Review: We're trying to eat less meat - but still love dishes like meatloaf, meatball soup, etc. I've been using this TVP (plus some additional seasoning) to substitute for half the meat in some favorite recipes and both of us eat them happily, though it's taken a bit of experimenting to get quite the same taste and texture. I look at dishes that call for plain TVP but am not so sure I'm ready to try them yet When a dietician told me I should to add more protein to my breakfast and suggested adding an egg (ugh - really don't like eggs), I tried adding a couple of tablespoons of it in my morning oatmeal. It needs a bit of flavoring (cinnamon and/or raisins plus some stevia for sweetening) to keep from tasting like dog kibble, but with the flavoring it tastes great and I can really tell the difference in the amount of energy I have in the morning. Rating: 5.0 Product: Barney Butter Almond Butter, Bare Smooth, 16 Ounce (Pack of 3) Review: This is pretty good - tastes like a slightly bland peanut butter and is an excellent substitute for peanut butter when baking for a crowd that may include kids with peanut allergies. That's what I bought it for, along with having it around to eat a spoonful now and then as a quick snack that's low in sugar (3 grams in a 2-tablespoon serving). Just one problem: getting the jars open. I'm on my second 3-jar shipment and managed to wrestle the first four jars open. A couple really were easy; another two more difficult but do-able with some effort if I tapped the lids firmly around the edges and used jar openers - one to hold the jar, the other to turn the lid. The fifth jar was impossible. I finally turned to my husband, who struggled with a while himself before finally getting the lid unscrewed. On the plus side, it's packed in a plastic jar, so we were planning to cut the thing open and move the contents to a Ziploc container if we had to. But I do wonder why manufacturers, in the interest of preventing tampering with food, make containers so difficult to open that people stop buying the product - which is what I'm going to do if I find another jar as difficult to open as this last one. Rating: 3.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['good', 'taste', 'sugar', 'like', 'one', 'much', 'great', 'used', 'bars', 'though'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. I only wish the company would make this white rice pasta in all the other shapes/types that they do in the brown pastas. [...] So please, if you like this kind please contact them as ask as I have for that to happen. They say they follow consumer demand - so lets DEMAND macaroni, linguini and all the rest too! "Skinnygirl" White Cherry Water Enhancer adds a very nice taste to water, and it is one of those zestier enhancers, not the underpowered brands that barely register on the taste buds. I put 2 or 3 squirts into a normal 16 ounce bottle of water and it yields a taste that is more strawberry than cherry. Always dilute Skinnygirl. It's for everyone to use, despite the catchy brand name. It has 5 calories per serving and zero fat, carbs, sugar, sodium, protein, or calories. Ingredients are: water, citric acid, natural flavors, cane sugar, stevia extract (sweetener), vegetable and fruit juice (color). Contains less that 2% potassium benzoate and potassium sorbate (preservatives). Highly Recommended. Five PLEASING Stars. (2-1.62 fluid ounce/48mL plastic squeeze bottles, 24 servings in each. No refrigeration required, use within one month of opening. Shop around.) In a one bottle serving. It provides: 26 grams of protein and a whopping 70% of calcium, 3.5 grams of fat, 2 grams saturated fat, 240 calories, 0 gram trans fat, 15 mg of cholesterol, 28 grams of carbohydrates, 340 mg of potassium (700 mg for Chocolate Flavor) 120 mg of sodium (140 mg for Chocolate Flavor) 15% of Vitamins A, 40% of Vitamin D Gluten free and caffein free, 0 grams of fiber. 26 grams of sugar. In addition to the nutrition, this protein shake actually tastes good all the way down, without the chalky aftertaste that some similar drinks have. It is a pleasure to drink for breakfast, before or after workouts, or for a snack. Highly Recommended. Five BENEFICIAL Stars. (1 each 11.5 ounce plastic bottle of "Core Power Vanilla High Protein Milk Shake" in a case of 24.) Product:
Bob's Red Mill, Texturized Vegetable Protein, 10 oz
Review:
I love TVP.  I use it at work all the time.  Here are some tips on using it:

Rehydrate your TVP in a double or triple strength liquid, like bouillon or soup base with twice or triple the recommended amount added to the water.

Cover the TVP with the bouillon or soup mixture until it kind of sloshes around.  It will absorb more liquid over time.

After the liquid has absorbed (usually 10 minutes or so) taste test it to see if the seasoning is to your liking.  You can add more seasoning, or add more TVP depending on how strong it is.

Once it's at the right flavor, use your culinary skills to give it some kick.  Add an egg and some breadcrumbs, and make TVP burgers or "meat"balls.  Add some cumin, onion, garlic, and chili, thicken with a little starch, and you get TVP taco filling.  The possibilities are endless!

BIG SECRET tip: Use a little sugar in your hydrating liquid if you are going to brown the TVP in any way, as in taco filling or patties.  The sugar will help it brown (Google: Maillard Reaction) And if your dishes are tasting salty without tasting "savory" try adding a little nutritional yeast, or yeast extract.

My only complaint: this TVP is pale, like breadcrumbs. I like my TVP to have a nice dark color usually, but it all tastes the same, so not a big deal.

4.0

The rice has a bubble gum flavor that is OK, but a little overpowering when mixed with the other ingredients, so I ate mine mostly separated to try the different flavors.  Each topping is a fruit flavor of some kind, and some are more sour than others.

The inner wrapper comes with little "plates" you can cut out and use to put your sushi on, it's adorable!

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Viva Naturals Organic Quinoa, 4 LB - 100% Royal Bolivian Whole Grain Review: The things I like Best about this quinoa is that it's USDA certified organic and that it is prewashed. Quinoa naturally has a slightly bitter coating which has to be rinsed off. This can be a little bit difficult since it's such a tiny seed. That means it has to be rinsed in a fine mesh strainer and often sticks to the strainer This product saves that step. It's already washed. Quinoa is nice for a change of pace from rice or other grains but can be prepared in much the same manner. It's actually a seed and not a grain and has a more complete protein profile than rice. I usually prepare it in my Stainless Steel Rice Cooker Model ME81 (Formerly ME8) - by Miracle Exclusives and often mix it with barley or brown rice and cook them together. I use about two parts of water to one part quinoa. I often use it for Tabouli Salad to replace the bulgar. I've also used it in pilaf and in chilled salads with vegetables. It works very well in a rice pudding type of dish too. (In place of the rice.) Quinoa has an impressive nutrient profile as well. It has 50% more protein than brown rice and more fibre. A cup of brown rice has 14 per cent of the recommended daily fibre. As good as that is, quinoa does rice even better, with 21 per cent. It also is one of the few plant sources that contains a complete protein meaning that it has all of the protein forming amino acids. Sample received for review. Rating: 5.0 Product: Emergency Preparedness & Survival Gluten-Free Food Supply - All Natural, Kosher, Non-GMO - 10 Year Shelf Life - 15 Servings Review: These aren't the kind of jelly beans where you stuff a handful into your mouth. These are meant to be savored and enjoyed one at a time. Each has a vibrant, distinctive flavor, the kind you want savor, one at a time. And this sampler is the perfect way to try a variety of David's Signature Beyond Gourmet Jelly Beans. It provides a nice variety including bacon, black cherry, blueberry, coconut, cranberry, ginger, grape, green apple, Himalayan sea salt, lemon, orange punch, peach, pomegranite, root beer, strawberry and vanilla bean. All of them were very good, but my personal favorites were strawberry, lemon, coconut and bacon. I have to admit that the bacon was a strange flavor for a jelly bean. Maybe that's why I liked it. It had sort of a burnt flavor, like bacon when it's crispy. These jelly beans use natural flavors that are quite intense. One of these small beans fills your whole mouth with flavor. If you are really adventuresome you could try a pack of David's Signature Beyond Gourmet Jelly Beans Man Mix. The bacon, ginger and Himilayan Sea salt flavors from this sampler are included, but there is also a chipotle, Thai chili, wasabi and a habanero jelly bean that is three-alarm hot! If you like unusual flavors you have to give them a try too. From what I understand David Klein created the first gourmet jelly beans some 35 years ago, so he's quite accomplished when it comes to unique flavors that are fun to taste. Wouldn't this be the perfect thing for the Easter Bunny to leave for the adult jelly bean fans on your list? The manufacturer supplied me with this sampler for review. Rating: 5.0 Product: Tiesta Tea Blueberry Wild Child Blueberry Hibiscus Fruit Tea, 30 Servings, 1.8 Ounce Pouch - Caffeine Free, Loose Leaf Herbal Tea Eternity Blend, Non-GMO Review: This herbal tea has an interesting blend of flavors with the predominant ones being watermelon and peppermint. The flavors remind me of summer. It doesnt contain any regular tea leaves, making it actually a tisane. Ive switched to caffeine-free drinks lately, so this is perfect. The flavors make it a natural for an ice tea but its also very good as a hot brewed tea. To make it iced, I just brew it hot with a smaller amount of boiling water, and then add ice once its brewed. Ive been using a lot of loose teas lately because I like having more control over the strength of the Tea and because its actually quite a good deal moneywise using the loose rather than teabags. I love these canisters with the airtight seals that Tiesta uses. Theyre attractive and they keep the tea fresh. Rating: 5.0 Product: goodnessKNOWS Cranberry, Almond & Dark Chocolate Gluten Free Snacks Square Bars 12-Count Box Review: The ingredients in these.small 4 section bars are basic and simple, with blueberries, sugar, crisp rice roasted almonds and dark chocolate among others. Each bar weighs 1.20 ounces, which isn't a lot, but the flavors, especially the dark chocolate, make them satisfying. They are just 150 calories each so they're a good snack for those of us trying to keep our weight down. They're low enough that they don't cause that big sugar drop a half hour or so after eating them like some regular candy bars do. They have 2 grams of fiber and 3 grams of protein per bar. I like that they're GMO-free. They aren't a health food, but they fit in with my plan for a reasonable number of calories in a snack while still tasting very good. Rating: 5.0 Product: Yogi Tea - Echinacea Immune Support - Supports Immune Function - 6 Pack, 96 Tea Bags Total Review: My husband often has a scratchy throat, probably from acid reflux. Several weeks ago my sister gave him a couple tea bags of this product and he said it was soothing to his throat so I ordered this pack of 6 boxes from Amazon. It's not always an easy tea to find in grocery stores and this is so much more convenient. He's been drinking it every night so it looks like I'll be ordering more in the future. Rating: 5.0 Product: truRoots Organic Quinoa 100% Whole Grain Premium Quality, 4 lbs Review:
 This quinoa is nice for a change of pace from rice or other grains but can be prepared in much the same manner. It's actually a seed and not a grain and has a more complete protein profile than rice. I usually prepare it in my Stainless Steel Rice Cooker Model ME81 (Formerly ME8) - by Miracle Exclusives and often mix it with barley or brown rice and cook them together. I use about two parts of water to one part quinoa. I often use it for Tabouli Salad to replace the bulgar. I've also used it in pilaf's and in chilled salads with vegetables. It works very well in a rice pudding type of dish too. (In place of the rice.) It should be rinsed in a fine mesh strainer because it tastes slightly bitter if it's not rinsed first. I use a strainer like this: Stainless Steel Fine Mesh Strainer Colander Sieve with Handle for Kitchen Food Rice Vegetable,set of 3. The prices change on Amazon but I can usually find a cheaper at Costco. I made a short video for anyone who isn't familiar with quinoa. I don't usually play with my food, but just wanted you to see the texture. :) Rating: 5.0 Product: KIND Sweet and Spicy Bars, Korean Chili, Gluten Free, 10g Plant Protein, 1.6oz, 12 Count Review: I just purchased my first box of Strong & Kind Roasted Jalapeno bars and I think these could become a serious addiction. They aren't too sweet which I appreciate when trying to lose weight and not overeat, because they don't give my that blood sugar spike that a lot of energy bars give which end up making me want to keep eating. These are satisfying and I love the jalapeno. It's heat is bold but not overwhelming. For me, it's just the right amount of heat. One bar is 230 calories but with all the almonds, pumpkin and hemp seeds it's very satisfying makes me feel full for a couple of hours after I eat one. The ingredients are: almonds, pumpkin and hemp seeds, honey, non-GMO glucose, and pea crisps, jalapeno chili, onion powder, garlic powder, smoked sea salt and sunflower lecithin. The nuts and seeds are whole, not mashed into some gooey mass and baked. I like being able to taste the indivual ingredients. The slight smoky taste is perfect with the other natural flavors. These are more savory than sweet. I will definitely keep buying these. Update 4/8/15 - I just had one of these bars from a different box, a box of 4. The heat was gone. I could barely taste it. I hope it was just that bar and not the rest of the box as well. The heat was what I liked about this bar. I hope they didn't change the recipe. Rating: 5.0 Product: Koffee Kult Dark Roast Coffee Beans - Highest Quality Gourmet - Whole Bean Coffee - Fresh Roasted Coffee Beans, 32oz Review: As soon as I opened the outer box, before even opening the bag, the aroma of these coffee beans was evident. This is some of the best coffee I've tasted. When brewing it in our Chemex 10-Cup Classic Series Glass Coffee Maker with a stainless steel coffee filter. the whole kitchen smelled like a coffee shop. This is a nice dark roast, much like a French roast. These beans are from Columbia, Guatemala and Sumatra and they have a nice smooth taste with no bitterness at all. The flavor is rich with just a hint of spice. They arrived in a stay fresh, heavy bag that is easy to re-seal. The beans were obviously very fresh because even before grinding them my kitchen was filled with their aroma. I love brewing coffee in the Chemex because I think it makes one of the best cups of coffee. But when I want just a single cup and am in a hurry, I've been known to use a refillable stainless K-cup in a Keurig and this coffee tastes pretty amazing brewed that way as well. Two thumbs up for a great product. A sample was provided for review. Rating: 5.0 Product: BUMBLE BEE Sensations Sun-Dried Tomato and Basil Seasoned Tuna with Crackers, High Protein Food, Gluten Free Food, High Protein Snacks, Canned Food, Bulk Snacks, 3.6 Ounce Packages (Pack of 12) Review: I like the flavor of tuna but canned tuna is one of those foods that is a basis for other dishes. It is best with other ingredients mixed in and this tomato and basil tuna works very well together. It's a good snack food that packs some protein but could also be a good diet lunch with 200 calories if you added a salad. I'm not so sure I like the idea of crackers packaged with it. The crackers are fairly bland, as they should be when they're offered with a topping. But I'm not sure I like tuna piled on top of crackers. It tends to fall off and I don't think it actually adds much except a lot of extra packaging and cost. I understand that the crackers may be included to use in packed lunches, perhaps to compete with a product like Lunchables. But I'd rather see this Tomato Basil Tuna sold alone in a 6 or 7 ounce can. I like the pop top can so a can opener isn't needed and it can be eaten anywhere with nothing else needed but a fork. It has only 120 calories for the tuna and 80 calories for the 6 crackers. The tuna is densely packed, not all watery like some cans of tuna. Still, I'd rather purchase a larger can of the lemon pepper tuna (with the pop top) and forget the crackers. Rating: 4.0 Product: Dr. McDougall's Right Foods Vegan Tamale Soup with Baked Chips, 2.4-Ounce Cups (Pack of 6) Review: When I first checked the nutritional label, I was impressed that this soup was only 100 calories--until I looked more closely I realized that this little cup is shown as 2 servings and is actually 200 calories for the cup. The soup is fairly thick, but still, it's not a large cup and I can't imagine dividing it between 2 people. I think the whole thing should be shown as a single serving. That said, the flavor is OK, but it is mainly a starchy soup of ground corn and corn flour with a few beans thrown in. I could sort of taste some peppers but couldn't really see any. I'm not sure I would buy it again. It's a handy way to enjoy a quick lunch that you could take along to work or have at home. You do have to be careful with preparation or you end up with a thick congealed mass on the bottom of the cup. I would suggest mixing very well after adding water and then stopping the microwave a couple times while cooking to remix, making sure you scrape along the bottom of the cup as you're mixing so you don't end up with dry product stuck to the bottom. Review:
For me, when it comes to dark chocolate, the darker (i.e. higher % of cacao) the better! Up until I tried the Lindt Supreme Dark 90%, I'd been enjoying the Lindt Excellence Extra Dark 85% Cocoa. The 90% cocoa bar definitely has a deeper, more earthy/rich chocolate flavor; something to keep in mind as I could see it being perhaps "too dark" for some people (although, personally, there's no such thing as TOO dark). Also, the consistency is noticeably more...I suppose "buttery" -- as it melts, it has a slightly creamier, smoother mouth feel than chocolate of a lower percentage. Dark chocolate is a daily indulgence for me, and I'm always on the hunt for the most premium/superior grade product. Of all the bars I've tasted so far, this is up there--like, top 3. If it's of any help/relevance to someone comparing brands and percentages and whatnot, I much prefer Lindt as a brand over Ghirardelli. In my opinion, both the Lindt 90% Supreme and 85% Extra Dark are tastier overall and much richer (chocolate-ier? lol) compared to, say, the Ghirardelli 86% Midnight Reverie. I eat a square of this bar every afternoon, and I've already repurchased it twice more since first trying it. Worth mentioning since I'm always looking to try new/different brands of dark chocolate. Unless or until I discover something that tops it, this may just become my all-time favorite.
