I'm impressed by these cashews.  The first thing you notice is the packaging - each cashew is individually wrapped which makes for a delightful and very fresh snack.  I've had other cashews that came in a bag and were stale and unpleasant.  Not so here.  The salt is subtle but brings out the rich flavor of the cashew itself.

The cashews are large and plump, not those tiny things you sometimes get in a can or bag.  The wrapping keeps them fresh and crunchy, which is a big plus.  I've had these for a week and a half now and they still taste like

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Archway Cookies, Original Coconut Macaroons, 10 Ounce Box Review: Summary: Not very lemony and very, very crumbly. Give these a pass and find some higher quality cookies. I love good lemon cookies, these really are not very good at all. The lemon flavor is there but subdued and not terribly "fresh" tasting. The cookie is soft to the point of crumbing in your hand and even taking one out of the package is likely to break pieces off and scatter your table with crumbs. There are far too many unneeded ingredients and they use (or may use) palm oil and other cheap oils and high-fructose corn syrup. For those to whom it matters, they use some level of genetically modified foods. I do nor care and this is not really a genuine issue but many people do care and I present the facts so people may make their own decisions. I'd suggest not giving these to small kids as it is going to be an unqualified mess as the cookies break apart if you glance at them and a small child will simply turn this into a cleaning mess with sticky crumbs and bits of "frosting" all over the landscape. In fact, I'd simply suggest giving them a complete miss regardless. These are third rate cookies at best, in my opinion, and not worth the cost or calories. Archway has always been a "brand of last resort" in my experience and nothing here changes my mind in the least. Addendum: As others mention, these leave an unpleasant aftertaste that lingers. I have half the package left and am simply tossing them into the food waste bin. Just not good. Rating: 2.0 Product: Bibigo Korean Gochujang Sauce, 11.46 Ounce, 2 Count Review: This is the first time I've used Gochujang hot sauce after hearing about it for years and seeing it on many cooking shows. Not sure I'll continue to use it though as it is one third sugar. No idea if they are all like that but that's way too much sugar. It occurs three times on the ingredient list in various places and there's 10 grams of sugar in a 30 gram serving. Sugar is the next ingredient after peppers. Ridiculous. The flavor is good. This stuff is no foolin' spicy. I like it. Good "burn" without overdoing it. Reminds just a bit of Tabasco Sauce although the flavor is decidedly different. There is (obviously) a sweet aftertaste as well from all that brown sugar and cane sugar. Too much really for my taste. Maybe in summer if you can use it like a barbecue sauce to get that caramelized flavor on the grill it may work better, but for for my use it's just sugary hot sauce and I can get great hot sauces without all the extra sugar for a lot less money. Not meaning to harp on this as I'm not particularly a health nut but if excess sugar in your diet matters, use this with caution. Rating: 3.0 Product: Jack Link's Meat Snacks Beef Jerky, Peppered, 5.85 Ounce Review: Rather like Pastrami Jerky...and that's a good thing. Hot without overdoing it, very peppery but not masking the rich beef flavor you get from Jerky. Very chewy, a traditional jerky that can pull fillings if you're not careful but worth the risk. ;) Only odd ingredient is "Hydrolyzed corn protein". No idea what that is doing in my beef jerky but be aware if such things matter to you. Overall, a great snack and a very traditional one. Rating: 5.0 Product: NongShim Neoguri Noodle, Spicy Seafood, 4.2 Ounce Packages (Pack of 20) Review: I was hankering for something a bit different from standard Ramen. I gave these a try and they are a serious hit. They take about ten minutes end to end using a microwave (I add some dried shrimp for a bit more flavor and Umami. The noodles plump up well and have a good texture with a decent "bite" to them, they are not soggy paste. They don't dall apart and remind me of a decent pasta. The broth is definitely spicy/hot. Not "burn your mouth " hot but not fooling around either. There's a great seafood flavor and an intruiging mix of ocean life (sand lance anyone?) As usual, there's a ton of sodium so this may not be for everyone and it's not low calorie either, a full pack is a bit over 500 calories. They play the usual game about portions and presume there's two portions in the bag. I doubt most folk will divvy it up but there is enough that you could do so without feeling like you are making portions for a child's tea party. On a cold, damp, rainy day, this is a nice way to warm up and I intend to keep some around and try their other flavors and maybe add some dried bonito flakes as well. This stuff is a good platform for experiments. Tasty, hearty and highly recommended to fill that void in your tummy or your craving for noodles. (Note, the product has origins in Korea I think but the version sold here is made in the USA.) Rating: 5.0 Product: Buzz and Bloom Honey Creamy Spread, Original, 12 Ounce Review: A very creamy honey. Easily spreadable with a knife or scoopable with a spoon but not pourable. Mild honey flavor with just enough cinnamon to enhance it without overwhelming it. I used it in my morning cup of very strong black tea and it works surprisingly well which I did not expect cinnamon to do. Melted onto toast or a hot bagel and you have an even better delight. It would seem Ukrainian bees do a fine job of work. ;) Highly recommended for a breakfast or snack "change-up" or to put some zip in your morning sip. I suspect this will be superb in a cup of coffee with some Cognac or in a Mocha with some Coffee liqueur as well. I shall report back on this once I try one or the other. (I don't drink alcohol much so be patient.) Rating: 5.0 Product: Bumble Bee Sensation Seasoned Tuna with Crackers, Chipotle, 3.6 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: Shredded tuna about one grade above cat food, doused with an annoyingly spicy chipotle sauce that is all burn and no taste. Can is annoyingly hard to open and the miniature plastic scraper almost useless in getting the tuna out without making a mess everywhere. Have a napkin on the table or desk as you're going to get tuna crumbs all over unless you have the dexterity of a surgeon. The included crackers are decent but not spectacular and work as a vehicle to hold the tuna and can be gently used to "spoon" upt he tuna once the can is somewhat empty. Works better than the tiny plastic "spoon" provided/. The chipotle flavor drowns out the tuna completely and lacks the subtle heat and warmth of the good stuff like the assorted "rooster sauces". This will do as a back-up snack or such but only if you have water or milk or something to tame the annoying afterburn. Rating: 2.0 Product: Pure Leaf Tea House Collection, Organic Iced Tea, Wild Blackberry & Sage, 14 Ounce Bottles, Pack of 8 Review: It's summer. Where I live has had record breaking heat and the joy of smoke from major brush fires. Add in the place not being fully air conditioned (Didn't used to need it in these parts) and you have the "prefect storm" that is best quenched by a nice iced tea (at least until I get bids on adding real A/C). Now, while I enjoy iced tea, I am coming to dislike the heavily sweetened versions moistly available. This particular line, while being sweetened, does use cane sugar rather than corn sweetener and uses it judiciously. A bottle of this is 90 calories while a similar bottle of "Gold Peak" is 180 calories. Another brand I like, Tea's Tea, is zero calories with no artificial sweeteners but is a bit more of an acquired taste if you are used to the fizzy corn syrup and water that passes for sodas and such in the USA. (I do suggest trying it...the Jasmine green tea does not *need* sugar and your palate will awaken.) There are multiple flavors in this particular assortment but I am only going to comment on the Sicilian Lemon and Honeysuckle as that is what I have had so far. I may add an update when I get to the Blackberry and Sage one as that really sounds odd. Short form: Good stuff, a refreshing drink that is not overly sweet. The lemon is tart without being bitter or making you pucker and the honeysuckle brings up distant chords of memory from when my grandfather taught me when I was a child to pick and enjoy honeysuckle nectar right off the vine. Refreshment and nostalgia in one bottle, a nice combo. if you want to advance your taste and selection past Lipton and Snapple, you won't go wrong giving these a try. You might not like every flavor but experiment, you may find something you didn't know you loved. Flavor Update: Just finished a bottle of the "Blackberry and Sage". Interesting. They use brewed blackberry leaves and brewed sage leaves along with the usual black tea. Makes for a different but not unacceptable variant. The blackberry leaves add a deep, mildly tart note and the sage presents an almost savory aftertaste that is not unpleasant but does linger. I'd not want this every day but it is an intriguing variant on an old stand-by. Worth giving it a try if you are curious at all about such things. Rating: 5.0 Product: Honest Tea Organic Fair Trade Pomegranate Blue Gluten Free, 16.9 Fl. Oz, 12 Pack Review: I rarely drink sodas or overly-sweetened corn syrup concoctions so this came as a refreshing delight in a desert of sugary-glop and artifical nastiness. A half liter bottle has about 70 calories which means it has far less than half the sugar in a similarly sized bottle of "pop". And what it does have is real sugar, not corn syrup or synthetic sweeteners that leave an aftertaste like C3-PO's gym towel.. Beyond that, this is a delightfully refreshing summer drink. Green tea and honey go well together and I generally open one up after trekking home from the store or such on hot summer's days. it is also a pleasant refresher for the late afternoon/early evening blah period as there is just enough caffeine for the tiniest of kicks without overdoing it. I'd guess less than half the jolt of a cup of coffee or strong black tea. All the relevant ingredients are organic and fair trade and there's just the things you expect in a bottle of tea. Simple, refreshing, not laden with synthetics and priced quite reasonably. I find this to be just about the perfect drink. (Also, you may want to consider Teas' Tea Unsweetened Jasmine Green Tea, 16.9 Ounce (Pack of 12) Packaging May Vary when you want a light iced tea and no sugar at all. Takes getting used to but once you get past needing a mouthful of sweet in every sip, it is really delightful. Excess sugar is probably the biggest dietary health threat going, talk to a real health professional.) Rating: 5.0 Product: Aquafina Sparkling Water, Orange Grapefruit, 12 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: I don't drink a lot of sodas, too much sugar or corn "sweetener" or worse junk in the "diet" versions. But I do enjoy a sparkling beverage when the weather is right so I am always looking for something refreshing but not calorie laden or loaded down with stuff you need the Handbook of Chemistry to sort out. I think I've found a worthy contender with this stuff. There's only ten calories of real sugar and a minimal amount of non-needed junk added in. You get a refreshing drink with a nice lemon-lime taste (for this variety) with no worries about your waist or pancreas. The tiny amount of sugar is just enough to take the full edge off something sharp like lemon-lime without turning this into a sticky syrupy sweet "soda". I am very impressed with this as so many of the drinks in this class use various artificial sweeteners that, to me, leave nasty lingering aftertastes. Even the so-called natural alternatives like Stevia taste wretched to me so this is a delightful find. With the modern trend for "dry" sodas this can fit right in as it is tart and tasty and not at all a kid's drink (Although they may like it too and it's certainly going to be healthier.) As a final note: The sugar is "fair trade" so you can even add a small glow of social justice to your thirst-quenching activities. ;) All in all a highly recommended product that I shall continue to enjoy and to purchase. Rating: 5.0 Product: Jack Link's Beef Jerky, Small Batch Peppered, 2.25 Ounce (Pack of 4) Review: This is one heck of a good bacon jerky. Soft with incredible bacon flavor an freshness. But,...there's not a lot of "maple" flavor at all. Unfortunately, "Maple" is thebarest suggestion int he flavor profile. Oddly, the bag wafts a lovely maple-y flavor when you open it and even after the jerky is gone but the product just doesn't resonate with maple flavor. I note that "Maple flavoring' is far down the ingredient list so it's pretty obvious they didn't baste these in Maple syrup first. Pity. Hit the Internets for a good recipe for candied bacon and you'll get what Jack's is trying for if not as a jerky. The other issue is the price: This stuff if hideously expensive as in "Costs more than an order of bacon and eggs sent by room service at an upscale hotel" which takes it right out of the casual snack category and into the "Hey, I won a small lottery drawing, let's celebrate." So, the search for the perfect Jerky continues. Rating: 3.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['flavor', 'good', 'like', 'tea', 'one', 'use', 'sugar', 'bit', 'get', 'without'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Cafe Altura Ground Organic Coffee, French Roast, 12 Ounce (Pack of 3) Review: I must say for the price of the coffee I was a bit nervous about what I might receive, but all I can say is that I am very pleased. I would compare the flavor to a Maragoya, but a little lighter. It is a light roast so the flavor makes for an exceptional pairing to a simple breakfast of a croissant or other light bread, the flavor is by no means intense but it is there. As for the acidic nature of the coffee I would place it is on par with most coffee house light blends and a below a Italian roast. Overall a good coffee and if you do not like it, the tins are nice enough to make a present of or as a donatation to the church for after service coffee. golds.output: We've been sipping this delicious and soothing Twinings of London Pure Camomile Herbal Tea for years, and it never fails to calm our senses and transport us to a serene English countryside. It's the best bagged black tea I've discovered, though we've enjoyed PG Tips and Yorkshire teas. This "Irish Breakfast" tea is strong, without being overly tannic or sour. It's not like loose Lapsang Souchong, being a far more mellow smokey experience. If you crave an authentic, comforting tea that reminds you of being far from the maddening crowd, perhaps in a safer environ of Midsomer than Badger's Drift, than this is the tea for you. We like it with milk & sweetener, though it's wonderful with honey or sugar. Rating: 5.0 Product: PG Tips Black Tea, Pyramid Tea Bags, 80Count Boxes (Pack of 4) Review: Other reviews are right, this is potent tea, bright and tart. So, if you can't be out on the moors, cold wind blowing, autumn chill refreshing the soul, then you can pretend. This leap of imagination may be even more necessary during the summer's bleak weeks, with heat lambasting the West, furnacing deadly forest fires. We highly recommend this reliable U.K. classic, PG Tips Black Tea, sweetened with Splenda. Years ago, we spend cold months in the U.K., savoring this tea when clouds darkened the horizon and wet leaves scuttled against the windows. For a simple, traditional accompaniment with your PG Tips tea, you may want to try Crawford's Garibaldi Biscuits (also available for a sightly better price with Pennywise (Crawfords) Garibaldi Biscuits), or the rich, spicy Carr's Ginger Lemon Creme cookies. And for vicarious escape to England's North Country, you can't go wrong watching Brenda Blethyn in the Northumbrian mystery series Vera and Vera: Set 2. Enjoy! Rating: 5.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Green Tea, Authentic, 40 Count (Pack of 6) Review: We make a big pot of this refreshing and gently invigorating green tea every morning. It's delicious, a blend of white & green tea leaves that brings out the best in each. I've imbibed a great deal of tea from various parts of the world, and this is an excellent, richly flavorful tea. For fun, we often add a couple of bags of Celestial Seasonings Herb Tea, Peppermint to the pot; it's a riff on a Moroccan tradition that mixes mint leaves with tea. Enjoy! Rating: 5.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Tension Tamer Tea, 20 ct Review: Celestial Seasonings Chamomile tea is the most intensely flavored I've tried. Sourced from Egyptian Chamomile, the aroma and flavor are concentrated, naturally sweet, and densely flowery. We have found this to aid in relaxation and even peaceful sleep. I've found it helpful combating colds and flu, and calming allergies. Invariably, Celestial Seasonings provides consistently excellent quality, holding to extremely high standards. Enjoy! Rating: 5.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Tension Tamer Tea, 20 ct Review: This does not taste artificial. It's delicious! Better tasting than most actual pulpy peaches these days. You'd have to have the tastebuds of a Macho Montana Iguana to not enjoy savoring this tea. I know whereof I speak, having entertained an Irascible Iguana who only deigned to eat raw elk-burger. Then he'd run around and try to bite the cat's tail. He grew large and monstrous on elk-burger, but would never eat a peach, or any other foodstuff he was supposed to like, aside from meat. So, go for it. Be an Uniguana and drink your serene peach tea sweetened with Splenda No Calorie Sweetener, Granular, Individual Packets, 700-Count Box. This true peach adds to the fantastic spectrum of Celestial Season's flavors. PS: The cat was given to a rural artist, grew large and happy, and did not miss the lizard. Rating: 5.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Tension Tamer Tea, 20 ct Review: This exceptional tea reminds me of running in the Rocky Mountains past fields of peppermint, fragrant in the afternoon sun. We drink this tea by the bushel-load, from morning to night. The flavor is exceptional and consistent, delicious during the summer, or warming you through Winter. Enjoy! PS: Best accompanied by U.K. mysteries, like Midsomer Murders: The Early Cases Collection, and buttery biscuits, lots of 'em. Rating: 5.0 Product: Celestial Seasonings Tension Tamer Tea, 20 ct Review: The flavors of each one of these five flavors is remarkably intense. Each sample pouch consists of four-bags of Raspberry Zinger, Country Peach Passion, Black Cherry Berry, Cranberry Apple Zinger, and Tangerine Orange Zinger. There are no artificial additives, this is achieved naturally by the master blenders at the ever-reliable Celestial Seasonings, a company that has not compromised on consistent high-quality. The teas are not only wonderful hot, each flavor makes for refreshing pitchers of fruity iced tea. Enjoy! Rating: 5.0 Product: Haribo Gummi Candy, Rattle-Snakes, 5 oz. Bag (Pack of 12) Review: Lowfat and delicious, these little guys just make us smile. They deliver a powerful burst of yummy flavor that lasts a long time, for such a tiny treat! The more you eat, the younger your spirit will feel. These tasty, fresh candies were highly welcomed as a gift for a colleague with a difficult pregnancy - these helped a lot! For adults and children of all ages. Enjoy! Rating: 5.0 Product: Navitas Organics Cacao Nibs, 8 oz. Bag — Organic, Non-GMO, Fair Trade, Gluten-Free Review: The word "cocoa" comes from the Spanish word cacao which is a version of the Nahuatl word cacahuatl. The cacao tree may have originated in the Amazon's Andes foothills, and in Colombia and Venezuela, where wild cacao can still can be discovered. In Mexico, the Olmecs were cultivating cocoa by 1500 B.C. Before the Spanish conquerors, cocoa beans were a common form of currency in Mesoamerica (too bad our money system can't be this pure & simple!). These high-quality, sustainable and ethically grown Navitas Naturals Cocoa Nibs are high in the benefits of cocoa, since flavonoids degrade during cooking and alkalizing processes (why you don't want Dutch-proceeded cocoa). Anyway, cocoa is a rich source of antioxidants, as well as flavanoids that contain epicatechin, which may benefit cardiovascular health and prevent heart-disease. In 2006, a study of elderly men found a 50% reduction in cardiovascular mortality, and a 47% reduction in overall mortality for those who regularly consumed cocoa ("Cocoa Intake, Blood Pressure, and Cardiovascular Mortality: the Zutphen Elderly Study," Archives of Internal Medicine, 166(4): 411-7). And Navitas Naturals Cacao Nibs even contain 4 grams of protein per serving. Enjoy! Rating: 5.0 Product: Carrs Cookies, Ginger Lemon Creme, 7.05-Ounce. Review: These delicious English tea treats exceed expectations! The crisp, intense-ginger cookies are beautifully complemented by lemon creme within. Based in Carlisle, U.K., these are a vicarious trip to a fascinating area with good taste in victuals, and rife with history; see Carlisle And Cumbria: Roman And Medieval Architecture, Art And Archaeology. Even with very warm Spring/Summer temperatures, Carr's Ginger Lemon Cremes managed to arrive in great condition. Given the intense taste, the ingredients of real lemon and ginger flavor are an understatement; I am also pleased that these contain NO hydrogenated Palm Kernel oil. To return to blustery climes, I'm sure DCI Vera Stanhope (the marvelous Brenda Blethyn), of the Northumbrian mystery series Vera and Vera: Set 2, would savor these treats with her much-needed tea. She might even share some with the Garibaldi Biscuit loving DCI Gene Hunt (Philip Glenister in Life On Mars, U.K.). Enjoy! You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
 Lindt LINDOR 60% Extra Dark Chocolate Truffles, 5.1 Ounce (Pack of 6) 
Review:
I love dark chocolate, and the darker the better (until we get all the way into unsweetened!).

These are gorgeous candies. The shell has a great snap to it, and the interior literally melts in the mouth. Both have superb flavor.

These are pretty much my favorite chocolates EVER...except that for Christmas my husband found a bag of similar ones but with COFFEE added! Those were even more brilliant.

Still, these are a totally gorgeous treat!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Frontier Soups Homemade In Minutes San Francisco Thai Golden Peanut Soup, 4.50-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4) 
Review:
I've now tried a number of Frontier's soup kits, and this is one of the best.

It is amazingly tasty, and does not taste pre-fab at all. The flavor balance is excellent, and the (added) peanut butter adds amazing richness and depth.

I made it with the meat from a turkey drumstick leftover from Thanksgiving, and it was perfect. The hardest part was cutting the meat off the drumstick! The only other add-ins are chicken broth (6 cups), and a cup of peanut butter; I used mostly unsalted natural style, since i don't think high-fructose corn syrup would be a welcome addition to the flavors.

I recommend this highly. It is only very slightly spicy; heat-lovers might want to supplement that a bit, though as-is, I can't see anyone objecting to it. If you are allergic to peanuts, I think sunflower butter would work equally well. I really liked the turkey in it, but the chicken the recipe calls for would be lovely, too.

It is also very filling. It makes 4 servings, and those make a very satisfying meal, possibly with a salad. It's even better after resting overnight in the fridge- the vegetables get more succulent, the soup thickens up, and the flavors blend.

I will definitely be buying this one again!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Maldon Sea Salt Flakes, 8.5 ounce Box
Review:
I love how handy this was to order. The salt is very good quality, and it's useful to be able to mail-order it.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Koon Chun Black Vinegar, 20.3-Ounce Bottle (Pack of 2)
Review:
This is an ingredient I'd despaired of finding in my suburb, many, many miles away from any comprehensive Asian market. And yet, so many recipes I want to try require it! OK, one can sub in balsamic, but that's definitely going to change the flavor.

I was very happy to find it available through Amazon, and I hope my 2 bottles last a while.

Although the packaging was excellent, the shipping cost was itself about as much as 1 bottle of the vinegar. So, if you can find it locally, that would be better than ordering it.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Frontier Soups Hearty Meals Minnesota Heartland Eleven Bean Soup, 18-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4)
Review:
This is a hearty and delicious soup, and it was both pretty easy and made LOTS. I really love the flavor balance, and all the beans were done at the finish time,

We did go with all the add-ins: ham hock (ours had lots of meat), kielbasa, and chicken breast. All the meats were from our meat CSA, by the way!

The meat combination makes this a sort of American cassoulet (which traditionally has pork, sausage, and poultry confit).

A nice crusty bread makes the perfect accompaniment.

It does take some serious elapsed time, though most of it is hands-off. It's probably 6+ hours from start to finish, though that can be divided into a couple of days. The physical prep is easy and straightforward- mostly chopping veg and the sausage and chicken.

And, like all the frontier kits I've tried thus far, it does not taste like a mix. It tastes homemade.

Can you do similarly yourself? sure! but I love the mix of seasonings and beans, and the meat suggestions, and just not having to THINK!

Very recommended!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Hoosier Hill Farm Dry Malt (Diastatic) baking Powder 1.5 lb.
Review:
My husband and i do home brewing, so we are not unacquainted with malts.

The problem with malts is- they are very hydrophilic- meaning, as soon as you open them, they glom onto any moisture in the air and turn into a sticky and sullen mass.

The packaging for this one is a huge help. It's far easier to seal it against humidity. It's not 100% effective- but it's a huge help.

I think if you are brewing, you'd do better to buy malt powders or syrups from your local homebrew shop. But when one needs an occasional tablespoon or quarter cup for baking- this is really handy.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Hoosier Hill Farm Fermented Black Beans, 1.5 Pound
Review:
I do not live handy to a good Asian market, so I tend to either buy stuff online, or in the supermarkets.

As with spices, the supermarkets tend to charge a LOT more for smaller quantities.

Failing a good Asian market opening up close, this kind of thing is great. It's a huge amount of fermented black beans for Chinese dishes, that costs per recipe a tiny fraction of what they do in the supermarket. The tightly-sealing jar in which they are shipped is also great.

Very cost-effective, and of a good quality for Chinese black bean dishes.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Colgin Assorted Liquid Smoke Gift Box 4.0 OZ
Review:
Liquid Smoke is exactly what it says it is: a part of a distillation of wood that gives a smoky flavor to things that have not been smoked.

I got this package because we have not been able to find anything but the hickory flavor locally- and that's a fine flavor, but I wanted a broader spectrum. This has the hickory, but also mesquite, apple, and pecan- and I'd never heard of pecan before!

They all smell gorgeous, and surprisingly different from each other- at least, it';s surprising if one has not done much smoking with various woods, which we have. All seem true to the species.

I grew up on a "smokey dip" which used this stuff, among other things, to make a rich and really tasty dip for chips and veg. These days, I'll add a tiny bit to various braises, especially- not enough to even notice, usually, but it adds a complexity. I am very excited to have several choices for this!

If you just want "liquid smoke", I'm sure you can find the hickory in your grocery store for cheaper. But if you want more variety- well this is the best way to go that I've found!

Also note- it keeps forever, doesn't need refrigeration, and is generally used in very scant amounts. I am sure this package will last me at least 10 years.

Edited to add:
Here's the dip recipe!
1 8-oz package cream cheese, softened (light is fine), mixed with roughly a tablespoon each of liquid smoke and lemon juice (scant), plus maybe a half-teaspoon garlic powder. Mix till smooth and taste- if it's harsh, add a bit more lemon, and add more garlic to taste- a lot depends on how potent your garlic powder is. If you end up overdoing either of these, a bit more smoke does not hurt. I start scant, then add more of each to taste. Once you have it tasing great, you can add a bit of milk to thin it down if it needs it.

SO GOOD on chips and raw veg!
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Orange Blossom Water (Cortas) 10fl oz
Review:
I live in the suburbs, but am a fairly adventurous cook. This is occasionally a problem, since i find recipes thqat call for things that make my local grocers say "huh?" when I ask about them.

I am very pleased to be able to buy this online. it's a big enough bottle that it should last me at least a year, which is wonderful.

I am not thrilled that- with this and a couple of other items- I spent more on shipping than on my items... but sonce it's that or not have them at all, it's an acceptable trade-off. The company did wrap everything very securely and well, and I have utterly no complaints there-that was great, as is the quality of the item.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Havista Dried Wood Ear Mushrooms, White/Black, 2.2 Pound
Review:
I bought this package because it is hard for me to find Asian ingredients locally. The other packages of wood ears cost 67% as much for a quarter the quantity... and we love "fungus" in all forms, so yay for the big bag!

-And it is HUGE.  Now it's also fluffy- the tree ears are not shredded, so take up a lot of space- but compared to other offerings it's a real bargain, and will give us yummy tree ears for many meals. The only trick will be storage, but we're getting food storage buckets.

I am delighted with the quality and the quantity!

Edited to add: Please note that the quantity in the headline is accurate, not the "5 pounds" mentioned in their product description. It is in fact 2.2 pounds. However, the quantity is enough to pretty much fill a 5-gallon food storage bucket; I have no idea what I would have done with twice as much!

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
FISHER Snack Honey Roasted Peanuts, Golden Roast, 14 oz
Review:
These are really good dry roasted peanuts. I usually get players but wanted to try the Fisher brand and was pleased with their flavor and crunch. Planters dry roasted peanuts have a very mild flavor than works as a snack or you can use in desserts since they do not taste very savory. These Fisher dry roasted peanuts are way more savory in a good way that is great as a snack or on salads like This satay salad and such. I would not use these in desserts, you can really taste the paprika and spices, which I really like but you should be aware of.

There was a TON of spice sediment in the hat that I had to sift out to avoid dumping powder in my hand when grabbing a handful for a snack. I will be buying these in the future when this jar is finished, they are very satisfying and great on curry and thai dishes! Get Planters if you are making rocky road fudge or other sweet.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Emerald Nuts Dry Roasted Almonds, 11-Ounce Canisters (Pack of 4)
Review:
I find the flavor of these almonds to be wonderfully savory, the coating is barely covering the nut but really keeps them nice and crunchy.  I think the coating has the same flavor profile as old fashioned dry roasted peanuts, the slightly seasoned ones I remember my grandma always having a jar of.

I guess these are really a love them or leave them type of product; you'll notice the very high or very low star ratings, not one 3 star review when I tasted these.  I think the split is because the almonds do not have the word "seasoned" in the title so people looking for plain almonds feel duped.  I also see that some people are mad about them containing MSG; it is listed clearly in the ingredient list so you can avoid it if you have problems consuming it.  Some people get sick or bad headaches so this is an important thing to be aware of if you are sensitive.

I can see how someone would be put off by any flavor if they were looking for plain; my advice is to always hunt down the ingredient list to any food you are planning to buy without tasting first, especially if ordering in bulk.  I went to the grocery store and got one jar of these to see if I liked them, when these are gone I will be getting these in bulk here on amazon since I paid almost $6 for one jar.  Good flavor, good value.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
YumEarth Organic Lollipops, Assorted Flavors, 5 Pound Bag
Review:
I had morning sickness so bad it lasted all day and for 5.5 months, ugh!  I called it baby flu since there was little relief.  Ginger ale and YummyEarth organic candies were the only two things that settled my stomach enough to eat a small meal.  The assorted bag was nice to switch it up depending on my taste that day.  After I delivered my baby girl, I still enjoyed these when I have a dry mouth or would like a little sweetness.  It was so nice to find a tasty organic hard candy, so much tastier than Preggo Pops!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
YumEarth Organic Lollipops, Assorted Flavors, 5 Pound Bag
Review:
If you need a treat for your toddler that is small and tasty and natural, then these are for you! The flavors taste like fruit, not just chemicals and dyes like other small pops like Dumdums do.  There are a lot in the bag and last a long time in our pantry.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
MacFarms Dry Roasted Macadamia Nuts With Sea Salt Fresh From Hawaii 24 Ounce
Review:
These are the BEST macadamias I have ever had the pleasure of enjoying. They are consistently crunchy, fresh tasting and perfectly salted! I love these straight out of the bag. A small handful is the perfect snack packed with healthy fats and salty crunch, the perfect replacement for chip cravings. The price is right and I will be a lifelong customer!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Newman's Own Organics Pretzels, Salted Sticks, 8-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
A pretzel is a pretzel right?  Wrong.  I was amazed at how these really taste better than any I have had before.  I think these are the best tasting pretzel rods you can get in a supermarket or here on amazon.

The malt really makes a difference in the flavor.

The diameter is perfect for dipping in mustard or eating plain, not too thin and not too thick.

They have an even and sufficient coating of salt.

They arrived undamaged and very fresh with high crunch factor, not at all stale.

Mine were not burned like others have experienced with their orders.

I have 12 bags and am happy to keep a supply in the pantry to put out for guests when they drop by; it makes it very easy to serve good food at a good price by buying in bulk on amazon.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Ritz Crackers, Real Peanut Butter, 1.38 Oz, pack of 8
Review:
Probably not the best snack for you out there, but better than candy or other sugar-filled kid's treat.  My toddlers get a pack of these if we are on a car trip, they make little mess and enjoy them quite a bit.  They don't get a lot of packaged snacks or food on a daily basis, to it is a treat to them to get this kind of snack food.  The crackers are always crisp and the peanut butter is sweet enough to make it taste like a special snack.  I like that they are not colored orange like a lot of PB crackers are, no one needs extra food coloring :P
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co. Chocmeister Hazelnut Spread, Milk Chocolatey, 13 Ounce Jar
Review:
I hate Nutella so I thought I hated Hazelnut spread, nope. Turns out I just hate Nutella because it is so flipping sweet! This hazelnut spread is wonderful and tastes like so much more than just sugar. The cocoa and nuts really dance on your tongue with this one. I stirred it into spice tea one day and it knocked my socks off, tasted just like german Christmas cookies!

This is still a treat, I know plain nut spread is much healthier and this has quite a dollop of sugar in it. But when treated like a sweet occasional indulgence it can really frost a muffin or make french toast extra special :D
Rating:

Review:
well, I loved the stuff.  I really did.  I made pot after pot, day in day out and I was convinced this was the best coffee around.  But the quality has veeeeeeeeeeery verrrrrrrrrrrrrrrry slowly been changing.  Its good coffee, don't get me wrong.  But it's no longer superior coffee.  It has that awful back taste that lesser blends or not so fresh beans have...an ugly bite.  No amount of french roasting will cover the fact that a bad bean is a bad bean.

I can't say it's all bad.  It's just not superior.  I hung in there for a while, even mixing it with an expresso bean to ramp it up.  But all I see is that it makes the other coffee taste weak and bitter.  So the search is on again.

________________previous revue________________
it's got everything:
rich roasted bean aroma before it's ground.
freshness
perfect oil balance (the beans SHINE like little patent leather shoes)
perfect acid balance
a touch of chocolate like flavor
winey

fantastic coffee. Now I'm spoiled rotten.  Had to make do with a lesser (although I used to think the lesser was good coffee but now  pftt!) when I ran out, became miserable and surly without my morning perfect cup.  and this IS the perfect cup of coffee.

if you're a coffee person, get yourself a coffee maker that grinds too, because no point in pregrinding and wrecking the perfection.  if you're gonna do it, do it right.

This didn't do it though. It's an adequate coffee, meaning not terrible and it is fresh, but it's got a back sort of oily/clanky flavor reminding me of supermarket brands, which isn't terrible but not good either.

I always freeze my coffee, taking out what I need for about a week and storing those beans in a container in the frig, so the coffee is always fresh and we use a Cuisinart grind and brew, which makes great coffee.

I would use it again if I had to, but I wouldn't recommend it as Cameron's best nor would I go out of my way to buy it.

Product:
Community Coffee Signature Blend Dark Roast Premium Whole Bean 12 Oz Bag (3 Pack), Full Body Rich Bold Taste, 100% Select Arabica Coffee Beans
Review:
The box arrived on July 22, the date on the coffee bag is Sept 30.  So that doesn't leave much shelf time here.  Thing is, most vacpac coffee has at least a 6 month shelf life, so that is worrisome.

Opened the bag, no smell.  That in itself tells the whole story.  Coffee is aromatic.  You open a bag of bean, particularly french roast bean and you're going to smell coffee, even before you grind it.  It's the nature of the oils on the roasted coffee beans, and it definitely affects the flavor and experience.

no smell.

Brewed up a pot this morning in my cuisinart coffee grinder/brewer:
beans were not consistant in roasting, some darker than others
no aroma when brewing whatsoever
coffee turned out very dark
med chicory like flavor
coffee flavor not strong or rich.

I've been playing with this coffee for a couple of days and after a while it's not terrible.  Compared to a stronger flavored French Roast, it pales.  But on it's own, if this is how you like your coffee, okay.

I can't say if it's the blend of bean or if it's fact that it was roasted a long time ago and it's lost it's strength.  But it lacks a rich coffee flavor.  except it has that mild chicory backtaste going.

so if you want a mild coffee with a hint of chicory, you found it.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Splenda Brown Sugar Blend, 16 Ounce Bag (Pack of 4)
Review:
This is a most excellent sugar substitute for those who watch their sugar intake.

BUT!!! (and this is important because one does tend to follow recipes to a fault) you must use half as much as the recipe calls for, which btw, does not work as well as you'd hope.  It's just not nearly as sweet cup for cup.

I make that up using extra Splenda white because I use brown sugar for it's sweetness as well as the molasses flavor.  This is why I will only give it four stars....because they COULD make it cup for cup by doing what I do and adding more Splenda white so a baker could follow their recipe and not give it a second thought.  Heaven knows they're charging enough for it.

I'm sure you know this:  Brown sugar is unrefined or molasses sugar.  You can make your own brown sugar by adding 1 tablespoon unsulfured molasses to 1 cup cane sugar and mixing it with a fork. It comes out nice and fluffy and you can control how much caramel flavor it has.  (and how much extra sugar too)

Splenda brown sugar blend as it is, is a very coarsely granulated Splenda, a little coarser than Splenda white.  So the texture is better than what you might mix up on your own.  So for convenience, you can't beat Splenda brown sugar blend.  The Splenda brand is superior (in my opinion) to the store brands that are popping up but YMMV, and your store might have a really good version.

Still...and this accounts for a very good four stars you can always count on Splenda, for texture, for flavor and consistency.  When you bake, that counts for a lot in my book.
Rating:
4.0
</similarpairs>

Product:

Review:
I've been buying the Lavazza Tierra - it's an espresso grind, this is a coarser "drip" type grind. It's got a lighter fruitier more acidic flavor when used in the drip coffee maker (one scoop per cup of coffee on the carafe ie. 8 cups on the side, 8 scoops in the filter) I'm liking it much better as a cold brew coffee, it's very smooth in the cold brew (but then most everything is). But I got this very very inexpensively, so I'm not that disappointed, I just can't rate it higher for the price, when people want a review of the taste. :)
Rating:
3.0
Product:
 Lavazza Tierra! 100% Sustainable Ground Coffee, 8-Ounce Cans (Pack of 3) 
Review:
1st cup down, second cup being enjoyed. My can says it expires 5/2011 - I have no idea how far out they set their best used by dates, so I've no idea how long this has been around. However, my first and second cup of coffee were flavorful and NOT bitter or sour. I paid next to nothing for this coffee and would again, but I wouldn't pay the nearly 8 dollars per can it is now when I paid a little more than that for 3 cans. It wasn't a knock your socks off, I can never drink another cup unless it's this cup of joe - but it's smooth, mellow, and enjoyable, especially when I paid next to nothing for it. If I'm going to pay nearly 8 bucks for a 1/2 pound, I'll go up to the local coffee roaster and get it fresh. (oh, normally I don't get my coffee in ground form, I usually grind it myself, but this was soooo inexpensive, I figured I'd give it a try.)

Side note - this is an espresso grind. I had no trouble with it floating or clogging, but I sprinkled it with some cold water to wet the grinds a bit before I started the brewing, that helps keep them from floating up. I also propped open the little spring loaded cover to the coffee basket with a skewer so it was as open as it could get. Result was a clear coffee and no mess. Ratio - one level coffee scoop per cup as measured on the carafe.

edit update 3/29/2011 - I've now had about 9 cans of this coffee - it's my go to coffee, it's still smooth mellow and enjoyable and I've given it an extra star for consistency, it's been good through all those cans, when ever it's on a decent sale (usually on the Friday Sale) I buy it again, just got another 3 cans. I also use it for the rub I put on ribeyes and a rub I made up to put on a pork butt for pulled pork...good stuff!  :)

Oregon Chai Caffeine Free Chai Tea Latte Concentrate 32-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6), Liquid Chai Tea Concentrate, Decaffeinated Spiced Black Tea For Home Use, Café, Food Service
Review:
I've been making my own Chai with Lipton Chai Spice tea (so yummy)and a little honey and a splash or two of half and half. I don't keep milk in the house. Well, I thought I'd try the sugar free concentrate as a quicker way to fix the tea, bought some milk and BLECH...it was so sweet I had to dump it. And it was not spicy. UPDATE 12/23/12 - now make my Chai from the Celestial Seasonings Chai - which blows the Lipton out of the water, in fact, I had forgotten I made it from Lipton till I reread my review. Try the Chai from CS - but it is generally less expensive at Wally world. Yesterday I bought several boxes for 2.48 a box. (vs 2.82 right here on Amazon)

Review:
These remind me of something made out of tapioca...especially the "rice" it's like little balls, not grains of rice. I have rinsed them, boiled them and rinsed them again and had no problem with them, but the texture doesn't bother me, the kind of semi rubbery texture of pearl tapioca. Honestly, I really like them and hope I can find them for less. I used the "rice" the other day in a dish of sausage, onions and peppers with some asparagus all sauteed together, I rinsed the rice and then put them in the microwave and nuked them for 5 minutes, drained and rinsed them again and then dumped them in the sausage veggie mix, they soaked up the pan juices and were delicious. I've enjoyed the noodles in Asian style dishes and with spaghetti. I think I'll use the little "rice" balls in soup. I recommend these. I am only giving them 5 stars because they are obviously not pasta, but for what they are, they are great. :)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Royal Oak Gourmet Jumbo Virginia Salted Peanuts, 40-Ounce Holiday Christmas Tins (Pack of 2) 
Review:
I have a serious nut addiction, granted peanuts aren't really nuts, but if they're crunchy and salty that's pretty much good enough for me. These are both crunchy and salty, they are big and you can see where the oil has bubbled on the surface of some of them. Some of them crunch with a soft crunch like a macadamia and then kind of melt and some of them CRACK and almost shatter in your mouth, some are just plain old peanutty and crunchy...the textures and taste and crunch crunch crunchy goodness make these a delight. Now are they way better than Planters or any other peanut, I honestly couldn't tell you, I don't buy peanuts. I'm generally low carb and eat other more low carb nuts, like pecans, macadamias, almonds, etc...but I bought these on a whim and now they are nearly gone. Five pounds of peanuts in a VERY short period of time, consumed in mass quantities, by the addict. Peanut crack. Buy some, buy them all, keep me from being able to order more...now, to buy some macadamias!

UPDATE: I was going to order more but today on 9/12/13 these peanuts officially cost around 8 dollars more than when I bought them last, less than a year ago. HOLY SMOKES!! What is going on with Peanuts, or is it just Royal Oak, too bad, I was going to order more. :( I can't justify a rise in price of over 25% in less than a year.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
 Royal Oak Gourmet Virginia Cajun Spiced Peanuts, 10-Ounce Tins (Pack of 6) 
Review:
They are just the right mix of crunchy, salty and spicy. They were gone almost before I opened them. Everyone I begrudgingly shared these with, loved them. I want to order more, but addictive wasn't a joke, I can't stop crunching them. I already have a problem with my love of practically all nuts (not so much cashews)so I really consumed these with abandon. If you have more self control than I do, I say, click that "buy with one click" and enjoy these wonderful crunchy delicious peanuts. ...think of me when you're saying "man, she was right!" ...because I'm waiting to order more till I feel a little more in control of the peanutty addiction...or not, I might try the crabby flavored ones! ....mmmm mmmm...  (p.s. they're gourmet salted peanuts are fantastic, too!)
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Celestial Seasonings Ice Cool Brew Tea, Blueberry, Tea Bags, 48-Count Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
Mine has an expiration date of 2 of 2009 - so my tea is quite fresh. The peach tea has an expiration of 2010. This blueberry tea is phenomenal. It tastes like blueberries and smells divine. It's easy to brew, I throw 8 bags in a half gallon container - put it in the fridge and there it is in the morning. I know you can make it quicker (and I have) but I like the more intense blueberry flavor from letting it sit. My adult kids love it to. I gave this tea to everyone, I loved it so much I wanted to share, now I need to order more! :D  My daughter likes to throw a handful of frozen blueberries in her tea and, boy oh boy, is that great! I wish there were more than 5 stars for this tea, since just opening the box and smelling the tea makes me smile!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Blue Diamond Homestyle Almond Butter, Creamy, 12-Ounce Jars (Pack of 3)
Review:
I am a self described nut addict, I cannot buy a can of nuts or a jar of nut butter and not consume them in short order. I bought this because of the price at the time and the fact it was much lower in sugar and carbs than peanut butter. That being said, it seemed sort of tasteless to me, I liked the texture, but it needs a little salt or something. I will still order it when it becomes available again because I put it in my low carb shakes, almonds butter and almond milk, some ice, some sugar free chocolate syrup...pretty tasty. Of course, my complaint about the saltiness is because I ate a lot of it right out of the jar...I told you I was an addict, if you don't do that, it might be just fine. :)
Rating:
3.0

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
 Arrowhead Mills Organic Hot Cereal, Steel Cut Oats, 24-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 4)
Review:
We've been experimenting with various oatmeals and this one, hands down, is the best we've found.  It's nutty, chewy and tastes good.  I don't even add salt.

One caveat is to let it cook for longer than the package calls for, and add a bit more water.  After 20 minutes, it's still pretty soupy, but 30 minutes gives the perfect texture. For two servings, I use 1/2 cup oats to 1 1/2 cups of water, bring to a boil, cover, reduce the heat and cook for 30 minutes.  I usually add one T of brown sugar and a handful of dried blueberries, dried cranberries or raisins to the water before cooking.  The moisture plumps the dried fruit beautifully and the sugar adds just a hint of sweetness. Slosh on some low fat milk and it's good to go.  This is the perfect breakfast food!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Marlo's Bakeshop Gluten-Free Soft-Baked Biscotti, Banana Bread, 5 Ounce
Review:
While there's definitely some banana bread flavor in these biscotti, they aren't wonderful.  They don't have the density of true biscotti, and they're very crumbly.  The one I just ate tasted like a slice of dry, almost stale banana bread made from a mix.

If you are on a gluten free diet, they might be satisfying bits of sweet, but speaking as a dedicated cookie eater, I'm not a fan of these.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Bob's Red Mill Organic Grain Quinoa, 26 Ounce Packages (Pack of 4)
Review:
Quinoa is the most user-friendly grain I've ever found.  It cooks in the same amount of time and same liquid to solid ratio as white rice, but it has a flavor and a little crunch that's not as bland as rice.  Cook it in water or broth; add some sauteed onion and garlic or some ratatouille and it's a wonderful quick lunch.  Serve it as a bed for salmon or chicken and it's an equally delicious and fast dinner.

Bob's Red Mill Quinoa is my first experience with this ancient grain, and I'll be a fan for life.  Although I've read that quinoa should be washed before cooking to eliminate a bitter flavor, I've not had to do that with this brand.  It does have a bitey quality, but I happen to like it.  Even my meat and potatoes husband likes quinoa!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Juicy Fruit Starburst Strawberry Sugarfree Gum, 15 piece,10 Count
Review:
I love Starbursts.  Juicy Fruit Starburst Gum has exactly the same sweet/tart flavor as the candy, but it lasts longer.  While not an habitual gum chewed, I do like a little afternoon pick me up, and this gum is just the ticket.  It's delicious.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Jeremiah's Pick Coffee Kona Blend, Whole Bean Coffee, 5-Pound Bag
Review:
We really liked Jeremiah's Pick Fogbusters coffee in the five pound whole bean package, so I ordered this one for a bit of variety.  We're SO pleased!

Yes, it's a blend (what did you expect for the price?), but the mellow smoothness of the Kona really comes through and makes for an outstanding pot of coffee.  Without the almost-bitter notes of the Fogbuster, this Kona blend is complex, rich and delicious.

For a 12 cup drip coffeemaker, I use two and a quarter coffee scoops of the beans and grind for 15 seconds.  It's perfect, and way better than Maxwell House or Folgers.  Highly recommended!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Peanut Butter & Co. Chocmeister Hazelnut Spread, Milk Chocolatey, 13 Ounce Jar
Review:
I could sit down with this jar and a spoon and eat the whole thing.  It's delicious.  I love the combination of hazelnuts and dark chocolate, and the back off on sugar is exactly to my taste.  The dark grittiness of the cocoa comes through, the hazelnut gives it richness, and it's not overpoweringly sweet.

By no means is this stuff good for you!  A serving size is two tablespoons at 200 calories with half of those from fat.  Maybe it does have bumped up protein, but I still got sugar jitters from the spoonful I couldn't keep myself from devouring right out of the box it arrived in,  This won't be a breakfast spread for me, but I'm going in search of some coconut macaroons to serve as its vehicle for a totally decadent Sunday afternoon snack.

I'm rating it in terms of its flavor, not for its implied healthiness.  That is simply misleading.  This is a fat laden sweet treat, and I love it!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Indus Organic Authentic Indian Curry Powder Spice (Medium Hot), 8 Oz, Salt Free, Freshly Packed
Review:
Through years of trial and error, I've learned I don't like curries with cinnamon, allspice, and nutmeg.  They give dishes a dessert-y dimension I find unpleasant.  I've been searching for the perfect blend and this is it!  It's hot, curry-ish and delicious.  I've experimented with using it in salad dressing, chicken salad, and deviled eggs and it's the perfect blend for my taste.  There's no aftertaste and no funky cookie flavor.

My only quibble is the "mild" description.  This curry is quite spicy, and I love it.  Though it's branded as Authentic Indian Curry Powder, this would make a great base for Chinese, Japanese and Jamaican curries as well.

Since my primary interest is flavor, I'm not that much concerned with organic spices, but I do appreciate that it's salt free, which makes it versatile.  I'm very pleased. It's everything I was looking for.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
HERSHEY'S KISSES Chocolate Candy, Pink Foils, 4.1 Pounds Bulk Candy
Review:
While these gold foil wrapped Kisses will make an elegant and tasty addition to holiday or wedding tables, the real gold is in the little bits of almond stuffed deliciousness inside.  I've never met anyone who didn't love Hershey's Kisses in all their guises, and the almond iteration is my favorite.

A dish of these on a dining table sparkles in candlelight, as do the eyes of guests who exclaim, "Ooooh, KISSES!"  This 66.7 oz bag will allow you to be as generous as you want to, and still have some in reserve as a reward for being a gracious host.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
CAILLER Praliné Chocolate Selection, Small Box Assortment, 4.8 Ounce, (16 Pieces)
Review:
I'd intended to hoard this little box of heaven, rationing its delights one piece at a time.  I did succeed in making it last for three days, but only by hiding it behind a bag of spinach in the fridge.

These pralines are simply wonderful.  Cailler provides a little booklet so you know what you're biting into, but it doesn't matter, they're all splendid.  What a great gift this would be!

The pralines come beautifully and securely packaged for shipping, as well as gift giving.  This vompany knows what it's doing.  Id never heard of the brand before, but for quality and taste, its right up there with Godiva.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Frontier Seasoning Organic, Tagine, 1.9 Ounce
Review:
I love trying new cuisines, and have eyed Moroccan fare for a long time.  The spice lists were always daunting, especially for a time-challenged cook.  I ordered this seasoning in the hopes I wouldn't have to measure countless quarter and half teaspoons, not to mention pinches, of half the contents of my spice cupboard,

I just made a Chicken Tagine using only 1.5 T of this Frontier Seasoning, and 1.5 T of paprika, plus a little Harissa paste.  OMG.  It's amazing!  The aroma from my kitchen is unbelievable, and the taste is outstanding.  I have no idea if it's authentic, but I don't care.

I did preserve some lemons a month or so ago (the process took all of seven minutes), and I do think some of the deliciousness can be attributed to the addition of that lovely, lovely condiment, but this Frontier blend is almost, but not quite a curry, and is absolutely brilliant with slow cooked tagine dishes.  Yum, yum, oh yum!

I'm so getting this on my automatically delivered Amazon list.  I don't to ever want to be without it!
Rating:
5.0
</similarpairs>

prompt.content:
You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style.
First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style:
<similarpairs>
Product:
Stouffer's, Meatloaf, 16 oz (Frozen)
Review:
We like this size of the Stouffer's Meatloaf. It's "okay" and we "like it" is the best we can say about the meatloaf. The mashed potatoes suck. I chuck those and make my own (Honest Earth instant is WAY better than this quickie mashie in this meal). I add a salad or sauteed veggies, and divide the two loaves: a meal for two pretty fast.

I hate molding/dealing with raw meat, so when I get a meatloaf craving, I go to Boston Market or I keep this in the fridge. This 16 oz size is fine for two if you add sides. (Trust me, the mashed potatoes are not worth the calories, and you're better off making your own or baking a couple taters or just having some veggies and crusty bread on the side.)
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Explore Cuisine Fettuccini, Organic Edamame & Mung Bean, 8 Oz (Pack Of 6)
Review:
First off, if you like a bit of an earthy taste to your noodles, this will work fine for you. If you are expecting it to be like wheat or rice or corn pasta--not so much.

I liked the simplicity of ingredients (mung beans + water) and the very high fiber (11 grams per serving), plus lower carb and higher protein than regular grain pastas. I figured I'd take a risk. Know what? I like these.

Because some reviewers had used the term earthy--rightfully so--I boiled up a batch (raw vegans can just soak them for a day). I sauteed artichoke hearts and fresh mushrooms in EVOO and garlic, then just tossed in these noodles and added parmesan. Very nice. I enjoyed them a whole lot. I cooked them till they were al denter and I like the chewiness of the texture.  I will be trying these with pesto and red pepper sauce, too.

A very pleasant surprise. I like em. I won't say they are like real pasta. They are simply a different sort of noodle for folks who enjoy that, and I do.

If you aren't sure if it's for you, just order ONE from some vendor. Don't buy this huge quantity.

Oh, you can eat these raw as a snack with a dip. My sister and I tried them raw before I cooked up some. We both agreed they were kinda interesting uncooked--crunchy. They might work fine for folks who can digest these okay raw.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Special K Crustless Quiche (Ham & Cheese), 7 Oz (Frozen)
Review:
Really yummy. Smallish size, add toast and fruit or make a sandwich out of it. I sometimes, if tired, have this with sliced tomatoes and a fruit smoothie for dinner. I like this one a bit more than the portabella one, but I have to say the ease of this frozen breakfast item is terrific. A couple mins in the microwave and DONE. I hope they make more flavors. However, they really need to rethink the price. For how tiny these quiche "patties" are, five bucks plus for 2 of them is insane. I'd say these should cost in the neighborhood of 3.00 for the box, certainly no more than 4.00. $5.19 is a bit nuts and is the only impediment to my buying more quantities.

Update: I've been making breakfast sandwiches for days with this (had to order more). Ezekiel bread, toasted, slice of cheese melted onto toast, one slice of Virginia ham. That's 8 grams of fiber for the sandwich,  about 400 cals, very filling and delicious.  (Tomato and fruit on the side). I gotta keep this one stocked.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Lean Cuisine, Craveables, Margherita Pizza, 6 oz (Frozen)
Review:
If it's a choice between no pizza or this lower calorie pizza: skip pizza.

The crust is gross. The toppings skimpy (as one expects in lower calorie). The flavor missing. This is a failure of a pizza.
You're better off buying pizza sauce with good flavor and low-fat cheese and getting a pita and making a pita pizza in the oven, adding toppings.

To make this one bearable I added garlic, mushrooms, and extra cheese. I also baked it a while in the oven to try and improve the crust. It helped marginally, but this pizza is so awful, that even with all those additions, it was unsatisfactory.

Nope. Can't recommend this.
Rating:
2.0

Lean Cuisine Favorites Swedish Meatballs - Frozen Meal with 16g of Protein and No Artificial Flavors, Delicious Frozen Meal, Ready in Minutes (9.125 oz.)
Review:
The meatballs are absolutely vile. I threw them out and just scooped out some of the noodles and sauce. The meat tastes horrible. I was thinking, "Is this dog food? This can't be meatballs for humans!"

I do not get the good reviews. Unless I got the bad batch of all batches, this is some seriously nasty meat in them there meatballs. And the sauce was bland. Salty, but bland.

Will never rebuy!!!

Please, Amazon Fresh, get some good frozen homestyle meatballs we can heat up at home. I've bought good beef and also chicken meatballs, frozen, at Whole Foods. You must have access now that you bought them out.

1.0

BariWise High Protein Powder Hot Drink/Instant Low-Carb Cappuccino Mix (15g Protein) – Vanilla (7 Servings/Box) - Low Calorie, Low Carb, Low Fat, Aspartame Free
Review:
I saw all the good reviews, and I find the hot chocolate by Bariwise drinkable for a protein shot. So, I dediced to try this.

OMG< sickeningly sweet and altogether gross. I can't drink this. I tried to guzzle it down, but I got to 1/2 the cup and just ditched it. I tried it in a cup of coffee, so see if real coffee mixed with it improved things. Um, no.

Not something I ever want to drink again. I'm glad there are folks who find this yummy for protein ingestion. I'm not one of them.
Rating:
2.0

Frigo, Mozzarella Cheese, 16 oz
Review:
I've bought all sorts of mozarella-fresh, logs, etc. This one was odd. Incredibly dense and hard to cut and the flavor just didn't wow me. Did not like it. I like their parmesan, but I won't rebuy this one. The texture was weird.
Rating:
2.0
Product:
Golden Malted Pancake & Waffle Flour, Original, 16-Ounce Cans (Pack of 6)
Review:
I'm a super lazy cook, and so I don't feel like making mixes from scratch. (I tried, and it didn't taste as good as this, anyhow.)  Although another reviewer complained about the vanilla "fakey" smell, we love it. I love how the house smells when I make these (or when we reheat frozen ones I make from this mix.)

I like the flavor, even if it's kinda bland (other reviewers touched on this). The texture is nice. It freezes great for reheating through the week, so I make one big batch that covers several breakfasts for me and hubby.

This is a solid, good product, and I've ordered it more than once from amazon. Note that it will be good for about a year, so if you don't think you'll go through all these cans in that time, you may want to skip the amazon purchase and get one or two at a time. I find that three cans takes me fine through a year, as we don't eat waffles every day/week, and I don't use this for pancakes, as we like Heidi's Grainy Day for that. (Also available here at amazon).

Thumbs up.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Namaste Foods, Gluten Free Say Cheez Non-Dairy Macaroni & Cheez Dinner 9-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
I gave up gluten more than a year and a half ago. But I'm a girl who has always loved the pasta/cheese combo, and as a kid and adult, was one of those addicted to Kraft Mac n cheese, Amy's, any mac n cheese, really. :) I've been using gluten free Tinkyada pasta and just adding cheeses.

I decided to try this, as it's dairy free. And it's fine. The pasta is fine. The spices packet is fine. And it makes a nice side dish. However, it's not mac-n-cheesy enough to satisfy that. Even having "Cheez" on the product name makes one expect cheeziness. Don't expect that and you'll be happier. :D

What I will say is that the amount of oil they recommend ended up in a way too greasy outcome. I used coconut oil, and while the flavor was fine, I found it too oily, so cutting back is recommended for those who don't want greasy noodles.

I'll also add that since this is mostly pasta and some spices, the price point is ridiculous, even with subscribe and save. Quite frankly, we'd be better off buying a good quality gluten free pasta and just mixing together the onion and paprika and other spices with oil and making our own. Yes, this makes it all-in-one convenient, but paying more than $4 bucks a bag for pasta and some spices kinda irks when it's not even organic.

However, this is from a dedicated facility and definitely gluten free, and that's a plus.

So, as long as you think of this as a spiced pasta side dish, you should  be happy. If you want cheezy, then get some cheez item (like Daiya shreds) or cheese (the real stuff), and add it for cheezy/cheesy happiness. Or, really, just mix/make your own and save moolah.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
 Schr Gluten Free Penne, 12 oz. Box, 5-Pack 
Review:
For those of us who go GF (out of need or preference), this is a decent replacement choice for regular penne. Nothing is as good as regular pasta--the texture--but this is fine. I cook it a bit longer than they recommend, but as anything, do to your own taste.

I also use the Tinkyada and that one's fine. If you don't want millet or corn, the Tinkyada is just made from brown rice. Some folks are sensitive to corn or have issues with millet.

But if you don't have sensitivities, this works fine in baked penne or regular boiled up with sauce. It's a small amount in the box for a higher than normal pasta price, but it seems everything GF costs more. I don't know why? Corn and rice are hardly race food commodities. Make me think GF folks are always getting slightly ripped off. But I like several Schar products, including this one.
Rating:
4.0

Product:
Simple Mills Almond Flour Mix, Chocolate Chip Cookie, Naturally Gluten Free, 9.4 oz
Review:
We do not have a gluten free diet at all but I was intrigued to try this because we do like banana bread.  As a test, I did not tell my family it was made without wheat flour to see if they would notice.

The directions are simple and easy and I had it mixed up in a matter of minutes.  Into a muffin tin and baked for the amount of time specified on the packet and when i opened the oven, they looked perfect.  I pulled a couple out of the tin to serve my husband hot, with a dollop of butter and after he'd had them (a treat because I rarely bake), he stated that he could live on banana muffins and butter.  Only then did I tell him he flour is almond flour rather than wheat.  He had not been able to tell a difference and obviously, thoroughly enjoyed them.

I have had them both hot and cold.  I did enjoy them hot more but even cold they are pretty good.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Nutiva Organic Chips, Coconut, 1 Pound, 16 Ounce
Review:
At last I've found it - unsweetened coconut!  I wanted to make a paleo dish for a family member who has found it helped his RA, and the recipe called for coconut but when I went to the store, all they had was sweetened.  And really - isn't coconut sweet enough already?  Then I found these chips and voila!  I was able to make the dish so that my relative could eat it, it is healthier for all of us, and truly just delicious.

Review:

Review:
The sampler pack provides a generous amount of pancake mix of multiple varieties and I like them all.  It is refreshing to find a pancake mix that uses whole grains instead of processed flour, and that includes quality ingredients all the way through.  I would have to say I preferred the plain variety the best - I'm not much for flavored pancakes - but I feel I'm alone in this since the chocolate was the preferred mix with the kids.  And the blueberry was my husband's favorite.  Needless to say, we were all able to find a mix that we enjoyed.

Snikiddy All Natural Baked Fries, Cheddar Cheese, 4.5-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12)
Review:
I was actually impressed with this snack, and I don't say that about many snack items.  For starters, the ingredients are actually GOOD.  Although there are rather a lot of them, the first few are cornmeal, potato flakes and sunflower oil, followed by seasonings.  I can't complain about any of those.

On biting into the snacks they are very light and airy.  You can eat a lot of them without spoiling dinner (on the flip side, if you were eating them because you were hungry, they wouldn't fill you up very fast either).  The best part is since they are baked, they don't leave a lot of oily residue on the fingers.

I personally didn't care for the shape of them.  They are roughly like a dehydrated version of a McDonalds French Fry and I would have preferred a different shape that wasn't so fiddly.  But I'm not deducting any stars for that since the taste and how good they are for you are the primary reasons I would buy them again.

I had read about how fresh and juicy the dried fruit from the Peeled Snacks line is, but I can't say I can tell a difference from any other dried fruit I've tasted.  For the price, I probably wouldn't buy this again.

Buzz and Bloom Honey Creamy Spread is a great addition to my pantry. I was looking for a sweetener that was not only delicious, but also had some nutritional value.
