prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Torani Vanilla Syrup 12.7 ounce Review: Torani makes a nice flavorful syrup, but the cherry is a bit tart. I prefer DaVinci Classic Cherry Syrup (DaVinci Gourmet Classic Syrup, Cherry, 25.4-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 3)). Both are made with cane sugar (and NO corn syrup of any kind.) I find DaVinci's more flavorful, even though they use artificial and natural flavors. Torani only uses "natural" flavorings. Try two ounces (1/4 cup) syrup in a 12-ounce glass. Add ice and fill with cold seltzer (not club soda.) Mix well and you have a great tasting soda (at about half the calories of a 12-ounce can of commercial soda pop.) Rating: 3.0 Product: Swiss Miss Hot Cocoa Mix, Sensible Sweets, Light, 8 count,0.29 ounce, (Pack of 6) Review: Swiss Miss diet hot cocoa mix is very tasty. The only problem is it is sweetened with sucralose (Splenda). For many people, sucralose causes gastrointestinal difficulties (bloating, flatulence, cramps.) If you are not affected by sucralose, you should try Swiss Miss - there is nothing diet about the flavor. Rating: 3.0 Product: HERSHEY'S Baking Cocoa, SPECIAL DARK Hot Cocoa, 8 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: This is cocoa. It is not chocolate, it is a component of chocolate. You need to learn to work with cocoa to achieve maximum enjoyment. Cocoa is bitter and a bit gritty. How you proceed depends on your desired results. Hot Chocolate is a good place to start. If you like the packets, then you want sweet and creamy. About 2 1/3 to 1 ratio of sugar to cocoa is about right. Try 2 tablespoons plus one teaspoon of sugar mixed with one level tablespoon of cocoa. One cup of hot (NOT boiling) milk and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract, plus a dash of salt. Mix well in a mug and enjoy. Hershey's is a good cocoa and a good value in this offering. Cocoa can also be used in baking (brownies, chocolate/devil's food/mocha cake, for example,) and chocolate or fudge confections and candies. Rating: 4.0 Product: Barilla Pronto Pasta, Half-Cut Linguine, 12 Ounce (Pack of 16) Review: Barilla Pronto is a new, interesting take on pasta. Use cold water, just enough to cover the pasta. Turn on the stove and allow the water to be absorbed. Just like steamed rice. No draining. Add sauce in the same pan and done. Voila! Quick-prep pasta al-dente. A great concept and quite the time saver. The package directions assume you are preparing one whole box. If you want a different amount of pasta, you need to visit the Barilla web site for alternate instructions. A chart on the box would be more convenient and useful. From box to sauce-ready in just 10 minutes. Quick, convenient and tasty. Rating: 4.0 Product: HERSHEY'S Kisses Chocolate Candy, Baby Shower Pink"It's A Girl", 7 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: If you are traditional, (boys=blue, girls=pink) Hershey's has a treat for you. Milk chocolate Kisses, wrapped in pink or blue foil. The same Kisses that have been satisfying your chocolate cravings for decades, now in lovely wrappers to highlight your buffet table or gift bags. They are small enough to indulge every once in a while, yet big enough to enjoy their chocolate goodness. Rich, sweet and affordable; the three pound bag is ideal for parties (or if you're feeling REALLY depressed.) The light pink and blue colors are also great for Easter and other festive occasions, not just your baby parties. (However, the "flags" say "It's a boy/It's a girl", so they may not be appropriate for other parties, but when you need chocolate, do you really care?) Rating: 4.0 Product: Kellogg's Nutri-Grain, Soft Baked Breakfast Bars, Assorted Pack, 1.3oz (48 count) Review: Nutri-Grain cereal bars are tasty snacks that are not totally devoid of nutritional value. They consist of grains and fruit pures. The package contains three flavors: Apple-cinnamon, Blueberry and Strawberry. The bars are flavorful, but the texture is off-putting.. It's like a cookie baked with insufficient shortening; crumbles and falls apart; no body. Nice try Nutri-Grain, you got the filling right, now let's see what you can do with the shell... Rating: 3.0 Product: Dubble Bubble 380 Count Tub - Fruitastic Flavors, 3LBS 12.3 OZ (1.71 KG) Review: What ever happened to the bubble gum of old? If you expect to find it here, you will be disappointed. Bubble gum used to be a penny a piece. The penny piece was also a decent sized piece. Now, the price has jumped and the size did shrink. This is not the same Dubble Bubble gum any more. The flavor is nice, for a few seconds. Then, nothing. The pieces are also too small to blow bubbles. You need to chew two to three pieces to get a decent bubble. Maybe I should look for Bazooka Joe? (Or is he too, just a distant memory?) Rating: 2.0 Product: Eight O'Clock Coffee, Hazelnut Whole Bean, 11-Ounce Bags (Pack of 4) Review: Why is whole-bean more expensive than ground? I don't understand. The packages are the same weight & same number of bags per shipment. Someone is not paying attention, I guess. Oh well, business as usual. The coffee is OK. Nothing spectacular. For a better hazelnut flavor coffee at a better price, try Coffee Bean Direct Hazelnut coffee, also available here on Amazon in 5-pound bags. Rating: 3.0 Product: Coffee Bean Direct Hazelnut Flavored, Whole Bean Coffee, 5-Pound Bag Review: Finally, an affordable flavored coffee worth drinking. Coffee Bean Direct Hazelnut is a really smooth, medium roast coffee with a definite hazelnut flavor. The flavoring is not sweetened, which is a real plus, especially if you don't like sweeteners in your coffee. (If you do, you have complete control yourself.) The flavor is not overpowering, but is enough to let you know you are drinking a hazelnut coffee. Those who have complained may have received a bad batch. Usually the blend is good and roasting consistant, but, as with any other food product, variations and accidents do happen. I have been using Coffee Bean Direct coffee for about five years and have not yet received a bad batch. This one is a winner. Rating: 4.0 Product: World Kitchens Hot & Spicy Beef Jerky, 12-Ounce Bags (Pack of 2) Review: World Kitchens beef jerky is world class. Moist, tender, a bit sweet, a bit savory. The brown sugar is a nice flavor touch. Just what you want in a desicated meat snack. Totally delicious. I think much better than Jack Links. Rating: 4.0 Now you will receive features shedding light into how you use words and formulate sentences: -Most frequently used words of the writer is: ['coffee', 'flavor', 'chocolate', 'good', 'great', 'one', 'sugar', 'also', 'ginger', 'like'] Finally, you will receive product-review pairs from other customers to help you distinguish your style from others. Product: Bonne Maman Strawberry Preserves, 13-Ounce Jars (Pack of 6) Review: Because I found Bonne Maman Cherry Preserves incredibly good, I had no hesitation when it came to purchasing the strawberry. I can only say I am disappointed by the product and hope my experience may be an aberration. Unlike most of the commercially available products, the flavor of these preserves is excellent. It is natural and does not taste as if the flavor was enhanced during processing. However, the consistency of the preserves reminds me of rubber cement - it is gluey and does not spread easily. Fortunately, I use a lot of preserves on each bagel piece, so this gave me an excuse to pile it on. I thought it might be that the jar I purchased was getting toward the end of its shelf life, but it still had 15 months until the pull date. Further, the jar I opened first had whole strawberries through it, rather than smaller pieces. While this may be considered desirable, I like to be able to apread the preserves and not just glop on chunks of berry. I enjoyed the Cherry Preserves immensely, but I think there are all-natural strawberry preserve products on the market that are better than Bonne Maman Strawberry Preserves. In fact, one of the big box stores has its own organic strawberry preserves available in a quart jar; these have the same outstanding flavor of the Bonne Maman, but are not rubbery and the strawberries have been crushed rather than processed as whole berries. I believe the cost is about $7 for that product. Rating: 3.0 Using the features, generate the proper review. If you haven't received some of the features, only make use of the provided ones. prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Amazon Brand - Happy Belly Italian Roast Decaf Organic Fairtrade Coffee, Dark Roast, Whole Bean, 12 ounce Review: Deep Dark french roast, perfect to blend or have alone. Indeed we had a happy belly yesterday morning after sipping this. Rating: 5.0 Product: Community Coffee Ground Coffee, Cafe Special, (Pack of 3) Review: We drink a lot of coffee in our house, its an integral part of our morning ritual together. I usually make the coffee, he fixes it the way we love it, and we share it together. We love flavored, mochas, lattes, chilled, espresso, we even love it in ice cream form. I cannot imagine a day without it. I have never had Community brand coffee. The opportunity to try a new kind, I jumped on it. Community has a few different blends, Cafe Special is described as "Medium/dark roast,hearty aroma, low to medium acidity, full body, smooth and nutty. Sounds yummy to me! Community is 100% Arabica coffee beans, which when I looked them up are high quality, less bitter beans. Brewed this right up, smells amazing...like the comfiest bed in the universe, with creamy pillows and silk sheets. Tasted very smooth, not bitter at all. It blended well with the flavored coffee we have, and we also brewed it with a touch of cinnamon. I would buy this brand again for sure, is there such a thing as bad coffee? yes, this isn't one of em. Rating: 5.0 Product: Kashi TLC Crackers, Fire Roasted Vegetable, 9-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6) Review: This is what health food tastes like, when people who are scared of health food think about eating health food. Dry, almost stale. Tasteless with no seasonings. Fire roasted? well actually some of these had burnt ends but I do not think that is what they meant. Vegetables! where? Zesty! in what bland world are these zesty? The only way these might be good is if you dipped them into the best most creamiest decadent dip and knew that dip would mask anything these crackers had to offer. Rating: 1.0 Product: Manitoba Harvest Hemp Heart Snack Bars, Chocolate, 12 Count Review: Hemp...its not just to make hideous pants and shirts out of anymore, and really ugly a$$ bracelets!! You can eat it! I know right? so weird. What is a hemp heart? well the hard outer shell of the hemp seed is removed mechanically leaving just a soft, creamy and nutty hemp heart. They are a super-food, but with no spandex or CGI. They contain 33 percent plant protein, 9 percent Omega-3 , Iron, vitamin E, and GLA ((gamma-linolenic acid) Manitoba Harvest Hemp Heart Protein Bars Apple Cinnamon (say that 3 times) only deserve such a long name if they taste good. and they DO!!! okay at first the texture was a bit strange, chewy like, but then I noticed that it was very moist, sweet, and tasted to me like apple cinnamon oatmeal. I really like them. I am most vegetarian and finding protein bars I like is a chore, these are a good source and I would love to try other flavors. Rating: 4.0 Product: goodnessKNOWS Cranberry, Almond & Dark Chocolate Gluten Free Snack Square Bars 18-Count Box Review: Goodness Knows, has created a snack bar that satisfies both my chocolate craving, and my need for a natural healthy alternative. Rating: 5.0 Product: Original Gourmet Lollipops, Original and Cream Swirl Medley, 60 Count Review: this...is a starter kit? I would hate to see the real kit! I do not know how anyone could get through these quickly!! I love lollipops, when I was a kid my favorite were the lifesavers and the tootsie pops....but those only came in certain flavors and my adult palette wanted more gourmet. These fit that want! 60 lollipops in so many flavors, including mystery flavor..which isn't such a mystery when you can compare to the other ones! These also last forever, one lollipop....is like hours of sucking and licking. Its a girls dream come true! In the bag I had these flavors: Juicy grape. strawberry banana. orange splash. pink lemonade. bubble gum. watermelon. banana split. orange creamsicle. strawberry shortcake. mocha latte. pomegranate berry. candy apple. root beer float. pina colada. blue raspberry. wild cherry. cotton candy. cherry cheesecake. blueberries and cream. I would think these would be awesome for a road trip, to have at an office front desk, to bribe your children, to tease your lovers! Rating: 4.0 Product: got milk? Crunchy Granola Cereal, Cranberry with Almonds and Flaxseeds, 12 Ounce Review: Am I supposed to put this in the fridge? Ha, that was my first question after receiving this. got milk? is a certified Organic Granola cereal, that you eat with milk of course! but I was naughty and tried it without at first. hee. I then got milk, and it was even better. It was crunchy, hearty, not too sweet, not too big of chunks where you scrape the roof of your mouth and a little tiny bowl filled me up so quickly. This is a perfect breakfast for anyone. Rating: 4.0 Product: Chex Snack Mix Bold Party Blend, 8.75-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12) Review: I love chex mix. Its got more variety going for it than plain chips, and you can easily snack on it in the car, home, or quietly in an office meeting. The BOLD flavor of chex mix is in my top 3 favorites. On the bag it has a bottle of worcestershire, onions and garlic as the flavor profile, I can definitely taste those in this. Its not supposed to be so bold that you cannot enjoy the vehicle the flavors on are on like the pretzel, or chex, or those pumpernickel amazingness. I like to MIX my chex mix together. I combine BOLD with the Chex Mix Chex Snack Mix - Honey Nut, 8.75-Ounce Bags (Pack of 12) you should really try it, its delicious! Rating: 5.0 Product: Food Should Taste Good, Tortilla Chips, Multigrain Bean Chips, Pinto Bean, 5.5 oz (Pack of 12) Review: Pinto Bean Chips, as in the beans that I use to make chili, or just put with rice when I am broke..those beans? wow. Food Should Taste Good...I freakin agree with this brand. Clever name, lets see if it lives up to that lofty promise. Nice size chip, but not kind of thin...so not a dip chip. Not very crunchy, more like...crumbly crunchy. First taste is salt, followed by a bit of oily flavor. I can taste the stone ground corn, not very beany...there is an aftertaste of bean though. These would be good with hummus, if they can hold up to it. After a few, the salt is major..and I like that but some people would not...especially the twig and berry health nuts. I love that it has Quinoa, and brown rice flour. Its gluten free, all natural, vegan, no msg, o rans fats and no artificial colors or preservatives. I do feel like these are light and perfect for someone with a chip need. Food should taste good..these do! Rating: 3.0 Product: Cascadian Farm Organic Oats and Chocolate Soft Baked Squares, 7.44 Ounce Review: I love Blueberry anything. I always need a snack to put into my backpack to eat as a snack on the run. I thought these soft baked bars would do the trick, they were okay. Tasty for sure, blueberries and all, oatmealy. But they were super soft, like crumble into nothing barely a touch and I had a bag of crumbs. I really love that they are Organic, healthy and taste good, so a bag full of that is a good thing I suppose. Product: Brooklyn Beans Corner Donut Shop Coffee Pods for Keurig K Cups Coffee Maker, 40 Count Rating: 5.0 Review:

golds.output: I really like the Amoretti Sweet Corn Extract.  The flavor is pure and intense, and I love that it's free from artificial additives.  As a diabetic, I'm always on the lookout for products that can add flavor to my dishes without adding sugar, and this extract fits the bill.  I've used it to make delicious corn fritters and cornbread, and it's also great as a topping for yogurt or oatmeal.  My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is that the bottle is a bit small for the price, but overall I'm very happy with this product.

prompt.content: You are an Amazon customer that likes to write reviews for products. You will be provided a set of features to help you understand your writing style. First feature you will receive is similar product-review pairs from your past reviews to remind you of your style: Product: Stevita Liquid Squeeze Bottle Sweetener, Chocolate, 1.35 Ounce Review: I love peach flavor, but have had trouble finding a stevia that gives that extra punch to a peach cobbler. This has a really authentic peach taste along with sweetness and is an excellent ingredient for peach tea, peach smoothies, cobblers or pies, or even simple peaches-and-cream. Yummy! :-) Rating: 5.0 Product: Frontier Organic Vanilla Flavoring, 4 Ounce Review: I hated this. There was nothing about it that tasted even remotely like vanilla. Rating: 1.0 Product: Dante Confections 98% Cocoa Stevia Chocolate Bars, 4 Count, Sugar-Free Review: Let's face it. Chocolate, all by itself is bitter. And Stevia is super sweet and also bitter. So the combination of these two ingredients creates an intense DARK CHOCOLATE that is very bitter-sweet. Not a product for beginners, but very good for those who are accustomed to and appreciate the bitter notes of true chocolate and the super bittersweet flavor of stevia. Chocolate has the potential to be a healthy superfood when it is consumed correctly - meaning that sugar and milk are not a part of the mix. When chocolate candy is created, sugar and milk are added to tone down the bitterness of the chocolate. But when people struggle with health issues, sugar is sometimes not an option, and often milk is also not an option. Furthermore, milk negates the health benefits of chocolate. According to the University of Michigan Health System, "Milk binds to antioxidants in chocolate making them unavailable; therefore, milk chocolate is not a good antioxidant source. To get the benefits of antioxidants, avoid drinking milk with dark chocolate." (I would cite my source but Amazon doesn't allow links in their reviews. Just google the terms, dairy and chocolate antioxidants, and the very first article should be the one I am referring to.) In other words, to get the health benefits of chocolate, you must consume it without sugar and without dairy. I really like the simplicity of the Dante's ingredient list: Chocolate Liqueur, Stevia, Pure Vanilla. 98% Cocoa. And as a diabetic, I am in love with the fact that there is no sugar in the mix. With this kind of list, the bitter taste is impossible to avoid. So - if you hate bitter, then don't try this. But if you like a simple, healthy, exotic and sophisticated dessert, then this might just be right up your alley. You must also understand that this in not a low calorie food. Even without sugar, there are still 260 calories per 45 gram bar AND 12 grams of carbohydrate. Most of the calories in the Dante bar come from chocolate's high quality fat. Compare to a Hershey's Special Dark Chocolate bar which is 190 calories per 41 gram bar and 25 grams of carbohydrate (the carbs are mostly from sugar). This isn't about low calorie, low fat or low carb. It is about the health benefits of pure chocolate and NO dairy or sugar - which is great news for diabetics who are open to new taste sensations. This stevia sweetened chocolate is SO intense that you might not be able to eat more than one tiny square at a time. This is where you will save on calories, fat and carbs - this chocolate is so satisfying that you will eat less and your cravings will be satisfied to the extent that binging will become a thing of the past. Or if straight chocolate is too much for you, then you can grate it and sprinkle it on top of a whipped coconut cream mousse for a touch of chocolatey flavor without the dairy and sugar. There are lots of things you can do with this, but be aware that this will NEVER taste anything remotely like a Hershey's candy bar. Do not buy this thinking you will be able to make that switch because the two do not really compare. It is better to realize that the bitterness inherent in both the chocolate and the stevia is to be appreciated and not avoided. If you can come to terms with that, you might end up being one of those people who LOVE Dante's Stevia Chocolate. If not, you will hate it. So - I am giving the 4 stars - deducting one star because I was unable to confirm that the chocolate used is organic and non-GMO. But for a simple, nutrient rich, sugar free chocolate rush - I think the Dante is wonderful! However I am a long time Stevia user and am used to the taste of stevia. And, my husband and I are both used to eating 100% UNSWEETENED chocolate and we weren't surprised at the bitterness. As long as you understand what it is and what it is not, I think you might like it, too! Nutrition Facts: Serving Size - 1 bar Servings per container - 1 Calories 260 Calories from fat - 210 (remember that chocolate fat (cocoa butter) is a super healthy fat) Total Fat - 24 grams Saturated Fat - 14 grams Trans Fat - 0 grams Cholesterol - 0 grams sodium - 0 grams Total Carbohydrate - 12 grams Dietary Fiber - 7 grams Sugars - 0 grams Protein - 7 grams Rating: 4.0 Product: Dante Confections 98% Organic Cocoa Stevia Chocolate Bars, 8 Count, Sugar-Free Review: Let's face it. Chocolate, all by itself is bitter. And Stevia is super sweet and also bitter. So the combination of these two ingredients creates an intense DARK CHOCOLATE that is very bitter-sweet. Not a product for beginners, but very good for those who are accustomed to and appreciate the bitter notes of true chocolate and the super bittersweet flavor of stevia. Chocolate has the potential to be a healthy superfood when it is consumed correctly - meaning that sugar and milk are not a part of the mix. When chocolate candy is created, sugar and milk are added to tone down the bitterness of the chocolate. But when people struggle with health issues, sugar is sometimes not an option, and often milk is also not an option. Furthermore, milk negates the health benefits of chocolate. According to the University of Michigan Health System, "Milk binds to antioxidants in chocolate making them unavailable; therefore, milk chocolate is not a good antioxidant source. To get the benefits of antioxidants, avoid drinking milk with dark chocolate." (I would cite my source but Amazon doesn't allow links in their reviews. Just google the terms, dairy and chocolate antioxidants, and the very first article should be the one I am referring to.) In other words, to get the health benefits of chocolate, you must consume it without sugar and without dairy. I really like the simplicity of the Dante's ingredient list: Chocolate Liqueur, Stevia, Pure Vanilla. 98% Cocoa. And as a diabetic, I am in love with the fact that there is no sugar in the mix. With this kind of list, the bitter taste is impossible to avoid. So - if you hate bitter, then don't try this. But if you like a simple, healthy, exotic and sophisticated dessert, then this might just be right up your alley. You must also understand that this in not a low calorie food. Even without sugar, there are still 260 calories per 45 gram bar AND 12 grams of carbohydrate. Most of the calories in the Dante bar come from chocolate's high quality fat. Compare to a Hershey's Special Dark Chocolate bar which is 190 calories per 41 gram bar and 25 grams of carbohydrate (the carbs are mostly from sugar). This isn't about low calorie, low fat or low carb. It is about the health benefits of pure chocolate and NO dairy or sugar - which is great news for diabetics who are open to new taste sensations. I think people often lose weight when using such foods because it is intense and you cannot eat much at all. A very little bit is satisfying and goes a long way. This stevia sweetened chocolate is SO intense that you might not be able to eat more than one tiny square at a time. This is where you will save on calories, fat and carbs - this chocolate is so satisfying that you will eat less and your cravings will be satisfied to the extent that binging will become a thing of the past. Or if straight chocolate is too much for you, then you can grate it and sprinkle it on top of a whipped coconut cream mousse for a touch of chocolatey flavor without the dairy and sugar. There are lots of things you can do with this, but be aware that this will NEVER taste anything remotely like a Hershey's candy bar. Do not buy this thinking you will be able to make that switch because the two do not really compare. It is better to realize that the bitterness inherent in both the chocolate and the stevia is to be appreciated and not avoided. If you can come to terms with that, you might end up being one of those people who LOVE Dante's Stevia Chocolate. If not, you will hate it. So - I am giving the 5 stars because it is sugar and dairy free and the chocolate used is organic and non-GMO. For a simple, nutrient rich, sugar free chocolate rush - I think the Dante is wonderful! However I am a long time Stevia user and am used to the taste of stevia. And, my husband and I are both used to eating 100% UNSWEETENED chocolate and we weren't surprised at the bitterness. As long as you understand what it is and what it is not, I think you might like it, too! Nutrition Facts: Serving Size - 1 bar Servings per container - 1 Calories 260 Calories from fat - 210 (remember that chocolate fat (cocoa butter) is a super healthy fat) Total Fat - 24 grams Saturated Fat - 14 grams Trans Fat - 0 grams Cholesterol - 0 grams sodium - 0 grams Total Carbohydrate - 12 grams Dietary Fiber - 7 grams Sugars - 0 grams Protein - 7 grams Rating: 5.0 Product: Mediterranean Gourmet Argan Oil, 8.45 Ounce Review: I have travelled extensively in Morocco, but during my stay, I only used Argan oil on my skin. It might have been in some of the delicious food, but since I never cooked while I was there, I am not sure if I ate it during my stay or not. I probably did and never knew it, but since I don't know, I cannot compare what I tasted there to this product. I think this tastes akin to a very strong olive oil. I prefer a lighter tasting oil, but I cannot say that this strong taste indicates a rancid flavor or if it is simply how Argan oil is supposed to taste. I suspect that it's supposed to taste like this - I know what a rancid oil is like and this doesn't taste rancid to me. Just really, REALLY strong. When you put it in a dish, be sure to know that the flavor will overpower everything else. I do have some real experience with exceptionally good quality extra virgin olive oil, and in my experience, the best olive oils do not have this intense, unpleasant flavor. This product gets 4 stars from me because of the vitamin E content. I bought this because I am allergic to wheat and since wheat is a major source of vitamin E in the American diet, my levels were getting low. Then I found out that Argan oil is even richer in vitamin E than wheat and my problem was solved. Since I don't like the taste in cooking, I just take a teaspoon every day along with my disgusting cod liver oil and other supplements. It does the trick. Just to make sure I have a really fresh Argan oil, I am planning to buy a different brand next time so I will have a basis for comparison. If I find that Argan oil is always this strong in flavor, I'll come back and give this item 5 stars instead of 4. If I find that I like other brands better, I come back and reduce my rating to 3 stars. If I realize that this Argan oil is rancid, I'll come back and change my 4 stars to 1 star. I might even take it to a local Moroccan restaurant and ask the owners to taste test it and give me a knowledgable opinion. Rating: 4.0 Product: Native Forest Organic Premium Coconut Cream, Unsweetened, 5.4 Ounce (Pack of 12) Review: UPDATE - June 4, 2017: Since writing the above review, I have discovered that Thai Kitchen has some questionable additives and I have switched to Natural Value Coconut Milk. I just pour off the water to get 100% Cream. And this brand does seem to have a generous amount of cream in the can, with absolutely NO additives. Get it here: Natural Value Organic Coconut Milk, 13.5 Ounce Cans (Pack of 12) ORIGINAL REVIEW: I really love coconut milk and coconut cream, but this is not a very good brand. It was supposed to be CREAM for goodness sake, but when I opened this can there was hardly any cream in the can. The contents were grayish and watery. There wasn't enough cream in this to make it worth anything. I would rather buy Thai Kitchen coconut milk, which is pure white, FULL OF CREAM, and a rich milky water that is great for smoothies or soups. I am not sure how they define CREAM, but I feel like I got mostly water from this can. Rating: 1.0 Product: Miracle Noodle Shirataki Zero Carb, Gluten Free Fettuccini, 7 Ounce (Pack of 6) Review: A quick look at the reviews of this product shows that people are divided as to whether this is a guilt free pasta dream come true or whether this is a nasty, smelly, slimy nightmare. And I fall solidly into the "Dream Come True" camp. As a person with miltiple food allergies and type 2 diabetes, my diet had become a bland, monotinous string of meat and vegetables. I don't like "fake" food and so I had opted out of substitutes like fake cheese, low carb bread, and artificial sweeteners. Then I ran across these noodles (my doctor carries a line of low carb foods in his office), and decided that I would try them once, even if I probably wouldn't ever want to eat them again. I am really glad I tried them. I like the texture, and the taste is so bland that they quickly soak up any flavor that is cooked into them. The initial odor coming out of the package is kind of "fishy", but that goes away quickly as the noodles are prepared and they absorb the flavors and aromas of the foods they are cooked with. The texture is slippery, stretchy, and chewy - kind of like I remember real pasta being. Some reviewers said that they didn't like the "slimy" texture, but I didn't find it to be any slimier than real pasta. In any case, it didn't bother me at all I started with spaghetti and meatballs, then I had buttered noodles, and then I had noodles with taco meat and a yummy mexican sauce with olives and avacado. Then there was my allergen free version of Pad Thai. The list goes on and on and I have never failed to love whatever I have used them in. AND my blood sugar stays within the normal range! I tried several shape varieties, and I like the fettuccini noodles the best for pasta because they have substance. I like the shiratake rice as a rice substitute. I used the "fake rice" for a stuffed zucchini dish that was to die for - my whole family dove in and raved for more! Shiratake noodles are now a part of my diet and long term lifestyle, and I have enrolled in the Subscribe and Save program because I use them so often. Shiratake noodles are something a person either loves or hates, and there doesn't seem to be much in between, so I recommend that anyone who isn't sure and wants to try it once should buy from the Miracle Noodle website because they accept returns if you don't like the product. If you like them, you can then purchase from Amazon, but first time users should buy directly from the manufacturer. Rating: 5.0 Product: Simple Mills Almond Flour Mix, Artisan Bread, Naturally Gluten Free, 10.4 oz, 3 count Review: This is absolutely THE VERY BEST paleo bread I have ever tried. For a diabetic who chooses to address this disease with a paleo lifestyle, the nutritional content is flawless. Only 100 calories and 11 grams of carbs per serving, with 5 grams of protein and 6 grams of "good fat". It is gluten free, soy free, grain free, dairy free and low carb. And for Paleo People who do not fear fat, this is a dream come true. But the nutrition facts don't mean a thing if it isn't tasty and satisfying, and that is where this product really shines. It is so yummy that I cannot believe it is made up of short, simple list of ingredients that fully comply with the demanding restrictions of "paleo". The secret ingredient is Apple Cider Vinegar, which is added to the mix along with eggs and oil. This gives Artisan Bread a distinct flavor of old fashioned sourdough bread. I love, love, love it! What is more, this bread actually competes with mainstream, grain based bread enough to interest my husband who is not Paleo and has no health issues that would require him to restrict his diet. He absolutely raves about this and I end up making it quite often because it gets eaten pretty fast around our house. I have type 2 diabetes, Celiac Disease, and numerous food sensitivities, and I know the frustration of a restricted diet that leaves me feeling unsatisfied. Finding something that falls well within the parameters of my dietary demands, that doesn't make me sick and that is also yummy and filling is a real find. I'll never be without this again! Rating: 5.0 Product: ZOT 100% Organic Licorice with Mint, 0.4-Ounce Flip Top Boxes (Pack of 6) Review: Not everyone's cup of tea, but I love them. The mint is very detectable, and blends well with the strong licorice taste. If your taste buds are attuned to offbeat flavors, then you might like this. People who want CANDY might not enjoy this as much as I do. THERE ARE NO ARTIFICIAL OR NATURAL SWEETNERS - just the taste of pure mint and licorice. Another thing I like about this product is that it makes a really effective cough suppressant. Since I am diabetic and suffer from frequent colds, this takes the place of sugary cough drops that ultimately leave me sicker. I have a large supply for this purpose, because it is the only losenge that relieves a cough without the added problems of sugar or artificial sweeteners. One note about the price: I purchased this item because it was cheaper than a similar product by Zagarese Licorice, but when it arrived, I realized that these little boxes are about 1/2 the size of the Zagarese Licorice. Zagarese is a better bargain, and is almost exactly the same product. It was my own fault for not closely reading the ads, but an unpleasant surprise all the same. Next time I will buy Zagarese (which is also available on Amazon)! Zagarese is very similar to Zot, but one difference is that Zot has a stronger mint taste. Otherwise, they are almost exactly the same. Rating: 4.0 Product: Rapunzel Pure Vegan Vegetable Bouillon, No Salt Added, 8 Cubes, 2.4-Ounce Packages (Pack of 6) Review: Awesome, healthy convenience food that is a great base for so many dishes. When I am short of time and need something flavorful in a hurry, this is just the thing. It is so great to have something like this as a back up and not feel that I am compromising my family's health in exchange for a quick, easy meal. No artificial ingredients, healthy fats, savory vegetables and salt free! What more could you ask for? My Pantry will never be without this. Product: Gatorade Performance Series Carbohydrate Energy Formula, Orange, 12-Ounce Bottles (Pack of 24) Review: I ordered this product for my husband who trains for triathalons. We normally buy the standard Gatorade mix from the grocery store, but were intrigued with the new carb-recovery drink. So, he put it to the test. For flavor, he states that this drink tastes pretty similar to the original orange, which is refreshing. Those who like standard Gatorade may find this a little on the overly-sweet side, as it is higher in carbs and sweetness than the "original" drink. For flavor alone, that was our only caution and the reason for withholding 1 star. However, after one particularly difficult workout (a long, sweat-soaked round of shoveling after a PA snow storm) he thought that the flavor and sweetness were fine. His personal recommendation was that this drink did a better job than the standard Gatorade of getting him back on his feet hydration-wise. We have often found that after a grueling workout he battles dehydration for the rest of the day, which also leads to exhaustion. In my years as a personal trainer, I have learned that the body maintains hydration best when it is accompied by a moderate dose of carbs because it helps the water stay in the body longer, thus making it more available to recovering muscles. Generally speaking, he felt that his total recovery from the workout was significantly faster and better than with the standard sports drink, and the flavor is good if you're not taking anything else sweet at the same time. Review:
About 3 months ago I stayed at a hotel in Los Angeles and these chips were in the room, offered comp to hotel guests. I am not sure I would've tried them otherwise, but I am glad I did and now I'm addicted. I am a thin person so it's all about the taste for me, calories are not an issue. I've never really liked the taste of greasy chips, but baked chips seemed so bland. These chips are the best  and you should give them a try. They are tasty and not greasy. My personal favorite is the original potato flavor, but they are all pretty good.

Highly recommended. I don't normally review food products but these were so good I wanted to share.
Rating:
5.0

Product:

Review:
Finally, finally I have a great consistent source for buying my favorite British tea. I got it from British food importers for many years, then my local grocery stores began to stock it.  Except they don't always have it on the shelf and I often have to visit several stores to find it.  Amazon has definitely solved that problem for me.

I really enjoy drinking this particular tea.  It is a very mild tea, without the harsh flavor some other black teas can have.  Since I make at least two pots of tea each day (and sometimes more) this lovely large quantity will come in very handy and keep my pantry stocked for a long time to come.  It was also much cheaper to buy in this larger size than the 40 count boxes I find in my stores, plus no sales tax and the additional savings of the Amazon Prime membership came in very handy with eliminating the shipping charges.

Product:
NOKA Superfood Blend, Organic Fruit & Veggie Smoothie Squeeze Pack, Sweet Potato Goji, 4.22 Ounces, (Pack of 6 pouches)
Review:
I am happy with this product.  It is a box of six pouches, with a liquid, smoothie-type product.

I was worried that this product might have soy.  But after reading the ingredients, I saw no soy.  Here are the ingredients:  organic mango, organic banana, organic apple, water, organic flax seed, organic coconut, organic brown rice protein, organic mango flavor, organic camu camu berry, organic lemon juice concentrate, organic coconut flavor.  It is vegan, gluten-free, bpa-free, organic & verified non gmo.

I particularly love the way the taste of the cashews come through and blend in so beautifully with the chocolate and coconut.  This bar is so heavenly good.

As good as this bar tastes, it is also healthy, vegan, organic, raw, soy-free.  It's hard to believe something that tastes so good can also be so good for you.

This bar is indescribably awesome.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Eden Organic Quinoa, Whole Grain, 16-Ounce Pouches (Pack of 6)
Review:
I finally bought this Quinoa, and it is really good.  It is versatile; depending on how you season it depends on how it turns out.  For example, it can be seasoned with lemon, pepper, garlic, basil, etc.  It can also be seasoned with brown sugar.

I am not going to write a long review; the grain itself is versatile enough to make it just about any way you want.  And it's easy to prepare.  And it's healthful (I'll get into that in the next paragraph).

From what I'd heard about the grain, it is "old", "strong", "healthy, "wise" (even has built up a coating that is a resistance to insects).  This grain intrigues me; I plan to look up its history.

Quinoa (which I recently found out) is what dieticians call a "complete protein".  Other than meat products, there aren't a lot of "complete proteins" that I know of, other than soy.  I do not eat soy.  So I thought I'd give this product a try.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Lipton Black Iced Tea Bags, Cold Brew Decaffeinated Family Size,22 Count,4.8 Oz (Pack of 3)
Review:
This tea is perfect for me, especially since I don't boil my tea, anyway.  I just let it seep out of the bags into the water.  I put the bags in the gallon jugs, and let it set there in the refridgerator.  And I love the taste of this tea.

I do usually drink decaffeinated tea, as the caffeinated versions keep me up really late.  I wish I had of known about this back in the day when I had to pull all-night duty.  Back then, I did not know that caffienated tea did this to me.  I tried coffee to keep me perky all night, but it did nothing for me.

I love tea.  This particular type of tea tastes really good to me.  And I love cornbread and iced tea.  That is a combination that goes good together for some reason.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Blue Diamond Natural Oven Roasted Almonds Vanilla Bean, 8-Ounce Jars (Pack of 6)
Review:
These nuts are heavenly in more ways than one.  For one, all nuts are healthy.  Almonds are especially heathful.  For two, the taste is out of this world.  It is an almond taste with a smooth vanilla background.  If you like both almonds and vanilla, then you will be in heaven.

Lucky for me, I am a nut lover.  I am lucky to love something so healthy.  And the vanilla background of these nuts make them a very healthy and tasty snack; they are so good, it is hard to believe that they are healthy.

Almonds are good for the heart, as well as other organs.  Even though raw nuts, I'm sure, are healthier than cooked nuts, I do sometimes include nuts in different recipes.  However, I would never include these vanilla almonds in any recipe, because I would be afraid that the vanilla might come off.  I only eat these raw.

This is a very healthy snack.  Highly recommended.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Late July Organic Dark Chocolate Sandwich Cookies,  8.2-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
I was attracted to this box of cookies because of the "brand". "Late July" sounds like a wonderful brand name, and late July does bring back wonderful memories for me: it sounds like a fish fry with homemade french-fried potatoes and cole slaw and hush puppies, an ice bucket, iced tea, a cool breeze blowing from the fan, a porch, and lots of love. That's what I thought of when I saw this brand. Also, it is natural and therefore, vegans can have this product.

Vanilla bean with green tea:  The cookies didn't taste good. The flavor idea was pretty good. There was a hint of good flavor. Vanilla bean with green tea sounds wonderful. Possibly, the bad taste was due to all the soy and soy products used.  I managed to eat this whole box (of vanilla bean with green tea) without throwing any out.

Dark chocolate:  Horrible.  I couldn't even finish the whole box; I had to throw out most of it.  (And I'm the queen of conservativeness.)  The "dark" chocolate was so dark and so horrible, that it was too much for even a chocolate lover.  The chocolate had a horrible taste.  Not to mention the horrible taste it left in your mouth.  (Possibly too much soy, and whatever was in that chocolate.)  I literally had to go and buy some lemons and ate two, and also some potato chips, just to get that taste out of my mouth.

Never again.
Rating:

Product:
 Sweet Leaf Tea Lemon & Lime Unsweetened Tea Bottle ( 12x16 OZ)
Review:
Sweet Leaf Tea Lemon & Lime Unsweetened Tea.

I love Sweet Leaf brand tea.  I think I love all the varieties of it.  It is made with organic and natural ingredients.  It is blended and brewed just perfectly.  I love the Grannyisms and the picture of the granny on the label.  I am also a granny and I love it.

Normally, I drink my tea unsweetened.  Very rarely do I drink my tea sweetened.  But i do drink the sweet varieties of Sweet Leaf (that is the exception for me).

This particular variety that I am reviewing is unsweetened, so this is my favorite variety.  It has lemon and lime flavor, which I love.

Sweet tea is just too sticky for me, even though I do drink sweet Sweet Leaf teas as an exception.  But even too many of those can get too sticky.  That's why this particular variety (Lemon & Lime Unsweetened) is my favorite variety.  It has a crisp, clean, pure tea taste.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
ORCHARD VALLEY HARVEST Cranberry Almond Cashew Trail Mix, Non-GMO, No Artificial Ingredients, 1 oz (Pack of 8)
Review:
There are no words to tell you how wondrous these dark-chocolate covered blueberries are.  They are not just good, they are the best of the best.  The most elite.  And there are no "bad" ingredients.  I am particular about certain ingredients.

First I will talk about the chocolate.  Who doesn't like chocolate?  The chocolate is so scrumptious.  Feels so good in your mouth.  It is the best chocolate I've had in a while.

Now I will talk about the blueberries.  I love blueberries so much.  They are so delightful, so pleasant.  I could eat blueberries all day.

Now we will put the two (chocolate and blueberries) and talk about this product.  This product is the most ambrosial food I have had in I don't know how long.  Yes, they are yummy, but that word is not delicate enough for this product.  Delectable is a better choice.  I just cannot say how exquisite, delicious, enjoyable these chocolate-covered blueberries are.  Heavenly:  maybe that's a better and stronger word to describe them.

Now we will talk about the packaging.  This particular package is:  8 individual packs in each bag, and 8 bags.  Since they are individual, you can take a pack for lunch.

I know my review wasn't nearly good enough to explain and describe how good this product is.  There are just no words and no way to let anyone know.  This is the best food I've had in I don't know how long.  I hope you will try these chocolate-covered blueberries.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Community Coffee Whole Bean Coffee, French Roast, (Pack of 3)
Review:
Community Coffee Whole Bean Coffee, French Roast.  Full bodied, robust, perfect amount of strongness, not bitter but smooth.  Smell is awesome.  I love the smell of coffee, anyway.  If you love the smell of coffee, this would be something that you would love to wake up to every morning.  And if you love the taste of coffee, this coffee, I think, would be perfect.

These are whole beans, so you have to grind them yourself.

If you're hooked on coffee, or if you like coffee, I highly recommend this product.

I love coffee.  I love the smell of it.  And I'm pretty much hooked on it.  Not so much to where I will go into convulsions if I don't get it, but it is uncomfortable without it.  After all, I've been drinking it since I was about 6 months old.  I love all types of coffee.

Not only do I drink coffee, but I also make things out of it.  There are lots of good recipes in which you can make things out of coffee.  I love the flavor, the taste, and the smell of coffee; therefore, I love not only coffee as a drink, but also as an ingredient in certain recipes.

This product is superb.  Highly recommended.

5.0

Product:
 McCANN'S Steel Cut Irish Oatmeal, 16-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 6)
Review:
A couple years ago, I tried to eat oatmeal regularly and bought a box of instant oatmeal. I stopped eating oatmeal as soon as I finished all of the packets in the box. I just did not like it.

Last month, Consumer Reports rated Quaker Steel Cut Oats the top choice, so I began contemplating trying those (for whatever reason, they did not rate McCann's Steel Cut Oats). When I saw these on sale, I decided to try them, fearing that six 16-ounce boxes is a lot if I do not like them, but I am glad that I did. McCann's Steel Cut oatmeal is very tasty and I like the texture a lot. You cannot even compare this to instant oatmeal.

I cooked mine in the programmable coffee maker. Before going to bed I put 1/2 cup of oats and a pinch of salt in the carafe, added water per cooking instructions on the box to the coffee maker's reservoir, and set the timer to start brewing the next day 30 minutes before I usually have breakfast. It all worked perfectly. I just scooped it out of the carafe into a bowl, added some blueberry preserves, and had a great breakfast.

I would definitely recommend this product.
Rating:
5.0
</Other Writer-1>

Chia seeds are the magic potion: sprinkle several tablespoons on a daily salad, a tablespoon in some eggs before scrambling, more on steamed cabbage -- they're small like poppy seeds and add a nice crunch on the way to your stomach where they'll expand and keep you feeling full longer. They also help move food through your system so that constipation is never a problem. Try them!

UPDATE: Figured out the best use of these seeds for ME--I love salad with 1/4 cup of sunflower seeds and am now adding 2 tablespoons chia seeds, too. This way I get lots of crunch, different textures and a REALLY filling meal. I've been eating very low-carb (20 grams or less/day) for about 9 months now and have lost 30 lbs. But, at that low level of carbs, even using them all on vegetables and drinking jugs and jugs of water can still leave a constipation problem. These seeds fixed that immediately even as they facilitated eating less and feeling more satisfied. Miracle food is REAL. Product:

Review:
The mistake began with me, I was supposed to buy beans, but I bought three pounds like this so we thought we'd use it (in our $400+ expresso-maker). We found the grind was course and uneven. We found the coffee completely dry (freshly ground coffee has indices of moisure being present when fresh and then ground). The uneven grind would mean uneven results, and we like to grind our own using a burr grinder which not only gives a consistent granularity; it does it without overheating (recooking) the bean as some grinding processes do. We have no way of knowing, but we think it was old. So it wasn't to our liking, we thru out 2 new bags and the partrtial we had opened. My wife correctly told me the least I could have done was send it to the local food bank. I have nothing against the seller, make sure you order the right product, and have some understanding of it's shelf life and age between you and the seller and you'll be fine.

This is not in place of any medication your doctor suggests (and I AM NOT A DOCTOR and I am not practicing medicine, I am sharing an experience on the basis of one person I know and what I have read; look up the topic yourself). As for the fortune, it's typical of what is given out these days. I used math and logic in my working life and the notion that one slip of paper can deliver a unique verbal prediction for you and a winning lottery number just can't travel together (if you hold any store in those fortune slips anyway).  The two diverse things on the slip are contradictory, if one's correct the other one can't be correct, but it's all in fun so why take a fortune cookie serious? So I withheld one star because of the slightly smaller size.

But it is so delicious and rich and has such a beautiful color and texture, I can see this drizzled on cheesecake, ice cream, waffles, used as a fruit dip, etc. The best part is it's real caramel instead of artificially flavored syrup. Glad I found this on Amazon Prime!

Product:
Deruyter Chocoadehagel Puur (Dark Chocolate Sprinkles), 14-Ounces Boxes (Pack of 3)
Review:
Heavenly! I'm sure glad I found these. After reading the reviews and having several customers answer my questions, I ordered some. They are, as promised, delicious! Very genuine dutch chocolate flavor. These worked great for topping and coating holiday treats like chocolates, truffles, and boozie-balls. The sprinkles added a lovely flavor and texture. They kept their firm shape and created a nice visual finish. I've used them sprinkled on cake frosting, whipped cream, and even cookie icing, which looks and tastes amazing. As an experiment, I tried to bake with them. While they melt beautifully at a lower heat, they don't do well at high heat, so use baking chips instead. DeRuijter Chocolate Sprinkles are perfect as is!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
SweetLeaf Sweet Drops Liquid Stevia Sweetener, Chocolate, 2 Ounce (Pack of 2)
Review:
I absolutely LOVE SweetLeaf Chocolate liquid! I've added it to my low carb cheesecake, brownies, smoothies, shakes. If your recipe already calls for sugar substitute and chocolate, A small amount of SweetLeaf Chocolate will punch up both the richness of the chocolate and the sweetness of the sugar substitute. Try a few drops in a glass of milk for a chocolate milk that tastes so much better than the sugar-free version of the big-name syrup. If you like your chocolate milk rich with a nice chocolate color, here's a tip: stir a half teaspoon of unsweetened cocoa with a few drops of SweetLeaf Chocolate into 12 oz of cold milk. The cocoa won't mix with the milk very well, but if you put the milk in the fridge for 20 minutes, the cocoa will become saturated and will then stir into the milk with a spoon just like the syrup! Bob's your uncle!

This is a very authentic chocolate flavor that is actually complimented somewhat by the slight bitterness of the stevia, giving it the depth of dark chocolate. I cannot wait to make no sugar chocolate whipped cream in my cream gun!

Now I'm going to have to try a few more flavors!
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Keebler Cookies, Simply Made, Chocolate Chip, 10 oz Tray
Review:
Yes, Keebler! Please keep making products like this! I stopped buying and eating "store-bought" cookies years ago because of the horrible ingredients - partially hydrogenated vegetable fats, artificial vanillin, etc. Simply Made chocolate chip cookies have a delightful flavor. They're rich and buttery with a delicately crispy texture, not hard and dry like most other store-bought cookies. The chocolate chips are plentiful and decent quality. They melt in the mouth like they should instead of being hard little burnt bits. The chocolate chips are pretty high in cocoa percentage, so they are strong-flavored with a slightly roasted aftertaste. If you're used to the anemic, overly-sweet, vanillin-flavored chocolate bits in other store-bought chocolate chip cookies, these may taste a bit different to you.

While they're not exactly "home made" tasting, they are far and away the best store-bought cookies I've had in a very long time. I wish I could give Keebler extra stars for making baked goods with wholesome ingredients (real sugar, real butter, coconut oil) instead of corn sweeteners and partially hydrogenated fats.

Edit: I think the "burnt" taste people are commenting on might be just the browning. Real butter will take on a slightly nutty taste (beurre noisette). It's a unique flavor but a sign that real butter is being used. Many people prefer this taste to the flavorless, greasy shortenings normally used in store-bought cookies. Additionally, since they use real sugar instead of fructose corn syrup, browning occurs at a different temp, which may add to the complexity of flavors of baked goods.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Madelaine Chocolates Easter Eggs - Traditional Easter Basket Mainstays - Solid Premium Milk Chocolate Eggs Foiled In A Variety Of Solid and Floral Colors - 1 LB
Review:
These chocolate eggs are exceptional quality with a rich, creamy, silky melt on the tongue, and a nice snap to the bite. A real treat, worth the time and extra money. My one complaint is that the foils are not the same colors as in the photo. If you plan to decorate with these (as I did with mine), the foil colors are different.

The gritty bits seem out of place and give the impression that the ingredients weren't thoroughly mixed. Additionally, they now give me the worst gas I've ever had in my life. Usually after a few weeks of eating food with bulk, my body is able to adjust and settle down. Not so with these. So, not recommended for road trips or for breakfasts before important meetings! Don't say I didn't warn ya!

golds.output: I really like the Mott's 100% Fruit Punch Juice, the flavor is great and I appreciate that it's 100% fruit. I've tried several other brands of fruit punch and this one tastes the best, I can add it to my lunch without worrying about added sugars. The small boxes are perfect for on the go and the packaging is very convenient, I can easily throw a few in my bag. The taste is a little sweeter than I expected but it's still very refreshing, I think it's a great alternative to soda.

<similarpairs>
Product:
Fruit Friends Squeezable Fruit, Apple, Berry Banana,  4-Count, (Pack of 8)
Review:
It's hard to tell from the photo, but these are small containers. Perfect for children's small hands and stomachs, but too small to quench the hunger of an adult.

I enjoyed the combination of berries and applesauce, but was a little put-off by its ultra fine texture. It reminded me of baby food. But I can see why they have it that way, seeing as how the neck of the pouch is very small - they don't want it to clog. The screw top lid is a nice touch, kids can eat part and throw the rest in their lunch box without fear that it will spill.

I think kids will like the idea of squeezing it out like toothpaste.

A tip for parents: The first pack opened very easily for me, but the second one didn't. It was a struggle to snap it free. With this in mind, you might want to go ahead and loosen the caps if you put this in lunch boxes for small kids.
Rating:
3.0
Product:
Swiss Miss Hot Cocoa Mix, Sensible Sweets, Light, 8 count,0.29 ounce, (Pack of 6)
Review:
But drinking a lot of milk and chocolate mixed with sugar has its negative health side. During the winter I like hot drinks and the Swiss Miss diet drink is very satisfying. I can taste the sucralose (substitute for sugar) and that is a slight reduction in enjoyment. Also I notice the thinness of the drink compared to regular milk. So I rate it 4-4.5 stars.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Barilla Whole Grain Spaghetti, 13.25 oz(Pack of 10)
Review:
Like a lot of people I have to limit my intake of white flour. The wheat version of this spaghetti is more healthy for me and I don't notice a taste difference from the white flour version. I like the higher fiber content and add this product to dishes with a lot of liquid to fill me up.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
HERSHEY'S Kisses Chocolate Candy, Birthday Blue, 7 Ounce (Pack of 12)
Review:
The latest fad seems to be foil colors and different sizes. Your mouth doesnt care- it still tastes the same. I rate the product not the exorbitant price for different packaging. Sales marketers have to justify their gimmicks (read their jobs) with new packaging because they don't want to mess with a product that cant be improved.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Lipton Green Tea Bags, Decaffeinated Blackberry Pomegranate, 20 ct, Pack of 6
Review:
I enjoy having a cup of tea in mid-afternoon as a pick-me-up. I drink my regular tea and Chinese tea straight. I've enjoyed sampling these Lipton fruit flavored teas. The flavor is more pronounced when I steep it for several minutes with a little honey added. The blackberry really was distinct in this tea. Lipton should take the pomegranate name off and just make a pure pomegranate tea. I know I would like that flavor.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Quaker Instant Oatmeal Original, 12 Packets per Box (Pack of 4)
Review:
This cereal has a nice apple flavor. Its plenty sweet too. I like to add some plain oatmeal to the bowl to create more volume to fill me up and make it less sweet. One of my tricks to keep it from overflowing the bowl in the microwave is to let it stand in the water for a couple of minutes while I prepare my coffee. The water absorbs into the oatmeal. I then put it into the microwave for about a minute and its hot.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Quaker Oats Gluten Free Quick 1-Minute Oats, Original, Breakfast Cereal, 18 Ounce Canister (Pack of 12)
Review:
I cant tell any taste, texture, or results with this gluten-free version that has changed from the old standard. So if its cheaper than the regular or 1-minute versions or you have a family member who is paranoid about ingesting gluten, by all means don't hesitate to buy this latest variation.
Rating:
4.0
Product:
Lipton Liquid Iced Black Tea Mix, Black Cherry Dragonfruit 2.43 oz
Review:
Ive used several flavors of Lipton iced teas and they are more satisfying than soda. I drink less and am satisfied. Of course, Im also consuming less sugar or its substitutes.

Im a big tea drinker- orange pekoe, green, oolong, etc. I taste a little tang from the black tea but the lemon dominates. I like straight hot tea. But in the summer I want some flavor in iced tea. So while the Lipton doesnt really taste like straight iced tea, I am pleased with its refreshing flavor.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Season Black Capelin Caviar from Iceland, 3.5-Ounce Glass Jars (Pack of 4)
Review:
I love salmon caviar and other expensive caviars with large eggs. This was a gamble that the taste would be good without the expense. I am well satisfied. The eggs are very small but a thin layer spread on top of cream cheese on a bagel was just right. To really get the flavor though, it is necessary to chew the eggs. Their smallness means you might just swish them in your mouth with your tongue and that won't impart the full flavor.
Rating:
5.0
Product:
Madhava Naturally Sweet Organic Blue Agave Low-Glycemic Sweetener, Golden Light, 11.75 Ounce (Pack of 6)
Review:
Agave Nectar is very similar to honey but sweeter. It does have a slight taste. I like that it does not solidify like honey and it is a great substitute for sugar as you use less. My nutritionist suggested rotating Agave, cane sugar, and honey to avoid some problems I was having and now I predominately use the Agave because I like it so much.
Rating:
5.0
